Summary Heading: Under construction and don’t tell you until you arrive
Summary: Was surprised to learn when we arrived it was under construction. Says nothing on their website . There were no restaurants, bars, pool , even a common area .  Construction starts at 8am . Had access to other hotels and their amenities . But very frustrating the price is the same without access to have anything to do in the hotel. Especially for the kids to have no pool within the hotel . front desk employees were super kind but it was chaos each day with so many people waiting to be helped . Be sure to call hotels priors to make sure all amenities on their website are actually accessible and in use.

Summary Heading: This hotel should not be open
Summary: This hotel should not even be open.  Everything is closed in the hotel.  It is under going a rebranding.  Total rip off.  Disney is still charging the normal rate.  Thieves. If I could give it o stars I would.

Summary Heading: So Happy we stayed here at Paradise Pier Hotel!
Summary: We were able to check in at 11:30 AM and our room had a wonderful view of CA!  We could watch the World of Color and fireworks every night!The front desk staff was genuinely kind and caring and made us feel welcome. We knew the rooms would be a bit dated because of the remodel going on,but that did not matter at all,all 5 of us slept comfortably. There were free hot beverages in the lobby every morning,and you could buy snacks if wanted.The ease of entering either park was a big selling point.  Saved so much time not standing in line to get in. Several days we went in at 7:30AM and rode the rides that we knew would have long lines later in the day.. All in all I am very glad we stayed at Paradise Pier Hotel.
Room tip: Ask for a room with premium views we had #1200 and it was perfect to watch CA World of color from...

Summary Heading: Location & staff is only thing going for this property
Summary: Pros: Convenient/close to Disneyland Park and downtown Disney (considered on property). Rooms are fairly large.  Cons: Property is under major construction (has been since October 2022) and will still be until next fall. When reading other reviews before staying here, I thought it CAN'T be THAT bad. But I was wrong! There still is no lobby, no restaurants/coffee shop, no front entrance, no pool, no fitness center, and not even a place for families to meet/hang out! And if it's during the week, the construction is taking place, so don't expect little ones to be able to take a nap midday (unless they can tolerate earplugs). The worst part about staying here is there is absolutely NO discount/compensation for the inconvenience! It's still an average of about $500 per night

We stayed here between Christmas and New Years and booked the stay several months in advance. We had a lot of options at the time of booking and didn't realize we were booking a $500/night stay with essentially no amenities - not even for kids. No restaurants, no food, no pool - basically a room and a key.  When you book a Disney hotel you expect something unique or disney flavored- this hotel might as well have been a motel 6 located next to Disney. The worst part was we were blindsided by the fact that everything they advertised on their website was not available during our visit. By the time we became aware of this- we didn't have many options to change.  Very disappointed.

The hotel is outdated for the price. Not very clean, bathroom had water damage. Hotel hallways stunk like mildew. Booked a king bed for my celebration and they weren't even able to provide that. Asked for a late check out just 1 hour and the front desk advise that they are NOT offering late check outs. They always say whatever we can to make your stay more comfortable please let us know. There excuse was that they need to allow the housekeepers in the rooms so they arr able to get them cleaned and not have stress on the workers, so I guess put stress on the guest to get pack up and out of the room. Just very surprised about the stay here at Disney I really thought it would be an amazing time and thought the rooms would be alot nicer. Won't be staying here again as I felt like I

I was a little hesitant to stay here after reading the reviews that were rolling in while the hotel is under construction, so much so I almost canceled my reservation. So glad I didn’t!!! We had a wonderful stay. We didn’t have any of the elevator issues some mentioned, no construction noise and was not inconvenienced by the makeshift lobby. Also, our room was made up every day which is rare these days! The best part was being able to use any of the Disney hotels pools and amenities. We took advantage of both California Grand and the Disneyland hotel pools. We loved doing that so much we skipped out on Disneyland to enjoy the hotels!

Place was terrible, the elevator system was terrible. No elevator in parking garage. Staff was nice and helpful. Better hotel’s for way cheaper. Disappointed in this hotel. Wait till renovations are finished to stay there.

Dropped off my luggage and backpack at Paradise Pier hotel's baggage hold in the morning while I attended a conference. When I came back later that afternoon, they gave me my luggage but lost my backpack. I stayed there only one night and my backpack had not been found by the morning before I had to leave. Initially, management said they could not do anything except keep an eye out for my bag and gave me contact info for guest claims. I was refused any compensation for this severe inconvenience and oversight.  Other staff I spoke with the next morning were much more professional and empathetic. I was extremely disappointed by the lack of accountability at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice room but had some issues
Summary: I came to Disneyland to attend a seminar at the Convention Center.  This is the cheapest of the hotels at Disneyland.  A week before I came to the hotel I found out it was under construction and a lot of the services will not be available.  But it was too late because the Disneyland Hotel was booked up.  The hotel lobby is bare minimum.  I feel like I’ve arrived at a motel 6.  There is a small convenient store with snacks that’s self serviced.  It’s got a good selection of snacks and coffee.  There is pretty much nothing else on site.  To get a simple breakfast I needed to walk to either downtown Disney or the other hotels.  The room was spacious and clean.  My only complaint about the room is that the shower starts hot and within a minute it turns colder and colder.   First

So disappointed in Disney. They used to care about your experience and were fair and honest, even though we know and accept the high prices. They closed the pool the day before we leave and call to tell us. Really!? And the guest service person said they would discount our room, then they put me on hold and changed their offer to nothing. No discount. And no refund, if we cancel. Just one option of going and paying for a resort that is not a resort at the moment. No food, no lobby, AND no pool. This is our last trip to Disneyland, because they don’t care about the customer anymore. Disappointed.

We have enjoyed staying here so much in the past, but this was our least enjoyable stay for several reasons.  This place is undergoing a MAJOR REMODEL. I knew that some things were going be adjusted, but wasn't quite prepared for the chaos at the hotel.  Uber/Lyft drivers had difficulty dropping off/picking up folks and while that doesn't sound like a hassle, it is when you get dropped off at a costly hotel on the main street and have to shlep your luggage to check in or get to your ride. How about just putting out a sign about where drivers should go?  The check in area is a nightmare as they moved it into a ballroom. The staff shared that they were all learning the new computer system. and apologized for the long delays. The long line of aggravated and testy visitors was

I would avoid staying here until their renovation into pixar place is completed. The restaurant is closed, the water slide was closed, the lobby is closed and you have to access the hotel from the back of the hotel. The elevator was only working part of the time. On our check out day we had to haul all of our luggage down 11 floors to get out. The view from our room was great and we could see the fireworks and world of color from our room and Early access was nice but other than that there is nothing disney about this hotel right now. Rates should definitely reflect the downgraded experience you get here but they don’t.

We booked our first family Disney vacation in September with no knowledge of renovations to be completed at the Paradise Pier.  Unknowingly to us, October is prime time so our room here cost $900+/night.  Our first indication this place would be bad is that they have guests enter through the back of the hotel which probably had been a service entrance.  No grand lobby or front desks great you but instead your directed to a make shift check in in an outdated ballroom.  We were told for the first time that renovations were underway and there would be no dinning or bar options.  The front desk employee apologized and stated I should have received a phone call or email regarding the reno.  The room is very outdated and poorly appointed.  The only lights are cheap little lamps with

Warning, the hotel is going through major renovations.  Entry is now in the back of the hotel.  This was told to us in an email received a couple days before arrival, but the note lacked specific directions and signage was absent.  Our Lyft driver was very distraught trying to find a way in to the hotel.  Turn left onto Disney Drive and take a parking ticket, go to the roundabout and take the road to the Paradise Pier parking structure.  Drop off is in the alley next to the hotel.  Pick up by Uber was just as bad and the driver refused to come to the back entrance. There a 3 elevators, which was not sufficient for the volume during peak times.  Our family waited 40 minutes in the morning which killed early entry privileges. Hotel is definitely in need of a makeover.

Summary Heading: Don’t stay here till they complete the renovation and fix the elevators
Summary: I’m a dvc member, used to be an annual pass holder, and love everything Disney, besides this hotel.  I typically stay at the grand or the Disneyland hotel but booked this trip last minute and those were unavailable. Last time I stayed here was on my honeymoon, many years ago and before we had kids. This place is in need of dire renovations and thankfully it’s getting them.  Now the bad news, they never told us the lobby is closed, all the restaurants are closed and the elevators seldom, if ever work at all. After waiting for 20 minutes to go down to the lobby, we gave up and just went back to our room. Called, found out elevators was down. This was the theme of the entire trip with them. There is no restaurant open on property and after 10pm door dash is the only way you are

Summary Heading: You won't get what you pay for, stay somewhere else
Summary: To start, this hotel is undergoing major renovations, so there will only be a hotel room for your stay, no amenities and  no restaurants.  Pros:   The rooms are traditional Disney themed and adorable. On the small side but still doable. The theming in the hallways continue the Disney theming. The bathrooms are small with shower, toilet and vanity all in the same space. This is a con for some larger families that count on separate areas to get ready for the parks.  The staff are wonderful and went above and beyond to accomodate a sometimes hopeless situation.  The pool is small but enjoyable.  Cons:     The elevators are a joke, only 2 or 3 working elevators depending on if elevator B is working, which broke down several times during our stay.  We had to use the fire escape

We arrived at Paradise Pier on 9/25/22 and were greeted by amazing staff. That was the best part of the trip. Everything went down hill from there. We weren’t told that the entire front end of the hotel was going to be shut down. So as we returned from the park on Monday at 10 pm with exhausted kids, we couldn’t find our way into the hotel. Everything was blocked off, no signs or anything. The rooms are very dated, the hallways smelled like sewer the WHOLE stay, you could never get an elevator because they decided to shut down 2 of the 4. We had to lug our luggage, stroller and kids down five flights of stairs!!!! For what I paid $4500+ I’m very disappointed and should have just stayed at a sister hotel. When we brought up concerns to staff all they said was “sorry”! I can find

Pros- kids loved the pool and slide and having the extra 30 minutes in the parks is a game changer in the am.    Cons-   Cannot get rented stroller from Disney anywhere near the hotel.  We had figured we would just rent them from Disney since we were staying right by the park, but you will want to bring your own.    Plan to leave an extra 30 minutes early for CA adventure  to avoid elevator waits (or 45min to an hour early with going to Disney Land) if trying to get there for early entry.  If you get there at 7am or after, you will wait 20+ minutes to get on an elevator off your floor.  Only having 3 of the 4 elevators in use due to construction probably made this even worse than normal.    Did not know they had renovations scheduled to begin the week we stayed here (they called

Surprised my family with a one night stay here and no one was disappointed. We loved the feel of the hotel. The staff were so helpful and friendly. The rooftop pool was great, lots of life guards watching and keeping everyone safe. We loved the decor of this hotel and the location. We had a great view of the parks from our room which was amazing! I was so glad I booked this night.

Pros: Very clean. Staffs are friendly. Close to California Adventure, with it’s own “secret entrance” Cons: Pool was too small and crowded, and surprisingly with no WiFi. WiFi in our room was also not stable. We did enjoy our stay there. However, with $500 “price tag”, I think they can do better.

Clean rooms, amazing Disney cast members as usual.  Rooms definitely need the upgrade they will be getting soon, it’s an older hotel but still getting the Disney Magic.  No restaurant, but ordering from Downtown Disney is quick, easy and no extra fees.  You could definitely stay at a newer hotel for the same price or cheaper but you would be losing all the Disney Property bonuses.  Early entry to the parks is AMAZING!!!   And again the best staff ever!

Pre-COVID, we always stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.  Because of the seemingly rise in room rates, we decided to try the Paradise Pier in order to stay in the Disney 'bubble'.  We were pleasantly surprised as I had pretty low expectations based on other reviews.  The rooms were comfortable (especially the beds), and yes they do need an update, but they didn't fall that short of the rooms at the Disneyland Hotel.  Where the hotel does fall short is the pool.  It is very small. However, it was never that busy when we were there, and we were always able to get a lounge chair.  It would have been nice to have had some dining options at the hotel but Downtown Disney is not far away. The best part of the hotel is the private entrance for PP guests into DCA.  This was very convenient

I like to stay on property when visiting Disneyland. We chose Paradise Pier because of the price, availability, and the newish entrance to DCA.  The staff was helpful & friendly. I love the elevator system. Fast & efficient if you know how to use it. We had a park/fireworks view that was great! The room is a regular size room with an outdated bathroom. Sure it needs an upgrade and will be getting it soon. I’m curious to the new pricing. The pool is truly whatever, but it does have a big slide. The day we were there the dj music was too loud and terrible. Probably just trying to drown out the construction behind them. The worst pool out of their 3 hotels, but better than no pool or the dreaded indoor pool. Great gift shop on site. Sells wine so that’s a plus for those needed a

A couple of good points:  Location and comfortable beds.  I guess my expectations were too high resulting in a very unsatisfactory stay at this hotel.  The hotel is rated 4+ but I would rate it no more then  3.  Pool was very unattractive and pool towels felt like cheap thin rags.  Absolutely no food / drinks at hotel!  Not exactly my idea of a resort.  A/C in rooms work but fan is extremely noisy.  I would pay more to stay at their other hotels.  I guess that is what they want!  they appear to be cultivating to a higher income client base.  I doubt that was Walt envisioned.

Incredibly convenient property backs right up to California adventure and is literally a 5 min stroll into the park.  Rooms are very nice and come with typical excellent Disney service .   We had a park view room which was fun.    Price is high (Westin nearby is nicer and cheaper) but you’re paying for convenient park access and Disney service which are both extraordinary .    This property was under some renovation at the time we visited so there were no on property food options other than a self scan grab and go.  Not a problem really though as the two other Disney resorts and Downtown Disney were all within a 5-10 min walk.

If you are wanting that “Disney” experience and feel then this is definitely not worth your $$$!  No restaurants on property, staff are not friendly and helpful and you can’t even get a decent coffee in the mornings…  It was not what we would’ve expected from a supposed “Disney Resort”

We picked this hotel as it was the cheaper of the Disney properties.  What we didn’t know when booking was it was going to go under construction. The room was amazingly clean, we did not hear any construction and had a very pleasant sleep. Pool basic but fun. And I thought we would be a long walk from everything and we really were not. It was surprisingly closer then we anticipated. I would stay here again!

We stayed at Paradise Pier in June 2022 for a few nights to extend a vacation to the Anaheim area and visit Disneyland. The hotel is comfortable and the service is excellent. You get the Disney experience you expect from a Disney property.   Although many hotels are conveniently located near Disneyland, Paradise Pier is just across the street. This also puts you in close proximity to Downtown Disney and all the dining and shopping it has to offer.  My only real complaint about Paradise Pier was that there wasn't a convenient restaurant on the property open while we were there. It isn't a deal breaker because there are so many places to eat between the hotel and either Disneyland or Disney's California Adventure, but I would have appreciated the convenience.

A convenient hotel for going to either Disneyland park or California Adventure. Not as luxurious as the Grand Californian, but still fun. Room has a fridge, but no microwave. Market on the first floor is very reasonably priced for Disney.

My two teenage grand girls and myself  just returned from staying at the Pier and I am glad to report that we had a wonderful stay. The pool and restaurant are open, the Downtown Disney view room was Disney beautiful,  clean and comfortable and the staff was exceptionally kind and helpful. The hotel is conveniently located across the street from the California Grand where an entrance sends you into Downtown Disney. The girls enjoyed the pool and I enjoy the close location into the Disney parks. Outside our room we had a like closet for ice and a vending machine with soda and bottled water. My only complaint --  no housekeeping pick-up so our dirty towels sat on the bathroom floor  for two days.   Apparently if you call the lobby someone will come and pick up the towels. Would

We recently stayed 4 nights and had a great experience! Yes, the hotel is dated. However, I found the customer service to be above and beyond, and the room was exceptionally clean. We were gone at Disney each day but always returned to a clean room with fresh linens and everything had been cleaned and wiped down. We also saw them frequently cleaning the carpets and surfaces in the hallways and elevators. Honestly I was very impressed with the level of cleanliness! The pool was small but it had a water slide which was a huge hit with the kids. The only other bummer was that the rooms do not have microwaves and you have to go downstairs to microwave food. We did use door dash and it’s also free to have food delivered from the other Disney hotels and downtown Disney. Overall I

Summary Heading: Good proximity to the parks, good value (for Disney)
Summary: Anywhere else, it would be overpriced ... but it's Disney. For similar proximity to parks in Florida you'd pay $100 more per night minimum. It's nothing fancy, but it was nice, clean and had good beds/pillows. I see other reviews that are disappointed in dining options, but it's not a secret and Grand Californian is just across the street. We ate at parks or downtown Disney all of which are very close. It was great to be easily close enough to come back and nap in the heat of the day and they have awesome AC and good wifi.

Summary Heading: A lazy pig in Disney lipstick.
Summary: Believe me, you need to read reviews like this.  I paid an insulting $1000 for a two night stay at this place. The only thing going for it is its proximity to downtown Disney and the theme parks. There are much much nicer hotels in the area to stay in.  This place doesn’t even serve coffee in the morning for that price. You have to go down to their snack station and pay $2.25 for a machine to make a lousy (literally lousy) coffee.     The hotel does not feel like a Disney property at all, despite the Disney art hanging on the walls and the Disney music being piped through the sound system.  Underneath it all is just a 1970s high-rise hotel guess it out to look vaguely like a Disney property. And I mean vaguely.  Unless you want pay an extra three to $500 for your stay just to be

Summary Heading: Welcome Home was when we got Home
Summary: Other than the Name and the Cast Members - we did not feel like we stayed in a Disney Location.  There was no place to eat in the Paradise Pier for Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner.  With my wife is a wheel Chair we had to go across the street every time we wanted some quick service Items.   From the moment we arrived we noticed an unusual smell of the water which we seldom used but when we started to notice small flies coming out of the sink we call maintenance.    No Pool on site which meant you needed to travel to another Disney Hotel for that also.   We have stayed in Disney World many times as a DVC member and never experienced such a disappointment.   See you seem Orlando...  Book Bye Anaheim.

The only reason we booked 1 night here was because the Disneyland hotel was sold out and we wanted to add a night to our reservation at a Disney hotel only.  We booked Paradise Pier because you are allowed to walk across the street and enter CA Adventure park thru Grand CA Hotel private entrance (just had to show our room key).  The entire floor smelled disgusting as soon as we stepped off the elevator, water smelled like sewer in sinks, everything was dated, there are no restaurants to eat breakfast at, pool was closed for renovation.....and it still cost over $300 night for this dump.  We will not be staying here again.

My family and I got this room as part of a Costco package, and it was definitely worth it financially. We got the room and a two day pass to the parks for a family of five. The rooms were a touch small, and slightly dated. On the other hand, we didn't spend a bunch of time in the room, so the size didn't make much of an impact. The couch was a rollout, so all five of us slept comfortably without any issue.   This hotel is a nice walking distance from Downtown Disney, with all the shops and restaurants. Definitely not a complaint there, as we didn't have to drive much. Also, access to Disneyland is available through the Monorail, so we did not have to go through security twice to get into the parks which was also a bonus considering the kids are smaller and we walked with a

Summary Heading: Typically overpriced but close to the park
Summary: As with all things Disney, the value received is dependent upon what your "love of Disney" entails.  Disney is always more expensive than anywhere else, and usually there is a benefit to staying at a Disney hotel.  In this case the only real benefit is location.  The rooms are older, but still comfortable.  The people are friendly.  Food options were terrible as they were testing an app that never worked so finding meals was tough.  Luckily we had a car which allowed me to drive and get some cheaper options.  There were no characters to speak of except a Santa Claus for pictures.  They need to do better to justify the costs in my mind

Summary Heading: Stay at Best Western - Save your $$
Summary: The pros are the staff are super friendly. Even when disappointed about our stay at the sub par Disney property and talking with management, she was very gracious and thanked me for feedback. Also enjoyed a golf cart ride over to Disneyland pool.  Yet, we wanted to enjoy a 'magical' time.  Instead we found the resort largely closed, no pool, nor restaurants, super dated and no better than either of the two best westerns on the other side of the park with a similar proximity.  We tried to use the Disneyland pool two times in our four day stay but it was jam packed.  Our server was kind but nervous as she was breaking the rules of serving us when we didn't have a chair - they were all taken given they were accommodating two hotels with one pool.  I also expected convenience of

So we stayed here on the Disney property to enjoy some specific perks that I was told only Disney hotels offer. I was told that if you stayed at a Disney resort that you could enjoy a magic morning which would let you into the parks 1 hour before everyone else, this IS NOT TRUE anymore.  All of the dining restraunts are all closed, so you have to go to massively full Donwtown Disney to eat or get food delivered to you. Plus we were never informed but the pool and the entire fireworks observing deck is closed and being remodeled, so the only other option was to take a golf cart shuttle from the Paradise Pier to the Disney hotel, which we did and enjoyed it one day. The bottom line is that there is ZERO reason to stay at this hotel over another close resort to the opening gates

Summary Heading: Overpriced and poor service and blamed on covid. Read this before you spend over $360 a night.
Summary: For $369 + tax a night, I expected at least a decent experience. The room itself was fine. Out dated but fine. The shower head was extremely low. I’m 5’6” and it was just above my head. The water temperature was totally unacceptable. Dangerously so. It would go from scalding hot to very cold in seconds and it did this every 20 seconds. You can’t leave a child to shower alone because they can get a severe burn. I was in room 434 if that makes any difference. Never have I experienced such heat change in any hotel shower. Then they had the excuse that due to covid there was only housekeeping service every third day. Imagine paying these prices to never having your room cleaned or bed made? My son stayed at the Hyatt down the street and every morning they made their beds and left

We've stayed at Disneyland Hotel and Grand Californian before. I was pleasantly surprised at how much we enjoyed our stay.  Rooms are decent size, clean and quiet. I have read reviews about elevator issues. It's because they installed a new system that allows you to select your floor  and assigns you an elevator.  I think it's just too new of a system to figure out. It actually works pretty well once you figure it out.  No pool or restaurant service due to renovation.  We got shuttled(golf carted) to Grand Californian pool which was fine. Overall the staff are very helpful and hotel is clean. You can't beat the convenience.

We knew that the hotel was under renovation (re-imagining) so we were prepared for the minor inconveniences that were in progress.  We also knew that the restaurants were not open, so we ordered a grocery delivery from a local store that allowed us to have some supplies in our room for the late night returns from the park. (We also got some breakfast items for the next morning from the Starbucks in Downtown Disney on our way back to the hotel). The hotel staff is extremely helpful and the easy access to the parks is worth the stay.  We have stayed there three times and  enjoyed it every time!

The hotel was amazing! The staff was amazing! The location was amazing! We loved every second of it. Even though we got evacuated at 3am our first time there because there was a mechanical failure with the fire alarm and we had to run down 14 flights of stairs at 3am with a sleeping child. Even though that happened, we still loved it. If we went back to Disneyland we would stay there again. I would choose Paradise Pier over the Grand Californian or the Disneyland hotel. Paradise Pier exceeded my expectations in every way!

Took my kids to Disneyland for their first trip and went with this hotel to keep the Disney theme going all day, but for a little less than the other Disney resorts. The biggest reason we picked it was for proximity to the parks, as the last thing I wanted to do after a long day is wait for a shuttle or walk for even longer with two cranky and tired kids.  I'll start with the positives: Really great location. It's a short walk to the entrance of the parks and you can cut through the Grand Californian for an even quicker trip. Our room view ended up being over California Adventure and it was fun for the kids to see the Incredicoaster and other rides running and lit up at night. The room itself was fine. Clean and with enough space for our family of four.   Negatives: We hoped to

Summary Heading: Outdated, dirty, no amenities, over priced
Summary: The hotel is very outdated with zero amenities. We were so excited to stay at a Disney hotel, but ended up being disappointed. Room 432 has a view of a loading dock and the back of CA Adventures- the noise level from trucks backing up, cars racing down the street and workers was so bad we couldn’t sleep. Lights from outside come through the AC vents as does noise. Terrible carpets near the bathroom, fan/vent in the bathroom does not work (mold on the ceiling), baseboards were coated with dirt and hair, shower pressure was minimal because half of the water was coming out of the bathtub faucet and would not switch to the shower head- someone should look at this. Air conditioning turned off when we left the room so when we came back it was HOT & humid in the room. No on site food

This hotel was ridiculous and very overpriced. The hotel room was old and run down. Staff was not helpful at all. On top of that they had no bell service available for our bags and did not even want us to borrow their baggage cart. I feel like Disney needs to step up their game and their should be more accommodations for those that stay at Disney’s Paradise Pier. They should also update their hotel and rooms for sure.

Staying at this hotel is not at all like staying at the Disneyland Hotel or Grand Californian. There is no restaurant, no pool, and food cannot be brought to your room (although you can order delivery from several restaurants and have them delivered to the front desk.) The high price of staying at this hotel comes with the perk of being able to walk through the Grand Californian to shortcut to California Adventure. For me, it was worth the extra few hundred I paid just for that, but I have bad knees and I know I am not most people. I knew this going in, and therefore I was not disappointed with the hotel at all. My room was clean and the bed was VERY comfortable, oh my goodness... I slept great. The staff here is so so pleasant, although not always helpful: when I pulled in to

I’ve stayed here a couple times and it’s not bad. It’s the cheapest out of the three hotels (Grand Californian and Disneyland Hotel.) I think the hotel does need an upgrade given the fact that it is a Disney Property hotel and it has its expectations. The beds are comfortable and I like the desk that the room provides. I usually cut through the Grand Californian to get to the parks rather than walking around the downtown Disney entrance.

No pool, no restaurants, limited housekeeping, a hotel in serious need of a refurbishment, and high prices.   But, they do have comfy beds and great pillows. I'm honestly feeling taken advantage of at these prices and probably won't be back.

I’m so disappointed in this resort. We have 2 kids and have always stayed at the Grand Californian or the Disneyland Hotel and planned this trip very last minute so ended up staying at Paradise Pier- I’ll never make that mistake again. First off it’s a very average hotel- which you’re kind of used to if you stay at Disney hotels- you’re paying mainly for the convenience but at least with the other 2 the Disney experience really spills over into the hotel but this one was just shabby and depressing. We had no heads up that the pool and water slides were closed so that was disappointing and in addition to that, the restaurant wasn’t open and no room service. On the first morning we went to the park all day with our kids, got back very late and our room had not been cleaned and we

Summary Heading: Walt Disney must be turning in his grave!
Summary: After years and years of going to Disneyland and staying at Disney properties I cannot adequately express my level of disappointment and disgust.  This is definitely not the "Disney Experience"  1.  Dirty Rooms (please see photos . . . I could have taken a dozen more) 2.  No Housekeeping  3.  Outdated 4.  Running a jackhammer all day remodeling the pool (no warning about the pool) 5.  No restaurant open on property (Don't blame Covid, the other two resorts were up and running . . . with all their restaurants). 5.  No early morning entry (a huge perk taken away) 6.  No delivery of items to your room from Disneyland shops. (another perk taken) 7.  Faulty air-conditioning, with bent vents.  The room was either freezing or stuffy. 8. Paper thin walls 9.  No real lobby in comparison

Read the fine print. Pool closed. Restaurants closed. And housekeeping only comes every other day and then only to pick up trash (no making beds or other services). Disney parks are full and restaurants open in parks and other Disney hotels open, so this is cost cutting not safety protocols. Feels like the hotel is functioning with very limited staff. Wait until they figure out how to open the hotel fully rather than wasting close to $400/night on a hotel with no services. Worst Disney stay in 15 years.

Summary Heading: Zero amenities for a high price
Summary: Although it's nice to stay so close to the parks for over $400 a night, I expect more. We booked a premium view room and, yes, the view was great.  California Adventure was laid out before us. The room was ok but nothing very special. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel has no restaurants ("They're all being re-imagined" but no work was being done) and no bar. There's a gift shop and a self-service food market where you can buy snacks. Housekeeping was almost non-existent.  They service the rooms only every other day and all they do is empty the trash can and put in new towels. They couldn't have spent even a full minute in our room. Sorry but I expect to have the bed made when I'm paying that much for a hotel room.  Also, it used to be that when you stayed at a Disney

Move over Kim, J.Lo and Beyonce.. Veronica is here!! They made us feel like we were celebrities from the moment I stepped foot into the hotel... that's when the magic began! We were there celebrating my husband's 50th Birthday who is an avid Disney lover!  Samantha greeted us with the warmest welcome and prettiest smile, she went above and beyond to make sure we had the best experience ever! She sprinkled her pixie dust and made all my husband's Disney memories dreams come true! Our room was absolutely beautiful and view was breathtaking!! The hotel is clean, all staff was nice, professional and helpful, Luis was very informative and amazing as well! Thanks again for helping us create memories that will last a lifetime!!

Because of Covid 19 there are no restaurants open in the hotel. The house keeping is every 3 nights but they are really good about bringing extra towels or items that you need. There is also no valet parking but the self parking is very easy and there are lots of spots available in the garage right next to the hotel.   The room was excellent with 2 queens and a day bed. Everything was very comfortable. We usually stay at the Grand Californian, but it wasn't available. This is a very good alternative. Also to get to the parks just walk across the street and go through the Grand Californian. DO NOT go the LONG way through downtown Disney.

I was a little nervous before arrival with the negative reviews, but we really enjoyed our visit to this hotel. We had done a lot of research on what was and wasn’t available due to COVID. We knew no restaurants were open in the hotel. The Grand Californian was quite literally right across the street and we ate there twice. One night we ordered take out from a restaurant in Downtown  Disney and it arrived quickly and hot and we enjoyed our meal out on the pool deck. We did not find the walk to the parks to be terrible. Because we were staying at the resort we were able to access Downtown Disney through the Grand Californian and that got you pretty close to the park gates. A couple of days we grabbed breakfast in Downtown Disney on our way to the park. As for the elevators we did

My family & I stayed here from July 24 - 26. For me, it is only worthy of a 3-star rating. For  a hotel that have the Disney name on it,  it’s just very disappointing that  the hotel looks like a regular hotel. Looks old, they haven’t tried to repaint the building. Nothing special! I just hate that the hotel is a bit expensive, no breakfast and needs to pay for the parking. Unbelievable! Not worthy of every penny. I just tried this place for the sake of my kids and what’s really the fuss about Disney hotels, and I’m thankful I’ve tried and I can only say that it’s not worth it. The only good side of this place is aside from walking distance, is the pool and water slide that you can watch the fireworks at night in the comfort of your seat. You need to try to stay here to see. But

This was our first stay at Paradise Pier and it will be our last.  I've stayed at the Grand and a few Disney hotels in Florida that were all very nice even the value resorts in Florida are better than this hotel.  First off the decorations in the room are cute and I loved the bedding but when I sat on the bed I felt the springs and heard the bed Creek.  I was shocked by this!  This is a park view room which you pay a pretty penny for and I could have had a better night stay at any Marriott or Hilton for half the price.  I was only here for 2 nights and booked this resort due to the convenience of not having to shuttle to and from the parks with such a short stay.  I also agree with the others that the elevator is horriable.  It doesn't account for how many people are in the

Summary Heading: Convenient, but total lack of Disney magic.
Summary: We stayed at Paradise Pier for four nights during our family vacation. While the staff was very nice and helpful, the room was a HUGE disappointment. It was clean, but the tv was so outdated. No Disney plus? No Disney movies available to rent? It's like stepping back to the tech of 2003. The rooms are so outdated and in need of repairs. The beds were comfy though. There is no food on property at all! The coffee they give you in room is gross. Closet coffee is in Disney Hotel ( 5 minute walk ). I understand there are covid protocols but come on. Oh and housekeeping just replaced our towels, no general clean at all. I even took everything off the beds and did a small tidy before they came. Walked back after a long day at the park hoping to have a clean room...nope just some

Summary Heading: Comfortable, but no food options detracted from the "magic."
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Paradise Pier hotel for our anniversary weekend.  We decided to spoil ourselves by staying at a Disney property for the first time.  We were upgraded to a park view room, which we appreciated, and enjoyed the pool and being able to watch the fireworks with the soundtrack piped in directly to the pool deck.  However, the complete lack of any food options in the hotel at present (July, 2021) and lack of any available dining options in Downtown Disney due to the impossibility of getting a reservation, meant that my husband and I had to do a considerable amount of walking in order to find food.  The off-Disney food options are limited and not particularly awesome.  So if you're planning on staying at the Paradise Pier during the summer of 2021, be sure

Summary Heading: Good and comfortable, but feel just like a Hotel Inn (at the moment)
Summary: We have good, comfortable stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel but looking at photos from other travelers, the hotel have not bring back it's Disney Touch yet:  1) There is no Disney Character, no Ball cushions etc in the room. The ONLY Disney items is a Goofy statue in the lobby, and a Disney poster in the room.  2) As other mentioned, there is no food options in the hotel. Not even a decent coffee shop. The Grill was closed for now so the front desk suggested Uber eat for dinning options. 3) The room however is comfortable, clean, and they give you nice H2O+ shampoos 4) The walk to the Disney is not that close. you need to go thru Disney Downtown first.   It's post Covid re-opening so I understand and accept the limitation. However one have to prepared that this is not at the same

Summary Heading: The elevator design in this hotel is attrocious.
Summary: Middle of July of 2021, reopening.  We get it.  Thank you for opening up. All 3 restaurants are closed so you have to make other arrangements if you want to eat.  The #1 complaint is the elevators which look like the engineering was given to an 8-year-old who knows how to program computers.  Not accounting for demand or capacity, you have no choice in these elevators, and you are screwed during high-demand times.  In normal elevator design, we are used to indicating to the car or bank of cars that we want to go up or down.  This eliminates that by having a kiosk that asks you what floor is your destination.  The kiosk then tells you what car to wait for.  Once you get in the car, we are used to then telling the car which floor we wish to go to.  Not here, there are no floor

I booked this hotel a little over a month ago, before "California opened". We have never stayed at a Disney hotel before, and were so excited for our trip. The rooms were nice, the pool was nice and the walk to the park was convenient. (that's what earned the 3 stars. But the amenities and everything else lacked big time! For the what you pay to stay there, it was a total rip off. We would be have been better off staying off property somewhere. There was absolutely no food service, or bar at all. Completely closed down after covid. I do understand, but when we booked this hotel, that wasn't decided yet or known to the public. Had I known we wouldnt have any type of restaurant or food service, I would have booked elsewhere. Also, no housekeeping between nights. After our long day

first we asked the front desk to switch out towels, and then housekeeping didn't do it. We asked for a room clean they say they only do it on Thursday which the manager then told us isn't true. No offer to do anything but bring it to staffs attention, and on our last day my wife tennis bracelet is missing along with a phone charger, they said the phone charger was picked up and taken to lost and found.

We love disney properties! This was the only one available so we booked it! This hotel would not be my first choice but it’s ok. Kids will like the pool area more than adults. It’s not really a resort. Just a hotel.  My pros-  We were able to check in early The pool was never really crowded  Quick elevator- I like their system  Gift shop full of park items Comfortable beds Great park side view! Friendly staff My cons- Cheap coffee maker Dated rooms The pool has a slide that is nice, but the pool area is truly whatever. It’s basically in a parking lot or at least feels like it.  Kinda expensive for no real amenities.  Lacks ambiance.   I will say that every cast member I encountered was friendly and welcoming. That goes a long way.

It began with the cheap and creepy “welcome” by some nut job blowing bubbles on people. The pool was shut down, the room phone didn’t work, the laundry facilities didn’t work and our son got stuck in an elevator for ten minutes. And it only went downhill from there.  The COVID issues like no food service are acceptable but the rest of this was not.  Do yourself a favor and do not stay there. We moved The Hilton and we’re much happier.

The staff was great but the hotel itself was not. We’ve been fortunate to stay in all three Disneyland hotels and this one is lacking in many areas. The rooms are clean but dated, the years of wear really show. The bathroom had ripped wall paper near the shower. The plugs at the desk were worn out and charging blocks fell right out(most hotels even inexpensive ones have updated outlets with USB chargers, they did not) there was no microwave on our floor. And we couldn’t find one anywhere. There was no binder or amenity info or even a QR link to find the information. No pens or notepads in the room. The gift shop was nice. The restaurants on site were all closed. In my opinion this is a huge issue to have the hotel not have food onsite. We went to the Grand for dinner one night

The room was lovely.  I had a view of the pool and the parking lot. I didn't quite understand the elevator system, though.  There are multiple elevators, but I'd put in my floor, and then the keypad would tell me which elevator to use.  During peak times (travelers coming or going), it was a long wait for an elevator, and often, it would be too full to fit one more person, so I'd have to repush my floor of choice and wait for another elevator.  That was a bit annoying.  In the middle of the day, it wasn't so bad.  As I had informed the person who took my reservation that I'd be celebrating my husband's birthday--even though he had just passed away, she listed birthday on the reservation.  When I explained I had come solo, the staff were so kind and compassionate and caring.

Exactly the service you'd expect from a Disney property. The front desk staff were helpful and efficient.  There was an issue with our reservation and they fixed it right away.  She even offered us an extra fast pass  for our trouble.   We had a room on the 15th floor with a premium view. The club level costs extra and so does the view. In there future I will still stay on the club level however I will not spring for the view.  seeing the park is fun, however its also fairly loud. ( until about 11 or 12 at night)  Being on the club level allows you to take advantage of the guest lounge on the second floor  snacks are out almost all the time.  A nice light continental breakfast. (have a frosted donut, they are super yummy) cocktails available in the evening at happy hour, and I

I stayed at the Disney Paradise Pier with my family in early March 2020. There were two adults and two toddlers. The overall experience was excellent. All staff members from the front desk, to the restaurant servers to custodians all displayed perfect customer service skills and were especially kind to my young children. Other companies and hotels would do well to study how Disneyland and its hotels treat customers. My children especially loved the character breakfast at the PCH Grill, this is worth doing once during your stay if it is your first time. The rooms were adorably decorated and the kids loved the Pixar "Luxo" ball throw pillows. My wife and I really liked the sea-scented body washes, shampoos and lotions provided in the rooms. The hotel is not too crowded and very

Summary Heading: Great Location ~ Great Amenities ~ Loved Our Stay!!
Summary: My kids (14 and 12) and I stayed here for 5 days over Spring Break.  Check-in was quick and efficient and the woman at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful.  We stayed in a regular room (the least expensive room category) and there was plenty of room for the three of us and our luggage.  We each had our own sleeping space, with two queen beds and the couch.  The bathroom was also spacious.  Housekeeping did a great job of making sure the room was very clean and it was always serviced by the time we came back from the parks to take an afternoon break.    The hotel and rooms are not luxurious (don't expect Four Seasons quality), but they are nice enough and you are definitely paying for the proximity to Disneyland and the Disney theme of the hotel.  Since I was

Once again my wife & I stayed at the Paradise Pier on our trip to The Happiest Place on Earth!  Once again the Pier did not disappoint!  We asked for an upgrade/room with a view at check in.  We were able to get a room on the 12th floor with an absolutely fantastic view of the Disney California Adventure park.  An added plus, the room was ready when we checked in at noon.  The staff at check in was great.  We were in the room in about 15 minutes then off to the park.  From our room we watched the World of Color show later that evening.  With the sound on the TV it was like being front row at the show.  Without having to walk back to the hotel after the show.  Room was clean and very comfortable.  Only place we stay when we come!

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel and turned out to be far better than expected! The rooms and service was top notch. The only mark against it for me was how far I had to walk to get to the parks

We spent 5 days here and by far the highlight was the hour early entry each day.  Friendly staff on front desk but bell service all seemed to have the attitude that guest were and inconvenience. The hotel room is nothing special at all (Legoland does a much better job for families) and the pool and slide was a hit for the kids but not too exciting for adults. The best thing was that this was an easy walk to the parks and was one of the few hotels that accommodated a family of 5. some people say its a bit far but we found it ok, and you have to expect to walk a lot in the park anyway. Biggest tip we have is that you can get amazon fresh deliveries nice and easy which really made our lives much easier rather than having to buy food constantly.

Spent a night here after a week at the Grand Californian. It isn’t the Grand but it is a nice hotel, we stayed club level and enjoyed it. Clean, comfortable and the staff in the lounge were great. The longe had lots of great food.

My family just stayed there for 5 days and we had a great time. My only complaint is there pool and hot tub hours, 10am -8pm and water slide closes at 5pm. The character breakfast was great but not cheap. Staff were friendly.

Summary Heading: Very nice for the price and locations
Summary: The staff was so friendly.  The rooms are nice.  And, I didn't mind the walk from the hotel to Downtown Disney.  There's a very nice, well-lite, sidewalk from the hotel, too.  There was a lovely gift shop and a very nice bar and restaurant area.

We liked the pool, although the slide was out of order half the time (we were directed to the Disneyland Hotel to use their pool those times, although we didn't take advantage. More walking was not on the playlist). Lots of lounge chairs; as we traveled in the "off season", the pool was never too crowded. The room was standard, on par with a Best Western but with the Surfer Mickey theme. Check-In was thorough, she went over every little detail of the hotel and our accommodations. She definitely made an On-Property Guest out of me, for life. The valet parking was great. Being able to send your stuff back to your hotel was kind of convenient, although they don't take it to your room like a lot of people tend to spout. You have to call bell services the next day, after 7am, to get

We were hugely disappointed to find out the actual entrance to Disneyland is a half mile from this hotel...so a nightmare if you have kids.  We spent a lot of money because their ads make you believe it’s very close to the entrance which is not true...sad

Summary Heading: A Nice Hotel but Too Pricy
Summary: We stayed 5 nights 1/28-2/1/20 and, while generally enjoyed the room, it had drawbacks enough I would not stay there again.  Bell service at arrival did not offer to help us with our baggage and stood chatting with a guest. Or it could have been a fellow employee. Check in was great. Desk staff knew their job. Our daughter and SIL were already in their room so we requested one on the same floor. I received a text when it was ready. We were in DD so I wrote we’d be there soon and received a very nice reply. I mailed a postcard and the desk clerk let me know they would have put a stamp on it for me which is listed nowhere on their website!  Room 832 had a nice view of DCA but the loud one sounds of the show was clearly heard if you were in the room during showtime. The lights were

We stayed here 5 years ago and had such a great experience that we stayed again. We stayed for 6 nights and while the hotel rate was a little on the expensive side, the benefits of being close to downtown Disney and both parks outweighed the price concern for us. We also stayed while there was a music convention, new Star Wars ride opening and MLK Jr weekend so that may be why it was a little more pricey. The kids 12 & 13 loved every minute of the experience and wouldn’t hesitate to do it all again! Smooth and easy check in and out process, friendly and professional service and close to so many fun family restaurants and activities.

Disney's Paradise Pier is nice hotel, although not particularly memorable. The rooms are good sized, including two queen beds plus a sofa that can become a day bed. The beds were comfortable. The decor is fine with some Disney whimsical touches, but not wonderful. We had no noise from the hallways and minimal noise from outside. The bathroom is dated, particular the shower. One morning we had lukewarm, not hot, water. The second day the housekeeping staff did not refill the shower gel despite the bottle being empty that morning and the fact that we left a tip in the room for housekeeping.  It's a quick walk to the entrance to Downtown Disney and the two theme parks from Paradise Pier. Disney's Grand Californian Hotel is just across the street.  We ate breakfast at the Surfside

We stayed the night before we went into the park.  is a little $$$$ but easy to get into the park  staff was supper friendly and had lots of advice on how to make the most of our stay.   Lock to the door did break and were not able to get in the room.  front desk sent worker up right away and was able to get us in.  fixed the door and even gave us some extra fast passes for the park the next day.    even the maintance workers want you to have a great time.    only bad thing I can say is that it was about the cost.  but you pay for what you get.

Summary Heading: Expensive but with many Disney touches
Summary: We had a group of 5 stay in a room which comes with 2 double beds and a sofa bed. It was surprisingly not too cramped and we loved all the mickeys throughout the room and despite the age of the hotel, we liked the decor more than Disneyland hotel which was a few minutes/blocks closer to downtown Disney and the parks. We stayed here for the early entry which was worth it for the time savings in Disneyland park and getting to the star wars ride as soon as star wars land opened but the room did cost about 3x any non-Disney hotel for the holiday season. That said, it was still cheaper than Disneyland hotel and the 5 person max occupancy was nice. We weren't huge fans of the character dining here as the breakfast food and service wasn't the best but our daughter loved meeting donald,

I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the room and the service we received at Paradise Pier! We booked thru Disney Travel which I highly recommend as we received extra perks for booking through them and the price was very comparable to the Grand Legacy which we've stayed at before and is across the street from Disneyland. Staying at Paradise Pier allowed us to gain access to both parks at 7am each day rather than only having one day of "Magic Morning". This was really beneficial at Christmas as the parks were very busy. The bedding and beds were really comfortable, the housekeeping was excellent and the front counter check-in was great as the lady changed our room to allow us a view of the World of Color from our room. The only strange thing is their elevators are

Summary Heading: Stayed one night for early entry
Summary: Only stayed here one night as we had a budget-friendly hotel elsewhere. The view from the room was great with full views of California Adventure park and the World of Color show.   Room is small and doesn't have the same fun perks as the Disneyland Hotel but it was comfortable for one night. Pretty tight for a family with two adults and three kids. Windows won't open at all which sucks.  The pool was nice and the kids loved swimming there and we liked the food and bar service. Good view of the fireworks from the pool deck.  Breakfast options for early risers trying to get to extra magic hour entry wasn't awesome but we found something for everyone at the restaurant in the lobby.   Good hotel and close location to Disneyland of course but not really enough of a Disney experience

I stayed at The Paradise Pier in November. While it was a super busy time for DL, CA, the hotel was also busy but that didn't put a damper on the service. We stayed for four nights. The concierge and cast members were amazing. They let me know when my purchases from the park had arrived, and even offered to deliver them right to the room. Everyone on staff was super friendly and welcoming. Our room was a standard 2 queen bed room. We had a very nice view of CA and were able to watch World of Color from our room our first night. We had a character breakfast in the hotel with Donald, Daisy, Stitch amd Minnie. The food was very good, and all different varieties for different dietary choices. All the characters mingle around, for photos and autographs. They definitely don't seem to

We have stayed at both the Grand Californian and the Disneyland hotel so we thought we would try the paradise pier hotel on this trip. We stayed in a premier view room with concierge club access. This still was not enough to make it seem like the type of hotel you expect from Disney. It felt more like a cheap roadside motel with Disney characters on the walls. The concierge club had people camped out at all times of the day just waiting for food and the food was not that great. The service was rough with dirty plates left on tables and staff members only appearing every so often so if you needed something... you really had to keep your eyes peeled. Our room had a nice view of the park but I would have traded that for some hot water... our shower only had Luke-warm water at best.

Great location. Great place. Interior was beautiful. I liked the decor. Staff were nice. Room was beautiful and well maintained.  Its close to Disneyland While the hotel is on Disneyland property, it's a bit of a walk to the parks.

Lovely check in process. We got a gift of 3 fast passes for ANY ride (other than the Falcon). And this is where the good ends...  Had nachos (Yum!) In the lounge. We both had tummy trouble afterward.   One server wasn’t enough for the whole lounge. He couldn’t keep up. He was trying... asked for napkins and didn’t get any. Gave us the wrong bill. I had to stand up to get noticed. The TV was playing a WRESTLING show in which we heard cussing. 😳  Gross stains all over center rug and chairs are scuffed up and look well used (not in a fashionable way).  Overall, the food is better in the park. Don’t expect to pay less than $10 for any food item. The PCH buffet is $42 per adult and quite mediocre. You’re paying to see Stitch, Daisy, Donald and Minnie.   BUT! *** after I filled out

We had done this before with our other children a few years ago and it wasn’t too bad, it’s now super run down and very very over priced. At over A$250 for four people - it was very substandard. Characters looked old and almost dirty. This is the only place you can do a character breakfast, so Disney really need to pick up their game here. Further insulted by the tip being automatically put on the bill, then asked for an additional tip on top of that ! Ordinary to say the least.

This place is really nice! The staff is very friendly. Everything is nice and clean. The walk from the hotel to downtown Disney is very close which is a plus. They also have a viewing area for fireworks by the pool.

Summary Heading: Wonderful staff, clean room, and Magic Hour access
Summary: This is our second time staying at the Paradise Pier.  The last time we stayed there my sons were in strollers.  The next two visits to Disney we stayed at the Grand Californian due to proximity to both parks and ease of getting back to the hotel.  My sons are now teenagers, so I opted to stay at the Paradise Pier again as it was significantly cheaper and my sons can walk long distances and don't need to return to the room for naps. 😊  We enjoyed our stay again at the Paradise Pier.  All the staff were just awesome to us. Some reviewers mentioned that the hotel seems dated, but I really didn’t get that impression.  It was nice, and I like the beach décor.  Housekeeping was amazing.  They did a fantastic job cleaning our room.  The hotel has water in the lobby and that was nice.

We went with family (two rooms) for a Thanksgiving visit to the Disney parks as well as the Universal Studios park. The visit was greatly diminished by the continuous rain we experienced throughout the visit. There is nothing quite like Disneyland as seen through a poncho. In spite of that, the parks were very busy.  The hotel was fully booked throughout our stay. Our first night we discovered our neighbor was noisy (and child abusive). After visiting the front desk, the staff was extremely apologetic and concerned, and relocated us (along with some minor park upgrades) to try to ensure our stay was pleasant. They really tried to make it right. The second room was laid out just like the first, with was a typical two queen hotel room. There was nothing spacious about the rooms.

Summary Heading: Eh...you’re buying location and the magic hour
Summary: It’s the cheapest of the three Disney hotels and you are staying for the proximity and the Magic Hour.  We normally stay off property but wanted the MH so we could be first in the park for Star Wars land.  For that I would give 5 stars, but the hotel itself isn’t anything great.  Older rooms, elevators take forever, and the walls are pretty thin.  We heard babies crying through the night from two different rooms.  One next door and one across the hall.  Look, you aren’t staying there really for the room, you are there for the access, convenience and overall experience.  We are DVC owners so we buy into the concept but now that we have done Star Wars land I don’t think we would stay at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Good location but otherwise not worth it
Summary: The location is great and the views from the park view rooms can be lovely.  Unfortunately the hotel is not up to par in other areas.  We had asked for a room with one bed as we were traveling as a couple but were given a room with two beds.  The noise from the overnight work in the park was disturbing and all the food options are very over priced.     This hotel was not built by Disney but was rather acquired from a developer when DCA became a thing.

Summary Heading: Fair hotel with all necessary amenities and close to the action
Summary: We had a standard room with a view for 5 nights.  The view was perfect.  Hotel decor is fair.   I was on crutches so we were worried about the walk to DL and CA.  In the end the walk was ok.  The walk is approximately 7 minutes to the entrance to Downtown Disney.  You then have approximately 12 / 15 minutes to the entrance to DL and CA.  One day we did 13 hours at the parks so I have to admit I did wish we were in the Grand which is right next to the park but you'll pay $240/night extra for the luxury.    Overall we (8 y.o. girl, 11 y.o. bit, mum and dad)  loved this hotel and loved being on property at Disney with a big Disney store and meeting characters.

Despite our last visit to Disneyland and it's utter disappointment we decided to give it another try. We have stayed in hotels all over the Western Hemisphere and, we were surprised at the Paradise Pier Hotel, the least expensive hotel on the resort. The people in charge at the Beachcomber's Club (the concierge/club level lounge) were particularly amazing. We asked for the moon and they gave us the sun. We requested a room on the top floor to not have the pitter-patter of little feet above us, and they arranged our room to be on the very top floor. They said that they were "here to please" and they didn't stop until they found what we had wanted. (And this is again, the LEAST expensive of the Disneyland Resort properties and they treated us like royalty).   Our room was

Summary Heading: A Good Place To Stay If You Want To Walk To the Parks
Summary: My daughter and I spent four nights at Disney’s Paradise Pier Hotel in the middle of November.  For both of us, this was a first-time visit to Disneyland and Disney’s California Adventure park.  We have had good experiences staying at Disney hotels in Walt Disney World and decided we would do the same for Disneyland.  We did not drive a car to the resort, but rather we flew in by airplane from different locations to John Wayne Airport (SNA) in Orange County.  A Lyft ride cost us about $25 each way between the hotel and the airport.  During our stay, we wanted to be within walking distance of Downtown Disney and the park entrances.  The hotel does charge a daily parking fee if you bring a car.  We arrived around 1 PM and found the friendly front desk staff to be very welcoming.

This was first time at this hotel. I’ve stayed at grand California before. For the price I think this hotel is the better option. The check in process was easy and the staff was very kind and welcoming.   The room was amazing. I upgraded to premium that faces California adventure park and the view was amazing from the 11th floor room. The room was very clean. Three beds (two queen and and easy fold out couch). The bathroom was clean and a nice size. The room has a nice size tv, mini fridge, safe, coffee maker, iron with board, blow dryer and spacious closet with hangers.   The park is not a bad walk. From the rear of hotel to main entrance is about a 10-15 minute walk depending on pace. You walk through downtown Disney which is always fun and nice. Plenty of shopping. For a

Summary Heading: Concierge Service Makes This Place A Great Stay!
Summary: This was our first stay during Halloween week at any Disney property. It was a great time and loved the holiday details Disneyland is known for. As with any Disneyland Resort, prices are high. But, it was so worth paying a little more each night for the concierge service. They offered a hearty "continental"  breakfast to start a busy day at the parks. Guests can stop by anytime during the day for sodas, beers, and food--usually sandwich stuff and cookies. The price savings is huge, especially for a group of four or more. It was not a bad distance from park entrances, but a wheelchair is recommended for older folks and not strong walkers. We averaged 5-8 miles a day! I love the extras offered by Paradise Pier including the Cel painting. What a unique and fun treasure to do with

We had 5 nights here in August. We had previously stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and enjoyed our time there and we were keen to see what the other Disney Hotels had to offer. I would say they are on a par in terms of theming.  The reception staff were awesome from the moment we walked through the doors we were greeted with smiles and a nothing is too much trouble attitude. Self parking was easy and convenient. We had a room on the 4th floor and found the elevator situation to be old outdated and in definite need of an upgrade, the same goes for the drinks and ice machines that appear past their best. Our room looked out over the pool and on our walk to the room enjoyed the great views of California Adventure Park. The room was clean, tidy and spacious with a few Disney touches

We stayed at the Paradise Pier for three nights when we visited with our two boys for Halloween.  The cast members we interacted with were all courteous and very helpful. For what we paid the hotel itself was completely average.We had a premium view room, which gave us a partial view of the CA Adventure Park. Was the upgraded room worth the extra money? In my opinion, no. I just didn't feel that Disney magic. The hotel is somewhat close to the park entrances, being at the end of Downtown Disney. After a long day of standing and walking, it did still feel like a journey. Nothing beats the Californian on location! However, staying at a Disney hotel does come with some perks. The Oogie Boogie Halloween Bash was sold out online for Halloween, but select tickets were made available

Summary Heading: Stunning View of California Adventure Park
Summary: Really great Disney hotel literally on the doorstep of the Disneyland downtown and the two parks.  Room is was a great size and had a magnificent view of the park.  Highlight was being able to the see the fountain light show at night as well.  Great casual dining option and full buffet breakfast with characters as well.  Self parking is easy or you can take the valet option which we went for.  For me Disney is all about the parks, this hotel is clean efficient and really close vicinity so will definitely stay there again.

A good hotel to go to but some flaws in the hotel like Landry soap hard to open and a long walk to the Disney park.overall a good hotel to stay in and you get to meet the characters in there surf side lounge

Good enough but I was surprised they lacked some of the amenities finer hotel offered.  I felt it was more expensive that the hotel itself,  .7 miles to,the gates of Disneyland, think an off site hotel might be closer.  Making you walk through Downtown Disney before you get to the park iwas a turn off for us

Paradise pier has a great location walking distance to both parks . The service was very attentive and efficient . We chose the club level room which at the beginning I didn’t think it would be worth it . I was wrong I’m glad we had the chance to go to and have breakfast , snacks , appetizers and desserts through out the day . Definitely worth the price especially when traveling with little ones .

This was our second stay at Disneyland. The first time around we stayed at the Disneyland hotel. This trip the Disneyland hotel was too expensive so we opted for the Paradise Pier hotel. I wish we would have splurged and paid the extra $200 for the Disneyland Hotel. While the hotel amenities downstairs were nice, the room was very small, and not kept up well. The pool was a huge disappointment. It was so small, it did not accommodate the number of guests staying at the hotel. There was nowhere for the kids to move and they wanted to leave almost immediately. The only positive to share was the proximity to the parks and the Disney theme. I would highly recommend upgrading and staying at the Disneyland hotel- it is absolutely worth the extra money!

Our daughter turned sweet 16 in August, and the only place she wanted to go was back to Disneyland.  This was our 4th trip to Disneyland, and we have stayed both at the Paradise Pier and Disneyland Hotel and enjoyed our stays each time. We always stay in the park, it is so nice to go back to your room and get rejuvenated and take a break. We had great dinners at Labrea Bakery and Catal, Catal had a photographer taking photos and we went home 2 great Family photos. The electrical parade and amazing fireworks show completed our Disney Vacation. After all of these trips, we stopped at the Jazz Kitchen Express for Beignets (why did we not do this before)? Great Vacation, we "played" hard for 2 days and were able to see all of the things that we wanted to.

We had a great time attending the Oogie boogie bash last night.  We checked in early to the Paradise pier Hotel and was upgraded to a theme park view room. We had recently stay at the Disneyland Hotel and the grand Californian Hotel. After staying at all three of these resorts in the last six months I would say that the hotel room definitely needs quite a bit of upgrading. The carpet is very old and the bathroom floor and showers could definitely use some new tile. We did have a great time at the Donald breakfast buffet this morning. The kids enjoyed having the swimming pool and waterslide all to themselves for a while. We had so much fun at the bash last night going on rides with five minute wait times and collecting tons of candy. Overall I would pay more money to stay at the

We booked the Paradise Pier expecting nothing special but were quite surprised at the experience that we had.  Located adjacent to the California Adventure park (but opposite the entrance) as well as close to Downtown Disney the hotel is the least expensive bed-for-the-night of the 3 Disney hotels on the property.  That said, staff are very friendly and helpful, the food in the restaurant (had a buffet breakfast) is appealing, and who can't get excited when Daisy Duck and Minnie Mouse stop by for a cuddle?  There are a few things which could be made better, most notably making guests walk all the away around and through Downtown Disney to access the entrance to California Adventure.  It seems to me that there's very little reason not to allow any Disney guest access to that park

Summary Heading: Very nice place to take your family too!
Summary: I took both my daughters and their family (my grandchildren) to Disneyland and thought it would be nice to stay close and be on the property for convenience for my grandchildren. The Disney experience was wonderful. They gave us joining rooms which I really appreciated. My grandchildren were so excited to see all the Disney things and we had a view of California Adventure land. The only reason I didn't give 5 dots was that the Micky Mouse cartoons they were showing on the TV loop were the new ones, not the classic old ones which I though would be much appropriate. Great experience though and I would love to stay there again.

It was our first time visiting Anaheim. People told me to book cheaper hotels outside the Disney area. But being there for the first time, I wanted my kids to get the full experience. So I booked us here, and it was the best thing I did for this trip. From the time we arrived, the reception desk people were more than helpful. The rooms were great. We had a great view. Then we got to experience how close we were to the Disneyland park.  What I read about the place as being less busy compared to the other Disney hotels was true. So if you want a quiet place, I suggest you look into booking here.

Stayed 4 nights over Labor Day weekend, checked out on Labor Day.  Used our Disney Vacation Club points.  Had a two Queen bed with a futon like pullout bed.  The room and hotel were very nice. Pretty typical Disney quality and service which is to say excellent. Our room was ready at 1pm so we checked in, unloaded and hit the park.   A cast member by the unloading area saw we were a little lost and my wife was limping so he took us in a golf cart to the entrance to Downtown Disney. It’s actually an easy walk though. The elevators were fine, you just need to understand the process and it is smooth.   Maybe a little more tutorial in the lobby could help.  Breakfast Buffett was one of the better character breakfasts we’ve had.  I prefer the Grand California and even Disneyland

Summary Heading: This hotel does not feel like Disney
Summary: We stayed here and I honestly wish we would have stayed at one of the other Disney hotels.  It did not feel like Disney. We came from the park and it wasn’t that Disney feel when we got back so luckily we didn’t stay longer. Glass elevator is cool, but they need to clean the glass. Rooms are boring. Food is blah and limited. Pool is very small and old. This hotel needs a remodel. Disneyland hotel is much better!!!  Was not happy with the money I paid for this hotel at all. You can watch fireworks from the roof which is cool. And staff was nice.

The hotel is easy walking distance to Disney and the price is good compared to the other on-site hotels.  The room was clean, spacious and had some fun Disney accents.  We did not encounter any significant problems with the elevators although there was a line at the end of the night after fireworks.  We did not use the pool but could see it from our room.  It looks like a basic roof top style pool but there is a nice looking waterslide as well. The main negative we encountered is that we woke up one morning to find the hot water was not working.  When I called about the issue they did offer a credit toward breakfast.  The person who answered the phone made it sound like this was a new problem but when I checked out the desk attended said it had been an issue for a few days.

We've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and now at Paradise Pier. To be honest, the Disneyland Hotel is a lot nicer, but for the price, this was nice.  Customer service was what you can expect at anything Disney related... amazing! The rooms were comfortable and fully decked out in a Disney beach theme. The cafe downstairs was nice. The coffee was overpriced, but it was convenient, especially compared to waiting in the Starbucks line.  Really, the only parts of this hotel we didn't like were the looks of the Hotel on the outside and the pool. The hotel looked like a cheap hotel wrapped in Disney stuff, and the pool was lacking. They only had 1 water slide (I know I know, first world problems), and the pool was on the smaller side.  In the end, we were all happy to be here. It's a

This is an awesome hotel.  It is an older hotel, but is well maintained. It has a California/beach theme. There are Disney characters that walk around the property. If you stay at a Disneyland resort property you have early access to Disneyland in the morning.  You can buy tickets on the property and avoid the ticket line at the entrance. Very good customer service. It is a 15 min walk to Disneyland.

This hotel is a lovely facility, we arrived very early and were very lucky to have a room available, so we could check in and put our luggage into our room.  Bell service was available if our room was not ready.   We had a fantastic view on California adventure from our window, with it still being dark gave us the most magical first look at park.
