Benefits of staying in a Disney hotel is magic morning which can be used both on check in and check out days.  So we could access the park during this time.  Walk time to park is around 15 minutes via Downtown Disney.    Our son loved the lift calling system.   The rooms were specious and very clean.  All the staff we met were very kind and trendily

Old hotel, pool is very small and can’t accommodate their guests, outdated elevators, laundry room wasn’t working and it seems rarely is !! Rooms are very basic, not worth your money. The only benefit is that you can walk to downtown Disney but you can do this at the much nicer hotels in the area

Summary Heading: Maybe Not Quite Paradise, But Not Bad
Summary: Just finished up our stay at the hotel. Overall, this hotel is pretty good. Service was fine. It was clean. Cast members were friendly. Location is pretty good, too. However, if you’re looking to be dazzled by Disney magic, this isn’t the place for you. Very limited on the theming.  Also, if plenty of dining options and super cool pool area are important, this hotel isn’t what you’re looking for. If, you want to be within reasonable walking distance to the parks and monorail station, this hotel might suit your needs. Also, if you’re inclined, I’d recommend springing extra for the park view room. That was a show stopper. There’s also much grousing about the elevators. I personally didn’t find them to be overly slow or complicated. The system is a bit different, but really not a

Ok the hotel has some upsides,  10-15 walk to Disneyland, great views of the water/laser show and fireworks and of course you get golden hour entry at the park, but you really do pay for it.  Going with the family booked a family room, which is basically 2 queen beds in a room with a seperate bathroom. The room itself was scrupulously clean and well maintained but could do with a refresh.   The staff were fantastic, helpful and friendly and the water dispensers by the lift a nice touch.

Hotel is old, feels it has not been updated since the 80s. The mattresses are not in good shape, the shower is rusty and the overall look and feel does not match the Disney magic. In the first 5 minutes at check in the lady in the desk tries to sell us all type of different stuff and upgrades that we did not needed, and when we got to the questions we had about the park she went into "robot answer mode" and was not very willing to help. Also, no real benefit for park users (in some days you get entrance an hour earlier but they are kind of random). Walking distance from parks is the only plus. Never coming back to this one...they should learn from Orlando hotels in terms of Disney experience and benefits for guests.

This hotel is the least expensive out of the three. We enjoyed our stay there. It has its own entrance to the park via the Grand Californian Resort. Cute decor. Kids loved the glass elevator. We ate at the PCH Grill and loved meeting the characters.

Short 10-15minute walk to Down Town Disney and a little further to both parks.  Usual Disney offering.  Reasonable sized bedrooms and well maintained.  Roof level, third floor, pool open until 10pm every night with life guards.  Patio area to one side of pool able to view fireworks at 9:30pm with music piped through, but unfortunately not able to watch full display from pool.  Apparently the pool slide is the longest of all 3 Disney hotels.  Great memory making location.

It’s a gorgeous hotel, beautiful pool! My family stayed here for several days while enjoying Disneyland. My only issue with the hotel is the distance from the entrances to the Disneyland parks. The walk was a good 20 minutes door to door. They provided no other way to get there. It was only rough when going back after all day at the parks. The character breakfast on property was astounding, we went early and so my son got to interact with Donald and daisy and Minnie multiple times. We loved it

We stayed for two nights. Arrived at 11:45 am was happy to be greeted with great service and have our room ready early! Kids enjoyed the pool area and the character themed breakfast, which at first look seemed a bit overpriced but it was worth it to be fueled up and ready for the park. Prices a bit steep and the ambiance not the same as Disneyland Hotel but would stay again VS a good neighbor hotel for the service levels.

Summary Heading: Walkable to Downtown Disney, but average hotel
Summary: Having stayed at Value Resorts in WDW, this hotel did not compare with those in terms of theming. Still it is walkable to the parks and it was comfortable and clean. You can also watch the Disneyland fireworks from the pool deck. Given the fact little was open for the extra magic hours in Disneyland, I would not pay the premium to stay in this hotel. Self parking is $25 a day.

Summary Heading: Great place for your Disney trip
Summary: This place is great for convenience to the park.  This was our 2nd stay here.  Quick 10 min walk to the park which is nice if you have cranky kids or tired feet.  You can leave the park and take a quick rest.  Pool closes at 10:00 which is a little early imo.  Food options are limited as well.  They have a buffet, and a coffee shop that also has a limited menu.  Staff is always friendly.  We drove from Las Vegas to paradise pier using Alamo rental car.  Highly recommend Alamo as they have a rental center in the hotel and you can just drop the car off in the hotel parking garage.  No free shuttle to the airports, but the Disney shuttles come frequently...very convenient.  $30.00 per adult for the shuttle to LAX.  Alamo was closed so we dropped the keys off with the front desk and

We had a great visit to the Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel.  The Hotel Staff was very accommodating.  Every person we encountered went above and beyond for anything we asked for.    The rooms were clean and very spacious.  We were walking distance to the parks and had a great view from our room.  The hotel was a little pricey for what you get.  Overall it was a great experience.

Rooms are old and out-dated. There is nothing magical about this sub-par three star hotel. You are paying exorbitant rates for the privilege of early admission and being within 10 min walk of the parks - no other reason. Disney can do so much better! Big disappointment.

The Disney's Paradise Pier is the lowest cost of the 3 Disney hotels as well as the furthest in walking distance to the theme parks. With that said, the walk to the parks is still not bad which took me about 15 mins (including going through the security check points, with short lines of course). Considering I did not use any of the amenities offered on property, choosing this hotel made more sense for the lower cost AND I did mind walking.  I chose the standard room which had 2 queen beds and a day bed which was easy to convert. Though no one slept on the day bed, I couldn't tell you if it was comfortable or not, however, if you're the unlucky person it is better than nothing. I found the queen bed and pillow to be comfortable while the A/C unit noise was minimal. There is an

We had a great time at the Paradise Pier! We checked in early so our room wasn’t ready but they held our bags for us and we were able to walk around Downtown Disney and have a snack while we waited. They called when the room was ready which was so convenient. Our room was a nice size with two queen beds and a pull out couch, everything was always clean. The pool is fun, the kids loved the water slide, we also took advantage of the laundry room which was really nice. The Surfside Lounge has the best veggie burger I have ever had! We had dinner there one night and breakfast there the day we checked out, we’d like to thank our waitress Peggy in particular! She was so nice and we enjoyed talking with her. The extra hour in the parks in the morning made a huge difference. We were

Summary Heading: Loved the hotel, can walk to everything Disney
Summary: This hotel was very efficient from the start. They had a hostess with a handheld device in the line taking information to make check in faster. They gave us bottons and a coupon for a lanyard and free pin. It was only Starwars but that was ok. IF YOU PLAN TO RENT A CAR they have an Alamo car rental INSIDE the hotel which made it SO easy when we wanted to turn out car in. We planned to turn it in since we were not going to drive it the days while there and planned to rent another on our way out. It is super convenient BUT BOOK YOUR CAR AHEAD! We didn’t so it was easy to turn our car in but they were booked up as far as renting another. Just FYI. The rooms were always cleaned. We paid extra for the view of the park with I felt was worth it. There was a full laundry room there. It

We spent two nights at the Paradise Pier Hotel during our visit to California. The location is great—walking distance to Downtown Disney and the Disney parks, plus shorter admission lines and early admission opportunities! It was easy to come back to the room during the day for a rest, and then go back to the park for the evening. The rooms are spacious and include a daybed, refrigerator, and safe. There’s a rooftop pool with water slide and cafe. You can even see the Disney fireworks from the pool area. There is also a Disney character dining experience in the hotel and a small cafe. Only downfall is the price—taxes and parking fee. It’s a splurge for the convenience.

We stayed here to take advantage of the early park opening, well worth it. It's the cheapest of the three Disney hotels, but still quite expensive. Check in was easy, nice staff. The elevators are a bit weird but seemed to work fine. The room was clean and comfortable. Downtown Disney was 5 minutes walk, with the parks another 5 minutes power-walking. Total time from hotel room to inside the parks was around 15 minutes. You can get purchases from the park sent to this hotel, but it takes 24 hours to arrive so don't do it on your last day. The pool area and water slide were great, very well supervised. We would stay here again.

This hotel has been around a while and it shows it in the style of the structure itself. It's been updated and everything was as it was supposed to be for a Disney property. The rooms were fairly quiet and comfortable.  All that aside - the staff is what makes Disney great! Sorry - the place is "magical" because the Cast Members make it so. They go out of their way and do a fine job in every aspect of their areas. It was wonderful to see....  Now the BAD!!!!  Old structure - old elevators. They are small - really small and the hotel is crowded at "rush" times. They have this crazy system where you select the floor you want BEFORE you get on the elevator. There is no step in and choose the floor. The screens to select the floor are on every level. So what, you ask? Excited kids,

We wanted a Disneyland resort hotel to take advantage of Magic Hour access, swimming pool and to fit 5 adults and 4 kids. To make it a 2 bedroom suite the hotel uses a hallway door to connect 2 hotel rooms. In total we had a suite that had 3 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms, 1 living room. Each room (3) had a TV console that also had a dorm size fridge and microwave. The bedrooms (2) had coffee pod machines. Beds included, 1-king, 2-full, 2 sofa pull out beds (which as expected are uncomfy for adult bones and no problem for exhausted toddlers). Easy stroll to Downtown Disney and park gates in the morning. Harder to stroll back at the end of the night on crowded days. Suite was on the 15th floor so you can catch a glimpse of California Adventure’s world of color. Disneyland firework show is

Having visited the Orlando Disney Parks and resorts many times, we were unsure what to expect from Paradise Pier.  We had a pleasant and welcoming check-in, and enjoyed both one lunch and a dinner at our hotel.  The evening pasta buffet is expensive but very much worth it! The make your own pastas are fabulous and service was excellent. You can also order a whole pizza of your choice as part of the buffet and it comes out fresh to your table. We were so happy we did that one night for dinner. The pool area was adequate and plenty of chairs, clean and charming hotel room (opt for the park view room- you will not regret it), easy walk to Downtown Disney and theme parks out the back door of the hotel.  No more than 15 minutes even if you walk slow. It took us around 10 minutes. So

This is a our second stay here and I have to say I am liking it!  We have stayed in all 3 Disney hotels and this is the most economical.  We kept avoiding it for a long time but the prices continue to increase on all the hotels so this one is much more at our price point than the Disneyland Hotel or the Grand Californian.  The access to the parks and Downtown Disney makes all the difference.  Entering on the Harbor side can be very crowded with all the hotels in that side.  Paradise Pier enters near the Disneyland Hotel and the security lines have been manageable both times we have stayed.  The gift shop is great!  The pool area and bar are great as well.  The only concern is that we had a premier view on the 7th floor (742).  It barely was over the palm trees and not sure if it

This hotel is very pricey compared to the other hotels around Disneyland but was worth every penny.  We wanted to go to Galaxy's Edge so we needed to stay in a Disneyland Hotel and this was the one available.  So we spent 1 night here before moving to a cheaper place closer to the maingate and honestly there was no comparison.  The staff at Paradise Pier were fabulous and really got our 1st trip to Disneyland off on to a great start!  Our room was fabulous, it overlooked the Pixar Pier and was a very magical view.    As far as the walk, yes it was quite a long walk through downtown Disney but going through baggage check at Downtown Disney was quite a time saver.  And as my kids put it, walking through Downtown Disney was much more magical than walking across the street from our

This hotel was AMAZING! We were on the top floor! Great view and great accommodations! Will definitely stay here again! The staff was all very friendly and helpful. We were just a short walk from Downtown Disney.

If it wasn't for the Star Wars Galaxy Land reservation that we received by staying at a Disney property, I would choose a Good Neighbor Hotel which we usually stay at. However, we wanted the guaranteed Galaxy Land reservation and thought that we would splurge by staying at Paradise Pier. We definitely splurged but this was no paradise. Let me explain: 1. The elevators were awful. I have never written about the awfulness of any elevators before but I have to mention these. This was our first time where we experienced elevators where we pressed the number of our floor on a pad and then the letter of the elevator that you are supposed to take appears on the screen. So we go to the corresponding elevator to wait. And wait. Finally the elevator comes and we wait for the people to

We are a Disney family (more than 10 trips between Florida and California) but this was our first stay at a Disneyland hotel because the price is so out of line compared to other hotels that are closer to the parks.  We stay on property all the time at Disney World so it's hard not to compare this hotel to the Disney hotels in Florida. The price for this room was probably double if not triple for what is considered a value hotel at Disney World.  The room was clean but definitely needs some touch ups (paint,I thought one of my kids left lotion on the door handle until I noticed all of the rooms had similar issues with the finish).  I saw housekeeping setting up large fans in several rooms down the same hallway as our room and the fans ran all night so I'm not sure what the

Summary Heading: Get ready to walk and be overcharged for it
Summary: You can see my 1-star review of Disneyland but here I sit on my last day and I'm fed up with this whole place. Our last day, the kids wanted to swim (in these supposedly "heated" pools that are FREEZING in June). So we go to get an elevator....  Elevators: Get this, you push the button where you are going on an ipad like thing outside the doors - so we hit pool and it says "go over to door D" - ok, as we walk over we see the doors aren't closed all the way and you can clearly see the elevator shaft and we watch elevator D go down right past our floor. WHAT IS THE POINT!? So we wait and wait (See other people getting on the elevator in our floor but their's isn't going to the pool floor I guess)... and here comes elevator D back up to us. We get on it and the door closes and a

We stayed here for the Galaxy's Edge (GE) access so we definitely paid a premium price for the room ($500 with parking).  That being said, even at a cheaper rate, the rooms are very abused and could use a renovation.  Caulking in bathrooms are dirty.  Bathroom door was sticky.  Beds are super cute and so is the décor but that doesn't cover all of the flaws.    Staff were amazingly friendly especially the two ladies in the GE room (wish I would have gotten their names).    We did not have time to use the pool, but it did look amazing.  Super close to Disneyland so walking to the park is nice.  We could not find an elevator in the parking ramp so had to carry luggage down the stairs which was awkward.  If there is an elevator, it is not clearly marked since we were not the only

Although pricey these are nice accommodations with a great location.  It is especially convenient when you have the need to break up the day by taking a break from the park or choose not to rent a vehicle.

It took some time to decide what to rate Paradise Pier, and because systemically nothing was wrong with our stay, I landed on 3 stars.   So why was it so disappointing? The price paid did not reflect the quality of the hotel.   Pros: The staff. Disney cast members are competent, attentive and helpful. The check in process was easy and the rooms were clean.   Cons: It’s surprisingly outdated and lackluster. You’d expect a little bit of magic at a Disney hotel, but the theming seems to be based on a beachside motel. For something that calls itself Paradise Pier, the pool is surprisingly tiny and overlooks a parking lot. There is no access to CA Adventure anymore either so it feels a bit removed from the rest of the resort.   This is not to say this is a terrible place to stay, but

It’s a Disney hotel so you kinda know what to expect. Room was clean, staff was great, characters found but very pricey. Even with the almost 1/2 off group rate for conference, room was more than I would personally pay for a hotel when there are many others in the area.   It was a nice experience and glad that it was paid for by employer.   Note: if staying with family ask when characters show in lobby. Happened to be in lobby at this time and there were very few people waiting to get autograph and photos of some popular characters.

We stayed here for 3 nights.  We had 3 rooms and all of us were put together which was great!  We had an adjoining room with our grandkids so it worked out well.  From the minute we pulled in to the time we checked out we were treated with respect and happy smiles!  EVERYONE was polite and eager to help.  Rooms were clean, gift shop was well stocked, restaurant/bar was quick and yummy, and the character breakfast was a lot of fun.  Short walk to Downtown Disney and the parks.  It's a little pricey, but for us it was worth it to be so close.  I highly recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: Grad Night At Disneyland And Anniversary
Summary: RE: Paradise Pier Hotel Subject: Grad Night And Anniversary  Making reservations prior to staying at Paradise Pier Hotel to enjoy both Disney California Adventures And Disneyland. Robert valet parked our vehicle and helped us with our luggage as we checked in with Jullianne and Kristina. Excellent service and room had a terrific view! We were able to take in both parks and slept in until late morning as we made late morning reservations to eat with Mickey And Minnie. Decided to try the buffet consisting of omelets to order, Mickey waffles, breakfast sausages, orange juice, and coffee (along with miniature chocolate muffins and cinnamon rolls). As this was our first time, we decided to return a.s.a.p. Thank so very, very, very, much for the memorable visit. Respectfully, Robert

Summary Heading: Had this been a first Disney visit they’d have ruined it for us
Summary: During our stay we found half eaten chocolate cake in our fridge, a pair of sunglasses on the floor by the nightstand, and empty Taco Bell sauce packets on the floor next the the edge of the bed (found these a couple days later while searching for my sons cars which we also never found despite moving every bit of furniture and turning the place upside down and digging through trash. I didn’t let him leave the room with these because I didn’t want them lost, so what happened to them? ) we had eaten on property the entire trip. These were not ours none of it was! Absolutely disgusting. I didn’t even begin to fathom the cleanliness of the room my children were sleeping in. I bought vouchers for meals the resort had no record of nor offered to me only told me how to pay with a card.

What an amazing experience we had. The ambiance, the extra magic hour for both parks, the great customer experience from all the staff you encountered, the amazing rides, so clean, so much fun for the kids. The food was ok and the rooms ok. Did expect the rooms to be a bit more nicer especially for the price you pay.

Pick up location is actually in the hotel near the garage entrance.  Only one person there when I picked up at 12noon on Saturday. Car was a nissan versa and located in the garage. Drop off was on Monday at 1030am with only two people in the office.  Fast, courteous and easy!

Summary Heading: Solid hotel, great for the family
Summary: Great location, great service, clean, and family friendly.  Generally speaking, Disney is excellent accommodations and Paradise Pier is no exception.  If you are looking for lots of bells and whistles, this is not the Disney hotel for you.  We travel with 5 kids and found the hotel to be relaxed enough for the kids but still full of Disney charm and character. Paradise Pier has one SUPER feature that we found so amazing...a wheeled table that pulls out from under the desk.  This is an amazing benefit if you are eating meals in the room because you can simply wheel it over to the couch and pull up a chair to eat together as a family.  We only eat breakfast in the room but this is a really great feature.

Paradise pier is a nice little hotel close to the park. We enjoyed our stay here very much. We did think it was a little overpriced but again it was very convenient. We bought the character breakfast because of our granddaughter and she thoroughly enjoyed it. The food was not great but there was much to choose from and the characters that visited the breakfast were fun. The beds were comfortable the service was good we would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Fairly small, but oh so convenient.
Summary: This was our first time staying at Disney hotel while visiting the parks, and it is truly the way to go.  If you like to shut the parks down like we do, the ability to walk to the room fairly quickly (often with sore feet) was a welcome experience.  The room was a bit cramped, but comfortable.  I'd hoped for more out of the pool environment, but it was just blah... nothing wrong, but no character, which you look forward to with Disney.  The staff and the service was excellent.

This hotel was well-kept and the staff was friendly but we felt like we were staying at any random hotel. It didn't have that Disney feel that we are used to from our Disney World trips. The pool was small, rundown and less than desirable. The rooms were clean but we could hear the cars outside our window all night long from our room. If you are looking for no-frills and plan on being in the parks all day anyway and not using the facilities, then I think it's a perfectly fine hotel to stay in. If you are looking for the Disney experience I'd suggest one of the other 2 choices in Disneyland.

We chose the Paradise Pier for the perk of Extra Magic Hour at California Adventure and the much shorter security lines. We had noted when booking the reservation that we were there to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday, which we thought would be recognized in some way, but nothing was. (We had stayed at the DL Hotel for our wedding anniversary a few years prior, and they sent up chocolates in addition to other goodies at check in.) It's not a slight against the hotel, but surprising given the Disney culture.  Upon check in, we were greeted warmly, which a recurring theme for the 5 days we were there. All staff we encountered were very friendly - they even have a cast member out the back entrance (the quickest way to the parks) each morning with a big Mickey hand, waving and

Summary Heading: A pretty good way into Disneyland
Summary: A little bit on the older side, they are doing a good job of keeping it tidy and well-presented before its inevitable redevelopment one day. Our family of five was accommodated comfortably in one room, as we were really only there to sleep Disney dreams and then get up and go at 6:15am to get to the rides. The swimming pool is fairly small and a bit older, but sunny and wet! The water slide and spa pool kept the kids happy. At night you can see the fireworks from the pool deck, which is good. We ate in the buffet one night, which was good and a nice break from the burger and chips-fest that is the only option everywhere else it feels. We took the airport bus to the airport at the end, which was a bit more expensive than Uber but we had a great driver who made it worthwhile. We

Summary Heading: Budget Option for the Disney Bubble
Summary: I stayed here for 5 nights with my wife and my 5 year-old son in a room over-looking Anaheim.  If I were to do it again, I probably would have spent the extra money to face the California Adventure park since it's a pretty awesome view.  My wife and I were traveling from the East Coast and decided to stay at a Disney hotel to take advantage of the extra Magic Hour.  In my opinion this is worth the premium over the other local (and far cheaper) hotels because we are awake super-early anyway (we consistently woke up at 4 am every morning) and the parks are really nice to experience with such low crowds during the 7-9 am window.  During the day, the crowds can become over-whelming so it's nice to experience a quieter morning.  Pros: - Extra Magic Hour - Very short (about 10

An excellent hotel and right in the Disneyland experience all in walking distance.park your car and never use it again till vacation is over.hotel was up to Disney standards and then some.hotel has all to Ofer and a great staff.

I reluctantly planned a trip here with my family for a long weekend.  This hotel is older but clean.  The room is fairly up to date, except the shower.  The beds were average in comfort.  The place was very expensive and I am not sure the proximity to Disney Village, a six minute walk or 20 minutes to Disneyland is worth the extra money.  If I had to do it again, I would stay off property and save a few hundred each night and Uber in.  The hotel restaurant buffet cost 35 dollars per adult for a breakfast buffet.  Too much for my liking.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Just completed a 3 night stay here (4/25-4/28)and I also stayed 2 nights (3/29-3/31). Both times I got a room for 5 as you get 2 queens and a sofa bed which is great. Many hotels do not accommodate 5. I would say that it is probably a 15 minute walk to the parks but the plus side is that it is a very safe walk ,unlike staying at the hotels off the property. I do not feel comfortable walking alone to hotels off site at night. The rooms are average size and clean ,however if there is an adjoining room it can be noisy. We could hear every word spoken in our neighbors room and we could hear their cellphones ringing and their alarm every morning at 0500. On my first visit when I checked in I paid my balance and was asked if I wanted a 200$ hold on my card for incidentals . This past

Summary Heading: Nice staff overall, but out-dated resort!
Summary: Between a poor and average score.   First, Most part the staff was good.  But the errors of one check-in girl led to a long list of problems, leading to numerous issues that needed managements involvement.  Starting with my credit card being charged the full amount of the stay, twice, even though it was paid in full before arrival.  And she issued us the wrong type of tickets, which wasn't found until attempting to enter the park.  At that point the cast member at the ticket booth was rude and insisted we go back to the resort to fix it.  Then we had to get the hotel manager on the phone to fix it, which took almost 90 minutes of our time. The rooms look so out-dated. They were very clean.  However, it was obvious that nothing has been updated in a very, very long time!  Carpet

We decided to stay closer to the park. This location is right across from the entrance.  The pool area was ok not very big. The beds were semi soft but ok. I really liked the character breakfast they offer on site.

Our experience at the Paradise Pier Hotel was not good and left a sour taste on our first time staying at a on site hotel by Disneyland. The room and hotel grounds were clean and well maintained, however, the decor felt dated and not Disney related. I think the rooms and pool area are due for refurbishment. However, the real problem was our experience with the lack of Disney-like customer service. Coming from FL, we are used to staying at several Disney hotels (value, moderate, and deluxe). PPH felt like a hotel between value and moderate, with the price of deluxe. I thought it was overpriced at least by $300 a night. On top of that, we had paid with the Disney Visa, but upon check in gave a different card for incidentals since the check in person said that was all it was for.

This was a stopover hotel for us as we had a single night/full day in LA.  With an 11pm flight out next day, we wanted to get ourselves weary and Disney seemed like the answer. We chose this hotel solely for its Early Magic Hour which would mean the difference between getting to do all the big rides or not, and liked ability to buy park tickets at reception on check in.  Pretty basic accommodation for the money but clean and they did try to get a few Disney touches in.   They stored bags for us but we’d have loved somewhere to shower before heading to airport and I’ll admit to surprise that that wasn’t available even pool side. Surely they get plenty of international tourists with late flights out? Just didn’t seem set up for travel which seems bizarre for a Disney hotel in LA.

Summary Heading: Not sure if it was us or them
Summary: When we were planning our trip to Disneyland California, we were considering many options both on the property and outside the property. I was originally looking to book Howard Johnson's because it had a water park of sorts and this was a holiday for our 6 and 7 year olds. However we were convinced that the experience would be better if we stayed in a Disney resort instead. The morning we arrived, we were greeted by friendly staff who tried their upmost to have a room ready for us as soon as possible. We did arrive quite early, around 9am from a 6am arrival. To their credit we had our room available by lunch time. The room itself was nothing special. It seemed dated and was quite disappointing to be honest. Now I can't compare it to other resorts as we didn't stay at any but for

My sister and I stayed over night last Sunday. Room was clean and very comfortable. Staff was great. Very pleasant and helpful. I have stayed there before and am always pleased. We were able to check in early and so had more time to wonder down town area.  Within walking distance to both parks and down town.

Summary Heading: Good Disney hotel, but not close to the park's entrance
Summary: Not quite like the hotels at Disneyworld, we still had a good time at this property.  It had a nice gym and restaurants.   The one downside was it was a far walk to the entrances of both parks.  We were under the impression it was just a few steps away, not so.  If you want to be closer then choose one of the other hotels.   I think this one may be the longest distance from the entrances.   Check in was easy, characters were always walking around for photo ops.

We stayed in early February and the whole hotel was delightful.  Fun Disney touches without being overwhelming.  The rooms were beautiful, in excellent condition and spotless.  We had a theme park view and it simply could not be beat - just stunning!  I would stay again in a heartbeat as the value is outstanding.

We just got back from a 4 day stay at the Paradise Pier hotel, and it was terrific.  We had a 2 bathroom, living room, bedroom suite.  The beds were a little hard, but the view was outstanding!  We watched World of Color from our bedroom window.

It's expensive compared with other local hotels, but cheaper than the other 2 Disney Hotels near by. A bit farther walk to the parks, but the views of California Adventure at night are quite enjoyable. We love looking out at Cars Land and the Cadillac mountains, and watching World of Color from the comfort of our room is pretty cool too.

Summary Heading: Great Disney ambiance and walking distance to the park.
Summary: Our room was not high enough to have a theme park view but it was in the right location to have one if it had been a few floors higher. We had a nice view of the Grand Californian. The room was clean and big There were fun Mickey touches on the lamps. Water pressure in the bathroom was good. They still had individual bottles of toiletries although I thought they were supposed to phase that out. There is a gift shop in the hotel and a lounge and a sit-down restaurant. Counter-service is available across the street at the Grand Californian. Since the last time we'd been there they moved security into Downtown Disney so now if you are in the hotel and want to eat there you have to go through security bag check and metal detector. You can ask the front desk for a trivia sheet for

Just spent a night with the kids and did the Disney parks for 2 days. The hotel was just ok. I didn’t feel like it lived up to the Disney standard of service. It was clean. That was good. The bellmen, valets, and housekeeping were extremely friendly. The pool was more for little kids. I was surprised at parents with coolers at the pool. I’ve been to two other Disney resorts and this was the least impressive of the 3.

The staff at Paradise Pier were extremely friendly and helpful!!! The rooms were a nice size and quiet. It is easy to get a cappuccino in the morning and they make it with a smile. The hotel is close enough to the park, which is convenient. I can’t wait to return!!!

This was our first family trip to Disneyland, after many visits to Disneyworld.  Paradise Pier was adequate as a hotel, but was nothing special.  Definitely didn't feel the Disney magic as strongly as one feels it when visiting a Disneyworld hotel.  Room was clean.  Service in restaurant was slow.  Elevators were slow. We liked being able to walk to the parks and Downtown Disney.

From check-in to check-out - excellent stay with excellent cast members!  When we checked in 'Jonny' was very friendly and helpful describing the hotel and the area in general.  Then we were chatting with 'Rachelle' at Guest Services and she was wonderful.  She gave me a trading pin to swap with 'Luis' at Concierge desk.  I'd admired one that he had and when I came back with the one from Rachelle, I told him it was just too nice to trade and he just gave me the 2nd pin!  Both of them made me feel so special.  Later, we met Rachelle over at California Adventure as she works at both places.  Next a.m. I wasn't feeling well as I'd gotten a chill and saw her at the front desk again so was telling her I didn't feel too well - she told me to wait just a moment and came back with a

Moderate hotel, great for family oriented. Elevators efficiency style, quick. Staff was on point with direction, recommendations and family accommodations. Pool pretty basic, typical water slide. Surfside lounge subpar 👎🏻needs improvement in offerings, comfort and staffing. Rooms park side upper levels 1100’s and up provide a great DCA view include side view of WOC show. Rooms comfortable living... nothing special, beds and pillows were awesomely comfortable with great pillows. Self Parking very accessible, Valet NOT needed  I never Parked my vehicle above second floor of garage, 20 ft walk from parking space to door ... Access to park morning, noon and night close .2 mile walk through Downtown  Disney or Grand Calif.

We've stayed at Paradise Pier 3 or 4 times.  We love how handy it is to the park.  You can come and go, taking breaks any time you need them. The character breakfast is fun for the first visit, but once is probably enough.

Summary Heading: My wife and I took a granddaughter and her 7 year old to Disneyland and stayed at the Pier for  convenience.
Summary: The hotel is next to Disneyland but actually the entrance is a few blocks away. The hotel room was decent but a bit  costly. The food service was mainly buffet but a nice selection. If the Disney Characters are present at dinner that is great for the youngsters but be prepared to pay for that big time.  Dinner for  four costs $200. The staff is very helpful and well trained as you would expect in a Disneyland operation. I rented a scooter for my wife who had a bad hip and that was a Godsend. The scooter was delivered to the hotel and kept in room at night. It was well worth the $50 per day!!!. The package we purchased included an early entry feature for one day and that also was very nice. I recommend that as well.

Even though this is one of only three Disney hotels in Anaheim, it is clear that this hotel is the stepchild. It would be only a block to Downtown Disney except guests here are forced to go out the back of the hotel and wander along the parking strip for an extra couple of blocks. We got a premium view room and found we could hear every truck, motorcycle and honk clearly in our seventh floor room alll night long. My one last quibble is the toiletries; who pays this kind of money for a dispenser in the shower?  Its a nicely themed hotel and everything you would expect otherwise.  But if you are going to pay this much, spring for the Disneyland Hotel, or better yet Grand Californian. Or you can stay closer to Disneyland across Harbor Blvd at half a dozen non-Disney hotels.

Summary Heading: Cute hotel, amazing proximity to Disneyland and Downtown Disney
Summary: Stayed here for one night before doing a day at Disneyland and then leaving for a cruise. The proximity to Downtown Disney and the parks is astounding! Every cast member we interacted with was fantastic. The rooms were cute with little touches of Disney. Bell services was perfect for holding our luggage while we were at the park all day. Would definitely stay here again.  PS, the character breakfast here is the best I have ever been to in my life, and we do them every time we go to Disney World.

Summary Heading: Awesome family friendly hotel within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at the paradise pier with another family and requested adjoining rooms which the hotel didn’t guarantee but they were able to accommodate and was greatly appreciated. We upgraded to the club level which was great with breakfast included in the club room and snacks throughout the day. They even have a beer and wine available for adults later in the day which is nice to unwind after a long day tromping through Disney. The hotel pool and slide are amazing with poolside service available. The hotel is nice to stay at even without entering Disney. The walk to Disney is pretty short, but if you have small kiddos I would recommend bringing a stroller or renting outside the Disney front gates. Also, take advantage of the magic hour at each of the parks with your hotel key,

Check in was easy, front desk was very nice and informative!  Location was convenient for walking to the parks.  My only complaints would be that the parking garage has no elevator, so after parking on the 3rd deck we had to walk down 3 flights of stairs with our luggage (If you valet you wouldn't have to worry about that though) The cost to stay did seem a little high to me as it is a very basic hotel room, but I guess anything with the name Disney in it is always a little more expensive.  The rooms were clean and comfortable though, and the hotel and staff were very accommodating.  I would probably stay there again if it were for a special occasion, but the local hotels are probably cheaper and just as nice.

I definitely will stay here again on my next trip to Anaheim, CA!  I was in town for an expo  and did not know what to expect.  Everyone was so friendly, professional and customer focused.  Cheers to Victoria (11th floor housekeeping) and Gabriela, Holly and Cristina at registration.  Not a lot of food choices and quite expensive, but overall my experience was great.  Easy to walk to the various venues and is in a godd location.

Summary Heading: Better value than other Disney hotels but a long walk to Downtown Disney
Summary: Rooms were fine and we were upgraded as we requested adjoining rooms but two in the standard view category were not ready when we checked in.  Thank you to the front desk staff.  Rooms had a view of California Adventure which was nice but I don't think I would have paid extra for this.  Food choices are very limited at the hotel.  Bar/lounge is the only choice other than the buffet which may include some characters but is expensive. I would estimate the walk to Downtown Disney is 4 to 5 blocks. Not that bad but when you consider about 10 trips in 3 days, it adds up.  California Adventure is at least that far after you enter Downtown Disney. The other Disney properties are much closer but again much more expensive.

I always love staying here! The service is amazing and the location on property is convenient. You just walk the path to Downtown Disney and you're on your way to Disneyland. The pool renovations turned out really nice, as I could see from the view in my room. Cast Members are always so helpful, and I love the beach theming. I can't wait to visit again!

We loved our stay at Paradise Pier hotel! The staff was great!!! We were upgraded to a park view room and the view was a 'wow!' The room was very nice (one minor glitch with plumbing was solved within minutes). And being able to walk to both parks (about 5 minutes) was amazing!

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay and Walk to the Parks
Summary: This was my first trip to Disneyland. I have been to Disney World many, many times. I prefer Disneyland mainly because I could walk from this hotel to downtown and the parks. Travel around Disney World is much more complicated.  I loved the beach theme in the room with a life guard lamp and beach ball pillows. It will cost you something like $80 if you take one of those pillows home with you! An interesting thing to me was the way the elevators worked. I have never seen elevators like these where the button for your floor is on the wall outside the elevator. You need to pay special attention to which elevator you are getting on. It seemed a complicated system until I learned how to use them.  We ate at the restaurant a few times. The food and service were good. I liked that we

Paradise Pier is great. We stayed there for 3 nights and loved it. Good location as it is walking distance. For us (2 50 year olds and 2 teens), about 7 minutes to the monorail stop in downtown Disney and another 5 min to the parks. Extra magic hour which at Disneyland really means something. Much bigger, nicer rooms than those that we've seen in Orlando. Super friendly service (checkin, bell, snack bar). Clean rooms and friendly staff. When we go back, we'll check there first.

There are a lot of perks to this hotel if you're visiting Disneyland. Pros: the character breakfast at Donald's Seaside Grill is AMAZING. Good food, the kids loved hugging and dancing with all the characters, and the service was awesome. The hotel is technically within walking distance of the Disneyland and California Adventures gates but note it's a good 20 minute walk. Our room was very clean and we came back to a clean room each day. The store inside the hotel is actually quite great- has snacks, water, even wine along with Disney store worthy toys, clothing, and trading pins. The service we received was positive - a highlight was the painting class instructor whom was high energy, full of facts, and kind. Cons: not very Disney decorated. In fact the rooms are kind of plain

Summary Heading: Dated rooms but Disney-quality service and convenient location
Summary: As other reviewers have noted the rooms and hotel spaces could use an update. They are well cared for and functional enough but look tired (and the matress was quite uncomfortable). The bathroom here looked like something out of a Best Western motel (plastic molded tub, dated tile etc). It felt slightly depressing.   The plus of staying here is really the staff (who accommodated a very late check out and would go out of their way to give my daughter balloons etc) and of course easy access to Disneyland. Not having to go through the horrible security scrum outside the main entrance area (where shuttle buses / Ubers etc drop off) was worth a lot. The extra Magic Hour was fantastic as well.  Overall glad to have had the advantages of staying "on-prem" esp with a 2 year old that

Not a bad place to stay.   Service was a little sketchy.   The room was nice we actually we upgraded to a suite so that made it nice.   Its very close to the parks and Downtown Disney,    The elevators suck!!!!  I guess this system is so the kids don't push the buttons but it took 30 minutes to catch elevator.   This is Disney so everything is overpriced.  The Breakfast with a character was $40 per person and it was a buffet.   Overrated I would say.

I had heard mixed reviews of Paradise Pier but I was more than happy with our stay there in September! It was perfect for me and my friends for our 4 days in Disneyland. It’s walking distance from the parks (maybe even closer than the Disneyland hotel) and the room was just what we needed. Perhaps a bit overpriced for what it is considering the amount of other hotels in the area, but we liked it for the Disney theming and extra magic hours of course! Probably my least favorite of the 3 Disney on site hotels but by no means is it bad - it met all my expectations and I wouldn’t hesitate to stay again.

This was our third visit to Disneyland with our kids and we usually stay in the Grand Californian but couldn't get the room we wanted so we thought we would give the Paradise Pier a go. It's a cheaper option so we weren't sure what to expect but we could not have been happier. Although it lacks to Craftsman style of the Grand Californian our beach themed room was comfortable, clean and had a fabulous view of the Californian Adventure Park which at night was simply spectacular. We opted for a Premium View Club Level room which meant we had access to the Beach Comber Club on the second level. It is open from 6.30am until 8pm every day with unlimited food and drinks (the food varies from breakfast, snacks, sweet treats depending on the time of day) so it's a great way to grab

It's not as nice as the California Great. But when your a Disney Vacation Club member your a little spoiled. Nothing like the Villa's but nice. They do need to lower their prices. Just because Disneyland raised their prices again.

Summary Heading: Great location, but be ready to pay for it
Summary: Great beds and views.  Do the buffet with Donald and friends once if you must, but you will over pay to the tune of $300 for a family of 6 with 2 being kids under 5.  It's no better than a denny's buffet with mickey mouse waffles and characters interrupting the kids when they finally eat. Walking to the park is great,  Pool and waterslide are great.  bar in the lobby is great when the kids finally crash.  Recommend Uber eats drop something off for a few meals to save some money.  getting gouged at every turn is part of the Disney experience but you don't have to take it all lying down.

Overall very happy with the hotel, the room was spacious, staff were friendly, breakfast in the cafe downstairs was nice, the fact there were obviously a lot of children around did not bother us too much and you could not hear a peep in the rooms. The only not so good thing was that we were, obviously, on our honeymoon, and we had even made this point when booking the room, but yet we did not get a room with a king bed, but had to sleep in separate beds (which cannot be pushed together)- I think a decision should have been made here to upgrade us if there really were no rooms of our original booking type available.

This is our second stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel and this time we chose a Concierge View level room.  Our room was on the 13th floor and the view of the park was absolutely magical.  We kept the curtains open the entire time and nothing beat waking up to a sunrise over DCA.  The view alone kept us in the Disney magic during our entire vacation.    The room is spacious enough.  There were enough drawers and hangers for our clothes.  The beds were comfortable enough, but the pillows were just terrible.  We will be bringing our own pillows on the next trip.  The layout of the room worked for our needs.    The bathroom had large counters which was perfect for all of our toiletries.  My biggest complaint at most hotels is the shower head and water pressure.  That was not the case

I booked this hotel for one night for an after-hours event in Disneyland park. I am a Disney Vacation Club member but there was no availability at the Grand Californian, which is the only DVC property in CA. I used DVC points for the reservation, which is not a good use of points but since it was only one night I opted to "overspend." Everything was fine--the room was spacious and nicely decorated, although a bit outdated. There were 2 queen beds plus a daybed, very comfortable for the 3 of us. It was a theme park view room, and the view of Disney's California Adventure park was spectacular. My only complaint is that my room was not ready upon check-in (understandable) and I was not texted when it did become available. It poured rain on the day of my arrival and I was out in

This resort is part of the Disneyland property. It’s about a five minute walk from Downtown Disney and the parks. It’s very family-friendly with several restaurants, movie places for kids, activities, a pool with outdoor food and bar, and a great staff.  Very comfortable rooms with good amenities. Some of the areas are a bit dated, but it’s still a great place with reasonable rates.  Lotsa fun!

We stayed at Paradise Pier this week and were very happy.  1. You can check -in anytime on your 1st day. You can park and they will store your luggage and let you know when your room is ready. 2. It is a Disney experience, the staff are very helpful and accommodating  3. You are so close to the parks and the monorail system. 4. You pick up your package in the lobby and they walk you through how everything works. 5. They store your luggage until midnight the night you check out, and you can leave your car in their structure too! 6. They have rooms big enough for 5 people  Drawbacks..only 4 elevators, I can’t imagine waiting for them during peak season. One morning we waited 15min and finally took the 7 flights of stairs.

Summary Heading: Reminded me of a budget DisneyWorld Boardwalk Hotel
Summary: Paradise Pier was the cheapest of the Disney hotels.  The spacious  room was basic with cute beach decor but the bathroom looked a bit dated.  The queen beds were comfortable. We had a great view of California Adventure.  We appreciated the Keurig and the refrigerator. It was a short distance to Disneyland.  We would stay here again.  We did not eat in the hotel.

This went very smooth. I’ve never booked through Trip Advisor/Cancelon. I’ve stayed at Paradise Pier many times and love it but never made plans through another party. The view was great. I was able to see the park through the hotel. The staff was warm and friendly. For a fee, there is valet to park your car and bring your bags upstairs. They will also text you when your room is ready while you’re in Disneyland.

We recently took a Disney Land vacation and stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel.  I can not say enough nice things about the staff, hospitality, quality of food, excellent service at bell desk, hotel desk, bar and restaurant.  We had a slight mix up on our reservations and the hotel management more than accommodated us for the minor inconvenience.  We stayed at the Disney Land Hotel previously, and although that hotel is a little nicer and a little closer, I would pick Paradise Pier over Disney Land Hotel.  Wonderful family vacation!

I know it is a Disney venue, but how much is too much?  The $40 per person breakfast buffet,  plus an automatically added tip of 15%, was not worth the money in food or service. In spite of the Disney characters coming by and interacting with our group of 5 adults, it was just not special. Service was lackluster, plates were not cleared, we had to take extra silverware from an adjoining table and ask for our coffee cups and water glasses from our waiter. We had told the Hostess at the desk we had 2 Birthday celebrations. They  forgot until reminded. The buffet food was varied. My scrambled eggs were dry and lukewarm, the egg white frittatas were tasteless, the food was just so-so. Sorry Disney, you can do better. And, by the way, valet service is $35.

Okay, I understand Disney did not build this hotel. It was obviously a former Hilton (low end at that) hotel acquired through a land purchase. I stayed there 1/14 to 1/16 2019.   Very old hotel! Instead of redoing things they continue to just paint over (and over) the obvious problem areas. Just like Motel 6 does. Small rooms, small lobby, no amenities (you have to walk to the nicely updated Disneyland Hotel to do anything).  Character Breakfast is SUPER lame--I have had better Free Breakfast buffets at other hotels. Cold food, poor selection, COSTS OVER $100 for 2 people. AVOID!!!  In fact, avoid this hotel--there are better choices for a Third of the price very close-by.

There is nothing special about the hotel. Value for money you don't get the return. There are plenty of other options for close to $400 a night. Wanted to get the Disney experience but did not deliver much perks. For that rate you will think that at least parking will be included...its extra. It was not a bad stay but average, will probably wont come back.

This was out first time at Disney Land!  We had the theme park view it was awesome both when the the sun was rising and when the sunset with the ride lights from California Adventure.  There is a button in the elevator that brings you to the perfect location to view the fireworks.  The character breakfast was great because of the characters.  The food was limited thought there would have been a better selection of food. Disappointed that the dinner buffet is not a character buffet and the service was not as good as breakfast.

Summary Heading: A convenient location while visiting Disneyland Park
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel over the last week of the Christmas holidays. It was a busy time at the parks and at the hotel. The location is great, within walking distance to Downtown Disney which you can then walk through to get to the park easily. The Disney hotels are expensive, and in my opinion they are more worth it for the convenience factor. It was nice to get a Magic Morning during our stay, and to be able to walk instead of driving and parking or taking a shuttle. I just wish the price tag was worth it for the quality of accommodations. The Paradise Pier is nice enough, but could really use some refurbishment here and there. The rooms do show their age. We arrived and received a room key but when we entered the room they gave us it was still being

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier is a Great choice!
Summary: LOVED Disney’s Paradise Pier Hotel!  The rooms are spacious, and there are multiple types of rooms from which to select.  Everything was comfortable and enjoyable.  Easy access to the parks by exiting the rear of the hotel and a brief walk to Downtown Disney security checkpoint.  From there you can walk to the parks or if going to Disneyland, jump on the Monorail if the line isn’t too long.  Leaving is just as easy, in fact you can access Disney’s Grand Californian from Downtown Disney (near Sephora), walk through that hotel out to Disneyland Drive and cross the street.  You can access the Grand directly from the Grizzly Peak area in Disney’s California Adventure too.  A stop at the Grand for a drink at their fireplace lobby is also a nice way to cap the day.  Watch Disneyland

We wanted to see Disneyland again and to stay on the property this time to avoid driving as much as possible, so we chose the PARADISE PIER HOTEL for our stay.  We are VERY disappointed!  Parking is $20.00 per day if you do it yourself or $30.00 per day for Valet Parking!  Most breakfasts are $19.00 per person with 19% gratuity plus $3.00 delivery charge for room service.  But, if we want to eat in the PCH Restaurant, your only choice is the $39.00 per person buffet!  This is HIGHWAY ROBBERY in my opinion and I refused to pay that exorbitant price!

It is a typical Disney hotel. The rooms are nice, the food not that good, but it is ok. The biggest advantage is the possibility of go to park walking - it is not that close, small children would maybe need a stroller. To spend some hours in the downtown is really nice - specially in the xmas time! There are a lot of restaurants and huge Disney and Lego stores.

My family and I stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel during this Christmas time for my son and my sisters birthdays.  For the price you pay some things are great about this hotel and some things aren’t.   Pros: Extra Magic Morning. This was absolutely the best perk of staying at the hotel! We loved being able to be in the park early without the massive holiday crowds. Proximity to Disneyland was great, about a 10 minute walk through Downtown Disney. Which made it easy to get back and forth for nap and bedtime for my 2 year old. The space of the actual room was nice and big. We had a standard room with 2 queen beds. We were able to get a bigger metal bed for our son to sleep in which was nicer than the pack n play that the room provides.   Cons: The price for the actual hotel was

My son who is 5, and I had stayed here for 2 nights on a spontaneous trip for Christmas.  I was able to get a fantastic rate through the Disney travel agents certification making the stay worth it.  If i would not have had the discounted rate, I would not have stayed here.  I feel it is way overpriced.  The convenience of this hotel is that it is in walking distance of the parks and downtown Disney and having the early park hours every other day per park.  That is it.  Being a regular guest to Walt Disney World, staying at a Disney resort gives you several benefits such as parking, magic bands of course being close to the parks, ect.  and their hotels are more affordable.  Disneyland is behind in technology and overpriced to have a touch of Disney in your hotel.  Overall, our

Wasn’t sure if we would like this Disney hotel as there were a few negative reviews however we thoroughly enjoyed our short stay.  The reception was efficient and friendly as expected with a Disney property.  We were given an unexpected park view upgrade which was greatly appreciated.  The room was clean, spacious and fun.  Room was equipped refrigerator, coffee and even a clothesline for wet items.  Walk to parks gave an opportunity to see Downtown Disney in its entirety. Enjoyed the roof top viewing of the Disneyland fireworks show with piped in music. Elevator was different but not an issue to us.  Checkout done in email.  Would definitely stay at Paradise Pier again.

This was our 2nd trip to Disney. We went in 2011 and stayed at the Days Inn. This year we spent the extra money to stay at the Paradise Pier and will NEVER return! it felt much cleaner than our 2011 trip but we A LOT more walking!!! our daughter is 5 so she is too old for a stroller and its 3/4 of a mile to the gates of the park... just to get to the GATE!!! we started early and would come back for a nap which means we spent 3 miles a day just walking to and from our hotel!!!! the slide closed at 5 so if we werent back, S.O.L.!! and the hot tub for the parents after walking about 10 miles a day, yep that has been closed since 8PM  bottom line is... what is the perk for paying the extra to stay at this place?   staff is friendly, our tub didnt drain which I reported but it was

I have stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel many times.  I love how convenient it is to walk to the park.  We spend our last day at the pool on the third level.  Great spot for viewing the fireworks.  The last time I was there was for Halloween and the hotel was decorated in a pirate ship theme.  Very easy, family friendly, and fun to stay.

We booked our Disney vacation online from Australia, we have stayed at Paradise Pier previously and enjoyed a great stay again recently. Smooth easy check in. We arrived early, dropped our bags off to collect later when our room was ready and headed straight into the park. We were pleasantly surprised when we returned to find a fast pass for any attraction of our choice posted under the door for the inconvenience of our room not being ready. Our room was lovely and clean, overlooking California Park, loved seeing all the rides lit up at night. The beds were  comfortable , bathroom nice and clean with a fantastic shower. Enjoyed our visit immensely, will stay again

Cheapest of the three but many complain that it doesn't feel like a Disney hotel. Room amenities include toiletries, microwave, coffee maker, and a mini-fridge.  This hotel is the furthest away. The walk is about 20-25 minutes. The bonus to this is that you can watch the fireworks from this hotel for free (with the music) if you are a guest. Some say say that it's not really worth it but when we stayed here for our 2017 trip, it was done up pretty nice with all the Christmas stuff. My girls loved the huge slide but the pool size was not as nice as the Disneyland Hotel one.

What a great hotel.  What tipped it off was robert at valet in the morning of 12/5/18.  The magical bus MISSED going to the hotel and robert who already was very nice and looking out for the bus and telling me when it would be coming (it was cold outside and rainy) totally helped me out and got me a taxi and calmed me down from the stupid bus leaving.  Couldn’t have been nicer or more helpful and really showed what great customer service is about.   Actually, the staff was great and helpful and I think her name was jenine and customer service desk helped me out a lot as well with checking in and questions about Disneyland.     The elevators were strange but a day later you get used to them.

Summary Heading: Loved the service and the convience
Summary: I would have gave a 5 star but the beds were too hard to our liking. Other than that it was a fun and enjoyable place to stay as we spent a few days at Disneyland. The kids loved the pool the most as they had a slide.

We just stayed for 2 nights.. staff was wonderful. We were At club level with a continental breakfast and snacks during the day. Wine and appetizers in the evening.. cookies and mints when we returned to our room. Close walk through Downtown Disney grab the monorail to get to Tomorrow Land.  Water was never hot enough in shower. We would stay here again..

Wonderful staff, clean and beautiful room! We traveled with our friends and their kids and they made sure to get us connecting rooms. This was amazing because we were able to open the connecting doors and let all of our kids play together. The walking distance to downtown Disney and the parks was very convenient. Not to mention the benefit of extra magic hours. Will definitely stay here again.

Our family stays at Paradise Pier annually for our Disneyland trip.  Makes it a little easier when you have little ones that require naps. Hotel is always clean, alive and welcoming.  No complaints at all!

Summary Heading: Best deal of the Disney Hotels
Summary: We stayed here with 3 boys and loved it. The main reason we stayed was to get a bit of the Disney experience in our hotel, but this is by far the cheapest of the three. You get what you pay for though. The other 2 are certainly nicer, but this was totally fine. The walk to the parks is about 10 minutes through Downtown Disney. Entering the parks, you are not allowed to use the secret entrance in the Grand, but leaving, you can exit through that entrance and then its a shorter walk home. One of the biggest reasons we wanted a Disney hotel was to get the Extra Magic Hour EVERY morning. That was just about worth it right there. We would get most of the big rides done in that first hour, and then wouldn't need to stress about them as much throughout the day. The pool is decent, and

This was a really nice hotel but I didn't find it any better than a Hilton or Sheraton or Merriot.  There were few references to Disneyland other than the free cartoons in the kids room downstairs.  These cartoons were not original cartoons but ones from the 80's with crappy animation. The store was expensive as expected, the character breakfast was fun but expensive.  I like the breakfast because there was a lot of time with the characters and a good variety of food in the buffet. They are also great about allergies and the chef came out and talked to me about what I could eat and made me a gluten free waffle that was yummy.  Make your reservations early for the breakfast so its not so crowded.  It was also expensive - about $45 a person.  The down side was the $20 a day to

We have always wanted to stay at a Disney Hotel and we finally had an opportunity last week.  We had an amazing corner room on the 14th floor with a magnificent view of California Adventure. The room was clean, larger than expected, and had a fridge.  When we returned from a long day at the park, we found cookies and mints for us.  The staff was friendly and there were characters in the lobby.  We did have the Club Level which included a very basic continental breakfast, unlimited snacks and drinks during the day, Happy Hour from 5-7 with unlimited wine and beer, and desserts.  If I could afford to stay here in the future, I definitely will.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and close to Disneyland
Summary: Visited in Aug. 2018 and was very pleased      Very convenient to walk to Disneyland, about 15 mins.     Rooms were clean and did not hear any sounds from other rooms.     Seeing the fireworks from the pool for guests who are registered was a nice bonus, this happens every evening.

We stayed October 2 - 4 absolutely not one complaint...from checkin to the parks.  Everything was as we hoped.  The rooms were lovely.  Two queen sized beds with park view.  they are nice nothing extravagant.  It is a bit of a walk from the entry to the parks but you get their via downtown Disney walkaround.  What I did find out a bit late on the last morning is that you can try and pass thru the Grand Californian.  My feet were done in after Universal and then Disney so I went for it and thank Goodness they let us without even a second look go back and forth.  I almost cried with joy.  The hotel and parks look amazing decorated for Halloween so glad we got to experience this first hand.

We had so much fun. The pillows are beach balls. My son had a lot of fun playing with them. The room was nice it had two beds and a couch that could fold out to a bed. I have stayed at all three of the Disneyland Hotels... I like the Paradise the best. Close walking to downtown disney and both parks. The elevators are a little different. You have to push in your floor then it will tell you which elevator to take. Due to security you can't walk straight across the street and go through Grand California to get into downtown or Disneyland like you use to be able too.

We stayed here for 2 nights (me, my husband and our 3 year old daughter), and cannot say enough good things about it. The staff were absolutely lovely, completely engaging with my daughter and gave us heaps of information on activities and where to go etc. We watched the fireworks from the third floor on the first night and it was absolutely spectacular. The room was enormous, 2 fridges and room service provided. In addition, the little touches like Finding Nemo toiletries were a huge hit. It’s not the newest hotel, but it doesn’t need to be as it’s got everything you could want and a magical Disney feel. We will definitely stay here again, it was fantastic, a highlight of our trip to the states.  Disneyland itself was also magical!!

We stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel during disney’s Very busy Halloween season. We haven’t stayed here in a couple of years, but decided it was a cheaper alternative to Disneyland Hotel. The rooms were nice - comfortable, clean and spacious.  They have a new (at least to us) elevator system that was very frustrating. There were no buttons in the elevator. There was a pad outside the elevator where you would select your floor. It would then tell you which elevator would take you to your floor. What do you think kids do when they see a screen with numbers on it?  Right. They press all of the buttons. So the elevators were coming and going and no one was getting to their floor.  To get to the lobby, it was the same struggle. Also they have a new registration system, so checking in

Summary Heading: Great! Wasn't perfect just for one detail!
Summary: I have stayed 3 nights at this hotel and I really liked it. Check-in experience was great! The service was good, it was all relatively fast and we were able to pay for an upgrade and get a room with the view to the park. By the way, this was one of the best things we have done. My son, who is 4, got crazy from the room when he saw Radiator Springs! The room is simple, but very clean and they actually had a good crib for my baby so it was all working well. I read a few reviews saying that you have to walk a lot to get to the park but I really did not have that impression. You walk just for a few minutes and get to Downtown Disney, go through Security right there and you are ready to enter the park. Everything was going perfect. The only part that I really did not like was

The hotel staff was wonderful. We had the greatest treatment- Matt G and Crystal were amazing. We traveled with a five year old and an infant and they couldn't have done more to help us. Room was very cozy- except for the pillows. Within walking distance of the parks. We'll definitely be back.

This stay has now concluded our stays at all three Disneyland Resort hotels.  We have avoided this hotel in the past due to the not so favorable reviews.  We have stayed many times at the Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian, with the GC being our all time favorite but way too expensive.  I am so glad we stayed at the Paradise Pier this time.  I will definitely stay again.  Let me set this straight we had a room with 2 queen beds and the converting day bed.  To clarify the day bed is only a twin size bed- many reviews reflect that 2 people can sleep on it (in my opinion it would have to be 2 young children, like under 5 years old to comfortably sleep 2).  Two other slightly downfalls: please beware the self parking garage has no elevator, so if you have a lot of luggage I

The rooms are clean and have decent views, everyone here is friendly and helpful. Room service is great and the pool is good. The gift shop hasextra toothbrushes and a large variety of souvenirs. Everything you'd expect from Disney.

Friendly service and quality food plus a good variety of characters taking the time to visit with the little ones make this worth the $$$ you’ll spend. Their chilaquiles are amazing! Plus just a short walk to the park.

We were visiting for our birthdays and the Cast Member at check-in did a wonderful job of making us feel special from the moment we arrived.  While this was a rare trip without our kids we didn't need as much space in the room but were pleasantly surprised by how much room we had with the King bed, pull-out couch and table & chairs.  We commented that we would have actually felt comfortable in the space even with the kids (which is usually hard to find).  Throughout our stay the room was well kept by the housekeeping staff and we had no issues with anything in the room.  The only constructive feedback we had was they needed a larger front desk area to be more efficient, the system to alert us when our room was ready (since we arrived early) did not work and the were unable to

Checked in Friday night and left Sunday. We checked in fairly lateon Friday,  around 10pm. The front desk staff was very helpful, got our park passes and got us checked in promptly so we could go to the room and rest.  She explained how to get our MaxPasses and how and where to use the coupons.  The hotel is clean,  but obviously dated. We got a room with premium view, facing the California Adventures Park. The furniture in the room looks tired and some have signs of chipping.  Mattress is comfortable.  It is priced lowest among the 3 on property Disney hotels, so dont expect too much. It is also about a mile walk to the theme parks, uncovered.  Didn't bother us but maybe inconvenient for parents with strollers.  They do have the monorail if you already have a park pass.

This was our first time staying on site at Disneyland. The hotel was super cute, family friendly and affordable. The location was not bad of a walk from the park neither. My kids loved the beach ball pillows in the room.

From the time we checked in we were disappointed. Our receptionist did not give us any information on the hotel or the theme park, or even where the eating areas were. We found out from other guests that the pool slide was not working. From there the laundry for guests was not working & there was a lot of confusion about this. We were offered a cart to take us over to a partner hotel to do the washing only to be told by the valet that the cart was out of action & we should walk. The movie on the pool deck was not even at our hotel, staff when asked had no idea if it was on or not. Our shower head is movable & you only get wet if you use it as hand held.  I really expected much better for what we paid and having stayed in Disney hotels in Hong Kong and Japan. A definite miss & no

Having stayed on many WDW properties in Florida, this hotel was a disappointment as there was no Disney Magic. We could have been straying at any chain hotel. Most staff were pleasant but a few were more abrupt. The hotel is dated but the room was large containing two queen beds, well maintained and clean. Our room overlooked the park, burt be aware there is a busy main road in front of the hotel and even on the 12th floor traffic could be clearly heard. The hotel is also opposite the park’s loading bay and we could hear reversing horns most of the night. We only had one meal at the hotel and found both selections to be of an average to poor standard. I would not recommend dining there.

Summary Heading: Is Disney Hotels's in California overrated?
Summary: Stayed at hotel in August 2018 due to fact we could be close to Disneyland theme parks. For what they charge it is not worth it, better staying in a Quality Inn and taking local bus to the theme parks and Downtown Disney. Also, you may receive better customer service as found the staff working in Surfside Cafe in the hotel are down right rude. I can only say housekeeping gave a first class service during our stay. Security also lack manners, so rude.

This was my 1st visit to California. So I want sure what I would expect. However; From the moment you check in you feel the Disney Magic. From the decor in the lobby to helpful cast members. I did stayed club level and had access to be Beachcomers lounge on the 2nd floor. It was Totally amazing they had a full continental breakfast which they kept refilling til the end of breakfast at 1030am. Followed by snacks and than they had happy hour where all beer and wine are free from from 5pm-7pm. They had plenty of juice and water and soda coffee tea and espresso for you to take with you in a To go cups. The food was amazing and the menu changed daily. They always had a Disney movie playing. They had your own personal check in and out desk up stairs you could look over and see what

We decided to splurge and spend a night here before we tackled both parks on a Monday. We enjoyed the view from the 14th floor of California Adventure. And while I was certain we would be able to see the fireworks because we could see the top of the castle poking out behind the trees, the hotel was correct, we could just barely see the edge of the Disneyland Fireworks. But the view from the 3rd floor “rooftop” pool was amazing!  And they pipe in the music from the park to go along with the show.   There was no World of Color show the night we stayed but if there had been, the view would’ve been spectacular!  We had a 1 bedroom suite which had 2 bathrooms, 2 Queens, and a single pull out in one room and a queen pull out in the other.   I couldn’t stay here every time I wanted to

we love staying in this hotel!!! it has food, pools, a movie room for the kids and is close to restaurants and the parks. Staff are amazing. every one is super friendly and helpful.  I don't like that the parking structure does not have an elevator. I was in a CAM boot and either had to walk up the stairs or drive my rented motor scooter up the ramps like a car.  Another concerns is that the rooms could use a deep cleaning behind the furniture. I dropped something behind the entertainment center and it was pretty gross and dusty back there. Otherwise the rooms seem clean.

We are a Disney family, and we loved this hotel.  It is the perfect location to DisneyLand, about a 10 minute walk.  The rooms are large and well appointed.  Our room had two queen beds, and a sofa bed, desk, and large bathroom.  Housekeeping kept the room very clean and we never had any issue with noise.  The view is also great, we could see California Adventure from our windows.  There is a sit down restaurant off of the lobby, it had Italian style food and was delicious for dinner and very reasonably priced for a buffet.  The gift shop in the hotel had a nice selection of souvenirs as well.  We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

It’s a nice hotel,convenient to the parks and downtown Disney. It’s clean and staff is friendly. We booked this hotel over the others because of the slide at the pool - which is nice but the pool itself is boring and needs to be updated.  One nice thing is that the music is piped in for fireworks and fireworks can be viewed from pool.  The rooms are nice but nothing to write home about.  we were on the 14th floor overlooking CA park.
