One fun thing we could actually hear people screaming on the incredicoaster. The beds are queen size and comfy.  We had a daybed too so it would be good for big family.  The bathroom was spacious but the shower was low.  My husband at 6 feet tall was almost too tall. It is nice hotel but I wish we would have spent more to stay at other hotel.

Summary Heading: A bit far from the theme park
Summary: Even though this hotel is located in the downtown Disney, it is a little bit far from the theme park. You can take a monorail from inside the Disneyland but the station in downtown Disney is 5 mins walk from this hotel. Maybe it's ok for bigger kids but after playing whole at the theme park and walk this far was too much for the 4-year-old kid.

You're  only a short walk to Disneyland.  Literally only 10 minutes. If you do book we highly recommend upgrading to Club Level. Money well spent!  From the moment you check in until you check out EVERY cast member you see greats you with a big smile and hello.  That includes the housekeeping and maintenance.  WE ABSOLUTELY LOVED OUR STAY!!!

Lots to love about this hotel.  The rooms are huge.  The place is clean.  The location cannot be beat.  The only thing I'd say could be improved is the elevator, which takes longer than it should and isn't very clearly marked - other than that, Paradise!

I've been doing Disney for years, usually Florida but we switched it up this time.  I was a little taken aback by the price for their value hotel.  Since it is Disney, I figured it was worth spending the extra money.  The only perk I noticed was lifeguards at the pool and the water slide.  Beyond that, it was almost further away than the surrounding non-Disney cheaper hotels  and no bus or tram service to get you closer.  After a long day at the park in Florida, a bus will drop you off at your hotel entrance.  Here, I pay more and have to walk all way through downtown Disney followed by another 2 block walk to get back to the hotel.  It was nice but almost not worth the extra money.  I'm glad I didn't pay the extra money for a room with a view of the World of Color because it

This was our first time staying at Paradise Pier Hotel. We stayed for six nights mid-August. Our usual hotel of choice is The Disneyland Hotel but thought we'd try Paradise Pier this time. While it lacks the magic of The Disneyland Hotel it is still special in its own way.   I found our room to be large and clean. The bedding was great, nice quality sheets, lots of comfy pillows. We had a standard view room however it looked out over the pool which was nice. The beachball pillow has been replaced with a Luxo ball pillow which was fun.  All staff we encountered were nice and helpful.  The location is great! I thought we'd have a much longer walk than Disneyland Hotel to get to Downtown Disney however, it was only steps longer than staying in the Frontier Tower of Disneyland

Summary Heading: Good location, basic room, little thin on theming
Summary: My wife, our 2 teenage boys and I stayed from 4 days here at the beginning of Aug.   The location is quite convenient, near Downtown Disney...I recommend catching the monorail to Disneyland instead of walking to entrance as queue is shorter.  The hotel is nice but compared to some of the Disneyworld hotels the theming is a bit thin in some areas...I.e. pool area.  The room itself is basic and we paid extra for the view which sort of looks at the California Adventure Park (across a road).  Of the 4 nights we were there, we spent 2 in the parks until closing and 1 at Downtown so unless you are planning on spending a lot of time in the room I wouldn’t pay for this extra again.  We had the Donald Duck breakfast in the hotel but I’d recommend the Goofys Kitchen dinner at the

Stayed here August 15th overnight. Would have rated the hotel of five except for a couple of Minor Details. 1 the next morning we had no hot water for showers. I have included photos of this Resorts room I don't know if $500 is Justified. Employees are friendly courteous and get the job done.

This was our second time staying here.  We were very disappointment,  the pool was closed the last time so didn’t know what to expect.  It was very small and over crowded.  The room wasn’t as clean as before,  the walls were dirty, the bathroom floor wasn’t to clean and everything was very dusty.  The hotel could use a little refreshing. The front desk was very nice and counter service,  the staff in the gift shop were rude.  We had a question and no one was in the store,  they made us sand their 15 mins until she would allow me to ask the question.  Also many of the workers questioned you where are you going.  I never had t o report to someone I when I was going to my room or waiting for my family.  This made me feel extremely uncomfortable.  One employee kept asking me if I

We were greeted at the reception with excellent service and a smile. We felt very welcome. Our car was conveniently parked across the hotel. From room 702 we had a sweeping view of the California Adventure Park. The room was clean and had everything we needed for our two days at the park. The viewing platform on third floor - next to the pool and a small bar - was a perfect place to see the firework display at 9:30pm. We have no complains and no regrets.

Where do I start? The carpeting in the rooms was brown and dingy. It looked gross. There were bright balls on the bed (which the hotel informed us would cost us $90 if we took..though why we'd want to I don't know). The shower curtain didn't cover the tub entirely, so the floor got soaked when I showered. The decorations were gaudy and kind of trashy. I was basically just unimpressed. It seemed awkward, and the decorations didn't seem to go together. I won't be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Awesome stay that enhanced our Disney experience
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights during Halloweentime. The hotel is very clean and in very good condition. We were in a concierge level room and had a wonderful view of the California Adventure park. We literally watched World of Color from our room! There is no fridge or microwave in the room, which I think is the norm at this price  point. In my experience, the more you pay for a room, the less likely it is that you will have a fridge or microwave!   The concierge lounge is awesome. The cast members are so pleasant and make you feel welcome. It was great to be able to grab some snack and some cups with ice and infused water to take to the park. We didn't have occasion to be there  for the heavy apps at dinner time except for once. I even enjoyed a nice beer, all complimentary.  I

I guess I am comparing this hotel to the Disney World hotels - and it is not the same at all.  Yes, it's nice, much nicer than the local chains, but the amenities pale in comparison   to WDW (especially the restaurant).  And it's a bit of a hike to the park as well, through Downtown Disney - "walking distance" is all relative I guess.  Nothing wrong here at all, but I think I would stay at the Disneyland Hotel or the California - much closer.  All in all though, I think all future Disney trips will be to Orlando.  I'm glad we went to see the original, and it was OK - but it's just not as good as WDW.

We recently stayed here for a couple of nights to visit the theme parks. I think that the hotel is decently located and is efficient. The rooms are clean and the price is lower than the other two resorts.

We went as a family, so we had two adjoining rooms. The cost for two nights was over $2000. The breakfast buffet was very disappointing, besides being cold. The cost for 4 adults and 2 children was $150. Don’t waste your money. They advertise those characters, but we only saw three. Just not worth it!

Summary Heading: The most “tired” of the Disney brands
Summary: This hotel is fine- but not worth the cost and is not worthy of the Disney name. The hotel and rooms are old and need updating. The pool is small and unimpressive. They claimed to pipe the fireworks music into the pool area- they did not.  Tried to go to the buffet- smelled awful, small selection and charged $50 for age 10 and up- even though there were no characters. Save yourself the frustration and stay at Disneyland hotel and go to Goofy’s kitchen-higher Disney quality.  Disappointed in this hotel and will not stay again.

Summary Heading: well, it's Disney but holy cow
Summary: this was way to much money for what we actually got. It is Disney and was very clean and friendly enough but food was OUT. OF. SIGHT. and honestly we we're that much closer to the park than other, cheaper (still expensive but not as crazy) places.

Summary Heading: Really great experience in typical Disney fashion
Summary: We were able to pre-check in and park our rental car as soon as we arrived to the resort and also learned that we had received a free upgrade to a suite....sweet! I vaguely remember answering a question when I booked about whether our stay was to celebrate a special occasion which it was....a big 5 year cancer free celebration for my 6 year old granddaughter! It is possible that we received the upgrade because of that, not sure, but really nice to have the extra space. Our package of Disney tickets and coupon for lanyards and Disney pins were waiting for us. Both the Adventure Park and Disneyland were a short walk through Downtown Disney from the hotel. Later in the day we received a text with our room number once our suite was ready. The character breakfast was pricey but the

As part of the Disney Resort Hotels, this place strives to bring magic to all aspects of your stay.  Helpful, happy staff in all locations/jobs (cleaning, valet, check-in/front desk, guest services; bell, restaurants, shops).  Each member was service oriented and completely focused on your absolute satisfaction.  They were glad for you to be there and glad to be there. themselves.  The amenities in the room are standard (as found in most hotel rooms) but with the Mickey touch of magic (decor  such as sheets with Mickey embossed on them).  The hotel offerings (food, entertainment, services) again are standard but excel due to the positive staff. Donald's Seaside Grill, a character buffet meal, is loads of beach-themed fun (decor, music).  Donald, Daisy, Minnie, and Stitch were

We had a GREAT stay here. We went during the off season (Jan) and since it was so much cheaper we upgraded to a room on a higher level, with a view of the park, that also included access to the lounge that has breakfast and snacks. We took our son who was 3 at the time. The walk wasn't that far. Its not right on the park but its just about 10 minutes to get into the gates. The room was clean , fun and lightly disney decorated.

Being advertised as “the happiest place on earth,”, this hotel is far from that.  Front desk was very inflexible and not accommodating at all. Very overpriced and not even that conveniently located to the parks.

Summary Heading: Not Steps Away from Disneyland or California Adventure
Summary: I am a Disabled Vietnam Veteran.....have some trouble walking.  We chose Paradise Pier because their website says the hotel is "steps away" from the parks.  That is not true....it's about a 20 - 25 minute walk.  I asked the hotel manager for assistance to get to the Disneyland entrance.  He told me I could rent a scooter from a third party company at my expense.....but said they had no way to take me there.     I would strongly advise staying off property and taking a hotel shuttle....they drop you off right at the entrance to either park....and much, much cheaper.

We had a Club level room on the 3rd floor with a patio.  Loved our location.  We could see fireworks at night, easy access to the pool deck and a short elevator ride to the club lounge.  The room was large - 2 queen beds and a daybed, coffeemaker, small fridge, DVD/Blu-ray player, small safe, desk and plenty of USB ports.  The staff were great, friendly and helpful.  There's something special about Disney's customer service.  The walk through Downtown Disney to the theme parks took longer than my weary legs would have wanted, but this is one of the closest hotels.  The club lounge offered a variety of drinks and snacks throughout the day.  Plenty for everyone.   Would definitely stay here again.  MJ and Hanah at the front desk were super!

Summary Heading: House keeper snuck in my room !!
Summary: My room had a DO NOT DISTURB sign on.. it was about 5pm & I was standing naked getting dressed . All of a sudden a house keeper just walked in my room ..no knock ..no announcement.. nothing !! I immediately yelled WTF !!! .. and she just calmly said oh I'm so sorry and gently shut the door behind her. Now why was a housekeeper coming into my room when it plainly said Do Not Disturb and why did she not announce yourself or even knock a she came in it was all very fishy to me?? I immediately contacted the front desk spoke to the manager and told him the story but he didn't really have much of an explanation for me and just apologize. I find it very alarming and will definitely not stay here again

I rated this hotel 4 stars solely for it's proximity to Disneyland, and it being worth the price as the "cheapest" of the 3 hotels on the property because of this proximity.  It is a 5-minute walk to Downtown Disney where you go through security, and then 2 extra minutes to the monorail that drops you off in the Disneyland park. Extra 5 minute walk through Downtown Disney will take you to the main gates of either park. I found this extremely nice and convenient, and could easily take breaks in the middle of the day.  The hotel itself is not particularly spectacular, it has a mild "surfing" theme to it. If you aren't big into heavy themes, you will find this hotel perfectly fine. What's neat about it is you can go to the roof every night and watch the Disneyland fireworks go off.

We took our Kaleo church kids to Disney land and stayed at the paradise pier hotel. We had a wonderful time the hotel staff is always friendly helpful and service oriented. Their restaurant is wonderful great  Food they had an Italian food pasta, meat balls With meat sauce, salads, salmon, sautéed vegetables, The chef also made gluten-free food for us. Our kids went swimming and the staff created an atmosphere of fun for all of them thank you Disney we had a great time.

Although it was great to have stayed at a Disney Hotel, I strongly believe the service could improve a lot, they are actually very friendly but we felt staff in general didn't go a little bit further to help us, we were traveling with a baby and we needed some assistance to get back to LA, we needed some guidance and didn't get that at all.  Check out is too early, which made it hard to enjoy the pool.  On the bright side, the breakfast experience was amazing, my little girl was beyond happy so we were too.

Summary Heading: Don’t be lured by the “cheap” price!
Summary: Ok, cheap by Disney prices. Have been to Disneyland a couple of times and we got to Disneyworld about once a year.  Usually stay at Disneyland hotel when we are here and Polynesian in Disneyworld.  Paradise Pier is not in the same level at alll!    The hotel has no theme, one crummy restaurant and you can hear the noise at the pool up on the 11th floor.  It is as loud as if you were there on the pool deck. Walls are made out of tissue paper.  Good luck taking a nap in the middle of the day!  Furniture is old and dated.  On the positive side, the walk to Disneyland is only 3-4 blocks longer than from the Disneyland hotel.

Summary Heading: Good Location for a First Timer
Summary: I traveled with my mom (I'm in my 30s and she is in her late 60s) and it was my first time to Disneyland and her first trip since the mid 1980s. Once we got the lay of the land, we were very happy with the location.  Room was simple but clean with a few Disney touches (lamps, artwork, etc).  The "home screen" on the TV (which is standard on all Disney properties) had details about park hours, services, and so on.  Neat nautical themed carpet in hallways, but the smell was a mix of cleaner and clean cat litter. Not terrible, just noticeable.   Pool is not large, but there is a pretty cool water slide in a separate area.  Tons of seating and pool towels provided. There were firework viewing parties each night, but we were always doing something else so we didn't get to go.  There

I was amazing to take an afternoon noon break from Disneyland and walk to the hotel for s rest. The children really enjoyed the Disney atmosphere and the hotels close vicinity to both Disney parks. The hotel is kept up very well. It is clean and employees are happy to be of service to you. The best part was that my young daughter left her prized blanket and they were nice enough to turn it in to lost and found. In the end it is an expensive hotel for the Disney name and much like other hotels.

I booked the Dana Point Suite for two nights for my son's birthday. After booking I tired to find more info online about this specific suite. Strange how I could find almost nothing, that said, I'm writing this review. The Suite itself is not really a suite, but one main room with two connecting rooms for a total of 3 bedrooms and a living/dining room combo. We had 11 adults and my infant son. I was a tight squeeze, but we managed. Booking this very expensive suite gets you a few perks. Free valet parking, welcome bag off all sorts of sweets, club lounge access and nightly shortbread lolly pops. By far the best perk is the private seating for shows/events at the theme parks. We were able to see the Pixar Parade, Fantasmic and the Fireworks. We would check in with the events

Summary Heading: Easy vacation destination for Disney & CA Adventure
Summary: We traveled with our 7 year old and other family.  Check in is a long process, but they are helpful.  The little restaurant in the lobby is overpriced but decent (slow wait too).  The character breakfast was probably one of the best experiences we've had with Disney.  Food was actually really good.  We did a 7:20 breakfast and it was basically empty on a Friday morning so you got two or three rounds of characters.  A little overpriced, but still worth it.  Pool is more than adequate for kids and slide was a hit.  We all had a little pizza and drinks from the bar there and sat down away from the pool and it was wonderful.    Staff was super nice. Room was clean.  My kid loved the fold-out type bed.  There is a line for wet suits in the shower.  It is a bit of a hike yet to

This Disney resort meets expectations,  no doubt. We arrived at 7am, pre checked in, received our room keys & park hopper tickets. By 8am, we were at California adventures opening up the joint (see my other reviews too, regarding everything disney) by lunchtime,  I received a text stating the room was ready. So we walked back to the hotel, and one of the cool features was the elevator. Trust me, you'll think how you are assigned an elevator is pretty cool. I did, or maybe I'm just a dork, lol. Anyway, got to our room. Not the biggest room I've stayed in but was satisfied nonetheless. The whole property was clean, spacious, and of course had the nicest cast members. The pool area is nice, and the slide is fast & fun. And because we stayed at a Disney property,  we had early entry

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a visit to Disneyland and California Adventure
Summary: This is a very good hotel to stay at when visiting Disneyland and California Adventure. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. There is no microwave or toaster, just a mini fridge and a coffee maker, but if you need a microwave there is the lounge at the lobby level. It is within walking distance of Downtown Disney, Disneyland and California Adventure. If you don't want to walk all the way to Disneyland, you can always board the Monorail at the Downtown Disney station. We used our DVC vacation points for this stay, so I can comment about the rates, but I think they start at about 270 USD per night for a double room with a daybed. There is an observation deck at the top floor for viewing the firewokrs displays from the parks. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Location.. Great Pool..  Great Staff
Summary: It is only a short walk to the DL parks.  The hotel has a convenient parking garage and the pool is awesome with the slide and pool side bar.  The staff was very nice and the room was spacious and clean.

Summary Heading: Overpriced mediocre food balanced out by location and staff
Summary: The double-room with a pull-out couch was spacious enough for me and two kids (9 & 13).  There were enough clothes drawers to be comfortable for three nights.  The room looked about 20 years out of date, but it was not shabby, just dated.  The room service food was mediocre at best and ridiculously expensive (although very fast).  For breakfast, skip the hotel and go to one of the three Starbucks on Disney Drive as you walk to the theme park entrance.  The hotel is a 10 minute walk to Disney Drive, and after getting thru security there, it is another 10 to 15 minute walk down Disney Drive past food and stores to get to the theme park entrances.   The pool was a nice respite after hot exhausting days at Disneyland.  My 9-year old enjoyed the staff-led limbo-line and games at the

Summary Heading: Proximity without frills - Opt to pay more onsite or venture off-site
Summary: At a whopping $436/night rate (June, high season) for a standard double-double room, the experience should be pleasant and effortless. Instead of customer service and modern accommodations you are paying for proximity and early entry into the park as a resort guest. The outdated room was clean, average sized, and acceptable in almost every way. The carpets were older, there was minimal counter space, the bathroom was dated, and the walls were paper thin. Customer service was not the same "Disney" experience as one might expect from Disneyland. We waited at check-in for 15-20 minutes and our service agent was minimally welcoming. I travel frequently for work and the customer and food service was pale in comparison at best to a standard Hilton, Marriott, or IHG experience. That

This Disney hotel has some of the largest standard rooms of any of the 3 Disney hotels. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Pool is accessible, Hot Tub/whirlpool is smallest, but hottest of all 3 Disney hotels

We stayed here for 1 night between days at Disneyland and California Adventures. We arrived at 9am to check in. They stored our bags and they put them in our room for us while we enjoyed the park. Room was clean, cool, and comfortable. Our purchases from the park were waiting for us at Front Desk. Wish we had time to enjoy the pool area, it looked awesome.   The hotel overlooks California Adventures - there should be a dedicated entrance, like Grand California has. It is 20 minutes walk thru Downtown Disney to get to park (waste of time/energy).

We were warmly welcomed into this restaurant modestly looking Disney themed hotel. The front desk checked us in swiftly. The kids were delighted to receive the badges.  The room was very bright and clean. We didn’t hear much noise from the Fireworks in the park compared to the other hotel which we had stayed in the night before.   The room had everything we need. The towels were fresh and clean.   We had also booked the premium character dinning st the cafe. It was a deal worth paying for. Not only did they enjoy meeting the Disney characters, breakfast was amazingly tasty!   The hotel is a short 5 minutes walk to Downtown Disney. You can find everything there. We enjoyed every minute in the hotel and would love to come back soon!

Summary Heading: Not much value for staying here any more
Summary: Unfortunately, once you get past Goofy in the lobby, you might as well be in any average hotel.  Rooms are drab, nothing Disney unique anymore.  Over half the vending machines and arcade games had out of order signs on them. When I mentioned it, they said they had only been that way a 2-3 days, but it sure looked like they had been out for longer.  The window glass in our room was distorted, so you couldn't see out clearly.  The monorail used to take you into the park on early mornings so you could beat the 3 day or more pass holders at the main gate, but now it doesn't leave Downtown Disney until after the park has opened.  We didn't get our express checkout folio on our door, so had to wait in line to check out.  When I complained that I was running late because of the wait,

Was a good fast check in, with a complementary upgrade looking over the park. Room was big and had all our needs, lovely comfy bed.  Was nice and close to the park and had no troubles walking there.  The Only complaint to be made was that I found the luggage storage guys were very rude. Wasn’t very disney happy...

One of our favorite things about staying at the Disney Park Hotels is that you feel like you never leave the park. You have the fun experience day and night. This hotel set the perfect spring break mood with the California Surfer Scene. The decor and characters all around the hotel, felt both welcoming and interactive.   Compared to Grand Californian, it is not as neatly kept or as accommodating. You no longer can use the special entrance by the Grand Californian for Magic Mornings. You do not receive turn down service nor top notch house keeping. Plus, the Paradise Pier Hotel looks dated compared to the Grand Californian. However, you are not paying as much to stay here either. I was actually surprised by housekeeping giving us multiple conditioners instead of lotions each day,

Summary Heading: Worth the money; Perfect for families
Summary: We live in Southern California, and have stayed in many of the hotels in Anaheim, both on the resort grounds and off.  For the price, I would say that Paradise Pier is the best value.  We had a sizable room that accommodated my family of 5 very well.  The service was "DISNEY" level, which means EXCELLENT, the proximity to the parks was fantastic, the Park View rooms were wonderful, and spending the day at the pool, on the water slides was a great ending.  We were able to walk back to the hotel in the middle of our day to grab jackets and put on jeans before we headed back to the park.  The closeness of the hotel made that transition easy.  I always go back and forth deciding whether to stay at a Disney hotel, and spend the extra money, or stay at a local hotel, and this visit

Summary Heading: Great Disney Hotel Close to Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed for three nights at the Paradise Pier. We had a great experience. The check in was fast and easy our room was clean and comfortable. The beds were great!  We loved being able to watch the fireworks from Disneyland from the pool deck. The walk into Disneyland and California Adventure is quick and convenient. We had room service which was great. The service charge is kind of pricey but it was good quality food. The pool area was nice and the kids loved the slide. We were able to buy our Disney passes at the front desk which was also nice! Would totally recommend this hotel! Can’t wait to go back!

Summary Heading: Large Comfortable Rooms 15 Minute Walk to the Parks
Summary: Doesn’t seem so far as you head out in the mornings, but after a full day in the park, it is a very very long walk back. There are no shuttles.   The hotel itself is somewhat dated. It does not offer full service amenities you might expect from a 4 star hotel.

The hotel is comfortable, but farther from the parks than the Disneyland Hotel, where we stayed before.  Besides that, the elevator system is unworkable when there are large numbers of people trying to get on at once.  Instead of having the buttons for floors inside the elevators, there is a screen by each of the four elevators where you punch in your floor; it works fine if there are only a few people waiting, but if there is a crowd it breaks down entirely.  After watching the fireworks on the third floor deck one evening, I waited for 30 minutes with a large crowd of frazzled parents and over-tired children, all of us trying to get back to our rooms, while the elevator system sent us all to the same elevator, each with room for about four parents and two strollers.  When one

Summary Heading: A Great Treat for Mother’s Day Weekend
Summary: Last Mother’s Day weekend was not our first visit to Disney’s Paradise Pier Hotel, and will definitely not be the last. Staff is always friendly and fun. Beds are comfortable. You can watch the Disneyland fireworks from the 3rd floor open terrace by the pool; they pipe in the music from the park.

Summary Heading: Family Trip - my granddaughter’s first trip
Summary: This was a magical experience for my “almost 3 year old granddaughter”. Amazing hotel room with “Disney Bedtime Stories” on TV. She asks for these stories still and replays the video I shot of our room over and over. We had a suite where “Momma and Dada” had two queen size beds and their own room and my granddaughter and I had the pull out Queen size sofa bed. Saw the fireworks from our 5 story window. Reservation staff efficient but Bell Boy station needs to be a bit more attentive we had to wait 15 min to check in luggage. TIP: If you have a child in stroller plan to take longer to get to lobby on a Saturday morning.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, outstanding customer service, don't hesitate to stay here!
Summary: We stayed here two weeks ago, and we absolutely loved this hotel.  We had read some mixed reviews on here so we were a little worried that it wouldn't meet our expectations.  Well trust me, it's an excellent hotel for several reasons, so here it is:  1.  The location is fabulous.  With a very short walk out of the front door you're in Downtown Disney.  You don't have to cross any busy streets or wait at traffic lights.  Essentially you're walking a small walkway into the Downtown Disney entrance.    When you decide you want to run back to the room, for a nap, change of clothes, or just a break, you can do that without major effort.  Walk through Downtown Disney and out the same way you came in, you'll be in your room in about 10-15 minutes from leaving the park.  You can't beat

Summary Heading: Would like to see what other Disney hotels offer
Summary: Late review, stayed end of January.  We were happy with our stay.  Hotel staff was always friendly and the room was clean.  The room is small, but had a spectacular view of California park at night!  The food at the concierge was nothing fancy with continental type breakfast, afternoon snacks, early evening hors d’oeuvres, & evening dessert.  I did enjoying making my espresso every morning!  Brisk walk to downtown Disney and the monorail took us into Disneyland.  The pool was small and got crowded real quick. Charge for parking the day you arrive AND the day you check out...

Summary Heading: Disenyland's Paradise Pier: Onsite location, low Disney dollars
Summary: There are three hotels on-site at the Disneyland Resort: Paradise Pier, The Disneyland Hotel, and the Grand Californian. There is a big difference in price and amenities amongst the three hotels. Paradise Pier is the most affordable. We actually like Paradise Pier for what you get. If you have a tight budget, check out Paradise Pier before you book off-site. You’ll be surprised to see that the prices may be within your budget. The rooms tend to be a little larger than other hotels in the same price range, and you get to stay on-site with all of the Disney benefits. The early entry into the park is worth the stay. There are two restaurants on-site. PCH Grill, where you can have a Character dining experience with Lilo and Stitch in the morning and build-your-own pizzas at night,

Summary Heading: Of course it’s expensive - it’s Disney
Summary: Always find it hard to be objective when it comes to Disney on site hotels.  First up it’s not WDW- the full immersion just doesn’t exist but it’s a big step up from the off site hotels by way of at least being interconnected to Disney downtown .  The hotel wasn’t overly Disney either . The rooms were basic and modest. The view which we paid for was overlooking DCA except most of it was under construction and there was no woc. Hardly worth the premium. I guess that’s not the hotels fault.   Service was a winner. Happy and provision of good service was on display and this is where Disney recovers a little of its magic.  The pool area was a concrete mess with nothing really Disney about it.  The walk to downtown Disney wasn’t hard and monorail was put to good use to get into the

The good: Checkin was fast and very friendly as well as informative. Parking was easy. The hotel has a nice atmosphere and the rooms were clean.  The "eh" The bar at the pool is not great in that it is nothing special. The rooms while clean were not special either. We stayed in the concierge level and expected much more.   The bad: The bed was very worn out. Especially by the disney standards we have been used to at WDW. The Beach Club Lounge is, well, much like Holiday Inn at Omni Prices. Seriously sad appetizer but if you like beer then drink up because you can have during the early evening hour. I looked at pictures before going the concierge level but the angles were deceiving. It is simply a counter of food a and nothing hot in the morning. Soda is in ab fridge underneath

Summary Heading: Cheapest Disney hotel but still convenient
Summary: Stayed for one night in a standard room.  The room was large, beds were comfortable and the staff were friendly.  Comfortably fit all 4 of us and our luggage.  It is the cheapest of the on-site Disney hotels which makes it worth booking if you wish to take advantage of other Disney offers such as Extra Magic Hours in the parks.  You need to stay in a Disney hotel to receive this little perk and it makes a difference if you wish to have an hour of little to no ride queues.  You can also use the room keys to charge items to your room while you’re in the park.  Tip: the self park multi storey car park doesn’t have a lift so drop your luggage off at the hotel lobby before parking your car otherwise you will have to carry your bags down a few flights of stairs.

We were upgraded to a premier room with a view of California adventure during our 3 night stay at Disney. The theming in the room was incredible and found many hidden mickeys in the room. Although it was not as good as the suites at Walt Disney world I would definitely recommend staying at Disney’s Paradise Pier Hotel. Will try the original Disneyland hotel next time I am back!

Summary Heading: Great location but for these prices they could easily improve rooms and amenities.
Summary: We all know the great benefits of staying in a Disney Hotel: the great location in the park, the priceless magic hour early entrance, and the Disney Magic the kids get walking into a Disney property.  But my point is they need to put in some effort if we are paying $400 per night.  They could easily provide high end bath soaps and lotions, plush towels, nice robes and slippers, and a room remodel that makes you feel like you are not staying in a motel.  We are all still going to stay at these properties but it is not asking too much to demand nice amenities for these prices.

Summary Heading: Do NOT stay at this hotel - so many better options
Summary: We don’t know why we stayed here. The romantic though behind our choice was that the hotel would have a wonderful Disney feel, the kids would get into the Disney spirit and we would get a jump on the public with the extra hour in Disneyland in the morning. None of it became reality. Firstly - any member of the public can buy the extra hour. Stay at the Hilton at less than half the price but twice the quality and you are in having photos with Mickey at 8.   Our hotel stay didn’t start well. We arrived at the hotel at 3.30pm after flying from NYC to be told that our room was not ready!! We thought we would talk to the front activities desk people to plan our next two days but nobody was there.   We got to the room 45 mins later. Stock standard but the Park view room only gives you

Would recommend staying at one of the Disney resorts due to the close location to Disneyland and California Adventure Adventure. When it started to get busy in the parks in the period after lunch to around 5pm, we'd chill in the room for a bit  before heading back to the parks at night. The Magic Hour is offered to resort guests meaning we could go into the park an hour before it opens for normal guests. This allows you to get lots of rides done early with little to no queue. The Magic Hour alternates between being Disneyland one day and California Adventure the following and so on.  Paradise Pier appears to be the cheapest of the Disney resorts however the room was all that we needed - good size, clean, beach theming and some nice Disney character content.   Avoid the buffet

We stayed at Paradise Hotel for an overnight annniversary trip, then on to Disneyland for the next day. This is the second time we stayed here. We're DVC members , so it was 29 points to stay. It is an older hotel but they have updated it to keep up with the times. It is a surf theme and is walking distance to Disneyland. If you're a DVC member your parking is free and you can park your car while you go to Disneyland the next day until 1159 pm, after that they say you will be charged for parking. The restaurant on the first floor was a very good surprise for breakfast and wasn't too expensive. There is a buffet style restaurant at the end of the hallway, that was 39.95 per person. We did not eat there, but looked like they had really good food. Nice hotel, very close to

We had such a fun time at Paradise Pier and celebrated our children's birthdays with a 3 day stay and visit to both Disney parks.  The staff at the hotel were very welcoming, knowledgeable, and added wonderful touches to our stay that made it even more special.  The hotel was decorated for the holidays and it was just gorgeous.  The DVD library is fantastic and watching our favorite Disney movies was a fun way to unwind after busy days.

When we checked in, our room wasn’t ready, however, we were given room keys ahead of time and we were instructed to leave our baggage at the hotel. In the meantime, he headed over to the park.   We received a text informing us our room was ready and our room number. We were allowed to go straight to the room; no need to check in again at the desk. It was super convenient.   The bathrooms are a little out dated, but the bathtub was a decent size and deep. After a long day at the park, it felt wonderful soaking in a hot bath!   The hotel also offers life vests and pull ups at the pool aside from the customary towel service. A plus with little ones.

Summary Heading: Its a little better than average but could be better...
Summary: Stayed in Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel for 4 days 3 nights.  I want to give a 3 and 1/2 stars but I can't do half star.    Check-in is slow.  The check-in process really make you feel magically slow...maybe the employees are trained in the wrong magical way??  We did get to meet Micky, Minnie, Daisy and Stitch in the lobby.  This  is a huge plus because we don't have to wait for 1hr+ in the park to take picture with them.  Its a time saver!  Room is clean but outdated.  With the price, the room should be remodeled.  I stayed in Hyatt Place near by before and the rooms are much better.  Disney should really remodel their rooms and bring the hotels to par (I also stayed in Disneyland Hotel before and rooms are similar to Paradise Pier -- outdated).  I mean, it's Disney brand,

Summary Heading: Good exclusivity to meet the characters
Summary: This was a lovely breakfast, fruit, cereal, fry up, continental food choices. It was very expensive for what it was. We did meet 4 characters, Mickey, Minnie, Daisy and stitch but I’ve done this breakfast in both Florida and Paris and you meet more characters there. Children did really enjoy it though.

Summary Heading: Very Close to Park and Early Entry
Summary: The best part of the hotel was the ability to enter the park early.  There package we had allowed us to a lounge area with snacks and some adult beverages.  The hotel is fine, the people at the hotel are very nice and helpful.  The bar/restaurant at the hotel is quite OK - not anything to write home about.  We thought the hotel was way overpriced for what it was.  I would stay elsewhere if there was a way to get in the parks early.  That hour makes a huge difference when the parts do begin to fill up - and they always do.

This me and my family's second stay at PP. We pay for the premium view with club access so we're able to utilize the beachcomber club room for the snacks, continental breakfasts, happy hour, and movie rental. This also allows us to view World of Color show from our room and reserved seating for the nightly firework show from the pool area on the 3rd floor rooftop! The staff is helpful and the customer service is always excellent. I was disapointed to learn that despite staying at one of the Disneyland Resorts we no longer have entry to the California Adventure park through the Grand California, this was always one of our favorite to access the park especially during the early morning hour! Also the new elevator system to press the floor and then you're assigned a elevator to

As with most disney properties check in check out are a breeze. We stayed in Paradise Pier in Nov. the rooms are noticeably larger at PP, but the location is better at Disneyland hotel. The price is about $400 more at DH, the rooms are appointed nicer at DH but smaller. The amenities at the DH are well worth the extra price, larger pools, short walk to downtown disney restaurants, in house bars and restaurants, and character breakfast. The beds were comfy, room clean, but the convenience is the selling point, monorail to park about a 10 min. walk.

Went on a family vacation with my wife and 2 son's, the hotel was a little hard to find at first but made it. The hotel and staff were great. The valet and concierge staff were polite and very fun to talk to and made us welcomed.  Checking in for whatever reason took a bit but finally got our room. We booked a standard room with 2 beds and we all slept well and comfortable.  Clean and well kept. Our view was on the pool side so it was cool to look out and see our kids at the pool. A couple of times we got golf carted to the main park entrance which was a nice touch but walking to the entrance was only like a 10 minute walk, plus you get to go through the ESPN Zone area which has tons of shops and eating spots.  Nice to be able to get into the park a hour early before the park

The hotel was just ok. The rooms were clean and bright the pool was somewhat supervised by lifeguards. Like most hotel pools you get the unsupervised by their parents kids running and splashing and unsupervised in the hot tub even though the rules are posted everywhere!  They have a fireworks rooftop deck which is good.    The problems we had were in the restaurants... we went to a character breakfast at the pch grill and breakfast buffet was terrible. The characters were fun and the kids enjoyed dancing with Mickey Mouse but everyone came away with a tummy ache.  Later in the trip we went to the sandbar for lunch while the kids napped.  It took forever to get someone to take our order, we waited forever then the waitress comes over and thinks we have gotten the food, turns out

Summary Heading: Five Stars for Staff, Four for Location, Three for the Hotel Itself
Summary: Stayed here for a family trip to Disneyland.  The pros:  Super friendly, very knowledgable, always smiling Staff. Location (easy walk to downtown Disney and the park entrances). Can watch fireworks from the pool (complete with soundtrack). The cons:  the rooms are tired.  Torn towels, peeling paint, chipped furniture, really stinky fridge, etc.    The condition of the room is less of a big deal because so little time is spent in the actual room.  We enjoyed being able to return to the room when we needed a break from the parks or to grab a jacket when it got chilly.  Also, the magic hour that you get when staying at a Disney property is a game-changer.    One odd thing-- in a room meant for 4-6 people (2 queens and a pull-out) there are places to hang exactly two towels. Where

I’ve been taking middle and high school students on field trips for over 20 years and have seen my share of hotels. This trip was partly to Hollywood/Burbank to visit the filmmaking industry & universities and part to Disneyland to participate in the Disney Performing Arts workshops.   Disney’s Paradise Pier is exactly what you need if bringing a school group or family on a budget to Disneyland. The benefits of being a Disney hotel guest speak for themselves.   What the brochures and websites won’t tell you are the absolute friendliness and responsiveness by the hotel staff to your needs. I must thank Melissa and Mo at the front desk tremendously. Melissa anticipated our needs every night without me needing to request a thing. Mo worked tirelessly when one of our students had

Paradise Pier is a nice hotel.  The rooms are a bit larger than most.  My standard view room is located on the 4th floor with a view of the rooftop area adjacent to the pool.  The room has two queen beds that are beyond comfortable.  It’s also nice that each bed has 4 pillows and two more in the closet.  Each bed also has s beach ball pillow.  Our room also has a couch.  The closet is a regular full size closet with an iron/ironing board.  The bathroom in a single vanity, with a tub shower combination.  We have a desk with two outlets.  No USB ports.  The thermostat is accurate and you can change temperature quick.  I generally gage hotels on two things...is the hot water hot and is the water pressure good. Both are excellent here.  My rate was $249.00, a military rate plus the

Was a nice, clean hotel that while a little expensive added to our trip.  A couple things I’d like to point out....  -we overlooked California adventure.  While the room was awesome for world of color, it was like we were being attacked during the Disneyland fireworks.  -we had club level access.  The people there were fantastic and met any need we wanted.  -we ate at the bar on Thursday night and the service was exceptional.  I ordered something wrong and they voluntarily offered to exchange the meal.  That never happens.  I just wish it was a little warmer for us to use the pool.

Nice hotel, comfortable and clean.  Very kid friendly and even have Character breakfasts with a reservation.  If you are visiting both parks over a few days you really spend little time in the room, but nice to come back to.  Cute pool area also!  Would definitely recommend, as it is less expensive than the other options.

We had planned to have a cheap vacation and booked an Air Bnb, however upon arrival in the area our plans fell through. Spur of the moment we decided to stay on-site at Disney and discovered the Paradise Pier Hotel was the cheapest of the options. I see that many reviews discuss the hotel being overpriced, which I will admit the price is high, however it's Disney so we knew that we would be paying a lot. At check-in we were surprised with an upgrade from the standard view to the premium view. The upgrade was wonderful, we were able to watch the World of Color from our room and the narration was even available on the tv. It seems like it is the further walk to the park from a Disney hotel, but we didn't mind. I have stayed at a number of resorts in Disney World and this is not at

The only reason to stay at this hotel is because you simply have to be on property at Disneyland.  The rooms are nice enough, but similar ones can be had nearby for much cheaper.  The location isn't any more convenient than hotels on the east side of the resort.  In fact, the official way into the parks is to exit the back of the hotel, walk through a parking lot, and then into Downtown Disney.  There's no guarantee that you would allowed into the Grand Californian across the street to use its private entrances.  Check-in was very slow, and service generally so-so.  Even though I requested a king bed, I got two queens -- and view directly onto the pool.  For a more magical experience, I suggest staying at the Disneyland Hotel.

Summary Heading: Great location but too expensive for the quality of the room
Summary: The room was a solid 3. The linens were good, beds were comfortable and it seemed clean enough (although I was somewhat suspect of the carpet). Our room had a nice view of the park, so we could see the firework from our window. We could hear a lot of park noise, but it wasn't bad and didn't disturb us. The room was dated, though, and seemed somewhat tired.  Considering the nightly rate we paid, I had much much higher expectations.  Our general thought is that the hotel is very accommodating to families and therefore believes that families have low expectations of their rooms.  Room service was not available in the afternoon when we were resting from a long day.  We did not use the pool.  Laundry service was so-so, in that we had to drop off the bag ourselves in the morning, and

I and my wife went to Disneyland on our honeymoon over 40 years ago.  For our anniversary we went to Disneyland just the 2 of us.  We had a great time.  What was great was that we were able to check into our room at 7:00 a.m. and enter the park at 8:00 a.m.  We spent the day in the park but we realized that we are not as young as we were when we first got married.  So about 5:00 p.m. we went back to our room but we were able to ride every ride that we wanted to because the park was not very crowded.  This was a great time to go and the hotel was just wonderful.  We had lunch in the park and we ended up having a lite dinner in the hotel that night.  This is a great hotel and very convenient.  Love this place and it makes you happy.

The Paradise Pier was a comfy and cheaper alternative to our favorite Grand Californian. My 8 year old and I stayed for just 1 night and found it to be a great base for exploring the parks. The beds are comfortable and the hotel is very quiet. Our 2 bedded room came with a sleeping couch too so could easily accommodate a larger family. The distance to the parks is about 1/3 mile walk - Grand Californian is much closer and the Disney hotel is a little closer. For a really special occasion I would splurge for the Grand Californian but for a quick trip this was great. There's an arcade off the lobby and a cute room for kids to watch Disney cartoons. The extra magic hour is worth it, we were able to do all the big rides at CA Adventure in the first hour the park was open - Soarin',

We stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel for two days. We were on the 14th floor facing my California Adventure and got the club level as well. Club level was on the second floor, you got continental breakfast( bagels, pastry, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, OJ, milk coffee) They also do lunch time snacks, have a cocktail hour with beer and wine and desserts...  The room was nice and spacious, clean and had a wonderful view. The lobby area had a kids arcade, and my favorite had a kids theater which played old Disney cartoons for the kids... Staff is super helpful and sweet as well. Can’t go wrong staying at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Large room, new Smart TV... Specs OK but needs a revamp
Summary: Another Disney hotel by music business industry when January comes, that's the NAMM Show,  indeed! So my company books dozens of rooms. I was happy about the room: as usual twin large beds, complete bathroom with all you might need and best of all, a new LG Smart TV. That made my day, guys! If you can recall previous reviews from me, I do travel with my portable USB drive and do enjoy plugging it in to enjoy movies (especially when TV sucks when it's a long trip and when the hour difference does not allow easy sleep -100% matching situation here-). The USB port was unblocked so I was successful with my entertainment mission, BUT it took me a very long time to be able to connect the cable to the back of the TV, because some old 70s (old, battered and really ugly, should be

Summary Heading: Great for Families but Only Adequate for Convention/Business Guests
Summary: As a convention/business guest for a trade show at the nearby Anaheim Convention Center, the hotel was adequate in that it was a relatively short walk to the Convention Center and had overnight parking (albeit at $17 - $20/night depending on applicable discounts), but since the hotel services primarily Disneyland guests and families, it did not have style and ambiance that business travelers expect. That being said, hotel would be a good second choice for families visiting Disneyland: not as lavish and updated as the Grand Californian and with access to the park a bit more removed than the Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian.  It has the Disney character breakfast, a Disney-typical perky, always helpful front desk and staff, early Park entry option and a slightly outdated

This is a nice hotel with some friendly people. The only advantage this hotel has is that it is a Disney hotel and offers early entry into the parks. The early entry was only available for one park each day and Disney decides which park. There is no hotel shuttle to the park so you have to walk (15 to 20 minutes) or taxi/Uber. This forces you to walk through Downtown Disney, where they hope you will spend more money. There is a short-cut through one of their other hotels but they have security at the street corner to discourage people from using it. Except for what I have mentioned I really like the hotel. For the price they charge I would not stay there again.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but Disneyland Hotel and Grand Californian are better.
Summary: My wife, 4 year old and I stayed here recently as a staycation (we live in Orange County).  We came here for two nights and booked a room with concierge service and access to the Beachcomber Club.  We checked in around 2pm, The cast member at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful.  She took us up to the Beachcomber Club, on the second floor, to show us around.   At the Beachcomber club, there is breakfast at 630 to 10am, Snacks from 10 to 5pm, and appetizers with beer and wine from 5-7, and deserts and beer and wine until 8pm. What I found a little odd about this club was that alcohol is only served after 5pm.  When I stayed at the e-Ticket lounge at Disneyland hotel, and at lounge at Grand California, I was able to get drinks throughout the day.  I remember getting

Summary Heading: Great if you have little children
Summary: Disney's Paradise Pier has a very good location and is a decent hotel but I would not say it is a good value for your money IF you have teenagers.  The rooms are basic with a beach scene.  It has a nice pool area but closes at 8 pm.  We were very disappointed that we could not enjoy the hot spa whirlpool after we were in the rain all day.  We did not have a view room and still paid over 200.00 and we needed 2 rooms so 400.00 a night,  I guess I was expecting a little more.    Very friendly staff for sure.

This was a last minute trip to Disneyland and we wanted to stay overnight. This was the only hotel available in the Disney resort. We were told that this room (standard) had no view, etc. we were okay with that as we were not going to spend much time in the room anyway. So check-in was a fiasco, not very friendly staff, did not want to spend anytime  answering questions, gave us our room keys even though the room was not ready, once room was ready they would be activated remotely so that we could go straight to our room when the room was ready. Hmmm.........we waited all day to get our room (past 4:00 pm) and we had a dinning reservation at 5:30 pm. We called at 4:30 pm and they said you need to come back to check-in to get other keys, what? No one explained the why for this and

We love Disney resorts, and although pricey, it’s always worth it. We checked in, and got a free upgrade (this is the second time) and were surprised with a park view room! The staff is friendly and very helpful, the theming is also super cute!

Summary Heading: Happiest place on earth to play and stay!
Summary: Nothing Disney does is sub-par, They have a premium product and they know it, they hire the best people, it's all about quality, and details....    I stayed here many years ago and wanted to come back.  I have also stayed at the Disney hotel and for me I would probably chose the Disney Hotel,  We don't spend that much time in the hotel but just the fact that you get early morning admission (1 hour) counts. Paradise Pier is a little further to walk but not substantial.   They explain how everything works, where to walk to get to the park etc.    Just follow the red brick road.   Prices are expensive, room was clean. What can I say I just love everything Disney does......

This is a decent hotel...no frills but a fun atmosphere! It is at the edge of Downtown Disney so it’s a good little walk to the Parks! Of course there are so many fun things to see you don’t really notice! Definitely do the Surf’s Up Breakfast! Lots of fun!

Its a great hotel with great location. THe service was fantastic with an easy walk to the parks. I highly recommend this as a great base for the family. We had 2 adults and 2 kids in a room it is was great. THe pool is also amazing for the kids.

We wanted to stay on Disney property and chose Paradise Pier mainly because it had the cheaper rate of the hotels on property. We were very pleased.  Our room was clean. We could see World of Color from our room, which was pretty each night. Hotel staff was very nice. The walk to Downtown Disney and the parks was not very far (about 10-15 mins depending how fast one walks). Kids loved the pool and water slide. Hotel, pool and grounds were very clean. We would stay there again.

This hotel has quaint ambience, trying to replicate the feel of an old-fashioned seaside resort. I thought it was great!  The beds were comfy, the bathroom was spacious and had good water pressure etc. Everything was kept very clean.  They pay attention to little details as well - we stayed on Halloween night, and found a little Dracula rubber ducky in our bathroom that evening when we came home from the park. Things like that make for a nice touch!  Check in was a breeze. We arrived WAY ahead of our designated check in time, but were exhausted having come direct from Sydney, so wanted to see if we could at least just drop our bags and maybe laze by the pool. Lo and behold, our room was already available, and we were able to check in properly and have showers and naps before

My first time visiting the land of imagination and enjoyed every moment of it. The hotel staff were friendly. I found no issues with the hotel at all. Barely got to stay in it given that we were out all day. Love it

Very friendly staff that offered us all the help, we had a room with a park view so you watch the show and listen to the music on the TV from the comfort of your room which was nice, didn't get to use the pools since it was cold, the property is on the old side and the food at the restaurant is not that great but average stay overall.

Summary Heading: Better then the Disneyland Hotel in my opinion.
Summary: I have stayed at almost every single Disney property minus just a few over the past 20 years. Each hotel has something to offer.  I personally loved this property.  I did have a theme park view on the 12th floor with concierge access.  This might have a lot to do with  how I felt about the hotel.  I loved how close I was to California Adventure at night.  The theme park views of Magic Kingdom at the resorts along the monorail in Florida are jokes compared to your view in California.  It was really beautiful and I really enjoyed that aspect a lot.  The concierge level for me was fantastic.  I believe the concierges name was Ken but he couldn't enough for us.  He wanted so much for us to have a great time and you could feel it.  I did have two complaints.  The first is they need

I have been to Disney Parks 3 times over the past 5 years.  In all 3 times I have stayed in a Disney property and I have never had such a bad experience with a Disney-run hotel.  First of all, the check at the Paradise Pier in was hectic, disorganized and slow - it took us 60 minutes to get from the hotel reception to our room.  Second of all, the heating in our room was not working and the sofa bed was not made - they took 3 hours to come and fix it.  And, third and worst of all, I asked the front desk the night before our departure to be able to check out TWO hours after their scheduled departure time of 11 am (which is not even based on standard practice) because my daughter was sick and we had barely slept the night before.  I was told that I needed to wake up at 6 am to

The rooms and bathrooms are clean, good sized.  Nothing fancy and a little tired, but it is Disney.  Not too loud for being close to the park and the early entry into Disney makes it worth it just for that.  We had a little security issue with the porters, my mom had some money taken from her bag while they were watching our bags.  But Disney dealt with it seriously and the money was found and returned to her.  All in all, I would use this hotel again, but not leave my bags withe the porters.

Check in was quick and simple. The room needed to be cleaned better. When looking for an outlet between the bed and side table I had found a black hair tie that did not belong to us. The carpet in the room had 4 stains on it. When pulling out the day bed I had also found trash that did not belong to us either. Whenever we used the sink it did not drain as well as a sink should. When I went to go shave with just soap and water it seemed to make the draining worse. The sink filled up almost to the top because it wouldnt drain and there was hair floating everywhere from my shaving, which is expected. After shaving we had to leave for our conference and when we returned our maid had been there and made our bed and gave us fresh towels. She however failed to do a simple wipe down of

Summary Heading: Good Disneyland hotel option to save money
Summary: My husband, daughter (2 year old) and I stayed here in January for my 30th birthday. We called pretty late in December to book a room and paradise pier had one hotel room left amongst the three so we took it. It’s cheaper than the other 2 hotels and you can see why if you’ve ever stayed in the other 2 hotels before. It’s a clean and comfortable hotel with PCH Grill (breakfast character buffet dining and dinner dining) and a bar/quick bite restaurant in the lobby. There’s a movie room and arcade for the little ones to keep them occupied. The biggest hit of the stay - we came back from the park for nap time and Mickey, Minnie, and daisy were in the lobby taking pictures with the kids and playing. That made our entire stay! It’s about a 15 minute walk through downtown Disney to get

Rooms and bathroom were a nice size and clean.  It was nice to have the sofa. Could have used more drawer space. I have college age kids so we were 4 adults in the room and didn't feel too crowded.  The lounge restaurant was solid - it was nice to have it there.  The decor/theme was nice, but not an overwhelming Disney vibe to the place (good or bad depending on how you feel about that).  Staff was pleasant, but not overly helpful, even though their tone would lead you to believe they thought they were being so.  We had a few minor things that did not get addressed, which was no big deal, but our main complaint was the check in time issue.  Check in is at 3.  We were early and were told room would be ready between 3 + 4pm.  At 4:05 I checked in at desk to get progress report was

Summary Heading: Only real benefit of staying here is daily magic morning access to the parks
Summary: We stayed here five nights over the Christmas holiday and paid a premium for a very average room. The lobby was decorated with a nice ocean themed tree and a few other holiday decorations were observed in the dinning areas. The character dinning in the buffet area was a nice Disney touch; however, you do not need to be a resort guest to dine here so people staying in other hotels are welcome to come to the character buffets.The food was pricey compared to an IHOP or other family style restaurant, but you do get to dine with Goofy and Donald wandering around. The food was good as far as buffets go.  The room is a decent size and provides a mini fridge and a pod style coffee maker.  There is no microwave for warming up leftovers or quick instant meals (oatmeal) in the room. The

This hotel is located behind California Adventure and is a bit of a walk at the end of the day at Disneyland.  Our room should have been ready after 3pm, which for us meant 5:30pm.  Not good with a tired 5 and 9 year old.  Rooms were nice but nothing out of the ordinary, our room has a beach theme and no microwave.  Daily room cleaning was a plus.  Registration was a bit of a nightmare.  Small front lobby with lines each time we passed by.  Parking was easy and available for $20 per day.   Pool was nice, water slide closed at 5pm, pool at 8pm and lifeguard on duty was helpful.

We spent the final two nights of our vacation here after six nights at the Grand Californian. The room was clean and comfortable. The theming charming. The staff was incredible. There was just something a little off about Paradise Pier Hotel. It didn't feel like any other Disney Hotel we have stayed at in Anaheim, Orlando, or even Paris. It felt more like an ordinary chain hotel, which I guess it was originally intended to be. We had a good time, and the parks are within walking distance. There are enough perks to make this a good choice if the Grand and Disneyland Hotel are out of inventory or out of your price range.

Although most staff we've encountered were nice and welcoming, this hotel just feels like any other hotel. Nothing too special.  No magical feeling what so ever. Room was decorated average and food at character breakfast was very average too.

Had a short 3 day stay at this property and definitely feel a bit disappointed. I had booked a premium view club level room for 2 adults and 3 kids.  The room was a tad too small to comfortably accommodate 5 guests and the decor is extremely old and tired. This hotel is in desperate need of a revamp. Unlike other Disney hotels I’ve stayed in this property lacks the spark of a Disney hotel.  The club lounge is of below average levels in terms of offerings with only the bare basics been offered.  There are all day hot and cold beverages and breakfast sees the addition of sliced fruit, bagels and cereals. The staff were excellent and the service levels are quite high  The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from either of the park entrances and had I been aware of this I would rather

We stayed here for our 20th anniversary. We honeymooned at the original Disneyland Hotel and came here 12 years ago. It is expensive but we love it. Restaurant options are limited and room service scheduled time was late. But staff gave us a nice treat. We love it here.

The hotel itself is quite nice, our room was spacious and attractive and the staff were great.  My main criticism is the long walk to the parks.  Surely they could come up with a better route or short cut for people staying here.  There are hotels outside the resort that are closer than this hotel.

Summary Heading: An easy walk to Disneyland and California Adventure
Summary: Our hotel room was wonderful.  We had a great view of California Adventure from our room.  The staff was always welcoming and full of smiles.  Unlike Walt Disney World, you do have to pay to park at Disneyland resorts.  Valet Parking is $30/day and regular parking was $20/day.  We opted for Valet parking.  The valet ended up knowing up personally within two days.  Great service.

Summary Heading: Not necessary, but great if you're going to stay on property
Summary: If you ask someone about whether or not to stay on-property at Walt Disney World, the answer is probably yes. There are a ton of perks and rewards for doing so. With Disneyland, there aren't as many perks all all, but I still think Paradise Pier is a lovely hotel for your Disneyland or Anaheim visit. The rooms are decorated with fun beach theming, and were always clean. It was easy to get whatever we needed during our stay, either from the gift shop or cafe, or the nearby Downtown Disney. Having the extra Magic hours at the parks was a nice touch.

This place always delivers.  All decked out for the holiday, love the big tree! First thing we saw walking in.  Room clean as always and nice.  No suite this time just a double room, but more than enough room to rest relax and recharge.  Staff was great as usual.  Some nice upgrades to the elevators since we last visited.  easy to get to and from the parks.  Just a great place to stay!

We stayed here for  3 nights. We had a connecting room with our grandkids. It was great. There are very few connecting rooms and they won’t guarantee them but if you get one it is great. The rooms are clean and ok in size. The rooms with a king have much more spa e than the rooms with two queen beds. We checked in around 11:15 and Mickey, Minnie and Daisy were in the lobby while we waited. Not crowded and the kids got a lot of time with them. Made our day.   You are not allowed to go through the California Grand hotel to get to the parks anymore. You need to walk through Downtown Disney or take the Monorail. It is a bit longer but a easy walk.   They have moved the security check points. You must now go through a security checkpoint to enter Downtown Disney.

The hotel was nice, but it's not on the same level as the Disneyland Hotel, or Grand California.  Very clean, service was great, convenient location (5 minute walk to Downtown Disney).  I would stay here again.  The only negative is the elevator system.  It was very slow, and they are little.  Sometimes had to wait 10 minutes just to get on.

We stayed there as a family.  We had a theme park view room, which gave us a great view of California Adventures.  The hotel is decorated in a beach theme, with surfboard motif in the elevators, etc.  The hotel is nice, but it is very noisy - the music from the various attractions at California Adventures plus the noise from the fireworks at Disneyland and the traffic on the very busy road that runs by the hotel make it difficult to sleep soundly.

Summary Heading: Average hotel but above average service.
Summary: The hotel is clean and modern but not overwhelmingly Disney.  There are some nice amenities, especially if you're "Club Level."  The service is Disney style, with a smile.  You don't really get that sense that you're at Disneyland while you're at this hotel, but at least the walk to the park is reasonable.

Paradise Pier kinda has a bad reputation as being the adopted Disney child. Not enough Disney or decor. I disagree. We are here during the holidays and the tree in the lobby is gorgeous! The room was spotless and has Disney touches everywhere. Our room has two queens and a sofa daybed and would comfortably sleep 5. The hotel is older but clean and well maintained. I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel a few weeks ago and I have enjoyed this just as much. My kids like the beach theme in the room. The walking distance is only slightly longer than the Disneyland Hotel. Great stay!

Summary Heading: Great hotel, long walk to Disneyland
Summary: The Disney Paradise Pier is a nice hotel. The staff at the front desk was very friendly and made check-in easy.  We requested a handicap accessible room and were not disappointed.  The room is large enough to maneuver an electric scooter.  The beds were comfortable and rooms were clean. You can request a room overlooking California Adventure and watch the World of Color.    The down side to staying at the Paradise Pier is the long walk to Disneyland, it takes about 15 minutes through Downtown Disney.  The price of a room here is high but it is a Disney property so you expect it.  I would definitely recommend staying here at least once.

The room was clean and comfortable, great location for getting to the park and downtown Disneyland.  Negatives, the dinner buffet we had was soo over priced and not the best but all the staff we met were all lovely. My boyfriend could not get onto the WiFi, with a Samsung, no matter what we did, worked fine on my iPhone though.

I am in a motorized scoot and we had a child in stroller, asked for convenient hotel, was dealing with Disney not a travel agent. Paradise was suggested, bigger rooms etc.  It was a pain to get an adjoining room as I had requested in June it took an argument. The rooms are MOTEL rooms not 500 a night rooms, bathrooms small, cant even crack a window a few inches to get fresh air and no fan in bathrooms so stuffy, I have asthma and it was hard to breath.  Room service breakfast, they say its 18, then it comes and for two should be 36 right? Nope its 50 minus tip with all the fees they put on. They are not clear when you check in that the early park alternates, we tried to go one morning and they said it was the other park, no one told us we missed out on that.. got stuck in one of

The only reason to stay here is because it is a Disney property hotel and it's very close to the parks.  Otherwise the rooms are fair and the price is expensive.  I compare this hotel to some of the hotel establishments on Harbor Drive.    Staff are friendly, gift shop is nice, and the walk from the hotel to the park is about ten minutes, as you have to go through Downtown Disney.  You will still need to pay about $20/day for parking, and $30 if you valet.    You used to be able to take a short cut through the Grand Californian if you were heading to the theme parks, but unfortunately due to new security you will be directed to walk through Downtown Disney.   If you are going to spend this amount of money, consider one of the nicer hotels on Harbor Drive that offers nicer

The Paradise Pier Hotel  One of the three Disney Hotels that are actually on Disney Property in Anaheim  The cast members are friendly and always willing to add a Magical touch to your visit.   Love this hotel.

My husband, my son and I just returned from a night stay.  And like the other comments, we were NOT happy we had to walk so far around now to get into the park.  We were planning on cutting through the Grand California as we could before.  Understanding that this world is a very unsafe place anymore, I understand and appreciate their security getting into Downtown Disney.  However, you'd think they would allow Paradise Pier people to show their cards to cut thru.  So, with a differently abled son, it added more stress than needed.  We chose the hotel for the convenience and closeness to Disney.  We will rethink.

Although not the best of the (currently) three Disney hotels, Paradise Pier is a good option if you want the Disney branded experience without the cost to upgrade to the Grand Californian. The hotel is clean and nicely laid out. The elevators have been upgraded since my last visit with a new system that you enter your floor number and it tells you which of the 4 elevators to get on. It is a little strange at first getting into an elevator without floor buttons inside.   The staff was friendly and efficient and the rooms easily accommodated the five adults staying. The benefit of the "Magic Hour" can prove worth it if you get there right on the dot and have a game plan for your day. I was dismayed to find that they no longer allow all Disney hotel property guests to utilize the

Paradise Pier Hotel was wonderful. The grandkids loved the pool, the outdoor movie. Gma & Gpa enjoyed the abundance of life guards, the Sandbar Lounge and the easy access to Disneyland and California Adventures.

Wanted to have the experience of staying at a Disney property so tried it last weekend and it was just okay.  The rooms were nothing special, no microwave, only one chair, not much counter space other than a desk.  The beds were comfortable but NOISY!  You couldn't move an inch without hearing it.  The rooms were quiet overall.  I did not like the elevator bank--it constantly sent us to the glass elevator which not everyone enjoys, in fact, my son had a panic attack after going on it.    I was hoping being a Disney Property it would be closer to the parks but quite frankly, we've stayed closer on Harbor Blvd.  To enter the park, you have to go behind the hotel, walk to the very back end of Downtown Disney (DD) and go thru security. Then, walk the entire length of DD to enter the

Summary Heading: Should be better for  Disney Property
Summary: I love everything Disney and I want to love this hotel but the best I can give it is 3 stars. Perhaps that is being too picky because it is clean and close to the parks. The rooms seem to be well-insulated; I never heard noise from other rooms. However...  The windows are not well-sealed. I had a room facing California Adventure and could hear every ride scream as well as every truck on the street below. Bring earplugs and you'll probabaly be ok.   The "rooftop" pool, on the 3rd floor, is pretty basic and not typical of Disney theming. Guests here have access to the Disneyland Hotel pool area which is far better but do you want to walk over there?  The bar and dining options are just standard hotel fare, with Disney prices.  In other words - boring, yet expensive.   Check - In

Summary Heading: Why stay at a Disneyland Hotel if it's not convenient?
Summary: Visiting Disneyland, the main advantage staying in one of the Disney Hotels in convenience to the park.  Stayed at the Paradise Pier for the first time, have staying a number of times at the Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian.   Paradise Pier is further from the park entrance, but across the street from the Grand California, so the convenient access is to go into the Grand Californian and enter downtown disney from there.  But now they won't let ANYONE into the Grand Californian who is not staying there.   So we had to walk way around to access the disney parks.  all of this is triggered by new security arrangements, which I can't argue with, but I certainly won't stay at the Paradise Pier again, as it is NOT convenient to the park anymore so what is the point?

We took the Disneyland Resort Express from LAX to Disneyland. The journey was about 45 minutes and the ticket was priced at US48 per pax. Do keep a look out for a green sign that says 'FlyAways, Buses, Long Distance Van', that's where you should be waiting for the express bus to Disneyland.   Check-in was a breeze and it didn't take us long to settle down in our upgraded Premium View room. The room appeared to be the same as shown on their website and came with everything needed for a comfortable stay. We had our dinner at Disney's PCH Grill which is located at the ground floor of the hotel and the service was excellent.  While it may seems that the two parks are quite close to the hotel, it actually took us 10-15 minutes walk to reach the parks. However, fret not, as you will

am not sure why I got such a nice view room but e loved it. The beds were very comfortable, had a sofa and work pull out desk. The decor was nice and very clean.
