The elevators call buttons are unique at least to me where it tells you which elevator to get on depending what floor you want.  They have a buffet restaurant that we wanted to try but did not get a chance. We did go to the quick eat restaurant/bar. the service there was not very good. I stood at the bar waiting while the employees talked with one another.  The people at the registration desk are very nice but we are spoiled by Disney World where the wait is very short. Here when the groups come in they are over whelmed. This is the farthest walk to the parks of the 3 parks but not bad about 8-10 minutes, no vans.  All

I will admit that reading some of the reviews had me questioning my decision to stay here.  I shouldn't have worried, this is a great hotel!  Every single cast member I have interacted with has been wonderful.  The room is a nice size for 3 adults.  House keeping has been well done, very clean room. Great to watch the fireworks from the pool deck.  It is a 5 minute walk from the hotel to the Disneyland Hotel.  It is a 15 minute walk from Paradise Pier Hotel to the entrance gates of both parks.  I would absolutely stay here if we return to Disneyland.

Paradise Pier is a good place to stay on property.  A bit longer of a walk than the Disneyland Hotel, but worth it.  There are restaurants on property, but be careful, they have character breakfasts that you have to book in advance, so don't think you necessarily will get in the restaurant for breakfast.  We did not.  Valet parking can be slow at times; keep that in mind when planning meals off site.  The staff are friendly and helpful, and we enjoyed our stay here.

Checked into this hotel around 1245 and were told that our room would not be ready until 4pm as that is standard check in time at this hotel. We're given room keys and told that we would receive a text when our room was ready along with the room  number. We went to lunch returned at 3pm room was not ready so We went to Disnelyland and told my two year old son that we would come back late once we had a room assigned so that he could put on his Halloween costume once the sun goes down as it was 100 degrees out. Not until 9:19pm did we get the text that our room was FINALLY ready. At this point we decided it was best to just stay in the park and not go change into our costumes. Our two year old son was not a happy guy seeing all the other kids in their costumes. Besides this issue

I have been reading reviews and find that some people did not like the walk from the hotel to the park. This hotel is perfectly placed for those who don't mind walking "more". (5-10 mins depending how fast you walk) If you are looking for an experience similar to Disney World, don't expect it. You will be disappointed. This awesome vacation offers something a little different and it's all good. We found that it was a totally different experience with different expectations. The first thing that was comical, Don't mention a comparison to Disney World. it isn't received very well and quickly stifled by staff in a very polite way. The cost was fair, food great, views were pretty, and I think the one thing that we enjoyed was the confusion created by the elevators. We appreciated

Summary Heading: A Good Place to Stay While Going to Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed here once before about 3 years ago. Since then the rooms have been updated. It is a very good place to stay. It is close by and a little more reasonable than the Disneyland Hotel or Disney's Grand California Resort. The rooms and common areas are very clean. The only issue is the distance to enter the Disneyland Parks. They have closed off some of the shortcuts that made this location one of the closest locations.

Summary Heading: Convenient, colorful and cute--best for those with kids!
Summary: The location is pretty good--a brief and very safe walk to the Disneyland Hotel end of Downtown Disney (still a trek to Disneyland and California Adventure, but convenient nonetheless; while the Grand Californian is just across the street, please know that you can no longer access the park there as a Paradise Pier guest; you must be a registered Grand Californian guest to do that).   The lobby is welcoming and fun for kids (including cute photo op with Goofy and his surfboard), and the staff was very friendly and accommodating at check-in. No complaints here about the elevators; they were no problem for us. The rooms are spacious and bright and appealing to youngsters with a retro Disney beach theme all around. I wouldn't be keen to stay here without little ones--this hotel is

This hotel was very convenient for walking to and from Disneyland. The rooms were on the larger side compared to others I have stayed in, was a very comfortable bed and pillows and very clean. The character breakfast was quite expensive but lots of great food to choose from and plenty of time with the characters, we got to see Minnie mouse, daisy duck, micky mouse and stitch. All in all a hotel and a added bonus that it was close to the park.

This year we stayed at the Paradise Pier hotel at Disneyland, unlike the Disneyland Hotel which we stayed in two years ago has less “mickey” themed decor, pretty simple but still big enough for the three is us.  I opt for a higher floor and we had the whole view of the pier in California adventure, so our room was right behind the boardwalk and we were able to watch the world of color each night they had it. Now if you are more into seeing fireworks then Disneyland hotel would be better to view that than at the Paradise Pier, we were able to hear it but were not able to see any.  It isn’t a far distance from downtown disney either from what I was told it was far but since they moved the secure checkpoint area it isn’t far at all. Laundry room was located inside the hotel which

Summary Heading: Nice room view but not convinced it's worth the price
Summary: Check-in Sept39 Check-out Oct1 2017  Room 936 and 938  -- Nice night view of the California Adventure Park water show with fireworks in the background from Disneyland. -- Comfy beds -- Room felt worn and tired -- 938 still had leftover food in it from another guest -- 936 didn't have hot water for my shower at 630am -- room service food menu was very limited: chicken breast, pizza, burger, salad... No pasta or steak -- Was told food might take up to 45 minutes to be delivered... used Uber Eats instead and got pasta delivered in 25min!  Parking  -- No elevator in self parking lot so drop everything and everyone off first before parking -- Valet couldn't find my keys for a while  Location  -- Hotel is a long walk to Disneyland/C.A. front gates -- If you have the $$$$ stay at the

My family and I booked a 4-night stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel for my birthday. The cast members there we're nice. The room was average. The beds we're not comfortable and one of the beds squeaked everytime you moved which got really annoying. The elevators are a bit confusing. Their room service menu needs to have more options. On the last night we were there my nephew found a roach, so we called the front desk who sent somebody to look at it. The man came, told us what it was, flushed it down the toilet, looked in two corners, said there was no more, and left. My sister and I didn't feel comfortable in the room so we went to the front desk and asked if they could send housekeeping back up to clean the room. They sent somebody to change the sheets. They could have acted more

Summary Heading: Out dated interiors, needs price adjustment.
Summary: Stayed here org. for our family vacation. 3 nights, was disappointed in the interior and over all conditions of the hotel and not nearly close to being worth it for what we paid as a per night cost.   The only reason we chose this. Disneyland. hotel was the pool and. water slides which they neglected to tell on booking that it has been and will be under construction.   Better hotels in the area for less money.   The staff however at reception was amazing.

Summary Heading: Decent and fun place to stay
Summary: Although the rooms and facade looked pretty old, the rooms clean and well decorated. Definitely a great place to stay for families and groups.  However, a fair bit of walking is needed to reach the parks. I would prefer to stay in the other Disney hotels which are nearer (but pricier), considering a walk after a long tiring day in the parks.

Summary Heading: Rude staff and not worth the price!
Summary: We arrived at the hotel without a hello from any of the 5 staff standing waiting for guests. No offer of help either. This place was the most expensive of all the places we stayed over the 5 weeks we were in the USA and I can tell you it wasn't any better than the 2 star places we stayed on the freeways across the country. The restaurants and bars were average and expensive with no service at all at the bar. The pool was really disappointing for a Disneyland hotel and the slide wasn't working either??? I would recommend spending the money on a really gorgeous hotel outside of Disney, the walk would be the same. By the way, the was no help with our bags on the way out either???

I attended a conference at this hotel for three days but did not stay there.  The staff were all friendly and excited to help guests.  The hotel is located across the street from California Adventure, but the walking path to get there is quite long as security blocks access through The Grand Californian Hotel.  The food was excellent.

The elevator controls are different. You select the floor and then you get a message as to which elevator to take. Easy enough but this method causes extra wait time when several people want to use the elevators at the same time. It's not as efficient as the old fashioned way. It's a great hotel but we're getting older and next time we will get a room where the monorail picks us up at the hotel and drops us off in the park. From this hotel I would guess around 1/4 to 1/2 mile to the Downtown Disney entrance, ten it's around 1/4 to 1/2 mile through Downtown Disney to get to the Disneyland entrance.

Our commute to Anaheim went much quicker than expected. We were early for check in yet staff got us checked in instantly and with an upgrade along w pool keys for DisneyLand Hotel since Paradise Pier slide was undergoing renovations. We were extremely pleased with our 2room suite, pool view, room decor and amenities! The short walk to downtown Disney and Disneyland Hotel Pools was lovely and landscaped with lush gardens, lighting and treescapes. After fun at the waterslides & pool we enjoyed wood fired pizzas via room service (delish) and caught a view of the World of Color show & Fireworks before bed. The morning breakfast dining with characters at Surf's Up restaurant was well worth the ticket price! Omelet's made to order and fresh foods were fantastic and each character

Summary Heading: Fun at The Disney Paradise Pier Hotel!
Summary: The Disney Paradise Pier Hotel is located walking distance to the Disneyland Park and California Adventure Park. We're greeted in the lobby by a big Goofy Statue holding a surfboard. Once inside the hotel, you feel the Disney magic all around you!  Check-in was a breeze. Our room was decorated in a beach theme mixed with Mickey. Cute pillows in the shape of beach balls were on the beds. A good size bathroom with a tub and shower combo. Sink and large vanity. Nice bath amenity set for your use. Out the window were views of The California Adventure Park. The hotel has a nice pool with a waterslide. A cute movie room for the kids to watch cartoons.  lovely restaurants. Self serve laundry room. Vending machines selling cold drinks and snacks. A beautiful, fully stocked gift shop

My husband has proclaimed that we will never stay at this hotel again but it really isn't as bad as all that. He's been spoiled by staying at the Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian and now that we've stayed at all 3 Disney Resort properties you can't help but note a difference between Paradise Pier and the other two.  I called it a commuter hotel because it just felt like somewhere to lay your head for the night with a touch of Disney magic. There is nothing grand about the lobby or property compared to the other hotels so you don't feel the same immersive, magical experience that you do with the other properties. And while the walk from the parks is definitely the farthest, it's only a few extra minutes past the Disneyland Hotel before you reach this hotel. But after a

Overall the room was spacious, nicely furnished, and clean--making this hotel a value for the price of a room. The location is nice with just a short walk to either park through Downtown Disney. The reason my rating is not higher is because of the hugely inconvenient elevators. The wait time for these things is longer than the lines inside the park. You select your floor and it directs you to an elevator that, more often than not, is already full by the time it actually reaches you. You would assume there are convenient stairs to utilize instead. You would be wrong. There are stairs at one end of the building that are clearly for fire use only that dump you off in the back alley behind the hotel. Not so safe for anyone at night. And most of the stay, at least one of the

Hello Everyone! So, I have stayed at the Disney Paradise Pier Hotel from 15th to 20th of September.  So, location wise, all the Disneyland resort hotels, theme parks and Downtown Disney district are very close to each other and it can be guaranteed that one will not get lost unless the person went down the wrong yellow brick road. Other than that, Grand Californian is just across the street and Disneyland hotel is just next door to Disney Paradise Pier Hotel. As what I feel, the rooms at Disney’s Paradise Pier Hotel are a bit larger than the other hotels’ rooms.  I was given room 307 which has a wonderfully spacious patio and it is lovely. I also had a club-level service room which gave me access to the Beach Comber Club. The club is open from 6.30 a.m. to 8 p.m. It is a bit of

Summary Heading: Good place to stay at Disneyland
Summary: This is within the Disneyland Park. It is the cheapest option of the three hotels there. It is a little further to walk than original Disneyland Hotel but this is not a problem. Rooms good with plenty of room. It does say you can see the fireworks and the world of colour from the rooftop. This is only partially true as you really need to be in the park to really experience it. Food is expensive but this is so everywhere in Disneyland. It has to be factored in. Still it is a good place to stay.

So it's 4 in the morning and I have been up for hours because there are trucks across the street working ALL night, workers yelling back and forth to one another, and back up beeps all night. It's been hours. We paid a good amount to stay here and what do they tell us, "we'll, you are staying across from a theme park." Rude. I could have saved money and stayed somewhere else. I've stayed at the Disneyland hotel and had a much quieter and pleasant, non rude experience. And now I hear hammering! And I'm supposed to move my 3 sleeping children at 4 in the morning? They won't ever go back to bed and how am I going to function when my alarm goes off at 7 a.m. Almost in tears. And by the way, it's a parking lot across the street not the theme park. And frankly it was quieter during

The hotel was one of 3 Disney hotels, and as the cheapest of the three was the furthest away, still only a 10-15 minute walk from downtown Disney. We were there during the Disney marathon so it was busy in the early morning. The hotel was more of a base for us, we only really used it as a sleeping point and somewhere to rest after 2 long days at Disneyland. The room was an alright size for 3 adults and had a great view of the California adventure park. I would recommend staying here but I imagine if there is a bit more magic staying at the other two Disney hotels! But still great to feel part of the Disney magic.

Stayed one night during recent trip to see my son and daughter in law.   Check-in was painless and our room was ready even though we arrived around 10:30 am.  Our parking was free as we were staying on Disney Vacation Club points.   We had a view of the pool and it looked like fun.  The room size was great for the four of us and the decor was in line with what you expect from a Disney property.  It is the farthest of the hotels from parks but the walk was not bad to the entrance of Downtown Disney.  Didn't have the time to dine on property because we were trying maximize park time.   The wait for the elevators was a little long when trying to check out but other than that there was nothing negative at all.   I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Hotel was very nice, it's Disney so it's what you expect. Check-in was good, upgraded to concierge and better room. Unfortunately didnt get moved to higher floor, stayed here before and you can watch World of Color from higher floor. Concierge room was very good. Rooms are very good and it's a good hoteI, but have stayed at most hotels at WDW and unfortunately that's my bench mark. So a very good hotel, but not a great Disney Hotel.

Summary Heading: Disney knows how to provide a great guest experience!
Summary: Staying at a Disney hotel during summer time is expensive. I like being walking distance from Downtown Disney and the 2 theme parks. Of the 3 Disney Hotels, this one is the farthest away from the gates. I think Disney should allow guests of this hotel to access Downtown Disney and the parks through the Disney Grand California adventure hotel. It would be less walking. The hotel is clean, the staff are very well trained and very friendly. They have a modern elevator system with 4 elevators. you use a touch screen to indicate what floor you are going to and it tells you which elevator of the 4 to wait for. Good idea, but sometimes there are more people waiting than can fit in the elevator. The touchscreen doesn't know how many people are in the party. Other than that, no

Summary Heading: A Great Place for a Big Group
Summary: This is a great place to stay if you have a large group and need a suite. The elevators are very efficient and it's easy to go from place to place. Our room had 2 bathrooms! A must for little kids. There was plenty of room to move around, a table to eat on, a refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot. There were plenty of towels in the room too. If something was needed, they would bring it right up. One day the cleaning lady left two little rubber duckies for my grandsons and placed our shoes in a nice row across the floor- a very sweet touch! The pool area is very clean with lots of towels. There was a little pool perfect for my grandson that was a little under two years of age (they even had swim diapers available). The older one loved their big winding slide.  It was walking

With this trip, we have stayed at all three Disney properties at Disneyland.  This hotel was once the Pan Pacific Hotel before Disney bought it.  While the public areas were clearly updated, the rooms have only been redecorated and themed.  The rooms can definitely use an update.  That said though, the rooms were comfortable.  I traveled with my husband and 18-year-old twins. We had two king beds and a pull-out daybed.  The beds were very comfortable but the carpeting was a bit thin.  The bathroom was very standard.  We did not eat at the hotel but we did have drinks at the pools and the margaritas were a bit watered down.  i am not sure I would stay here again.

Great hotel convenient nice amenities  Have stayed there five times   This past time our room had an issue and they immediately took care of it  Great place for business or families close to everything  Staff is friendly and helpful also knowledgeable on directions

We visited 4th of July, with four small children and two adults. The hotel is close to the parks, and our room was great, we had a view of the entire California Adventure park. We did not spend a whole lot of time there besides sleeping, but the two bathrooms in our room were awesome. This is not the nicest Disney hotel we have stayed in as far as amenities, the pool could use a remodel in my opinion but it's good enough for kids to enjoy themselves. Being the lowest priced hotel on property, it's the convenience factor of being close that's worthwhile. It's about a 15 min walk to the park entrance. Overall, we would return.

Room on the 12th Floor. View of pool and parking lot. Not a desirable view. Rooms were cute Beach oriented theme with stuffed beach balls on the beds, A day bed and decorum Mickey themed lamps and I liked the striped blue/green curtains.  We self parked which service was terrible. We had to haul our own luggage and bags to the front of the hotel. There is only 1 restaurant PCH Grill for breakfast and Dinner. Both were buffet type only. The weird thing. The elevators are preprogrammed from the outside key pad in Lobby designating elevator A-D to enter. It takes you only to that floor. It may have 2 other floors also in that one elevator. Elevators are very small. The second day we waited 12 minutes just to get up the elevator. Some of them were not working. In fact only one

Summary Heading: OK, but not really Dinsey-esque enough and not worth what they charge
Summary: We stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier and although it was OK, I thought it was just a regular hotel with just a few Disney touches to brand it "Disney".  It certainly was not what we were used to from Walt Disney World.  I thought the hotel was pricey for what we got.  I would place it almost at the level of a value resort. The pillows were terrible.  It felt like the foam was crumbling and the pieces were being held together by the casing.  The pool was SUPER small and unimpressive for the size of the hotel.  The water slide looked OK, although we didn't use it.  The whole property was a little underwhelming.    Although the staff were friendly enough and helpful enough for the most part, they just didn't have that Disney feel -- not bubbly and overly excited to help -- maybe

Summary Heading: Good location for the parks but that is all.
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two nights, so we would be close to the parks, and so we could take advantage of the extra magic hours for Disney hotel guests. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, advising on which restaurants they would recommend. Check in started off easily enough, and the young lady checking us in, told us we had been given a complimentary room upgrade, so our room would be facing the parks and we would be able to see the fireworks from there. This was a lovely touch, but it didn't last. We went up to our room to find it did not face the parks, but the noisy hotel pool. When I queried this at reception, she went into the back office, then returned to tell me that there had been a mistake on the computer and we we not getting the complimentary upgrade,

Overall, our stay was great at the end of July for 4 nights with the family. Hours after checking in, my mom had an issue and needed a nurse and they sent one up quickly. The concierge arrived first within minutes, and then the nurse followed and helped her out. They called a taxi which took her to Kaiser for additional assistance. We appreciated the attentiveness and the fact there was a nurse on-call.  The rooms were very clean, and the beds were soft. We had an adjoining room with other family members. The Club level was nice to have breakfast every morning and snacks and beer in the evening.  The pool area had a nice selection of drinks. The bartenders were very nice. Drinks were a little pricey, but that s expected. They were strong and did not skimp on the alcohol.  I

While the hotel had every IT issue possible while we were there, the cast members were all amazing.  I recommend paying for the upgraded club experience.  It was nice to be able to get snacks, soda, juice, and even wine prior and after being at the park.  Nice sized rooms and very clean.  Elevators are a hassle around opening and closing of the parks.

This was the first time we decided to stay "on property" while visiting Disneyland. The convenience of the hotel (able to walk to the parks - about 15 min) was a real advantage. The room was clean and comfortable, but nothing fancy. We did get a view of the fireworks at night - a nice perk. Used the pool once - slide was fun, but not enough shade and pool deck was HOT! Our daughter loved the nightly buffet (macaroni and cheese). Parking behind hotel was adequate and easy to use at checkout to load luggage. Front desk was helpful in aiding us to find a location nearby to ship purchases to home. The gift shop was well stocked and was convenient for last minute purchases. We have stayed at many Disney properties (in Florida) and I would put this at the same level as one of the

Whilst the room was comfortable it didnt warrant the $880 US per night price. Restuarant was average and onsite facilities were out of order or empty. Swimming pool was ordinary and no where near as good as the Disneyland Hotel. Was expecting alot more from a disneyland resort hotel and will be looking elsewhere next time.

We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel before and always liked it, but now we have a new favorite. The view from the room was a stunning view of California Adventure. The room theme is fun and the room size was good. The desk staff were helpful.

Came hoping for a magical experience at Disneyland so decided to stay at one of the Disneyland resort hotels. From the moment we pulled in, the doorman made no effort at a welcome, just said valet was under construction so would have to pull car around the back. My daughter was super excited to be finally arriving at Disney, front desk agent did not even acknowledge her, just asked for name and credit card, he was fake, rehearsed and uncaring, made me feel like I was just another number. Hotel is dated and looks like it was built in 1955 and not much has changed. Room was old,but clean. Had noise issue in early hours, room had connecting door and walls were thin, could hear guests next door. Staff with the exception of valet seem not happy in their jobs and treated us like we

The staff was excellent, the view was beautiful, and the convenience was ideal. The room was inviting and clean, and we could enjoy fireworks from the hotel window. We were even able to get character photos in the lobby. It was perfect for our quick trip to Disney. We could walk to the park and Downtown, and all our other needs were close by. Some downsides were the lack of an elevator in the parking deck (from what we could tell), lousy choice in television channels (if you came for the tv), and the restaurant hours did not work for our needs. All in all, it is a nice little Disney location.

Summary Heading: For Disney it was just okay
Summary: We have stayed at a number of Disney hotels now and Paradise Pier was okay. Nothing flash to report on, other than the location to Downtown Disney and the parks are good.  Having nothing really exciting to review, there isn't to many positives to rave about. The negative of our stay however though, was our room was not what I would have classed as clean. The floors had clearly not been vacuumed or the bathroom floor wiped down, as there were still hair balls from previous people scattered around the bathroom. Whilst we certainly will stay at Disney hotels again, as we love the experience it gives you, Paradise Pier won't be the one we choose to stay with again.

Have stayed here many times... If you're willing to walk just a bit further to the parks than the other two hotels offer, then it's a better deal price-wise, for sure!  Didn't get a very Disney welcome at check-in. Was lukewarm at best ...despite flying across the USA with kids and being quite excited ourselves at check-in!  Rooms are OK -the theming is cool though --love the beach ball pillows...  Valet parking can be confusing as they accept your car in the back of the hotel and then randomly return it to either the front or the back with no notice unless you tell them otherwise....

The first hotel I stayed at whilst in USA, it was okay. For a Disney Hotel, there wasn't too much Disney overload (Depending on what you like, this could be a good or a bad thing). It is a bit out-dated and probably in need of a spruce up. But overall, I had everything I needed.

Pricey hotel, great rooms. We had a view of California adventure, which was pretty cool. The location is everything with this hotel. It was an easy walk through downtown Disney to the parks. Very safe area. The pool was meh, it was very crowded and a little small. Overall it was very nice, but expensive.

We went as a family and was our second time staying here.  We love this hotel, the kids love the waterslide and pools and we spent a whole day just hanging out there.  Love that it's so close and walking distance.  Rooms were very clean as well.  Would definitely stay again!

Summary Heading: Club Level at Disney's Pardise Pier
Summary: Stayed for 4 nights at Disney's Paradise Pier in a theme park view, club level room.  We checked in around noon and our room was not ready but we were able to sit in the club level lounge and enjoy some snacks and Disney movies while we waited.  We had been given our keys at check-in so when we got the "your room is ready" text we were able to go straight to our room.  Our room was clean and comfortable with some nice Disney touches.  We had an amazing view of California Adventure Park.  We loved the elevator system where you touch what floor you are going to on a screen and it then tells you which elevator to get in.  We thought it was very efficient.  The parks were a bit of a walk from Paradise Pier.  Wondering why they have not come up with a tram system for resort guests?

We stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel.  It was an average hotel and it was further from the Disney Parks than I expected.  The room we stayed in had 2 queen beds and a pull out twin which was perfect for us.  We did enjoy the perks of staying at a Disney Hotel of being able to get into the parks early, which was nice because Guardians of the Galaxy had just opened and we were able to go on the ride twice in the matter of a couple of hours.  We have also stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel which is much closer to the parks, but much more expensive.  It you want the Disney experience at a little better price this is the place to go.  You could see the fireworks from Disneyland from the balcony of the hotel and the World of Color, but you could not hear the music from the World of

Stayed here for the first time and will not again. The hotel is dated and dirty. The pool has very limited food options and the elevator system is inconvenient. We did the character breakfast since we were staying on property and would rate the service, food and cleanliness as poor. We love Disney and frequent their properties and cruises but this hotel does not meet the Disney standard.  I realize it's the most affordable Disney hotel in Anaheim but the actual cost is not reflective of the experience. We do enjoy the extra magic hour so we will try one of the other two Disney properties next time. We stayed at Disneyland Hotel several years ago and it was great.

Summary Heading: Moderate Disney theming - Not a moderate priced hotel
Summary: This was our 2nd time stay here.  We booked 3 nights immediately after D23 Expo so that we had closer proximity to the parks & Downtown Disney, and got the early entry hour benefit.  Unlike the WDW hotels that have value, moderate, and deluxe options, there's only one option out here - deluxe.  Paradise Pier is the least expensive of the 3 hotels and the least themed.  We did receive an upgraded view (though with two double beds instead of a king) that looked out over California Adventure which was nice to watch both day & night.  The room was spacious, with a desk and sofa. We did use the pool once, though if there was an adults only area we didn't find it. We didn't do any onsite dining although the dinner buffet actually sounded like a decent deal.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed being near the park but it is 3 star service for 5 star rates
Summary: We stayed in club level room. The room was nice.  The club level services were minimal with no view from the club room. The food was the same as at the park and even the kids would not eat the hamburgers. The pool area needs work and there is limited food service at the pool as well and not fare that most would eat.

Summary Heading: Worth it for the extra hour!
Summary: We had a wonderful 6 night stay in June with the family. We chose paradise pier as it was the cheapest of the Disney hotels and we wanted the magic morning/ extra hour at the parks. The room were large, clean and quiet with a fridge, so we stocked up on breakfast goodies and saved some $$'s. It's about a 15 minute walk to the parks via downtown Disney, we had been under the impression that we could enter via the grand Californian hotel- but when we arrived that wasn't the case. Only downside was the size of the pool, every afternoon it was absolutely packed with kids taking a break from the park.

We stayed here for three nights in July and spent one day in Disneyland and one day in California Adventure. we were greeted by a friendly bellhop who helped us bring our bags to our rooms. The room we reserved was 2 queen size beds and had lots of space. There was even a pull out couch, but we didn't need it. The room was clean with plenty of towels. The pool was great with a little water slide that the kids loved. We ate breakfast at the Surfside Lounge each morning. It's a great location and only about a 15 minutes walk to lots of restaurants in Downtown Disney and then another ten to the parks. We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: Just about every Disney hotel employee is great so that is a given. We had a great view of California Adventures. I wish there was an easier way to get into the parks rather than the walk behind the resort and over to Downtown Disney then walk thru the entire Downtown Disney or take the Monorail to Disneyland, I am not sure why guest of this hotel were not allowed direct access to the park entrance in the Grand Californian right across the street. The pool area could have been a little bigger as well, but understand that land is scarce in that area. But all in all we had a great time.

Paradise Pier Hotel has been a hotel I've frequented dozens of times over the last decade. It is a hotel with some basic conveniences and nice touches when visiting Disneyland.  Yes, it is the furthest walk to the parks than any of the three, but really no further than some of the hotels on Harbor Blvd.  Aside from the pleasant and cheerful beach-themed decorations, and rooms overlooking California Adventure, the real two advantages of staying on this property comes down to: Lowest Cost and Extra Magic Hour.  It's possible to ride two of the biggest, newest rides during Extra Magic Hour and if you're trying to do and see it all in the shortest amount of time, this is essential.  Paradise Pier has a really great management team and it shows. The upkeep and service at the hotel is

Went for a wedding and loved area.  Hotel was very busy, but elevators were pretty fast.  Check in went very fast and parking was expensive, but really close.  Easy walk to the parks and lots of good good close.  Security was very tight

We stayed for 4 nights to spend 3 days at Disneyland and California Adventure with our two children (ages 3 and 6) and my parents (the grandparents).  We really enjoyed staying at this hotel and would recommend it to any family traveling to Disneyland.  We were greeted by helpful baggage handlers and front desk staff.  The rooms are very spacious and clean.  There were two double beds and a pull out couch, and a refrigerator in the room.  The bathroom is spacious too.  We enjoyed the pool and water slide, and there were lifeguards on duty.  It is very easy to walk from the hotel down a path to the security entrance, and then you just walk through Downtown Disney and end in a plaza with the entrances to both parks (Disneyland and California Adventure).  You never have to enter

The hotel is very nice, with bright, clean rooms with cheerful beach touches.  The staff was accommodating, but I had a package I needed shipped and they told me incorrectly that no hotel on property could ship it - The Grand Californian was able to ship it with no issues.  The major flaw is that you are no longer allowed to cross the street and enter the parks thru the Grand Californian.  When you cross the street, you are questioned by guards as to why you are going to Grand Californian - you are allowed in to eat.  If it's a security issue, then why not just do a bag check instead of questioning people.  If it's so non-Disney staying guests cannot enter the parks thru the hotel, then just put up a sign and have the security guards ask for room keys, but having guards question

Summary Heading: Amazing staff and Club level stuff
Summary: Me and my wife and her family love the Disney Paradise Pier all the staff was amazing they were nice to us they made our experience magical and they also in the club level made our experience amazing and taking the time to get to know us and our families. I know it's a little pricey but it's an experience that's magical I would highly recommend the Paradise Pier to all my friends and the club level.

Summary Heading: Nice Disney Hotel!! Magic Hour is so worth it!
Summary: The hotel was our last stop in our California trip.  We stayed 3 nights.  Our teens loved it!!  From the moment you arrive, you know you have arrived in Disney.  The bell hops greeted us and were very helpful.  There was a life-size Goofy statue in the lobby.  I had requested a room with a daybed and we were given one.  The room is beach themed with adorable, beach ball pillows, Mickey Mouse lamps and decor.  It was very clean.  There's a coffee maker, refrigerator and safe in the room.  Laundry facility on-site was a huge amenity.  The pool, hot tub and water slide were great.  There's a restaurant with an amazing buffet.  The kids enjoyed the arcade too.  We so enjoyed our stay here, and would have liked to stay longer!!  Take advantage of the Magic Hours offered to hotel

Great hotel for children, a bit over priced. Breakfast with Mickey and friends is well worth the money we spent, our grandson loved it! The large buffet for breakfast and dinner was great very convenient when your in a hurry to get to the parks. The rooms are kid friendly. The pool area is ok, the spa outside is small too many people go init. When we got there the water was brownish! Yuk. Next time we will look for a hotel outside the park with free suttle service and bigger pools.

I have to say this was my first time booking a Disneyland resort vacation. I read so many mixed reviews for the Paradise Pier Hotel. Well, I have to say it was awesome! We stayed from June 17-22, 2017. Check in was painless. Our room was ready just before noon. Without question, we were upgraded to a view of Disney's California Adventure. That in itself was amazing and we didn't expect that to happen. The room was a good size for a family of 5. Other reviews state how outdated this location is and that it's worn down and what not. I will say it was nice, clean, comfy beds, nice Disney touches inside the rooms, water pressure was not a problem, nothing was broken, and each night we got back to a clean room, made bed...falling asleep to the lights of DCA...it was relaxing! There

We stayed at Paradise Pier in June 2017 for 4 nights. The theming for the hotel was fun. They played a lot of Beach Boys music. Check in was quick and easy with a very friendly cast member. My biggest complaint is the elevator system. There are 4 elevators. You push the button for the floor you want & it assigns you an elevator. The only trouble is, most of the time the elevator you are assigned is already full, and sometimes it takes as many as 4 tries to get on one. The rooms were nice and clean, and fairly large. The pool area was nice with plenty of room and a nice water slide. You could also watch the DL fireworks from the pool deck with piped in music. We chose this hotel because it was is Disney owned, and because it is directly across the street from California

Summary Heading: A hotel limping along from the 1980s...
Summary: Don't get me wrong, compared to the other hotels near the Disney parks, this is pretty nice. However, this hotel has had several superficial remodels which haven't dampened the 1980's "Howard Johnson" charm that we all remember from our childhoods. Everything in the lobby was clean and well maintained, but the rooms are in need of modernization and maintenance. For example, our room on this trip was "okay", but had obvious water damage in the bathroom near the shower/tub. The wall had buckled and it appeared that the maintenance staff had gone to town with the caulking guns in order to fill the gaps. The result was artistic but generally unappealing. For the price, you'd expect a fully modern, clean and well-maintained hotel. In this hotel's case, it missed the mark.

We arrived at the Disney resort at 10 A.M., we weren't sure if we would have been able to check in since we were early. Rooms were ready and we were able to upgrade to a room with a view.  Grand daughters had a great time looking out at Disney California Adventure. The pool and hot tub were great diversion in the middle of the day, they enjoyed the fireworks from the pool deck and enjoyed watching the world of color from out room on the 11th floor. We ate breakfast with the characters one morning, the only downside was the price we paid for breakfast, $150.00 is kind of steep (4 people, 2 adults 2 kids) for breakfast since they didn't have a good selection of items to choose from. Was within walking distance to Downtown Disney and the parks. The cost of parking should be

True Disney quality at this hotel on the grounds.  Very clean, comfortable beds, great service, good size room, nice outdoor pool area, small lounge area with great drink and food options, very nice gift shop, all in walking distance to Downtown Disney and the 2 parks.

Stayed here 3 nights with my son enjoyed every moment of it. Shuttle from John Wayne airport was a deal 20 one way 30 return trip no cost for my son. Check in was fast and efficient. Was pleasantly surprised that DVC members don't have to pay the $20 day parking however Alamo car rental share their parking lot so I got my car for the day and did not need to use my membership parking for the day. The hotel staff was on their A game and the store and restaurants on property was up to par. We had buffet dinner at the resturant down stairs had coffee and dessert at mini bar also. Enjoyed my 10% discount at all location because of my DVC membership. Downtown Disney and both parks was st our back door. We watched the firework both nights on pool deck of the hotel. Side note rented car

This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. The location is great if you want to be close to Disneyland. The staff are amazing, the rooms are fantastic and well set out. The only thing that lets this Hotel down (same thing on both stays) is the restaurant.  We were taken to our table by the lovely lady at the desk (Carla) and told to wait for our waitress then we could help ourselves to the buffet. After waiting 15 minutes we were hungry (it was 8.15pm and we had a child with us). We were never served at all for the whole night so went without drinks.  Would of thought maybe a discount on our meal or a voucher but there was nothing offered.  This is our second visit and the same thing happened last time too. So definitely stay at the hotel but use restaurants out of

Summary Heading: High quality hotel walking distance to Downtown Disney and the parks
Summary: High quality accommodation. Comfortable beds. Excellent exercise room. Nice pool. Very helpful staff. 1/4 mile from Downtown Disney entrance at the far end from the theme parks.  About 1/2 mile to the theme parks entrance ares.

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel, not so for access to the Parks.
Summary: We had 12 lovely days using the Paradise Pier as our home base, to explore the entire Disneyland & Resorts. We have stayed here and at the Grand Californian before, so felt quite at home. Firstly the in house dining, as well as room service there is conveniently downstairs the Disney's PCH Grill(Pacific Coast Highway),they have character breakfasts and buffet dinners. They currently have the "Beach Side Bonfire Dinner", we had dinner later (no characters) and there was no waiting to be seated, the restaurant was not busy, the buffet was well stocked with a variety of choices, sodas, coffee and hot chocolate are included nice! For the quick eats there is the Surfside Lounge in the lobby. The have Disney Characters in the Lobby around 11:00 to 11:30, great for kids and photos with

It's truly a paradise pier feel.  Disney hits a home run here.  Great kids club. Great gym. Great pool  Great waterslide  Great rooms Great staff   The elevators were a little confusing at first but I got them Down.  Be ready to pay for parking and take your time finding a spot.

We stayed at paradise pier hotel Disney for 2 nights and found it very clean and tidy. The room had awesome views of the park and had plenty of room The hotel is close to Disneyland, approx 5 minute walk. Staff were friendly and helpful

Summary Heading: Disney hotel nearest Disney California Adventure, with Goofy as greeter
Summary: I love my birthday cause I get to choose what we do and Glen's a great sport, so this year it was Disneyland and DCA (Disney California Adventure). Staying at Paradise Pier hotel gets us into the park and hour early.

Thoroughly loved this hotel. We had a great view of California Adventure and the rooms were a good size. Easy access to the parks. Love that there's a coffee shop right down stairs. Thank you Beckie at the Front Desk for making check in such a breeze. It was a treat for my family. Once a Disney fan always a Disney fan. Thanks for making it so special. It was my home away from home. Enjoyed our breakfast at Surfs Up. Change of pace from the Plaza Inn character breakfast.

The hotel is centrally located and reasonably priced. There are non-Disney hotels in the area that are cheaper, but you do get a few extra benefits staying on property that were worth it for us in the end. Our daughter loved it and we thought the walk to Downtown Disney and the Parks was very easy. Next trip we will definitely stay here again. The rooms were clean and well put together; the staff was professional and courteous; the pool was fun for our 5-year old.

We stayed here for our first Disneyland vacation. It was awesome! A very short 5 minute walk to the parks and our window had a view of the pool, which has a small kids wading pool,a big slide, a regular pool and a hot tub with a bar.  The elevators were a bit confusing at first but we figured it out. The only complaint I had was the beach ball pillows on the bed were strictly off limits. They informed us the pillows are $40 each so if they get dirty we'd be responsible for replacing them, we jyst placed them in the top shelf of the closet before the kids could play with them.

Summary Heading: Not The Greatest Place On Earth
Summary: Our experience from the start was bad. When we arrived in our shuttle, there were no Bellman/Porter there to greet us or offer to take our luggage. I went inside to the guests services desk and again received no friendly welcome and when I asked if there was someone available to help us to bring in our luggage he just fobbed me off with " he is probably parking someones car". No offer to help from him and so I went back outside to wait for this mysterious absent porter. Still did not show after 10 mins so we proceeded inside with our bags ourselves where again no offer to help whatsoever. Finally got to front desk to book in and told them of the issue, but gave a poor apology and nothing else said or done. The rooms look like they date back to the 80's and everything is cartoon

We arrived at about 2am and the man at the front desk was extremely friendly and made the check in process a breeze.  Our room was on the 13th floor,  with a view of a parking lot but views aren't important to us. The room was clean, big, beds comfortable, lots of room for our luggage. It also had a mini fridge. We ordered room service one night and it delivered quickly. Quick walk to the parks is convenient with a small child.   Elevators get packed fast and you may have to wait a few minutes for one but it wasn't a deal breaker for us.   We would stay here again.

This is considered a value resort at Disneyland, but if this resort was at Walt Disney World it would be considered a moderate or maybe even a deluxe. This hotel is the furthest walking distance away from Downtown Disney as well as the park entrances, but it truly does not matter because it still is not that far away. I would recommend upgrading to club level too. It is a lovely resort, it is truly a great value (which does not come often at Disney).

Great Hotel, good views and friendly staff. The Character Dining for breakfast if you have kids is a 100% must. The only thing missing was a bit of evening adult facilities ... they had a little Bar, but it want cozy and it was difficult to relax in... felt more like a cafe. The rooms are amazing and we'll kitted out. Had a really good time and the kids loved it!!

The BEST part about this hotel is the view. You can watch fireworks and World of Color from the room! It was AMAZING. We went for Christmas and I honestly loved every second of our stay. Would definitely would stay again if I could afford it again! Haha

Summary Heading: All of the Disney resort 'perks', with a little less sticker shock
Summary: Having had the privilege of staying at several Disney resort properties in Florida and California, this was my first stay at the Paradise Pier.  Although this hotel is billed as the 'newest ' of the 3 onsite resorts, it appears that it is not the 'newest' in true age...as compared to it's sister resorts.  That said...you get all of the amenities of staying at either of the closer, higher-end properties and a much better value.  The hotel staff were above average, and made our stay very enjoyable.  We paid just a little extra and had a fantasmic view of the California Adventure park, which we greatly enjoyed.  We stood at our room window the night we checked in, and watched the California Adventure Park 'World of Color' show while listening to the music simulcast over our room

We loved staying here with our two children aged 10/11.  We upgraded to the club level which gave us an amazing view of California Adventure Park as well as access to the club lounge.  This provides a light breakfast, snacks and non-alcoholic drinks throughout the day, drinks and canapés in the evening and dessert.  The staff were super helpful and friendly.  Our room had two double beds and a sofa bed.  You can watch the fireworks from the pool deck and they have a water slide as well.  It's a short walk to Downtown Disney and park entrances.  Staying at the hotel also gives you early access to the park as well.  I wouldn't recommend the PCH Grill though - we went to the night buffet which was really expensive and a very basic selection of food.  The cafe downstairs does

We splurged for the concierge level for 2 of our 3 nights. It was not available the 1st night. Standard room was on 8th floor and was nice. No view of anything spectacular. Our concierge room was on a high floor overlooking Disney Adventure Park. Perfect views of Mickey's Color Wheel and Radiator Springs. Concierge level provided us with a continental breakfast, mid-day snacks, evening appetizers, and free printing of our boarding passes. There were some instances that they ran out of food (chocolate chip cookies), especially late afternoon. We liked the ability to walk to each park and Downtown Disney. Room was large. We enjoyed the evening treats delivered to our room. Pool was average. Only 1 hot tub that was full of people. Either room is nice. Be sure to get park view and

Summary Heading: Character Breakfast was a wonderful experience.
Summary: We did not stay here but we had both the Disney Character Breakfast and a dinner at the Paradise Pier Grill. If you are gong to experience the Disney parks and want your children to interact with the Disney characters then I cannot recommend enough the Character Breakfast. It is well worth the price. We were able to get pictures and autographs with Mickey Mouse, Minnie Mouse, Daisy Duck and Stitch. Each came to our table, interacted with the kids, and were amazing with the youngest who at first was scared but then after a few minutes loved it. Every 30 minutes there is music and dancing on the dance floor with the characters. There is a meet and greet photo op with Mickey when you first enter. Then there is the breakfast buffet which is varied and delicious. We have several

This is the least of the expensive hotels a block from the entry to Downtown Disney. There was nothing special about this hotel other than a spectacular view over California Adventure. Parking however was easy vs the huge hassle we encounter trying to get into a Disney parking 2 weeks ago.

At first I was very apprehensive reading all the reviews prior to my family of 4 arriving at Disney Pier Hotel. BUT I was pleasantly surprised our stay was fantastic. We had a One Bedroom Suite with Park View and Concierge Level Access.  The room was great very clean and spacious for 2 adults and 2 children. The servicing of the room was attentive and always did a great job daily.  The fact that the hotel offers a laundry where you can wash and dry clothes is genius. This is one of the best ideas that any hotel can offer.   The lifts were no issue at all for us, we were positioned on the 12th Floor and always found the lifts quite quick.  The food and beverages in the Concierge level were more than enough for the daily snacks and morning breakfast required. the only fault is

We loved our stay at Disney's Paradise Pier; there was a couple of glitches though.  The elevator was one of them - however we had 7 people with us and we often heard people stating things like -"I want to go in elevator "D" so I click several floors until I think I am going to get "D" and then I go", also spent time helping others understand how they work.  Possible Solution would be that they just bite the bullet and hire an elevator operator for high traffic time ( it might take 2 of them).  Then you would walk up to them on the Lobby level and they would enter what floor you want.  I think this would help immensely.  Second problem and last problem was that I am have disability and when booking I specifically asked about the monorail and was assured it would be up and

Summary Heading: From a Disney fan - stay somewhere else
Summary: There are a lot of differing opinions about this hotel, so I had to try it for myself. The price is high for what you get. Many of the old benefits are gone - not only can you not use the Grand Californian entrance to the park, but you can't even enter the Grand Californian from the front at all! You need to go through the DTD entrance, which means a walk and going through security with the masses.   Room was clean and pleasant, but some flaws. No balconies, which wasn't a surprise. The thing that bugged me is that the windows didn't open! I dislike being hermetically sealed in a room. Plus, the hook to hang a towel in the bathroom clearly broke off, and the hole in the door was spackled closed without replacing the hook.   Boring pool, but fireworks viewing is great.   I have

Fantastic hotel. Staff very friendly.  Has a refrigerator but no microwave. Great pool and hot tub.  Only 5 minute walk to Downtown Disney. Very kid friendly. Gift shop and restaurant.  Room service available.

My friend and I stayed at this hotel during the Tinkerbell Half Marathon weekend. The rooms are vintage Disney inspired and well maintained. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and courteous-especially the housekeeping staff. The hotel has a pool with waterslide, a kiddie pool and a sauna. They also show Disney movies on the pool terrace. The hotel also has a great restaurant and café. We enjoyed this stay so much we will most likely go back for the half marathon weekend next year.

My husband and I stayed here for a few days in May. We finally wanted to try the Disneyland Hotel experience. Other than some Disneyland characters in the Hotel and early access to the parks,  there was no other Disney Perks. Perhaps if we would have had kids with us it might have been different. This hotel is OLD and the rooms definitely need updating. Wallpaper coming off the walls, no closet (just a bureau), restaurants close early and the bathrooms are dated, vent didn't work. Every time we took a shower and turned the hot water up the wall shook like it was going to explode. They did have a nice pool with water slides for kids though. I would not recommend this to couples without kids for the amount of money that you have to pay to stay there. It's possibly a little bit

First time at Disneyland... 5 year anniversary trip... not the caliber of hotel I would expect from Disney. We're toughing it out for the rest of our stay but we won't be coming back to this property. It's tired... very tired and worn out. Not what I expected. Lesson learned: upgrade to another hotel.  Definitely not how we wanted to spend our special vacation. :-(

I am going to review the concierge "club" level and room service.  We stayed on the club level about 1 1/2 years ago and had a wonderful experience.  So we decided to do it again... complete waste of money!  We went for afternoon snacks. There was trail mix, chips, cookies and some fruit. I can not have gluten so there was really nothing for me to eat. I took a banana and ate in downtown disney.    The hot appetizers were also a disappointment. It was race weekend so it was all carbs.  There was  a good selection of cheese and veggies but I wish that was at least one more protein.  Last time,  we didn't even need dinner because we ate so many of the hot appetizers!    We asked if we could play games.  The last time we stayed there was a closet filled with games.  We had a drink

We spent a few days at a near-by non-Disney property and a few days at this property.  Spend the extra money and stay at the Disney property.  The extra time in the park alone make it worth it.  The customer service is WAY beyond the neighbor hotels as is the overall quality.

This was my first time staying at a Disney Los Angeles hotel. I have stayed at Walt Disney World Hotels. The service was good. The hotel was clean. The only thing I would recommend is that the property needs a remodel. Rooms are a little outdated and look like the years have gone by. I stayed in room 1017. This room faces the pool and parking lot. The Mickey lamp on the media table was missing his nose. All the plugs were hidden to charge phones. Bathroom wallpaper has a few stains from use. Media table had a few corners in the rear bottom section missing. You get the point IT needs a Remodel!!!   The hotel is about a 15 min walk to the main entrance of the parks. Its not that bad if you are in good shape. Problem is when you spend an entire day on your feet walking back is

Was our first trip to Disneyland! Naturally we had to stay at a resort hotel. Wouldn't trade it for anything! Loved the breakfast buffet! Got to meet Mickey,Minnie,Daisy,Goofy,and Stitch! The rooms were nice! Staff was great! And took full advantage of magic hour! Going back again and can't wait!

i stayed at the disney paradise pier hotel for a DECA competition and i allowed my room to be cleaned by a maid, of course i left my jewerly behind because i was not going to wear it all. i left it on the desk next to my bed and when i got back it was not there. the only person who had access to my room was my maid. $10,000 gone, and the hotel does not care.  i left 4 messages for lost and found and the claims department and no one got back to me so i asked to speak to a manager and she did not do anything about the situation neither. i should be remburst for my jewerly because it is not my fault, but the hotel claims it was mine and theres nothing they can do. please, do not let the maids in your room or make sure to take all of your belongs every where you go,.

This stay was wonderful from check-in to check-out! The hotel staff was wonderful to work with as I was there with a large group of kids for a conference. The hotel and it's grounds were immaculate, beautiful and cheerful! I loved the beach ball bed pillows! Our view was of the pool so of course that was great! We will definitely stay here again!

Fun family getaway! Did 2 day park hopper and spent all of it at Disneyland. Downtown Disney was great for shopping and late night dinners. Plenty of variety and options for the whole family. Activities and entertainment were great as well.

Stayed here for 4 nights, 2 adults and 1 child. Originally wanted to stay at the Grand Californian but they were doing renovations at the time. The paradise pier is comfortable  and the rooms fairy spacious. Initially I was concerned to stay there given the reviews on here but it was fine! Check in could have been disastrous as we arrived at 0900hrs from a 14 hour flight only to be told that the room may not be ready until 3pm...but it was ready and the staff at reception were excellent. A nice stroll through downtown Disneyland to get to the theme parks was good. If staying at the grand Californian, you can walk straight through but those folks may not have seen all of downtown Disneyland like we did :)  The restaurant meal was nice and had a lot of variety. The lifts were

I recently booked 10 rooms for a student group with the assurance that all of the rooms would be on one floor.  However after arriving at the hotel I was told 3 student rooms were assigned to a different floor. When I requested to change the rooms to the same floor, I was told it wasn't possible.  My concern was that two of the three rooms had connecting doors and were booked for female students. After receiving a curt no from the front desk supervisor, I requested to move one of my chaperone rooms down to that floor and move one of my females rooms up.  Again: NO Room or Key Changes along with a smug attitude--No magic there.  Customers staying in this hotel should ask if there are student groups in the hotel during their stay.  The hotel intermingled several hundred high

Summary Heading: Celebration of retirement and wedding anniversary
Summary: My husband and I and my daughter and son in law visited and had a great time. Loved our connecting rooms and views.  Rooms were perfect, clean, and we'll designed.  Will definitely stay here again.  Pool and poolbar was definitely grest. Great service. Lots of fun. Great view for  fireworks.    Nice restaurants available on site.

Summary Heading: Would go back in a heartbeat !!!
Summary: This is the least expensive Disney hotel at Disneyland so I expect the other 2 might be better but we were very satisfied here.  The theming is very light and the elevator system was ridiculously inefficient but we spent very little time at the hotel and used the stairs.  The room was nice, clean and large enough for us.  The staff was very nice.  The character breakfast (Surf's up) was really good, with a lot of character time and a great atmosphere.  The pool area was clean and the slide was a lot of fun.  Not a whole lot of food options at the hotel but downtown Disney is so close by that I don't see any reason to complain about this.  Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Lower cost fun hotel but noisy!
Summary: We have stayed at the Grand Californian before but friends had good reviews if the Pier so we decided to try it for 3 nights during Spring Break.   The rate was reasonable and the room was comfy, clean and accommodating for our clan. Kids also loved the pool and water slide (go in the afternoon when there's more sun). Parking was easy, and walk to Downtown Disney was 5 minutes.   We did the character breakfast too, so fun! Portions are big at the cafe, so order light.  Tips: - You're not able to cross the street and short cut through the Grand anymore. Tightened security. You must go through downtown Disney. Buy your park tickets at hotel so you can jump on the monorail. Note: You can come home that way though.  - Park strollers are collected at the Grand CA. Better to bring

This hotel is on the bottom tier of Disney hotels. Needs to be updated and there are some maintenance issues. Loud room noise when showers from other rooms are running. Loud water pipe banging sound. Notified front desk. Furniture showing wear. TVs didn't work properly. Elevators are slow and have this weird floor selection method where you select your floor on a screen in the lobby and then are told which car to get on. So once in, you're stuck unless you get off on a floor it's programmed to go to. TV in lounge has extremely, non-relaxing buzzing sound coming from the TV. Notified staff.   Breakfast is a great place to meet characters and food is good. Lounge is a good place for s nightcap, if you sit far away from the buzzing sound.   As always, service from staff is superb.

Summary Heading: Not close enough to the parks to warrant paying the premium for this Disneyland resort
Summary: I've stayed at the other two resorts at Disneyland.  This was our first time at Paradise Pier.  The hotel itself is definitely a step down from the other two resorts.  And, it's a long walk to the parks!  As long, if not longer, than when I've stayed at one of the hotels outside of the park.  Grand Californian is the way to go in my opinion - 2nd choice Disneyland Hotel - 3rd choice I'd rather than stay outside the park than at Paradise Pier (especially if it is true that they won't let you use the Grand Californian entrance like some reviewers said - we were told sometimes they enforce the rule and sometimes they don't and didn't have a problem using that entrance - although there was no line when we used it).

Summary Heading: You'll love it ... Don't sweat the small stuff.
Summary: I read all the reviews on here prior to traveling.  Don't sweat the small stuff ... Your trip will be great.  Elevators:  We never waited for an elevator more than 3 minutes.  Taking stairs isn't an option except for the 1st to 2nd floor.    Check-in:  Matthew was awesome.  Found us the best room available.    Concierge Level:  Pur room was on the third floor with a patio to the pool level.  It was so convenient for afternoon pool trips, firework viewing and movie night.  The longe breakfast and snacks made our kids happy and kept our budget down.  We would eat one large meal at the park or in the vicinity once a day and then eats snacks from the longe.  Pickle popcorn and cake pops are awesome.  Walking:  Its not that much farther to go through Downtown Disney to get to the

Actually a very nice hotel.  Very roomy and their premium view rooms have great views.  Good is terrific and reasonable in the lounge/bar in the lobby. But..I thought it was really tacky not to let guests of the paradise pier hotel enter California adventures through the grand California hotel entrance.  After all, they are both Disney resorts.  It made us feel like second class guests even though we were paying $1000.00 per night for two rooms.  As far as I'm concerned, there's really no point to staying here right across from California adventures if we have to walk all the way around to the end of downtown Disney ( an extra 1/4 mile) to get in to Disneyland.  I might as well stay at a non -Disney property.

Friendly staff and Club lounge exceeded expectations.  Kids loved the heated pool, spa and slide.  Room service menu very limited, buffet good but a bit expensive. Even though the Paradise Pier is far from luxury, we would have been quite happy had it not been for security at the Grand Californian Hotel forbidding us from accessing Disneyland or California Adventure park via their entrance.  Paradise Pier guests must walk an extra 10 min to the theme parks compared to Grand Californian guests.  Being rejected was embarrassing and gave us a sense that we were at a lower class hotel and not worthy of the promoted Disney hotel benefits. This goes against the Paradise Pier website which says - with valid theme park admission, enter and re-enter Disney California Adventure Park using

We were very impressed by the Paradise Pier.  We've stayed at quite a few Walt Disney World on property hotels and weren't sure what to expect since it was the least expensive of the options at Disneyland.  While it was a weekend stay during Spring Break, our check-in was very quick and easy.  The room was larger and better appointed than we expected.  My son was thrilled that a pullout couch existed in the room, providing additional space.  Our room was upgraded from a standard view to one overlooking California Adventure, enabling us to watch their World of Color show from our room.  None of the common areas ever felt crowded.  And while their quick service breakfast options weren't extensive, they were adequate.  (Highly recommend the breakfast burrito).  We also very much

While I firmly believe that Disneyland resorts are considerably over-priced, The room was nice inline with 3-4star accommodations. The location and access to park and food is excellent.  The early entry to the parks well unbeatable if used effectively.  Service is very good. Hotel food was better than most of what is in the parks.

Very quiet for such a kid heavy place. The staff is over the top friendly and helpful. We were very happy with the stay. We do prefer The Grand Californian but this works very well as a substitute. Can't say much about the food since we only ate once late night but that was good.

This hotel is run down and depressing. We stayed here because the hotel we booked (Disneyland grand hotel) told us five days before we arrived that the pool was under construction. We moved to the Pier and it was disappointing. It is not at all magical. Rooms are tired. Facilities are less nice than the other Disney hotels. The coffee shop espresso bar had a broken espresso machine. In all - just not the way we expected. Its really loud (Disney park and street noise) and they make tons of noise emptying garbage etc. in the middle of the night. Just not nice in any respect.

The hotel was clean and nice.  We stayed in the 2 queen bed room.  It was a nice surprise to have the couch flip to a twin bed also.  Room was a good size.  Loved all the Disney touches my kids loved finding the hidden Mickey's through the hotel.  We had a Park view which was very fun.  Pool area was nice and clean.  It was perfect having the early entry at the the parks with staying at a Disney hotel.   Room had a fridge but no microwave which we wished it would have had. We wished that there was more perks to staying at a Disney hotel like maybe a discount on purchases and food in the parks.  Also it would be nice if there was a private entrance to California Adventure like the Grand has.  After days of walking it is a little far to go all the way through Downtown Disney and

Summary Heading: Super room, super view, super fun!
Summary: We stayed at PPH for 3 nights, and we couldn't have been happier with our accommodations. The proximity to Downtown Disney, and to Disneyland makes this hotel the perfect option for those who want to stay on the Disneyland property without breaking the bank.  We ordered room service, which arrived hot and tasty and right on time. To deliver such a wonderful meal during such a busy time was very impressive. The hotel was at maximum capacity yet it never felt overly crowded or noisy. Our room was very quiet and had a lovely view of the pool, parking area and city lights. We were also impressed with how comfortable the beds, linens and pillows were. Housekeeping did a fantastic job as well.  Another wonderful feature of this property is the self parking option, which was an added

This hotel is the cheapest of Disney's on property hotels. The rooms are very cute and comfortable. The pool is on the third floor and you can view the fireworks near the pool area. However, everyday we were there the fireworks were canceled. Also, the pool closes really early in my opinion. It's only open until 8 pm. The slide closes earlier, I believe around 5 or 6. The walk to the parks isn't too long if you cut through the Grand Californian hotel, however, they don't tell you about that shortcut and we discovered it our last day. If walking is a bit more difficult for you, I would definitely recommend staying at the Grand Californian instead, as this hotel has its own private entrance to California Adventure and is not a long walk to the monorail. If you are on a tighter

Summary Heading: Great stay that exceeded our expectations
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a full week in March-April and had a fantastic time. The hotel is very clean and the service from the front desk attendants and bell desk workers was exceptional. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning our room every day. The kids enjoyed playing in the pool. There were plenty of fresh towels at the pool and we also appreciated that they had free swim diapers. The pool isn't huge but it was never too crowded for us. Our toddler loved the baby pool. We had a view of California Adventure park and could see some of the World of Color show at night. The guest laundry room was handy and they have a 24-hour fitness center. The only downside of the hotel is the walk through Downtown Disney to the park. If you want to arrive at the park right when it opens,

My family loves staying here! Recently stayed for the first leg of our Disney trip, celebrating my son's seventh birthday. They had birthday pins and balloons when we checked in. The new elevator system is definitely an upgrade from what they had before. Since this was always our biggest issue, I was curious to see if this new system would help. It's always busy around certain times so just understand that, plan for it, and it won't be a big deal.  I will admit it's a bummer to not be able to walk through the Grand Californian anymore.  However, I don't understand the people complaining about the distance it takes to get to the park. You're going to literally be walking miles all day! What's 10 minutes? They can't shuttle you to the front gate .The walk is beautiful! Much better

Summary Heading: Extra Magic Morning Makes Paradise Pier Worth the Cost!
Summary: This was our second visit to Paradise Pier and we were not disappointed. The worst thing about the hotel is how long the walk is to the park entrances. Even the walk to the monorail is a bit of a stretch. We've stayed at a lower quality hotel across the street from the park and that walk was quick and easy. That said, the trade off for getting into the park an hour early is so worth it.   Extra Magic Mornings are different than Magic Mornings, so look into that!   We arrived before 1 pm and was told our room on the 7th floor was ready. When I requested a lower level, we were given one....and it was ready too! Great experience with check in.

We visited Disneyland and California Adventure over Spring Break. We thought it would be more convenient and more fun to stay "on the property" and selected the Paradise Pier Hotel. The room was spotless and the maid service was attentive and prompt. We had a room that faced the parking lot but we had a nice big window so lots of sunshine. The curtains are heavy and create total darkness when you want it, which is great.The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were spacious. The pool had a lifeguard on duty from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. and again, plenty of towels and attentive service. The pool is not huge but there are plenty of areas for guests to relax in comfortable lounge chairs and lots of towels. There's a slide for children of all ages who wish to go on it. There's a snack

Summary Heading: In depth review of the Paradise Pier Hotel
Summary: Staying on property is a valuable asset in Orlando, but in Anaheim, the value isn’t so obvious.  You have to look at why you want to stay on property and make your decision from there.  In addition, you have to see which hotel of the three on-property hotels matches your needs and budget.  The following comments, in no particular order, are based on my opinion of the value in each category specifically for the Paradise Pier Hotel.    Disney immersion/Hotel Atmosphere: This hotel is the least “Disney” of the three.  I believe they did a fair job in adding Disney touches such as Disney-themed lamps, pictures, and small items like the shower curtains.   The background sound of beach tunes isn’t Disney, but it fits the hotel’s beach theme.  The waves on the roofline are pretty cool

This was our first time staying at this resort hotel, and all I can say is WOW! Super friendly staff, as our room was not quite ready upon arrival. We received a text message from the front desk within 15 minutes, and our room was spotless. We upgraded to the "premium park view room" and we were definitely not disappointed. We had a wonderful view of the World of Color show in California Adventure as well as the nightly firework display. We stayed during a pricing special, which helped since this resort can be pricey (although cheaper then the Disney Hotel or Grand Californian).

Summary Heading: Another great family vacation at Disneyland
Summary: Clean hotel with friendly staff and excellent customer service.  Location is great for being able to walk across the street and enter the park through the California Grand Hotel, or through downtown Disney.

We were here about 10 months ago and my gosh the changes. The elevators are refurbished and now they are programmed. You just cannot take any elevator now, they are assigned and it doesn't seem all that efficient. We are using the stairs in the morning to get out as the upper floors fill the elevators. We were on the 7th floor, go figure?   Also, room keys didn't work on all the doors. I wound up with 4 keys personally to open the laundry, ice machine, my room, and I do not know what the 4 the was for.   Oversized car parking is easier at the lot next to the hotel, forget trying to get a spot close to the hotel.  FYI, new security rules! You could cut through the Californian to the park before. No more. Only guests are allowed on premises! Even if you are staying at a Disney

Summary Heading: March stay at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel
Summary: The remodel of this hotel was very nice!  The rooms were a great size, clean and very comfortable.  We got adjoining rooms as requested and loved that feature.  The staff was very accommodating.  Disney always tries to please when it comes to their resort hotels. My grandchildren loved the pool and water slide.  There were complimentary life jackets and plenty of clean dry towels.

This hotel is in proximity to downtown Disney and Disneyland itself. Rooms and meals are quite expensive for what you get. The food is not fresh or quality.
