The alcoholic beverage are also not mixed well and over priced. This hotel clearly takes advantage of tourists . The cleaning service does not clean you room until late afternoon . I would not recommend this place for a business stay and furthermore should a family want to come to Disneyland there are probably other places you can stay for the same amount of money and get far more bang for your buck.

If a view is important to you then this hotel has the best. We were on a high floor and had the perfect view of World of Colour and a good view of the fireworks. With the soundtrack on the tv its like your own private show and that alone makes it good value to go for the Theme Park view room. We were worried about the elevators, having heard they were a problem, but the new system worked perfectly for us. The kids loved the beach ball pillows and the bright, fun room.   All of that said, it definitely felt a bit shabby and in need of an update in places, and the service wasn't as good as at the other disney hotels. We'd just stayed at the Disneyland Hotel prior to this stay, and the staff there were amazing and made us feel so welcome.

Summary Heading: Meh- you are paying for the Disney name...
Summary: We are annual pass holders who rarely stay on property because I think mainly it's a rip off but for whatever reason this hotel was close in cost to some of my favorite local hotels so we booked it (I love trying new hotels).   Pros:   It is walkable to Disneyland which is a huge benefit. The pool might be fun for some.  The room was comfortable and clean though somewhat worn.  I guess the conciege/food service might be good (didn't get it) but it seems like you'd have to be at the hotel a lot to benefit and we like to be at the park.  The Magic Hour could be good and in general getting to the park really early is the best thing for avoiding crowds.   Cons -Apparently you used to be able to enter via the Grand Californian but this recently changed.  That would have been a huge

Summary Heading: Decent hotel but very few good perks (i.e. long walk)
Summary: They make you walk back and around a parking lot now to get to downtown Disney.  Which feels very unwelcoming, as a security guard makes sure you don't pass thru the Grand California Hotel (GCH) now.  You are still paying a premium but it's a lot less convenient.  Rooms are comfortable and clean but there isn't much of a benefit on staying at a Disney resort unless you stay at the GCH now.  We probably won't stay again at one of these resorts.

We enjoyed how spacious our room was.  It was clean and comfortable.  The beds were the best ever! We were on the 7th floor overlooking the pool.  The bathroom was clean and spacious as well.  We made use of both the fridge and coffeemaker in the room. This hotel is a short walk to Downtown Disney and the Parks.  Would definitely recommend it and return again.

We made our first visit to Disneyland and chose to stay at Paradise Pier based on our long history of staying at Disney resorts. We arrived and we're promptly greeted and the check in couldn't have been easier. There are 4 elevators that take you to your room, you simply punch in your floor and it tells you to go to A, B,C or D. This groups people together on close floors and speeds up the elevators greatly. We loved this feature. There's also a kids area to watch cartoons and a Goofy statue near the lobby. There is an on site restaurant that features a character breakfast. They have a pool, hot tub and small slide but it's unremarkable for a Disney property. We had 6 so we had a corner suite. The beds were fine, the pull out sofa not so great. We did have a nice view of

Just stayed here recently for my 18th birthday with my mom and friend. It is located conveniently to both parks and Downtown Disney which made it super easy for getting around. The room was nice and clean and was themed well. We also had a theme park view room which gave an amazing different look at the parks, especially at night. Would definitely recommend especially if you want to stay on property and be close to everything.

Staff was excellent, but of course, it's DISNEY!   Character Breakfast at this location....EXCELLENT.  make reservation early.   Rooms were Clean & nice.   Its a mid range hotel...but has all that you really need with Downtown Disney and the Parks w/in walking distance.  I would stay here again.

Spent a day here with my friend and her nephews, and I have to say that for a Disney property, we were underwhelmed. The room was just average, pool area - very average. No food or drink service, at least this time of year, and food on property was pretty average. Main advantage of staying here is the monorail directly into the park, but that was broken, and it was a longer walk to the park than you'd have from many non-Disney hotels, and no discount offered. Disappointing.

Summary Heading: Wow what a nice resort for a great price
Summary: We have stayed at Disneyland hotel before and loved it but the Paradise Pier was even nicer. We were out of session for the pool and it rained two day we were there once really hard but it all made up for by the hotel for the rain. The beds were so soft and we had the option for a pull out day bed too! The decor was so nice California beachy with that special touch of Disneyland magic! The bathroom was very clean and even had a laundry haper for our wet towels which was so much nicer than having to step on wet towels or around them on the bathroom floor. The soaps and shampoo smelled great and there was separate ones for the bathroom verse the sink! Oh and the closest was huge and had extra blankets and pillows which is big plus cause I like a nice stack of pillow to sleep on

How can Disney approve of this?   After having stayed at the Grand Californian and the Disneyland Hotel, I expected a similar level of Disney hospitality for over $300 per night.   Boy was I wrong!  The one bright spot was 1 very hard-working bellman who was the only one who seemed to understand what Disney service is supposed to be like.   The beds were saggy and uncomfortable and the shower barely had water pressure.  I am beginning to understand why my S. Cal. friends have started staying in non-Disney accommodations around the park.   It's not worth the money if you don't get the Disney experience!    The location is not that great to justify the price when there are tons of non-Disney affordable places that also offer the magic hour and are just as close.

The rooms are small, but the the place is well kept and the staff is nice. The walk is a bit of a distance to the parks, but not that bad for adults. i imagine it might seem a long way for a youngster, or if pushing a stroller. I get the complaints about the size vs price. But you are really paying for the extra hour in the park. As long as Disney provides the extra hour for hotel guests, I'll overpay for the room. We rode the Cars Land ride twice before the normal opening time.  We did not eat in the hotel, so I can't help there. And our kids felt too old for the crowd in the pool, so we did not try that either.  Recap: Clean room in well kept area with nice staff and early entry to the parks.

Summary Heading: Overpriced and long walk to park... save your money and stay offsite
Summary: We decided to splurge and stay at one of the resort hotels, but don't make our mistake. We were disappointed by the Paradise Pier hotel for the following reasons:  1. It was a long walk all the way through Downtown Disney to get to the entrance to the parks -- no shuttle, no monorail (except midway through Downtown Disney to Tomorrowland) 2. The Extra Magic Hour was only for California Adventure for the 2 days of our stay, and the rides that we wanted to go on in Cars land were not operating and we could not even get Fast Passes, so not sure the Extra Magic Hour was helpful.  3. The pool was small, and the slide was not very special - my kids went on it twice and they were done.  4. The hotel itself is run down: peeling wallpaper, the toilet ran and ran, and the AC had a faint

Summary Heading: Quick: 3 good and 3 not so good points
Summary: I don't normally spend so much on a hotel room, but all my life I've wanted to stay at a Disney hotel and decided to do so for my kids' birthday.  Places like the Hyatt and Hilton were half the price.    Good #1:  Loved the tv room for kids.  When you've traveled a long ways to here, having something to entertain the kids while you check in (or relax) is a bonus.  Parents, you know what I mean?  Not So Good #1:  Staying at this hotel didn't provide any benefit to getting into the park without having to walk all the way around through Downtown Disney.  In the past, you could just go through the Disney Grand Californian Hotel.  Walking at least a mile to get to Disneyland with three kids under 3 was not fun.  Plus, you had to unload all your stuff each time so security could go

Summary Heading: Great for Location, still a little Pricey for the Size
Summary: Let's start with the positive: Beds were comfy, the views are all great, the location is convenient, the staff is excellent, the rooms are clean and the room keys are cool, elevators are unique (and would be nice if someone taught most how to use them because we ran into a lot of people that we had to teach). I even liked that you didn't have to go to the front desk to check out. It's all you would hope for a $200-$250 a night hotel. However, being $400+ a night I expected a bit more.  There was a day bed/Couch which was awesome, but one chair. If you are people that enjoy eating at your room, ask for more chairs. People LIVE off their devices and there are hardly any plug ins. Those that were in our room did their service, but a couple were very loose.   The room is not very

But we already had paid for our Disney Park Package, so we went anyway - AND LOVED IT!  The staff was friendly, the room clean and pretty.  We had a gorgeous view of CA Adventure Park.  The bed was comfy, there were enough hidden mouse ears around to be fun.  We could leave our room and walk to either park in 10 minutes.  We used room service for breakfast one morning, and it was great, and more food than we could eat, and not too pricey for room service.  It was quiet.  I would stay here again without hesitation!

Summary Heading: A little less expensive, but no less of a stay
Summary: There are two other on property places to stay in Disneyland, but we chose this one because of the price. It doesn't make sense to me to stay in a really expensive hotel room when you are going to spend 3/4 + of your day at the park. It was very clean, safe, a short walk to the parks. There were four of us in the room. It was nice to have a convertible couch, although we never used it. While we did not use the pool (too cold) it looked nice.   We grabbed coffee and muffins from the food area right off the lobby. The coffee was acceptable and the muffins were really good. I advise getting coffee in the hotel as the line for the Starbucks in Downtown Disney was always very long. The line in the hotel was always short.  The staff were helpful and the facilities were always clean. I

Used this for 2 nights en-route to Vegas. Booked in to a 2 double bed room or twin room as it was classed. Hotel was rather quiet for the time of year however there was plenty ongoing. Pool was being cleaned so cannot comment on it although it looked fun for kids. Directly linked to the parks via a short walk. Food was okay as we were booked in through their executive club and had a continental breakfast which was adequate.   Staff were very friendly and although we used this a stop for a couple of nights I would happily stay for a week with kids.  Please email me if you have any questions.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, still a bit of a walk
Summary: Hotel was close to Disneyland, about a 10 min walk through Downtown Disney to access either Disneyland or California Adventure Park.  My daughter (22) and I (48) stayed here as we thought it would be close to Disneyland.  The hotel is dated and tired looking. I think it would be great if you had little kids as it was very much themed for young kids.  The lifts are so slow and cramped.  It takes a while to get up to your room especially at night when everyone else is trying to get back to their rooms at the same time.  We had club access which was fairly ordinary.  Was great to get a cool drink or a quick snack.  The breakfast was cereal, bagels and cold eggs.   As I said if you had little kids its probably ok, but for someone used to a bit of luxury it really was quite ordinary.

First of all, let me state that I am writing this review as a business traveler.  No 4 year old in tow trying to find Mickey or a magic princess. This property is in a great location if you are here for a convention.  It's a very easy walk to the convention center, and if it's raining (yes, it does rain here) the cab ride is short and cheap. There are also several restaurants within a short walk, as well as a market where you can get everything from fresh fruit to a bottle of whiskey. Downtown Disney is also close, about a 5 minute walk.  Lots of dining options there as well as souvenir shops to bring something back for the family. The property itself is fairly well updated, and like all of the Disney hotels, the service is great.  Front desk, concierge, bartenders - everyone is

We stayed at this resort February 27 to March 3 and received the most pixie dust we've ever witnessed! Our experience started with a wonderful upgrade to the Newport Suite to help us celebrate our wedding (February 28th) - we didn't book our wedding with Disney so this wasn't a tradeoff of any kind. Dalton was the cast member that assisted us at the front desk and he was very friendly and compassionate. We loved the room, of course, and used the suite to its fullest potential by entertaining friends after our wedding ceremony (something we wouldn't have been able to do in a standard room.) We ate at the Surfside Lounge one morning and the cast members were incredibly bubbly and charismatic. The breakfast burrito and croissant sandwiches were large portions and a great value.

Stayed the night here to celebrate at the Napa Rose (across the street at the California Grand) and visit California Adventure the next day.  We did not take advantage of any of the amenities, so this review covers the room only.  Room was clean and very comfortable.  This was our first time staying at this Disney hotel and while not as wonderful as the CA Adventure or the Disneyland Hotel, it was a pleasant stay and very convenient.  We bought our park tickets at the desk, so that saved us time.

I checked the rating before I booked What a disappointment this hotel is First one of the perks of staying at a Disney property is the access to parks No way they did not advertise but the magic pathway is no longer available  You are directed to walk around to the start of downtown Disney which is a further walk than those staying at a cheaper hotel But first let me say when I got off the bus with my 4 yr old granddaughter  The bellman looked at me and walked away  I struggled with ours things until I asked for a trolley and was told they cannot lend it out So I said then can someone please help me  I thought seeing someone checking in who is struggling with luggage they would help but hell no Then the mildew in the bathroom the holes and repairs ongoing in the hallways and the

I feel bad writing a bad review about anything Disney. We go to Disneyland often and always stay at the Disneyland or Grand hotel. The only hotel available was the Paradise so we tried it. for the money we paid compared to Disneyland or Grand California just not worth it. I paid just about the same as the disneyland hotel. The room is cute with beach theme. Out of our window we couldn't tell if it was raining or sunny, our room backed up against a concrete walls with tall plants behind it, literally no view at all not even a parking lot. The bathroom was generic absolutely nothing special all about it. The other hotels have the Disney magic in the facet shapes, the mirror everything. The room i think is smaller than the Disneyland hotel too. The breakfast buffett was our

We stayed @ this property Feb 3 to the 5th. Excellent Hotel with all the amenities needed. Room very clean. Bed was very comfortable. The Hotel is in the park. Therefore, very easy to go in and out of the Park. The grounds are well kept and clean. Lobby area very nice. Concierge level very convenient.

We usually stay at the Grand Californian, but due to construction they were unable to accommodate. That place is 5 stars all the way. This beach themed Embassy suites is an embarrassment to Disney family lodging! I don't mind paying the already ridiculous pricing for the their premium hotels, but this feels like a motel 6 that goofy decorated. They don't get a total 1 star because they are still very professional and tried their best for polish this turd of a hotel. We originally booked a king with a sleeper sofa but Were forced to upgrad to a room with a view (to get the king bed we already had and could not accommodate) of the world of color and the fire works. There were no fire works and the world of color was being rebuilt. So thanks for that. We were upsold to the

Late review: we stayed at this hotel with my family, included my 80 yrs old grandma. Nice hotel inside Disneyland, easy access to downtown and the parks. The rooms were clean and beautiful. We relaxed one day at the pool and even we visited the tiki bar. Service was excellent, we had a memorable stay so everybody went back home very happy...

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier was the perfect place to stay for our family trip to Disneyland....
Summary: We recently stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel at Disneyland for our kids' first trip to the Magic Kingdom. Was it pricey? Yes.  Was it worth the splurge? Yes, most definitely! After reading TONS of Disney blogs, asking friends and co-workers and reading travel books, we decided that the pros of staying at a Disney property far outweighed the extra costs say compared to staying at a ton of other hotels nearby. After running the numbers, we decided to go with a combo ticket+hotel package from Costco. This package also included a booklet that included photo package coupons, a coupon for a discount meal at ESPN Zone in downtown Disney, and a discount card to several eateries in downtown Disney. We also got lanyards, Disney pins and luggage tags as part of the package. We arrived at

So far not so good.  Had a nice 5 hour drive in the rain from Las Vegas.  Arrived at 310pm as the website says rooms available after 3.  Well it's nearly 4 and I'm sitting on a bench awaiting a text that says my room is ready.  We were told it would be ready by 4.  TIC TOC...

Great Hotel. As everything Disney this is just another great adventure. It is surfer themed which my husband loved since he is a surfer.  They have everything there so there is no need to travel anywhere restaurants, shopping, bars, movies and much more. From the second you walk into the hotel you are treated with the courtesy that Disney has to offer. They have character dining for the little ones and more elegant dining for a romantic getaway.

It had everything I expected.  Disney characters, large windows, 2 queen beds, and a sofa sleeper, Small refrigerator, free Wifi, TV with  many channels.   Bathroom very clean, room very clean.  View from standard room, parking lot, but, I was not there to look out of the window.  Housekeeping personnel always cleaned the room and remade the beds.  Finally most important reason, easy access to the Magic Kingdom and California Adventure.  Will be back in 2017, I purchased an Annual Pass.

Spent three nights at the Paradise Pier Hotel, staff were very good and Michael at the Surfs Up Bar was just a gem!! For the amount of time we were at the hotel I would highly recommend this for a family

Great access to the parks. We arrived early and they managed to secure a room two hours prior to the normal check in time which was welcome. My daughter loved the character breakfast in the hotel's surfs up restaurant. We also made use of the hotel's washer and dryer. The hotel was also kind enough to extend our check out time to an hour later. We did not get to view the fireworks as it was cancelled due to the weather. Other than that, it was a fine stay.

Hotel room was clean and relatively modern. Obviously the price is much higher than it should be - but your paying for location. Parking is easy. Nice enough pool. Food at the hotel is very limited and very expensive. $1.99 for a banana and $3 for coffee. But the ability just to walk to the park and without waiting for a shuttle or whatever is really nice. So I say bring food and stay there if you're at Disney. Plus the magic hour is very much worth it.   I had a hard time choosing which Disney hotel. I didn't go in the other two hotels. At the time I booked Disney hotel and grand spa were both about 50% more expensive. From a location standpoint there isn't that much distance between Disney hotel and paradise pier. Yes pier is farther but negligible for the extra cost. grand

Summary Heading: Disappointed with overall hotel, lacking the 'Disney Magic'
Summary: We were not very impressed with Paradise Pier. For starters, the parking garage isn't connected to the hotel, and it has no elevators. We did a lot of schlepping to get into our room. Also, we were surprised there is no front-door shuttle service to the parks. Downtown Disney is nearby, but getting there and then getting to the monorail to actually enter Disneyland is burdensome. We were traveling with a sweet little old grandma who does not walk swiftly, and she was very tired out every day. The pool's waterslide closes early--at 5:30 p.m., so we never got to use it. Also, the "heated" pool was frigid, and we were forced to cram into an overcrowded hot tub to warm up. Our room was just OK, not many Disney touches. While we appreciated the modernity of the automated elevators,

After leaving a bracelet behind, They found it snd have mailed it to is.  We are grateful for their support and integrity to satisfy our request.   their reputation as a disney resort is reassuring.  I will recommend this resort.  Sll information provided by reception snd bell hosts were great!

This was the 1st time staying at Paradise Pier!  We did not know what to expect, we have stayed at Disneyland Hotel and Grand Californian on the property but I gotta tell ya... We will most definitely be returning to Paradise Pier on our next visit to D-land.  The room was very nice, beds were ultra comfortable, the hotel is quiet and we were fortunate to have a nice view of California Adventure across the street.  The walk to the park was not that long of a walk as you walk through Downtown Disney, just a pleasant experience all around.

We usually stay at the Disney Hotels when we go to WDW, so we thought it would be good to get the full Disney experience at Disneyland.  We liked the idea that we could easily walk to DCA through the Grand California and try the other Disney hotel restaurants/bars.  We usaully visit other resorts when we are at WDW to eat and see the theming.  We were really disappointed on the first day when Disney put a security person in front of the GC Hotel and forced us to walk around through Downtown Disney to access anything in the GC.  We had a short conversation with the Security person and said we wanted to go to a restaurant in the hotel, but he would not budge even though we were right in front of the hotel.  The reason was we needed to go through a security check.  I was wondering

We enjoyed our stay at the Paradise Pier hotel very much. It is a shorter walk to the parks and Downtown Disney than other good neighbor hotels on Harbor Boulevard, and the extras included for Disney hotel guests made the trip more special. We were able to enter the park early for the magical hour and received discounts and offers for photos, shopping, etc.   The hotel itself is well kept and the staff are friendly and helpful. The view from our room was fantastic! Paradise Pier and Cars Land were lit up at night and it was beautiful. The hotel provides a breakfast delivery service--you fill out the menu provided in your room, check a delivery time, and hang the menu on your doorknob before midnight.   There is a pool with a water slide and a jacuzzi, but we were much too

I stayed with a mentally challenged young adult for 5 nights to visit Disneyland.  I choose this hotel because of the price and the rooms looked kid invinting. The hotel staff is very friendly, but room  is lacking Disney magic.  We paid additional for a room with a view of California Adventure, but the room has a view of the road and limited view of the park, not exactly how it was advertised.  We had a handicapped room with roll in shower and that was great, but one night there was an evacuation and we ccould not evacuate due to having a wheelchair.  Thankfully it was not a real emergency but had it been we could not manage the stairwell from the 6th floor. Hotel staff did not have a clear cut procedure for evacuating a wheelchair guest.  They say they do now because of us.

We stayed here for part of our honeymoon. We had never stayed at a Disney resort In California before. And it was such a cute hotel and room. We chose this hotel because we love the beach and it was a very beachy hotel. It was a bit of a walk to Disneyland but we were prepared to walk anyways. I would definatley stay here again. The only thing we were upset about was on our last night we had found out there was another place in the hotel besides the character breakfast to eat at! But regardless we ate breakfast there on the last day and it was the best breakfast we have ever had. We could even watch the World Of Color from our room.

Summary Heading: Not as good as it used to be
Summary: We have stayed here several times and I still think it's great value for money, and pay for a room with a view. However, for me location is important and this hotel id the farthest from the parks. Previously you could cut through the Grand Californian to get to the parks, but with the new security checkpoints, this is no longer the case. The walk isn't too bad, but not as convenient. There are checkpoints for hotel guests, but they were letting anyone through any checkpoint. Also the monorail was extremely busy with wait times of 20 to 30 minutes. You can walk back to PPH through the Grand Californian. The other thing I noticed is the hotel is showing it's age and the bathroom is looking dated and not so clean.  The bathroon has no fan in it, which I had not not noticed before,

Summary Heading: Good Value - easy walk to the parks
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  It's about a 7 minute walk from the gates to Disney and California Adventure Parks.  You walk through the Disney shopping area - so, nice to grab breakfast or a snack on your way to/from the hotel.  Rooms were clean and pleasant - nothing special, but hey, you're there for the parks right?  Had a safe for your valuables, TV, etc...  Staff was very helpful.  You're paying for the proximity to the park - we enjoyed it and would definitely stay there again if in the area.  They have a nice looking pool area (we did not use it) outside.  Try to stay on a high floor for a nice view.  The only negative comment we have is that it seemed to take forever to get an elevator - probably because everyone leaves at the same time in the morning!

Summary Heading: Best Value of the Disneyland Hotels ... Need a High Room
Summary: We stayed 3 nights in the Paradise Pier Hotel in Disneyland in Dec 2016.  Firstly for context we have stayed in both the Grand Californian and Disneyland Hotel many times before.  The hotel is a bit back from the parks/Downtown.  Which I thought might be a pain to walk, but in practice it's only about 10min more when you walk through the Gand Californian. The hotel is admitedly showing its age, but the room was large and the two queen beds, bathroom etc all good.  I suggest 3+ stars, rather than 4 or 5 star.  We had a room facing DCA park on the 8th floor which was nice and honestly a MUST as the road noise from out the front is loud.  The 6 lanes are loud enough to hear inside the room, although quiet.  On a low floor it must be uncomfortably loud.  All in all 7/10.  Having

Summary Heading: Not a Disney experience - MUST READ to decide if this is for you
Summary: Not a true Disney experience - I am actually surprised that Disney owns this property. If you are OK with the price tag for what feels like and functions like a Holiday Inn Express with Disney shower curtains, then you won't have an issue.  However, if you are expecting even the tiniest bit of Disney, whether it's service or safety, this is not it. I'll start off with the safety issue: the water in the shower goes from cold to scolding hot randomly, similar to old plumbing in houses when a toilet is flushed. We called management and they sent someone up who put in a new shower head, but that did not fix the problem. Because of this, we were unable to take showers and had to take baths.  When we arrived, the valet was not very welcoming. As the first impression of your vacation

Summary Heading: The least pricey hotel in Disneyland still more than others in the area but it's worth it.
Summary: So here is the scoop, Disneyland as a whole is not cheap. In the last twenty years they have invested a great deal improving the resort area and the walking areas surrounding the parks. You could easily book a room of one of the cheaper hotels in Harbor Blvd and get your Disney Tickets for the park and save perhaps hundreds of dollars in the process. I've done that before but the experience does not compare to the one of staying at one of the three Disney hotels within the property.  For one, the cleanliness of the rooms and overall place is light-years away from the other hotels. Secondly, you get some perks like early entry to the parks, character breakfasts (a must if you have small children) and you can ride the monorail into the park on your way there. The staff at the

Summary Heading: Loved our stay, first time trying concierge level.
Summary: We stayed her with our toddler during the holidays and loved the hotel. The christmas tree was beautifully decorated and every time my daughter saw it she was excited. I would recommend asking if concierge level is available during your stay. It was worth it to have snacks and drinks during the day and to take into the park. This park is a short walk to downtown disney. We loved all of our stay and would come back again.  The pool was clean and warm even on a cool december afternoon. I brought my own swim diapers but thought it was great they offered them for free out by the pool if you needed them.

Not a fancy hotel, but beds were very comfortable, room was very clean, all staff were great!  Buffet was a little expensive if you are not a big eater but they did have a good selection of food.  They do have a small menu at the bar - food was good.  I would highly recommend this hotel - we had a room with two queen beds and a day bed.  Has a view of California Adventure - awesome show done at the park.  Short 10 minute walk to downtown Disney.

This is a decent place, comparable to a Holiday Inn. The beds were fairly comfortable and our room was quiet. It is the closest hotel to the Disney parks, but was still quite a walk. The staff were wonderful. They helped us have a great time. This is the least expensive of the three hotels, and gave us a great Disney experience.

Summary Heading: The best choice for a family trip to Disneyland
Summary: Our experience at Paradise Pier was great. Upon arrival, the suite was ready pretty fast to receive us. We arrived early so our suite was not ready but the staff was welcoming and helpful. Our suite had an amazing view of California Adventure and enjoyed it on every morning and night before going to sleep. Both rooms were clean and as expected. Not too huge but with enough room for us. Is a well maintained facility. The walk to the parks is pleasant but a little bit risky if you have small children because you need to cross a heavily trafficked street, Disneyland Dr. It was super easy to leave the park and go back to rest during the day then head back to the park later. We enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Awful Concierge Service and Totally Disorganized
Summary: Don't waste your money staying at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel!!! We have stayed on Disneyland properties many times and almost always stay with concierge service. We like the convince of having food available and assistance in getting tickets and service, but this property doesn't understand what service is. We had booked 3 rooms for our family and non of us had a pleasant experience. Several times when we asked for help we were told by the concierge staff member that they couldn't help us and we needed to go to the front desk. What's the point of paying for concierge service since I could have walked down to the front desk by myself. The food was the exact same for all 4 days that we stayed there, without any variety. When we wanted adult beverages it was difficult to get a

We came down on a slow part of the year and it was raining. Got a great deal and was upgraded to a Signature Suite. The room is fantastic, although there is a whiff of Axe body spray and BO when you walk in the door. The room is huge with a great tv system to entertain the kids (so many ABC/Disney channels, nothing else). Large table and a bar/kitchen area. No stove or toaster. Can sleep 6; bedroom has king and pullout, tv area has a pullout.  Also has a lock off. If I had a big family, this would be worth it. Walk to the park. Eat in the room (See my review of PCH Grill) and you may off set the higher cost of the room. Have your stuff delivered back to the room and get a Magic Morning too! Tough to swallow the bill and it's always packed....suck it up, it's worth it.   Hints:

I go to Disney a lot and I have stayed in many hotels.  I have got to say that this is my favorite.  The service is impeccable, the rooms are clean and the convenience is incomparable.  We had a club level room and it was so worth it.  Just to get away from the crowds at any time of day justifies the cost.  It also helps that this is the most reasonably priced hotels in the park.  This place is my new go to.

This is the perfect place to take the family on an adventurous holiday. There was amazing dinning, room service and an amazing theme park to visit everyday. I would recommend staying for at least a week to explore everything in Disneyland.

Our room was really nice and clean. We stayed here only for one night but it was really pleasant. Vallet staff was kind of slow when we arrived, we waited appox 10 minutes for them to show up in front of the hotel so they can take over our car. We were staying on 6th floor and it was really quiet. Reception staff was friendly and a very helpful.

I was in Disneyland last week from Jan 4-6 and was booked to stay here instead of The Disneyland Hotel where I had stayed the last time. Since I was traveling from Manila and was staying with family in LA, I decided not to take my passport with me. When I arrived I went up to the counter and presented the woman on duty, Lorena,  my email confirmation (they had already billed me $428). She then asked me for photo ID and because I did not have my passport or driver's license, refused to let me check in. In vain did I show her my resident ID at my condo in Manila, and the actual credit card used for the booking. I told her I had a scanned copy of my passport in my phone but she refused that. When I told her my sister would soon be checking in and could vouch for me she said that

Super resort. Our room had a fabulous view of  California Adventure park and if the mountains. We were able to see the World of Color and it was great. We did not have kids with us but it very kids friendly. Lots of activities and heated pools. It a bit of a walk to the theme parks but was able to see all of Downtown Disney on our walk. Be prepared for a thorough security check we were very glad they have them.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and see the lights
Summary: We came here for a staycation for our wedding anniversary. We were greeted by wonderful desk hosts and given a room overlooking the Paradise Lake. The room was very clean and comfortable with a beautiful view. The bathroom is a little small, and lacked hand towels, but had good soaps and shampoos available. You have to walk about 5 minutes to an entrance to Disney walk where security does it check out for hotel guests. Easy in and out parking. The highlight was we were able to watch the light show on the lake, and the music and narration is piped in through a special tv station. It was the best seat in the park, and no need to be in the crowd! I only would recommend that after a long day at Disneyland and walking all the way back through Disney walk exhausted, it would be nice

Our experience at Paradise Pier was great. Upon arrival, our room was ready well before check in time. The front desk staff was welcoming and helpful.   Our room had an amazing view of California Adventure. The room was clean and as expected. Not huge, but with the daybed, enough room for our family of five. It's definitely an older hotel, but it's been well maintained.   The walk to the parks is pleasant but took longer than I expected.

Apart from a weekend stay at EuroDisney about 20 years ago (in a caravan), this was my first Disney experience.  I loved every single minute of it!  We arrived early and the lady on Reception (I think her name was Rochelle) was just wonderful.  She was so cheerful and excited about our holiday without seeming false, which is pretty impressive if she manages to pull that off all day long.  We were offered a room upgrade for $30 which we took, and I was so pleased that we did.  It gave us access to the guest lounge which included unlimited drinks and snacks (you name it, juice, tea, coffee, fresh lemonade, cans of pop, cakes, biscuits, crisps, fruit…).  This meant that we had somewhere to sit, plan and relax with some lovely food and drink.  The room upgrade also gave us a view of

Summary Heading: Great Disney hotel experience but next time staying at Disneyland Hotel.
Summary: This a great Disney hotel and had a wonderful experience while staying here. However, if you are traveling with small children, it is better to stay at the Disneyland or Grand Californian Hotel. The walk is a bit farther than the other hotels from the park, rides and rail station. Staff was great at holding bags and taking them to room when it was ready, also held them so we could go from park to airport as well. Also found best place to meet most of Disney characters is at Goofy's kitchen. Surprisingly I think all of the princesses showed up at ariel's grotto inside the park there for lunch too. Kids had a great time, slept very well every night and rooms very comfortable.

We got to the hotel early in the morning, they held our luggage until we arrived back to the hotel around midnight! Room is extremely spacious and staff were amazing! Only about a 5/10 minute walk from the park entrance and all items purchased in the parks can be sent back to your room saving your arms from all those shopping bags! Will recommend this hotel to all friends and family :)

Summary Heading: Christmas and New Years in Paradise
Summary: We spent 7 nights at the Paradise Pier (Hubby, me and 21 yr old daughter). Previously we have stayed at the Grand (3 times) Disney Hotel (once) and partner hotels (2). First impression was that the Pier is bright and had a nice feel. Great staff at check in and valet. The one downside was that we can no longer cross the street and access the parks through The Grand. Apparently this changed 2 weeks before our check in. But the staff at the Pier, especially at Beachcombers Club were outstanding. Donny, Rachelle, Patricia, Patrick and everyone there was amazing, Donny made us all feel like VIPs. The food, snacks, afternoon beverages, and DVD rentals made this a great perk and well worth the additional cost. Although the Grand was more "Grand" and convenient, the staff at the Pier

Summary Heading: Good Family Hotel close to DL
Summary: We enjoyed our stay. Room was comfortable. Beds super comfy. We walked to DL and used our magic mornings each day, came back for a an in the middle of the day and returned to the park for the evenings!

We took a family trip and stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel. Staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. The Breakfast buffet was fun and has good food. Walking distance To Downtown Disney and both Disney parks.

We have now stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and the Paradise Pier.  In comparison to the Disneyland Hotel, it is definitely not as good, however this is reflected in the cheaper price for accommodation.  The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the parks.  You walk across the road and through the Grand Californian Hotel to either the California Adventure Park or Downtown Disney.  The room is quite nice.  We had two queen beds, and the beds were quite comfortable.  The bathroom has a shower over a bath tub and the toilet is separate.  The beds face a television, which has channels including Disney bedtime stories, and information channels regarding the parks and dining, as well as normal channels.  We paid the extra for the 'club' level, which I did not feel was worth it.  This

You know how they say never judge a book by its cover? Well that's exactly what happened on the outside the hotel looks amazing lobby, pool area. The rooms on the other hand is a different story everything in the room was outdated wall paper was coming off the wall in the bathroom , tub had hair in it , and the bath towels were dirty.  The carpets was disgusting  for the amount of money the hotel makes I really encourage them to upgrade the rooms !! I will never stay here again !!

We enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay again. The hotel is a very very short walk to the parks through either the entrance in the Grand Californian or the entrances in downtown Disney. It was super easy to leave the park and go back to rest during the day then head back to the park later. The room itself was a little run down with a couple things looking like they needed replacing. The beds were very comfortable!! The only downside was the sound proofing. We were facing the park on a lower level and we got woken up during the afternoon by one of the parades a couple times. We could hear the music perfectly in our room with the windows and blinds shut. The overall feel of the hotel is more of a value/moderate than a deluxe. We usually stay at Port Orleans Riverside

Just walking distance from Downtown Disney and the parks, this theme hotel lived up to our expectation. Rooms were nice and comfortable and the cafetaria was nice. Stayed here for a couple of nights.Would prefer staying here again.

Summary Heading: Expensive for an Average Experience-No Wow Experience
Summary: We stayed 3 nights here last week during our Disneyland visit with 7 people.  We booked 2 rooms and we were excited about the "wow" possibilities we expected by staying in the resort.  It seems the wow never really hit us. The hotel is a dated design and even the Disney treatment cannot hide the fact it was built in the 80's.  .  We were on the 5th floor and our room overlooked the pool area which was nice.  The rooms themselves are average size but nicely decorated.  The beds have nice treatments but they are VERY loud and I am not sure why. Every time you sat on the beds, moved on the beds etc it was really loud. Everything else is really just average in terms of the rooms themselves. One morning before 9:00am the maids were conversing in the hall way really loudly which was

We stayed one night this past Sunday and we're so disappointed.  The cast members who were working there that we encountered were not very friendly at all.  In fact we had an issue with our Orbitz room reservation and when they contacted the Paradise Pier the one cast member lied about the issue (it was then corrected hours later and was told he would be spoken with, but by then too late to change our booking).  It was a mess.  The view was amazing from the premium view room and I definitely loved the view.  Water pressure was so so.  We didn't get to see fireworks from the pool area since they were cancelled, but the set up is really nice up there.  The food from their lounge was also really good.  They changed security measures, so now you have to walk all the way down to

Summary Heading: Beach themed family hotel a hit!
Summary: Our family stayed here for a week in November. Across the street from The Grand Californian, the Paradise Pier is a 5-10  minute walk to the parks -- either through the Grand Californian/California Adventure Park entrance or through the Downtown Disney/main entrance plaza.   We loved the light, airy, casual lobby and rooms and the Disney perks like Magic Hour entrance an hour early to the parks, a family cartoon lounge, Disney movie nights. etc. Our room had two queen beds and a single day bed that magically appeared from a cabinet. Our 15 yo daughter enjoyed having her own queen and our 5 yo was thrilled by her day bed. Disney art, beach ball pillows, strikingly beautiful carpet -- I love the Disney attention to decorating details.   The service was good, the pool and waterpark

My family (2 adults and 2 teenage kids) stayed here for 3 nights with a 3 day hopper pass for Disneyland. The location is good and the beds were comfy. The lifts however were very frustrating to get up to the rooms and especially down in the mornings. We ended up using the fire stairs every morning as we could never get into the lifts due to the amount of people and only 2 or 3 lifts which were very slow.

I can't say enough good things about Paradise Pier!  Upon arrival they upgraded us to a California Adventure park view room.  The room was so comfortablevand offered a great view of fireworks and th Christmas World of Color show.  Both parks and Downtown Disney were a short walk away.  Room service was quick and the food was great!  On our last day, my niece woke up ill with a very upset tummy.  The staff could not have been more accommodating, tending to our every need.  Extra towels, sheets, tissues,e tc., were quickly delivered.  They even sent us complimentary chicken noodle soup, crackers, soft dinner rolls and juice.  Customer Service is truly the top priority.  Absolutely wonderful family experience!

Summary Heading: Nice room, a little far to walk to the park
Summary: Pros: Great room, clean, comfy beds, roomy, nice decor. You get some of the Disney perks like being able to send things you purchase in the park to your room, and we got early entries into the parks. Cons: You are paying premium resort prices, but it is just as far to walk to the parks as some of the less-expensive hotels nearby. Also, elevators may be a problem in you're staying in a middle or lower floor.

Just visited Disneyland LA for the 1st after doing Orlando for the passed 6 years... Have to say we all had an amazing time.. Everything Disney is in close proximity and not having to wait for Disney Transportation was a delight... If travelling from the UK and wish to see the other parks (Universal Studios) just be prepared for a long trip.. LA traffic is a nightmare, going to us an hour an half but coming back was a 3 hour trip... This hasn't put us off though and Starline Tours do so great coach trips... We will be defo going back! The hotel is lovely but we didn't get the Disney magic welcome every time you walk into the hotel like we did in Orlando. However all staff are polite and the rooms are big a comfy..  Defo stay here again but next time have a park view! Be sure

This hotel was a breath of fresh air after having spent the previous night at a musty old hotel outside the park.  We loved our room!  The view of Disney's California Adventure was entertainment in and of itself.  I spent awhile at night watching the light show on the ferris wheel --- ever changing patterns and colors.  The hotel was a close walk to the park.  Enjoyed our stay here very much.

Lots of great characters including Mickey, Stitch, Minnie, Goofy etc. Watch for them to do some unrehearsed stuff. Great buffet as well. make Resos for sure!!! Plan on staying for about 1 1/2 hours or so.

We chose to stay on property for this trip to Disneyland.  The Paradise Pier Hotel fit our bill perfectly.  It was an easy walk to Downtown Disney with their many restaurants and shops and both of the theme parks.  The staff was always friendly including the big shots wearing suits.  They all went out of their way to help you or to just say hello.  You could not open a door if a Disney employee was near, they would always beat you to it.  The hotel features a parking ramp that is secure and while they have a pool, it was under construction but you could use a different Disney hotel's pool.  This particular hotel also offers clothes washers and dryers for a fee which worked out well for us.  For parents with young kids, there is a mini theater playing Disney cartoons and movies

Summary Heading: I didn't think we'd stay here again, but we came back.
Summary: My family of four came to the Happiest Place on Earth to experience the Halloween festivities and decided on staying on the property at Paradise Pier. This was actually our second time staying here over our previous few stays at Disneyland Hotel. Despite the Paradise Pier not having all the grandeur of a Grand Californian or Disneyland Hotel, it definitely is a great economical option for those guests to experience all the perks of staying on the resort property and not shelling out $500+ per night at the other two hotels. The main perk (I think) is the Magic Mornings, where DL resort guests get 1 hour extra in the parks before the general public.  Another cool perk if you're an early riser, you can partake in a roughly 2 mile guided power walk through CA Adventure at 6am every

Summary Heading: spend the extra $$$ & stay at the other disney hotels
Summary: traveling w my husband & a baby & a toddler. we were trying to be cheap & stay here instead of the Disney hotel. we regretted it each day lol. we have to go back to our room a lot to nap, etc w the babies & it was just so much further than the other hotel. it doesn't look that way on the map, but when you are lugging around a drink, kids, just stuff- it is a lot further. also, the pool area isn't as good (although, they have redone it since we were there). there is no fan in the bathroom which we cant stand. the elevators took FOREVER. like, no joke, a 5 min wait. everyone was complaining to each other about how absurd the elevator wait took. the hotel was clean enough & the valet and bell hop, front desk, everyone was 'Disney friendly' lol like you would expect. however, the

Summary Heading: Great View of Disney's California Adventure
Summary: We had a wonderful view of of Disney's California Adventure Park from our room. Though on property, be prepared to do a lot of walking. You can use the monorail into Disneyland, and can access the California Adventure Park through the Grand Californian Hotel with your room key and prepaid package. The room and bedding is Hampton Inn level. We found that some things were a bit worn, like our shower head, but all in all, we were comfortable. The staff was helpful and friendly. The character buffet breakfast was excellent, but a little pricey (as to be expected). Be sure to make reservations for your meals at the hotel.

If I could give this hotel zero stars I would. For the price it's shameful. I requested a king bed for my wife and I and instead got two queen beds and a day bed. For two people? Seriously ? The front of house staff surly and couldn't even muster a smile. Here's a clue. If you hate your job do something else. Check in was slow and ridiculously late and the toilet didn't flush properly. For an organization such as Disney to treat people this way is shameless to the extreme. Shame on you.

Summary Heading: First time at a Disney hotel
Summary: We have visited Disneyland four times in the past decade but this is our first time staying in a Disney hotel.  We couldn't justify the added premium cost of staying at the Disneyland Hotel or Grand Californian.  The Paradise Pier Hotel suited us just fine and provides many of the same benefits as the other two pricier hotels, such as Magic Hour access on all five days of our park-hopper and we were still able to enter California Adventures through the Grand Californian.    Our Paradise Pier hotel keycards did not let us into the Grand Californian pool areas but our 5-year-old seemed just as happy in the heated pools of the Paradise Pier Hotel.  Other families staying at the Grand Californian were kind enough to offer us access into the GC pool but we politely declined as we

You would think since its connected and on Disney soil that it would be a little higher quality or at least a little different than most hotels, unfortunately not. We even tried to surprise my sister for the holidays and we told the staff not to say anything...they still ruined the surprised even after they said they wouldn't.

Summary Heading: Very impressed. Disney everywhere. Bring Cash though....
Summary: This is a very fun hotel. Best price for the Disneyland Disney Hotels. Rooms are very clean. Concierge service is excellent. The pull out bed is nice for kids. Staff very pleasant. Our pool was closed at the time - but they let us use the Grand Californian Pool which was nice. The only drawback is the cost. It is incredibly expensive for an immersive Disney experience. You can stay elsewhere - in same cased closer than the Paradise Pier and enjoy the park just as much. HOWEVER, being complete encased in Disney is the whole point of going to Disneyland for us.

Wow, do not stay here.  Our room was stodgy, the bed creaked, the ambiance inside was "worn".  We had a great view - on the 10th floor but there was tons of street noise because the windows were single glazed, not double glazed.  The bathroom tub surround was 6" tile from the 1980's.  The feel of luxury was totally lacking.  The reception had a feel of Motel 6.  The pricing was "Encore" level pricing.  For a charge of over $400 a night, next time we will stay at a motel 6 and spend the balance for shows and attractions.

We stayed here the last week of October (10/24-10/29).  This would be our second time staying here.  We arrived to the hotel around 1pm-ish and couldn’t check in until 3pm.  We dropped off our luggage to the concierge in the front of the hotel.  I don’t remember his name, but he was very pleasant.  He told us we can do early check in and once our room was ready we would get a text message and we can go to the room.  My husband and I received a text around 3:30pm and headed to our room on the 9th floor.  Not sure if the elevator always took long, but we were waiting quite a while.  Once we got to the rooms we settled and rested for a bit.  So here are the problems, the SHOWER!  It was leaking water, no matter how tight we made it, it was always leaking.  PLUS when we switched the

Summary Heading: Disney Fun Recommended by an Australian Family
Summary: We stayed at Disney's Paradise at the beginning of our USA trip in July for 4 nights, as well as at the end of the trip in September for 3 nights and we enjoyed it immensely.  We are a family of 4 (Mum, Dad and 2 boys aged 6 and 8) from Australia. We booked our accommodation for the first stay online from Australia, along with 3 day Hopper tickets with no troubles and all went smoothly upon arrival. Our final stay we booked with 2 day Hooper tickets via phone while on the road and again all went smoothly and staff were polite and helpful.  The rooms, while basic, with 2 double beds, suited us fine as a place to rest while seeing the parks and the kids loved the pool and water slide when they needed a break. We bought some groceries and had them delivered from the local store

As a longtime Disneyland visitor and Annual Pass Holder, and after having always stayed at the Grand Californian, I thought I'd give one of the other two hotels on the Disney property a try.  Saving the Disneyland Hotel for another trip, I booked a room at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel, the least expensive of the three properties.    First, the good...  It's a great location at the tail end, plus a few steps, of Downtown Disney.  Walk across the street and you can go through the Grand Californian and use the resort guest only entrance to California Adventure.  (Note, however, that although this is a benefit, this entrance has a very small staff for bag check which can result in a very long wait.  Overall, though, I'd recommend this entrance over the main entrance.)  Walk the

Summary Heading: Nice on property hotel with views of Disneyland.
Summary: My family and I are Disney people, so of course we chose to stay on property and close to the action. Especially since this was our first trip to Disneyland! This hotel was not originally a Disney hotel, and it shows. Obviously they've updated the décor and if you hadn't known it wasn't built by Disney you'd be none the wiser, but little things like the sinks being in the bathrooms and the noise level really show that this is not a Disney design.   That being said, overall, our stay was great. The room was clean, standard hotel room size, don't expect anything spacious, but it was big enough to accommodate five adults with a day bed. The day bed truly had an actual mattress, so that was nice! The beach theming is cute, and well done. The beach ball pillows are such a neat touch!

Summary Heading: Wonderful staff. So close to Disneyland.
Summary: Love the pool for kids. Great slide.the rooms were nice and clean. Room service was wonderful. They offer a breakfast with Disney characters.  That was fine. The staff was very nice and helpful. I would stay there,again.

Summary Heading: Noise is a huge problem at this hotel.
Summary: Way too noisy!!! Stayed here over the weekend and there were a couple races going on around the property. On Sunday morning we were awoken in the middle of the night. by a marching band playing in the parking lot below our room. We were 6 floors up but the band sounded like they were right outside our window. Front desk was completely unsympathetic and could care less stating that there was a race that morning and that the hotel was right across the street from a theme park so getting woken up in the middle of the night should be the expectation. We were also told that due to the race the hotel was entitled to not have to 1- care about their guests quality of stay and 2-provide their guests any level of quiet enjoyment of the property.

Stayed for two nights in a premium view room with concierge service. Compared to the other concierge lounges at the other resorts, this one ranked 3/3. Lounge closed at 8pm...the same time the parks closed. There's also no view from the lounge (located on the second floor.) our room was on the top floor so we had more space; the view was of California Adventure. The bedding was okay, few outlets didn't work, and the water pressure could have been better. Checkin was a bit lengthy as well, yet workers were just typing away with nobody in front of them. Elevators were just refurbished; now you type which floor you want and the system tells you which elevator to wait for. Overall, you pay for location and a safe place to stay with the family.

Summary Heading: Location is good, that's about it
Summary: This Disney property isn't quite up to the level of it's Disney World counterparts. Having stayed in several Disney Properties, (Coronado Springs, Port Orleans, Grand Floridian) I would say this was the poorest of the bunch. Outdated old room, could not accommodate a late checkout, just a bunch of little things that turned my wife and I off. On the plus side, we did have a great view of Adventure Land and it was across the street from the entrance to the parks (Grand Californian).

Summary Heading: Extremely Happy but for One Thing
Summary: While convenient to Disneyland's entrance, there is a bit of a walk.  I'd prefer a walk vs staying off grounds and having to drive into the park any day.  Check in was painless even though my room was not ready, I dropped off my bag, and just headed to the park.  Prior to my Downtown dinner reservation, my room was ready, and I found it both clean and comfortable with a great view of the park.    While I cannot speak of any of the hotel's restaurants since I 1) only spent one night and 2) only had dinner Downtown, I do have a major complaint:    Even after sending text messages to the hotel about the availability of purchasing various sundries (shampoo, conditioner, skin cleanser) at the hotel, and being told they were available; unfortunately, I learned they were not without a

We stayed in a room with a view of DCA and it was amazing.  Loved the short walk to both parks and was fun to,watch the WOC show from our window while listening to the music from the tv.  Overall the benefits of staying at a Disney hotel was great wee also enjoyed the early entry days.    Don't miss Trader Sams while you are here.

Great location. Lovely view of California Adventure. No ironing board or iron. Game room, only have the games worked, so cold. Needs updating. But satisfactory for sleeping and nice little restaurant in lobby. Great staff very helpful

I normally stay at the Disneyland hotel, but this time stayed at paradise pier, all the cast members were lovely, beautiful clean hotel. The house keeping did a magnificent job, the only problems were the elevators! They took forever, in what should be a 2 Minute from room to lobby ended up taking us 15 minutes a few times.  Access to down town Disney whilst not as easy as if I stayed in the Disneyland hotel, you can cut through the back, or go the front and cross at the traffic lights cutting through the grand Californian hotel and popping out near Anna and Elsa's boutique  Pools are very nice too

Summary Heading: Most Reasonable Hotel on Disneyland Property
Summary: Clean and more than adequate for sleeping.  We play all day at the park and this hotel provides a clean quiet rest. Beds are good, decor is getting a bit dated, but still well maintained. Housekeeping is adequate with clean towels and sheet on request (rather than daily). Least expensive of the 3 hotels on the Anaheim property. We've stayed here multiple times as it allows us to walk to Disneyland or California Adventure.

Summary Heading: Staff went above and beyond expectations
Summary: My family and I love Disneyland. We've gone at least once a year since 2011 and always stay at the Paradise Pier. The hotels beach theme and excellent views of Disney's California Adventure is one of the reasons we keep coming back. The other reason is the staff. They are always friendly, helpful, and in Disney fashion seem to be really happy the guest chose their hotel.  Last year the staff went above and beyond the call of duty during a frightening family event. At 7am in the morning my husband  and I awoke to the sounds of our oldest Son struggling  to breath. After trying a few things to help his breathing my husband notified guest services what was going on and also call 911. The hotel sent the hotel nurse to our room. The nurse stayed with us until the paramedics came and

Staff was awesome. We checked in after spending 2 nights at another hotel, that we had to get out of. Rooms are great, spacious. It's nice being able to use Grand Californian to access the parks and downtown Disney. We will stay here again for sure

We recently stayed here and decided to splurge at the end of our trip with a stay at a Disney hotel. As a stay here was so much more expensive than other Anaheim hotels we were a bit dubious about if it was worth the extra money - but it actually was. We arrived early and didn't expect to be able to check in early but we're fortunately able to. The rooms are decorated nicely with subtle Disney touches. The rooms are large and clean. The beds were super comfy. The kids loved the Disney Princess bedtime story channel on the TV. We loved that our room had a view over the water slide and pool area. The kids also loved the glass elevator. I also really liked that laundry area was open 24 hours and took credit cards as I never have coins. The pool area was amazing. We loved the water

Summary Heading: Amazing service and worth it if you spend time in the Hotel
Summary: I loved the convenience and the level of service of this hotel but unless you plan to spend a lot of time in the hotel it really isn't worth the money.  When we go to Disneyland we don't spend time in the hotel rooms or in the pool. My kids want to be at the parks as much as possible. Now if you are a family that needs a bunch of down time this is a great place to stay. The rooms are spacious and very clean and the rooms are quiet. I didn't like the check out time being 11am that is very early and they were not helpful when requesting a late check out.

The hotel was very comfortable with easy to access Disneyland and early morning entry as part of price. Staff were very helpful and made a very good impression about staying at the hotel. It was more costly than staying in an equivalent hotel as we wanted to be in the resort and there may be better value for money in booking outside of Disneyland.

We just finished up a five night stay here and it was great! Upon pulling up, every person we came into contact with seemed happy to have us here. At check in they gave my kids a balloon, first visit pins, and an autographed picture of Mickey & friends saying that Mickey couldn't wait to meet them. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The rates were $305/night and generally I would expect a nicer hotel for that price but the friendly staff, the impeccable cleaning, and the Disney magic made up the difference. If this were any other hotel it would be on par with a Hilton or Sheraton. I was very pleased overall and can't wait to try the Disneyland hotel on our next visit. I would recommend the Paradise Pier wholeheartedly but I like to try new hotels.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel, friendly staff, excellent stay!
Summary: Okay first of all I only just realised the other day that I hadn't done a review on our stay at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel which was actually back in August 2015 not November 2015 but I can't go back that far in the date options.  My daughter Emily and I were travelling back from visiting family in St Louis and I decided that for her 13th birthday (19 August) we would check out Disneyland and Disney California Adventure Park.  This boardwalk-themed Disney resort sits across a palm-lined boulevard from the Grand Californian Hotel & Spa, a 5 minute walk to Downtown Disney and a 15 minute walk to Disneyland Park and the Disney California Adventure Park.  Amenities include a rooftop pool park, arcade, movie room, fitness centre, laundry room and business centre.  We stayed at

I will state that as this is a Disney hotel at a premium price my expectations were pretty high.  Well it started with an hours wait for the bus that runs every 10 mins!  We'd flown in direct from Melbourne and arrived at the hotel at around 9am. Check in wasn't until 3pm but we were told to come back in an hour.so we did. Still no joy. Try again in an hour and a half. So we did- still no joy with a room.  We arrived back at 2:53 to be told our room still wasn't ready. I'm tired and cranky now so I asked for the manager-who managed to produce a room. All through this we never received a smile or an apology.   The room itself is ok- very reminiscent of an IBIS or accord hotel.  This was underwhelming as we expected so much more from  Disney- this is a budget hotel. Other than 1

Summary Heading: Disneyland, California Adventure and Disney Downtown.
Summary: We had booked a concierge view room and were upgraded to a suite, wonderful. In the evenings we could watch the fire works and water works from our windows and at the same time heard the music through our TV. The continental breakfast and evening happy hour were very nice and the service in the hotel what you expect from Mickey. It is quite expensive to go to the parks but staying in a Mickey Hotel makes it so much enjoyable. A very nice visit.

Points lost because the elevator to go down takes forever!  We waited ten minutes many times to go down from 9.  Ended up going up first because we couldn't get a down car.  That said, very nice room, very clean.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Can't beat the location.  Take the monorail from tomorrowland to Downtown Disney and it's a short five minute walk after a long day of walking.  Earl of Sandwich is a two minute walk away and has amazing food that will save you tons of money on breakfast or a later night snack. Starbucks is right next door and the monorail entrance is across.

Positives: Location AND access to both parks 1 hr early with room ticket was excellent and worth the stay + resort entry meant not lining up at main gates. As well had access to both other Disney resort facilities. Not great food options and pool bar limited, but again Downtown Disney (open till 2am most nights) is a 7 min walk. All staff we met were great, especially check in with Dusty :) Rooms were good. Negatives: Paid for premium view rooms, view was great but the Tinting on windows was badly wrinkled in both rooms wish certainly messed with view. Elevators mega slow and busy to high floors. Pool / surroundings basic and a little tired

Customer service was amazing!  There was a line to check in but it moved smoothly.  We were upgraded to a room overlooking the fireworks and water show in California adventures.  We watched the show from our room almost every night.   Our room was clean and well kept.  We were traveling with stinky teenage boys so this was a plus.  I loved that I could do laundry before we moved the our next location.  The shop in our hotel had nice souvenirs too.  We ate at the park or downtown Disney for every meal.   Very close to our room.  You can't beat Disney service.  I want to go back.

Overall I'm pretty satisfied with the Hotel but it has some very serious flaws which could easily ruin your stay.   Firstly; it was the word check-in I've ever experienced - Disney need to take control of their guests. Three people were complaining that they couldn't check-in at 1pm when it clearly says everywhere it doesn't open until 4pm. If you arrive earlier you take your chances, why allow guests to complain?  Secondly; the on site facilities are frankly terrible. The bar is so slow and so expensive, the shop shuts before the parks (work that out) and the pool was closed for refurbishment, a disappointment.   The room was however very nice, it was clean and well furnished which was definitely a positive.  The staff were a mixed bag. Not everyone had the Disney spirit.

Very clean hotel. Walking distance to everything. We can see Disneyland fireworks at night. We had a view of Disney California from our room. Disney Grand California is right across.  The only downside for us, the elevator can be slow sometimes.

The hotel was just 'okay', nothing spectacular for the money we paid.  The room was clean and tidy.  We ordered room service and asked for a small bowl of plain pasta with butter for our three year old.  They charged us $20 for the pasta!  Literally 50 cents worth of pasta with a spoon of butter.    We called to complain and was told that that was what they charged, and basically, tough luck.  My husband asked to speak to the Room Service Manager and was told that $20 was the cost of the pasta and sausage dish, they just withheld the sausage...  We were expecting exemplary customer service, but it was all very lacklustre.  Every single time I went to the lobby cafe to get coffee, I had to wait until the baristas had finished their private conversation before being served.    If

Summary Heading: The Less Than Average Disney Experience...Resort Hotel -- I Don't Think So !!
Summary: Well if you like to have your expectations NOT met, this is your place. It looks like Disney converted a Motel 6 into one of their "Resort" hotels. There is no real restaurant, other than an overpriced buffet (PCH Grill); the poolside snack bar has some really bad stuff; the Surfside Lounge is way too small. The 3rd floor pool is way undersized, although the waterslide is great for the kids. The jacuzzi was disgusting with brown algae on top of an always present white foam (YUK!!). The rooms were generally OK size-wise BUT quite dirty with stained carpets, windows with sun films bubbled and peeling, and tattered furniture. One "highlight" of our stay was the arrival of the Anaheim Police Dept who were called because a woman gained entry into one the rooms on our floor posing as

I booked the concierge level with a view of California adventure. It was $69 US per night plus taxes.The deciding factor to be honest was the free wine and beer between 5 and 7 in the evening. Two people having two glasses of wine each night paid for the upgrade. The price also included breakfast and some hot finger food, cheese and fruit in the evening with dessert. The room was clean and looked recently renovated. The bathroom was huge with a separate toilet with a door. The seaside theme was cute with a cushion 'beach ball' on the bed and a mickey mouse life guard lamp. The first night in the room we got mickey snacks and free bottles of water. The staff throughout were extremely helpful and so friendly.  The hotel was only 2 minutes walk to the Grand California hotel and

Summary Heading: Best View for a Disney Hotel
Summary: If view is your priority while visiting Disney, Paradise Pier, 12th 13th 14th or 15th floor "premium view" is where you want to be.  It directly overlooks California Adventure Park.  The view of the night water/light show is unbeatable.  You can tune into the music via the TV in your room.  You can also view and tune into the fireworks music.  It is not the same as standing in the crowds in front of the shows, but we prefer it.  The best view of the fireworks, other than in the park, is at the Paradise Pier pool with piped in music.  The hotel rooms are tired and in need of remodel, especially the bathroom.  Room service is limited, restaurant on site is limited to buffet character breakfast and buffet dinner, a bar type area, a gift shop with limited snacks and drinks, and a

After reading reviews, I was picturing a mediocre place to sleep after my days at Disney. I was pleasantly surprised! My room was very clean and decorated cutely. The bed was very comfy after a long day. The maid service was spectacular and on the last night, left chocolates, a book and some toys for my 5 year old arranged with her Disney stuffed animals. We were a very close walk to everything. I will definitely be coming back here.

Summary Heading: 1 Bedroom Suite for 5 adults and 2 toddlers
Summary: We booked a 1 bedroom suite at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel.  The room was included in our vacation package that we purchased through Costco's.  The 1 bedroom suite was 2 regular adjoining rooms with one room consisting of a large L shaped couch, dining table, TV and Bathroom while the other room had 2 queen sized beds, recliner, TV and Bathroom.  The room was located on the 15th floor facing the pool.  As far as location goes it was perfect about a 5-10 minute walk across the street and you're already at Disney's California Adventure. Staying a at Disney Hotel also gives you access to early magic hours with means you're able to go to the theme Parks 1 hour early before the regular admission (Check on what park is available to get early entrance because it switches from park to

Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel was clean, convenient, with some fun Disney touches. We were greeted by a friendly Cast Member at the front desk who registered us.  There's a very nice Disney gift store in the lobby and a nice, little bar/restaurant in the lobby too.  We had lunch in the bar and enjoyed the food very much.  Plus the wait staff was extremely friendly.  When a mistake was made with our order, they gave us a choice of anything from their bakery counter.   The rooms are basic but clean and decorated with Disney themed artwork and accessories.    We took a break from the parks each afternoon and spent a couple of hours at the hotel pool.  Fun water slide.  Again, the pool is very basic and was scheduled to be updated starting the day that we left.  Bring your own

I give this hotel 5 stars. Everything was perfect from the style, cleanliness & comfort of our room; customer service & the view from our room. We were just a short walk away from all of the parks too. Disney never disappoints! Highly recommend this hotel!

The Paradise Pier Hotel at Disneyland Resort was a pleasant surprise. Could do with a little updating but was very comfortable and clean. Housekeeping service was excellent every day there was chocolate put on our pillows in the evening and our curtains pulled shut. We were greeted with rice krispie treats done in the shape of Mickey Mouse with chocolate on which I thought was a nice touch. The swimming pool outside was excellent and they had a water slide for the children which they thoroughly enjoyed. I would be glad to stay there again. The concierge was very helpful and accommodating. Overall the hotel is a very nice place to stay

We stayed here for 2 nights to go to California Adventure Park in Sept 2016. Booked a standard view room, asked upon check-in for available room upgrades, and received a complimentary upgrade to a premier view room with a great view of the park (room 810). The window did have some coating on it that was a bit bubbled that caused some distortion, but that was just in the middle. The view was great, the room was clean, and they promptly delivered extra towels and pillows for us when asked. The hotel overall is fairly basic and not as nice as the Grand California hotel (we stayed there last year), but the rooms at the two are exactly the same, just with different decor. While the pool was very standard, we enjoyed using it one night and my daughter loved the 1 foot deep kiddie pool

This is a very nice hotel.  All the staff were excellent.  We had a room with a view looking over California Adventure and it was a great view.  Was able to watch the color water show and the fireworks.  The room was clean but maybe a little dated.  The bathroom door was tacky where people open and closed the door by grabbing the door instead of the handle.  (Yes I was one of those people).  I was surprised that the hotel didn't provide any drinking water in the room. You could by it in the vending machine for over $3.00 per bottle.  Most hotels I have stayed in would have provided two bottles a day.  For the price they charge this would be a reasonable expectation.  Location to the park was actually much better than I thought it would be.  Especially California Adventure.

I thought the rates were a bit on the high side; however, the convenience of being on Disney property is nice.  The hotel is a quick five minute walk to Downtown Disney.
