The shortcut through the Grand California into California Adventure is convenient.  A long line forms here as well, so arrive early.  There’s a snack shack right there for coffee, juices, and muffins.  Early entry is well worth the cost of staying onsite as long as you actually use the early entry.   I like the beach theme and the Disney touches; although, the flooring on the first floor doesn't match the theme really... too formal.  The signature smell of suntan lotion is a nice touch.   They need more elevators.  We often waited an extended time for an elevator.  Also, the pool hours were short.  We would

Summary Heading: A good base for the parks
Summary: Ideally located for the parks and downtown Disney with only a short walking distance . Basic rooms which overlook California adventure park .I found the bed a little uncomfortable and the air conditioning unit  very noisy. Character breakfast helps to add Disney Magic. 10-15 min walk to other selections of restaurants

The rooms are good, clean and very well maintained. They had a safe, fridge (empty), tea and coffee making facilities.  The hotel had free wifi.  Located across the road from the Grand Californian Disney hotel, through which you can access both Disney parks.  After booking we were told that during our stay the pool and area was shut due to work being carried out in the area, so we had to use the other Disney pools, unfortunately our room keys never worked to access these pools which resulted in having to wait for a member of staff for each entry. The pool area was also the suggested area to watch the nightly fireworks.  The hotel has a lounge bar and a restaurant with Disney character photo opportunities, the buffet food selection is good although more expensive.  A paid for

Summary Heading: not bad but will probably try a different hotel next time
Summary: we got a one room suite at the hotel for 4 nights.  pros: Close to the park. The room was pretty clean. room service was on time and the food wasn't too bad.   cons:  The towels they provide are SUPER rough! it feels like your skin might come off when you use them. for the price that they charge, I'm sure they can afford better towels. There was a open can of soda in our fridge when we checked in. not a big deal but would've been nice if they hadn't missed it. One of the bathrooms ran out of kleenex but the cleaning service never replaced it. we had asked for 2 cribs prior to arrival; however there was only one crib in the room when we got there and the crib was broken so the gentleman who brought us the second crib replaced the first one as well.   we didn't use the pool or

Cost-effective Disney accommodations.  Recommended for families and DVC members.  DVC Points --- We have been Disney Vacation Club (DVC) members for 13 years, and wanted to have a summer vacation in LA.  We looked into the posh Grand Californian hotel, but it required way too many points.  The Disneyland Hotel was fully booked, but we found vacancy at Paradise Pier at an affordable point cost.  We paid 165 DVC points for Paradise Pier (5 nights) and had a view overlooking the pool.  PP is 33 points per night during regular season, while DL Hotel is 43 and the Grand Californian is 50.  Comparison to other Disney Hotels --- Comparing Disneyland hotels to the Walt Disney World hotels in Florida, The Grand Californian is very close to the Wilderness Lodge (picturesque lobby,

While I know this isn't the Grand Californian, it IS still a Disney resort and you pay a premium.  The location is good--right across from the park and you can use the GC entrance, so thats a huge timesaver.  The rooms are clean and fine, but aside from that, it's all a bit tired.  From the lobby, which is small, low-ceilinged, and not super inviting, to the pool, which has a seriously weird layout and really needs a makeover, this hotel has just seen better days. Stay at the Grand Californian and splurge on the full Disney experience, or save your money and go to a hotel within a few blocks of the resort.

One star for the amazing view. That is the only reason we didn't just up and leave this hotel. I wanted to be able to watch 'World of Color' and the fireworks from our room at night and this hotel served that purpose. We stayed in room 1200 from Sept 10-13, 2016.  It is on the Disney property but the furthest walk of any of the hotels. Add in waiting and waiting for the elevators and you'll feel like you are further from Disney then you were expecting.  Here is the real problem: dirty, dingy and dated. The main lobby was okay, no real problems. There are three elevators for 15 floors (unless there are more somewhere else that isn't obvious) plus one 'glass elevator' that has an obstructed view of the theme park. This elevator is the slowest of them all, very small and smells

Summary Heading: Decent and clean but nothing special
Summary: I have been in the Grand Californian and the Disneyland Hotel as well, and prefer either of those to the Paradise Pier. This hotel is a bit outdated, but still nice as well as impressively clean, other than the empty soda can we found under the bed. At the rate of $280/night, however, I would think your money would be better spent at the Disneyland Hotel. The decor is beach themed, and pretty cute, but reminded me of a fancy motel 6. We were on the 6th floor. Perhaps the rooms on the other floors are better. Again, no complaints other than the price but for such a short walk to the park entrance it may be worth it to you.

Location for the parks is excellent!  Pool is small.  Elevators are slow. Hotel is showing signs of age and in need of an upgrade.  Have stayed here too many times to count but this past trip was utterly disappointed.  Service level in the Club Lounge would be less than one star.  Selection in the Club Lounge would be less than one star as well as the attitudes of the cast members in the Club lounge.  If you decide to stay here, save your money and don't stay club Level.  Sadly no longer worth it.

Summary Heading: Good clean room and great location - nothing more, nothing less
Summary: This is basically a basic, clean, good hotel.  Provides a decent size room with 2 queen beds and a clean, plain bathroom.  It is reasonably close to  Disneyland;  10 minute walk even at leisurely pace.  But the pool is about the size of a suburban home in-ground pool.  Has  a decent slide, but don't stay here for a pool.  We're used to Orlando themed rooms;  we did not feel like we were staying at a Disney hotel.  Staff was very courteous and helpful.  Limited eating options in the hotel, but we ate at downtown disney which is only 5 minutes walk.   Also,  not enough elevators - during morning rush and evenings, you could be waiting several minutes for an elevator.

Summary Heading: Happy Hotel for the Happiest Place on Earth
Summary: This was our second time staying at Paradise Pier.    The positives: We love how close it is to Downtown Disney and the parks - and we love the every day magic hour we enjoyed as Disney guests!  The staff are very friendly, the rooms are a nice size (we were in a standard room that had 2 queens and a pull out sofa bed).    The negatives: the dining at the hotel is not that great but Downtown Disney is a five-minute walk and there are several options to choose from there!  The hotel pool is under construction so we had to move our pool time to the next door Disney hotels - a minor inconvenience but an inconvenience just the same.  We didn't know about this until we arrived at the hotel.    This is the least expensive of the Disney hotels and while more expensive than other area

This hotel is located within easy walking distance to both Disney parks and downtown disney, which made it very easy to stay and play at parks. Staff friendly as you would expect from a disney property. Swimming pool with water slide and plenty of towels and sun beds available. This hotel is what i would call discreetly disney themed and we had a pleasant although busy stay. i found it lacked atmosphere and considering it was a Disney hotel very quiet including the pool at various times when we used it during our stay which was nice. Wifi free and easy to use. Small fridge/cooler in rooms. Parking is available free in you are a DVC owner, and you can also get various discounts at the food outlets. Park access via California hotel - not sure i fancied staying at this hotel as it

Like most things Disney, it's a bit pricey for what you get.  It is convenient to Downtown Disney and the two parks; it is filled with Disney "references;" and the pool area provides an excellent out-of-the-park spot to see the fireworks; registered guests get an extra hour access to one park each morning; but as a place to refresh and recharge, it's just a basic hotel.  Yet, you pay considerably extra for those Disney "touches."  Comparable accommodations, minus the Disney flair, are available close by for half the price.  And , , , this is Disney's least expensive hotel property.

Summary Heading: Good if you don't mind not eating
Summary: The rooms are cute and clean.  The pool top area is wonderful, a perfect place to watch the fireworks. Convenient for Disney access. Staff were friendly and very helpful The characters were wonderful, they did such a great job, making the children feel special. The reason I didn't give this hotel a better rating is that they over charged for parking and food.  When I say overcharged for food, I mean OVERCHARGED for food. What choice do you have, you have to eat, and they take advantage of that. No reason for the food to be that expensive, it wasn't even that great. Elevators were very slow, the wait time was very long.

During our recent stay at the Paradise Pier the pool was closed for a few days, so we were invited to the pools at the other properties.  We only had time to visit the Disneyland Hotel pool and it was amazing...beautifully landscaped with lots of chaise lounges around the water slide area (which offered 3 different sizes of slides with wading pool around the two smaller slides) and 2 pools.  So when we made it the (one small) pool at our hotel, I was disappointed after being spoiled at the other location!  I liked that each pool had life vests to borrow.  But onto the room...it was a good size, beds were comfortable and liked that there was a couch for extra seating and stuff.  There was also a small table that rolled out from under the desk and a fridge (which I don't think is

I just returned from four days at the Paradise Pier Hotel while vacationing at The Disney Resorts.  My family stayed at the Disneyland Hotel while I opted to try Paradise Pier for a change.  It's a very nice hotel, clean and comfortable as only Disney can do it.  I had a beautiful view of Disney California Adventure and could see and hear most of the World of Color every evening.  It's quieter, but that comes with a price.  There are fewer elevators and they are slower.  The pool is much much smaller.  The spa wasn't very clean.  The restaurants closed at 9, leaving a bar that welcomed small children, a two-block walk to Downtown Disney or Room Service.  I didn't mind waiting for the elevators, and ate in Downtown Disney most evenings with my family.  The staff is helpful.  But

I had heard this was not up to par for a Disney property, but we enjoyed our stay.  The decor is very cute and service was on par for Disney.  One tip: concierge lounge is not as nice here as at other properties.  We used it, but it was not an inviting place to hang out.  Dated furniture and no windows.

Booked this hotel for a quick last minute trip to Disneyland and stayed at concierge level. The hotel is a good walk to the park through Downtown Disney you can gain entrance to California Adventure through the hotel across from PP which helps cut down the many steps and the crowds   The staff was very friendly and accommodating we had turndown service. The theming was not quite as much as a WDW hotel but still had the Disney feel with a coastal emphasis. Might need a little more variety for breakfast (even cheap breakfast serve you make waffles) but a free beer or glass of wine at 5 sure tasted good. My only complaint was the elevators were slow but I would stay there again if I had the chance.

We traveled to Disney for our first big trip since my husband had a health crisis.  I was very nervous about the accommodation as we need a bit more room so my husband can maneuver around.  When I went to the front desk, I explained the situation.  They bent over backwards to make it work for us and found us a great room.   It was SO amazing.  I will say the rooms are a bit small-ish and the hotel is definitely a little dated.  It feels more like a hotel that was converted to be a Disney property than a Disney property proper, but that's just the bones.   The staff goes above and beyond to accommodate and EVERYONE we came across bent over backwards.  It's a super short walk to Downtown Disney (my husband is in a wheelchair and we were able to get him there easily) and close

We as a family had a terrible stay here, the location and view of the park is great but that's about it. Some of the staff were rude, unhelpful and our rude, I say some because the ones in the grill restaurant felt as the ought they didn't work with the others as they were very good. After a busy day at the parks and returning at 11pm we couldn't even get a drink and I'm not talking beer, we couldn't get a coffee, so we tried the machine in the room, which also did not work. The room felt tired and dirty It may sound strange but the hotel didn't even feel like a Disney hotel, there was no magic and if there was the lack of customer service managed to make that bit disappear  Very disappointed as we spend a lot of time and even more concerning a lot of money with Disney and

I've stayed here once in the 2 bedroom suite! the view was beautiful. I saw the whole califronia adventure park! the fireworks right infront of us but i hear you can always view them where the pool is so thats cool! I loved the theme and beach ball pillow. HOTEL is very clean when i went it was november and it wasn't packed at all. Disney PCH Grill downstairs was amazing ! the omelettes were great but the rest of food was ok...what i loved is they had music playing and the characters were dancing with the kids! why better than goofy kitchen they just walk around and u can't get up go to them the workers start freaking out lol  overall my experience with my family was amazing!

The hotel was fab, staff are lovely and friendly! Very close to both attractions, beautiful view for the fireworks!  Very family friendly, the food is perfect, only good things to remember.Absolutely 5 stars!  Would recommend it anytime to anyone!

Summary Heading: Convenient to both parks and Downtown Disney!
Summary: Nice hotel and clean room with nice amenities. We ate at the buffet a couple of times and one time with the characters. It was fun and the food was good with a nice variety. This week however that we are here the pool was only open one day. I feel I should have been told about that in advance.

Summary Heading: Not especially Disney but a good choice
Summary: We found the hotel to be lacking in the Disney charm of other resort hotels but it was clean , comfortable and a few minutes walk from both parks . Considering the amount of time you actually spend in the room this was a good hotel if you don't want to spend all your money on accommodation.

Summary Heading: Poor value for money. Expected more.
Summary: A very old tired hotel that is very over-priced. I really expected so much more and was bitterly disappointed. I have stayed at many hotels around the world and would rate this a 2-3 star hotel that you pay a 5 star price for. It is definitely not worth what you pay. The only reason I didn't give this a 1 rating is that it was a great location to see the fireworks. The fireworks display is excellent.  The rooms are very dated and are quite small seeing that they offer 2 queen beds and a day bed. This is very convenient for families but do make rooms quite small so it only works ok for a short stay.  A few key issues that were rather irritating: If you phone the front desk expect a long wait for someone to answer. Hotel is old and seriously requires an upgrade.  Magic morning

Take advantage of the magic morning! The location is very convenient to the parks, well worth it with small children. We will definitely stay again, clean room, wonderful staff, especially housekeeping.

The best part was the pool, the kids loved it. I guess I just expect more from a Disney property but then again, I am comparing to Disney World hotels. The rooms are a bit dated and there were few amenities. The snack bar was disappointing for a selection, the buffet was just too overpriced. I don't mind paying for food but I do like a selection and it was limited. The characters were cool and fun for the kids. Would I stay here again? No, there are many hotels within walking distance of the Disney complex.

We stayed here for a week and loved it! The room was nice and clean and cold! After a day in the parks, coming back for a nice cold shower and a nap was great! Housekeeping was great and always done by the time we got back. Love how close to the parks and Downtown Disney this hotel is. Will definitely return when we visit Disney again!

Just back an thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It id the least luxurious of the on site Disney hotels and a little expensive for what it is, but you are paying for location. Walk to the park is good, 10/15 mins to the parks and Downtown Disney, if a little strange that you have to walk through the Californian hotel ( Nice advert Disney for next time!). Rooms are a good size, if a little worn in places. AC was very noisy and was turned off each night, wouldn't be able to sleep with that on. Hotel is spotlessly clean, Pool area nice mix of quiet and not so quiet areas, also a great place to watch the fireworks with the music played through the pool side speakers.

This place was great short walk to Disneyland.able to have snack services from 6:30am to 8:00 pm every night we were their.  The had breakfast cereal,bagels fresh fruit , etc. during the day and into the evening had cheese crackers veggies dip chips drinks both beer and wine.and much more . At 7:00 to8:00 pm had deserts. This was part of the package .when you thought you had enough you could take what ever wanted with you chips pop what ever. When booking this place we first planned to stay at calf.grand but for about $1300 less for 11 people and 1 small child we got the above Benny's an at the calf. Got nothing. Our room was fine just went out patio door turned right walked about 30 ft. And had great view of fireworks stayed on floor 3 room 337 only bad thing I have to say is

Summary Heading: OK but You Can Do Better
Summary: My family of 4 spent 2 nights at this property and were amazed that a Motel-6 type room would cost so much but you are paying for the convenience of walking to and from everything Disney which is a help-if you are willing to pay for it. First off-be aware that during peak times (especially in the AM when the parks first open) you will wait to get an elevator which are all small and hold about 2 strollers and the parents so, if you can, find out where the stairs are to go down and save a ton of time and only use the stairs when going to and from the mediocre pool and water slide. Second-Be careful in using the Monorail when GOING to the Magic Kingdom as it is small and, especially during the day, people are not forced to depart at Downtown Disney (few empty seats) but only at

Out of the 3 Disneyland resort hotels, this is our least favorite but definitely a nice hotel. We love the beach theme and the Disney perks. The major problem I really can't stand is the horrible elevators. They are super slow, old, and there's always a line. People seem to be sick of standing in lines at the park so when they're at the hotel they just budge in as fast as they can, oftentimes cutting off strollers and small children (dangerous!) If you're going to floors 2 or 3 or even 4 without a wheelchair or stroller, use the stairs!! It's good for you! The parking structure is great if you have a car, keeps your car out of the hot sun. We were pleased to hear it was free for our stay as vacation club members. The walk to downtown disney isn't bad but is the longest of the

Summary Heading: A lovely hotel, but quite expensive and too small for 5 people.
Summary: I'll start with the positives. The view from our 2 x Queen premium view room window was spectacular! We could see the entire California Adventure Park including the World of Colour water lights show of an evening. A short walk down the hallway to view the fireworks from Disneyland. An awesome doorman gave us complimentary valet parking during for our entire 5 day stay. This was very much appreciated and a great example of how the staff go above and beyond to provide exceptional customer service. The room was kept extremely clean and the decor was exactly as the website photos suggested... except for one very important item, the beach ball pillow! I actually forgot to ask while we were there. Not a big deal, but would have been nice for the kids. I arranged for a welcome gift

Summary Heading: Disney Prices for a Motel 6 Experience
Summary: Pros: 1) Convenient to Disneyland 2) Magic Hour 3) Relatively fast free wifi  Cons: 1) Had a Park View room but could not see out the window since the tint was warped. 2) Small and slow elevators. One elevator was not working during my stay. One time, it took me 7 minutes from pushing the lobby elevator button to getting off my floor. 3) Weak air conditioner fan. Takes a while to cool down room. 4) In-room safe only working intermittently. Needed to have battery changed.  You're better off saving your money and staying elsewhere.

Paradise Pier Hotel is a great hotel if you want to be close to both parks, Downtown Disney and the other Disneyland hotels. It is the cheapest cost wise of the 3 Disneyland hotels. The rooms are nice as you don't really spend much time there on this kind of trip. The bathroom shower curtain had a little bit of mold. The elevators are the slowest I have ever experienced, which is frustrating if you are in a hurry. Nice pool and slide.

We had been staying at the Grand Californian Hotel for many years so we were a bit hesitant to downgrade to this Paradise Pier Hotel.  Well, we were pleasantly surprised!  From the moment we pulled up in our car, we were greeted with outstanding service from the valet, bell services, and front desk!  Got there very early so we could take advantage of the magic morning.  I didn't even have to ask for a hotel card----the front desk agent knew exactly what we had in mind and so even though our room wasn't ready, she gave us our hotel room cards that we can use to get into the parks early.  We were there at 6:30am so we were able to not miss a beat and get into the California Adventure early.  And I was able to access my luggage from the bell services so I could get ready for a nice

Wanted to celebrate my daughter's 9th birthday (and first trip) at Disneyland. Had a very bad experience at a Good Neighbor hotel in the past. A previous stay at the Disneyland Hotel was unspectacular for the higher price. A happy medium was the Paradise Pier Hotel. Paid about $100 more per night for a premium room, but the view of California Adventure and having two queen beds and a day bed were worth it. Access to Downtown Disney and the theme parks was very convenient via a short walk through The Grand Californian. The staff were friendly, professional, and efficient. Other reviews complain about the elevator service but we had no problems. Housekeeping was good. Use of the laundry facilities on the 2nd floor cost about $7 per load, which covered the cost of detergent, dryer

We stayed here for 1 night for my son's birthday.  We were able to check in early, and received a text message when our room was ready.  I would suggest mentioning any special occasion when you reserve your room because we got a room upgrade because of it.  Our room faced California Adventure and we could watch the water shows.  They even gave my son a signed photo of Buzz and Woody.  The birthday package we ordered was waiting for us when we entered.  My only complaint is that there is a door hanger to fill out and place on your door at night to order room service for breakfast.  We placed ours outside before the midnight cutoff and it was still there in the morning.  The breakfast was ok, and the fees are a little ridiculous.  All-in-all it was a great experience and I would

What a wonderful and magical place we were treated like family. Convenient to both parks. Clean rooms and comfortable beds.  The staff stands up to the wonderful Disney standards. Can't wait for a return visit. The only down fall was the slow elevators.  This is something I can overlook. The cast more then makes up for that one minor flaw..... I would so. Recommend this hotel

Summary Heading: Disney magic with the Disney pricetag - but worth it in busy times
Summary: We've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and this was our first time at Paradise Pier - most of you will know that this hotel is the "value" amongst the Disney-owned properties (value being a relative term - you'll pay two times to stay at a Disney hotel what you'll pay off-site).  But honestly, I found no difference in the quality of the rooms, personnel or amenities in this property vs. Disneyland Hotel.  And if you're a California Adventure enthusiast, it's a shorter walk to that park from Paradise Pier.  The pool isn't as awesome as Disneyland Hotel, but it's adequate for cooling down after a day at the park.  The pool deck hosts fireworks viewing parties - and honestly with the audio piped in I'm not sure why you'd watch the show from the Magic Kingdom - sitting a chair with a

I love Disney and I try to go as often as I can but, like most people, I can't be taking weeks off work at a time to escape to Disneyland and California Adventure. This results in my husband and I taking 2-day trips and maximizing our time. This is where staying at Paradise Pier (PP) has the most benefits. While staying at PP, you receive a Magic Morning everyday at one of the parks (one hour earlier entrance time), which is great when you're pressed for time or just like to get an early start. Also, you get to enter the parks through a special entrance, avoiding long lines - another time saver. Other perks include being able to send your purchases over to the hotel so you don't have to carry them all day in the park, you can charge all purchases in the parks to your room, etc.

Great place to stay, friendly staff and just a short walk to Disneyland.  Really loved the room decor felt like we were at the beach, not to mention the extra pullout couch so the kids had there own space.The cafe was awesome, will def be making a trip back

Summary Heading: Expensive But Family Had Great Time
Summary: Not cheap, but your family never leaves the Disney park experience.   Provides great convenience to park.  Simple walk across street and pass through Disney Grand Californian and you have access to Downtown Disney.  Staff is extremely friendly.  Hotel is kept very clean.  Has self laundry facility (nice).  First night we arrived we sat by 3rd floor pool area and watched fireworks show to synchronized music (very cool touch).  We particularly like the included benefit of free delivery of purchased merchandise to our Disney hotel, so you don't have to lug it around the park. Rooms are standard size with Disney decorative touches.

Stayed at Paradise Pier for the 4th of July and had a GREAT vacation!  Close enough to walk to the park.  Early entrance and fast passes available,  The hotel had a nice pool area and you can watch the fire works right from the pool,  Disney itself was awesome with little wait time for rides and fast passes used for other rides which allowed us to walk right on. Enjoyed parades and fireworks. If you haven't done Disney, try Paradise Pier and say "hi" to Mickey!

One of the best things about this hotel is being able to go to the pool deck and watch the fireworks and listening to the music. Personally i didn't think the restaurant was that good although it did have good coco. The room was good loved the beach ball pillow. I would definitely stay here again. Its also just across the road from the grand californian.

Summary Heading: A perfect stay with top notch guest service
Summary: WOW is the first thing that comes to mind. Thank you to the entire Disney Paradise Pier Hotel team. You made our stay so memorable and went above and beyond to ensure my almost 4 year old had a magical time. My only complaint is that I wish we stayed one more night! From the moment we arrived and the front desk lady checked us in, our experience was seamless and friendly. My son was given a special button and signed picture of Mickey and his friends. The bell desk was awesome and helped so much (single mom traveling with a very excited child can be challenging). The guest services manager upgraded our room when I told him about our flight delays and lack of sleep getting in. I would never do Disneyland without staying at this hotel. The magic hour is AMAZING and so worth it. It

Did not spend a lot of time at the hotel, most of our time was at the parks.  All the staff were exceptionally nice and accommodating.  When we returned to our room in the evening it was spotless thanks to the housekeeping staff.   We did go to the pool on our first night, and it was packed, wall to wall packed.  That could have been due to the fact that it was 106 degrees. I will definitely stay at this hotel again

Summary Heading: High Price, no microwave, small room
Summary: The staff was friendly and helpful, to an extent. Had a 5 month old and needed a microwave and the hotel did not even attempt to obtain one. Just said we would have to upgrade to a suite for that. The room was crowded with the beds and furniture. Was within walking distance to Disneyland. The WI-FI did work well. No happy hour nor breakfast included. For the same price one mile away is the Embassy Suites and they have 2 rooms, plenty of space and a kitchenette with dining tables and multiple TVs, free breakfast to order and free happy drinks and snacks.

For a full Disneyland experience, we stayed on property at Disney’s Paradise Pier Hotel. There are three Disney hotels and they each offer a variety of amenities, character dining and child activity centers. As a bonus, if you stay at a Disneyland hotel they allow you to have all purchases sent to the front desk of your hotel for pick up the next day. Very nice, so you don’t have to haul a life-size Winnie-the-Pooh and Minnie Mouse around the park with you. They also offer depending on the season and day of the week, Magic Hour. Where with your hotel room key and ticket, you are granted special early admittance to the park, one hour before it opens to the general public.

Love it... but dang pricey.  We used to love the concierge level but this last visit was a bust. Most affordable Disney property so I can see why people stay. Small pool, small slide that's only open limited hours GREAT location to view fireworks!

What a great place!  We checked in on a Sunday stayed 6 nights.  Had a suite on the 15th floor.  Had the best view of Disney California Adventure!  We could watch the "World of Color" show, we could even see and hear the fireworks at Disneyland from our room!  The staff was great from the folks at the counter to the house keeping staff and the bellhops.  We had a great time at the Mickey and friends breakfast at the PCH grill and the granddaughters loved the movie area.  The pool was nice and sunny and the kids loved the slide!

I enjoyed staying at Paradise Pier.  I am not sure if I would rank it as nice as the other two Disney properties, but they do add the Disney amenities, which is nice.  We enjoyed our theme park view room.

Check in was fast and easy. We stayed Club Level for the first time as a treat for my birthday. We were thankful they gave us a complimentary upgrade to a theme park view room---it was a great bonus for my birthday celebration!   The room was clean and spacious. Everything was what we expected at a Disney resort. I like the cute beach theme of this hotel.   Rooftop pool with slide was nice. The kids loved it but it was too cold for us adults to swim in December.  The Club Lounge was a great bonus that saved us money and time on breakfast and snacks/beverages. A quick stop at the lounge before heading to the parks took care of breakfast and it was a great place to wind down in the evening with snacks and a beer or glass of wine. The kids enjoyed watching Disney movies while in

Summary Heading: Great Disney hotel - all the benefits with half the cost! Easy walk to Disneyland and Californian Adventure
Summary: We stayed in May 2016 (booked about 4 months prior) and found that PP was 1/2 the price of Grand Californian and about $150 a night less than Disneyland Hotel.    Here are our highlights: Beds - comfy, pillows were fluffy and comfortable Fold out bed was great so the kids didn't have to share beds.  (We had 2 queens and the fold out in the corner) Beach theme is cute - kids loved it. Bathroom is a little crowded - it is an older hotel that was bought by Disney.  Missing some of the little touches you may find in a Disney World hotel but overall it was good, generally the size/layout of an ordinary hotel room. Shower was a little weak - not sure if it was the water pressure or shower head but it was OK (just not great). Rooms were quiet - we were on pool level facing the pool

We just stayed here for 3 nights and we loved it! We stayed in a concierge room. Room was very spacious , clean and comfortable.  We had a great view of California Adventures along with World Of Color. Beautiful. Staff is very friendly.  Love the rooftop pool and waterslide. We got lucky with an outdoor movie poolside one night. They had complimentary bags of popcorn. Only wish they did this at each hotel each night instead of swapping. Love the concierge level. The snacks are delicious and love how they always show Disney movies.  The Surfs Lounge is wonderful for late night snacks or drinks. Wonderful way to end the day. Also enjoyed the Surf's Up breakfast with Mickey and friends. Great location. Very easy walk to the parks with easy access through Grand Californian. Can't

Summary Heading: Great Disney hotel for the price.
Summary: I stayed at the grand Californian and now the paradise pier mainly for the early entry benefits.  The paradise pier lobby looks like any normal hotel, but the rooms look similar to the grand Californian rooms.  I think you save about 150-200 a night and received the same hotel benefits.  The hotel is only across the street of the grand Californian. So in fact if you want to go use the savings per night on a nice meal at anywhere in Disneyland.

I was torn on how to rate this hotel. There was nothing special about the hotel but the location to the parks was perfect. The rooms are sort of updated with a Disney surf theme but bathroom and shower (oh the crappy shower) were old. We were able to walk back and forth at our convenience through out the day. We didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants or use any amenities so I can't say anything about them. Check in was slow and there was always a line when we walked through the lobby but the girl that checked us in was super nice. We were able to walk to Hertz when it was time for us to rent a car to continue our California trip which was convenient. I would have rated it one higher if it was not as pricey.  My husband just told me our room cost a lot more because we had the

I normally don't leave reviews but after having a horrible experience at a different hotel brand I felt it necessary to let everyone know about my experiences at this hotel. It is the absolute favorite of mine to stay at anytime we are in the Disneyland area. Everything is perfect and I sleep better at this hotel then I do at home. Food and restaurants are great. Play area for the kids and pool is awesome and my daughter cannot get enough of it! Perfect location for anyone visiting Disneyland as it is a simple walk either through the grand Californian or just over to downtown Disney. I can't say enough about how perfect this hotel is. I have worked in hotels for 20 years and this is my favorite hotel in California!

Large bright rooms, great service at the information desk. Being able to have the early bonus at Disneyland - fantastic! Great pool and view of the fireworks!!! Everything you need in the one place. Will definitely visit again - thank you for a great experience!!!

Disney Hotel, it had a lot of Disney touches which is nice. It is not Grand California extravagant but it is the cheapest Disney hotel so it is to be expected. It is quite a walk to the parks, need to cross a major street thru Grand California hotel. Room is decent w/ Disney touches. There is a small movie area that was great for my twin boys. The small Disney store in the lobby was a great place to get last minute souvenirs.

This hotel is directly opposite both of the parks and is better value than the other Disney resorts. Staff are wonderful and the actual Hotel is very clean and comfortable. The rooms are a great size and the beds are extremely comfortable as are the pillows. Breakfast is quite expensive but it is the same throughout all of Disneyland. Walk just across the road to everything so a great location, I highly recommend.

Great pool area!  We decided last minute to stay here and paid through the nose but it was so nice to be close to the park.  The pool area was what really made this hotel worth it!  Not the fanciest of the 3 park hotels but the pool and slide made our hot June visit great!  Staff is very nice and friendly.   Food isn't great but we didn't pick it because of the food.  Only downfall for us was we had grandma there to watch the kids at night and the bar/lounge closed early.

Summary Heading: Mickey Mouse, it's time to update this hotel!
Summary: We had to settle for a handicap room which meant a nice large bathroom but the adjustable shower head would not stay where you put it!  And the flat entry to the shower means the whole floor gets wet!  Bathroom countertop space was minimal.  No fridge, no microwave (time to update!) Very expensive but you're paying for the convenience of being able to walk to the Disney parks.  Parking is extra.  Hotel restaurant with Character breakfast was very expensive, $35 per person plus tax/tip.

A nice hotel but at a five star plus price You can easily walk to Disneyland via the hotel across the road The breakfast buffet is simply extortion for a very ordinary meal The pool though is a great place to wait our the afternoon peak at the the park The rooms are clean and the service is good The parking is close to the park as well

We stayed here for 3 nights as I am a bit of a Disney freak, but I was pretty disappointed. Not much Disney stuff around in room. Had to pay for parking, no breakfast included. Nothing special about it. We ended up staying 1 night at one of the Best Western Hotels and they were a lot better value for money, free parking, Wi-Fi and breakfast.

Summary Heading: Not the Disney service or quality you have come to expect
Summary: We found the service and general staff vibe at the hotel to be less than you've come to expect at a Disney property. If you took off their name tags the people at the check in desk could have been at any chain hotel.  When we arrived in our room the bathroom had not been properly cleaned and we had dirty dishes right outside our door. Before we went for dinner I went to the front desk to alert them and ask for these items to be addressed. No apology. When we returned, the bathroom had been cleaned, but the dishes not removed from the hall. I called downstairs and explained this was the second time I was contacting them about this situation. Again, no apology, but the dishes did disappear.  The pool is nice and you can watch the fireworks at Disneyland from the pool deck, which

First, all the employees are very friendly. The room was cute but small. The pool area is tiny and the water slide, billed as 184' I think, was a bit oversold. It might thrill a four year old? Obviously the advantage is proximity to Disney and the ability to get in an hour earlier. And those were both great.

Summary Heading: Most Reasonable of the Disney Properties
Summary: We stayed for 5 days in June 2016 as hotel guests with "club" privileges.  If the bell staff were not so crabby, our stay would have been much more pleasant - both arriving and departing.  However, the "club" privileges can ultimately save much money on snacks and breakfast in the park.  The breakfasts consisted of  bagels, muffins, fruit, yogurt and dry cereal, along with good coffee, milk, juice and water.  Afternoon snacks got me one day when the fresh vegetables and ranch caused me serious "stomach" upset.  That's all I'll say about it here, but I'm thinking they should wash those vegetables better.  That one episode ended ruining that particular day for me.  I sent my adult child to the Beachcomber's Club to fetch me some water and she returned empty-handed when the

It was my first time staying in a disney hotel, and it was pretty good! Got to see paradise pier and it was close to it, so why not? Yeah, it's overpriced, but that's what happens if you stay in their hotels. :/

The hotel was ok, nothing super great but we think for the price we probably could have stayed somewhere else. It was maybe a 10 min walk to Disneyland so it's not super close, I thought I seen others that were closer. The one convenient perk is the extra hour we get before the public entrance. Other than that I would stay somewhere else unless the price is not a factor

This we our first time we stayed at a Disney resort hotel while visiting Disney. We did it because we were only buying two-day passes (1 park/day) and wanted to get the extra magic hour. We paid a hefty bit for staying on resort, but the jury is still out on whether it was worth it. When we got there it took a while to check in. There must've been some problem (or they gave our room away) because after a while the front desk clerk came back and said that we were getting a "free upgrade to a park view room". We didn't ask why because we were all so tired. The room was okay (in need of updating--looks like it is 'well-used') and we did appreciate that there was a couch daybed so we could split our boys up and give them extra room. The refrigerator in the room never got very cold

Summary Heading: Good value for money, close to the action.
Summary: I've stayed twice now at this hotel, and will be staying a third time this December.  The service is a bit hit and miss - the first time I went with a friend and we were treated to wonderful service and chipper attitudes from all staff we encountered. However, on my last visit there I must've caught all but maybe three staff members on really bad days as I received surly attitudes, a total lack of enthusiasm and effort - forgiven only because of the most lovely valet who kept me company as I waited for my airport shuttle. Valet aside, I received more friendly reception from other hotel guests.  That aside, considering the location - about a five-minute walk to Downtown Disney/theme parks - I believe it's worth every dollar. It's the cheapest of the three on-site hotels (still

Summary Heading: Great place to stay good value for money
Summary: We have stayed here a few times and have always loved our stay. The staff are friendly, room is always clean and close to California adventure. I would definitely recommend staying here as it is good value for money compared to the other Disney hotels.

We have stayed at the other two Disney properties and loved them even though they are overpriced.  I have not stayed at this one because it seems a little farther away and didn't seem as exciting.  We booked it because it was the cheapest.  I had read reviews that said people were frustrated with the elevators.  We didn't ever wait a long time for the elevators and we were there during a very busy time.  The room was on the 10th floor and had a view of the California Adventure.  It was a gorgeous view.  We stayed on the 10th floor.  Since the hotel is smaller you don't have to walk as far to your room as you do in the other two hotels. If you cut through the Grand Californian it isn't that far too walk.   We really enjoyed our stay. We also had a room with 2 queens and a daybed.

Summary Heading: Good hotel but in need of a fresh up
Summary: Comfortable rooms with clean bathrooms but some areas might need freshening up. Some areas, like the breakfast room are coloured for kids, but looked scary to me. Mickey and Minnie passing by made it all good though. The food is good too. Service was slow though. All in all a comfortable but non-impressive stay.

I have stayed here several times in the past. The room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. The AC worked perfectly.  My only complaint about the room was that the hot water didn't get very hot. The little snack bar/bar was a great place to stop after a long day at the park.  The elevators were just fine except when everyone was coming back from the parks and had giant strollers.

Summary Heading: Convertible bed was hard and you need a cover to keep springs from jabbing you
Summary: Typical Disney attentiveness and service. great! Would have been a five if not for the horrible convertible couch mattress. If you need acupressure and acupuncture, this bed is made for you. Otherwise do not count it as a sleeping device. Torture device would be more accurate.   Choose the bed by the bath if you want to sleep comfortably somewhat. By the desk and furnace a/c, you will freeze. If they complain and adjust you will burn up. Just an FYI. No happy medium here.

This pains me to write since it's a Disney hotel.  We stayed for 2 nights.  The cast members were very friendly and helpful.  The elevators are hit or miss as far as how slow they are and how many people are getting into them.  The room is very large.  The bedding is beautiful and the mattress is very comfortable and so are the pillows - great night sleep.  Unfortunately though I think this hotel needs a total renovation.  Needs new furniture and wallpaper.  The bathroom vanity is so low it's as if it's made for children so it's difficult leaning over to brush your teeth.  There is a lot of wasted space.  They do have a refrigerator (although it's more like a mini cooler and doesn't really get that cold so I probably wouldn't put milk in there) and a coffee maker in the room

Amazing. Glad we didn't stay off property. Getting magic Hour entrance to park was worth the price of hotel rooms. Parked the car for three days and walked. Ate at Downtown Disney most nights and had wonderful

Summary Heading: Most spacious standard rooms of the 3 onsite hotels. Great Experience.
Summary: Our family of four has been visiting Disneyland almost yearly, we didn't go in 2008 or 2013, since 2007.  In the past we've stayed at The Grand Californian and the Disneyland Hotel, with the Disneyland Hotel being my favorite because of its contemporary decor, lush grounds and room size.  This year, however, we chose the Paradise Pier because both the Grand and Disney were way, way over priced. Not sure why the huge price increase over last year.  Anyway, it all worked to our advantage.  The rooms at Paradise Pier are bigger than the other two onsite hotels.  The closet is huge and we could fit both my luggage and my husband's in it face up and opened for easy access.  Kids luggage fit nicely in a recessed part of the room, so no clutter.  I hate clutter.  The room felt

While this is not the nicest Disneyland hotel, it is certainly the most bang for your buck. I loved the walkable feel of the area, and the fact that this hotel was just a few minutes away from the park entrance on foot. Even better, the back pathway to Downtown Disney had you there in about 5 minutes flat. You had easy access to restaurants and shopping galore, as well as an easy stroll to the monorail entrance to the Disneyland park, or hop across the street through The Grand Californian to access the entrance of California Adventure park. It was so close to everything. The hotel itself is simple, but very clean and updated enough. The elevators were slow, but nothing like the monstrosity that we had built up in our minds when reading reviews before our trip. The room was

As someone who goes/has gone to WDW quite a bit, we thought it was time to explore DL/CA. Disney's Paradise Pier was a really nice hotel, the only thing I would suggest to pay the extra money and fave the park (the view looks awesome at night). We faced the pool area, which was fine. But you did see a parking lot and what not. Paradise Pier is a short walk to downtown disney and the parks. Unlike WDW , there are no food court like areas in the hotels. Only character dining and a small bar area. The theme of the hotel was displayed everywhere, which was fun. It's also pretty close to some family restaurants if you're trying to save some money. Both coco's bakery and I believe it was named Tilly's, had good food for a reasonable price! Up the block you can catch a bus to the beach

Summary Heading: Location is great, everything else average at best
Summary: Our family of four stayed here for four days for our stay at Disneyland. I can't recommend the hotel. Just too many things wrong here. Summary:  The Good -Getting in early to the parks "magic hour" is a definitely a plus -The location is a 15-20 minute walk to the park through the Grand Californian and Downtown Disney  The Bad -Lobby gets very congested with old elevators that don't adequately move people up the floors -Eating options are very limited in the hotel -No real bar in the hotel, the one bar is adjacent to the snack bar and is not a great experience -Hotel feels run down and in need of an update  We had some poor service experiences with this hotel. We had ordered some things from Amazon for delivery based on our dietary needs and the staff just couldn't figure this

We stayed here for 7 days. Our first stay at a Disney hotel. Very impressed. Used valet service the entire time and they were so nice. Used room service several times. Room service attendant who delivered was so nice and helpful. Front desk staff when we checked in the gentleman who checked us in was so nice to our kids. The bellhop with our luggage was awesome. They gave us a room on the 3rd floor where the pool was for our kids. The life guards were always nice. Housekeeping always did an awesome job and always put my daughter's stuffed pooh bears on the bed in cute positions. Character breakfast is a bit pricey so we cancelled but next time will do it. The little snack bar down stairs was cute and people were nice. Only bad thing I would mention is when u do the magic morning

Summary Heading: First time at a Disneyland resort... was pleasantly surprised...
Summary: I decided on trying a Disneyland hotel this trip with my 2 boys. It is a little more expensive than the surrounding hotels in the area but I wanted to try the whole Disney experience with the Paradise Pier Hotel. We arrived around 1030 am and wanted to let the front desk know I was here, so when a room became available they could let me know. I was pleasantly surprised when the front desk (Denese, I think) found a room for us and even gave us an upgrade to a park view room. We checked into room 810. The room was plenty big enough. There were 2 double beds and a day bed, which would be enough for 5 people. The room was clean. It had a mini fridge, which helped out a lot. It had a great view of Disney California Adventure. There was a small desk, as well. It is just a good all

Summary Heading: Clean and Friendly, but way overpriced for what you get ...
Summary: The rooms were dated but clean , beds were comfortable , OK bathroom with one sink. We stayed on the 3rd floor over looking the entrance to the hotel facing DCA , not much of a view and the noise form the street was a bit annoying , but since the pool is on this floor it was a convenient walk with the kids.   Pros: Enjoyed a magic morning everyday, that was nice and allowed us to see much of the parks prior to the crowds.  - Nice view of the fireworks from the pool area, they pipe in the music which was great.  - Staff was friendly and always willing to help  answer questions.  - Good WiFi on the 3rd floor  Cons :  - Lets discuss the elevator situation , or lack of.. VERY SLOW elevators and with there only being 3 for the entire property they were often crowded, sometimes

Summary Heading: Not far from park, but not the same quality as the other Disneyland Hotels
Summary: Let me start off by saying we never ate at the hotel. The Sand Bar was closed (not sure why) in the middle of the day. The PCH Grill was booked too far in advance once we got there, but it looked good.  We had a room on the 4th floor with a "pool view". It really isn't a view except for maybe families who want to relax and watch their kids out in the pool area. You face away from Disneyland and California Adventure and get the pool plus trees and some other buildings as the view. This wasn't a huge deal to me as we came to go to Disneyland.  The room itself was a bit small. It had a King bed, a small couch, a desk, and a TV cabinet. All of it was kind of packed in. We are both on the big side and had it been any smaller it would of been cramped. Just enough space to move around

Summary Heading: Too expensive with no value added
Summary: I really wanted to give my family a great experience this year by staying onsite at Disneyland Paradise Pier in California. I paid way too much money for a hotel that wasn't any different than the one I stayed in 2 years ago with my family. It wasn't close to the the entrances of the parks. There isn't a shuttle for you to take to the entrances. The older Disneyland hotel was closer than the Paradise Pier. Upon checkin we didn't get a run down on everything like I heard other families receive. I learned more eavesdropping on their checkins. We didn't know about the movie nights. We were staying 3 nights. The room was basic with a view of the park. There wasn't a microwave or breakfast. The prices for the restaurant were very expensive. The pool was advertised as heated but not

We chose to stay at the Paradise Pier for our first family vacation! I am unable to compare this hotel to the other Disney hotels, but we loved the room! The hallways are spacious. The noise volume was low (even with Trump down the road and helicopters overhead!)  The pool and spa were a great experience to escape the heat of the park in the middle of the day and to relax! The location to the park was great, a very short walk through the Grand Californian and Downtown Disney!  Our room was on the 12th floor, with a park view. Wonderful experience! My family watched the World of Color, as well as the parade from our room (on the 3rd day when we just needed a break!)  The room was very spacious for my husband, myself and our 3 daughters! We had the character breakfast at PCH

I visit Disneyworld almost every year and this year we decided to try Disneyland.  I booked the Paradise Pier which is listed as a Moderate Hotel.  The room was nice, and the theme through the hotel was nice, but I was overall disappointed with the experience there.  At Disneyworld, I have stayed at a Value Resort (Pop Century) & Moderate (Wilderness Lodge) so that is what I am comparing to.  The hotel only has 4 elevators total.  My mother has a scooter and we were on the 4th floor.  Every single day of our stay, it took almost 20 minutes to get to the lobby.  Every elevator that came, was completely full so she couldn't fit, and the elevator only came 4 or 5 times in 20 minutes.   Even if we wanted to take the stairs, its not an option.  I have no idea why, but both staircases

We stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel from May 5th - May9th 2016.  We can now boast we have stayed at all three Disney properties.  I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with the Paradise Pier.  Of the three properties, this hotel has a lower price point then it's two sister properties.  It is clean and very quiet.  The rooms were spacious and the beds comfortable. We travelled with our two teenage daughters who have A LOT of stuff.   The room offered enough space to store all of our luggage and things, without bumping into each other. The walk to the Parks was short.  You are encouraged to walk through the Grand Californian to make your way to your destination. The hotel offered a fitness centre, which my daughter used and said it had just enough equipment to get in a quick

I am a DVC member and have visited both Disneyland and Disneyworld before - Disneyland in the 1980s and Disneyworld many many times since it first opened. My home at Disneyworld is the Boardwalk. We stayed for two nights at the Grand Californian - beautiful and then for the next three nights at the Paradise Pier. This hotel is not magical or whimsical enough for me. It was clean and the person who checked up in was wonderful = I wish I could remember her name. It looks like the window pane seals have been broken and water has gotten in making the view blurry. I was worried about the elevators as it was quite crowded when we were at Disney but we never had a long wait or a problem. The pool is tiny. When I return to Disneyland we will not be staying at this hotel.

Paradise Pier Hotel at Disneyland totally met my expectations.   Not quite as fancy or "magical" as its sister hotels (Disneyland and Grand Californian), it served its purpose in getting us close to the parks and still feeling that Disney magical touch.  ;o)  The hotel was clean, the hotel staff was pleasant and helpful.  It was super close to the parks, and we enjoyed the "special" entrance into California Adventure offered only to Disneyland guests staying on property.   The room was large and clean.  The bathroom was very nice.   The free wifi worked fine.  I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting the full Disneyland experience without the paying more for the other hotels.

Summary Heading: Magic Morning Early Entry worth the cost for the room
Summary: Great location to enter the Disney parks.  Also Magic Morning early entry is a plus.  Get up early to bee the crowds.  Staff were all helpful and very friendly.  Nice to have an "elevator monitor" for the busy times when the elevators are overloaded.

This was our second stay at a Disneyland Hotel, the first being the Disneyland Hotel.  Well I felt this was not as good as the Disneyland Hotel for some reason.  I just can not put my finger on it.  The theme was ok but I think not enough for what it was supposed to be, beach type.  In my view perhaps a bit limited theme wise.  The benefits are the same being close to the parks with a short walk putting you at Downtown Disney and both parks.  We had breakfast at the PCH Grill with the characters and while the price is a bit too much for the food choices the character experience kind of offsets it somewhat especially if there are little ones with you.  If I had to choose again it would be the Disneyland Hotel versus here but that is just my opinion.  Service, staff, everything

I love Disney. It costs extra to stay on-property, but for Tinkerbell Half Marathon Weekend, we decided to splurge and book a room at Paradise Pier. We have stayed at the Grand Californian before and really enjoyed the atmosphere and proximity to the parks, and were hoping for the same benefits, but with a more fun and beachy theme.  Pros: Proximity to parks Proximity to start of race corrals for the 5K, 10K, and Half. Incredibly comfortable beds and very nice bedding (it was hard to pull ourselves out of bed at 3:30, and not just because of how early it was!) Watching the Disneyland Forever fireworks show from the pool deck (they pipe in the music and it's a great view). Watching "the World of Color" from one of the hallways facing California Adventure. I wish there was a

My friends and I went to Disneyland for the fabled Tinkerbell10K and Half Marathon, so we wanted to stay at a Disneyland hotel.  Paradise Pier was a lovely place to stay.    The rooms were decorated in both a Disney and a fun beach theme.  Our rooms were on the third floor, so we had an outside patio and could walk directly to the pool and to the fireworks viewing area. The pool area had a side hot tub and a water slide!  We stayed on the concierge level-- a first for me. With that came a place for breakfast, snacks throughout the day, and a Disney concierge for extra help with reservations, tours, or questions about the parks.   The only downside to the hotel was the walk to get to the parks: across the street, through the Grand Californian and into either California Adventure

Summary Heading: The Ugly Step Sister of Disneyland Hotels
Summary: This average Disney hotel (not Resort) had a previous life as a non-Disney property and it shows, despite a pretty average Disney overlay of décor, names and slapped on decorations.   The disappointment takes center stage in the Lobby - hands down the most depressing and average Disney hotel lobby of ANY Disney hotel in the world. Disney has done very little to make major improvements to this early 80s space, and it shows. From the flooring to the ceiling, to the architecture, it's all wrong.  The rooms however, are a big improvement over the public spaces. Many of the rooms are fairly large, comfortable and colorfully decorated. They are good - not great. There are however, some great views of California Adventure and the room upgrade to park view is well worth the extra money.

Amazing hotel. Best way to visit Disney. Go to parks an hour early. Go thru hotel. Had park side room so watched fireworks AND laser show from comfort of room. Quiet. Luxury bedding. Valet parked. Cast members are top of the line... friendly, professional and more than just helpful. Loved the gift shop. Valets, front desk. Wished the jacuzzi wasn't filled with young children unattended so adults could use it in afternoon. Maybe life guards could fix the problem. But would HIGHLY recommend as way to go. Thank you Paradise Pier Resort!

A great hotel right in Disneyland. There is a fun waterslide and a nice pool. You can see the fireworks from Disney on some nights. The hotel itself was nice and everyone who worked there was very helpful.

We loved everything but it could've had a couple more options for eating. It was great to be on Disney property to get early access to the park. If we purchased anything it was sent directly to the hotel for pickup the next morning, that was a great perk!

The hotel is conveniently located across the street from the Grand Californian where we usually stay.  We could not get into the Grand this trip so gave the PP a try. (Pricing was more affordable at the PP, the Disney Hotel is more expensive and most expensive is the Grand.) The PP was quiet, hassle free, friendly accommodating front desk considering all the requests I had for our room type.  Rooms were spacious, housekeeping incredible (even when requesting late cleaning), the view was FANTASTIC! (see my photos). One would pay a pretty penny to get that view at the Grand. This view is seen from all the premium view rooms at the PP (rooms are either premium or standard), which are a lot less expensive than the standard, no view rooms at the Grand. (Wished the rooms had balconies

I stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel to attend a conference taking place at the Disneyland Hotel's convention center and I have to say that the staff appear to really enjoy their work. I was only able to stay one night due to occupancy and transferred to the Disneyland Hotel the next night.  From check-in to gift shops, and restaurants, floor greeters, to check-out, everyone made me feel that they genuinely were happy that I was there with them.  The hotel rooms and grounds are nice with a beach theme throughout and Disney touches all round that makes the place relaxing.  Likewise, after a full day working and traveling, arriving at my room I felt immediately relaxed. To sum up the room, it's fun!  (see the pics.)  The only down side at this hotel is the very slow elevator

Summary Heading: Our 2nd stay won't be our last
Summary: We first stayed at Paradise Pier for our honeymoon and recently for the Tinkerbell half marathon. When planning our trip, there was no question where we would stay. Paradise Pier was fantastic last time and nothing has changed. Staff were friendly and helpful from check-in and Patrick was able to find us a room even though we were checking in early. The rooms are comfortable, clean and spacious. They may be starting to look a little dated, but haven't lost the magic with the Disney touches in the decor. The beds are very comfortable so you can expect a good nights sleep! The only issue with the hotel is the elevators are very slow and you need to keep this in mind if you have somewhere to get to. The location is very convenient in regards to the distance to both parks and

I've stayed here twice and have never had any issues. Staff is friendly and it is only a short walk from the park. The rooms are clean and more spacious than I thought they would be. The rooms facing the park have a great view, but if you're budget-concious the carpark view rooms are basically the same room minus the view (and cheaper), and I'd recommend it if you're planning to stay late in the parks and won't need a view. You can also hear the World of Color show from these rooms (its not really loud, but you will hear it) so if you go to bed early you may want to consider this when picking rooms.

Summary Heading: Hotel staff are friendly. Location of hotel is good.
Summary: The hotel staff are friendly and willing to help us. The location is near the Disney downtown and Disney Land. It is about 10-15 minutes walking from hotel to disney land. The room is OK for us. The price is a little bit high for its room.

I've stayed at this Disney hotel the past 2 times I've been to Disneyland (star wars half marathon & the tinkerbell half marathon). It's extremely convenient for the races and to the parks as well--which is the perk of staying at a Disneyland Resort hotel. When you stay at the hotel you get extra magic hours (going into one of the parks an hour early). The lobby has what park the extra magic hour is for each day--you just have to have a valid park ticket & bring your hotel key card.  This hotel is located across the street from the Grand California Hotel, which you can walk through to get into California Adventure or Downtown Disney. It's a super easy & convenient walk, less than 10 min--great after a long day at the parks! The hotel itself seems a little dated but I'm there for

Any Disney hotel is the best option to stay at if you are planning to spend most of the time visiting the parks. We stayed here because one of my friends recommended it and we were not disappointed. Everything is just perfect, the room was amazing, the views, the overall experience... you just have to go there. There´s no perfect words to explain how amazing our time at the hotel was, even when we didn´t spend that much time in the room. Staying at a Disney hotel also offers your the magical hours and believe me, they were well worth it. The breakfast with the characters was also pretty cool and the food delicious. It is so close to the parks and thats a plus when you end up pretty tired from walking all day.

The staff is awesome!!! The room is plenty roomy and the sofa in the room is a pull out bed. Housekeeping cleaned the room spotless and even gave us extra shampoo and conditioner. My 2 adult daughters my 4 year old granddaughter and I stayed in the hotel from April 29th to May 3rd 2016. one of the days was my birthday and i was surprised when we returned to the room and there were red roses and baby's breath in a white vase, a very nice book, a red Mickey happy birthday balloon and chocolates on the bedside table. i have stayed in the Disneyland Hotel many times and the California Lodge once but I will be staying at Paradise Pier Hotel from now on. Oh, the Character Buffet Breakfast is wonderful. The dinner buffet was good too.

We have stayed here 4 plus visits.   We usually stay off season and stay away during summer peak attendance.   I'm a former native of southern California.   And this hotel fits the bill for casual fun luxury.   We use the walkway through the Grand California Hotel to enter the parks.   Supper fast short cut.  Highly recommend the PCH grill at the Paradise breakfast buffet at least once.   Sure its pricy but the characters  (Daisy,  Mini, Goofy, Stitch and  Pluto) come right to your table and interact.   Stich is the best.  Loves to interact with the kids.

We stayed there for the Tink Run and loved the location to the run.  We loved the size of the room and that their is a couch in the room.  Also, loved you could go to 3rd floor by pool and watch fireworks with the music from DL.  Definitely will be back!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when time is a factor
Summary: This was a great place to stay.  We were able to start our day early, come back to rest, and then stay late into the evening with our children.  It took the stress out of this short trip. The person who checked us in was amazing!  He cared what room we stayed in and wanted our happiness. Lastly, they have a great pool area.

We had a great time during our stay. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel is very kid friendly and very close to the park. We walked to the park and it only took about 6/7 mins. The shuttle was not available when we went otherwise it we could have also used that route. I would definitely recommend it to any family's during their Disneyland trip.

Just returned from a week's stay at this place. On a scale of 10 would rate it 6. 1st impression driving up is that u would never know it's a Disney property. The only clue is that there is a goofy statue in the lobby. The hotel room is well worn out. The only thing disney is a mickey lamp. You can hear people 2 doors down. $2. for a single banana (yes I know it's disney, where bleed u till they have shaken every last penny out of u). Slowest elevators I have ever experienced!  No shuttle service to park. The hot tub next to the pool area was a joke...bunch of non supervised kids constantly in it...staff gave no mind. 12 plus rides or attractions were closed down. $18. A day for parking at a place that I was paying over $200. A nite!  the first  and last time at this place!

Paradise Pier did not start out in life as a Disney property, and it shows. However, Disney has done a good job in converting it to one. It provides a more affordable option for those wanting to stay "on property". While the Grand Californian and Disneyland Hotel may be more desirable, Paradise Pier is certainly an acceptable option as well.

We would stay here when it was called the emerald hotel in the 80s. Disney purchase it and worked it's magic the drawback is the rates more than doubled. The result is a very nice addition to the Disney resort with a great view of Cali adventure!

After staying at a few different "good neighbor" hotels, as well as Disneyland’s two other properties, Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian, this was our first time at Paradise Pier. We got a great rate, so it was an easy decision—and one I’m glad we made.   While many reviews note you can spend just a bit more and be at the wonderfully magical Disneyland Hotel (which it is) or spend a lot more and live it up at the Grand Californian (also incredible), I think Paradise Pier is right on the money for families who are willing to pay for the perks of staying on property, but are not concerned with some of the more high-end amenities the other two hotels offer. Paradise Pier doesn’t have the amazing view at concierge level or the sophisticated dining options the others have,

There were a total of 8 of us and we had 2 rooms that were connecting (such an amazing experience for the grandkids!).  We had premium view rooms, so we overlooked California Adventure.  Every Cast Member that we encountered during our trip was fantastic and displayed the level of service that you would expect from Disney.  We had drinks at the Pool bar, treats at the lounge and Character breakfast at the PCH grill, all were fantastic! Our entire group had the time of our lives, we made memories that will last forever! Being able to enter a park early each day was a huge benefit, one that we enjoyed every day of our stay.  We stayed here for a total of 4 nights/5 days.  I would recommend staying here to all of my friends and family. Thanks to all of the staff for helping us to

The Disney Paradise Pier Hotel is the cheapest out of the three resorts at Disneyland.  It is not luxurious in any way.  I was expecting something better for the price we were charged per night.  However, it does have its perks.  The Magic Hour which allows you to enter the theme parks one hour earlier than the public would be one of the best benefits for staying at one of these hotels.  Also, the room key allows you purchase food at any restaurant or shop at Downtown Disney, or the the theme parks.  The staff were really helpful and knowlegeable.  The staff at the hotel shop were extremely helpful,  we purchased something at the park which was of poor quality and although I did not have a receipt they were willing to give me a credit note.  The character breakfast at this hotel

As an Annual Passport holder for Disneyland, I've stayed in quite a few hotels around the area and the location of the Paradise Pier is very good. Like the other Disneyland Resort Hotels (the Disneyland Hotel, Grand California), the prices are steep and the room amenities are not in line with what I'd expect anywhere else for the prices paid. Essentially if you slap the "Disney" name on something, prepare to see the cost double for really nothing more than that name. I'd really love to see a Disney hotel property with the same attention to detail that the Imagineers employ through out the park, but since people happily continue to fork over their hard-earned money hand over fist, I am doubtful that will ever happen.   The shortage of elevators (four for this size hotel?) and the

My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend to celebrate our anniversary.    We arrived around 12:30 and our room was not ready yet, but we were able to get checked in quickly and headed off to find lunch. A couple hours later we received a phone call to stop by the front desk for a different set of keys as they had to change our room. This time there was a long wait to get the new keys. We got them finally and went up to our room, which had two double beds in it. So back down to the front desk to see if we could be put in a room with a king bed. Another wait in line, and they were able to move us to a room with a king bed and finally we were settled. I should have verified when they switched rooms it was a king room.   The lobby is small around the front desk area and is

Let's just get this out of the way:  None of the Disneyland Resort hotels are worth the money that they charge.  For $400/night, I'd rather be in Venice .. . . Italy, that is.  But we happily stayed in a suite for 4 nights which was clean and comfortable.  The furnishings had seen better days (chipped armoires, lumpy bed, vanity in bathroom that wouldn't close . . .), although the bathroom fixtures seemed almost new.  The elevators, as frequently noted below, are indeed slow, awkwardly placed as to  maximize blocking traffic flow through the lobby, and there aren't enough of them.  Whoever designed this hotel should be placed in elevator purgatory, forced to endure their wait indefinitely.  It's pretty obvious this place was not designed by Disney.   We had a room with a view

Summary Heading: BEST view of DCA, day and night
Summary: If you get a room on the north side, Premium rooms, you'll  have the best view of  Disney's California  Adventure(DCA)  and/or Disneyland  of  any other hotel. The post card view, see attached, from way atop of DCA was worth the PREMIUM. Very comfortable  rooms, beds and temperature. A fairly  good walk to enter either parks, even though the hotel  is just across the street from DCA. Best CLUB LEVEL food and drinks, all day long. My cell or wifi did not work so well from 13th fl. Staff are always helpful and friendly. I  will be back very soon.

I loved watching the cast members prepping the park for the day - the view of World of Colour and the fireworks is fantastic. We were on the 14th Floor, lifts are slow so plan accordingly. Housekeeping a little patchy with coffee supplies not stocked and we didn't get much of the Disney magic in our room, (some reviewers talk of treats being left for the kids). Beds are super comfortable and plenty of toiletries and towels in the bathrooms. Check in seriously slow especially after the parks close so if possible go early and check in, we did this and still had to wait over 30mins to find out the room number - they need to staff the front desk better at these peak times.

Summary Heading: If traveling with a larger party splurge for the one bedroom suite!
Summary: When traveling with two under two and a set of grandparents a one bedroom suite is the way to go! This is the only hotel on property at DLR with two restrooms! What a huge win for a party of two infants and four adults. The one bedrooms facing the parking lot tend to be larger than the ones that face California Adventure, although the view of the park is great after a long day in the sun. The rooms that face the park have a great view of world of color and you can have the music sync'd on your TV. The fireworks can be viewed as well from the rooms that face the park, although I would suggest the pool deck on level three. If you are at all superstitious this hotel does have a 13th floor. The PCH is great and when character dinning you have a chance to meet almost all of the fab

Did the character breakfast and the young ones in our group loved it. Got personal visits from Pluto, Minnie, Stitch and others. Also photo time with Mickey. Much easier than standing in lines in the park for the character photos. Well worth the 45 per adult price. Kids 3 and under were free. Call the various Disney numbers for breakfast reservation times. They do book up quickly.

Paradise Pier is convenient to Disneyland and California adventure. Super nice beds. Also the pool is nice for kids and adults. The hotel has nice small tv room in the shops area for kids to sit in. We had dinner with characters which was tons of fun for my 5 yr and 8 yr old kid. If you get the room facing the parks, then you can see beautiful night view or fireworks.

We stayed here this weekend during our visit to Disneyland and California adventure and it was great. No complaints. Bed was comfy, room was spacious, flat screen TV, gorgeous view, nicely decorated and very clean and quiet. Would definitely stay here again. It's awesome to just be able to walk a short distance after a day at the park and be at your hotel. Only complaint would be the remote for the TV didn't work very well.
