We stayed here five nights to celebrate a special birthday. The room was fine. Most everything worked. The room deco does need updating. The location is pretty good, especially to the two other Disney hotels. Housekeeping did not refresh the amenities as they should. We had a park view room and were disappointed at the bad window tinting.  Also, the day we arrived, the Internet Wi-Fi was not connecting. After several calls to guest services and AT&T connection services, they send up a room engineer.  The room engineer was technically challenged, but he did show me where the modem and router were in the room. I simply disconnected the router, and was able to connect – I assume via another room.   I would return, but much prefer the original Disneyland Hotel.

Summary Heading: If can afford not to. Don't stay here.
Summary: The general reception was good. The rooms are standard with very comfortable beds. We identified 2 main problems. First, the elevators. They have either been programmed very badly or there are just not enough. There is NO popping down to the foyer or the restaurant to get a quick drink. Expect to wait at least 5 minutes each trip ( at least). During heavy periods you'll be lucky to get down in under 10 minutes. There are emergency fire escapes on the outside of the building that many guest did start to utilise. Apparently the higher levels have priority and don't have any problems. Try to get above level 5. There are 2 restaurants. One is buffet style and the other is a la carte. The problem is that during our stay they were very understaffed and response was slow or non

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great service, great memories.
Summary: My husband & I took our son to Disney for the 1st time. We booked at Paradise Pier, mainly due to it being more affordable than the other Disney hotels. We went to check in around 1300, all hot & sweaty from walking around the parks all morning. We were told our room wasn't ready, but they would upgrade us to a suite & call us when that was ready. I'm not sure why we were given the upgrade. Maybe because we looked exhausted & they felt bad that our room wasn't available yet? Who knows, but I was pretty stoked & I thought it was such a nice gesture. The front desk staff were really amazing.  We headed back out to Downtown & the parks (a pretty short walk) & returned around 1600. We checked into the one bedroom suite in room 822 & the view of California Adventure was awesome. My

The employees there were helpful and happy. The characters at breakfast were perfect, our grand kids loved them. The buffet was well stocked, and a chef came out to help with food selection because of food allergies. They have 4 elevators seemed like enough until the morning and evening rush. We waited 20 minutes one night. Our room was nice, beds comfy, and the adjoining room was a big help.

The staff (or cast members) at the Disney Paradise Pier Hotel were all very helpful and friendly and the 10 minute walk across the road and through the California to get to the Disney park was not unreasonable. After reading previous reviews I was concerned about the elevators, but we never had a noticeable wait (we were heading out by 7 am every morning) and were pretty high up. My son loved the room service - great breakfasts and dinners at (hotel) reasonable prices. The view from our room of the Disney rides was great, all in all, the hotel exceeded our expectations and it was a good 'launchpad' to send us into the Disney parks during our stay.

It's across from California Hotel & Spa which has direct access to Disney California Adventure.  The staff were friendly and helpful, and the rooms were nice but the walls are thin, as you can hear your neighbours. The hotel rate was not worth it, except that my sister and I wanted to be part of the 60th diamond celebrations. We were in Disneyland in May 2001, and we had stayed at the Disneyland California which was even more expensive at $450 USD a night. So I guess it'll be another 15 years before we go back again.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay on Disneyland property
Summary: We have stayed at all three Disneyland properties now.  We choose this one for our most recent trip to try it out.  It is still pricey when you compare it to the Harbor Blvd properties, but it is so nice to be able to walk across the street from the GC and use the resort guest entrances.  You can't beat staying on property when you can swing it :). The rooms at PP are nicely decorated and the pull out couch it is nice for larger families or those with teenagers.  The movies by the pool, proximity to Downtown Disney makes this a great choice. The staff was very helpful and very typical of Disney :). My one big disappointment was the pool area.  The pool is too small for the resort.  The pool are was packed daily and a little claustrophbic at times.  If you are looking to do some

Our room was spotless and comfortable. Easy walking to Disneyland. Very helpful staff. Arrived early and were able to check-in and get a text when our room was ready. All our rooms were next door to each other as well. Our character breakfast was here as well.

I would just like to say our stay with your hotel was less than satisfying. Upon check in was unpleasant when the cast member was not very friendly and was just trying to rush us through the line. I understand being busy but when you have comments or concerns with how the magic morning hours work and with how to check your luggage and you are being told short soft answers when it is loud in there is not appreciated. Our room was 1218 every morning we stayed we told the house keeping staff that our sink in our room did not drain and that it would stink,(never was fixed) also there was mold under the sink. We also had to ask them to change the linen due to blood on the pillow cases from the prior guest. We spent over $90 on room service one night to have it brought up cold and

If you are considering this hotel you are an in-betweener.  You are willing to shell out the big bucks to stay at the resort but are still conscious about price.  Otherwise you would just book the Grand California and be done with it.    We have stayed at both and would happily return to either but for the money the Paradise Pier is the better choice especially if you don't plan to use the pool.  To start with, the rooms are similar in size and quality.  True you can get bunk beds at the Grand California but these aren't guaranteed.  The Paradise pier is a 5 min further walk and let's face it, we all need more exercise.  The lobby of the Grand California is much MUCH nicer but you will still walk through it every day because it is a shortcut to the park.    My family thinks the

Summary Heading: Best Disneyland Hotel Prices, Least Convenient Location
Summary: Disney’s Paradise Pier Hotel is the least conveniently located of the three Disney hotels in Anaheim, and the least expensive. All Disney properties have attractive pool areas, offer early park entry via an exclusive gateway for hotel guests, feature Disney character restaurants, Disney character wake-up calls, and provide package delivery service to your room so you don’t have to carry your theme park souvenirs all day. On the plus side, when you stay at a Disney resort hotel you never have to leave the magic of Disney. On the negative side, when you stay at a Disney resort hotel you can never leave the magic of Disney.

Definitely not worth the outrageous price! This is nothing more than a glorified motel 6. The hotel itself is worn and extremely run down, the windows in the room have leaks in them and you can hear traffic even on the 12th floor. The premium rooms have a nice view of California Adventure park but the film the hotel has put on the window creates a weird wet look when looking out. The beds are very firm and kind of lumpy and the room decorations are nothing to get excited about, very sparse Disney. The only restaurant is a buffet and definitely not worth the exuberant amount $40 for adults. Your only option for getting food is the hotel's lounge that sells limited kinds of food and beverages at limited hours and at Disney prices. Basically everything in the hotel shuts down

The arrival was smooth and the check in was nice and friendly, the hotel doesn't have slow elevators I don't know what people are talking about, normal elevator speed. The beds were clean and comfy, the hotel is half the price of the other Disney hotels because the amenities are fewer and less grand, but is close to Disney and clean which is all we cared about. Didn't use the pool but had a view of it, the floor is all peeled and worn looking giving it a dated look. Could use a lot of updating everything is older but its clean.

This hotel was very good.  We've always stayed at one of the Good Neighbour hotels in the past but this time decided to try a disney hotel.   The location was very convenient.  It is the furthest of the three hotels, but still close to California Adventure and Downtown Disney.  The signage isn't very good, so it does take a bit of time to discover the quickest paths everywhere.  For going to Disneyland, when you come out of the main doors, make a left and go left at the first street.  Head towards the Disneyland hotel, once there take the monorail into Tomorrowland. This was by far the quickest and less congested.  Going to California Adventure go through the Grand Californian unless you are making use of magic morning at 7am. The line ups were massive, it was much quicker to

Summary Heading: Nice but nothing special for the price we paid.
Summary: Our stay was for four nights, we left a superb hotel in Vegas on The Strip for a third of the price, to arrive here for the last part of our stay in California. We know disney is special we have been before (Florida) and we love it. This hotel booking was a treat saved for the kids at the end of the trip, having never stayed in a Disney Hotel before! I wish we had booked The Hilton, which we could see from our window!! The staff are friendly, the room was clean, the pool area is small and dull! Overall, for the price we paid this place is a let down, nothing awful but it certainly doesn't have The Magic!!!!!!

This Disney property is located across the street from The Grand Californian Hotel. While it doesn't have its own direct entrance to the park, that can be a benefit. As a guest,you are encouraged to use the Californian and Downtown Disney entrances to the parks so access is quick and easy. The benefit is the people traffic is reduced to guests only at Paradise Pier. The restaurants aren't as crowded and there isn't any lobby congestion. The pool area was easily accessible and wasn't overcrowded. The rooms were quiet and we heard our "neighbors" only once during our stay. It was the perfect get away for our family and full of all the magical touches you'd expect from Disney.

Summary Heading: A good third tier Disney hotel
Summary: I suspect that if you have not stayed at the Disneyland Hotel or especially the Grand Californian that Paradise Pier would have seemed more exceptional. However, when you compare it to them it is a very distant third. This is not to say that I did not enjoy my stay but I found it lacking in numerous areas in comparison. It is the most "generic" of them with the least Disney theming.   Some people call this the "budget" Disney hotel in the area and that's not the case. It is still pricy and for not a lot more you can stay at the superior Disneyland Hotel. It is NOT a budget hotel by any means.  The staff were typical Disney and by that I mean very helpful. Regardless of everything that I did not enjoy, you will not find better service at non Disney hotels I've found.  The room

We decided to splurge and stay 3 nights here while visiting Disneyland. It was a very fun hotel and the customer service was amazing! Everyone was very accommodating and helpful. There is a full bar with a restaurant for sit in or take out food that was very good and fast! The front desk staff was very nice and really went out of their way to help with everything! Make sure to go to the character breakfast with the kids! it was one of our favorite things we did. The rooms were kind of standard/small. The bathrooms were very basic. We wanted a park view room but they were oversold so we ended up with a view of the parking structure. For the money we paid to stay at this hotel, i was hoping for more when it came to the rooms. We had stayed at the Double Tree the night before, paid

Travelled with my husband and 2 girls (10 & 11).  We had a 9th floor, premium view room. The room was a good size and had 2 double beds and a sofa. Our room overlooked California Adventure Park and we watched the world of colour show from our room, which was great. We could not see the fireworks as we were on the south end of the building. The girls used the pool area and it had a waterslide, heated pool and spa. Lifeguards on duty as well. The hotel was only about a 10-15 minute walk to disneyland and so we could easily  go back and forth through the day if needed. The route was a bit confusing, not well signed. Had magic morning access available each day but only used it only once as the girls were so tired from the days activities they had trouble waking up.  Had an outside

Hotel was nice and clean. Beds were comfortable but the roo doesn't include a microwave or a Keurig. For the price it wasn't bad but I'd rather stay at the Howard Johnson. Food at the hotel is extremely expensive so if you can work around it. We had done an express order for breakfast and they didn't pick up the request from our door so we had to run down to find out why. For two orders of Mickey waffles no drinks just what you see in the picture it cost us 37.00USD a little much

Summary Heading: A bit of splurge but worth it
Summary: Stayed here several times, its not as expensive as the grand Californian or the Disneyland hotel. They have a great pool with slides and  bar next to pool area, rooms with view of California adventure are great. Magic morning pass also make it worth it. A  little off subject but this will complete a great family trip, when going to Disneyland, book the welcome to Disneyland tour, its around $25per person, 2hour tour and you get souvenir pin and fast passes, along with walk-in onto a ride with tour guide.

I took my 2 girls to Disneyland for Spring Break and since we were traveling without my husband, and I didn't want to pay double for the Grand Californian, we opted for Paradise Pier.  I wish I hadn't done it.  Although the room itself was fine, I was awoken multiple times each night by crying infants in the room next door (which was occupied by two different parties while I was there).  I have now learned my lesson to always request a room that does not connect with another.  The offerings in the Club Level Lounge are not up to par with that you would find in the other two on-site properties either.  The pool is small and leaves a lot to be desired.  In short, for me, Paradise Pier was the "cheap" option and I got what I paid for.

The room and view of the park was fantastic.   We could see the fireworks at night .The beds were comfortable and the food at the hotel was good.  The bathroom was large and had all we needed including a place to hang swimsuits.  Kids loved the heated pool and slide.   Would definitely stay again.

this hotel was average but is pretty close to the parks. It is still at least a couple blocks worth of walking before you get to the park entrance and the initial walk over is not very well marked. Using the resort guest secret passage at Disneyland California adventure helps except don't plan to use it for the early morning entrance unless you get there extremely early. It can't handle the people that try to use it. We were given a handicap room since  we didn't check in until after midnight. The bathroom had no counter space. The room was on the 3rd floor with a balcony and next to the pool which was very nice and you could watch the fireworks from the rooftop. There was not much seating on the rooftop except for the pool area. Lifeguards were on duty when the pool was open

There are no exhaust fans in the bathrooms 5 people in one room too crowded. Very expensive for why you get.  Seeing the fireworks from our hotel was awesome. Outdoor movie time was good, able to use the pools from one hotel to the other Disney hotels was great. Should have been up front about paying for parking. Expensive!

Stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel during the Star Wars marathon. This was our first time at the hotel and really enjoyed it. Wished there was another food option in the hotel but it was an easy walk to the other Disney hotels and Downtown Disney. It was awesome to stay there during the race. It was a quick walk to the start line on the race morning. It was also fun to see the half marathon racers from our room the morning of their race. We would definitely stay there again.

This was my second stay and is my last. I booked the park view with club level. Such a waste of money. From the second we pulled up it was bad. The bell service did nothing, so I pulled into a parking spot to check in. I had to get someone to help me with my bags. Once they realized we tipped, then they wanted to help us with a smile on their face. When we stayed at Disneyland hotel they walked up to the car and took the bags out.  The room was big but over 1/2 of our view was blurred out due to the window film coming off. Beds were horrible. Every time we moved they made horrible noise and they actually hurt our back. The room was not clean, every time I turned around I found stuff from previous guest. Chopsticks, lotion, and hair ties.The bathroom was not clean found hair

we stayed here to be closer to the Parks on this trip and to avoid a bus trip to the park each day , as we had done before. We have a child with an intellectual disability and behavioural problems - the staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful to us as we sometime struggled to manage our son's behaviours. He also has coeliac disease and we had no problems with getting safe food for him either at the Concierge lounge or at the PHC grill. The help they gave us was above and beyond and truly helped make an amazing holiday for us. We know that it's expensive compared to the other hotels nearby but the Disney attitude to disability which was also present in the hotel, was well worth the extra money. We love you guys and will be back!!

Summary Heading: Fun family stay close to Parks
Summary: Quiet hotel, pool is decent, not great compared to other Disney hotels we have stayed at, but it is the budget one on this location.  Easy access to Downtown Disney and Parks.  Rooms and bathroom good sized so thought value was there.  One downside, no sit-down restaurants on site except expensive buffet and Character breakfast - just a quick coffee/quick service spot.

My family adores this hotel, my son calls it the Goofy hotel as you are greeted by a large Goofy statue upon entering. The service of the staff is always stellar and the location near the park cannot be beat. The character breakfast located in the hotel is also one of our favorites, Mickey's Surfs Up. It is California surfer themed, of course with the Disney accents, and offers conference rooms, a workout facillity, a pool, a nice sized gift shop, a children's theater viewing room, and cafe as well as the restaraunt. It is located near the California Adventure pier and overlooks the park, rooms with park view see all the way to Cars Land, it's enchanting. It doesn't have its own CA park entrance but is near the Grand Californian and that Hotel does. While this is the less

So I was a little late booking a room for a quick two day visit on my way to San Diego, and the only options left were a suite and premium view club level. Since I didn't need a suite and wanted to stay onsite I paid the extra money for club level with a view.   I love this hotel and love that it is a short walk to the park, so everything was as expected in that department, but I wanted to say a few things about Club Level.  I wasn't really sure what to expect and for an extra $100 or so per night I'm not sure we got our money's worth out of it (granted we only stayed 2 nights so it might have been another story if we were taking our time on the visit).  We were thinking we might be able to get a nice breakfast out of the morning offering, but it was a little on the thin side.

You will have to plan and hunt to get a good price- but it is the least expensive of the three and so worth getting into the park early.  Also, it is not so big.  Other hotels are so large it takes 20 minutes to find your room.  This hotel you can get in and out of quickly.  Easy walk to the park and there is a medical service that can drop off a scooter right to the hotel.  We have stayed there several times.  Book late at night and call back during the day to add triple A discount.

We stayed 5 nights at the Paradise Pier.  "We" consisted of me, my wife, and our kids 10, 8, 6, and 2.  The location was great and with the day bed we were all able to fit (probably won't in another year).  If you plan to spend time at the hotel then there are other nicer locations but as a central location that is easy to get back and forth to the parks, this is pretty hard to beat.

We stayed here for three days with my husband, two kids and my mom. We had a standard room - I was worried that we would be crowded (it was, but not bad at all) and it was actually pretty great. My one son was in a crib (we brought one, but they had one to use in the closet) and my other son slept on the daybed. The hotel isn't anything fancy - and that is perfectly fine with me. My husband and I went to the roof for the fireworks display, it was amazing! The chairs had just gotten washed down so there was a very nice staff member handing towels out to sit on. The bar was a nice place to sit down and have a drink after a long day at the park. Loved the magic hour into the park - that was worth it right there. I would definitely come back!!   There is a nice gift shop in the

We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite and loved the room. 2 bathrooms!  My kids loved tossing around the beach ball pillows.  Nice view of California Adventure.   One of my favorite things was being able to watch the fireworks from the 3rd floor pool deck.  They play the music that goes with it too so you get the full show!  Nice buffet restaurant for dinner at PCH Grill .  My kids and I loved the Mickey waffles from the lounge.    Here are 2 issues I have with this hotel: 1.  The elevators take a long time. 2.  If you park in the ramp and want to bring in your luggage yourself, beware!  There are NO elevators in the parking ramp.  You'll have to drag your bags down several flights of stairs.

We stayed here for 3 days then moved to Grand California Hotel and Spa.  Our kids and grandkids were here and we had ajoining rooms. Which is really nice with little ones. The rooms were comparable for  both hotels but that was about all.  The Grand California is beautiful, much nicer pool and prettier.  No bathrooms no pool service near the pool at Paradise. You had to go 3 floors in your swim suit thru the lobby and could only bring 2 drinks back.  The walk didnt seem bad to the park the first day but by the third day coming back was a lot of walking.  At the Grand California you are already in Downtown Disney and Calif adventure Park so no walking back to hotel.  Its was so nice. Eating in the Paradise is bad too. Although Mickey and Minney are at the Character Breatkfast

Have stayed Disney Hotels in Florida and was disappointed in nothing but California seems to have different standards except for price. Dirty diapers can be found in hallways commonly. Don't call front desk for anything as they do not answer. Rooms are average motel 6. Had a blast with the grandkids but would not stay on property again. Just not worth the extra expense, concierge level is a joke.

A couple positives of this hotel is that it's a short walk to the parks so there's no need to rent a car. And some of the rooms have a great view of the nighttime show over at the California Adventure Park, but you have to pay extra for the view of course otherwise it's the parking lot view. This hotel definitely needs to be redone. It's outdated. It really feels like a Best Western that they stuck the Disney name on. The bathrooms are small, our tile floor was chipped right next to the bathtub so water had gotten in there, which didn't seem sanitary, and our bathtub took about 45 minutes to drain. Also, don't bother with the "Concierge Floor". It's nothing more than a few tables set up with some snacks. Not worth it at all. I would HIGHLY recommend spending the extra money and

Family frieny rooms with lots of space. Room for kids to do homework and fridge to keep snacks in. Rooms offer great views of the park at night and fireworks. Customer service was great and waterside kept kids busy

We enjoyed our stay at Paradise Pier.  The room was spacious enough and we liked that there was a convertible futon in the room for one of our kids to sleep in.  The Disneyland Hotel was not too much more $, though, and I think we ultimately wished that we had stayed there instead as it is obvious that this hotel did not start life as a Disney property.  With that being said, it didn't hold the same "magic" that the other Disney hotels would have and we could have stayed off property for a better price and been just as close.

We stayed for three night. I was wary having read other reviews, but this hotel was perfect for us. Close proximity to Disneyland, perfect for families with small children. The kids loved the kiddie pool. We experienced friendly staff and no elevator issues that others had posted about. I would recommend if you want the Disney hotel and location without the price tag of the other Disney hotels.

This hotel was nice.  Nothing special but it is a great location and reasonably priced for the area.  You sometimes had to wait 20+ minutes for the elevators as they are very slow and everyone is waiting for them.  Ended up walking up 14 flights of stairs more than once.  Breakfast with the characters was really good.  Food was really tasty.

Summary Heading: Elevators are the issue with this hotel
Summary: I almost didn't stay here after reading all the other reviews. The wait for elevators is very long you can take the stairs if you can find them. We had a great experience besides that. The room was ok and it needs a refresh. The view was great. The club level might not be worth it. Its really only snack food so you can't plan on that as being a meal. Breakfast was cereal, fruit and pastries. Lunch its just chips and apples. Dinner they have appetizers. They were all good but we ate other places. The Service was excellent. Mo, drove my husband to Mc Donalds  because our son has Aspergers and will only eat certain food. Mo also arranged for a taxi to the airport when our shuttle didn't show up and the hotel paid for it. We will stay here again because the staff was great. You need

Stayed here for a business meeting. It is a very nice, modern and upscale hotel. The staff is wonderful. The rooms are large, very comfortable  very clean and stocked with plenty of towels, toiletries and even a little coffee maker and refrigerator. They have a nice pool and Jacuzzi. Just short walk to Disneyland.

The rooms are nice and they are very nicely decorated. The biggest problem is that there are no internal stairs so everyone is relying on the elevators to get up and down, quite the mess most days especially after the park closes or early in the morning when people are headed to the park. This alone will keep us from staying here again.

Love the fact they were offering a great rate in mid-week Feb.  None of the other Disney properties were extending a discounted rate. This place was clean and convenient for walking to the parks. Love the early access hours as well.  Also worth noting, there was room for the 5 of us which is not always the case in a single hotel room - score!

I read the other reviews after I booked this hotel and  I almost cancelled. I'm  glad I didn't cancel. Our room was clean, beds fine, towels normal for hotels (bleached and stiff).I had read negatives about these things. Our check in was smooth, room ready early, and they had a balloon and button for my son's birthday. You can also buy park tickets at the front desk to skip the lines at the park. Park is across the street and through the Grand Californian, any easy walk. The absolute best reason to stay at this hotel is to watch world of color and Disney fireworks from your room. Request a room on the highest floor possible and pay extra for park view, or don't bother staying there. Pool with waterslide was also fine. You are paying for the view and because you're at Disneyland,

The staff was super nice and helpful. I give them an A+ for the staff. The goofy up front was cute. But the hotel was NOT worth the money we paid. It was not what I would expect from Disney. I've stayed in better best western hotels for a 1/4 of the price. The walls are thin and people woke us up all morning in the halls. The bathroom was tiny. The beds were kinda hard not too bad though. The  couch bed sucked and didn't fold out into a bed just a little spot and my kid cut herself on the edge of it when getting out of it. If I were you I'd stay at the hotel across the street. We went through there to get to Disneyland and it was really nice inside. Looked well worth the money and I bet the rooms were nice too. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. Like I said staff was

Summary Heading: Disappointing for a Disney owned property
Summary: When we checked into the hotel, there was a long lineup of people checking in.  It took them 10-15 minutes to check in every guest.  Very inefficient checkin and not enough help. When we got into our room on the 10th floor facing Disney Adventure, the window was so distorted and dirty you could not see through it.  We paid of $65 night more for view room. We had to go back to the front desk and wait another 30 minutes in line to complain.  The desk clerk acted like he knew the that room had problems and immediately gave us a new room.  Not sure they were renting that room.  I don't think anyone would pay that price and not be able to see out in a clear manner.  The room was a corner room. We went down to the little restaurant in the lobby and was waiting in line to get a

Summary Heading: It's a 3 star hotel - it's OK
Summary: I stayed here with the family for a week while I attended a tradeshow at the Anaheim Convention Center.  This was my 2nd say here in two years, and nothing much has changed.  As long as you set your expectations that this is a 3 star hotel, then it's fine.  But if you have higher expectations, you're going to be disappointed.  Room was like I remember.  Decent size, beds were average, work desk was average, TV full of Disney channels and bathroom was average.  Worst thing was that the shower couldn't keep a steady temperature.  Even if I left it on the same setting, the water temp would jump from too hot to too cold and back.  Kids loved the beach ball pillows.  Food options are limited.  The Lounge is OK for a quick, simple bite (the Mickey waffles are good for the kids).  The

This was our first visit to Paradise Pier. We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and the Grand California Hotel. We were here with our daughter and her family to take our grandson to Disneyland for his first visit. Since he's three, we didn't feel like spending the money to stay at the Grand California Hotel. We would have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel but they were remodeling the pool and Goofy's Kitchen was closed to renovations. I knew this was Disney's value property, but since it was Disney I thought it would be fine. What a disappointment! The lobby is substandard and tiny! Check-in was less than pleasant. After a 20 minute wait, the "Cast Member" bordered on rudeness. She curtly told me our rooms weren't ready, they would "try" to honor my reservation and we would be

Very expensive but condition of rooms is below average. Mildew in shower, noisy air conditioner, paint wearing off door edges, dirty furniture, etc. Sure, it's across the street from Grand Californian and yes, it is owned by Disney - but it's lightyears worse than that place. Spend your Disney vacation money elsewhere.

I just finished a three night stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel at Disneyland.  I was with a group of 25 business associates that were combining business with a little pleasure as a reward for Yearend accomplishments.  The hotel was great. The rooms were clean and fresh and the location is perfect for getting to the Disneyland.  The hotel staff was courteous, well informed and very helpful.  The only issue was the elevators.  Oh, my!!!  The wait for the elevators took up to 10 minutes at times and the elevators moved at a snails pace.  If they ever get the elevators fixed it will be the perfect Disneyland Hotel.

The room was perfect for a family of 5 as the couch slid out flat into a bed.  We stayed for 4 nights. The location was good, about 10 min walk to entrance of park.  The pool was awesome and the kids really enjoyed the waterslides and pool and hot tub.  You can see the fireworks from the pool area at night and they pipe in the sound system from Disney too.  We had lunch one day at the hotel and the food was OK. For breakfast we just ate at Starbucks on the way walking to Disneyland.

We spent four nights here in a club level premium view room. This hotel is very convenient to the parks. However, I would not rate this as a four star hotel. The amenities are lacking.   The room itself was ok. The beds very hard and the bathroom is quite small. Towels and bed linens definately not four star quality.  Our biggest disappointment was in the club lounge. Breakfast was hard boiled eggs, small muffins and pastries, fruit and cereal. Same thing everyday nothing changed.  They advertise afternoon snacks but they consisted merely of barbecued potato chips or Doritos, cookies and fruit. They no longer have water bottles for you to bring into the park. They have three flavors of soda and one flavor of juice box for the kids.  We have the afternoon appetizers one night

Rear seats stolen from our suburban while parked in hotel parking deck.  NO active security on duty, though they have 2 cameras, an entry gate with arm, and, 2 manned exit booths .  3 cars hit in early morning hours.  Disney didn't see it as they don't actively man their cameras.  I reported the theft at 7pm the following night.  The Disney claims dept would not return multiple voice mails or emails.  Didn't hear from them until a week later.  All 3 families left on their own to secure 3rd row seats on order to return home.  Disney's policy at this hotel, their lack of response, A JOKE.  Staying at Paradise Pier??  Beware

Summary Heading: All round great hotel for families
Summary: Stayed here for four nights in early January. The location is perfect for Disneyland, Downtown Disney and the California Adventure Park. Only a 5 minute walk to all, and very safe at night walking to and from the hotel.   Were a family of three, the themed rooms were very comfortable.  We had a room overlooking the California Adventure park and views of the nightly fireworks were spectacular.  Theres a few perks when combining a Disney hotel and park entrance. Check the Disney website.  We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Very average hotel in a great location.
Summary: Stayed in this hotel many years ago when it was new and not owned by Disney. Hasn't changed that much. The rooms are typical of a hotel you would pay about $100 a night but will cost you $250-300 a night.  Restaurants are obscenely overpriced. A decent breakfast buffet for two with Disney characters running around was $85. Service good, staff very pleasant. Tough to make the case that this avalanche of average is worth the amount of money they are charging. Not a lot of negatives or problems. Just a ridiculous markup on everything much like the theme parks themselves. Go to the Marriott or Hilton and save $150 a night.

Summary Heading: Convenient and a little cheaper than the other Disneyland Resorts
Summary: We've been staying here several times a year now -- we live locally to Disneyland, but in this case, joined out of town friends staying at one of the hotels.  We like the location, the casualness, slightly less expensive than Grand Californian and Disneyland Hotel.  Like the rooms, especially.

The best way to experience Disney is to stay in one of their hotels.  We had the most amazing family holiday at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel and can't wait for the opportunity to come back.  We especially loved the pool for cooling off during the day.  It's an easy 5 minute walk from the parks.

For starters, I cannot say enough good things about the staff at this hotel, particular mention goes to lovely Donnie who always went out of his way for us. This guy is a gem.  We purchased a club access room, which provided buffet's at breakfast, snacks, lunch buffet and dinner buffet and drinks - it was the best decision and the children loved it.  The staff in the club room always went out of their way for us and made us feel special. Especially at night when mums and dads were treated to hard earn glasses of wine and beer!  The pool and slide was a huge hit with the girls as was the viewing platform for the night time fireworks.  The gift shop is expensive - as is all of Disney - (fortunately we had visited Desert Hills Outlet mall on the way to Disney and we bought all our

Summary Heading: An excellent place to explore Disney's parks
Summary: I have stayed at several of the Disney parks resorts over the years and Paradise Pier definitely lives up to my expectations of Disney properties. The rooms were impeccable eclean and even though the hotel is been there for many years it seems at least in T really like its almost new. We had a room overlooking the park high floor and it was spectacular. The beds were comfy and cozy. Internet Access is included in the hotel price. And it is a very short walking distance over to California Adventure as well to Disneyland. And because you're staying at the Disney property you got extra Park hours at both parks and that is a very nice feature because you can explore the park almost by yourself. The three hotels on the Disneyland property area are not that big and so the number of

The room was neat and tidy, the hotel staff were helpful and friendly. We found the ability to have our shopping sent back to our hotel very useful, it allowed us to shop in the morning when it was less crowded. The hotel was a short walk to Downtown Disney and the California Adventure park was easily accessed via the Grand Californian hotel across the street. We had an excellent view of the World of Colour show from the large windows in the hallway. There were decent meal options in the hotel restaurant and the kids zone was brilliant with movies, arcade games, drawing and more. I would definitely stay again.

This is a nice Disney hotel but Disney definitely has better.  Elevators are really slow and not enough elevators for the crowd. Beds are hard like a rock.  Disneyland hotel or Grand Californian are better choices.  Staff is very good and really save this place from a lower grade.

This was an average hotel, with a few special amenities (water slide - it was closed for us due to weather), a tv room for little ones with cute chairs and Disney shows going. Our door would not open when we went to settle in, it took them quite a while to fix the problem. The restaurant, with a buffet and all the characters was wonderful. Great food, all the fun characters for the kids to meet, BUT it was over $200 for our family of 5. Way too much...AND they try to sell photos to you on top of it all. Jesus, Mary, and Joseph, we are not made of money, Walt, we simply wanted some good food, a nice Disneyland experience for our family and a convenient, nice place to sleep. I do not see us EVER choosing this hotel again.

This is my second time staying here and I will always come back! Its the more affordable of the three Disney hotels which is great for my budget. The staff are always friendly and helpful no matter how late it is. It's a quick walk to Downtown Disney which makes for a lovely walk to the parks. The rooms are cute and clean and decent sized. They also have a great view for fireworks from the rooftop. The decorations were great and you can meet Mickey and friends in the restaurant. Can't wait to come back.

I had an issue with the water in my room during my stay, the temperature fluctuating between boiling hot and freezing cold. It was impossible to have a proper shower. I have matinance in my room multiple times but the problem wasn't easily resolved.  That is fine, things go wrong. But an alternate room wasn't offered, and when I mentioned it on checkout my grievance was ignored. I just hope it was properly fixed before a family checked in, their child would have been in serious danger of being scalded by the hot water otherwise.  Some sort of Disney Magic would have been nice but I found the magic missing for majority of my stay. Disappointing. I'll stick with Walt Disney World for my international trips :(

Summary Heading: great location, early access to park
Summary: I asked for Adventure park view upon checking in, Clerk said its $45/nt plus tax, good thing i didn't upgrade because of the traffic. Our room has the view of the pool (831) with 2 queen beds, No microwave in the room. The f/d  service is average. convenient to park. The problems with the hotel include poor elevator access... they have 4 elevators and are sooo slow especially in the morning.

We were overwhelmed with the size of the hotel. Then we walked into the lobby and registered. We went up to our room and the view was unforgettable. We are going back in May, and can't wait for the club level with a view.

We had a club level room on the top floor overlooking Disney's California Adventure.  Amazing view and we could watch the night time shows at California Adventure and Magic Kingdom from our window with the music from the show on the TV.  Clean room and large bathroom.  Shower was a bit small but we didn't mind.  Easy access to the parks and loved early entrance!!!  Wish they had a better night time lounge on property.

Summary Heading: A Disney Weekend Alternative for SoCal Residents
Summary: Our travel plan included a day in Disneyland and a day in California Adventure. Instead of driving back home (2hrs), we chose to stay in this hotel. Our initial impression was a good one. The hotel was easy to get to (although not without some L.A. traffic drama) and located 15-minutes walking distance from both parks.  Although check-in was 3-4 PM, the hotel allowed early arrivals to park in its parking complex so that folks could go enjoy the parks until check-in time. (DO NOT DO THIS IF YOU HAVE VISIBLE "STUFF" IN THE CAR!!).  Our room appeared well kept; except that there was a slight unpleasant smell that was noticeable to all three of us.  Not knowing what the source of the smell was or where it came from restricted our freedom within the room a bit. However, because we

We've stayed at all three of Disneyland's owned hotels, and several of the Good Neighbour options. If money is tight, then you're better off staying off-site, especially since many local hotels are a 15 minute walk to Disneyland's Gates.   With that said, Paradise Pier Hotel is the perfect stay when looking to be on site at a semi lower cost. The atmosphere is fun and relaxed, and the park views are incredible. Especially with the World of Colour nighttime show available from your hotel window. The best perk of course is gaining early park access with Extra Magic Mornings. Paired with the exclusive hotel guest entrance for California Adventure these perks are too good to pass up. The ambiance is purely Disney, and there's just a sense of Disney Magic around you when staying on

Summary Heading: Location was great, parking was easy and the rest was average
Summary: We live in southern California so we stayed here in order to make the most of our teenager's birthday weekend (stay late, start early).  The parking was super easy when we arrived early and we were able to park at the hotel and spend the day at visiting Disneyland without having to re-park.  Check in was easy as well.  Our room was supposed to be a "superior view" but really we had a view of the street, some trees and the tops of the rollercoaster at California Adventure.  Not so superior in my book but oh well.  We literally just stayed in the room for about 8-10 hours total (to sleep, and shower).  The room was average - just average.  Stuffed "beach ball" pillows were supposed to give the room a beachy feel I guess...?  The room was clean and the bathroom was adequate and

My sister and I enjoyed a wonderful stay on the concierge level. We arrived at 8am. We self-parked (We were only charged $18 for the entire two days we were parked). They quickly check us in, stored our bags, and sold us our tickets. We walked across the street, through the Grand California and into the "Extra Magic Hour". We returned around 1:30 and took advantage of the drinks and bar snacks in the concierge lounge. The lady was so kind, we found out alter *after receiving a text with our room number, that she was sorry that we had to wait so long, so we were upgraded to a Premium View room! When we returned for the hot horderves, drinks, and other snacks, we took it back up to our room and sat overlooking the beautifully lit California Adventure. What an amazing trip! Notes:

We have been here twice, and it did not disappoint. On our last night, my husband had really hurt his foot. The guest services opened the store and got him some ibuprofen.  Great service.  We slept well and had a great time. However, my favorite part though, of staying on property is the EARLY hour in to the parks :). That is worth it to our family.

Summary Heading: Room theft last week definitely put a damper our stay!
Summary: Really the only purpose of this review is to warn all future guests of the Disney Paradise Pier Hotel that our seventh floor room was burglarized while we were in the parks! When we returned our door was not latched! We quickly discovered that while we were in Disneyland that evening about $1800+ worth of clothing, luggage, handbag, keys and electronics were stolen from our room. We immediately called the front desk and soon after Disney Security arrived to interview us and make their report.   Be advised that Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel is an older property with old-style door latches that may stick and not shut completely by themselves. This certainly was the case with our door.  Also be advised there are no security cameras in the hallways to aid in crime prevention.

What you would expect from then clean and family friendly, Great place to stay close to the park,straight from the airport  Can check in go to park & then stroll back have a rest & head back to the park for some night time fun

Summary Heading: Magic from the moment we walked in!
Summary: From the moment we got out of the car it was Magical!  Although a little expensive compared to non-Disney properties nearby, it was our teenage daughters first visit to Disneyland, so we decided to go all Disney!  Our cast member at check in was just as excited as they were, giving them Badges and pictures - all the staff members were wonderful and made our stay extra magical.  Would recommend to everyone!

Our family party of 10 (2 teens, 8 adults) stayed in 3 standard rooms on the 5th and 10th floors in January.  I had read some recent reviews that were critical of the staff and rooms, but decided overall the reviews were mostly positive.  We were very pleased we chose to stay here.  We stayed Jan 7 through 11 to spend 5 days at Disneyland.  There were reviews that commented on the "worn" appearance of the rooms, however I saw only minor signs of wear that would be expected, it is not brand new!  We were very satisfied with the rooms, clean, comfortable nicely appointed.  We did have 1 set of adjoining rooms on 5th floor and that was great for spreading out.  5th floor had a fair view of the park, I would reccomend a higher floor for best viewing of the park at night.  Location

Summary Heading: My favorite place to hang out in Disneyland
Summary: The pier, restaurants, the location.  It just goes on and on. Just enjoy the view, the food, the good karma all here at the Pier. Once you get that feeling to move on, you just again take your time to enjoypres what is presented to you and more.  Yes, you feel like youre on one of those piers in California, but all of them wrapped up into one!

Summary Heading: No easier way to get to Disneyland
Summary: In December 2015 we were going to Disneyland and wanted to do the 2 day hopper Made reservations at the Disney Paradise Pier Hotel for 2 rooms facing the Parks. The hotel it's self is located right across the street from the parks, Our rooms were very nice and very comfortable. Being on the street, the windows were single pane and you could hear some noise from trucks,etc. Also, these rooms only come with 2 queen size beds, even though they offered King size beds online. I went thru Expedia and it may have been stated on Disney's website but not on Expedia. The beds were Very comfortable and the staff at the Paradise Pier Hotel were a pleasure..  Our next visit to Disneyland later this year, we will be staying at Paradise Pier Hotel.

We stayed at the Paradise Pier for a RunDisney race weekend, in a Club Level room. Because of the cooler January weather, unfortunately, we were unable to enjoy our easy access to the pool. (And the pool rooms don't have much of a view of the parks.) However, the room was a great size for our family, with two queen beds and a pull-out couch, and there was more than enough room for both people and luggage. With the exception of one morning, we did not have any problems getting onto an elevator at any time (which I'd read would be a concern).  The Beachcomber Club was really useful to us during our stay; we ate breakfast there every morning, and had no trouble finding a table. We also popped back to the lounge in the afternoons for quick snacks and drinks. Actually, the lounge was

Summary Heading: Best hotel I have stayed in
Summary: This hotel would have to be one of the top two hotels I have ever stayed in, with in 5 to 10 minute walk to the happiest place on earth Disneyland and California adventure park, it was absolutely amazing, the facility's were great restaurant, gift shop, laundry, pool and fitness centre, the staff were so friendly and helpful, my room was immaculate and so nice, and I had a fabulous view of California adventure park from my window. I could not recommend this hotel more highly to anyone.

We just came back from our second time staying at this hotel.  I'm happy to say it was another enjoyable experience. Even though we were paying for a standard room, they upgraded us to a room with a view of CA adventure. That was a wonderful surprise. We could hear music for the world of color show on the tv while watching from the window. We couldn't see all the details of the show but it was still cool. One night we discovered the lounge in the lobby (which was a nice quiet spot)  had pretty good food and a bar. They let us order child meals for adults. It was perfect after a long day. Getting to CA is easy by crossing the street and walking through the Grand Californian hotel. Our room had two queen beds and a twin, sleeping five. Everything was comfortable and clean. The

Summary Heading: Getting a little old now but very convenient for a visit to Disneyland!
Summary: We booked a 3 night stay here at the Paradise Pier hotel in a double room with club benefits in early December 2015. Upon arrival from LAX we were greeted at driveway by nice bell boy staff and was quickly attended to at reception.  Reception staff very nice and helpful showing us all we needed to know about the hotel and Disneyland itself, then on up to the 19th floor to our room.  The room is a classic hotel room for the USA, a touch old but all features working a really we didn't plan to spend much time in the room anyway. We popped down to the club area for a drink or 3 and found that area quite ok. Ultimately you stay at the Disney hotels for 1 or 2 reasons, that is the extra early hour you get to go into the park early, and the convenience of the location. Easy 10 minute

Our stay at this hotel was fantastic. We had not stayed at any of the other resort hotels before, as we're from the UK. We were also celebrating my fourteenth birthday while there.  The cast member that checked us in was so nice and she really made my stay magical. I remember her name was Rachelle, so if you're reading this, thank you so much for making our stay even more magical. I was given a signed picture of Mickey by Sleeping Beauty's Castle, a balloon and a birthday button. They had also upgraded our hotel room to a Theme Park view for free, so we were able to watch World of Color in our room. When me and my mom returned from Disneyland Park at 11:30, Rachelle saw us and asked us all about how the day was. I really felt the Disney magic when we were talking to her and it's

If you really want to be close to the Disney Parks and have early entry, then this would be the least expensive option of the three onsite hotels. That said, I am not sure it is worth the inflated price tag we pay when here over special events like race weekends.   We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel before and loved it, but we wanted to be a bit closer to the parks and the kids love the views from the Paradise Pier, so we opted for here for our Star Wars race weekend. This is my second time staying here and we have had the same problems we had when here previously.   We have luke warm showers at 7am, which is not a great way to start the day. We had the same problem last trip when we stayed here. Maintenance came by last trip and said everything was fine, it was just because

Summary Heading: nice place- very convenient but expensive!
Summary: very nice hotel- not new. everything expensive. self park $18/day. only dinner available us huge buffet at $31.  but sooo convenient. easy walk to both disney parks and downtown disney with lots of restaurants.

The hotel was pleasant and staff were friendly. The hotel itself was a little average , it needs some work. I didn't feel it was worth the money, the cafe was average and bland. We thought the  buffet breakfast with the characters was enjoyable , it's costly, however worth the experience if you have children. A good location, 5 min walk to the Disneyland entrance and Downtown Disney. Overall nothing bad about the stay, however I think there are more modern choices with better facilities within the Disney District.

Summary Heading: Not as good as other Disney hotels
Summary: The hotel was very average, while clean and serviceable. We had no real complaints, but also nothing there was nothing  particularly praiseworthy. For the price, you'd be better off paying a little more and staying at the Disneyland Hotel.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disney... not too expensive!
Summary: This place is a great family friendly hotel. It's convienet to the park... and is clean.  Reasonably priced as well.  The front desk was very helpful!  As expected at a Disney property.  My only issue was when I got accidently locked out of my room with my 2 year old sleeping inside. (dropping off the room service tray).  They wouldn't send anyone up... I had to go all the way down to the desk and leave her alone.  Thank goodness she was asleep but definitely not perfect.  They should have sent someone to help me.  My only other piece of advice is not to pay for valet.  Just self park.  It's too expensive and pointless.

We have stayed in this and the Disneyland hotel. The Disneyland hotel rooms are nicer. The staff were all friendly and nothing is a problem. The hotel has a small cafe downstairs and character dining and a shop. You are paying for the location of being inside the Disneyland experience. That is worth the cost. The beds were fantastic and comfortable and the block out curtains are great. It is a short walk through California hotel into that park and the other way to Disneyland. Earl of sandwich is a short walk. There is the themed bar/ restaurant in the Disneyland hotel. The restaurant is great the themed bar is a pain as there is no room to order or fit in there and staff were slow and not that interested unlike all the other staff in Disneyland that nothing was a problem.

This was genuinely last year, but I never had enough time to indite a review. We stayed at two hotels, the Grand Californian and Paradise Pier. We were coming to Paradise Pier from the Grand Californian just to not spend all of our mazuma. When we entered the lobby and checked in, the people at the front desk were very auxiliary and nice. There was withal a cartoon room for kids to optically canvass cartoons in and have some private time without their parents. Our room was genuinely yare right away, and we didn't have any special requests. When we entered our room, it was a SUITE with a VIEW of California Adventure! It was astounding! It was all beach themed and it looked pulchritudinous! This room was better (And more frugal) than a mundane room at the Grand Californian! Not

Nothing too fancy about this hotel. Room is clean, staff were helpful.  Magic morning really helps beating the crowd, as waiting queue can be hours in the late morning.  It takes about 10min walking to Disneyland entrance, slightly shorter to California Adventure by entering through Grand Californian Hotel.

Hotel stay was ok. Rooms were clean and decent. Not sure it was worth the money I paid for. Nothing really extra except an early morning entry into DL and DCA. Beds comfortable. Lots of pillows. One extra blanket. Travel crib provided.

We have stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel a couple of times now. The rooms are nice, nothing fancy,  but comfortable. We like the Magic Morning early entry to the parks, the convenience to both parks, and the luxury of sending purchases to our hotel, rather than carrying it all around. This visit we decided to pay extra for the Club level, or concierge level, room. While it is nice having access to the Beachcomber Club with a continental breakfast in the morning, snacks all day, and beer and wine at happy hour,  it isn't worth the extra expense of nearly $100 each day. There really isn't a great spread and we did not save money in the parks as anticipated. I recommend the hotel, but not the Club Level rooms.

We stayed in room 1317 where glass window is very dirty.  We choose this hotel for the Magic Morning which turns out not so magical.  Many of the top rides were closed in the morning i.e. Radiator Spring Racer and Toy Story Midway Mania.  And by the time we hopped to Disneyland Park in the afternoon, it was already way too crowded.  "The Happiest Place On Earth" is overrated.  But we do like the location that both parks are all within walking distance with the downtown being in the middle.

Booked 1 night stay for New Years Day. 5th stay at this hotel. Arrived early to find they could not locate my reservation in the system right away. Purchased park tickets right at the front desk. Room keys issued and we were assured a text would arrive when the room was ready. 3pm came and went and no text. Called to find our room was ready.   Room was clean and as expected. City view. Strange thing happened the next morning, someone tried to enter the room (not housekeeping) but we had the top secured. No issues with elevator availability this time around. Found gift shop carried last minute personal item which was great. We always park a vehicle in self-park, in/outs were a breeze.   When you stay at the resort hotels not only can you charge to your room throughout the parks,

Summary Heading: Not much better than a comfort inn
Summary: My son and I went there for 2015 Disneyland Halloween Party.  I get into the hotel and automatically realize this is not an original Disney hotel.  The service was nothing better than Comfort Inn or Holiday Inn.  I am not saying anything wrong with those brand hotel, but I have stayed at the other 2 Disney Hotel in California and the quality of service was MUCH better at those hotels.  I also did like the layout of the hotel.  If you do your research the hotel belong to a Japanese Hotel Company prior it becoming Disney Paradise Pier.  The only thing it had was convenience, the service was not what I called Disney.  If you want Disney service stay away from this hotel, but if you want to pay for convenience it is well enough especially if you cut into Disney Grand California

This hotel is a very over priced hotel. $400/night and this hotel over all is no better than a Holiday Inn. There is only one advantage to staying here and that's the early entrance to the park. There was absolutely no "magic" to this hotel. I have stayed at both the other hotels, Disneyland Hotel and The Grand and they make you feel like your in magical place, but not this place. I should also point out that the morning we arrived at 6:20am to check in they kept us waiting until 7:10 (cutting into our hour early entrance to the park). I was told that I had not purchased my  tickets, even though I showed proof of purchase. By the time the hotel figured out their mistake it was to late to make up for early entrance. This is just one example of the mishaps that occurred during our

We loved our stay at Paradise Pier! The rooms aren't anything special, but you should be out having fun at Disney anyway. The price was great and the location was excellent! Being able to walk to the parks was a huge bonus and gave us so much more time for fun! Be sure to walk over to Downtown Disney. There are lots of great shops & excellent restaurants! I'd like to add how awesome the guy at guest services was too! We forgot to pick up a hat we had embroidered at the park and he called and got them to bring it to us since we were leaving that morning! I was blown away! Our vacation was amazing and I would totally stay here again.

Summary Heading: What a difference a year makes!
Summary: Booked this hotel again mainly because our fabulous experience during the same time last year. What a complete and utter disappointment this time around. We had booked a city view room, upon arrival I asked about upgrading to a room with a view of California Adventure but unfortunately there were no rooms available. It was no big deal because a city view sounded nice anyway.  The first disappointment was the view, " City View" is very misleading, the view I actually the parking lot. Next we noticed the crumbling wallpaper in the bathroom, the extra holes in the wall next to the electrical plate and the chipped furniture. These were not huge inconveniences for a motel but fir the additional costs AND being a Disney property, I expected more. Next we went to the coffee bar

Summary Heading: Average hotel, not as close as non disney hotels but wanted extra magic hours!
Summary: If you don't know from other reviews or research, this was a good neighbor hotel that Disney purchased and changed the appearance and theme of to suit the fact that you can see it from California Adventure park.  So, it wasn't built as a Disney hotel.    We payed a few dollars extra to get a room with a view of the World of Color and I am glad that I did.  We had travelled from the East Coast and although we had adjusted pretty well, we would never have been able to stay up that late.  A few nights, we were able to have our PJ's on, turn on the TV station with the music and watch the World of Color from our window, then hop right in bed.  I wish I would have been able to take photos out the window, but they were just way too dirty.    The way that we entered the park was to go a

Brilliant budget hotel within the Disney resort, walking distance to other hotels and parks, extra park hours and resort perks. Clean rooms, great guest services and hotel staff with lovely theme throughout. Pool has a view of the nightly fireworks and we could hear these from our room also, hotel has a direct view of the Paradise Pier section of the Californian Adventure park which looks beautiful at night. On our trip we visited all of the hotels and would recommend The Grand Californian over this one if your budget allows, it is absolutely gorgeous and has direct access into the California Adventure park. Could not fault our stay at this hotel but didn't rate the dining options as highly as The Disneyland Hotel.

We stayed here for a night for my son's birthday.  You are able to check-in early, and get a text message when your room is ready.  Parking is $17, but you can get 2 days out of it for every night you stay (the day you arrive, and the day you leave until midnight).  The staff were wonderful.  We were chosen for an upgrade, and the lady at the desk (I wish I had remembered her name because she was a gem!) brought out a signed picture of Woody and Buzz for my son.  We also ordered a basket to be delivered to the room, and it was there when we got in.  The rooms are adorable.  The shower was roomy and the toiletries were plenty.  My only complaint was that we filled out the form for room service breakfast and left it outside the door, but when I checked in the morning, it hadn't

The rooms was basic and clean, the shower could have had better pressure however given the water situation .... Hotel is old and therefore you will hear noise from the street.  Fireworks can be viewed from the pool deck.  One of the great things about staying on site and purchases will be delivered back to your room and therefore you won't be lugging them on rides.  We ate at the in house restaurant once and would not recommend this, check it out before otherwise walk over to the one of the other hotel restaurants, Downtown restaurants or order in.  You can also have food basics delivered to your room.

Summary Heading: Average hotel - the real value is extra hour in the park
Summary: We booked to stay here using our Avios points. It was pretty expensive but that's the case for most things related to Disney.   We stayed in room 826 which has a great view of the Disney Californian Adventure Park (see picture) but be aware you can't see the Disneyland fireworks from this room.  As a family of four we had our teenage son in one of the double beds, we shared the other double bed and our eight year old slept on the sofa bed. There was plenty of room on this basis.   The singularly best thing about this hotel is that it is a short walk from both parks and you get to access the parks one hour before general admission. This was invaluable for popular rides like Hyperspace Mountain and Radiator Springs Racers.  Parking is charged at $18 per day.  Overall we had a

We stayed for 5 nights over Christmas 2015. We loved the Disney themeing and found the hotel perfect for Mr 4 and Miss 5. There was lots of Disney on the TV. There was a movoe viewing atea with beach chairs downstairs. The pool area looked great although we did not use it as it was cold. The room had a fridge and toiletries were stocked daily.   The magic hour for the park each day was awesome.

Summary Heading: Convenient to parks but fairly ordinary
Summary: This hotel is terrific for convenience to the theme parks and access to early admission hours, but the property itself is pretty ordinary, more akin to a 3-star hotel. The decoration could use updating, and more upscale amenities would be welcome.

My favorite part about staying at any Disney Resort is having access to the club.  This was my first time staying at the Paradise Pier, and I was so pleased with the service of the cast members in the Beach Comber.  Breakfast and the happy hour made for convenient dining, which was a top priority of ours.  Cast Member Braillon really stood out and gave us exceptional service during our stay.  He made us feel very welcome.  I also loved having access to the DVD library as one of the club amenities.  Any time I stay at Paradise Pier, I will always book the club level!

Summary Heading: Housekeeping left door to our room open all day
Summary: Hotel is nothing to rave about as we could just as well be staying at a non-Disney hotel that just happens to be classified as a Disney hotel. The only nice thing about this place is the proximity to the park.   Place feels dated and old with modern bathrooms. Skin feels itchy after staying here but to be fair, it could be psychological my brain is thinking that my whole body is itching from this place.  Worst thing is that housekeeping is pretty sloppy. Not only did they knock on our door at 8 am this morning to try to clean our room (which was annoying but too petty to consider writing a review for, but the person left our door open/unlocked the whole day after cleaning our room. We came back from the park around 6 and discovered the door ajar. Thank goodness we are staying at

We stayed here after Thanksgiving weekend.  Our room was filled with Surfing themed Disney touches.  The staff were helpful and polite.  Our room didn't face California Adventure, after seeing the view from the corridor I wish we had paid a little more and gone for the uograde.  By staying at the Paradise Pier you get early entry into the parks.  It's a short walk across the street through the Grand Californian into California Adventure.  Exclusive entry with your room key and park tickets.  You can also use your room key to charge products and restaurant bills back to your in the parks, and World of Disney.  Very useful,  but be careful.  You forget how much you are buying.  Items bought at the park are delivered to your hotel concierge after 730am the next day.  A short walk

Summary Heading: Stay the night at the park
Summary: Our stay at the Paradise Pier was just that...Paradise. We stayed in an upgraded room with a view of California Adventure. Upon entering the room with the blinds open all we saw was the park! Anxious to get out there we hurried away. Although not much time was spent in the room due to enjoying the parks, when we were back in our room it was a quiet oasis. No sounds of children running around screaming, nothing. But as soon as you opening the window, you could hear all the sounds of the excitement of Disney rush into our room. Pure bliss. Hotel staff were delightful and even allowed us to check in early due to our early flight. When we had a late flight going home the staff even kept our belongings while we enjoyed the park one last time. This will be our hotel of choice every

We stayed here because it was less expensive than the other resort hotels. It was okay. The CM at the front desk who checked us in was very nice and helpful. We went during Christmas last year so it was decorated really beautiful. Still quite a bit away from the parks though. It would be nice if we could have taken the monorail to the park. Next time we will probably stay at the Disneyland hotel. We ate at the buffet and were less than impressed. Food was not very good and the price was ridiculous. My son did get to meet a lot of the characters though so he enjoyed that. Not sure if we would stay again.

The hotel is old and has nothing to do with the actual theme of the rooms. The rooms are basic and dated. The bathrooms are average. The beds are comfortable but the pillows are not comfortable. There are no robes in the room. I am just not sure why we are paying $600 a night for this hotel. It is close to Disney but it really has nothing special. The continental breakfast does actually have some fruit and an espresso maker. I would suggest grainy bagels instead of just plain. The boiled eggs are fine.  I don't think I would stay at this hotel again. It is just too expensive for what you get. i don't mind the price but for what you get the price is far too high. We were in the 13th floor so we could watch the light show from Californian Adventure and the fireworks from the end

First time to stay on-site at Disney, and it was very convenient.  The hotel is older, but they do a good job of keeping it clean.  Being able to come and go from our room was great! We stayed for a few days, and needed to do laundry, and having a laundry room available 24/7 was great!  Vending machines dispensed soap, and it was very handy using credit cards for payment.  I never had to wait for a washing machine or dryer, so our laundry was done relatively quickly. The dinner buffet is nice, but very expensive.  We did it only once, and while it was a good experience, it wasn't worth it to us to do it another night. Overall, we had a good stay :)

Summary Heading: Cheaper alternative to other Disney hotels
Summary: Clearly, Paradise Pier is the less expensive of the Disneyland hotels.   There are even better deals outside the park, but we really enjoy staying here.  The check-in process was fast and the front desk were helpful and courteous.   Somehow, we even were upgraded to a higher floor.   The room was the usual hotel size but had great views of California Adventure.   We were able to watch the Disneyland fireworks and CA World of Color from our room.   There was a channel that would play the music with the shows.  Amazing.  One downside is the lack of elevators, but we didn't have any long waits.   There is character dining onsite.   We opted to stop at the quick cafe.   The line was shorter, no wait, and we still got Mickey waffles.    The BEST part of staying at a Disney hotel is

we had  a room on the 11th floor over looking the adventure park, we were able to see the  world of colour and if you went to the end of the hall you could see the fire works. the rooms good clean and tidy staff were friendly it was a short walk to down town disney which had great shopping and food to eat.it was also a short walk to the parks

We enjoyed our stay, we were given a room facing Disneyland, the staff were friendly and helpful and only a short walk to Disneyland. Get a hopper tickets and enjoy both parks, you won't be sorry, we weren't

We stayed here while visiting Disneyland.  You can't beat the location.  Everything was within walking distance so once we were on location no rental car was needed.  There is a park entrance right across the street and we had a beautiful view of California Adventure Park.  All music for the light shows are broadcast over the TV's so you could watch right from your room.  TIP:  If staying here, there is an excellent view of all fireworks shows put on in the Disneyland Magic Kingdom park from the third floor pool deck.  They even set up speakers so you can hear the music without having to brave the crowds at the end of the night.

Disney prices are high, we all know that, and  Paradise Pier prices are no exception. However, for the price Disney should at least provide a microwave in the rooms. Also, the rooms don't meet the current demands of our phones and laptops.  There were 2 electrical outlets by the desk, but none between the beds and no charge ports for phones. Adding to the tech issues, Wi-Fi is woefully slow and suffers from constant disconnects. Staff was under whelming for Disney standards compared to the many other Disney hotels in which we've stayed. There was zero Disney magic. With so many hotels within walking distance of the Disneyland Resort that are more reasonably priced, I see no reason to pay so much more and get nothing for the extra expense.

We had a great time staying here while attending the Avengers weekend and half marathon. If you're going to a RunDisney event at DLR you can't do much better. Comfortable, clean and quiet. The extra park hours are a plus. Nice pool. Super convenient to the parks and Downtown Disney. Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Not worth the money at all.
Summary: If you want to stay close to Disneyland and not pay too much, I recommend going another few blocks and walking the extra distance.  This hotel doesn't live up to Disney standard.  It has terrible food options, cheesy decor, and none of the amenities that it should have for the price.    It promises poolside service and there are signs all over the place for the Sand Bar in the pool.  None of the signs noted that it was closed so we decided to go there for lunch.  When we got up there the bar was closed in the middle of the day when it was 85 degrees out.  We called down to the restaurant and they said we had to come down there and order food and bring it up ourselves.  They didn't even take my order over the phone.  Definitely NOT ideal with three kids.  If they had noted that

I did a lot of research.  This hotel was perfect for us.  The view from a premium room was great.  The film on the windows made it unclear, but the side ones were fine.   Very clean, great staff.  My only complaint was we never had hot water in the shower.  We had warm, but not hot.

This was the first time I had stayed at Paradise Pier and it is definitely not the last!    I have previously stayed at The Disneyland Hotel and The Grand Californian, as well as a number of other Disney Properties at Walt Disney World.    Paradise Pier definitely lives up to the Disney reputation.    The Mousekeeping was wonderful-we never needed to ask for anything, everything was perfect.    The rest of the staff was extremely helpful and friendly from the front desk to bell services to merchandise.  We were there for the Avengers 1/2 Weekend and this was a perfect location for the event-a quick walk away from the Race Expo and the Corrals and the Finish Line-perfect.  We had a theme park view on the 12th floor-we could see parts of the Disneyland Forever fireworks show and

Summary Heading: Well maintained hotel with a wonderful view!
Summary: With Paradise Pier being the least costly of the Disneyland Resort Hotels, I wasn't expecting "much," especially since guest ratings have been so varied.  I was very pleasantly surprised with my stay last week.  Upon arrival, I asked for a high floor overlooking California Adventure and, despite the fact that I checked in well before noon, a 12th floor room was ready and waiting.  The view could not have been better as we could see practically all of California Adventure Park.  We had a wonderful view of The World of Color so my 5-year-old granddaughter, exhausted from a long plane trip and a fun-filled day, could enjoy the show from the comfort of our room in her jammies.  As a bonus, we had an only-slightly-obstructed view of the fireworks above Disneyland Park.  Music and

I stayed her the last week of October. The first thing to remember is that Disney hotel's are expensive, you are paying to be near the "magic". This review is based on that premise, I wouldn't pay as much as I did for this hotel if it wasn't Disney.  What this hotel has going for it, is that you have a manageable walk by cutting through the Grand Californian to get to both Downtown Disney and the two Parks. As a frequent Disney World traveler this is a big selling point, since everything there is so spread apart. The other benefit is being able to get into the Parks an hour early, the early hour rotates between Disneyland and the California Adventure.
