I have stayed at the Grand Californian before which is a nicer hotel, but I would stay here again over returning there just

We enjoyed a very quick weekend stay at the Paradise Pier for Halloween. As always, the hotel is conveniently located to the park. The beds an linens never disappoint. We went with this hotel because we figured it would be too cold for the pool. We were wrong. The pool here is lacking. It's a slightly larger backyard pool with a cramped spa nearby. The water slide gets little use and is far enough away that it's not distracting.   The best part was that we were on the floor 3, with a balcony that opened to the pool. We've never had that before. That was truly enjoyable! I'm not sure how that happened, but it's worth requesting in the future.   We always go with Club Level. The breakfast and drinks in the evening more than make it worth the extra money for us. No, I don't think

My stay at paradise pier was amazing, I stayed at club level where you had a seperate check in and a room that had a catered food bar pretty much all day that went from a continental breakfast to after dinner deserts. The room had a view of California adventure and I was able to watch world of colour from my room and listen to it via the tv. The room was well kept and the staff were amazing. A great perk of staying at a Disney hotel is also the offering of extra magic hours and the ability to send in park purchases to the hotel which is great as carrying bacgs around in the park does get in the way.

Summary Heading: Save the money and stay down the street... anywhere but here.
Summary: This may be long, as I have a lot to share. I have left numerous reviews and I am pretty honest, a lot are on Disney property and around the country. If you are used to the Magic that Disney World has to offer, this place WILL be a major let down.   Our experience, start to finish. My daughters sweet 16th birthday was coming up, and her dream was to go to California! So being the Disney lovers our family is, we arraigned a surprise stay at the Paradise Pier hotel on a Disney cast members recommendation. This was done in May 2015, and the trip was for October 2015. At the time I booked a standard view room for 5 people. I called several times asking to upgrade to the club level, and we were told that they couldn't upgrade us over the phone, but they would in person and we could

We celebrated our daughters birthday in October, and we had a great time. Like the fact that it's close enough to the Disney parks to walk to, but some days it did seem very far. Staff was very helpful and the hotel was a little dated but we still enjoyed our stay and would stay again. In fact I'm going to book another stay in May! Loved the room decorations! Great family hotel!

My family and I stayed on level 14 with a view of the Disney California Park which was a premium club level accommodation. We had three nights there (wed through to check out Saturday am). My parents were on level 8 and had not selected the club level.  Some great attributes: Staff were very friendly and were very happy to help, especially when you first arrive and have no idea where anything is! The view! Oh my gosh AMAZING! We had room 1416 and we had the BEST view of the World of Colour light show in the evening, We managed to get the window open a smidge so we could hear it too. Wow is all I can say (go see the show if you can) The location is sensational, I am sure others have written about that though We got delivered some little rice bubble cakes made in the shape of

Summary Heading: Not worth the money for us
Summary: We are annual pass holders so we like to stay at different hotels each time to try out which one we liked the best.  For the $$$ we paid, I don't really think this hotel is worth it.  The room was good, a little dated but the little touches of Disney are nice to see.  We got the premium view with the California Adventure park which was great at first but do you really need the view to sleep in your room?   The Fairfield Inn is across the street from the entrance and has Disney-themed rooms for way lot less money.  I don't really know how the view of World of Color there is since we were mostly at the park at that time.  I know now, it wasn't really worth paying for the premium view for my family.  The magic morning the Disney hotel guests get as a perk for staying there is only

My Favorite of the Disney properties; rooms are comfortable the pool large with a nice spa and the best staff available. Years ago this used to be a Pan Pacific owned hotel and they established a tradition of excellence that has carried on today...

Summary Heading: VERY NICE HOTEL IN EXCELLENT LOCATION!
Summary: We stayed here for one night, after "doing" Disneyland and California Adventure. Our room was wonderful, on the 12th floor with views of both, CA Adventure and Disneyland. We had two very comfortable queen size beds, with very comfortable bedding. The room was spacious, clean and had a little fridge, not to mention complimentary toiletries....the only thing that was missing and would've been a nice addition, is a hair dryer...there wasn't one in the bathroom. Everything was perfect, from the decor to the views. The hotel staff was super friendly and very helpful, and we enjoyed having coffee at the little coffee shop that's located next to the lobby. We also went out to their pool, the pool area is very nice and clean, with lots of umbrellas for shade. There's always a life

We stayed at Paradise Pier for 4 days in October to take in Halloween at Disneyland.  The hotel staff were amazing as they always are with Disney, giving the kids buttons, sorting our luggage until we could check in, getting all the characters to sign our kids keepsake books (leave them at the front desk for a day for this) and wrapping a picture I had purchased so it would be safe to take home with me.  The rooms are large with a fold out bed which is great for extra sleeping space.  The rooms could be updated as they are looking worn and dated.  The pool was great, my kids loved it and we took a break there every afternoon.  Good size, life guards on site, hot tub.  You can watch the fireworks from the pool deck which is good for kids that are too tired to stay all night.  The

We usually stay here on Disneyland vacations. As usual, it's dated and in need of refurbishing, but the staff is amazing! Easy access to the parks, fireworks viewing from the pool area, view rooms for World of Color, etc are all wonderful. The character breakfast is always a highlight for us and a must do if you have young kids.

Summary Heading: Amazing vews from Park View room & great customer service
Summary: This review is extremely late - a whole year late in fact. My family of 2 adults and 2 teens stayed at the Paradise Pier for the second time in October 2014.  Once again, we had a great stay, and the park view room was definitely worth the little bit extra. What an amazing view to wake up too, and see last thing at night.  But what set this stay apart was an exceptionally kind and thoughtful act by some of the staff and management.  As part of our 20th wedding anniversary in 2014, we visited the US for 5 weeks, culminating in a week's stay at Paradise Pier. When we checked in, we'd just received some terrible news about the death of a family member back in Australia. I was a bit upset during check in, and mentioned both the anniversary and death to the check in lady.   A few

The extra Disney touches everywhere made the stay quite magical. We had a room looking over California Adventure which was just beautiful. The staff were wonderful and really made our stay extra special. The kids loved the pool area, especially the waterslide, and the complimentary kids life vests were great!  We would have stayed longer except for the high cost of the accomdation.

I have stayed at the Grand Californian at Disneyland and wanted to try another Disney hotel. Went with friends, and 3 of us shared a standard room with 2 beds and a pull-out couch. The good is that the hotel is clean, convenient, the hotel restaurant - which was a buffet - had very good food/variety,most everyone we encountered was polite and attentive.The bad is we got back to our room late and tired, but the sofa bed was not made up.We couldn't figure out how to use it so called to front desk for someone to come help us.We were told, over the phone,how to do it and then told if we still couldn't figure it out to call back.Also we had to ask where the sheets,etc. were.Finally got it pulled together. 2 of us bought lattes(almost $5 ea.) at the cafe and they were horrible- we

On the day we were leaving Aug 29th, My husband and I had packed up to leave early in the morning and we had also taken one of our daughter's and husband suitcases with us. My other daughter and family hadn't finished packing so they decided to leave their things in the room because we had until 11am to check out. We all left the room around 7:30am and when they returned around 10:30am to get their belongings so they can get checked out. During this time someone had been in the room and stole some of their belongings. Their suitcase had been opened and gone thru and the stuff in the bathroom was taken. We stayed at the Paradise Pier in one of their 2 bedroom suites.  The thing that is so frustrating to me is as of today 10/22/15 nothing has been done to recover or reimburse them

We stayed here for 3 nights after 3 nights at the Grand Californian and were expecting to feel a big difference in the level of hotel but really didn't.  The room was nice and bright, separate outside sink and mirror made getting ready a lot easier for the two of us.  Short walk across the street to get to the Grand to enter DCA and about the same distance to the monorail to Disney.  Had breakfast at the Surfside Lounge, wasn't thrilled with the menu choices but the buffet breakfast looked very busy as it was a table service with Characters.   We didn't eat here otherwise.  Bell Services did a good job for us holding our luggage until our room was ready, checked in around 9 am and received a call that room was ready about 11:30.  We also had them check our bags to hold them on

The lobby is nice, staff is helpful.  Room is a decent size and clean.  Decor is cute.  I loved the hotel but my only complaint is the price.  Yes, I get that it's a 5 minute walk from the parks but it was a lot of money per night in my opinion.  We were booked for one night for my birthday, and decided we wanted to stay just one more night (even at that price!)  We were informed that the hotel was booked solid till the following week.  I asked if they knew about the other two Disneyland hotels and the CM asked me to give her a moment.  She talked to her manager and they were able to free up a room, which was nice.  We decided since we had spent copious amounts of money already, why not spend more and get the room service express breakfast they offered - it wasn't nearly as bad

We loved this hotel!  The decor was fun, the service was perfect and we were very happy here.  I have read about issues with the the elevators and we were on the 5th floor so it wasn't a problem for us.  We visited the Disneyland Hotel and the The Grand Californian and found our hotel to be much more relaxing with an easygoing vibe.  You can still go see all the fancy stuff at the more expensive hotels and enjoy those restaurants (which we did) but at the end of the day it was so much less crazy at our hotel once you returned after a day of crowds in the parks.  My only wish is  that the pool were a little larger and warmer (says it's heated but it was pretty cold when I went in one night) but since I spend more time out and about than at the pool it didn't matter to us.

Room facing California Adventure had warm colors and nice view. I was on 4th floor, suggest a little higher to avoid palm trees.  As always staff was extremely nice. As I was celebrating an anniversary they gave me balloons for my room and an autographed picture of M&M.

Summary Heading: Economy hotel with luxury price tag
Summary: Nothing magical about it. Just an average hotel that costs more because it's Disney owned. It was no cleaner and the service no better than the Tropicana or Desert Inn on Harbor, which cost a third of what this one does. Room was too warm as the thermostat would only go down to 65. Fridge froze and ruined our food and drinks, including 2 bottles of Diet Coke that froze so hard they exploded. Housekeeping didn't come one of our 8 days, so I had to track down a maid in the hall to get coffee to make in the morning. The 2 cup coffee maker made 1 full cup and a 1/4 cup, rather than 2 equal cups. Wifi was spotty and we had almost a whole day with no internet (I know it isn't the end of the world, but when you are paying over $300 a night things should work). We wouldn't recommend or

We were upgraded to a concierge level suite and that was a plus with kids. Breakfast, snacks and cocktails included in the room rate. The surprise upgrade was of course welcome and the suite was very comfortable, the proximity to the Disney Park, the 1 additional hour at the park (to get some of the most popular rides out of the way), the water slide on the top and a view of the fireworks were the other hits with the kids. Having said that I am taking away a star for having had to wait for  almost two hours beyond the check in time to get into our room. And with tired kids that was not a great situation to be in... Maybe that's why the upgrade. The staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean and comfortable.

We have stayed at The Paradise Pier twice, but this visit was a little disappointing.  The room was nice and the beds were comfortable. But I would like the beds changed everyday, I shouldn't have to call down to front desk to get them changed.  The washroom only had one sink and it was too small for two people to get ready for the parks in morning.   The room also wasn't cool enough for us, for sleeping.  The thermostat will only go as cool as 65 degrees, now enough for us Canucks.   It was our 41st anniversary and decided to celebrate it with Disneyland's 60th Diamond Anniversary. We tried to get an upgrade but to no avail. The room wasn't worth the price we paid. This was the last time staying at the Paradise Pier, next time it will be a different hotel.

Stayed for 2 nights during a visit to Disneyland. It was my 3rd visit to Disneyland but 1st on site and it was amazing. Great location, so nice to only have to walk 10 mins after a long day or even pop back to the room as often as I wanted.  Also being able to sign my in park purchase back to the room was great & then having them delivered back too was amazing so I did not have to carry them around.   Great size comfortable rooms with super cute Disney theming.   I will be back

For the price of a regular room at the other hotels, you can get a premier view with club level service @ PPH. We spent 5 days and 6 nights there and thought the service and location were awesome! Our room had an incredible view of California Adventure and fit our family of 4 perfectly. Donnie in the Beach Comber Club took such awesome care of us and really made us feel like top priority. He was an absolute pleasure. The hotel and room were super clean and everything was to our satisfaction and more. The walk to Disney was about 10 minutes and California Adventure was a straight shot through the Grand California hotel. Downtown Disney was a 4 minute walk through the side or back entrance of our hotel. For price and location, plus awesome kid friendly-family quality, you really

I stayed here from October 5-8, and it was wonderful. We had a room with a great view of California Adventure. The walk to downtown Disney & the parks was so short, it was such a nice change of pace from having to wait for a bus in WDW.   I was concerned about the wait for an elevator after reading previous reviews and I have to say we never waited a long amount of time.   Rooms had that Disney charm we all know and love. Rooms were very clean and well stocked with toiletries and towels. Staff was nice. Since my room was not ready when I got there They asked if I'd like to receive a text when my room was ready, they did forget to text me so I ended up having to go to the front desk around 430 and get that all set up myself. That was my only complaint. We were also surprised at

We spent 5 nights here, in a concierge level room, on the 14th floor, with the most magnificent view of California Adventure. The music and soundtrack to World of Colour was piped in via the TV so we could watch it from our vantage point. From the fire exit next to our room, we also had a great view of the Disneyland fireworks. The room was spacious and comfortable with a sofa and desk which we appreciated. There was only one sink in the bathroom.The reception staff and concierges were friendly and helpful. We were inadvertently charged for laundry for the previous occupants of the room but the matter was cleared up in 2 minutes. It is a short walk to the parks through the Grand Californian Hotel. Incidentally, that hotel bears a distinct resemblance to Grand Central station and

We had planned our trip a year in advance and had so much fun. The hotel had all the great Disney touches. The room was clean and quiet with hidden Mickeys all over the place. We had a room with a view and could watch the fireworks from our window. The TV plays the music for the shows as well. The staff was so helpful and friendly. The gift shop was great. I can't wait to go back.

Paradise Pier is the most basic (& therefore, the least expensive) of the 3 Disneyland Resort hotels, but as a party of 8, we found it to be sufficient. The check-in process was lengthy but that was likely due to the fact that we had multiple rooms on multiple reservations, & also because we made a last minute request for two adjoining rooms. Although they were simple & lacked the amount of Disney touches one would expect, the rooms/bathrooms were clean & served their purpose. We quickly discovered our shower drained painfully slow, but I can’t say it bothered us too much because we never called to have it fixed. The staff members we encountered during our stay were always friendly, & although it was small, the on-site gift shop was convenient.  As with any Disneyland Resort

Had a great room on the 14th floor.  The view of the park was beautiful.  The room was large and airy.  I loved the decor.  The concierge lounge was nice when open, however it closed early.  (8pm.)  The lobby is sparse and not like other Disney hotels.  Now for the bad....  The elevators were a major problem.  We had to wait every morning.  Because the elevators were slow and full, people would ride the elevators up to be able to go down, so we had 2-4 elevators go full when they arrived for us to go down.  We may have been on the top floor, but people learned the secret to getting an elevator.  This is something that needs to be addressed.

Summary Heading: Cute hotel with super friendly staff
Summary: We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in the past and decided to give Paradise Pier a try.  I have to say we really enjoyed our stay.  The only downside is the size of the pool.  It is very small.  We were very surprised since there seems to be a lot of empty space on the third floor.  The staff was super friendly and really made our stay memorable.

We booked this hotel because it was the least expensive of the three Disney ones. We wanted the perks and "magical" feeling of staying on Disney property. Overall we very much enjoyed our stay! If you go with realistic expectations, this is a great place to stay. This isn't a five star ritzy place, but it's nice, clean, has a good atmosphere, and is Disney!   Things we liked: Decor, cleanliness, beds super comfortable, large room, surfs up breakfast at the hotel restaurant. Amazing view of DCA in the theme park view room. Water slides at the pool were a hit with our three year old.  Things we didn't like: Far walk to the parks. Not so far I wouldn't stay here again, but far enough it started to bother us and we didn't take afternoon breaks. Instead of feeling in the "Disney

Summary Heading: Close proximity to parks, extra magic hour made it worth the price
Summary: Stay at Paradise Pier for the proximity to the parks, the extra magic hour, and the DCA entrance through Grand Californian.  When you stay at a Disney hotel, you get to experience the Extra Magic Hour, meaning you can enter either Disneyland or DCA an hour before opening. You can also enter DCA through a private entrance at Grand Californian, which is just a quick walk across the street from Paradise Pier. To me, these perks completely made the expense of staying at a Disney hotel worthwhile.  I booked a premium room on the 10th floor for my 30th birthday. Great views of DCA, but mediocre room overall, something I'd expect a mid-level hotel chain. Found some trash behind the couch, hair in the bathroom, stains around bathtub, etc. I didn't plan to spend a whole lot of time in

As I've noticed many times over the years, front level staff work very hard to please (as is the case here) but they are thwarted by outdated equipment or curious management policies. This hotel has one button for three elevators, and one button for another. People tend to push both buttons, take the one that comes first, so the second elevator to arrive is not needed, leading to many unnecessary stops, and frustrated guests, especially from the upper floors. Take the stairs you say? Can't! The only stairs are emergency evacuation, and the doors are locked. So, if you walk up to the 5th floor, can't get in. Also, surprised not to see a blue box, or other encouragement for recycling. What a great opportunity to have the children's idols ask them to separate papers, bottles, etc.

We had a standard view, was still an amazing room. The maid service was perfect - the room remained gorgeous for our three night stay.   The staff at the hotel were so friendly - they went above and beyond in any way they could to make our stay the best possible. They even sent our postcards for us when we couldn't find a mailbox.   The walk to downtown Disney and the parks was so much easier staying close by - and made the parks that much better since we weren't exhausted before we got there.   We walked through the other Disney hotels - and I have to say that the Paradise Pier Hotel had the friendliest feel. A great choice for us - wonderful experience.

This was our 3rd stay at the Paradise Pier.  Disney was offering no specials so we opted for a standard room.  Our room was just that...standard.  We could tell that some aspects of the hotel had been well maintained, but our room was really showing wear.  The furnishings are well worn, the carpet is looking old, the tub had caulking over peeling caulking, stains were around the tub and on the floor, bathroom fan did not work, etc.  We have always paid for upper level, theme park view and have been pleased with our rooms.  This one did not live up to expectations.  Staff was fine, elevators are a pain during busy times.  A nice staff member actually took us upstairs in a service elevator because of the length of time it was taking to get on an elevator.  As others have said, the

It's a Disney property, so I expected so much more than what I got.  What I got was an older hotel, with just moderately OK rooms.  This is a $120 a night facility, not a $300+ night Disney facility.  Small lounge, horrible overpriced buffet restaurant, an outside bar that closes at 6:00 PM (really?). $27 a night to park, and the worst thing?  The elevators!  These elevators are just the worst. Super slow. Need to be updated badly for speed. Doors seem to open on every floor, and then stay open soooooo long, that it is no wonder they take forever.  Even the staff admitted the elevators are a major gripe.  It is "on property", but not really.  It is across the street, and about the same as a 5 block walk to get into Disneyland itself. Nice views of California Adventure if you

First time staying at a Disneyland hotel and it was everything that I wished it would be.  The staff was amazing, the service and surprises for a magical stay were priceless, the room was adorable and comfortable, the Mickey and Friends breakfast is highly recommended! Loved our stay here. Quick and easy walk to the parks, and benefited from the early entrance to both parks with our stay.

The park view room was worth the extra - we could see the world of colour display at California Adventure Park and the fireworks at Disneyland. Avoid the hotel restaurant even if you're tired - it's boring, limited and overpriced.

My family of four, and my parents stayed here. We had adjoining rooms. The hotel was clean, the service was friendly. The distance to the parks was a short walk. You just walk across the street to the Grand Californian to enter California Adventure. To get to Disneyland, you walk a little further. This was faster and more convenient then our past stays when we waited and then crammed on the bus. The hotel seemed clean and I found the décor to be charming. We enjoyed watching fireworks in comfy chairs on the pool deck instead of being crammed down Main Street. The elevators were the only issue we found. The elevators were slow, and I think there was a day when one or two were down. However, the staff was mindful and if they saw a group of people waiting on the lower level, they

Summary Heading: Not on Par with other Disney Resorts
Summary: If you stepped into Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel for the first time, it would be hard to differentiate it from a bland Holiday Inn or Hilton property. The rooms are average in size and feel slightly outdated and worn. The rooms do have a beach theme to them and are adorned with various Disney decorations.  The property is in a great location and is about a 10 minute walk from the two parks, and you are able to admit directly to Disney's California Adventure through Disney's Grand Californian Resort.   The Hotel does have a small pool and water slide that seemed to be overcrowded whenever I visited, and due to the volume of guests in the hotel it was often difficult to get an elevator in a timely manner.  If you are looking for a Disney resort similar to those found onsite at

We went for my daughters birthday. Had a great view of the fireworks and world of color as well as saw Mulan in their outdoor movie area. Fun time. Great Beach. atmosphere. Easy walk into the parks and easy parking. A little expensive for everyday but a great way to have a special celebration at Disneyland.

We only stayed one night at this resort as we were on a world wind tour.  This hotel was simply amazing.  The rooms were wonderful, decorated in a beach Disney theme complete with beach ball throw pillow. You could purchase the pillow as well, which I thought was a nice touch.  The bathroom was spacious and the anemities were so nice and included shampoo and conditioner, lotion, scope mouthwash, a toothbrush kit, a shower cap, and a special wash cloth for makeup and a hairdryer.  There was also coffee and tea available in the rooms (which is always a plus in my book).    This resort in within walking distance to both Disneyland and California Adventure.  We had a perfect view of California Adventure from our hotel window.  They have a fantastic pool area, complete with water

Summary Heading: Was it worth the extra price?
Summary: We are from Las Vegas and go to Anaheim every other month. Thought we'd try this to see if it was worth the extra money to get in early and get the club level room. First let me say the room was nice standard room. Club level was not worth the extra paid to get sodas, and chips and for breakfast stale pastry.  Stood in line to get in early entry for hotel guest. People in line talking saying they lived a couple street over but get early entry with a key card from friends who stayed several months ago. Told us they don't look at the dates on the key cards. Took it to the test, watched as they (9 in their group) went in. Associates telling everyone one key per room. Really 13 people in a room, no way! Everyone in the parks everyday not staying at the Disneyland hotels. Some of the

Ideal for families, right on the doorstep of the Disney Parks, clean and spacious enough, but obviously had a little wear? But overall would recommend. Only downside is the distance to any other amenities and attractions beside Disney? Taxi's are quite expensive so beware when attempting to visit other areas. Seriously consider hiring a car.

This is the second time we have stayed at Paradise Pier, and for value and proximity to the parks it's our first choice. If the budget allowed we'd choose the Grand Californian, but a bonus of staying at Paradise Pier is walking through the lobby of the Grand every day and we also took time to sit and enjoy the architecture. Having stayed once at the Grand I also find the rooms at Paradise Pier roomier and brighter.  We last stayed here in 2012 and I can't say I noticed much wear and tear in those 3 years. Our room on the third floor was convenient to the pool also on the same level and we had no issues with elevators in the mornings. Wifi worked fine in our rooms. My kids enjoyed the pool but were disappointed the waterslide was under refurbishment. However the weather was so

We took our 7 year old to Disney/California Adventure for her first time and invited another couple and their daughter.  We had adjoining rooms at the hotel.   This was the cheapest of the three hotels on the property and we were pleasantly surprised at how nice it was.  It is definitely not the biggest nor the fanciest of the hotels, but we didn't spend hardly anytime in the rooms anyway.  It is within walking distance of everything (5 min walk to Disney District, 5 min walk to California Adventure, and 10 min walk to Disneyland) and the hotel staff was super friendly and knowledgeable.  The rooms were large, clean and brightly decorated.  The beds were super comfortable.  If I were to stay on property, I would choose this hotel again due to the simple fact that in my opinion

While not as "high end" as Disney's Grand Californian or the Disneyland hotel, we very much enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were large with two queen-sized beds and one day bed. The room was clean and housekeeping did a great job. We ordered take-out breakfast from the Surfside Lounge and it was very good as well.   For frequent travelers to Walt Disney World, this hotel might feel generic in comparison to the heavily themed hotels in Florida. The vibe here is a chain high-rise hotel with a little bit of Disney theming mixed in. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, but it is a change from Walt Disney World or the other Disneyland hotels.  We loved the short walk to Disneyland, Disney California Adventure, and Downtown Disney. Being able to enjoy the restaurants and shopping at

The Paradise Pier is the "low-end" hotel on the Disneyland properties.  With that said, the quality of the hotel and rooms are not much different than the higher end hotels (such as Grand California).  For me what sets this hotel apart is mainly the distance you have to walk to get to Disneyland.  It's about a 15min walk and if that's bearable, I would select this hotel as a way to save a few bucks during your stay.  Additionally their breakfast buffet restaurant has the "best" characters for the kiddies.

We decided to stay a Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel due to its location. Nice clean rooms with cute Disney touches. They are not super flash (as expected) but catered to our needs as we spent all out time at the parks. The staff are all very friendly, informative and welcoming. Very close to Disney Downtown, Disneyland and Disney CA Adventure parks. Nice and quite for sleeping, beds comfy.  Even though a budget hotel I still found it a tad expensive compared to other hotels in the area. However staying at the hotel entitled us to enter the park an hour early and that a great bonus.  All in all a good stay and no complaints. .

Summary Heading: Not on par with other Disney hotels
Summary: We usually stay at the Grand Californian or the Disneyland Hotel in Anaheim but decided to try the newer Disney hotel this trip. It is much less expensive, but I did not get the "Disney" feel. The hotel really has no lobby and the room décor was blah. It was also quite a walk to the parks, even taking the shortcut through the Grand Californian. The pool was a disappointment as well. Good alternative for those on a budget.

Summary Heading: Not enough Disney "magic" for the price.
Summary: Nice enough Disney hotel, friendly and helpful staff. However: The elevators in this hotel are very slow. Our room was on the 12th floor with a premium view of Disney's California Adventure. Unfortunately the lower half of the window was dirty and the solar film on the outside was wavy and crinkly and impossible to see through. The only place to get a somewhat clear view was all the way behind the drapes looking through one of the side wing parts of the window, which made for a very limited viewing area. I don't think we'll stay there again, the condition of the window made the extra money spent for the view worthless. When making the reservation six months in advance, we requested king bed room and feather pillows. Neither were available when we checked in.

Disney is renowned for the best service that the USA can offer but sadly this hotel does not live up to that reputation. While our room was clean and the view (which we sacrificed extra sums of cash for) was fantastic we felt that the process for checking in and meals left a lot to be desired. Our cards, which were supposed to allow charging of any items in the Disney parks, never worked and there are absolutely no facilities for guests who need to check out early but are leaving California late which was very disappointing. Breakfast was not included and amounts to extortion for what it is. The four stars are only for the view which was beautiful but I would not stay here again.

the rooms are just large enough so your not claustrophobic. the beds are not that  comfortable. there is a 17 dollar a day self parking charge or 25 if you valet park. just being walking distance to the park is not worth the cost. I would stay further out and drive in daily

We decied to add 3 days to our trip and stay at the Paradise.  We ve stayed there many times ,but this time was disappointing.  The first room we had smelled like old socks, or a sour, wet swimsuit.  We had them spray fragrance 2 times and I sprayed Lysol  The firat night I had to cover my face all night so I couldn"t smell the horrible smell. The next day we spoke to the front desk again and they moved us.  Thank you, very nice, but then we found an e-cig under the desk and while getting the dryer from the closet , we found someones underpants  YUCK !  I guess the housekeepers were busy and didn't really check the room  The hairdryer was out of its bag so she hadn't looked in the closet.  We expect more from the Disney hotels.  We ve stayed off site and had nicer rooms.  It was

Everyone at Disney's paradise pier was very friendly and willing to answer any and all questions we had. The hotel was also very clean and a short walking distance to the parks. I think the bathroom showers could have been a little cleaner but overall was a great hotel. My girls loved the pool and water slide.

The 3 Disneyland hotels may be more expensive then the good neighbour hotels but the added cost is so worth it. Your treated like gold and the extras they give you are amazing. We've stayed here twice and it's always incredibly clean and the staff so helpful and friendly. If you can afford the concierge level do it! We ate breakfast and supper for free each night (if your not picky and don't eat like a horse) plus it's free, all you can drink beer and wine each night. All you can eat snacks, pop and water during the day as well. A little extra money on the hotel room, plus concierge can really save on food. Love love love this hotel. Also no waiting in line to get DL tickets or book character dining. Just head to the front desk or if your concierge go to your personal cast

Looking at pictures we knew ahead that it didn't appear to be the nicest of the three Disney hotels but that was what was available at spring break. But we were expecting better given the price we paid. The room was extremely dated with chipping furniture. The bathroom had worn tiles and wood counter was damaged. The service was okay but certainly not the Disney experience and atmosphere that we had hoped for. We never ran into any characters and decor was mediocre in my view. Positive was the small pool and water slide worked well for the kids. Note that parking is convenient but be prepared to haul bags up and down stairs. Key selling point of the hotel was the location and access to magic Morning. Next time we would stay in a non-Disney property as we had our first night or

Disney's Paradise Pier is a fun and a little less expensive place to stay compared to the other Disney Hotel properties.  It still has all the amenities that the other hotels have, but just a little less flash.  Great place to stay when visiting Downtown Disney and the parks.

Let me start by saying the hotel was fine. In fact if it weren't Disney but rather a Hilton or a Marriott I'd probably say it was better than fine. The problem is this hotel IS Disney and because Disney has set the bar so high for themselves this hotel just doesn't feel like part of it. While the staff was friendly enough and there are some slight Disney touches here and there it really felt like an overpriced Hilton to me. The lobby, store, and restaurants were standard fare with Disney imagery practically taped over the signs that once read "lobby bar" and "gift shop." The pool lacks almost all theming (except for a waterslide) and sits adrift in a barren wasteland of concrete. Because of the age of the property (I assume) the air conditioner in my room was just not up to the

Paradise pier is clean and near everything. Beautiful pool with slide and close to downtown Disney. They have buffet breakfast but we didn't have time to eat there. Friendly staff and views. Rooms are nice too,

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay, great amenities, convenient location!
Summary: First time at this hotel and loved it! The room was very nice and the Disney touches like beach ball pillows on the beds were fun. Our view was of the pool area... in the evening we watched as they played Disney movies on a giant outdoor screen. Super friendly front desk staff. Good shopping in the lobby stores, and Disney Character meals in the main restaurant (packed, so suggest you plan accordingly). The small cafe to the side of the main restaurant had a reasonably priced menu and we had one of the best breakfast burritos ever! The hotel is walking distance to Downtown Disney and the park entrance. They have a large parking garage but we used valet parking. Didn't mind the cost but the service, while always courteous, was sometimes really slow. Easy freeway access. We

Paradise Pier was a good hotel. The staff is very nice. We were in town for two of the Disney races. It was so sweet of the staff to wish us luck as we walked out the door at 4:45 am, and we saw them again later, standing out in front of the hotel waving as we ran by. I found out that a lot of the Disney Staff volunteer their own time to cheer on the racers. It's amazing! As for the hotel itself: Everything seemed fresh and clean. The rooms were a decent size, but have a lot of furniture packed in. I suppose that's good for big families, but my husband and I didn't really need two double beds, a fold out futon and a crib!  All the amenities were good, if you like grapefruit scented lotion and body gel. The beds were comfortable. The pillows were a little too fat for me, so I

Summary Heading: Not pleased, money spent does not = value paid
Summary: 1-Parking - there is a parking garage, for a daily fee, that WITHOUT an elevator.  Not informed of this at the front desk and we had to carry luggage down THREE flights of stairs. 2-Club level - only open from 6:30 to 8PM.   could only use the morning food and beverage. The club closes before either park. Unless you are willing to walk the 15 minutes each direction from one of the parks, you CANNOT enjoy any snacks or beer/wine nor any other service you have paid for.  In Florida, club level is open till 10PM.    3-Room was neat and clean.  But, the coffee and tea supplies were not replenished. 4-though located on property, it is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel to either park main entrance.    And it seems even longer after a long day in the parks. value received does not

Having stayed at the Disneyland hotel in November 2014 I have regrets for trying something different.   For two nights out of three we had no hot water and the pool was once again out of order.   We were warned about one night of hot water but why complete maintenance at 10pm when everybody returns from the firework shows ? It would make sense to complete hot water maintenance during the day while its 35 degrees.  The room was ok but average would sum up the complete experience. Do yourself a favour and stay at the Disneyland hotel!

Summary Heading: Not worth the money - not close to the park
Summary: We stayed here in June because we wanted to be near our family who chose to stay at this hotel.  We have also stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and that was a good experience.   When we checked in they explained to us that there would be no running hot water after 10 PM until 6 AM the next morning due to upgrading their systems. When you pay $400 a night for a hotel you expect that you'll be able to shower after coming back at midnight from a long day in the park… The guy who checked us in was polite and nice and spoke to his manager and they did comp us breakfast at the hotel --- I would have rather have known in advance that this was happening so we could have chosen to stay elsewhere for the one night and save $400 or just know what we were walking into. We only booked the room

We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and Grand Californian on our last two trips to Disneyland and decided to give Paradise Pier a try on this stay. We were not disappointed. We knew this was the "budget" Disney hotel but we weren't planning on spending much time in the hotel itself, so we weren't overly concerned about our accommodations.    Our first impression with the hotel was great. The staff at the front desk were all amazing and made us feel very welcome. Our room wasn't ready yet, so we checked our luggage and went to the park. The hotel staff phoned us when our room was ready, but unfortunately it went straight to voicemail and we didn't get the message until we were already back at the hotel around 9pm.   I've heard some people say this hotel is *much* farther away

Summary Heading: Visiting Th Mouse at the Original Magic Kingdom 60th
Summary: Spent a week visiting the Disneyland Resort with our daughter and her family (Granddaughters 6 and 9). Had a great time and staying at a Disney Hotel added to the trip. Is it overpriced compared to others in the area, probably yes. Is it closer than some, yes but others may be closer for walking. However, my daughter wanted to stay here and I was able to get us all a military discount which made the stay a bit cheaper. The staff was outstanding, we checked in early but rooms were not ready. However, we were issued our room cards and would receive a text message when the rooms were ready and the cards would be activated at the same time. Sounds good, but in action it failed. We finally checked back with the hotel around 3:15, not having received a text and one room was ready. We

This may be the lowest price of the 3 Disney hotels at Disneyland, but I thought it was a nice stay.  I was there with my 2 adult daughters for 5 nights.  The room was a nice size with 2 queen beds. We were on the 4th floor with a partial view of California Adventure. The staff was very friendly and it's an easy walk to both parks -- you can cut through the Grand Californian.  The pool is fine and there's a nice place to view the evening fireworks complete with music piped in.  My only negative would be options for food & beverage.  We didn't eat there (too many great options in Downtown Disney, the parks and other Disney hotels), but I would have enjoyed a better lounge to relax at in the evenings upon returning from the park.

The only good thing about staying here was the close access to Downtown Disney and walking to the park. 1 - Checked in, arrive in our room and the room is unmade and dirty 2 - Told at reception that we are only allowed to use the early access "magical Mornings" once during our stay. Later discover that we can use it everyday. 3 - The beds are VERY uncomfortable 4 - rooms are small 5 - Pool is small and was closed for a day with no notice to customers.  For the price you pay to stay at a "Disney Resort" we would have been far better off staying at a hotel outside the park and use the extra money saved to buy nice things once onside.  Very disappointing

Our family of 4 visited Paradise Pier in August 2015 and stayed in one of the rooms overlooking Disney's CA Adventure Park.  What an amazing view - fight from our room we could see World of Color, Cars Land, and Grizzly Peak.  Everything was clean and operated exactly as advertised.  We had previously stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian - so it was time to try this one.  The only reason it was third, was that it looked the farthest away on the map - but it really wasn't bad at all.  You can cut through the Grand Californian to get to the parks, which saves loads of time.  The hotel restaurant is a buffet style (character breakfast) - we were able to get in our first night without a previous reservation.  Only waited about 10 minutes for a table.

Summary Heading: First time stay at the Disney resort
Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel and were really looking forward to and were very excited about our first stay at a Disneyland hotel. On arriving at the hotel we checked in at reception and were served by a very friendly girl who did a wonderful job making us feel welcome. As we were early we could not get into our room until 3pm so we left our bags with the hotel and went to the parks.   When we came back at two we waited until 2.30 when I approached guest services hoping for an early entry to our room as we had just seen a couple of girls do that exact same thing and were granted access to their room early.   Louis, the man at the counter gave me a resounding 'NO! Come back in 15 min!' after doing that I was still told no. At 3pm I again went back to the counter. Room will not

Summary Heading: Family of 5 - great view of World of Color from room
Summary: So we booked a trip to Disneyland with our 3 young kids and we booked a premium view room at the Paradise Pier so that we could return to the hotel for afternoon naps.   By some stroke of luck, they upgraded us to a suite on the 13th floor. We and our kids very much appreciated the extra space to spread out! We had a microwave and fridge in our room, and they have a pack-n-play in every room too. We had planned to order some supplies (like diapers and such) and groceries to our room, and while Von's does this often, they only accept US credit cards. So we had to use someone else after we arrived at the hotel. Just ask at the front desk, and they'll give you the pamphlet. (We figured it would be easier than packing a big stack of diapers and heavy baby food on the plane.)  For

my wife and i stayed here last year.they treated us like royalty when we stay here and now we are gong back again. in fact we are getting an early start by having breakfast at PCH Grill and going in to the park early. we are gong to stay for seven days.

We stayed here for 3 nights. On arrival we were checked in straight away. The check in assistant informed me that we had been given a room upgrade. This was to view the park. Nice to watch world of colour!  I didn't hold any expectations of the hotel as other reviews were mixed with positive and negative feedback.  The room was nothing special but clean. I agree with other reviews that it does need to be updated as there's obvious wear and tear.  We loved being close to the Parks and Down town Disney.  The food choice for room service is what you would expect. Ours took about 40 minutes to arrive. Very nice and we'll presented.  But as you would expect, expensive!  The pool area was great and my children loved the water slide. The life guards take their job seriously and we're

My son and I had a great stay at Paradise Pier!  We chose to stay in one of the concierge rooms and it was a really good value for everything we received.    The Good: Our room had a great location with walk out access to the pool and 1 floor away from the concierge lounge. Our beds were comfy, the blackout curtains worked well, nice amenities in the bathroom, all very clean.  My son loved the beach ball pillow! The concierge lounge was well stocked for a continental breakfast--pastries and breads (including bagels that you could toast,) fresh fruits (including berries, not just melons), cereals, juices (cran, orange, and apple,) and really good coffee and tea. I'm on a low carb diet, so there were a couple of choices--hard boiled eggs and a variety of cheeses.  I asked for some

I was told this was once a hotel owned by someone other than Disney, and I believe it. It just doesn't have that Disney feel. Hotel staff was not overly helpful: they answered questions, but didn't offer information. They didn't seem happy in their jobs. The walk to the parks is much longer than they say because you have to make it all the way though Downtown Disney before entering the parks. Room was ok. Pool was a disappointment and really, the restaurants need upgrades. The pool restaurant had very, very limited options (except for alcohol) and they we constantly out of items (example: a two hour wait for pretzels). The rooms were clean, but the rest of the facilities were not (spilled ice cream in places, and I am not even sure they sell ice cream).  When I stay at a Disney

We had a great stay at Paradise Point from December 30 - January 2, 2015.  This was our first family trip to Disneyland.  We've stayed both on and off property at WDW many times.  Paradise Pier is a wonderful hotel for families, and just a short walk to both gates and Disneyland and California Adventure.  Our family loved strolling through Downtown Disney in the early morning hours, stopping at Starbucks for a coffee, and heading to the turnstiles to be among the first in line for the day.    We had a car carrier on our vehicle since we had driven across country from Arkansas, and the nice attendants in the front allowed us to park our car right in the front of the hotel, as it was too tall for their other parking option.  Wonderfully accommodating!    We didn't eat at the hotel

We got in early before check in and were able to drop our bags and head directly over to the park. The. Heck on process was extremely quick and efficient as well as the bag check in at the bellman desk. We also has a few big breakable souvenirs sent over with their resort delivery service and they were there at 7 the next morning..  Overall a great trip and am looking forward to staying here again!

This is the second time we have stayed at Paradise Pier Hotel. Rooms are always comfortable and clean. Ordered room service for dinner and it was timely and very good. It was nice to just chill in our room after a long day at the parks. The location is great, you get the early morning hour which is awesome! We walk through another Disney hotel to go directly into the California Adventure Park, there is also a shortcut that lands you in the middle of Downtown Disney, rather than having to walk the long way. We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Stay Overall, but Magic Band Disappointment
Summary: I just checked out today from a 4 night stay with my family, on our Southern California Adventure!  I did have high expectations because it is Disney and I know their product well.  The only thing I was disappointed in was the fact that Disneyland resorts are still in the dark ages with their ticketing, and room keys/charging to your room.  The Walt Disney World resorts and ticketing have all been upgraded to Magic Bands if you stay on property, and bio-metric cards for park entry if you are a pass holder of any other kind.  Because my family owns property in Orlando, my child was looking forward to the full Disney experience.  He was very disappointed on arrival when it was a plastic keycard, even though it was personalized with his name on it.  Even more disappointing was the

This was a perfect stay for many reasons:  1. Location! This enabled a comfortable walk to the parks, the ability to go back to the rooms when heat became unbearable and return in the evening. 2. Early access to the parks is available to all guests regardless of duration of stay. This was not clear to us from the web site, but is indeed the case. This means a LOT in terms of popular rides. 3. Association with Disney - our purchases at the parks were delivered to the hotel - no need to lug them around all day. 4. Rooms for five - not easy to find.  In addition to these, the hotel staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, parking was plentiful, the rooms was nicely set up and maintained.  Fireworks are visible from the roof, and are fun to see from the hotel, but definitely also

Summary Heading: Great location! Expensive, but expected and worth it!
Summary: I have been a Disney nut since my first time at 1 years old ;). This was my first time ever staying at a Disney hotel & it was definitely worth it. When we arrived, we had a plate of 4 HUGE Mickey cupcakes and a certificate waiting for us on the bed. This was accompanied with a note from the fairy's who clean our room welcoming us to the hotel. We also received an automated call from Mickey. It was a very nice surprise!   The hotel is bright, clean, fun & steps from downtown Disney. While there are much cheaper hotels within the vicinity, you just can't beat the convenience or the "magic" a Disney hotel has to offer. I wasn't disappointed. The character theme breakfast buffet was delicious & the drinks in the lounge were yummy! I really don't have a single complaint, other than

For our first mommy & daddy vacation in 3 years, my husband and I decided to splurge and stay at the Paradise Pier for Disney's 60th anniversary. The hotel was clean, but felt a bit run down. I knew it was an older hotel, but I think I was expecting to feel a bit newer and fresh. Our room was very nice, but the bed was slightly uncomfortable. It had a "hammock" feel to it. The WiFi was a bit frustrating to connect to in the room, but was fine when you are in the common areas. We loved how close it is to the parks. It's nice to be able to enter in one of the parks an hour early and use the special entrance for Disneyland Hotel guests only!

Summary Heading: I just can't recommend this hotel
Summary: My child and I stayed two nights in this hotel at the end of our trip. It was a disappointment. First, what I liked: * Staff was friendly and helpful, at a level only Disney staff can be. * The room was large and bright. * We ordered room service each morning. Breakfast was good, and delivered quickly, though a tiny bit expensive when all of the fees were added in.  What I didn't like: * This soured the experience for me...the incomprehensible lack of an elevator in the parking garage. I parked on the second floor. To get to the lobby (with a small child), I had to take two suitcases and a stroller down two sets of stairs. It made no sense to me that there is no other way to get stuff from the car to this hotel. * It was expensive. For the same price or less I could have stayed

This is an expensive place to stay, but the kids wanted the whole disney experience, so we did it. Nice place to stay, wifi was good, and staff was very friendly. Just dont order room service, go down to the restaurant and save some $$$.

Summary Heading: First time at a Disney Hotel
Summary: Put this in the book of memories because this was the first time stay for our family at a Disney Hotel.  Of course you'll pay a lot because its Disney but if you're me, you'll look for a deal and I found one. I probably cant mention what and where but I got a great package deal so for me to stay here was worth it.  We were so close to Downtown Disney that we didn't have to drive to the Disney parking or shuttle, we just crossed the street into the Disneyland Resort Hotel.  The best part was, one night we were in CA Adventure Park and we were able to exit through the Disney Resort Hotel right back to our hotel. Saved us about a 10 minute walk and believe me, at the end of the day with tired kids, you want a shorter walk.  So Paradise Pier's rooms were clean and decorated nice.

We spent several days at Paradise Pier the first week of August.  The location is ideal, and yes, you do get early entry into the parks which is nice.  We had a double queen room on the third floor and could see the Disney fireworks from the roof on the third floor.  The staff was quiet friendly and accommodating.  The pool was closed for part of one day that we were there so the grandkids were a little disappointed, but were able to enjoy it later.  If I have any negatives to say it would be that the hotel is showing age and seems dated especially for the cost to stay.  I would also have to comment on the lack of dining options if you happen to come back later in the evening.  Also, the WIFI was a bit spotty so if you need to work that could be an issue.

We had a great time in Disneyland and the hotel was more or less ok. It is a bit old fashioned and the pool area isn't nice. It has fun slides for the kids but compared to other more modern hotels we stayed at during our vacation it was not very charming. Location is of course great with walking distance to the parks but it doesn't come close to the quality of Disneyland itself and it ought to since the price is up there. We passed another hotel even closer to the park that looked a lot better and if we had known about the quality difference in advance we would have been willing to pay for the upgrade.

I have to agree with some other negative posts here. I guess I was thinking it would be more like a Florida Disney resort (I've stayed at the Polynesian)...it was not. I didn't even like the location- you still had to cross a street and the monorail was a bit further than just walking to the main gate- so it was no help (just another line to stand in).  Either stay at an "off property" nicer hotel for half the money and walk another 100 yards or pony up a lot of dough and stay at the Californian Resort (it looked amazing). The staff was okay, the pool was small and crowded, and the concierge level wasn't worth it. The only bright spot was that my 4 year old loved the slide. We didn't even try either of the restaurants because they were always empty and depressing looking.   Oh-

This is a nice hotel -- nothing spectacular except for being on property and having the extra magic hour.  We stayed here in 2008 as well as in 2015, and there were very few differences in the hotel between our two stays.  It is becoming dated (needs a bit of a facelift), but it is pleasant and incredibly convenient.  There is a cartoon viewing room  and arcade for kids -- perfect places to send tweens while parents pack up and check out.  If you have a park view room, you can watch the Pixar Parade and the nighttime show at California Adventure right from the room.  And the hotel sets up chairs near the pool for viewing the Disneyland fireworks each night.  So even though the rooms aren't outstanding, the hotel has lots to offer to round out your Disney trip.

We stayed at this hotel for the benefit of the extra magic hour. That's why the hotel gets 2 stars. This was invaluable for us in getting on the good rides early at California Adventure. Other than that, the hotel felt like a cheap motel - certainly not like a Disney hotel. There was no Disney 'magic', the hotel was old and tired, the staff were ignorant to the point of being rude, the wifi in the rooms didn't work (despite the staff trying to insist that it did). And all this for over double the price of a non-Disney hotel equally close to the park. Don't get me wrong, we love Disneyland - and our day there was magical - but this hotel is not. Disney take note - you need to seriously renovate and upgrade this hotel - and hire new staff. Not impressed.

Summary Heading: Pretty good, just not necessarily the best option
Summary: Let me start off with, we've stayed at the Grand Californian the past few times, so my opinion is a bit skewed.  That being said, we tried the Paradise Pier as a "lower cost" option to get the same general conveniences of the Grand Californian at 75% of the cost.  In other words, you still get the Magic Morning pass to go in an hour earlier (about the only way to guarantee a fast pass for Cars Ride), and good walking proximity to and from the park, especially valuable with young kids.  Room was nice and spacious, bright, and well decorated.  We overlooked the pool, and also got to see the fireworks at night, so great overall views.  Swimming pool is great, had a big pool for the big kids, wading pool, and a pretty good water slide.  Hotel does seem a bit tired, it could use a

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, hotel not like a Florida Disney hotel
Summary: Enjoyed our stay but the hotel is not like a Florida Disney hotel so be prepared.  Staff is nice, rooms spacious and clean.  Restaurant options are minimal so we ordered room service for breakfast which wasn't our first choice.  The regular restaurant was only a character option, much too crowded.

We were here for a conference. Easy to access to Disneyland less than 5 minutes. Our room was easy to see and hear the scream from roller coaster :) also ok to see the firework at night. Parking space was limited but ok to find one.

We stayed overnight even though we live about 2 hours away because we purchased 2 day tickets. The room had an awesome view of Disney's California Adventure park. I'm pretty sure Disneyland's nightly fireworks are visible from the higher floors as well. The room was clean and had a safe and mini fridge in the TV console for guests to use. The sofa folds down at the backrest to turn into a twin sized bed. The beds were very comfortable. The pool area has a kiddie pool for younger children and a water slide that goes into the regular pool. They have life vests and swim diapers for babies if needed. There's a room showing Disney cartoons with adorable mini Adirondack chairs for the kids. We had no problems walking from the parks to the hotel. You pretty much expect to walk when you

My trip to Disneyland wasn't a great experience. Hundreds of people and the heat did not really do it for me and I probably won't ever be back. However, this hotel made all the difference. I thought the rooms were so cute and the view was amazing. The staff was very kind and helpful. I highly recommend it.

Summary Heading: Few problems, but worth it to stay on property
Summary: I just returned from a Disneyland trip, there were 12 of us in the room. I took my daughter and 4 of her friends, then my dad, brother and other brother and his wife as well as their 2 small children. We got one of the large suites on the 15th floor. The room had 3 different rooms - one had a king and a sofa bed, the middle room had a couch that folded out into a queen sized bed as well as a table with 4 chairs. The other room had 2 queens and a single fold out sofa chair. There were 3 total bathrooms. We added the concierge service to our room as well. I will go over the pros and cons for you in case you are planning a large group trip (or family trip).   Pros: Very close to the parks, I timed it and it was 12 minutes walking from the gates of Disneyland to the hotel. If you

Summary Heading: Concierge is the way to go!
Summary: You are certainly paying extra for a Disney hotel, the question is if it's worth it to you.  All of the famous Disney touches were there from outstanding customer service to hidden Mickeys.  My family (4adults & a 16 yr old) stayed in one Park View Concierge room.  Sharing one bathroom took a bit of planning but we would certainly do it again.    For the price of 2 rooms in an off-property hotel, we were more than comfortable in room 1410.  The view of the park was a splurge; seeing the 'back' of World of Color with the audio playing from the TV was a unique experience.  There were chocolates and Mickey shaped rice crispy treats left in the room for us (YUM)!  The walk to Disneyland was 8-10mins and DCA about 5mins.  We took advantage of early entry in DCA; only waiting 20mins

Loved this hotel great customer service and clean nice rooms with comfortable bedding and pillows and was so nice to have the fold down twin size bed that was couch and even that was comfortable . Only thing was if your not going to character dining you have to eat at little bar area. Pricey hotel but would love to stay again. Also if your using pool be prepared for lots of people , we walked to California Hotel to check it out it has 3 big pools little more swimming space over there but I don't think your allowed to swim if not staying at that hotel .

Summary Heading: Good value for being on property
Summary: This is not a luxury resort, but it meets our family's needs. We don't spend much time in the room because we are in the parks. Only issue we had was getting breakfast so we could get into the parks early. The hotel cafe says it opens at six but most days it was 10 minutes later. Hard to get a hot breakfast and get in line early for early admission when they open so late and take 20 minutes to cook food.

This review is for the surfs up character breakfast only. Upon arrival we had our photo op with Mickey. That was the moment I had been looking for from the time we made our reservation. You need reservations if you want to make sure you get in. Our server was very polite and attentive to our drink needs and clearing our dirty dishes. The buffet has a lot to offer. Just a few to mention are made to order omelettes ,salmon, fresh fruit and Mickey shaped waffles and pancakes to briefly mention. We ate enough to get us through the morning and early afternoon. Mickey hangs out in the photo op area so everyone gets an opportunity to get photos with your own devices while Minnie, Daisy Duck, Pluto and Stitch come to your table for fun visits. Be aware the price is about forty dollars

It's certainly the farthest Disney-owned hotel from the parks, but for the price and quality you get at a Disney property, it's totally worth it. I've stayed multiple times with my family, eaten at the restaurants, enjoyed the pool and watched the fireworks from the roof deck. We've enjoyed every aspect, and I would highly recommend a stay!   For little kids though, be prepared for some complaints on the walk back to the hotel. You can take the monorail out of Disneyland to shave a good half mile off the work (approximately), but you have to be prepared to walk through downtown Disney, past the theater, and then another 5 minutes around the corner to make it back to the hotel. Completely manageable, but it does feel like a schlep towards the end of the night.

Summary Heading: Onsite doesn't live up to the hype
Summary: I've been to Walt Disney world a few times and on the Disney Dream cruise ship so maybe my expectations were too high. It wa an average hotel. Housekeeping was sloppy and cut corners. You get access to extra magic hours but that didn't make it worth $325 per night. There are tons of non-Disney properties which are a shorter walking distance away. If I ever come back I will either stay at a non-Disney property or I will stay at the Grand Californian. Walking through there every day on the way to the parks just emphasized how crappy our hotel was in comparison. My daughter is taking an online summer school class and the wifi is the worst I've ever experienced. When we called to report it, rather than offering to do anything about the poor connection she was told to come down to

Summary Heading: Wasn't sure how we'd like the hotel, but after staying, we'll be returning!
Summary: Purchased this hotel through a vacation package through Costco. I have had both good and bad experiences with off property hotels / motels at Disneyland, so decided to try this one for a little more money. We were not disappointed! We arrived to Christmas carolers in the lobby, a nice little holiday touch. Check in was impeccable and although we reserved a standard room we were upgraded to a too with a fabulous view of California Adventure. We were even able to watch their nightly water/ light show from our room while listening to the audio on the tv. Easy walking distance to both parks and Downtown Disney.

Booked a last minute 4-day stay at the Paradise Pier with my wife. We had a great time, the staff at the entrance and front desk were very personable and friendly. We had a package that included park tickets (and early morning access to the park) as well as the club services at the hotel. It was so awesome to be able to take a short walk back to the hotel to relax during the day and grab snacks/drinks, etc. They also provided bottled or filtered water which is a lot better than the tap water in Anaheim. We enjoyed a couple drinks in the evenings and 'rented' the complimentary Disney movies. The pool area would have been my favourite back when I was a kid, I'll settle for the hot tub as an adult though. We had a room with a patio space and it was great to sit in the chairs there;

Summary Heading: Fun place to enjoy the Disney magic!
Summary: The beach themed rooms are fun, clean, and very comfortable.  We've stayed at this hotel on two occasions, and both times we were completely satisfied.  We live in the area, and opted to stay at a Disney hotel to get the most of our our visit, and to enjoy the early admission granted to hotel guests.  The pool and hotel grounds are nothing special, but that's not really the point of visiting this hotel.  Overall, a quality experience.

This was the first time our family "splurged" and instead of staying in our usual Howard Johnson's, we decided to stay at Paradise Pier. What a great experience. The atmosphere puts you into vacation mode as soon as you step into the main doors. All of the employees were extremely helpful and courteous. They were always eager to help whatever the need. The walk to Disney is so much easier with the monorail just a short walk away. Or, you can walk Downtown Disney and enter the main gates if you choose.  The rooms were very spacious, which were nice for our five adults. We had two queen beds and a couch that folded into a bed. All were very comfortable.  There are several perks to staying at the hotel, but I recommmend you actually spend time in the hotel to use them all.  The

We had some complications at the Grand Californian Hotel and Spa, where we had to move over to Paradise Pier. This hotel is absolutely amazing. When you walk in the hotel its warm and inviting. Here at the Paradise Pier you're automatically transformed into a beach themed hotel. Great hotel, especially with kids. The hotel itself is just magically. We were in 1437 which is a standard view 1 bedroom suite with club level. The beachcomber club agents Rochelle and Donny were absolutely amazing. They made us forget about the nightmares at the Grand Californian. The beachcomber club is simply amazing. The food is much better than the Grand Californian. The rooms are just spacious, well-themed, and gorgeous. The bathroom is huge with modern amenities. At the end of the night we

This was our first time staying at Paradise Pier. We loved the Ocean Theme. The room was clean, comfortable and super cute. It is a short walk to the park. The pool is on the roof which was different. But it isn't fancy like Disney Hotel or CA Adventure hotel.

Summary Heading: Semi-annual family visit to the parks
Summary: We were in 3 rooms on 10th floor. Parents in one, new 21 year male, two teen girls. Arrived on a Friday at 10am, one room was  us to drop bags in and get ready to hit the parks. Two rooms were connected and one was solo. This level with rooms 1026, 1028 and 1030 you get a really nice view of WOC and a couple of the parades passing through the plaza. Rooms were quiet, the AC would reach max cool very quickly. It's also nice to be able to open the windows (3-4" max) for fresh air; although doing so will enhance traffic noise (racing engines - immediate police sirens) from Disneyland Drive below. We did not experience the elevator jams mentioned in earlier reviews. We did not do any early mornings. We ordered morning room service around  8-9 am each morning. It would take between

room was clean and decorated with beach theme, safe and very good working fridge in room, kept soda and water nice and cold, close to theme parks, only complaint i had about this hotel was lack of affordable food, buffet was 28 per person, not alot of choices at this hotel for food, ordered room  service one night at about 7pm and was told that there were no more mashed potatoes for that evening, really the price you pay for room service they should have everything available until at least 10pm , poor planning on their part, and we were there for four days, and the water slide was closed at least one of those days, that was one of the reasons i had booked the hotel, of course you could walk on over to disneyland resort and use their slide i was told, but after walking all over

The hotel is very close to the Disney parks. That is the main reason to stay here. The convenience is great. However the hotel has many things lacking.   Pros - short walk to downtown Disney and california adventure.   - had a view of the tower of terror from our room. Could see the parks.   - rooms were spacious and fit for comfortably.   Cons - hotel lost power for 3-4 hours during our stay  - they offered direct tv. This did not work during the entirety of our stay. This was a little annoying when trying to unwind after a day at the park.   - wifi was spotty at best. We basically had to turn it off on our phones and use data.   Overall the hotel lacked many things and was very expensive. However it is very convenient for access to the parks.

Good location.  The hotel had a "Surfing Theme". Everywhere we went was clean.  The staff was helpful and friendly.  The kids loved the water slide by the pool.  I thought it was very family friendly and would recommend it.    :)

Great location clean and lovely hotel very dated  Location was great walking distance to Disneyland and downtown Disney area  Great eateries all around   Hotel services was great efficient and friendly   Would stay again and children enjoyed it immensely   Family friendly with laundry room to make travelling a bit easier

We reserved 3 rooms for our family of 7.  The front staff was very friendly. The rooms were on the third floor and close to each other but just above the pool.   Only one room was ready on arrival.  The room was adequate but in need of updating.  Torn beach ball pillows and dinged furniture. This hotel really doesn't say "Disney."   The pool was refreshing but quite small and noisy.  My husband left a shirt and we received a phone call saying they would send it to us.  I also lost a gold necklace and it has not been found.  My fault--should have put it in the safe but it was tucked in my makeup case. The best thing about this hotel is location.  We took advantage of magic mornings, came back to rest and went back in the evenings.  An easy walk to Downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: Great Location, and worth the spend
Summary: The location of the Paradise Pier is excellent and well worth the extra spend to stay on park. We had club level rooms (2) that were interconnecting. The club level offerings are fantastic and make it well worth the spend.  The staff in the Club lounge were exceptionally helpful and service was excellent.   Rooms clean, but you will wait for a lift and no internal stairs that are an easy option. But hey you are on holidays.  Be warned it is loud, but only because of the Disneyland fireworks   Would highly recommend and go back

Checked in 1 hour before check in time and room was ready. Front desk staff very helpful and were even able to exchange our vouchers for park tickets so we didn't have to stand in line at the park ticket kiosks. Room was large (2 adults, one 11 year old and a 1 year old). Included a pack n play for the baby which was great! We had room 1310 on the 13th floor with a view of DCA and it was amazing. At night we watched WOC from our room with the soundtrack playing on the tv :) Maids were great - always came back to a clean fresh room by 12pm. No issues with elevators which had been mentioned in past reviews. Also thought it was worth the $ to stay at a Disney hotel to have a magic morning everyday. A wonderful stay!

Clean rooms, very cute decor, friendly and helpful staff. You are paying a little extra for the location.... but its more affordable than the Grand and this place is always up to Disney's high standards.

My wife and I decided to take our 3 Grandchildren to Disneyland for the first time. My wife and I had been before several times but had never stayed at a Disneyland property. When I researched on line for a hotel the big draw over other properties was convenience to the parks. It does deliver on that, even though it's not as close as the Grand Californian or Disneyland Hotel it's a 10 to 15 minute walk.   The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. We had an oversized vehicle but all the oversize parking was taken when we arrived. The bellman let me park up front and saved my spot when we left the hotel for a few hours.   Our room was very clean, and while not spacoius like a suite there were 2 Queen beds and futon that accommodated 3 children and 2 adults very

Summary Heading: Good hotel, but expected more from Disney.
Summary: The staff go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable, but they are missing so much that they have in Orlando. The parks and the hotel don't share functions, so they can't help you with ticketing issues. The hotel is very quiet and boring. The locations of the 3 hotels on the Disneyland property are ideal, directly connected to Downtown disney make the access to and from the parks a snap. For the price you do expect more.

Stayed at this hotel in 2005, ten years later hotel did not let us down. We are yearly visitors to the Disneyland Resort and last two visits we stayed at the other properties. Stayed 3 nights. Paradise Pier was clean, staff was helpful and friendly. We were able to get an early check-in which was key as we have 3 kids including a 15 mo old. Our room had a pool view, got quite loud at times. Kids loved the surf theme in the room and throughout the hotel. Character Breakfast at PCH Grill inside the hotel was great, we had reserved a table in advance and got a table by the window.
