Accessing Downtown Disney and the theme parks was a breeze, taking shortcuts through Grand Californian. Parking was not an issue. Only disappointment was the wait time for elevators. We had to literally

Summary Heading: Not Disney Quality for the price
Summary: Not impressed for the price.  Pool area was ok and staff was not attentive.  Most days the bar was closed and had limited selection.  The staff was not warm or friendly.  The hotel and rooms are very dated and no extra Disney magic other than old, torn beach balls.  I will never stay there again.  Would rather pay less for a better resort off property or pay more for the Disneyland Hotel.

Summary Heading: exellent location for the parks but very old hotel
Summary: Very old hotel, the pool is horrible small and no very clean. the rooms smell bad. the location is great to go to the parks but for the price its very very expensive because the condition the hotel is very bad.

My boyfriend and I decided to celebrate our son's birthday a little early this year.  Paradise Pier had a great rate and we chose this hotel because it seemed fun.  We were right!  The rooms are a beachy feel and quite spacious with 2 queen beds and a sofa in the room, along with the usual desk, t.v. armoire, and nightstands. Of course, the Disney theme is all over the room, which made me very happy. The bathroom was a good size, and I LOVE the fact that the bathroom is one room with a door to separate, as opposed to so many hotels and motels that the bathroom sink area is opened to the sleeping area.  We were on the 11th floor and faced the pool. A nice view, nothing overly spectacular but okay since we wanted to use the pool anyway.  The pool is a fairly good size and was

We met family that came in town from Alaska.  The hotel was clean and the rooms were spacious.  The pool was nice but the downside was they advertised their water slide and that was closed off for repairs .  But they did offer to upgrade us to the Disneyland hotel pool if we wanted to.  There was only one little restaurant bar.  There was a breakfast buffet that we paid for with our package to have breakfast with the characters and the kids got to meet three characters Stitch,  Pluto and they saw Mickey Mouse when they walked in.  Overall great hotel for the price and for celebrating precious family times.

Not worth the money spent. Rooms are small, even for two queen beds. The pool water had a nasty taste and small. Not much places to eat within the hotel. The staff are friendly and accommodating. A good view of the park if you're in the upper rooms.

Excellent hotel for our stay. We had two adjoining rooms for the two families. We were located right by the pool and it was very quiet. This area is awesome for viewing the fireworks. The walk to the Park is not long at all and the early hours is a big help. We went to two character breakfasts and the entertainment was the best, the food just better than OK. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. Everything about Disneyland is expensive so we just go with the flow while we were there. The room delivery for food was the best. Breakfast was huge. For dinner the two waiters rolled the service carts into our room and even sang a Disney tune and poured our wine for us. I do think we shall return.

As a young married couple, my wife and I used to stay at the Grand Californian. But now with our son with us, we need our dollars to go a bit farther. Nonetheless, we enjoyed our stay!  Pros:   The hotel is a lot quieter (less busy) than either the Grand Californian or the Disneyland Hotel  The pool, while a bit small, was well run and everything was clean. Plus they had free life vests and free swimming diapers for the little ones!  The beach theme of the hotel was a nice change and our room was great!  Cons:  The Surfside Lounge, while the food was good, the service was below par. Some of the worst Disney service we have ever had.   Food options at the pool. Unless you like hot dogs, chips, and a choice of 2 cold sandwiches, there is no food to speak of. However, awesome

Yeah it's pricey, all the Disney hotels are. Stayed 3 nights, club room included. Dalton checked us in early, gave us a park view and our 'pack' with tickets, vouchers and commemorative luggage tags-nice touch. Had 2 very full days and nights at parks, Downtown, pool. Exhausted! Great fun

Just stayed here the last 2 weeks of July.  I had read lots of reviews before arriving and was a little worried about a few points. Mainly the lifts and the distance to the parks.   After staying here in peak season I can say the first worry about the lifts was no problem.  Yes it gets a little busy in the morning from 7am but that's when everyone is getting ready for the parks.   We just got up earlier and had no problems.  Same at night time. Even when we didn't miss the crowd it was never more than a few minutes wait.   The walk to the parks is close and easy.  I don't know why people complain it is far.  Cut through grand California hotel for downtown disney or DCA.  It's not even 5 minutes.  You will end up walking 20km in the parks.   Rooms were clean. Our check in was

Summary Heading: Kids thought it truly was paradise
Summary: We opted for Paradise Pier as it was more economical than the other Disney locations. We had no trouble checking in. The hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly.  Our family (two adults, two kids ages 5 and 7) stayed in a room that had a view of California Adventure. It was great as we had a perfect view of the fireworks and water show every night during Disney's 60th anniversary.  We had dinner the first night at the main restaurant - can't think of the name. Our server was so nice. The food was good and the drinks were great. this was very much appreciated after our long journey from CT to CA.   The pool area is very nice. Note that it is empty in the morning and gets very crowded in the afternoon when families seem to be returning to the hotel to take a break from the

We stayed here for our family trip to Disneyland ...it is the cheaper of the three resort locations that one can stay at. Overall it was a good location, at the end of downtown Disney district, easy access to California land if you cross the street and go through the grand California .  Rooms big and clean, cast members helpful and pleasant .   Overall a good experience

Our room wasn't ready at 3:20pm.  Then they told us they had 'upgraded' out room. I originally booked a room with 2 double beds but they were giving us a room with a king bed and a pull out sofa but it had a park view. The pull out was so uncomfortable I had a backache all day at Disneyland. The sofa bed was not made up either which we only found out that night when we returned from the park. I had a hair in my club sandwich which was ordered from room service. My friend stayed in Disneyland a few hours more than me  and she had the bag tags so baggage services wouldn't release the bags to me. The hallways are dark, dated and dingy. $500 a night, what a joke. Customer service was of a poor standard. Not what I'd expect for a Disney hotel.

We love staying here. From the Disney themed rooms to the Disney customer service, you get it all. It's less expensive than the Disneyland Hotel but just as good in my opinion. You get what you pay for here.

Summary Heading: Still great after all these years
Summary: Although many people state that of the three Disney properties this property lacks the Disney theme, I would say that yes, it's not all in your face, but it's great. The last remodel has been quite some time but I'm still impressed how well the rooms have held up. The beach theme is very nice and I like the light colors in the theming in the property. I especially love the size of the room. I've been in the room with 2 -4 people and it's never felt too cramped. The other plus is the mirror and coffee maker which doubles as another vanity while someone is in the bathroom.   I do find that this property is overlooked and some amenities are minimal but you have the two other properties within walking distance should you prefer a finer cocktail lounge or some entertainment.   The

Nice place to stay, place was really clean. The resort is very close to Down Town Disney, and both parks as well as the too other resort hotels. There is also a sit down character breakfast in the hotel.

We had a premium view room that we booked through Orbitz.  The view was AMAZING.  The view alone I can now understand why you pay so much for the hotel.  We watched World of Color from our room the one night (music is played on a specific TV channel).  You could also see the fireworks from the balcony area at the end of the hall.  The room itself is pretty standard.  We found the beds super comfortable and our son loved the beach ball pillow.  We utilized the pack n play for our daughter as well.  We didn't have any issues with the room whatsoever.  With that said, I can't say we would ever stay again.  We were there for 4 nights.  We did go back to the hotel room during the day.  2 days we used the pool.  The water slide is so much fun and the kids pool was great for our 1 year

Stayed on the 12th floor pretty good views the suite was very comfortable overall 2 full bathrooms a living area and 1 bedroom with two queen beds probably not worth the money but my 5 year old and 2 year old couldn't sleep all night excited looking at all the lights across the street and fireworks going on

The room was very clean and decorating nicely.  We were on the 5th floor facing California Adventure.  Unfortunately, the palm trees blocked our entire view of the park.  The elevators are extremely slow especially at dinner time.  All and all, the hotel was very nice with the previous exceptions.  We would visit this hotel again in the future.

Summary Heading: A Disney Property that doesn't live up to the others
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights at the Paradise Pier.  In the past 4 years we have stayed 3 times at the Disneyland Hotel.  Comparing the two is almost unfair.  Let me first say that this doesn't mean that the Paradise Pier is a bad hotel.  We chose to stay here because our vacation was a week later than normal and as a result the rate at the Disneyland Hotel bumped up $400.  We decided that we would try a new property and see how we liked it.    The rooms were nice.  The beds were comfortable and each room comes with a refrigerator, coffee maker, and TV that includes the ability to hook up your own devices.  That's a nice feature for people traveling with kids who have their favorite movies saved on a laptop or tablet.  Our room was on the third floor looking out at California

Paradise Pier was one of those one off experiences that you have every now and then, the rooms were spacious for 2 of us and the hotel was lovely and clean, we had concierge, so were able to go and get snacks if were got hungry

We enjoyed the paradise pier hotel  very much . We had a concierge level room with a patio that had access to the pool . What a great room .   Location of hotel was great right across from the disneyland hotel & short cut to downtown disney which led u to the park entrances .     Hotel was kept clean . Only complaint I have is the elevators were very slow .. Other than that we enjoyed our stay very much !!!

My wife and I decided to stay at the Paradise Pier since it was close to Disneyland, and indeed it was, at short walk right into California Adventure or Downtown Disney (Shops & Restaurants) with a path to the gates of The Magic Kingdom.  The hotel has a character breakfast at PCH Grill, buffet food, custom omelets. Overall great experience.  There is a pool with water slide on the third floor (we did not attend, however our room overlooked it. Looked amazing.)  There is also a Disney gift store and smaller cafe on property.  Only negative, small negative was the bed was a bit to hard for us. It did not affect our stay, just our preference.  Room was large, king bed, sleeper couch, desk, flat screen, safe & fridge.  I had a surprise for my wife and the hotel did not let me down.

We stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier for my son's 5th birthday party.  We had a fabulous time.  I am not sure how many people know this but if you stay in a Disney Hotel you get in to Disneyland an hour before the general public.  Disney hotels are expensive but Paradise Pier is the least expensive of the three and with kids I think it is the best option.  The "Magic Hour" makes it worth the extra expense and even if you only stay one night, the "Magic Hour" perk is valid both the day you check in and the day you check out.  I called the hotel a couple of days before we checked in to ask if they could do anything to recognize my son's birthday.  The customer service person I spoke with was very personable and helpful.  He chose us as the "Big Kahona" guests of the day.  This gave

Summary Heading: BEWARE - Just spend the extra money and stay and Disneyland Hotel
Summary: Let me start by saying that I have stayed at the other properties and I ALWAYS have a pleasant experience. Until this hotel. We wanted to mix it up and try a new hotel next to California Adventure. BIG MISTAKE. There are three elevators. One of them broke. We waiting over 20 minutes to get an elevator down to the first floor. Someone got stuck in the elevator. The fire alarm was broken on our floor too. The beds were horrible and the wifi was horrible. It was like Disney gave up on this hotel. It's just sad. I could have paid 60 more an stayed at Disneyland Hotel which is phenomenal. Boo.

Summary Heading: Great Front of the house service, still over priced.
Summary: When you walk through doors you know the experience you are going to get is real.  Your at Disneyland and you are going to have a great time with your family.  A statue of Goofy in his classic swimwear sporting a surfboard stands watch in the center of the lobby drawing the careful attention of the children as they walk in.  The front desk service was top notch full of information and covering specific details about attractions and times during your stay in the area.  We went on a Birthday vacation for my daughter and everyone was on point with a Happy Birthday wish while she was wearing the pin with her name provided by the front desk.  There is a small lounge area with a bar tucked away in a back corner behind the bell desk that comes with big bar prices.  I was surprised to

We frequently visit Disneyland and love to stay in the park at the Grand Californian and Disneyland Hotel.  This time, we tried Paradise Pier Hotel which is also a Disney hotel.    The staff was certainly up to Disney standards.  Everyone we encountered was kind, friendly, cheerful and helpful.  The hotel itself was not magical enough to justify the pricing.  The air conditioner/heater in our room couldn't be adjusted to a tolerable temperature.  The window glass was so distorted that we couldn't enjoy the premium view.  The hotel is showing its age and in need of some work.

It seems the Paradise Pier Hotel is hit and miss, and we experienced both good and not so good.  The majority of the cast members here were friendly and helpful. Unfortunately upon check-in we were not given the room charging privileges I had requested, which was both embarrassing and frustrating when we later ordered room service and I didn’t have time to fix the room charge issue until we returned to our room after midnight. We also had to carry our recyclables around with us if we wanted to be more earth friendly. The only place at the hotel I saw recycling bins offered was in the pool area (nowhere in the hotel itself, in our rooms, in the parking garage, or out front). There were also recycling bins nearby on the walkway toward the Disneyland Hotel, at the Grand Californian

This hotel was so cool, the breakfast had all the characters so was very exciting for the kids!!  Although on site it was still a long walk to the entrance of the parks so I'm not sure if it's closer compared to any good neighbor hotels!! Great view for the nightly fireworks & pool is heated so can swim until 10pm! More explanation on the magic morning is required though as we were given incorrect information about which park was open the 1st morning.  Although this isn't the hotels problem only certain parts of the park are open for the earlier entrance, which was disappointing. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

We stayed here 4 nights. Twice (so far) the woman has come in and cleaned when we had our sign out that said not to.  The disney channel on TV doesn't work.  People in the shop downstairs are so rude.  We got in trouble for moving chairs by the pool, even though there was nobody using them. There were a total of 18 people by the pool, but God forbid we move 4 chairs!!  Not worth it. Never again.

Summary Heading: there was no diamond celebration in our room
Summary: We visit Dianeyland on average 4 times a year, Vacation club owners, Passholders etc. We stayed at the Pier 6/5-6/9 and not once was our room cleaned the way it should. Additionally we faced the parking lot for Down Town Disney and the lights shinned directly in the room and the noise was so loud. In fact when we first checked in we asked for a room change due to the drainage problem in our room in the tub. They sent an "engineer" who basically came in with no tools flushed the toilet and did nothing. The same dust balls and debris from the previous guest were in our room the entire stay. There was a leftover knife that was in our room from a Room Service from the previous guest that was never removed for the entire stay. Additionally our room had stained curtains, peeling paint

Summary Heading: Stay at Paradise Pier to get your stuff stolen!
Summary: We have been Disney Vacationers For over 30 years.  We celebrated our 25th at WDW and this last week, our 35th at Disneyland.  We stayed at the Paradise Pier for 3 nights.  Early in the morning of the 3rd night, someone used a key card to enter our room while we were sleeping.  They stole our electronics, luggage, camera, wallet and keys.   In the few hours before discovery, our cards and bank accounts were maxed out.  Try having fun at Disney with absolutely no money. The security guard, Mike, was wonderful and stayed with us through the police report.  However, the rest of the staff wanted nothing to do with us.  Guest services were clear that they could do nothing for us, and only grudgingly gave us a day pass to the park to replace the stolen one, and the claim number after

Fabulous. I was afraid it may be a little cheap from other pictures and reviews but no.. it is fabulous!!! The customer service is great. The room is immaculate and it's only a hip and a hop from the park.    The concierge level is worth it!!! They are so sweet and they let you take stuff to your room, in case you want to eat in your room. You also get water/soda to take to the parks.   The room was super clean, roomy, had a nice patio, and the decor was so adorable!!! It was a great idea to stay there. We were so close to the park and because of that, we did not have to pay any extra parking fees because we walked. For people visiting California - its important. There are parking fees everywhere!  The hotel smelled awesome.. Iol.. I know that sounds weird but it did. The one

Summary Heading: Lovely Disney atmosphere,  unfortunately we'll never stay there again.
Summary: Nice hotel, with good atmosphere,  staff was nice, location okay, with a standard trek to both Disney parks. We stayed for 3 days, with a 4 day Park Hopper ticket. Didn't sleep a wink for 3 days, quite possibly the worst bed we have ever slept on. The other family traveling with us said exactly the same thing, horrific beds. It definitely depleted our enjoyment of our stay. Spend the extra money and stay at the Disneyland Hotel or find a good neighbor hotel with decent reviews.  We'll never stay here again,  which makes me sad!

We had a very pleasant stay here. The staff was so friendly at check-in and our luggage was delivered to our room. There is a short walk to the parks which can be made shorter by taking the monorail to Disneyland or going through the adjacent hotel to California Adventure. The beds were very comfortable after a long day in the parks.  I used the guest laundry room which was clean and functional but a little expensive at $2.50 a machine.  I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Stay during Disneyland 60th Anniversary kick off and 24 hour park hours
Summary: When I first checked for hotel accommodations I did not realize that the weekend of May 22nd was the kick off of Disneyland's 60th Anniversary celebration kick off and that the parks would be open 24 hours 5/22-23. This was the only weekend that we would be able to visit however, as I had a business conference in San Diego that preceding week, so decided to plan accordingly and go anyway. Initially, due to costs I compared both the Disney resort hotels with the off site. I did book the Carrousel Hotel as it is actually less walking distance, but due to the online booking site error had only one night reserved and when I realized it the other nights for the room type needed were sold out. Comparing costs, I also found that while the offsite appeared less expensive the add on's

Summary Heading: It was ok but if you can afford it stay in the park
Summary: This hotel is nice and clean... But it certainly isn't close to Disneyland.  It's a long walk, especially with small children.  If I had it to over again I would definitely spend the extra money to stay truly in the park. The pool is good for kids, but once you get back to the hotel you will be too tired to trek back to the parks so it's a good thing the pool is nice. The life guards at the pool are VERY professional and actually watch the kids, which is a welcome rarity.

We stayed in the 2 room suite and was satisfied with our room. Short walk to the parks. We only stayed one night, probably should've stayed an extra night experience everything the area has to offer. The staff was courteous and was helpful throughout our stay. Overall the hotel was clean and would recommend to others.

My wife and I went on our Anniversary trip to this Hotel and had a wonderful time. The room was large and could accommodate our entire family if we had decided to take them.  The bed was very comfortable and the view of California Adventures was great.

Our experience of Disney's Paradise hotel was very enjoyable and walking distance to Disneyland. The Disney character breakfast is a must, but not cheap. Has swimming pool as well and was enjoyed by children after an exhausting day exploring Disneyland. Staff are very helpful.

We reserved a room to accommodate 4 adults plus our grandson with a view of the "World of Color" from our room. We were thrilled to be up-graded to a larger room upon check-in and spent the most magical weekend with our family! After many trips and overnight stays to Disneyland over the last 30 years, this remains our hotel of choice! it's a bit of a walk to the Monorail and Downtown Disney (about a 5 - 10 minute stroll), but the grounds are beautiful and it's nice to have a quiet place to go for a nap in the middle of the day :)  For a bonus, consider getting a club level pass for the 2nd story concierge club - they have cold breakfast foods and coffee, snacks throughout the day and then a "happy hour" time for Moms and Dads to relax with a snack for the young ones before going

This hotel is located perfectly to the park. It is right next to the Grand Californian, but less costly. Good for families. The room was clean and spacious. The pool had great slides for the kids and the service was excellent.

I was an ok hotel. Rooms were not as theme decorated as advertised. The staff were friendly though and it was close to the park within about 8 mins walking time. They have you pay onto of the hotel stay $17 a day for parking with no breakfast. At least other hotels around the area offer one or there other, either breakfast and pay for parking or free parking but no breakfast. They do offer a character breakfast for $35 a person but each time we passed it there were no characters out. For a snack through there vending machines were ridiculously over priced. Gift shop was the same  as in the parks and at the same price so no complaint there. Through booking we were told we would get a king sized bed and instead we got 2 queens. DO NOT GET ROOM SERVICE!!!!!! Expensive and they

I stayed here May 2015 for a conference. The property, rooms, meeting spaces were well kept, clean and comfortable. You really cannot beat the easy access(5 min walk) to downtown Disney and the parks. It was family friendly and very busy on this memorial holiday week. Next time I would ask for a room facing the parks so I could enjoy the nightly firework shows.

Summary Heading: Expected a little more given the high cost
Summary: I have stayed at numerous Disney resorts on Disneyland and Disney World property, and this is my first stay at Paradise Pier, which will probably be my last.  This was probably my worst visit for a Disney resort, which I'm glad I got to experience just to say I have been there.  With that said, here's what to expect:   -The room is decent and appropriately sized.  A little dusty but not enough to give this a bad review.  -The noise level is terrible:  We heard people to the left, right, upper floor, and outside our door.  Again, I expected a little more, considering it is Disney and the price.  -The shower water/water power was fair.  However the temperature was awful.  It would go from scolding hot to freezing cold. I put in a request to fix the temperature, but it just stayed

Summary Heading: Would Rate Higher if it had been Cleaner
Summary: We have stayed at many hotels around the Disneyland Resort. Some have been good others not. This time we decided to try Paradise Pier. Having stayed at other Disney properties, I expected a certain level of cleanliness and this room did not meet that expectation. The sheets on our beds were stained. Even after a linen change, they were still stained. The price you pay for a Disney property should warrant clean sheets. The room was also musty and generally dusty. Other than that, the room was fine. It is very convenient for enterance to the parks.

We stayed here in April 2015 and had a total of 2 rooms. I can honestly say that I was shocked this was a Disney hotel - from the moment we checked in until the moment we left, the hotel just left a whole lot to be desired.  We paid to have a room with a view of world of color. One room was fine, the other room had something over the glass that you couldn't see clearly and trying to take pictures made them come out all blurry. What a disappointment - you pay extra for a room with a view only to find that the window was repaired or something and didn't live up to its expectations. The room that had the clean/clear glass was not the cleanest. It was almost 10pm and we called housekeeping to have them come change the sheets.   It just amazes me that this resort is owned and run by

Summary Heading: Perfect for the price and convienence and great slide for toddlers
Summary: Obviously it's not going to be as nice as the grand Californian but you're paying half as much. It has a cheesy Disney feel but if that's what you're looking for it will suit you. Was there two nights right before the 60th anniversary. Lots of excitement. The hotel is in a great location and walking distance to the parks and downtown Disney.   The rooms felt very clean and spacious. They have a pull out bed if needed as well. A perk of Disney hotels is we got all the Disney channels and ESPN channels.   The pool is tiny but gets great sun and was easy to keep tract of kids. They have a slide on the second pool that they do not have a height requirement (great for my little one who can swim!!) and they can wear life vests if needed. It's goes into zero depth too so great for all

This room was immaculate. The desk was so helpful and friendly. Having our luggage wait until our first day at Disney was awesome.     Housekeeping was helpful and made sure we never needed anything. Treated our son like a VIP.    The only issue was getting out bags to the car. We were scheduled to have someone help and it took over an hour. The reason was a tour bus just came in. We needed to leave yet we had to wait even though our request was earlier and that should have taken precedence I believe.

We brought our girls to Disney for the second time (the first time they were too young to care where we stayed) and the Paradise Pier was fabulous!  The girls were 13 and 14 and they had a great time touring the parks.  The rooms were clean, the park entrance was closeby, and we could see California Adventure from our room.  The pool was awesome (the girls loved the water slide) and everyone should stay at a Disney hotel once.  It rocked!

For just slightly more cost than the mid-cost off property hotels you can stay on property here. This saves quite a bit of time on the local bus and if your kid is old enough to let run loose you can keep them on property.  The quality of the staff is what Disney is known for.  Very good "Cast Members".  Staying here the Disney experience starts at breakfast and goes the entire day.  The buffet has characters and is a bit costly compared to Dennys or similar off property.  But then that is the experience that you came for.  The building is apparently fairly old but looks freshly remodeled and modern.  Good thermostat control int he room and not too much noise from the neighboring rooms.  If you are off property you will probably spend at least two hours waiting for the bus,

Good hotel, not as near as you can expect for price, of the parks. doesn't include breakfast. elevators overcrowded, not enough for so many people. Only benefit is 1 hour priority entrance to the parks.

Accommodations were great... food great... weather not to hot... Disney Parks not too crowded... lines for rides not bad... had a wonderful time.  Disney did a wonderful job!! Staff everywhere were very cordial!

Summary Heading: it's Disney-what else is there to say
Summary: staying for 5 days with family. This hotel. Isn't new & a little outdated but clean & friendly. Just across the street from Disneyland there is no need for a car. Food is very good & although resort priced,  it's not outlandish.

Summary Heading: We felt like we were princesses
Summary: I took my granddaughter to Disneyland for her 20th Birthday and we stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier...when we walked in (stayed on the 13th floor) we began to jump up and down like little kids as the room was decorated so funky and fun and the view of Disney California was unbelievable!  Truly a lovely place to stay and all the staff treated us like Gold.  Thank you

Summary Heading: Looking for the Disney experience on a budget?!!!!
Summary: Do this. We set a budget and we were below it. This place is so great for the money. Some people didnt like the view, who cares? I want to be at the park. You are right across the street from Grand Californian and you can use the special entrance, do it. It was so easy to leave with the 2 year old go back to the room take a nap and go back out. I will stay there again for sure. Yeah, the pool isn't as cool as the others but again we are there for the park not for hotel stay.  The only thing that I wish is that it had a kitchenette it would have been perfect. Oh and the couch folds out into a twin, so my son had the other queen and my toddler had the pullout both slept in all week :) My son wished his bed at home was as comfy.  If on a budget but want the Disney touch, do

This was my first time to Disneyland.  It was a solo trip for me as I was participating in the Tinkerbell Half Marathon Weekend.  When planning a trip, it's always hard for me to weigh the cost options of hotels. There are certainly hotels less expensive within a mile of the Disneyland area but for me, personally, being right in the middle of it all is worth the extra money because of the EASE of getting to everything I want to do.    I chose the Paradise Pier Hotel because it is the least expensive of the 3 Disney resorts in Disneyland.  I was SO PLEASED with my choice.  Exceptional furnishings throughout the hotel, as one would expect from Disney. There is a parking garage connected to the hotel.  I walked to Downtown Disney and both parks.  I never got my car out.  No

Summary Heading: Probably not worth the money with the Elevator Situation
Summary: We took our family to Disneyland for our son's third birthday Tuesday-Thursday in late February. The hotel had some lower rates than we had seen and we had yet to stay at a Disney property so we thought we would try it despite the reviews I had read about the issues with the lack of elevators. I have never seen such long line for elevators in many years of traveling full time for work. If it were just my husband and myself we would avoid the elevators and hike up and down 9 flights of stairs, but that's not possible with a stroller and three small children. Trying to plan the day around peak elevator times to minimize waits was not fun; the morning we left it took us almost an hour to get all of us in an elevator to get down to the lobby level. If you leave several hours before

It was a good hotel, a solid 3.5 star. Very clean, friendly, super easy walk to the parks.   However, the super flush toilets EVERYWHERE could be heard ALL the time. Like, not just your next door neighbours, but their neighbours, and upstairs and downstairs.  At about 10 PM it was a loud flush every 30 seconds!  It was a bit annoying and kept me from falling asleep the first night, but I guess I got used to it.    View room facing CA on 10th floor which means you can hear all the random stuff they were practicing at the park late at night, but, well, earplugs are always good to travel with.  I'd definitely stay there again.  I mean, R2D2 was downstairs one evening.  Doesn't get much better.  ;)  We got the View Room for Standard rate on Expedia.

Summary Heading: Go for the view, not the pool
Summary: We stayed at PP for my husband's birthday. We were sprinkled with pixie dust at check in and got upgraded to a theme park view room. It was really fantastic. My son was worn out after we went out for dinner and asked if we could watch the fireworks from our room. Sometimes it's nice to be out of the crowd.  We enjoyed the decor and loved the staff.  Only disappointment was the pool. Really?! It's a Motel 6 pool on the roof with a slide that's really far removed from the pool. Doesn't make sense and wasn't any fun.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Hotel and great stay at Disney!!
Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights with hubby and 2 year old son and we all loved it!!!!  Close to both parks and Downtown Disney, for us well worth the extra cost to stay on site as we would head back to the room for our son to have a nap midday.  The hotel and Disney in general is spotless and seems really well managed. Only have 2 moans, 1 was the check in as unable to get into room until 3pm. We made use of pool area which has a lifeguard and a slide until room was ready, but then had to que up all over again just to get our room number. Which isn't fun with a rather grumpy toddler who needed a nap. And 2, whilst all the other staff were amazing, didn't appreciate the bell boy sarcastically shouting 'thanks for the $2 tip' on our check out!! That was all we had in change and he

The furthest of the Disney resort hotels but still a easy walk to the parks. My kids really liked staying here. As well as my husband. I loved the decor and they maintain the true Disney spirit. Good part is that you can see Ca. Adventure from some of the rooms.

Summary Heading: The Adopted Step-Child Holds Its Own
Summary: Anyone who follows Disney history knows the Paradise Pier Hotel was not built by Disney, but by a Japanese hotel company before California Adventure was built. How savvy an investor would you have to be to build a high rise hotel replete with glass elevator and top-story amenities, overlooking what was, at that point, a surface parking lot? Once the dust settled, and Disney decided on a second gate at Anaheim, they gobbled up the mid-range hotel and sprinkled some pixie dust on its many Japanese speculator-induced inadequacies. Voila: the create a third (in time, stature and amenities) Disneyland Resort Hotel. Having stayed at the Grand Californian and Disneyland hotels in the past six months for extended stays, I can tell you our expectations were tempered by the mixed reviews

Summary Heading: Older, over-priced Hotel in need of some repair
Summary: Stayed 2 nights to surprise for our kids while visiting Disneyland. The proximity to the parks and Downtown Disney was a major perk and we booked planning to maximize the extra Magic Hour for hotel guests. Unfortunately, we were not able to use this time. We spent the first day trying to get a vacation voucher exchanged for tickets. We were directed from guest services, to front desk and eventually to the park gates. We started this process 45 mins before magic morning began but spent the next 60 mins in line or speaking to a cast member. By the time we entered the park, there was 15 minutes left for hotel guests. There was NO hot water the first night and when checking out, we discovered that the elevators where not working properly. We spent our second "magic morning" carrying

I stayed here with my daughter (who ran the Tinkerbell Half Marathon) and my grandson, age 11.  The location was perfect, the property immaculate, the staff wonderful and the room service breakfast was the BEST I've ever had in a hotel.  My grandson loved the pool, especially the slide, and the video and arcade game area.  If you're planning a trip to Disneyland with family this hotel would be a great choice.

I have now stayed at all three Disneyland Resort hotel properties, and I have to say that Paradise Pier is the absolute best! It is the most reasonably priced of all the Disney hotels, is only about a 5 minute walk from the park (vs. the Disneyland Hotel, which is a much longer trip), and has great staff and amenities.  When we checked in, we asked for a room with a King bed instead of two Queen beds. The person helping us was not only able to accommodate our request, she upgraded us to a Signature Suite for our entire stay - for free! It was a wonderful surprise, and made our stay much more magical.   When we return to Disneyland in the future, we will definitely stay at the Paradise Pier again.

Summary Heading: Average Hotel, Nice Location and Early Entry Perk
Summary: My husband and our 2 littles (5 and 2) stayed overnight. We live less than an hour away, but we wanted to visit both parks and figured it would be nice to have a place for naps and breaks. Plus, when you stay in a hotel it makes it seem as if you're on vacation!   The hotel was a nice average hotel. Clean, nice staff, average amenities. Like I read on here, the water pressure was slow in the sinks, but was fine for the shower. Beds were super comfy and the kids loved the beach ball pillows. We ordered room service upon returning to the room at about 10pm. We're vegan and they accomodated us as best they could. Food was nothing fancy, but decent hotel room food. We also stopped at surfside lounge for a salad for lunch and some snacks for breakfast. Again, decent for a vegan, but

The service was impeccable as is all Disney service, but it did not make up for the cost.  For the money you are better to stay at a good neighbor hotel just across the street. The walk was about the same and if you're traveling with young children the extra hour in the morning may not be worth it.

This is a very nice hotel and perfect if you are running with rundisney because it starts right in front of the hotel and ends in back. The room was clean and comfortable but I thought the maid was a little lazy. We were there 4 days and the she just left our coffee pot and cup from the first mornings room service on the bathroom counter for three more days. they have great services so take advantage of them. Everything I bought in the park I had sent to the hotel, love that. I rented a scooter from guest services. On checkout I had the bell desk pick up all my luggage and retrieve my items sent from the park. I called to valet and my car was waiting when I checked out. Easy peasy. I will definitely stay here again.love Disney service.

Good hotel. Check in was very slow but staff was nice. Room was big, pretty clean but little disappointed the room didn't have much of a Disney feel to it.  The only issue I had was the bathroom.  Got up early to take a shower before the rest of the family. Jumped in the shower and guess what no shower curtain. Ran out of hot water within 5 minutes. I was looking forward to a nice hot shower after a day of traveling. That didn't happen. When we were headed to the parks for the day I stopped by the front desk and told them about it, this was about 8 am they apologized and said someone would get us a shower curtain and said that one of the boilers went out in the middle of the night. We came back later in the afternoon and room keeping was just stared to clean our room.  She

We stayed at the Paradise Pier for 4 days.  When we arrived at the hotel, we spent about 30 minutes in line waiting to check in.  No real place for the kids to sit and wait in the lobby.  When we finally got to the room, we were disappointed.  The room was dirty with carpet stains and spilled soda on the cabinet.  The furniture was worn and outdated.  The elevators were very small and slow.  Each day we waited a while to catch one heading down to the lobby.  There was one time we waited almost 25 minutes.  Unacceptable for a family hotel.  When we did get in the elevator, we could barely fit the 5 of us and a stroller.  This Disneyland Resort hotel was cheaper than the others which is why we chose it.  We just needed a place to rest our heads for the night.  Next time, we will

This is a great hotel option when at the Disneyland resort.  The hotel is clean fun and safe.  Our room was plenty big for the two of us, and from what I saw could accommodate a family of five just fine.  All of the staff was warm and welcoming as well as attentive to any of our needs and questions.  We felt comfortable right away.    At this hotel you get early entry to the parks which alternate with one day at Disneyland and one at Disney California Adventure, this is a great option for hotel guests.  The whole early entry (Magical Mornings) is really quick and painless, in fact I was surprised at how quick we were actually in DCA.    There are two restaurants, one a little more casual and one had a breakfast buffet and dinner option, in fact we ended up at this restaurant

What I liked most about this hotel is that it was walking distance from Disney. I feel like the rooms could have been nicer. Customer service was ok when I would call front reception the receptionist there was rude. I felt like I was bothering her. Besides that I'm not sure if I would stay there again. It wasn't all that great but it was more affordable than the other two Disney hotels.

Love this place! You can't beat the views of Paradise Pier and the World of Color show. The character breakfast here is by far, the best of the Disneyland hotels, offering the most characters (especially Mickey). The staff is always friendly and helpful. A special shout out to the manager Randy, who was very helpful in responding to a problem we had with the sound on our TV while watching the World of Color. She went out of her way to make it up to us and also helped extend our reservation, even though the hotel was very busy. The rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious. The kids love the pool, spa, and water slides and it feels like a Private Beach Club for the grown-ups (pool-side service, comfortable lounge chairs, and plenty of shade).  You won't be disappointed, can't

We love Disney!  We had a great stay at the Paradise Pier.  Our room was super clean.  Huge shout out to mousekeeping!  The bed was very comfortable after a long day at the parks.  We had a view of Disney's California Adventure and even could see the fireworks over Disneyland. We loved that the hotel staff in the morning would say "Have a magical day at the parks".

Room was very clean. Staff was very nice. Location is good. Water slide was not working during our stay however at check-in we were told we could go over to the Disneyland Resort and use those pools. We were surprised as a hotel guest you still paid for hotel parking.......$17 a day.

We stayed at Paradise Pier from 4/28 to 5/2.  The rooms were clean and well-maintained and the staff was friendly and professional.  It seems a little pricey for what you get but the location and Magic Morning access to the parks make it worth it for our family.  We would definitely stay here again.

We arrived early at the Hotel 9.30am after 20hrs traveling with 2 children,checkin was 3pm so we ambled around & returned to the Hotel at noon,asked about our room not ready,kept asking & by 3pm our patience was running out.At last  at 3.30pm we got our room.I have arrived at Hotels many times & they have done their very best to get the room ready,so we were not impressed.We has a suite which was very nice & it overlooked California Adventure so we were able to see the water show & the fireworks at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Spend more for REAL Disney hotel or just stay off resort
Summary: Paid for a cabana room 5 months in advance and upon arrival they wanted to put us on the 14 th floor with a fabulous view of the parking lot....after an hour of haggling and a few tears from my wife on her birthday we got our cabana room.That being said.....the pool is tiny cold and the waterslide was closed. As far as the concierge club level..its a sad showing of Disney the food is flat out nasty unless you enjoy those crustable sandwich things and a endless supply of powdered milk and cereals and a handful of other sub par pastries. We went over to the DL Hotel to swim and realized quickly that we had made a mistake in booking a room at PP Hotel.NEVER AGAIN.Pay more for DL or GC or save your money and stay off resort PP Hotel is such a waste.

The location of the hotel is great since its on the Disney property and within walking distance of the theme parks and Downtown Disney. I am glad we chose this hotel. The staff was great upon arrival and during our stay. Our actual room was only okay. We had a nice view of California Adventure but the room was small. The bathroom sink and shower had very low water pressure. Also, we had to call guest services to come check one of the beds that made too much noise. Housekeeping came up to check on the bed and it turned out that the box spring was no longer usable. The gentleman from house keeping quickly switched the old box spring with a new one. The fitness center is pretty good for a hotel. It was equipped with dumbbells, a few treadmills, a few elliptical machines and a cable

I was pretty excited to stay at the Paradise Pier hotel and for the most part it was fine.  Not really bad in any way, just didn't knock my socks off.  The room we received (and booked) was a standard view room for 5 people, which consisted of 2 queens and a "daybed" that was just big enough for my son who is 5'10".  The daybed was maybe a bit narrower than a regular twin, so it would be a bit of a tight fit for larger people. Our 6th floor room looked out on parts of the California Adventure park, which was nice at night. Check in at 10:30pm was fairly quick and easy, friendly Cast Member at the desk. The bathroom was average but clean, think any general mid range motel bathroom and that's what it looked like.  Travel size bottles of shampoo, soap and lotion in the bathroom.

Summary Heading: Great middle of the road hotel on Disneyland property
Summary: We stay here primarily to take advantage of the magic hour at the theme park the next morning.  Of this hotel, Grand Californian and DIsneyland Hotel, this is the most economical and honestly since the kids don't want to stay inside a hotel room all day, we really didn't need anything that fancy.  They allow you to park in their garage and take advantage of the parking garage the entire day you check out so you don't have to worry about moving your car.  The rooms aren't anything to gloat over, but they come with the standard necessities.    Surprisingly, the room service for breakfast isn't too overpriced.  Downstairs there is a little cartoon viewing room for the little ones, a game room/arcade for some older kids and two eating areas.  Primarily though, you can't beat the

This is the least expensive hotel of the three hotels considered "in Disneyland". It is a lovely hotel (like a very nice IBIS) with a seaside theme. It is a 5 minute walk to Downtown Disney, but the whole area is Disney Town. We had a family room with 2 large beds and a view of the park. The pool is small but heated and open until 8pm. The staff are great, we checked in after a long flight with 2 small very tired kids and the receptionist was kind and considerate. The restaurant is great and I can thoroughly recommend the character breakfast where we collected all the autographs we had missed during the day.

I read a lot of the negative reviews for this hotel before our visit, and honestly was very concerned.   My husband and I arrived around 10AM to check in.  My husband is 6'7" and they were able to do some adjustments so that we got a king bed room.  **There are only 9 rooms with king beds in the entire property, so beware**  Since we were early, the front desk said we would recieve a text when our room was prepared.  We enjoyed the rest of the day in the parks and only came back late that evening.  Our room was just fine, although housekeeping had been a little negligent.  One waste paper basket still contained a very disgusting piece of trash and there wasn't a rubber bath mat.  The housekeeping staff removed the offensive trash immediately and I appreciated their promptness.

Summary Heading: Very worth the price to upgrade!
Summary: We upgraded and stayed in the Premium View club level room.  Very well worth the extra $, as you received so much with your reservation (cont. breakfast, snacks, happy hour) and just the extra added touches that they did for us.  It was such a relaxing and enjoyable time for my family and I.  The staffing couldn't have been better.  We didn't meet one that couldn't answer even our strangest requests or questions.  It was truly a place to relax, refresh and renew.  Our meals in the PCH grill were excellent and our service was above the top!  Thank you for the fabulous vacation!

As it had been a while since going to Disneyland, I decided to treat my sister and myself with staying at one of the hotels. When I happened to look, Paradise Pier ended having prices that I hadn't seen from a Disney property and ended up booking. What a surprise! When I first booked all the description said was that it was a room and did I want two queens or a king. I had to call and put my sis on the reservation so she could check in. Whoever it was a talked to was great and asked me a little about my upcoming stay. Imagine my surprise when the room turned out to be a suite! Nothing in my online reservation prepared us for that. The staff was wonderful. The suite was very clean. It might not be screaming Disney, but it was just the right amount for us. Also the magic hour you

Summary Heading: Less money still a bit of the magic.
Summary: Disney's least character and magic driven hotel.  And sometimes that is not a bad thing.  The rooms are well appointed with a nostalgic beachside resort appeal.  We had a king room with view of California Adventure.  This gave us a unique view of the World of Color show(wish they piped in the music and narration! ).  We ate once at the hotel restaurant,  nothing special and with the Grand Californian and  Downtown Disney a 5 minute walk away we had plenty of choices.  Parking is in a multi level garage behind the hotel and is very convenient.  As with all the Disney properties the service is excellent.   It, along with the Disneyland Hotel are the farthest from the park entrances but the walk warms you up for a full day and its nice to know at end of your day you're not

Could not speak highly enough of this hotel. The staff were excellent and very helpful. Our room is lovely with comfortable beds and spare bedding.  We ordered a pizza and desert from the surfs up restaurant downstairs and it as great.  It is also just a short stroll from the parks Main Street. Hope we come back again one day.

Summary Heading: Nice. But not over the top.
Summary: I stayed here with my daughters for just one night. I believe I received a decent rate...which means less than $400 but more then $350 for one night (it's the Disney way)! Room was clean. Small. Just sort of "used" feeling. Some of the outlets wouldn't work to charge our phone. Coffee maker had a broken top. Shower curtain was dingy. But beds are comfy & room was quiet which is great after a long day at the park. Plus you get to enter the park an hour early if you stay at a resort hotel! We had room service for breakfast. It was on time, hot, lots of food & tasted good! Yes it was pricey, but overall worth it. I will likely stay again if I can find a decent rate!

My family (2 adults, 3 kids under 6), stayed at the Paradise Pier during spring break.  The rooms are great for families.  They have a cool convertible sofa that was perfect for my 6 year old.  It’s not your typical, “springs are digging into my back,” uncomfortable, traditional sofa bed.  The back of the sofa basically folds over the sitting area.  We had a room facing the parks and if you’re a light sleeper, you’ll definitely hear the boom of the Disneyland fireworks and visuals from the CA Adventure World of Color show.  For some reason, the elevators in this hotel take FOREVER.  It’s not something I would typically notice in a hotel but it seemed unusually long here.  We were on the 8th floor and it took sometimes up to 5-10 minutes for one with enough room to arrive.  Maybe

for families or couples, this is an OK place to stay.  nothing fancy but clean and pleasant.  hotel staff gives good service, great breakfast buffet with character dining.  bed was comfortable, and had a nice view of the parks.

Three generations shared a room and it was satisfactory with the couch and little desk.  You pay a premium price for the easy walking location and ability to get into the park early.  Overall the hotel was great: service, pool, water slide, fridge in room.  The downsides were expensive food (especially room service), slow WiFi, and no hair dryer in room. But we will stay again because of the convenience and excellent staff.  And it's cheaper than the other two Disney hotels!

We did a somewhat unexpected trip to Disneyland for Spring Break and booked a package through Costco, so got a good deal on two nights and 5 two day park hopper passes.  The room was quite nice (and easily accommodated all 5 of us with a really cool fold out style couch I had never seen but was very comfortable for our very tall 10 yr. old), but for some reason I just expected maybe a little more from a Disney property.  The staff was great and we even got a free upgrade on the room.  The water slide was closed which was a bummer on Spring Break but the kids had a great time just the same.  My wife says I was too critical with expectations...she is probably correct and I would absolutely do it the exact same thing again and would be happy with it.

We booked 2 rooms for 3 nights at the Disney Paradise Pier hotel because we wanted the experience for the kids to be magical . Our experience here was much less than magical !  Booked 2 rooms months in advance and payed for the whole experience in full , including 3 day Disney Park passes for 6 of us . When we got there , check in was easy , but they did not have our passes on hand even though we payed in full . This was not an issue , due to us not gong straight to the parks the next day , we were having a rest day . Next day we went and obtained our passes with ease . That was no problem . Had 3 good nights there and had no hiccups ........... UNTIL !  After we left the hotel and checked in at another one , we discovered that ...... When we handed over a credit card for the

Summary Heading: Somethings great, other things not so great...
Summary: Overall the hotel was good.  The location and proximity to the park is great but for the size of the hotel the elevators were tiny.  We often had to wait for the next one as more than 6 or 7 people in the elevator car would be extremely tight.   We were also disappointed with in room entertainment options.  After a day of hitting the park, when all you want to do is relax in the room and perhaps order a movie especially if your kid needs some down time isn't an option.  There is no way to order a movie on the TV in the room.  We were told that there are DVDs and DVD players for rent, but unfortunately we had the wrong color key.  I have no idea what that means, nor was it explained to me.    Food options, especially for kids were sadly lacking.  You would think that a hotel that

This hotel is great! The price is great for the superb service you receive and the location. You are paying more than a neighboring hotel, but you are paying for convenience and it's worth it. Yes, there is a short walk to the parks...but you go to Disneyland knowing you will be walking all day. So it's not a big deal. For California Adventure Park you can cut through another Disney hotel and be there in 8 minutes. For Disneyland, it's a short walk to Downtown Disney and then you are at the Park. With small kids location is key. It's not so far that you can't go back to your room and take a small break. The service is outstanding and the rooms are very clean and nice. The pool is great and every employee is super friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel for the

We stayed at this hotel and loved every minute of it. Upon check in Andrew upgraded us to a room with a park view! The room was very well kept, comfortable and clean. The park view was amazing and we could see the water show from it. Staff was lovely, polite and so friendly! I used the laundry room and thought it was very useful for families. Would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat!

One of the best place to stay if you are planning to visit Disneyland. Less than a mile away, you can walk across.  Stayed with family while visiting Disneyland, Spacious room, good beds. WIFI works well.  Rooms overlooking the park give you a great view in the night.

The rooms are decent, but the price isn't. Even as a registered guest, to have a car here, they charge $17 a day, $25 if not. Breakfast prices are absolutely absurd. Their continental breakfast is 2 pasteries, bowl of fruit & 2 drinks $11 each person, not bad right? Than add 19% convenience fee & $3 service fee, over $63. No markets or grocery in walking distance. Staff is very friendly & the property is kept up nicely.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to unwind after a day at Disneyland
Summary: The staff at the hotel were terrific.  Always willing to help and do whatever they could to make our stay an enjoyable one.  The room was plenty big enough for our family of 5.  Close enough to the parks so that we could take afternoon nap breaks, which were a lifesaver.  The pool was relaxing and viewing the fireworks from the pool deck on our first night was a nice treat.  No complaints about the price, as we expected things to be a little costly for a once in a lifetime experience.

We stayed at Paradise Pier last month with our small grandsons. We were on the 12th floor with an excellent view of California Adventure. The boys loved the pool and hot tub, and I was grateful for the life jackets that are provided free of charge poolside. The boys also enjoyed the small arcade and the cartoon room. We had room service for breakfast, good. The walk to both parks was quick. For a family looking

Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel was our home base for our 5 day vacation to Disneyland & Disney's California Adventure.  It was our first trip to the area, so we knew we wanted to be within walking distance of the parks and also stay at a Disney hotel.  This hotel is very easy to get to and parking was no problem!  It is a quick walk across the street to Downtown Disney and the entrance to both Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure.  We had a room with 2 queen beds, located on the 8th floor of the hotel.  Our room was the first one off the elevator lobby, so I expected to have a lot of noise as people used the elevator and happily, not a single noise was ever heard in our 5 day stay!  We were happy with the desk staff, as they gave us tips for how to get to the parks and the

The hotel is clean, and the staff are nice and helpful. However they charge almost $400 per night. So the value for your money is not there. The one thing you do get it early access to the park, and the entrance is close by.  Have a great time! Exploretraveler

Summary Heading: Awesome experience staying at this fun, relaxed, family friendly hotel perfectly close to Disneyland and California Adve
Summary: I loved the southern california PCH theme of this cute, fun, and family friendly hotel. The staff were all amazing, the restaurant was great. Location is fabulous. Definitely pricey but it was worth it for our short vacation with small kids!

We stayed at DPPH in November 2014. This hotel is smaller than the other Disney hotels in the area and not as grand I guess. However, I actually liked that about this hotel. We stepped foot in the other two and it was chaotic and crowded. The Pier offers a more tranquil setting. It's close enough to the parks without the craziness. We walked across the street, through the Grand Californian and right in to the exclusive entrance to California Adventure Park. That alone is worth staying here. The decor is beachy with mickey cameos all over. The room is a great size, with a pullout sofa, very clean and up to date. Housekeeping cleaned everyday and kept things spotless, which I appreciate. Tv has HDMI and hard drive outlet, so download your movies and bring them.  Downstairs has a

Summary Heading: Would be perfect but for one itsy bitsy thing... #hotelsnob
Summary: My family and I just got back from Disney today!! Fresh review!!  This is the second time we've stayed at the Pier, so I guess you could say we liked it. It is very clean, quiet, staff are friendly and helpful. Decent pool area with a water slide and lifeguards for the little ones. We didn't use the restaurant this time, but went to the character breakfast on our last visit, and that was cute. Got to meet Mickey, Daisy, and Stitch. We were unaware that gratuity was included with the bill and added a tip at the end, which they reversed, which is pretty cool. They have a fairly well stocked gift shop off the lobby for anything you might need (or not need)... They also have an arcade for bigger kids and a movie room for the smaller.  The location is very convenient, you can walk

Have stayed at both the disneyland hotel and most recently the Paradise Pier, My family preferred the Paradise Pier.  We stayed on the 12th floor and had a great view of Disney's California Adventure Park.  As guests we used our room key to access the much better pool at the Disneyland Hotel.  Had a very nice dinner at the PCH grill.  If you stay at the Paradise Pier I highly recommend getting a view room

This hotel was OK. The housekeeping didn't do a great job as our bathroom wasn't cleaned well during our stay and there was still water in the coffee maker from the last guests. It was nice to be close go the park but there are other, cheaper hotels just as close. You're paying for the Disney name and in this case, it wasn't worth it.

What a fantastic park view! Every night we would come in from a full day of fun and our room was cleaned and the bed was turned down with a spectacular view of the theme park! We would stay here again.

We stayed here last week for three nights and four days. Our stay was very nice. We had the Concierge Meal package and our floor was facing Disney Adventure. We arrived very early and we were able to use the Concierge Dining area and pool while waiting for our room. Our room was ready by 12pm early! The room was clean, beds were very comfortable, and the sofa/sleeper was comfortable for our teen son. The room space was "OK" it was enough to come back and sleep. Three days is all we could handle (3 children 14, 14, & 11 and 2 adults), typically we get two rooms but due to price we choose one room this time. We received turn down service every night and a one time platter of Mickey Mouse rice krispy treats for each family member.  Laundry Facility was clean. Pool was small and I

Summary Heading: Close enough and still Disney, but not perfect
Summary: This is a hotel that was another hotel when I was a kid and they really did a great job refurbishing an old hotel. The rooms are the same size as the other Disney hotels with 2 queens and a day bed. Good for five people. The pool was fun. The water slide is great. The downside is the pool is above the parking and you can smell exhaust. We went over to the DL Hotel to swim since you can. It is a block or two away. The little coffee shop downstairs was a place to get a roll and coffee, but they are understaffed and take forever. The character breakfast on site was fun, but pricey. It is the most reasonably priced DL hotel and you can get concierge floor to get snacks and continental breakfast and waters. If you don't have picky eaters, it's a good deal. To get to the parks, you

Summary Heading: Grossly Over-Priced and NO ACTUAL VIEW of Disneyland
Summary: The Paradise Pier hotel is NOT located inside Disneyland.  It is situated across the street and, apparently, there are a very limited number of rooms that have any real visibility into the  Disneyland park.  At $350 per night, we were given a room with a "Disney view," which is just a busy street running in front of the hotel.  Otherwise, there are palm trees that obscure the view of a parking lot for delivery trucks on the Disney property.   Disappointing?  Very!  Deceptive?  Definitely!   Our room had very good acoustics - we could hear the road noise really well from the busy street below our room.  However, the road noise was drowned out, the benefit of paper-thin walls, by screaming children throwing tantrums across the hallway. All for the low, low price of just $350 per

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier Hotel Premium View Club Level  (Family of 5)
Summary: The second we stepped off the Disneyland express we felt the magic. Our check in was the most wonderful experience I had ever had. It was so quick and easy. The gentlemen checking us in was wonderful. His name is "Mickey". I hope everybody staying here has the chance to get him at the counter. Great cast member, very helpful and extremely friendly. Every morning on our way to the park we always looked to see if he was behind the counter just to say hi. Our room was ready upon check in. We went up to our room and the view was better than expected, size of room fit my wife and I, and our kids ages 15, 13, 11 very comfortably. Bed's are very comfortable. Pool area was well kept, pool chairs are awesome. Had a few naps on them. Easy access to both parks either through GCH or DD.

Summary Heading: Magic Hour is not what I thought it would be...
Summary: This was our first trip to Disneyland.  This might be a long review.  Please feel free to message me with any questions.    We picked the Paradise Pier because it was a downtime and we got a good price on a lounge access room.  We wanted to stay onsite to take advantage of the magic hour at the parks.  Let me first say that the lounge access was not worth it for us.  We ate breakfast there and that was about it.  We used the concierge service once.  You have to ask for bottled water and drinks. They have them hidden in the back or in the cupboard underneath where they serve the food. The other food options (snack type food/desserts) were put out at times that we were always at the park and the lounge closed before we returned back from the park each night.  We also found that

Summary Heading: Always better to stay on Disney property
Summary: My family stayed here for 4 nights booked through Disney Travel and we had a great experience.  It started out with some mistakes but with some persistence they did make it better.  We are a family of 5 and I thought the room was a nice size.  I love how the sofa flips into a single bed, not taking any extra room.  I like the Disney details in the sheets & furniture.  I enjoyed the walk with the beautiful California weather, much better than waiting & packing into a shuttle.  To get to Disneyland, we go to Downtown Disney & take the monorail.  Really not a bad walk at all.  We did experience the elevator issue when we tried to take advantage of the early morning hour, I suggest leaving a little earlier or later to avoid the crowd.  That was really the only time we had the

I asked for a room for 1 night for a very special nite, and they gave me a room that looked out at a wall,  and the other window looked at nothing!    The valet service was horrible, we pulled in and they were hanging out in a group just chatting with themselves, we unloaded r  own stuff and parked the car ourselves!  Then as we were waiting at check in, i told the check in person who was so rude and didnt know what she was doing, and got someone to take our luggage to our room for us.  Didnt eat here so dont know about the food.

Was here for business and the hotel is a much older one.. .the bar is more like a coffee shop and the food not good… the service was great…. just much older hotel and not great food or atmosphere for hanging out with co workers for drinks… it is located next to Disney so can walk across the street thru that hotel and come into a area at Disney with lots of restaurants and fun to walk around.. The rooms were very clean and quiet.. Not a great hotel, but it does provide nice staff service…

Summary Heading: Ok, not worth the disney prices
Summary: I stayed here with my partner.  The price of this hotel was nearly 3 times the price of the local Hilton, but we stayed there nonetheless because the conference hotels had all been booked up.  The staff here are wonderful.  Really nice, polite people.  The receptionists know everything Disney related and you can buy tickets and sort out activities at reception.  There are two dining facilities at the hotel, the PCH grill and a regular bar / morning area as well as vending machines for snacks and a Disney shop.  The rooms are a nice size and the come with a beachball for each bed.  As well as coffee making facilities and a fridge.  The room itself provides the tiniest amount of shower gel.  So if you don't like using soap, do take your own (I asked housekeeping for extra, but

Summary Heading: Only One Night, Wish It Could Have Been Longer
Summary: We drove from Ohio to Disneyland for our 10th anniversary. We planned on staying in the Disneyland area for 12 nights, but knew we couldn't afford to spend that kind of money on a hotel room to stay at Disneyland, so we stayed off grounds, but decided that for our first night we would splurge and stay at Paradise Pier.  I booked the room through a friend that is a Disney travel agent, and was able to get a discount. When we checked into the hotel, the cast member checking us in was very nice. She informed us that we had been upgraded to a suite. Originally I had booked a regular room in the Club Level. What a nice surprise.  We were hungry, so before going to our room we went right up to the Beachcomber club (the Club Level area) to grab something to eat.   After eating, I went

Definitely worth booking the "park view" rooms. The night time view of California Adventure is absolutely stunning. Concierge service is worth the investment if you are going to be around the hotel, but not if you plan on spending a lot of time at the parks. Only a short stroll to the park entrances and getting early entry is an added bonus. Character dining with Mickey Mouse and friends is fantastic, although quite expensive, but the kids loved it. The only issue is the Wi-Fi. It is atrocious. The only time I could get any signal was in the Laundry room. Whilst this is good while you watch the washing machine go round and around, it is annoying when you can't get a signal n your room. Otherwise a very clean and tidy hotel with extremely helpful and friendly staff.

We are frequent WDW travelers, have stayed in Value, Moderate and Luxury hotes there. We stayed at Disneyland Hotel in 2013 but for this we chose the Paradise Pier because it was just a quick get away for my 14 and I.  We paid over 300 dollars per night for a clean, modest room with two queen beds and very little Disney magic. We had an amazing view of California Adventure Park that was very distorted by the ancient, bubbling UV window tint film applied to our window.  This is an upgrade that is not worth the money in my opinion.  We arrived early, our bags were taken so we could start our day at the parks, our room was ready by the late afternoon, the cast members were extremely helpful and friendly.  I read about issues with cleanliness before, but we encountered excellent

Took my Mom for her 60th Birthday to Disneyland and we decided to stay at the Paradise Pier hotel. First off the decor is fabulous, as to be expected from Disney. The location is great and if you get a higher up floor you have some amazing views. We also decided on adding the concierge package which was nice but when you are on the constant go, not really worth it. I was hoping for more with the breakfast that was included, but obtaining many bottles of water was worth some value especially since a bottle in the park is pretty expensive. We never got the opportunity to go to the concierge room for the snacks or evening drinks, so it might be a good value if you are able to part take. For the room, it was very spacious with a comfortable/cute atmosphere, but it did have a couple

I will be coming back! I am hoping to come back to Grand Californian for the Diamond Anniversary. I have never been to Disneyland, and my family and I loved it. We spoil our grandkids, if they are happy, we are. but we all had a grand time. It's not at big at WDW but it has it own beauty. The resort was great, perfect location, we had a few days just to stay and play and it was just perfect. We had a hiccup and staff handled it right away and made up for it! Great stay. Need help booking, I have to give a round of applause for my Travel Agent. I won't use anyone but her. Always throwing me together a last min trip! You can check her out via Facebook. Jamie Porter Magic Travel. Tell her Bob from Jersey sent ya!

Read many reviews before hand, and honestly can't find much wrong with this place.  A few minor irritations, but nothing that would make me say never again!  All staff that we met, from bell hop, check in, to cleaning staff and maintenance, were all very friendly and eager to help if needed.  The rooms were not run down at all, beds were comfy, fridge was cold and a good size.    The hotel itself was a little walk to Downtown Disney, and the park itself, but nothing too major, and it's nicely landscaped and decently lit along the way.  We walked out and about till quite late, and never felt unsafe.  The Magic Morning was a nice plus, and pretty much all the rides were open immediately ( just no fast passes), while a few of the shops/ stores were not yet.  Yes, expect crowds that

Everything was in the right place, and service was great. We got a free upgrade on check-in, and it made our experience there even better.  The made everyone feel special and helped us have a great time. Not only in Disneyland but at the hotel as well. We only spent 1 night there, but it will be a vacation we'll never forget.

Summary Heading: It is Disneyland, but not much else
Summary: I cannot say we had a bad stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel, but I have stayed at better hotels. The whole place seemed a bit run down, particularly the common areas and the restaurant (the restaurant in particular looked like a copy of a 60s motel). The room we got was of a decent size for the four of us and we had the promised view of the park but the wifi was terrible and the service from the staff ranged from fantastic (check-in, valet and the bell hop) to poor (concierge). All this for a price which was fairly expensive. The biggest downer was that the restaurant shuts at 9PM (the park shuts at 8), so the only food one could get once we got back and showered was room service or some snacks at the bar. All-in-all, while the stay was decent, the next time, I will probably stay

Although the location is great, it is not as close to the park entrances as you would think. We stayed at a property off site, and it was closer!! We were greatly disappointed by the "Magic Morning" advantage that you get by staying at a Disney property. California Adventure has exactly 2 rides that are open for Magic Hour, the Disney Park however, was better but still only had 2 sections open. The line-ups to get into the park for this hour, are also huge which we were not informed of by the hotel staff-that would have been appreciated!! We were a family of 5, and the room we stayed in was incredibly small to say the least. The room itself was also pretty run down (although clean), and you would not expect that from the prices that you paid. We were not given any special

My family and had a wonderful time here at Disneyland's Paradise Pier Hotel. We had a nice room very clean and big enough for the four of us to stay comfortably. I really enjoyed having a coffee maker and refrigerator. We didn't spend much time in the room, it was used mainly as a place to keep our things, sleep, and shower. Its a short walk to DCA and the monorail which will take you directly into Disneyland's Tomorrow Land. I have no complaints about the walk because I knew it wasn't right next to the park before hand. I have stayed at some hotels that are directly across the street from Disneyland with shorter walking distances but like this walk better as I now have two small children and the walk to Disneyland takes you across no major roadways. The walk to DCA does take

My family and I just got back from a wonderful 4 nights and 5 days here.  The Hotel was classic Disney.  Everything was ridiculously expensive and almost perfect.  I say almost because of the Wifi.  Hotels that advertise Wifi in their Hotel should be held to that throughout the hotel.  None of this "you have to sit on the first floor in the corner with your back facing the vending machine while putting one hand over your head in an awkward yoga pose".  The wifi just didn't work in our room.  What is the point?  Sure it showed up on the phone and tablet but would it connect? Probably not.  If it connected would it stay connected for any period of time?  Probably not.  And then every time it disconnected you have to reaccept their ridiculous spying terms.  Which don't

Stayed one night primarily to get into the park one day early.
