Thought we could just walk into the park (Disneyland), but you had to walk to another hotel and through Downtown Disney to get there - not a difficult or long walk, but just be aware that you have to budget that time in.  The hotel feels a bit dated (popcorn ceilings and a short shower - we are tall people and a short shower is no Bueno).  It worked well enough for our one night stay.  Nothing special.

Stayed here for two nights while visiting disneyland for my wifes birthday. This hotel excels in customer service at every level. The valets are quick and helpful, front desk agents are very professional, room attendants do a great job and seem happy.   The restaurant staff are also fantastic, and the character dining is good on all fronts.  We were on the 14th floor with a park view, and this was 100% worth the extra cost. We could see all of DCA, as well as space mountain and the matterhorn if you press your face up against the window, which I did :).  Having the magic morning is an excellent perk.  I hope to stay here again next time we go to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Will recommend to families and friends!
Summary: Loved our stay in this hotel! Our room had the view of the DCA Park, it was large and clean. Very convenient and doesn't take long to walk to the parks. The reception and club staff were very friendly and made us feel welcomed. We will stay here again next time but hopefully they'll fix the free wifi service that they offered. It was slow and most of the time, can't access it.

Usually visiting Walt Disney World we found the choice of hotels at Disneyland limiting and expensive. Paradise Pier is the cheapest of the three Disney properties in Anaheim.  Overall it is a lovely hotel with excellent facilities in a great location. The decor is very Disney, the Cast Members well trained to Disney standards and views spectacular. Slightly disappointing was the quality of food at the PCH Grill for the rather expensive Character Breakfast. There was plenty to choose from but key items like eggs, bacon, pancakes etc were cold.  We were also dissapointed with the free Wi-Fi, struggling to get even a 1Mb/s download speed. Overall we really enjoyed our 7 night stay and if we go to Disneyland again we would certainly stay again.

Summary Heading: Great for families with young kids
Summary: This is the 2nd time we stayed there for a week long disneyland visit. The attention to details are great. Things like one of the clerks offering to call or text me when the groceries we ordered arrived, remembering I asked about the pool, and sending the delivery person up there to meet me. Also housekeeping arranging our kids stuffed animals on the beds when doing the rooms up.  The cartoon viewing room is way more quiet than the one at The Grand, and the kids liked winding down each night for a few minutes in it.   The view was great and I'm not sure what everyone else was complaining about with the window tinting. Also the proximity to downtown disney is a big thing for us. Walk across a street and you're in DCA via the Grand. Stroll through Downtown Disney and you're at the

this disney property is in great location and staff is exceptionally disney. very pleased with service and friendliness of staff. the room was quiet and comfortable but disappointed in some minor issues. the remote did not work well for tv, the phone cord clip was broken so you had to hold the cord to phone when in use and the tub drained very slowly. all minor issues but the room did not live up to the excellence we have been so used at a disney property.

Summary Heading: Cute,but not sure its worth $300+ a night
Summary: We stayed only one night and Im glad we did this during low season. The lobby is tiny with only 2 chairs to sit in and some little benches down a hallway where elevators are. Only 3 elevators and I witnessed a long line and wait at check in time. I would have expected more Disney theme in the room but it was minimal. The beds were high and comfy and all very clean. The little fold down couch is great for a little one to sleep on and easy to maneuver.We were on 4th floor with view to pool. We could hear the loud screamers and a couple cussing at each other, but the rest was muffled. Walls are thin and unfortunately the people across the hall and next to us were a family traveling together with screeching kids allowed to bang in and out of the rooms over and over. Disney, I know

Our family registered to run in the Disney 10K and half marathon, so decided to stay at one of the Disneyland hotels.  Paradise Pier was perfect for us.  We rented a suite for two nights: the room, with two bathrooms, a separate bedroom, a sleeper couch, and a refrigerator, was perfect for us!  The location, especially for the run, was also perfect - we walked out the front door, directly to our corrals.  The view from our room, especially as the sun rose over California Adventure Park, was breathtaking. We will definitely return to Paradise Pier for our next Disney running event.

After having experienced the other DLR hotels, I was excited to try out Paradise Pier. While the cast members were excellent, the hotel lacked the Disney magic of the other DLR hotels. I would rather pay a little more for that experience and stay at Grand Californian or the Disneyland Hotel. However, if you are looking to save money, stay off-property.

Summary Heading: Not my first choice, but it got the job done
Summary: I had a conference in Anaheim and always love a quick trip to one of the Magic Kingdoms.  Because it was close to the convention center and the theme parks, I decided I would stay here.  I was within walking distance of the convention center and could still enjoy the perks of getting into the park early.  Now, if you want a great view of the park, this is it!  It's the best place to possibly stay.  It's multiple stories allow you to get a great view of the park at night, and the glass elevator appeared to be a lot of fun for the kids.  The rooms were nice enough, beach themed.  They were clean and had a nice sleeper bed.  It was, overall, an average hotel room.  It was a room that was to appeal to the masses, who wants to get in cheap.  Which, when you go to a Disney Property

Summary Heading: I had the time of my Life....
Summary: The hotel was comfortable, staff very friendly and helpful. Close to walking distance to Downtown Disney, Disneyland, Disney California.  My only complaint was the elevator wait time. This hotel accomodated many families, one many floors, and it seemed there are just not enough elevators --3--to accomodate all the waiting customers.

Summary Heading: Perfect Place for a Family with Young Kids
Summary: I did extensive research prior to booking to decide the best of the 3 Disney Properties for my family and it paid off. It paid off because I think I did make the right decision but most importantly, my expectations were set. So many of the negative reviews are things you could have discovered before arriving by only reading a few reviews. I am not comparing this to any of the Disney World resorts because I’ve never been.  We booked a concierge level room with no view (after much debate). This was the single best thing about our lodging and something that could only be offered at PPH. We had a patio outside our room that led to the pool. My husband and I found that space invaluable. 4 comfy cushioned chairs and a table where we could look at lush plants like we were in Hawaii. We

I only had 1 afternoon and 1 full day to see Disney with 23 year old daughter.  Decided to stay on property to get the extra hour of park time.  The hotel was adequate but not worth the premium rate.    Didn't use any of the amenities, so felt  the $17/day parking fee was excessive.   Hotel staff very friendly though!

Can you think of a single North American hotel in 2015 that doesn't have working wifi? I can! It's Disney's Paradise Pier.  The front desk staff and manager are lively and do a good job. They were great in doing little things for my son's birthday and after a mistake involving getting our room ready, comped us a breakfast,  which was great. I really think they do a good job. They're the only reason the hotel gets any stars.  No wifi. Unfortunately,  I have work to do on a family trip,  so need an Internet connection after the kid goes to bed. I can't do anything,  so now I have to do work in the business centre with a special needs preschooler. It takes twice as long to do any work, and it takes time away from my kid's vacation. Normally I can just do this after he goes to bed,

Summary Heading: Great price for a disneyland resort.
Summary: We stayed here in March of 2014 with 3 adults and 2 kids plenty of room for all. Love being able to send my in park purchases to the room. Definitely going to stay here again. The people were incredibly nice and helped us get to where we were heading.

Celebrating a 65th birthday of a dear friend - we had the time of our lives.  Check-in was super fast and included balloons and cheers for the birthday girl from the fantastic front desk team.  To keep costs down the four of us shared a two queen room which was perfect, beds were so comfortable!   Our room had a lanai where we enjoyed our morning coffee.   We delighted in the "Surfs Up" character breakfast at the hotel, great food and giggle inspiring interaction with several of Disney's biggest stars!  Walking across the street and entering Disney's California thru the Grand Californian Hotel is one of the perks of staying at a Disney hotel, didn't move our car for three days.  Already planning a trip to Disneyworld!

A very nice and clean hotel on the Disneyland property.   This was our first time in Anaheim and staff were very warm and receptive. Provided all the extra information/advice we need as first timers.  Gave us room facing the Disney CALIFORNIA adventure park so could see the lovely view at night.    Nicely arranged rooms but a little over priced. Adding a microwave to the room facility will be a plus.  Has Mickey surf restaurant for breakfast character dinning and it's souvenir shop incase you missed buying at the park.  Easy access to the parks so was easy to hop back and forth allowing the children time to rest.  Overall,  wonderful experience!!

Paradise Pier was the best hotel I had ever stayed at. Staff was friendly, rooms clean. Love this place. It is pricey but you will not regret it. Parking wasn't bad ether. The Disney staff made it hard for my family and I to go home.

The previous review says it, there is no Disney magic here. If you have been to a Disney World resort in Orlando, you will be very disappointed here. Staying at Paradise Pier for 2 nights, plus one day of park tickets, costs about the same as 5 nights and 3 days of park tickets in Orlando. I cannot figure out way because the overall quality does not even touch Disney World. This hotel feels like it is a random mid-level hotel chain. Something is very strange about the elevators, we have waited up to 10 minutes for an elevator. The wifi is spotty. The service and staff are not as friendly and welcoming as the Disney World staff. I hate to keep comparing, I was just expecting so much more.

Summary Heading: Great stay for Half Marathon weekend
Summary: My family and I had a lovely stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel over the Half Marathon weekend that just passed. It was our second stay at this property and this one was even better than the last.   Front desk staff, valet staff, bell staff,  housekeeping staff and room service staff were all extremely helpful and friendly every time we encountered them. We were sprinkled with some Disney Magic as soon as we checked in! Housekeeping staff did a great job of keeping the room clean. We didn't want to pay the extra money for a park view room so our pool view room was perfect. The beds were super comfortable. Even the foldout twin bed was comfortable for my son. I will say that the rooms have some Disney touches, but they're not overwhelming. If you're looking for a room that screams

Just returned from a 2 day trip and was very dissapointed with our stay here.  The Disney Magic apparently does not travel across the street -- all the employees seemed bored and sad to be working at this hotel and showed no Disney hospitality. The lobby is drab and the rooms horribly outdated.  The toilet handle needed to be jiggle to stop running and the showers had various temperatures cold and then scalding hot. Housekeeping was also spotty. We didnt receive turn down service the first night and had to call for the second night.  Front desk personnel were unfriendly.  When asking for late check out, it was treated like a huge inconvenience for 1 extra hour and they told me I had to get a new room key.  I was skeptical (I've never had to do that anywhere) but complied because

Summary Heading: Good option if you want to stay on property.
Summary: I stayed one night at this hotel for the first time a couple weeks before Christmas.  We had no trouble with self parking and check in.  We were able to check in early and we were upgraded to a park view room. The room was clean and good sized, with a small desk and a couch.  Being a fan of the beach, I really enjoyed the beach theme of the hotel.  There was a This hotel was not originally built as a Disney hotel and it shows in terms of amenities, notably the pool area.  I've stayed at a number of Disney hotels in California and Florida, and this was the most disappointing pool area.  We did not use the pool, it being the middle of December, but it looked pretty small and unremarkable.  We did not eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel - there appeared to be a small cafe

I am very disappointed in the quality of food available at this hotel. I was expecting much more than this. Rooms were decent though and pool area and slide were great. Short walk to Disney. Overall, glad we took the kids, but will never do so again. In their defence, the food almost everywhere around Disneyland was horrible.

Let me start by saying that if you're just looking for a basic hotel that is clean and safe, this one will do just fine.  If I had paid for a basic Motel 6 room at $89 or so, I would have been fine with this.  At $250 for a park-view room, I was first excited, then upon arrival very disappointed. I feel more than a little cheated.  This hotel has the appearance and feel of having been bought from one of the budget hotel chains and has simply had some Disney signage applied here and there. A good indication is that if you park in the garage, there is no elevator so you'll wind up banging your bags down the stairs to the first floor to get into the hotel.  Like I said, I paid a ton to be in a park-view room.  I had romantic thoughts of laying in bed with the lights down low and

Deciding to stay on property at Disneyland is a choice itself.  You pay more (sometimes much more) and get certain benefits: early admission to the parks, closer access (in most cases), Disney service, and a more immersive  experience.  For me this is generally worth it as my trips to Disneyland are usually years apart.  Once the decision to stay on property is made, there are three hotels to choose from.  On this trip, I choose the Paradise Pier and was not disappointed.  Paradise Pier is the least expensive and smallest of the three Disney hotels, but still offers the benefits.  It is a short walk to the hotel guests entrance at Disney's California Adventure and you have the option to monorail or walk (cutting through the Grand Californian) to Disneyland.  The rooms are large,

Hotel was clean neat and tidy. What let it down was restauarnta area down below - dinner is very plain and overpriced. we had a young lady introduced as our server - very nice, bubbly and enthusiastic, great....then she disappeared for the night. we got served eventaully and food was average and overpirced.   also the bar area ran out of tap beer - i only ordered one i didnt drink it all.   Wi fi was hopless and didnt work after first day  i tried to ask guest services the best way to get from there to santa monica, judging by the two fellows at the counter you would have thought i had asked if was possible to crosss the rcokies on foot in winter. i booked a yellow cab myself and if anyone is interested it was $130 plus tip.

This is the least expensive hotel on Disney property that still allows you the benefits of being close to the parks and the use of magic hours. Disney owned hotels cannot be beat, the cleanliness is outstanding and the staff are always friendly and super helpful. We haven't tried the hotel restaurants but would like to in the future. The only downside is the access to the parks as it seems kind of confusing and seeing as it is so close to California adventure you'd think they would have direct access. Unfortunately you either have to walk into downtown Disney next to the Disneyland hotel or walk through the California hotel. Those are the only two ways we found but they're not that bad. I hear you can see the world of color performances from some rooms towards the top which

I stayed in this hotel only for one night, as my friend who we were visiting Disney Parks with didn't feel like spending money for Disney Hotel. When she arrived, I moved to another Anaheim hotel, so we could stay together.  I booked club level premium view room to have a view of the parks and World of Color show. It was a bit pricey, but it was off-season, so I figured I'll book and get full Disney immersion. So I did!   As when I arrived to the hotel at 6.30 am, to be able to go to the park and use an extra hour, the check-in lady not only checked me into the room right away, but she gave me free upgrade to Malibu Presidential Suite on the 15th floor! I heard Disney does stuff like this once in a while, but didn't completely believe it could happen. And of course I totally

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay on Property
Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had a room with a view of the California Park which was perfect for our first time at Disneyland. We had access to the breakfast room which was perfect to start our day. The snacks late at night came in handy for the viewing of the water/music show from our window. They even pipe the music in through the tv so we had great seat for the show. The staff were all super from handling our room( they didn't have it ready due to our early time of arrival) and the bell people taking care of our bags until the room was ready. One of them even took us over by golf cart to drop us off at the Downtown Disney entrance since we were not sure how to get there. It is pricey to stay on property and staying off has a lot of selection close by. However when it is

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay on Disney Property
Summary: Staff were very friendly and helpful.  Hotel nice, but not as fancy as the Grand Californian or Disneyland Hotel.  Rooms higher up preferable for the view.  Great news is that unlike Disney World, you get a discount at most of the non-Disney shops in Downtown Disney.  The downside is that your hotel "magic Band" will not allow you to charge those purchases to your room - Just a bit of an inconvenience.  In the park, everything works off the Magic Band,   You have to cross the street and pass through the Grand Californian to reach Downtown Disney.

Third time to Disneyland, but first time at a Disney hotel. Couldn't fault it. Close to the parks and Downtown Disney which was a real bonus on a lot of other Hotels.  The early hour entry was probably the main reason we stayed here and was certainly worth it. Staff were excellent, helping us out in many ways, including organising a room ASAP after we arrived early from a long flight from Australia. In house laundry was also a bonus, as we later found, most hotels don't have them.   Definitely would stay here again, if we one day return.

We have now stayed at all of the Disney properties in Anaheim & this Paradise Pier did not disappoint....Sure it is a little smaller than the other two, but it still maintains the Disney's higher standards of cleanliness, friendliness & all inclusive. The room itself was spacious & clean...nice views from my window & within walking distance to the theme parks...The food was OK, not great,  but overall satisfying...I would definitely stay here again if it were cheaper then the Disneyland hotel...my rankings #1 Grand Californian #2 Disneyland hotel #3 Paradise Pier...

Summary Heading: Disney Service and Location well set
Summary: This is the first time to try the PP and found it to be very good. We had a park view room in an upper floor and enjoyed the ability to see the park and watch the show with the piped in music. The staff were pure Disney with everyone we met going to the max in providing info and service. The restaurant was nicely appointed and we showed up at 5 minutes before they were to close and never felt rushed to finish. They even went out of their way to accommodate some of our requests. Staying with Disney gets you into the park early and makes it a great perk on the days when it gets crowded. Went to Downtown on one evening and when we asked for directions, the doorman put us in one of their golf carts and took us over and pointed out the fast way to return.

Our stay began with a friendly welcome from staff as we checked in.  Nice, large, clean room with amazing views from the 11th floor.  Although next time I would ask for a room on the other side (Disney side) so we can watch the fireworks from our room.    The location is great, just a few blocks walking distance to Downtown Disney and the entrance to the park.  In the evenings, there is a "viewing area" near the pool, where you can watch the fireworks and they pipe in the audio --- it's so much better with the music accompanying the fireworks!

We celebrated New Years at Disneyland. Best part of this hotel is location and the magic mornings. Staying at a Disney property allows for an hour early entry. The hotel itself was average for a resort. It is pricey but the cheapest of the three Disneyland resorts.  The room was nothing too fabulous, but was clean and a decent size. The matress  on the bed must have been older because it sagged toward the middle.  Our view of California Adventure was nice.

I stayed here with my 9 year old son, my friend and her 8 year old son. We stayed for 1 night and were celebrating my friend's son's birthday. Parking was easy and check-in was easy. The lady who checked us in was very friendly and gave the birthday boy a pin and some balloons. We even received an upgraded view! We reserved a room on the concierge level which offered free drinks and munchies throught the day as well as wine and beer for a few hours at night. The employees in the concierge club were all very friendly and helpful. The club room could use a little bit of a make-over though, to make it more modern.  The room was a basic room but the view was great! We went to the pool and slide. The boys loved the pool and hot tub (just your basic pool and hot tub). They went down

We usually try to stay at Paradise Pier when we come to Disneyland.   The concierge service and lounge can't be beat.  We had a room with a view of DCA again.  We stayed in our room for NY Eve due to a congested 3 month old, but could still watch all the goings on that we usually enjoy from the window.  This is by far our favorite hotel.

From the minute we hit the lobby until the minute we left the experience was phenomenal, Every staff member has a smile even the security and room staff, its nice to see people who love there job. Our room was a across from the  world of color which we watched several times form the comfort of our room along with watching the fire works from the pool. My sister and I had taken a repositionable cruise to LA then took a short Transfer bus to the hotel. Arriving around 11:00 A.m. our room was not ready yet, But the staff advised they could help us out with get our park tickets and advised we could check our luggage up front and see town or hang out pool side. They also advised we go visit the Beachcomber Club and have a snack and relax since it came with our room we did all the

My family stayed at this hotel and was pleased.  Rooms are clean and bright.  It is conveniently located by the monorail entrance or you can cut through the Grand Californian if you want to enter through California Adventure.  Very convenient if you like to hang around Downtown Disney.  The previous year we stayed at the Grand Californian, which definitely has a more pleasing ambiance in the lobby area; however in comparing the rooms, we found that Paradise Pier is very comparable especially considering the price difference.

I stayed here with family from 6-1 to 6-5 2014 and we loved it. My cousin, nephew, and I loved the water slide. the beds are awesome and comfortable if you stay on the 9th 10th or 14th floor there is an amazing view of the Disney park. And the bathroom was clean, beautiful and had a nice tub.

This is the first hotel that we stayed in for our family trip to California. This is also the first Disney hotel we have ever stayed in. As such, we may have had great expectation for it. But it turned out to be just yet another usual hotel. It is conveniently located, within walking distance to Downtown Disney and the theme parks; but for the price we paid, we expected more. It just lacked the magical touch. I would not be paying to stay here again. I think any other hotel or motel will do the same.

Summary Heading: IMPERFECT BUT WOULD DEFINITELY STAY HERE AGAIN!
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed @ the Disney's Paradise Pier for the first time on 12/15 - 12/19 in a Premium View room. We normally stay @ Disney's Grand Californian on the DVC side however,  it was too late to rent a villa as we planned this trip two months ago so we decided to give DPP a try. We booked our room through getawaytoday.com as they provide a small discount which @ times is more than Premium Passholders would get (we're Premium passholders) so we decided to go that route instead.   Upon entering, we were met with a lobby of moderate size with a tall Christmas tree in the middle and an empty throne like chair probably meant for Santa Claus or other Disney characters for photo ops. I will say that the lobby did look somewhat dated however, I wasn't bothered in the least as

My family usually stays at this hotel. If there aren't any specials and it's full price, we will usually stay for a couple days, to get the early entry, and then move over to a good neighbor for the last couple days of the vacation. My kids loved the huge, beautifully decorated tree in the lobby, the holiday carolers are a very nice touch. The store is handy. Arcade is very inviting, and the movie room is adorable. Make sure to ride the glass elevator all the way to the top for a nice view of Ca.Adven. The only thing I can say "negative" is the distance. The hotels on Harbor are closer, but when you stay here, you're walking through the gorgeous Grand, downtown Disney..with all the live music..it's a very entertaining walk to the parks, how can you complain?

The Paradise Pier hotel in the Disney Resorts is very nice.  Everything is clean, well managed, friendly and efficient staff and of course conveniently located.  But it doesn't really add to the Disney experience because the beach atmosphere while cute, doesn't in any way say Disney. Few Mickeys, etc are present.  So, if you are going to spend that much money, spend a little more and stay at one of the other two Disney hotels, or a lot less and stay at a non-Disney hotel nearby, many also within walking distance.

This was our 2nd time staying here, and it is a great hotel.  Right here at Disneyland.  A short few minutes walk to both parks and Downtown disney, which has numerous places to eat, drink and shop.  The staff here are outstanding!! They always are happy, friendly and helpful. There are a couple of places to eat here at the hotel, the PCH Grill and the Surfside Lounge. (Plus a vending machine room on the 1st floor).  There are 2 bars onsite, the Surfside Lounge & the Sand Bar on the 3rd Floor.  They have an amazing fitness center, a guest laundry with 4 washers & 8 dryers. There is a business center with 4 computers & a few printers. Not to mention an amazing pool  area if you have time between the 2 parks.  Our room was spacious, 2 queen beds, large bathroom, mini fridge and

Summary Heading: Pricey, average rooms but worth it for the convenience
Summary: I stayed at Paradise Pier for the first time this year. In the past we've always stayed at nearby hotels (the Howard Johnsons, Park Vue, and Best Western). The room was average, but I have yet to stay in a Disneyland area hotel that wowed me. The service was spotty and the hotel restaurants are crowded and overpriced. But the convenience and early entry can't be beat. We did not have a park view room, but we watched the fireworks from the pool deck. I'd stay here again. The rooms do have fridges, so I'd bring my own breakfast. The in room wifi was also pretty bad, but we didn't spend much time in the room.

terrible place to stay if you wish to have a meal,only spot for meal is snack bar/cafe in lobby for coffee, bagels. No vending machines, no bar, nothing! Two places for breakfast are a block away, no stores around for snacks, provisions, only 3 elevators so it takes forever to get up/down. also hard to get a cab, its near the Disney Park but thats about it, I'd never stay here again, I was there for conference and rates were very low so that was the only advantage this hotel had. if you have a car you can drive a few miles to find snacks for room. It is near Disney however and thats a plus.

Our very first time staying at the Disney paradise Pier Hotel and visiting Disneyland during Christmas time.   Overall excellent experience!! I will try to be as detailed as possible about our stay.  We arrived early at the hotel. We were greeted by a courteous, very nice valet attendant. He took care of our bags, and we valeted the car during our stay.($25.00 a night) Our first time walking into the lobby, our 9 year old daughter was blown away by the huge Christmas tree in the lobby, the parents were too! We did early check-in which the hotel staff was able to accommodate us.  Went up the our room, which was on the 6th floor with a awesome view facing Disney California Adventure. Its was a standard room, with two queen beds. The room was very clean, Disney themed of course.

The rooms are average - at BEST.  Like an older Best Western or Holiday Inn.  I waited for what seemed like forever to check in.  Hotel elevators are SLOW and always crowded.  You STILL have to pay $17.00 per day to park!  I thought location was a perk, but I was wrong.  The "hot" rides were closed on magic mornings, which made them basically useless.  Our safe broke twice while we were there.  I will not be returning soon, but if/when we do, I will save some money and stay down the street with a free breakfast.

Overall 4 stars, my wife and I plus our 6 yr old son just stayed here and was nice, well kept hotel. We were able to get a dummy room key at 7am so we could take advantage of early morning access to parks and we're notified by text room was ready at noon. Beds comfortable especially after walking around parks all day. Room service was fairly quick and food better than park junk and only cost a few dollars more. Ahi tuna dinner salad ;-)  Really only downside is distance to parks,  if you cut through grand California makes trek a little shorter. Especially if you use that special entrance to cal adventure ,  we did both early mornings about 45 min early and 1st through turnstiles into cal adventure both days  Still after 12-14 hrs in park, it's furthest away if walking from gate

My wife and I checked into the Paradise Pier Hotel in Disneyland on Tuesday, 25 November. Our travel agent chose this hotel for us because it was located on the Disney property but was not as expensive as the grand Californian Hotel. We are enjoyed our stay very much. We never ate in the restaurant but we ate in the little café one morning. Our room was very clean and had two queen beds. It was a very easy walk to downtown Disney. We ate there a couple of nights. And it was very convenient to grab the monorail at downtown Disney and take it into the tomorrowland station at the park.

Summary Heading: Another great experience at this hotel
Summary: We booked our vacation in February for November this year. We were able to check in early, leave our bags and go enjoy that Disney magic we were there for. All the staff were friendly and accommodating, welcoming us back to the hotel at the end of a long day. The rooms were spacious and clean. Thanks again for a wonderful stay,  I'm sure we will be back again!

There were 9 of us and it was great. Adjoin rooms looking out over California Adventure. Easy walk to entrance through CA Hotel, easy access to Downtown Disney and the monorail into Disneyland.  We had great food in both parks as well as in DD

This was our second time staying at this hotel.  We received awesome service from the moment we pulled in.  Donnie at the front desk is amazing!  He remembered us from last year and took the time to talk story with us and make us feel like family there!  The hotel is convenient and clean.  The view of the fireworks from the pool deck is wonderful not to mention not having to be in the crowd in the park to view the fireworks.  The microwave and toaster in the lobby make it so easy to grab breakfast for the family on the go in time to make it to the park to take advantage of the Magic Mornings.  The character breakfast at PCH Grill is always fun too!  This hotel is definitely our go to spot when we visit Disneyland!

This was an awesome early Christmas present and a great experience. We showed up to check in and the cast member was really happy and excited for us. She upgraded our room to one with an amazing view of DCA. We also received some fast passes that were very happy to use. This is one of those times that Disney is truly awesome and they go out of their way to make their guests happy. All the cast members were very helpful and very cheerful. It made our stay that much more an experience. LOVE DISNEY and CAST MEMBERS!!

We stayed here for 4 nights in October. It was a great place to stay as it is so close to the park entrances, was also great to get the Magic Mornings every day of our stay. We watched the fireworks from the pool one evening which we loved. Character breakfast downstairs was expensive but the kids really enjoyed it, and it was the only opportunity to meet the characters as they were not walking around Disneyland at all (other than a quick visit with Mickey and Minnie at their houses in Disneyland).  The only negative is that our bathroom had been cleaned with what smelled like 3 bottles of bleach before our arrival. The fumes were so strong that we had to leave the room for a few hours hoping it would subside. In an effort to avoid this happening again, we kept our Do Not

Excellent hotel - I loved my stay at this hotel - The staff were friendly always had a smile of there face and willing to help you with everything and anything.  The room was nice and clean and tidied :) Would recommend and stay here again :-)

From the moment we drove up, the service was never less than stellar!  The front desk agents, Niki and Marc were amazing: not only were they friendly and hilarious, but they worked hard to get us an upgrade for our room AND to get it cleaned way before check-in time because we had a tight schedule that day.  The guest services folks, the waiters, the Mousekeepers, and the gift shop staff were all friendly and welcoming.   The hotel itself is quiet attractive inside and out.  Decorated for the holidays, it glistened with lights and cheerful decor!  The room was comfortable, clean, large, and had THE BEST SHOWER I have ever experienced!  What a delight!  The vending areas, the game room, and other public areas were great as well.  The only issue that I had was that the pool was

Well, duh!  But honestly, that is the only reason to stay here. Rooms are small for the price. Shower heads are perfect height for a 12.year old; bad for an adult. The wireless is inadequate; don't bother to sign on, use 4G ( this is true of all three Disney hotels; Walt would be furious) But, it is the most affordable of the three Disney hotels; it is a nice short walk to the attractions; you get in one park an hour early each day. So, if you want nice, stay at the California Grand

Wonderful hotel!!! Staff was incredibly friendly and everything was very very clean!!!!! So important for us because we had come from the hilton and it wasn't very clean..:(.  Rooms were decorated very nice! Cute mickey lamps and beach balls, and lots of great details! They even mailed a postcard to our daughter for free at the front desk. Easy to walk to downtown disney or the parks. Would recommend  this place to everyone!!! Great job disney!! Worth the price!

Stayed with my wife and 4&6 year old daughters for 3 nights. We had been spoiled at the Penninsula Beverly Hills the 3 nights prior to our arrival, but my part of our vacation was over and it was time for the kids.  Valet and bellman service were quick, check in was a breeze and as we had arrived at 11 our room was expectedly not available. Bags were put in to storage and we went to disneyland and were telephoned once the room was ready. Hotel is across the road from the grand californian disney hotel and you can access downtown disney or california adventure through the hotels, or you can walk through downtown disney a different direction. About 5 minutes of walking to california adventure, closer to 10-12 walking to disneyland. With all the theme park food and drink you will

Room was cleaned well every morning, my 2 year old daughters dolls were arranged on the beds every day. Staff is friendly enough, character breakfast was worth the price for the kids, we had a family of 5. Magic mornings paid off if you had a bit of a plan. We took water and snacks in to the park with us, purchased from a local market with in walking distance just outside the gate and to the right (by the Denny's). Plenty for the family to do at the hotel and great access to adventure land from the Grand Californian. Had 3 day hopper passes for everyone and could maybe have used a 4th, 2 days in each park. When going to Disney land, get in the line for a fast Pass to meet the cast of frozen as they cut off issuing them early, use a magic morning to get a place in line before the

We go to Disneyland once a year, and usually stay across the street at the Grand Californian Hotel; this year, we wanted to save a little cash and booked the Paradise Pier for four nights.    While the hotel was adequate and seemed clean, the entire hotel is showing its age and has a very run down feel about it; it's time for Disney to sink some cash into this place.  The rooms have received a slight redecoration with new bedding in the past few years, but otherwise they're quite dingy.  We paid for a premium view room, but as other reviewers have mentioned, the window tinting is bubbled and warped, making it difficult to even see through.    In all, the hotel was fine, but a bit of a letdown.  We will most likely spend the extra money to stay at the Grand Californian from now

Pros:  Disneyland property = magic morning perks & decent location/proximity to theme parks and downtown disney. View of World of Color (tho ours wasn't ideal.. see below) Friendly employees - restaurant, front desk, bell hop, etc. (except the gift shop) Quiet rooms  Cons: Our room had a bad window "tint" job, so for the "premium view" perk, it sucked. Half the window looked like it was underwater. I made a complaint to the front desk initially. In hindsight, I wish I insisted on a discount because the view was the point of the premium cost. (room 1114... our neighbor had a clear view)  Housekeeping skipped our room. The door signs have "privacy please" on one side and "housekeeping needed" on the other. It turns out that they don't actually read the signs - if it's hanging on

Stayed here from 10/1-10/4/14 and had a great experience as usual.  We’ve never had bad service when it comes to staying at a Disney hotel and this stay was no exception.  Staff was friendly and always accommodating.  They even upgraded us to a family suite and comp’d our valet because it was my birthday and my daughter’s first trip to Disneyland.    We ate the Surfside Lounge and the food was very good.  I cannot comment on PCH grill as we did not dine there.  We also did not use the pool area but it looks very nice.  There is a parking garage directly behind the rear entrance of the hotel which offers valet and self-parking.  The room was great.  We were on the 14th floor and had a view of California Adventure.  We could view World of Color from our room.  It was a suite so it

This hotel is so overrated. Been to many hotels over the years and thought it would be great to stay with a hotel associated with the Disneyland chain. What a disappointment, no where near the standard that we thought a Disney hotel would be, still a fair walk to the Disneyland Park. And to top it off we woke up and had been bitten by bed bugs😡😡😡😡😡😡😡

My friend and I only stayed one night but loved the set up of our room! Everything was clean and looked great. Staff were helpful when we had questions. I wish we were able to stay more then one night and were able to explore a little more of what the hotel had to offer.

My wife, I and our two sons (12 and 7) stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier for 5 nights in August and had a simply outstanding time/experience. We had earlier stayed at both Disneyland Hotel as well as Grand Californian (loved both), so decided to try the last remaining Disney resort (also the least expensive of the 3) and our worries of it being a substantial downgrade from the other two, never happened. Oooh and ahhs galore as we stepped into our 8th floor room -- a spectacular view of the entire Disneyland complex, fantastic glimpse directly into California Adventure Park, as well as sweeping views of downtown Disney, other resorts and Disneyland itself. My boys immediately loved the beach ball size pillows on the bed, a fun game of makeshift volleyball played while we adults

We went to this hotel during my daughter's school break. We were there from Oct 27-31 2014.  Great things about this hotel: Proximity to the California Adventures and the pool/water slide. Great weather when we were there and we used the pool area quite a bit. There are lifeguards on site so that's nice and the area was clean. Pretty sound proof rooms. I could only hear kids in the morning, at about 7:30 but nighttime, nada. Very nice. Beds and pillows were comfortable. Surfside breakfast staff was awesome!   Not-so-great things about this hotel: Rooms are dated and not very clean, the carpet had red streaks of I don't know what. I've seen better, especially for this price. At 6:30am every morning I'd wake up to the smell of bacon/breakfast. It must be an old venting system.

Summary Heading: Might as well have stayed at a Motel 6...
Summary: On my last visit to Disneyland 3 years ago we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.  We loved it.  It was clean, service was impeccable and the rooms were decorated nicely and amenities were readily available.    My family and I again came to Disneyland from November 6-9 of this year to celebrate my son’s 10th birthday.  I wanted to try a different Disneyland Resort hotel, so I chose the Paradise Pier.  Upon check-in, I asked for an upgrade to our room and was informed that the hotel was “almost completely booked.”  ALMOST.  The guest services person did not tell us what the “almost” was, and we were flatly denied an upgrade.  I also asked about paying extra for access to the Club Level, which was where I really wanted to be.  Again, FLATLY DENIED.    We checked in, and went up to our

We wanted to stay at a Disney Property to take advantage of the extra magic hour so we choose the least expensive of the three choices and were pleasantly surprised!  We booked a 2 Queen bed suite (no view) and were given a free upgrade to a suite with a view!  The suite included an L-shaped couch that opened into a sofa bed, a kitchen table, fridge and microwave as well as a separate bedroom with 2 queen beds.  Both rooms had views that displayed the rides at California Adventure over the tree tops!  The kids loved the pool slide and the adults used the rooftop (3rd floor) hot tub!  The walk to the parks was minimal (and even quicker if you walked through the Grand Californian lobby to and from California Adventure)!

The only benefit from this hotel is that it is close to the parks. I had a fabulous time at Disney - except for the hotel experience.  The decor is old, the shower dripped and there was no food to be had. The restaurant closed before I got back from the park and no one told me that I needed to make a timed reservation in order to be able to eat breakfast. I was ridiculously hungry and there was no sympathy from anyone.  Instead I was pointed to a tiny cafe with a thirty minute queue and even longer wait, where the cutlery was plastic (plastic cutlery for a $200 room!!!!) and didn't even cut through the food served,  The pools were only open at the same time as the parks, which seems pretty pointless.  Certainly no Disney quality experience in this hotel.

Living about an hour away and having annual passes to disneyland we don't typically enjoy an overnight stay. This time we decided to stay and so happy we did! Disney hotels never disappoint. When we arrived the bell service was right there waiting to take our bags and direct us to the hotel desk. The desk agent clearly outlined all that we could enjoy at the hotel. Our room couldn't have been more perfectly placed. The patio was at ground level that led right to the pool and water slide. Our kids 6 and 10 really enjoyed the water slide. The pool is smaller but it is mainly little kids so it was appropriate. There are life jackets and swim diapers available complimentary to guests. While we didn't need these items I felt it was a helpful amenity for traveling families. They also

Summary Heading: Too expensive for what you get
Summary: The only bonus I you get for staying at this hotel in my opinion is that you are close to the parks and to downtown Disney.  The decor is ok but the hotel does look rather old.  The buffet line had a 30 min wait and the other place to have eat had a very limited menu.  I was never able to make the wifi work (4 days).  And also the hotel is very expensive.  You might be able to get a better cheaper hotel in the area.  The service was good and the rooms were very clean.

This hotel really needs to be renovated. It feels old and worn.   The rooms are clean. But the maintenance could be improved. Chipped tiles and watermarks in the bathroom are so sad.   The staff were mostly very helpful. Except for that guy at the breakfast with mickey mouse place who stopped us from taking a photo with minnie. He didn't stop the white people from doing that. He only stopped us.

I chose the Paradise Pier over Disneyland hotel because it was less DVC points. I enjoyed the beach theme and location. Rooms were comfortable and have a refrigerator in the room. Beds have a beach ball pillow and are firm & comfortable. Pool area and hot tub were great after a long day at the park.

The only bonus with staying in this hotel is that you get the magic hour for Disneyland and California Adventure.  The hotel was clean and the rooms were nice but the price was way too high. There were only two restaurants in the hotel and one was more of a coffee and breakfast place. The other one didn't stay open very late and it was a little pricey for what you got.  The customer service was great which is expected since it is a Disney property. I would not stay again because of the high price for the rooms.

Summary Heading: happiest place on earth, with dodgy wifi
Summary: We had 6 nights in paradise! Ultra friendly, helpful staff. Room was clean,reasonable size, comfy beds, great room service. The restaurant downstairs was tasty, not to overpriced, we ate breakfast in the little coffee shop/bar, not a huge choice of food, but again was tasty. The WiFi connection was terrible, had to go down to the coffe shop to pick up a bit of WiFi, but the pool was great , the kids loved it, and being so close to the two parks was priceless , as we could just come and go when we needed a rest.    It was a fabulous end to a magnificent holiday.

Just returned from a weekend at Disneyland and stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel.  The hotel was great! It was clean and decorated well (beach themed).  The pool is on the small size but it did have a slide for kids to use which was nice, there were also available life jackets for kids who weren't the best swimmers and a lifeguard on duty during open hours.    It is in a great location for getting to the parks! You can enter Disneyland by walking to Downtown Disney (about a block) and hopping on the Monorail which puts you into Tomorrow Land, or walk through Downtown Disney and catch the front entrance.  It is also a quick block walk over to the California Hotel where you can enter into California Adventure. (You need to have your room key to enter and exit during the mornings

Summary Heading: Perfect place to spend the first day before the park!
Summary: Arriving at the hotel, we first had great fun on the huge 3 story water slide which was no match for my water-loving 3 year old! Hopped to the pool deck to check out the fireworks and they were playing the accompanying soundtrack on speakers to add to the event.  We got a wonderful view of the park, a preview of World of Color  and easy back and forth access to California Adventure and Downtown Disney which was awesome.  The valet guys will whisk you over to the edge of Downtown Disney (and maybe the park too) if golf cart is available.  They were there 4 out of 5 times we needed them. It helped shave a little extra 5-8 minutes off of the walk.  I heard you can even call them for a pickup but I didn't try that.   We did have trouble with a miscommunication over a flower delivery

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier Hotel showing its age.
Summary: This is my first time staying at this hotel. The beds are very comfortable and the room is cleen. I stayed in room 340. The bathroom definitely needs quite a bit of work. I would say that its comparable to a Motel 6 bathroom if not worse. The reason for this negative review is that the shower head and sink is situated very low. I am not a tall person.. 5 ft 7 tall and I have to crouch/duck my head to wash my hair. The sink and counter is very low. Think of a sink for little toddler.   Another issue that I noticed is that the WiFi internet throughout Paradise Pier Hotel is horrible. 0 to 2 signal bar strength and the connection drops a lot.  There is also Ethernet connection in the room but unfortunately the DSL router did not work. I called the front desk multiple times and it

This was my first stay here.  I have stayed at the other resort properties, and figured it was time to give this one a try. I had been staying at the Disneyland Hotel, but they did not have accommodations for my entire trip so I booked here for the remainder.  While it is an OK place, it also shows it age. Disney should start thinking of a rebuild as an updating probably will not be enough. This hotel has been here a very long time (It was the Pan Pacific before Disney bought the property). My room on the 11th floor showed cracks in the walls and ceiling, making me think of where I should move away from in case of an earthquake. ;)  I checked in early because of moving from the Disneyland Hotel to this hotel.  The staff at check in was very friendly and helpful.  Of course a

Our recent stay at the Disneyland Resort was spit between here and Grand Californian. We really enjoyed our say here, especially the pool area. The slide was great, and it was nice to have a properly deep pool, missing at both other on site hotels.  The rooms were nice, some Disney theming, and a good size. The bathroom was standard but the bath was a little slow to drain and the shower water temp was a little tricky to moderate.   Other amenities were standard for a 4* type hotel. Bar and room service were good but as expected. The PCH Grill was good for the Mickey and Friends breakfast.  The Early Entry is the real benefit to this hotel, at the lowest price of all three hotels that qualify for this benefit. The walk to Disneyland seemed shorter from here through the Grand

We booked a relatively last-minute trip to Disneyland for our six-year-old son and wanted to stay on site so booked this hotel as it was the only one of the three on-site properties with rooms available for our dates.   The check-in staff was very friendly and helpful, but the rest of the staff did not seem overly happy or even helpful. We had a park-view room on the 9th floor...the view was nice, and we could see/hear the World of Colour show each night, which we appreciated. However, the room itself was musty and had an odd smell. The walls are quite thin, too, which meant we could hear families on either side of us in the early mornings and late evenings.   The hotel is also not extremely close to the parks...I advise others with more time to do more research to find a

Summary Heading: True picture of hotel on second trip
Summary: First trip I gave it great reviews. Sorry I spoke to soon. Second trip the hotel showed it true colors. From food on the walls, mirrors smeared with something,  the vent in the bathroom would drop lint or something like it while you would try to get ready. This after a shower that would change from ice cold to boiling hot and it would do this during the whole shower. To be fair ill breakdown some areas.  Valet - Robert gets 5 stars,  Front Desk/Check-in gets 5 stars it was not there fault the room wasn't ready long after 3:00 pm. Housekeeping - 0 stars I don't have enough room to write all the bad things. Lounge - Martin in the lounge is not a a happy person and they don't follow food safety protocols.  And it makes me wonder how many people they have make sick while there on

Summary Heading: Just a stroll away from the Park
Summary: This hotel is quite different from the original Disneyland Hotel.  It's more kid friendly and seems to have a lighter air about it.  Here and there it's beginning to show wear and I'm sure that will be taken care of quickly.  Disney's rooms are large and comfortable and you can see the evening fireworks from some of them, we did.

Summary Heading: 4 nights with little to complain about.
Summary: Spent the Columbus Day holiday weekend at Disneyland.  Checked in on Friday night late.  Got started early the next day.  Hotel was sitting right where we left it when we got back that afternoon for our usual siesta.  We have been to Disneyworld in Orlando many times.  First trip to Disneyland.  Hotel was clean and comfortable.  We had a great view of California Adventureland.  We ate at the Character breakfast at Surfs Up and since we did it on Tuesday morning we pretty much had the place to ourselves.  The pool is pretty cool with a water slide although my adrenaline junkie kids said it was "too slow".  Our only real beef was not really with the hotel but rather with Disney itself.  We tried to make reservations at the hotel restaurant but their "system was down" every time we

My wife and I recently visited Disneyland Park and stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel. When we arrived the front desk was extremely helpful and informed us we had a theme park view room. The room was absolutely fabulous. We enjoyed looking at the theme park, especially at night. We were on the eleventh floor and wow what a view. I would recommend this hotel for everyone who loves Disney like we do.

Summary Heading: Small pool and a long walk.
Summary: Stayed here in September and frankly I am wishing we had not. It would have been better to stay at the Disneyland Hotel, but that was not available.  Pros:   Early admission to the Disney Parks on select days.  Great view of the World of Color and the Disneyland fireworks from our room and you could listen to the same music from the parks on your TV.  Friendly staff  Great Mickeys Breakfast that should be done once if you have young kids.  Service staff took care of TV issue we were having very quicky and professionally.  Cons:  Long walk to get to the parks and Downtown Disney which also makes you cross a pretty busy road.  Small pool.  Rooms need better cleaning from the staff.  Only the really expensive place where there is Mickeys breakfast and a small quick service that

My friend and I stayed two nights at this hotel while visiting America.  The service was great, the rooms were great and it was just all in all a great experience.  If you are going to visit disneyland, I recommend staying at this hotel so you can get the full Disney experience, you also get souvenir room keys with your name on them and luggage tags!

This Disney hotel is worth your vacation dollar. Located directly across from Grand Californian, this location has rooms that are just as nice and affordable. Nice pool, upper floors have a good view of the world of color and park sights. Only draw back from being 5 star on this visit was that WiFi was not available on 9th floor and spotty throughout. Calls to tech support did not help. Nighttime Manager at the Hotel was less than helpful and would only ask others to do quick items that she could check herself. All the other staff were more than helpful especially the Valet staff. Once you experience this hotel, you will ask why you pay extra for the others.

My family and I have been season pass holders for years now and this was the first time we have stayed at any of the Disney hotels. I have to say it was definitely worth it for the convenience and being immersed in the Disney experience for the entire weekend. We got the park view, which was nice, but the next time I stay I might just get the standard room and save some money since we spent so little time in the room itself.  To get to the main park it was about a 5 minute walk to downtown Disney, which you would hop onto the monorail and take it to tomorrow land. This was the most convenient way to enter and exit the park. California adventure is just a short walk through the Grand Californian where you would enter right next to the Grizzley River Run ride. Overall, this was

Summary Heading: Two night surprise for the kids
Summary: We had an almost two week stay at Disney.  After ten days, we checked out of our hotel to "go home".  This is what our kids thought, but we had reservations here!  Awesome room, better service, and great house keeping!  Would stay here in the future for visits.

Summary Heading: Disney prices for a below average hotel.
Summary: Rooms not ready said they would text when available, still waiting. Rooms booked with Disney view but windows covered with a plastic film which was severely wrinkled & completely spoiled  the view & photographs were impossible, complained & we were given $45 per rm per nt compensation. Room was very quiet & beds comfortable but no better than the Ramada across from Disney  where we stayed the previous night & they included a breakfast. very poor wi fi reception the staff said the only good place was in the business centre but we didn't have time to find out. We have stayed in Disney hotels in Florida & they were good completely different to Paradise Pier which apart from Goofy in reception had no Disney feel. Make sure all luggage is taken out & returned to the car before

I wanted to share my experiences from a recent  5 day trip to Disneyland. We stayed at the Paradise Pier for the second year in a row.I am so happy we chose this hotel again.     The planning and anticipation of a trip is always enjoyable to me.I often read and or write reviews. I  check Disboards.com and other Disney related sites for tips, reviews, and happenings at the resort.   For this visit I contacted the hotel directly to find out who the GM was and to ask some questions about the hotel.I had made a reservation at the new Anna and Elsa Boutique in Downtown Disney.There was a pushback on the opening.I spoke with Gilbert Flores about all of my questions and concerns.He definitely went out of his way to help me.For me it's all about customer service.   I found out that

Large room that easily accommodated 3 of us. The easy walk to Disneyland & California Park was ideal. We were able to return to the hotel for a swim in the heat of the day.  Small pool, slide for the kids and the spa wad relaxing after a day at Disney.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel, has what you need.
Summary: We just got back from 6 nights here and l would say it was not spectacular, but good and served the purpose well!  That purpose being, so close to Disneyland.    Our kids were given helium balloons and a signed pic of the disney characters on arrival which was amazing!  The check in staff were excellent.  Rooms: we had a twin with a sofa bed which was comfy.  The room was a good size as was the bathroom.  No balcony tho which we were not used to, but didn't bother us too much as were were up and out early and in bed early!  TV had lots of good channels and of course Disney overload!  Facilities:  it had a great guest laundry which l was very thankful for.  Had detergent dispenser and dryer all of which was good and clean.  The reception was nice and the lifts good although they

Summary Heading: Very pleased. Stay at this hotel if visiting Disneyland
Summary: I took my family to Disneyland for a couple days and paid the upgrade charge to stay on a higher floor so we could see the world of color. When we arrived because we were 5 people they upgraded us to a suite on the 10th floor. It made my wife and mother very happy because it had two full bathrooms in it. The view was awesome and we could watch the world of color and the fireworks. We had breakfast downstairs at Surf's Up Breakfast with Mickey and Friends this was the best character dining we have experienced over the years going to Disneyland. Main characters included Mickey, Minnie, Pluto, Donald Duck, Daisy and Goofy. They were so friendly and accommodating, Minnie even ran and got my daughter a fork. Best Customer Service throughout the hotel and restaurant. We found our new

I am a Disney fan. I've always wanted to stay at a 'real Disney resort' but it wasn't quite the magic I was hoping for.  Turns out it is just another hotel.  Let's start with pros: 1-great staff (like, GREAT) 2-sofa and pack n'play in every room  3-magic morning entry even on check in day  4- valet washed our van and even tidied the inside a bit 5- use of the Grand California entrance into California Adventure (get there a half hour early)  6- very clean Cons: 1-further walk than a lot of 'neighbor' hotels (SOLID 10 min) 2-pricey dining, breakfast not included (most neighbor hotels do) 3-water slide isn't on before 10am or after 7pm (anytime we were actually at the hotel) and the pool is just OK. Slide was broken one of the days we were there and the lifeguards were unnaturally

Stayed here to attend a conference.  Checking in was very easy and smooth but our room was not ready. We were given room keys to use to charge items within the property and have access to the pool area. Registration took my cell phone to call me when the room was ready. About an hour passed and received a text that the room was ready, along with the room number. When we arrived to the room, the maid had just gotten there and the room would not be ready for another 30 minutes. I went to the front desk to ask why I received the text and was informed that they were having technical issues.  The hotel offers free Wi-Fi. Once we were in our room, I tried logging onto the internet. After 45 minutes I still was unable to log on so I called the operator to have someone come up and help.

I really enjoyed my stay at Paradise Pier.  I had never been to Disneyland (though I have been to Disney World many times), and PP was great.  Very clean & nice room, and I had a park view on the 13th floor, so that was beautiful.  It was interesting watching World of Color from above & behind.  It's also nice that you are able to watch the DL fireworks from the pool deck & the music is piped in.  I ordered room service for dinner one night & it was delivered very quickly, and the food was excellent.  I have no complaints with the hotel itself, but my reason for the 4 star rating is that there are no signs for it.  Maybe it is because Disney didn't build this hotel... I didn't know that till just now when reading other reviews.  When I got to the Disney property, there were NO

Summary Heading: Great On Property Hotel at Disneyland
Summary: If you are planning a trip to Disneyland and intend to focus on being in the park you should stay on property.  Yes, it's a little on the pricey side, and yes you can get some really great deals for a fraction of the price off property and even very close to the park.  However...it is soooo nice to be able to walk out the door and practically be at your destination.  If you are going on a Disney vacation why have a car to go anywhere else?  Plenty of dining options in the parks and in Downtown Disney that are just steps away! To me, the price is worth the convenience! The room was very clean, very cute and very comfortable!  I stayed with a friend for three nights during the Disneyland Half Marathon.  I doubly recommend staying on property if you are running one of the races,

My cousin booked this hotel as a thank you for helping her through her cancer ordeal.  We were upgraded to a family suite which was wonderful.  We had a view of the park and watched the World of Color from the rear.  Staff was wonderful couldn't have been any friendlier.  Had all you can eat and drink in the concierge level VIP room.  Pool was great. Got into the park an hour early.  It really is the happiest place on earth!

Summary Heading: A pleasant place if not quite paradise!
Summary: Our family recently stayed two nights at the Paradise Pier Hotel.  We had the park view from the 12th floor and could watch World of Color from this very different vantage point.  The room was clean and fresh, everything worked, and the staff was really very friendly and helpful.  The pool area is spacious with nice views of the other hotels.  We had absolutely no complaints during our stay!  The reason for four stars instead of five is because of the cost.  As most of you know, Disney did not build this hotel, so it doesn't have the immersive theming of its sister properties.  Paradise Pier is not a five-star hotel like the Grand Californian, but it is priced as if it were.  The most important thing that you are paying for is the extra hour of magic (early entry) to the parks.

I decided to stay at this hotel because of the proximity to the park and I chose this one, over the other two Disneyland Hotels because of the special price they had at the time of me reserving the place. The lady who checked us in was very customer service oriented and it made us fell welcome immediately. The people working here were all very nice, my problem was with the hotel itself. First, I requested to upgrade to a park-view room. The view was great, but the room had not been properly cleaned. We even found the review card that the previous guest had left behind!  Our room was the last room at the end of the hall and there was a small balcony with a door. When we got back from the park, there were three guys drinking in the balcony; they were being loud so I called the

Yes we paid a small fortune to stay at the Paradise Pier but it was well worth it. The level of service provided by Disney is unlike any other. From check in to the character breakfast our last day, we were treated like VIP's. The pool area is a fair size and offered other activities like a "pool party" and water slide. The poolside bar was nice also. The room was a good size and the Disney touches were present. The biggest benefit was the location. There's nothing like walking a short distance from the parks to your room. Anyone who has left the parks at midnight knows how much it sucks to wait in line for a tram and walk all the way to your car. I don't mind paying a little extra for the convenience. So worth it!

We visit California pretty much every fall because the crowds are less and it's fun to see the Disney parks all decked out for Halloween. The Paradise Pier is a good hotel just a little pricey in my humble opinion. I like the fact that they offer rooms for families of 5, because we would not want to have our 3 kids in another room. The beachy boardwalk theme is great. We always visit the restaurant (Goofy's Kitchen) for dinner on the day we arrive so the kids get some of the character's out of the way! Less time waiting in line at the parks :) The hotel pool area is nice, clean and relaxing. We usually plan a hotel day in the middle of our trip just to enjoy the atmosphere and recover from the long park days. The location and convienence of hoping on the monorail keeps us coming

After much reviewing of this and other hotels in the area, we ultimately thought Paradise Pier was a good choice based on cost, convenience, and distance to Disneyland. The front reception staff were friendly and helpful and truly engaged in helping us check in and enjoy our stay.  We ate at the restaurant and were treated to fantastic service. We felt staff went over and above expectations; food was incredible and serving sizes were abundant. I'd definitely recommend Paradise Pier and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again when next visiting Disneyland.

We stayed here in September for 2 nights - we are 2 mid twenties couples and we had a fantastic time. The check in was smooth, we upgraded from a Standard to a Premium View for 25US per night per room - totally worth it - the view over Paradise Pier was incredible. We had interconnecting rooms which was handy. Getting to Disney/California Adventure was easy, a quick walk through the Grand Californian. The pool is great, small but still awesome. We had a great time and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it!

This was our 3rd time staying at the Paradise Pier and I’m not sure that we will stay again. I’ll break my review into the pros and cons.  Pros Close Proximity to Disneyland and DCA. You can walk down a path through the Grand Californian to enter DCA.  Early Magic Hour- If you stay at any of the Disney properties you get to enter Disneyland an hour early on Tues/Thu and Sat and DCA on Sun/Mon/Wed/Fri. This enabled us to ride cars 4 times in one day and several other rides before the park opened to the public Cleanliness and Comfort of Room- The hotel is clean and the rooms comfortable Character breakfast- there is a fun character breakfast If you pay a pretty penny you can see DCA from your window and a glimpse of the World of Color show.  Cons The pool is freezing cold. It was

Disney's Paradise Pier hotel offered all the amenities desired for families with children! The breakfast buffet is the best hotel breakfast I have ever experienced. I also enjoyed how close the theme parks were to the hotel, and the magic hour was a great way to access the park early!  The rooms are plenty spacious and very tidy. I really appreciated how the housekeeper arranged my siblings stuffed animals on the bed. It is the small acts like these that truly created a great experience for my family!

Summary Heading: Great Location with good sized rooms
Summary: We were in Anaheim so that my wife could run the Disneyland Half Marathon.  For convenience, we decided to stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel, as it would allow her to pretty much walk right out of the hotel and be at the starting corral in 5 minutes.  One of the main drawbacks of this hotel is that it does lack some of the Disney ambience.  This is probably because it was not originally a Disneyland hotel.  Disney bought it and converted it to their name.  That being said, there are a lot of good things about this hotel.  First off are the rooms.  We found them to be perfect for us and our two kids.  Each room has two queen beds as well as a day bed that would easily sleep another adult.  Since our kids do not generally sleep well together in the same bed, this worked out

Fabulous hotel!  Close the both parks, easy walking distance to park gates as well as the monorail in Downtown Disney.  Nice rooms, although not overly large.  All facilities in working order and very clean.  There were five of us in the room and we were not cramped or crowded at all.  There is a small fridge which is nice.  The pool is nothing to write home about but it works if you just want to get wet.  The water slide is really for younger children.  Our youngest is 9 and he thought it was pretty lame.  But he also loves roller coasters so anything that is not fast and wild he thinks is lame.    There is also a hot tub and kiddie pool.  There is a deck with lounge chairs away from the pool, nearer the bar which is great for relaxing.  They serve a variety of drinks,

This is not our first time at Disney's Paradise Pier hotel. We like it because it is the cheapest of the Disney hotels that allow you to do early entry into the park. We have stayed at the Grand Californian too, for a much higher price. The Paradise Pier is an easy walk to the park, with a fun yet small pool and water slide. We have had a view over California Adeventure and a non-resort view which was lower and looked right out at some awesome palm trees. The staff is always super friendly and helpful. We had a weird loose door lock on our previous stay that required both security and mantenance to get us back into the room. They were speedy and friendly both. I like to coffee pod machine in the room. We will be back I'm sure.

You'll never go wrong with Disney hotel, worth the price difference. Very convenient & rooms were impeccably clean. Staff are friendly & approachable. Magic hour for hotel guests are worth lining up for if you plan to do parks early. The cue can get pretty loooooooooong but then the line moves real fast so that's okay for me.

This was just the experience we were hoping for! At the end of a long trip, my friend and I wanted to indulge in our inner child and stay somewhere luxury but also full of Disney. This was just that. The service was exceptional and the room completely gorgeous.   Would definitely recommend this.

Summary Heading: Good Location - Not good for parents
Summary: We stayed at the PP with our kids in August 2014 for our Disney/California vacation.  Our kids are 10 and 7 and had a great time.  I don't recommend this hotel for solo adults or families with older kids.  PP is the most inexpensive of the three hotels surrounding the parks and within easy walking distance.  First the positives.  It's a quick walk to downtown Disney and the parks and just like the other two hotels you get early entry (Magic Hour - 1 hour before opening - 8 a.m.) into one of the two parks daily.  This is a good perk to get on about three of the premium rides before the crowds.  The staff at PP is friendly and helpful.  The pool area is small but they have a great waterside that my kids loved.  Of course my kids loved the pool too, but didn't care that the lounge

i never go again,bad services,not guest services at the pool,small pool,long wait for elevators and restaurant,nightly rate to high for this hotel,food quality not good and price too high xxxxxxxx xxxxxx

We are Disney Vacation club members so we stayed on our membership. Hotel very clean and the staff friendly and helpful. This is not the best of the Disney properties, but it is close and convenient. The are cheaper options that are nicer in the area, but we prefer to stay on site, plus being club members we don't pay. PLEASE Disney, do something about the elevators. They are SOOO slow! Still a fun hotel with Disney charm and magic.

Honestly, I would probably rate Paradise Pier a 3.5, but thanks to a surprise room upgrade, I am "upgrading" my score.  Last weekend we met up with some friends for the weekend to celebrate Birthdays at Disneyland/DCA.  We wanted to stay somewhere special, while also not breaking the bank.  Since we were splitting the room, we splurged and decided to stay at Paradise Pier (since it was $330 a night).  I was excited to learn that as a Disneyland Hotel guest, you get to enter the parks (on designated days) an hour early... what could be better?!?!  Check-in was a breeze, probably because we arrived after 5PM, but were super surprised to be upgraded to a premium view room.  How awesome is that?  Totally unexpected and I think it was because they knew we were celebrating a Birthday.

We decided to visit Disneyland before taking our oldest child to college & surprised them with a stay at Paradise Pier. We loved the convenience & Magic Hour entry, room was nice and a welcome sight after the hours spent in the parks.  Only downside, there are three elevators (four if you count the one that sits in an alcove) and they seem to take an eternity to arrive. There were times that we waited more than 15 minutes for one to stop at our floor (4th). It seems that if you stayed on floors 10 & up it would get to you faster. We were unable to call the alcove elevator on our floor so we opted to use the stairs instead. Quick tip....take the stairs to the second floor and then go back in and take the staircase down to the first floor.  Another heads up....the elevator will

One of the Disneyland hotels.  The hotel is clean with a nice beach decor.  The staff are very professional and friendly.  Check in was quick and well handled.  Rooms are spacious and clean.  All amenities work well.  I found two issues with hotel.  The first was the verrrrry slow elevators.  Some waits were 10 or more minutes, causing the guests to take the fire escape stairs.  The second issue was the high cost of everything in the hotel.  A cup of coffee, one only, was over three dollars.  Meals were like wise costly.  The buffet breakfast was over $30.00.

We stayed at this hotel for two nights. It was the first trip to Disneyland for my three nieces and my first time in 30+ years. For the price (nearly $400 a night, with tax, for a standard room and non-park view) I was expecting way more. It was just a standard run of the mill hotel with a Goofy statue at the entrance and a mickey mouse lamp in the room. Our room was not ready when we checked in around 3:30 (even though check in was supposed to start at 3:00). The staff was not apologetic nor did they offer any sort of upgrade or credit for the mishap. It took nearly 30 minutes to purchase our park tickets at the hotel front desk (the staff accidentally over charged us and couldn't figure out how to credit our card back) and the rooms could use some serious updating

We have stayed at the DisneyLand Hotel the last two stays and decided to try the Paradise Pier we were so happy.  The room good not be any cleaner. The staff went out of their way to make us happy. The shower head was not working properly and we told the Elizabeth the room service person and she called right away and made things happen! The maintenance man showed up within 5 minutes and put in a new shower head on and even showed me how to work it.
