Elizabeth (I think she went by Eva) took care of our room and she was the best ever, she left some great decorations for my granddaughter s birthday that was outstanding, my granddaughter loved it. She is a great person, and works so hard on making you happy. Stars to you Elizabeth, thank you. I saw reviews of slow elevators and we

Pros: Hour early into parks multiplies the number of rides you can go on, worth it for family with teens. Can enter DCA through Grand Californian next door. Walk to Downtown Disney isn't far and you can re-enter Disney through the monorail that stops in Downtown Disney, rather than walking to and waiting at the Disneyland front entrance each time. Pleasant cast member found us a room when we arrived rather than waiting several hours more for check-in which was very welcome. Printed off our entrance tickets for us. Rooms very clean and well-stocked. Rooms pleasant but understated beachy Disney, not over the top Disney. Store had small sundries, like milk, toothbrushes, etc. Small fridge in room, coffee maker with pods. Could store bags with bell services on last day after

If you happen to be in California; you are visiting Disneyland in Anaheim; and you hope to stay in a Disney hotel (something all Disney fans should try at least once), but you don't want to pay an arm and a leg, Paradise Pier might be your best choice.  The magic starts when you arrive at Paradise Pier. The Cast Members are very friendly and on hand to help (for a fee of course - Disney may be magical, but the magic doesn't come cheap). The room is decent, clean and serviceable, though a little old. The wallpaper is somewhat yellowed, the fixtures are somewhat tarnished and the shower curtain shows signs of age. It's largely dust-free except for under the beds and behind the furniture (I'm enough of a clean freak to check).   There are exactly 3 things in the room with any link

I would give the hotel 3.5 stars if I could.  The location is great.  I don't understand reviews that say it's far from the parks.  It's right across the street from the Grand Californian which is as close as you can get (and at least $200 more per night).  The walk to Disneyland was under 10 min. and DCA is more like 5 min.  It is closer to both parks than the Disneyland Hotel, but that being said, if we go again we'll try to stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  The grounds and pool at the Paradise Pier are pretty lame (no grounds really).  The hotel itself is like a slightly gussied up Holiday Inn, which is fine, but we paid so much for so little.  At peak times, like mid summer when we were there, the rooms are over $300/night.  The beds are comfy and I found our room quiet despite

When Cast Member Jamie checked us in to room 906, she told us we were upgraded to a park view of California Adventure plus she gave my daughter a signed pic of Mickey and a "Just Graduated!" button. Jamie also gave my husband and me "I'm Celebrating!" buttons. When I booked this stay online I did indicate in the comments section that we were belatedly celebrating a high school graduation and a 50th birthday. Still I felt like royalty being treated to nice gifts!  This was our first stay at Paradise Pier, and I was very pleased with the size of our 2 queen bed room and the hotel in general. We've stayed twice at the Grand California before. Comparing these hotels is unfair as it's like comparing apples to oranges. That said, I don't regret our stay. Great service from

My family and i just returned home from a wonderful vacation to Disneyland. We stayed at the Paradise Pier and loved it.  The best part of this hotel was the close proximity to the parks.  You never have to take a shuttle or wait in long lines for a bus.  The parks are right across the street. I've read many negative reviews on this hotel but I can NOT think of one bad thing to say about it.  It was super clean, very comfortable beds, sound proof walls and all around a wonderful experience.  The staff was very friendly and willing to help.  I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Being in a connected suite on 14th floor helps.
Summary: We had a lot of space with the connecting door to a dining and sitting area.  Kids sleep in the hide away bed in the couch and the other room had two queen sized beds.  There are two bath rooms in this configuration which really helps.  If you go to Disneyland and want to keep the kids on a sidewalk path, follow the path out next to the parking garage out to the start of Downtown Disney and grab the monorail.  We had views of the fireworks off to the side from the room and the light show in CA Adventure below.  I thought the room was OK.  We were usually too tired to care about the finer points in our living area.  It was kind of bland but quite clean.  My only tip is to get a room high up away from the road and early morning park noise.  There is also a lot of beeping from

Hotel is a little dated, but the staff was excellent. the rooms were very clean. The Paradise Pier is the lesser expensive of the 3 on site which overall rates good for the money. location had easy walking access to both parks and downtown Disney too.

My husband and I stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier hotel on DVC points if only because the DVC villas at the Grand Californian were booked for the three nights we wanted to stay.  The hotel is a pretty far journey from Disneyland but slightly closer to California Adventure.  There are rooms of the hotel that actually overlook the DCA park!  The walk to the parks includes crossing the street to the Grand Californian, walking through the sister hotel's lobby, and trekking through Downtown Disney before making your way to the esplenade that takes you to the main entrance to either park.  The hotel was nice, a step up from a Four Points by Sheraton, and had a whimsical beach motif throughout.  There are restaurants and a gift shop on the main floor, but beware of the single bank of

Summary Heading: Will Not Choose This One Again.
Summary: The good part: Get in an hour early to Disney. (all 3 on site hotels offer the 'Magic Morning')  The less than good part: Very small room. Absolutely NO water pressure in the shower. Next time, we will spring a bit more for either Disneyland Hotel, or the Grand Californian.

We stayed in a premium view room. We had a view of California Adventure Park. The view was great. We did have a little walk to the parks, but it was not bad. If we go back I think I would stay at the Disneyland Resort, just little closer to the gates. To get to the parks from the Pier you need to cross the street and walk through the Grand Hotel which does take you right into California Adventure, but if you want to go to Disneyland you have to walk through Adventure out the gate and into Disneyland. Not that long, just a lot of walking when you are going to be walking around all day. The room was clean and a nice size, there was just two of us. The pool was ok, nothing great. Not like the pools at Disneyworld Resorts. I also wish they had more of a food court. The restaurant

If the Disneyland  or the California Adventure Hotels are booked----find a hotel close to Disneyland!  The Paradise Pier is not even worth a single thought, the rooms are extremely overpriced, loud, very far away from anything Disney, will nickel and dime you at every opportunity. More than $23.00 to print a boarding pass, more than $3.00 for a not even cold coke and on and on it goes.  RUN AS FAST and AS FAR FROM THE PARADISE HOTEL AS YOU CAN GET!

We stayed at the Paradise Pier for 4 nights. It was good having easy access to the parks and downtown Disney. The room was nicely decorated and served its purpose well. We used the pool everyday, it was a nice escape from the midday heat. The staff here were very friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: A Hotel of the Disneyland Resort
Summary: We stayed in a standard view room for three nights in December. The room was large enough for two adults. We had quick and easy access to Disneyland Park, Disney California Adventure Park and the Downtown Disney District.

Rooms are just as good as the Grand Californian but cheaper.  We had a room on the third floor and our balcony led right to the pool area, which was great.  The valet comped our parking after we shared our cross country adventure with him, a lil Disney magic :).  I've stayed at all 3 resorts at Disneyland, this was the cheapest (which still isn't that cheap), but just as nice for the room.  Paradise Pier def has the smallest pool area, but there were very few people using it.  You can't beat how close it is to the parks and Downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: Loved location and early entry to parks
Summary: This was our first trip to Disneyland. We loved having the early entry into the parks at Disneyworld, so staying on site was a nice perk. The room itself was ok. Having the couch was a nice plus though. The view, however, was awesome! We were on the 5th floor overlooking the theme park. We were able to watch some of the light display from the California Adventure Park that night. We walked across the street to get to the park and downtown Disney. The pool can't compete with the pools on site at any of the Disneyworld hotel pools. The slide could have been cool but I got stuck at several points (I am not heavy so water pressure was the issue). Cost for parking awfully high since car never left the garage. We considered taking the Disney shuttle but that was expensive. It was

Summary Heading: Enjoyed the Stay but Expected More
Summary: I've stayed at the Paradise Pier before and enjoyed my stay much more than I did this time. The room is great, and my children enjoyed the hotel's beach theme, but there were minor annoyances. The first was that the water pressure for our shower was nearly non-existent. I have a daughter with long, thick hair and having nearly no pressure from the shower made it difficult for my wife to wash her hair. Second, also shower related, was that the drain was slow so by the end of the shower I would be standing in nearly two inches of soapy water. My last issue was the motion sensor activated A/C unit in the room. We walked in after an evening in Downtown Disney expecting our room to be cool, but were treated to a humid, warm room. We called the front desk since we thought our A/C unit

Summary Heading: The best part is the location
Summary: Decent hotel. The location really makes the place. Just a short walk across the road to Disney land and California land. The hotel itself feels a bit dated. The rooms don't provide much. Not even a bottle of water (I won't drink LA tap water) the water pressure was below average for showering. The restaurant was below average. After eating there once, we never returned. The staff in the hotel were great, really made you feel welcome.   All In all, worth it for the location, not for the room quality.

Summary Heading: Close to the park, that's all the matters
Summary: Room was comparable to a Holiday Inn for 3x the price….but you are close enough to the park to walk and you get in an hour early.  We know what to expect going in as we have done Disney several times with the kids.  You overpay but you are paying for convenience, not comfort which is what you need for a trip to Disney with the kids.  This hotel was ok but the ones in the Magic Kingdom in Florida are much nicer.  Next time we’re in California for a Disney trip, we’ll likely stay at the main California resort.

Summary Heading: Good location, but overall poor value.
Summary: We are annual passholders who have visited Disneyland almost every year for the last 10 years. We've previously stayed at many of the Disney area hotels, mostly on S Harbor. This was the 1st time we stayed at one of the 3 Disney hotels - we thought it would be nice to experience one of the DIsney hotels this time. We stayed 8 days in mid July.  The good:  Hotel is overall well kept and clean. Pool - Ours kids, aged 8 and 11 enjoyed the pool and slide. Great lifeguards and the pool itself was very clean. Location is good. Nice to have the California Adventure entrance through the Grand California Hotel. Staff are courteous. Room - beds are comfortable, furniture in good condition. Nice touches with the kids cartoon room on the main floor. Our kids enjoyed watching the disney

What is it about Disney that makes you miss it when you have barely been gone? Even the hotel is part of that. That's why we always stay Disney at Disney. It makes a difference. Disneyland hotel was booked so we landed here. Grand Californian was first choice but at $700 more for three days I couldn't bear to!   The hotel is farther in some respects from Downtown Disney and the entrances but closer to the Paradise Pier section of California Adventure (no direct access though) closest through Grand Californian. Views from the park and high floors are great, combined with Channel 16 and 17 broadcasting the fireworks and World of Color music. Keep in mind you are seeing the backside of the show so you miss the water back-dropped graphics.   The hotel is not on the luxurious scale

Summary Heading: Average Hotel in a great location
Summary: For the price we paid the hotel is disappointing.  The rooms are no better than a Holiday Inn.  The pool was nice but small.  The kids enjoyed the slide. What made this hotel almost worth the cost is the view we had and the location.  We had a view of California Adventures and it is an awesome view.  You can see all of the rides and watch the World of Color show.  Staying at this hotel made it very easy to walk into either park and Downtown Disney by cutting through the Grand California Lodge, which is beautiful.

The hotel is good, the service is good, the pool is good.  But nothing to say:  OMG this is the best place on the Earth! We stayed there two weeks ago.  We are a family of 4 (3 towels) and pretty hard to get extra soaps.  And I was not asking for 15 bars.  Just one extra ( two days, there was no soap enough for us). Not even a couple of bottles of water.   Lets say that the overall stay was good, but I was expecting more from a Disney resort, as it is called.

Summary Heading: Pay extra for the park view room
Summary: We were lucky enough to have a park view room, which was amazing.  You could watch the world of colour from your room, and tune the Television into the right channel to hear the music to go along with it - totally amazing experience - would certainly do that again

The hotel room was nothing more than average. The pool area too, was nothing special. We paid extra to have access to the concierge lounge where we could have breakfast, snacks, drinks and afternoon appetizers with a beer or glass of wine. A little expensive for what was offered, but much more convenient than having to go to a near by restaurant every morning for breakfast. We didn't even consider the hotel restaurant because the meal selections were limited and the prices were rather high. This hotel made For easy access to Disneyland through downtown Disney or through the Grand Californian to California land.

After reading some of the excellent reviews, seems to me this Hotel picks and chooses who they wish to give excellent service too. Well, we didn't luck out.   This was our first stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel.  We were expecting excellent service as we had previously at The Grand Californian Hotel.  However, this was not the case. We arrived 4 hours early, we kindly asked if it was possible to check in earlier, just to get settled.  It was not possible under any circumstance. The cast  members were rude, not at all accommodating. We were able to walk across the street to get access to California Adventure Park, so that, is one positive. After spending a few hours there, we headed back to rest.  We again decided to take a chance and ask if the room was ready, this was around

Summary Heading: OK hotel but great location and access
Summary: So it has taken me a bit to write this review because I really want to be objective. So this is about the hotel itself (not our trip).   The facilities are average. They are basic hotel rooms like a Best Western unless you really splurge and rent a suite (a named suite). The other suites are just two Best Western Hotel rooms joined in the hallway or through a door. The Named suites are the fancy ones. So be sure you know what you are booking when you ask for a suite.   The food is basic American cuisine however the character breakfast is a must. The buffet is amazing and their effort to make your children feel like a princess/prince is worth the investment in the meal. The reality is we did not find it expensive considering the experience and meal.   The swimming pool is decent.

We stayed here for the last night of our Disney adventure, and found it extremely easy to access the Disney Downtown area and parks.. with the added bonus of a Magic Hour!  The room was very spacious and clean and had all the amenities you would expect of such a hotel.  The pool was excellent and the kids activities we very welcome.  We had no trouble getting to Disneyland.. an easy 5 minute walk.  Great stay and thanks.

Ok, this is the lest expensive of the three DL hotels.  But sure, it's still rather expensive.  However, by searching hotel sites or being a Annual Passholder, you can get nice prices during off season.  Are the rooms that much nicer than surrounding "Good Neighbor" hotels?  Not really. But there's some nice benefits. First, if you stay in any of the three DL hotels, you are considered staying in all of them for benefits like using the pools or the secret entrance into DCA from the Grand Californian.   Next, they are  a little closer.  Not a lot, but when staying with those who have walking issues, or if you wanna get back to the hotel for a nap or to change clothes after being drenched on Splash mountain, it's nice.  Finally, and this is hard to quantify, there is that "Disney

This was our second stay at the Disneyland Resort, the previous year having gone to the Disneyland Hotel. That property was not available for our dates, so we booked Paradise Pier. I am an Authorized Disney Vacation Planner, so staying off site wasn't really an option because I like to experience the Disney Resorts firsthand.  We were very pleasantly surprised.  The staff was courteous and we loved the theming of the room.  It was cleaned well every day during our stay. The location was fabulous- very short walk to the parks and easy to get to.  We ate at PCH Grill for dinner one evening, and it was empty.  The food there was good and service was great.  We didn't experience the elevator wait issues I have read about- a few waits but nothing that stressed us out.  The hotel is

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, clean, friendly service so close to the action
Summary: I really find it fascinating that so many people complain that the hotel is such a hike from the parks and Downtown Disney.   Considering that you walk around 10 miles a day inside the park, a 5 minute walk to get to the parks (I timed it) can't possibly be a deal breaker.  It took us 7 minutes to walk to Downtown Disney - I've walked further for MUCH less.   The hotel itself is very clean, smells fresh & is bright and airy.  I can't compare to the other two Disney hotels ( I did walk through the Grand Californian which is obviously fancier) but I really liked this hotel.  I had NO problems with the elevators taking a long time and we were on the 12th floor.  The pool was great, but there was a lack of seating around the main pool mid-day so we found ourselves sitting around the

We stayed here for two days for the Fourth of July weekend, and it turned out to be a very good choice!  We checked in at 1pm, and Heather at the front desk was friendly and efficient.  Our room was already ready, room 339.  Located on the third floor next to the pool, the room had no view, but rather it has a lanai, a rather big one, too, with a large table with four chairs and a gate that allows you to head right up the stairs to the pool - we spent our first night lounging on our lanai, looking up at the few stars that twinkled above.  Room was large and clean, and our Mousekeeping staff responded quickly to our requests for extra towels and extra stationery (I like to collect hotel stationery, which is rare these days, so it was a blast to discover that the Paradise Pier

We stayed here last month for a quick Disney trip. We wanted to be close to the park but not spend the prices at the Grand Californian and The Disneyland Hotel. We were greeted warmly and got right to the park. You can use the entrance through The Grand Californian to California Adventure, so it is very convenient. We would come back again for sure. The rooms are clean and comfortable, nicely decorated with a beach theme. It's nice to park and walk to everything!

If you have to stay here, you have to try concierge with theme park view. We had a small problem when we checked in, but with the magic of Disney hospitality, our room had rose petals in the shape of a heart with a bride & groom ducks and love spelled out with the petals (it was an anniversary trip).  We were on the 14th floor, and had a wonderful view of the fireworks.  You can see the beautiful colors of World of Color, but if you have never seen the actual presentation, you probably would not know what it's about.  The king sized bed we had was like sleeping on a cloud - very comfortable.  The room was relatively quiet.  No one running in the halls, just an occasional water faucet sound from another room - but again, very quiet.  You can have the windows open slight, just

The paradise pier hotel was fantastic I stayed with my family it's just walking distance to disneyland the hotel was very clean the staff always to time out to look after you I will come and stay there again

Summary Heading: Great hotel at a great place
Summary: We loved everything about the  Hotel. It has a very friendly staff. Only takes a few minutes to walk to both parks. The magic hour is great. We got to go on about 5 rides every morning before the parks officially opened.  Can watch the fireworks from the hotel.  The restaurant is very good. Will definitely return on my next Disneyland visit.

The view from our room was amazing!  This is by far the best location (of the three Disney hotels) for viewing World of Color.  We could not directly see all of the images that are projected on the water, but that was okay since we have seen it a few times.  Room was clean and had two double beds, a sofa/futon, desk, mini-fridge, small safe, and coffee maker.  It was spacious enough for the two of us.  There were four pillows on each bed and it was comfy.  The room stayed cool, even in the July heat.  The bathroom was pretty standard, but had lousy water pressure in the shower (kinda like rain).    We had no issues with the elevators.  Would definitely stay here again because of how close it is to the park.  That being said, service was disappointing and definitely not up to the

Summary Heading: Expensive, but you can't be the location.
Summary: This was our 2nd stay at the Paradise Pier hotel this year.  It is the least expensive of the three Disney properties (you can't say it's the cheapest when it's $379 a night).  Getting the Extra Magic Hour is a nice perk.  Plus, we were able to leave the park, go back to the room and rest, and then go back into the park.  Two negatives - there isn't a shuttle or transportation to the park, so you will walk a pretty good bit before you ever go to the park.  You can use the Grand Californian entrance to California Adventure.  However, we wanted to go to Disneyland at 7:00 a.m. for Extra Magic Hour.  We walked to Downtown Disney to catch the monorail, but the monorail wasn't working so we had to walk all the way to the park.  That's a lot of walking, only to find out that Space

This was the first time we stayed at a resort hotel and loved it! We booked two rooms, adjoined, and had plenty of room for our family. We had a standard view on the 4th floor facing the parks and could still see the fireworks from Disneyland and some of the rides at California Adventure.   The kids loved the water slide. The pool was closed on our third day, so we were directed to the pools at the Disneyland Hotel. It was just a short walk.  Everything is just a short walk away. Using the entrance at California Adventure and having the Extra Magic Hour is totally worth the extra we paid to stay on resort property vs a Good Neighbor hotel!

We checked in for our first stay at the Paradise Pier about 2 pm on a Monday.  We were told that both of the two rooms we booked were ready but unfortunately only one was cleaned.  Guest Services immediately put the room on a rush for cleaning and issued us four vouchers for a free character meal anywhere on property.  I love a hotel that apologizes and makes up for a mistake!  (Note: This is far cry from the terrible service that we have received in the past from the Disneyland Hotel staff and from some of the hotels at Disney World.)  The room was large, bright, clean and Disney without being too themed.  The location means everything at Disneyland Resort is walkable.  The pool is a bit small in the late afternoon with crowds coming back from the parks.  I had read about slow

Summary Heading: It's still a Disney property with all of the benefits that that brings
Summary: We booked our stay at Paradise Pier with the added bonus of a 25% discount that I had forgotten that we had received in the mail months before I booked. The very friendly cast member that I spoke with to book the stay told me that it was still active. Always ask about special promotions when you call to reserve your room. We were able to book a room on a high floor with a theme park view WITH concierge for not much more then I was going to spend for a non view room. SCORE! Then I found out a few days before our trip that we had been upgraded to a one bedroom suite- DOUBLE SCORE!   Our suite was on the eleventh floor, one below what we were going to get with our standard room, but it don't think that the room could have had a better view. It was great! We were able to watch

This is now my second favorite Disneyland Resort Hotel right behind The Grand Californian. The staff is amazing! The rooms are bright, clean and spacious. The branding is cute and appropriate. The rooms are decorated delightfully with a summer beach/resort Disney vibe. The view from room awesome if you have the park view and it is worth the extra expense (we were on the 13th floor). If you cut through the Grand Californian both parks are just moments away. A bonus is the self parking is the closest of all the properties, just steps from the front desk and elevators. I would say this hotel is worth the money and I plan on coming back again!! Thank you Disneyland Resort Paradise Pier for a great 7 days!

We checked in on Monday (06-16-14) and checked out Friday (06-20-14) The property is beautiful and the staff is very helpful and kind. The bag checkers are not very cheery but you don't really spend too much time talking to them anyway. Every day our room was made up and our maid's name was Ava. She was AMAZING!!! She left my daughters coloring pages, crayons, cute little bathtub duckies and more! She would also pose their Minnie dolls on their beds and every night when we returned the girls looked forward to see how she did the room up that day! We had a blast at the pool and the lifeguards were really paying attention, and very friendly. I felt like everyone at the hotel knew their job and did it really well! We will for sure be staying there again!

The rooms here are just average, but that's why it's the cheapest of the three Disney hotels. I preferred staying on property, rather than across the street. Disney cast members are the best and are worth the extra cost! If you are travelling with children it is worth it to stay at a Disney hotel so every min of you trip is within the "Disney magic." This trip was much more fun than our last when we stayed at Crown Plaza. Being able to walk to the parks and early entry every day bump this place up to four, from a three.

Loved the Disney theme and friendly service. Felt like an honorary guest. Great close access to the parks and downtown disney. Loved the theme of the room and the complimentary calls to let you know what was happening each day.  Only complaint would be the cold shower!

Grandparents taking grandkids to Disneyland.  This is the second stay here.  The hotel staff is helpful, friendly and seem to truly enjoy their jobs.  But then, who wouldn't in the "Happiest Place on Earth"?  We were served by Lauren in the Surfs Up restaurant.  She was very pleasant and helpful when asking about how to "do" Disneyland and California Adventure.  The rooms were clean and well equipped with the exception of a microwave.  That would have made it perfect.  We arrived well before check in and our room was ready and no waiting in line to check in.  The staff at front desk were very helpful with directions.  Definitely will stay again.

I'm a DVC member and have stayed here before.  We love the pool and slide.  Especially for my little ones the 1 foot deep pool is great.  Although there are not enough umbrellas to provide shade.  We stayed here just for the pool.  They also provide swim diapers for the little ones.   We only stayed one night as the hotel was booked and only accepting cash reservations at $700+ a night.  That's insane, for a regular hotel room.  No bells or whistles just 2 queen beds.  We had a park view which was nice.  But very noisy.  We stayed on the 13th floor.  It was like we were on the street.  Trucks backing up and beeping all night.  Loud machines.  I'm lucky my kids are heavy sleepers.  The walls are super thin and you can hear everything from the room next to you.  The guest

This hotel was nice, but i felt like it lacked the Disney theme. The staff was very nice. From our room we could hear lots of noise coming from the California Adventure Park. Apparently Disney was hosting some kind of graduation event and we heard noise till  wee hours of the morning. Our room had a nice view of Paradise Pier in DCA. I have no complaints, although I expected more from a Disney Hotel. Overall great location, great staff, i would recommend this hotel to a friend.

My siblings and I enjoyed the Paradise Pier Hotel two weeks ago and we loved it. We are 26, 21, and 17 of age and are often not treated like the adults that we are. Paradise Pier treated us so respectfully and professionally. We were celebrating my engagement and they gave us a room upgrade to a park view room! Everything was clean and wonderful. The convenience of the location was perfect for us to take a nap during the afternoon. Thanks for a wonderful experience!

I loved the theme of this hotel, however the rooms are in need of some restoration. Our floor had huge stains all over the place, there was mold in the shower and the wall paper was peeling up in the bathroom. Our room had an amazing view of California Adventure's Paradise Pier Boardwalk (this room costs more). We were upgraded because we were on our honeymoon. This view also gave us a pretty good view of the World of Color show at night. However, the windows are not sound proof and you could hear screams all night long and you could hear the roller coaster. We were down there when Disney was hosting the 24 hour opening and the Grad Nights; so the park was open either 24 hours or till the wee hours of the morning.  We did like how close it was, it was about a five minuet walk to

We are DVC members, and were visiting the Los Angeles area,so decided to use points for a room at Paradise Pier. We used extra points to get a room with a view of Disneyland,which I highly recommend. The hotel is older, and the elevators can be very slow,but the room was ample sized, and very comfortable. There are great little beachy touches throughout the room, and the bed is very comfortable. As adults, we chose not to use the pool area, as there were lots of kids there having fun, which we knew would be the case. We headed for beaches in the area, for a quieter experience. It's nice having a fridge in the room, as well. The light show was visible from our room, so we were able to enjoy a dessert we brought from our dinner out, to share, and with the ability to tune your

This is the most pocket-friendly of all the Disney hotels, and is pretty comfortable. First, about the location. It is the farthest from the parks of all the Disney hotels, but we did not find that to be an issue at all. It is a 10 minute walk (or less) to DCA and just about 12-15 minutes to DL if you cut thru the grand Californian. Considering the amount of walking you have resigned yourself to while in the parks, this is not a big deal at all in our experience. The walk thru the hotel to DCA is fun, and you emerge midway into downtown Disney as you turn towards DL, so that is not a pain either. So in our opinion, with 2 girls 11 and 8, the distance is not an issue.   Next the check in. It was very smooth, no time in the queue at all - though must be kept in mind that we

Summary Heading: Tried them all and the Paradise Pier shines very bright
Summary: I need to give some history first. I would only stay at the Grand. After the remodel of the Disneyland Hotel we wanted to try it. So after staying now at the Grand and Disneyland I wanted to try the Paradise Pier so I could say I stayed at all 3 hotels. This review is from a back to back trip. 3 night stay,  and 7 days at home,  and returned for 3 more nights.  From my arrival on the first trip I was met by Robert who helped with my car and luggage.  And I thought if the rest of the staff was half as nice and helpful it would be great. I was wrong, I can't think of any of the hotel staff that wasn't great. I even needed  the assists of hotel maintenance and they were there within 30 minutes to restore the power to the bathroom. Comparing Paradise Pier to the Grand the Pier rooms

Summary Heading: Don't stay here!  Run down and over priced.
Summary: Great location, but over priced and run down.  Nice to be near disneyland and enter hour early every morning of your stay, but until they improve the hotel OR reduce their price, stay somewhere else!  Pool area needs a major overhaul and not enough lounge chairs to accommodate everyone.

Could not really fault this hotel.  Yes it is a little bit more expensive than non Disney but for that extra magic on your vacation it is worth it.  My son loved the pool and slide, they have lifejackets so no need for your own floaties etc and lifeguards are present for extra peace of mind. Great for entry via grand california hotel and early entry. Staff were very helpful.   My son left behind a souveneir at the hotel and as many would do, assumed was lost but I did contact hotel and was very pleased to hear it had been handed in and they posted all the way to Australia for me.  THis level of service you can not put a price on, when my son was in tears when we got home and he thought he had lost it, then the big smile when it arrived via post.  I will stay here again..... if I

Summary Heading: BEST Disney Property Experience + Club Level
Summary: I just returned from a 6 night stay at this property. I have stayed at both the Disneyland Hotel and the California Grand a number of times but this was my first stay at their "value" property. I was with my SO, my 7 year old and 10 year old.   Room 1418 is super cute, oddly angled room, has a great view of World of Color and has 2 queens and a pull out futon double.   Room 1426 is an accessible room, great views of World of Color and has 2 queens and a pull out chair twin. No "proper" closet but does have a wardrobe to hang up some clothes.  PROS:  Good location to Downtown Disney and easy access to California Adventure via the special entry at California Grand (just across street).   Rooms are large and clean.   Staff is very friendly  Lots of kid activities from arcade room

Long story short, what was to be a family trip ended up minus my husband of 25 years. He walked out on me and the three kids just days before our 4 night trip to Disneyland.  I was blown away by the compassion of the staff at this hotel.  Our check in was quick and easy. The bellmen kept our luggage till the room was ready and we did the early entry into Disneyland.   When our room was ready the front desk called my cell phone which was nice.  When we did check in we were again in awe of the room. The 15th floor, 2 bedroom suite with a beautiful view of California Adventure.  Room to sleep 7 but only the 4 of us. The boys had their own room to relax and play games in. My daughter and I enjoyed the quietness of a room to ourselves. The close, easy walk across the street and thru

We had a great experience at this hotel. The staff members are all extremely friendly and helpful. The room was clean and well decorated, the pool (although filled with kids) was very nice as well. Housekeeping was courteous and did a great job. The "magic morning" option that you get for staying there is a great perk. There are several dining options that we enjoyed, especially the cafe for quick breakfasts & snacks. This hotel is about a ten minute walk to the entrance of Disneyland. Overall, it's a great alternative to the more expensive Disneyland hotels and staying here made our Disneyland vacay even better!

We stayed here for 6 nights and it was worth it for the early entry. Having stayed at Grand Californian on the trip the year before, we were surprised at the quality of Paradise Pier. It is clean, comfortable and not that far from the GCH. We grabbed a quick coffee, fruit and muffin from the little cafe downstairs but other than sleeping we were not really in the actual hotel. I would stay here again if the rate was a lot less than the GCH, as it was this trip.

We usually stay at the Grand Californian, but because this was a quick two night trip on our way to Palm Springs, we decided to try something new and a little cheaper.  The hotel had been given mixed reviews by our friends so I wasn't sure what to expect.  We were able to afford the conceirge level with a view of the park and were very happy with our decision to stay there.  There isn't really a lobby to speak of so you don't get the same feeling of the Grand, but our floor had new carpet and the room was very clean.  They brought us Mickey Mouse rice crispy treats while we were out which my kids loved.  We were able to see the fireworks and the water show from our room with the music on the TV.  It was just a little bit further than the Grand- I would stay there again.  My

Basically, I chose this hotel only for the early entry perk, which was great for California Adventure (less people) but not so great for Disneyland (way, way more people; slow lines; only Fantasyland and Tomorrowland are open early so there were long lines early on).  That aside, the rooms were nice but nothing fancy.  Our mattress was weird and it squeaked oddly with every toss and turn (maybe it was just that room - 13th floor, north end).  The room was clean but not as clean as I would have thought - there was a hair in the shower and the sink but I just cleaned it all up.  The refrigerator is small but is good for keeping water cold to bring to the park the next day.  We checked in really early but our room was available about an hour later so the available bell service was

Summary Heading: Great option for a Disney Experience
Summary: If you are looking for a great Disney experience at a lower cost than the other two hotels of Disney, then this is what you are looking for. It has a great view to the park or the pool. You can purchase the tickets at the front desk and make reservations for every Disney's restaurants. If you are looking to have breakfast, go to the restaurant (make reservations) where you'll meet some characters (and they even might have breakfast with you). The rooms have a great beach/surf theme. Don't hesitate and give it a chance, I'm sure you'll have the time of your life.

Summary Heading: Two-and-a-half Stars: high expectations that were not met
Summary: I am not sure why the average reviews for Disney’s Paradise Pier Hotel are so high.  Perhaps my expectations are too high after having been told time and time again that Disney is the litmus test for superior customer service.  I will say that my trip to the Paradise Pier Hotel was business related so perhaps that was part of the issue?  I don’t know.  We came to the hotel for a conference and got some of the Disney experience as a tertiary add-on.    CHECK IN/FRONT DESK: We arrived at the hotel extremely early (11:00am) and pre-registered.  I thought that they wouldn’t allow us to check-in, but the process was smooth.  They took our cell phone numbers so that they would be able to text us once our rooms were ready. Around 12:30 one person in the group received a text message

Summary Heading: Best Value of the Disney Properties
Summary: We wanted the extra's of the theme park view, conceirge service and early entry to the parks and this hotel provided at a much lower cost then Disney's other 2 properties. Our room was nice with a Surf Disney theme overlooking the Paradise Pier. We were told that it was grad night so to expect noise but we didn't hear a lot of loud noise with the windows closed. We watched the World of Color from our hotel room and it was nice to see from a different perspective. The property is located accross the street from the Disney Grand Californian and we were able to walk across the street and use the park entrance at that resort. The conceirge room had no windows so no view of the parks and did not have as much of a selection as the Disneyland Hotel conceirge. The Pool area had a big

The place isn't the fanciest hotel in the area but if you are going to stay at one of the Disney hotels this is a good choice if you get a concierge room with a theme park view. Room service isn't great but you get free snacks in the lounge and the view of the parks is pretty amazing. The price of the concierge is about the same as a standard room at the Grand Californian where the staff is horribly rude or a view room at the Disneyland hotel. (haven't been there since the remodel so I can't comment on that place)

The room was great with a great view of the park. (Room 1402)  I will kind of echo what one of the other reviewers stated that yes it is pricey but if you want extra magic hours everyday then it is worth it.  We have two little ones (6yr old and 4yr old) so the extra magic hours were worth it.  I will also say going through the lobby of the Grand Californian was very convenient.  We once left our room 1402 in the afternoon and made a fastpass for RSR in 15 minutes.  We only dined our property once, but we ate at both of the other Disney Hotels (Whitewater Snacks and Trader Sams).  Also, If anyone thinks the walk from Paradise Pier is long, I take it they have never been to WDW.  I have walked more to get to the bus stop at WDW than getting into the park at DL.  I would stay here

Summary Heading: except for the price, few complaints
Summary: large rooms with refrigerators, portacribs and irons in every closet, nice amenities. Great activities for kids...from a young kid friendly water slide, organized games at the pool, an arcade, a movie/tv room.  microwaves and condiments/supplies at the edge of the restaurant.  Many complimentary perks.  only downside was the price was much more than neighboring motels (except the rest of the "Disney" hotels) and the restaurant was a bit slow and could have had kid friendlier options.

From the time we checked in till the day we checked out everyone was very friendly.  The room was nice & clean.  The only thing we did not like was the A/C is on a motion sensor, so if your not in the room all day you come back to a hot room.  Or if you don't move during the night it gets hot.

Summary Heading: Was Okay for One Night....but, Overpriced.
Summary: We stayed for one night.  When we arrived early, about 11:30, we were told we would be paged when the room was ready and that was a little after 3:00 that we received the page while we were in the Park.  We had no trouble with leaving our car in the garage and proceeding to the Park for the day.  However, please know that you have to pay to park your car even if you are a guest at the hotel.  I understand this is a common practice...but, come on, the room was over $400 a night!!  This hotel just okay.  There is nothing fancy about it and it is obviously converted from some other hotel that was there long before Disney decided to expand.  We had a safe and a fridge in the room and that was good.  Bed was comfortable and the window opened slightly for fresh air.  Since we were

Summary Heading: Convenient and great perks...if you choose to use them.
Summary: We stayed at Paradise Pier the first week of June 2014.  I read many reviews prior to our stay and want to use this review to not just give you our experience but address many of the points previous folks have talked about.   First, the cost of the hotel.  Yes, it is pricey in relation to the Good Neighbor hotels.  In our minds, one must decide what is important to them.  I'll go on the assumption that you are staying at the hotel as part of a Disneyland vacation.  If you and your family are willing to get up early and utilize Extra Magic Hours (7am open for us, in line by ) getting on many favorite attractions with little or no wait and enjoying empty streets in the parks, then the cost of this hotel is likely worth it.  If you like being immersed in the Disney magic, being

We recently travelled to the States from Australia with our 3 children. We spent the 1st 8 nights of our trip down in Anaheim and stayed at the Paradise Pier. We loved this hotel, the room more than accommodated our family of 5 and the lounge that flipped down into a single bed was well received by our son. We chose to pay the extra and include the concierge level which included a theme park room, we were on the 14th floor and the view from the room of California Adventure was awesome! We could even see the World of Colour every night as well as the projected pictures in it. The concierge level was fantastic with a cold breakfast every morning, snacks throughout the day and a light hot snack bar at night with desserts and between 5-7pm was free beer and wine. Tabitha in the

We stayed in a park view room and were overall impressed with the Hotel.  We arrived at about 1 p.m. and stored our luggage and visited Disneyland for a few hours before returning for our room to be ready.  The room had a great view of the park and an excellent view of the World of Colour display at night.  The short cut to downtown Disney via the Grand California Hotel was handy and only a 10 minute walk had us in the parks.   We had a late flight out and on check-out day we stored our bags and the staff both at bell services and concierge were helpful with luggage and transport arrangements. We have previously stayed at the Sheraton Park which is also a good hotel and a bit cheaper, however the location and view from Paradise Pier is worth the extra if you're attending for a

The only advantage to staying at this hotel is the location and ability to enter the park an hour early.  You really don't "get what you pay for".  Although it is the lowest priced Disney hotel, the current rate for 2 nights at the hotel is $940! We really didn't experience the "friendly" service that other guests mentioned. I'm happy for the person who got an upgraded room.  I was told that the rooms were available, but it would cost an extra $40 a day. I declined.   We found that one of the men who worked at "Guest Services" was very ill suited for his job.  We felt that we were interrupting his time with his bell men buddies.  We rarely were greeted with a smile.  He truly did not want to be bothered with our inquiries.  Donnie was by far THE WORST CONCIERGE I have ever seen.

I live in Los Angeles and am a Disneyland Annual Passholder with a 3 1/2 year old son who LOVES Disneyland, so we make frequent trips to Disneyland. We find the best way to make use of our pass is to travel down on a Thursday night, enjoy the park for a few hours and then stay in a Disney hotel to take advantage of the magic hour/early admission as well as some other perks that Disney hotels typically offer (Fast passes, free 5x7 photos, AP hotel discounts, etc.)  We have typically only stayed at the DIsneyland hotel (our fave) or the Grand Californian but this time we decided to try Paradise Pier - since we were only staying for one night and were going to check in fairly late.  Here's what I will say - the service was typical Disney - which is to say, service with a smile and

We recently visited all three Disneyland Hotel properties. (I also have reviews for the Grand Californian and the Disneyland Hotel) Of the 3, Paradise Pier is known as more of a "value" resort, and that's pretty much what you get--Disney Magic that is a bit easier on your wallet!   Location-The location is very good, it took us about 5-10 minutes to get to the entrances of the parks, by cutting through the Grand Californian. The walk actually took us less time than from the Disneyland Hotel. The Downtown Disney shops and restaurants are nearby as well.  Pool- This is where we felt as though the "Disney Magic" was lacking the most. The pool is a roof-top style on the 3rd floor, and is basically just a rectangle, with no charm. There is a small water slide my 7 y/o daughter

Summary Heading: Great location, lacking a little disney charm
Summary: Room was nice, cutely done in the beach theme, and we had decent view of California Adventure. Disney details have been added, but a little more should be done. Pool is too small for a hotel of this size and the pool area could use a little more "magic". Overall the hotel is nice enough, considering it wasn't built by Disney, but you are paying a premium to stay "on property". From our room on the 5th floor it was about 10 minutes or so to get into a park and be in line for your first attraction or shopping in downtown Disney, a treat for those of us used to Disney World. Getting into the parks early is worth staying here, really. We did learn to use the stairs in the morning to avoid the elevator lines,  (an easy descent) but we had no elevator issues in the afternoons or

We have stayed at all three of the Disney Resort Hotels, and must say that Paradise Pier is one of our favorites. Being a little farther from the parks and the other Disney resorts, it's a bit more quiet. And yet, it's a very short walk to Downtown Disney and 5 minutes or less to the Grand Californian where as a Disney resort guest you can enter California Adventure Park through the Grand Californian.   The rooms are a good size and very clean and comfortable. The beach theme is very cute and happy! Front desk is super helpful and friendly. The little gift shop off the lobby has a lot of good things in it and is fun to browse through.  My only complaint was the Concierge Desk. Other times we have stayed at the Paradise Pier, the concierge has been very helpful, but this time

With a toddler we decided we wanted to stay at one of the Disney hotels but we didn't want to spend a fortune either.  This was a great location and a great price.  The lobby and the rooms looked like they were recently decorated.  Really cute beach theme.  We had the upgraded view which was worth it.  We looked right over California Adventure and it was even better at night.  We were able to watch the World of Color from our room with the music coming though the tv.  My daughter loved it. The pool was really small but we only used it the one day we didn't go to the parks - the afternoon we arrived.  We were at the parks the rest of the time but walking back for nap time was great.  We thought this was a great price and location but we might go a little more luxurious next time

yes, i know it costs more but for the money you get two words - early entry.   1 hour early each day to where you are already paying a ton of money to get into.   plan on walking onto any ride multiple times before the crowds show up and you will be glad you did it.   wife and kids thanked me every morning - yours will too.   package delivery is a nice service from any store in mouse land.   5-7 minute walk to entrance.   watch out for cabs over at the grand californian as they don't always take the quick route.   $18 to angle stadium $12 return.   only complaint was food service for a pbj to go 15 minutes.

For someone looking to stay on Disney property, while still watching the budget, this is a great choice.  You can splurge and book concierge level, or just pay extra to have a room that faces the park (great for watching World of Color).  It is close enough to walk to the park, plus it gives the extra benefits, such as extra magic hour (enter the park one hour early each morning).  Definitely a great place to stay, if you plan on spending a lot of time at the Disneyland Resort.

Summary Heading: Fantastic base for Disneyland with children
Summary: We stayed here back in March for a spring break trip on a discounted internet rate.  While it was really pushing the top of our budget, we are planning to go back to Disneyland within the next year and we will stay here again we loved it so much.  We drove out from Colorado with our two small children, aged 5 and 3 and stayed in a standard size room with the upgraded view of DCA.  From the moment we checked into the hotel, we felt we were part of the Disney magic.  Yes, the rooms are a little small, but they are very clean and having the refrigerator was a lifesaver.  The beds were very comfortable and the room seemed pretty soundproof.  Given how little time we spent in our room, there was nothing at all lacking in the room.  But, the benefits of staying here are not about the

Just returned from 4 nights.  I was traveling for a work convention, and my husband and son accompanied to visit Disneyland and DCA.  Staff was quite friendly, providing my son with balloons and autographed pictures of buzz, woody, and Mickey and pals at check in.  We had a theme park view room on the 7th floor.  It was fun to look out over the park and see a good portion of world of color.    We also enjoyed the restaurants. The cafe was good for a quick coffee and pastry in the morning.  We also ate at Surf's Up for a character breakfast and a late dinner.  Breakfast was good with a nice variety on the buffet.  Delicious fruit and smoothies for some yummy healthy choices. Character interaction was wonderful.  They spent a lot of time with the kids and even did dance parties.

We are WDW vets who just returned from a 4 night stay...and we loved it!!!  Fantastic family friendly hotel with Disney/California theming, terrific concierge lounge and services, wonderful staff, lovely rooms and a fun pool.  All for the best prices on Disneyland property.  Walking to both parks was super convenient (just through the neighboring Grand Californian).  We were doing some special celebrating (birthdays and 25th Anniversary!) and were treated to a heart of rose petals and treats in our room.  What an amazing place!!

Summary Heading: Perfect stay for two young adults
Summary: My husband is deploying soon so he spoiled me with a trip to Disneyland and we used the military discount and stayed here. What an amazing experience. The staff was always nice and helpful and the room was perfect. We stayed on the 7th floor with a view of the park. We thought with the discount it was reasonably priced but if they take away the armed forces salute we will stay across the street.

When our little girl got sick eating at Ariels Grotto, the hotel staff was very supportive even sending balloons and a small stuffy to the room to cheer her up.  The Staff here is very very good.  Pool is small, and the Hot tub can only accommodate 6-7 adults.  We stayed on the concierge service floors, and although handy because of the unlimited snacking, the food is basically all junk food (muffins, pastries, cookies and chips) so not really very good for you or the kids.  I would recommend staying here as it is far enough away from the park to be quiet but close enough to allow multiple trips to and from the park.

Summary Heading: Excellent location, hot tub overcrowed, excellent staff
Summary: Quiet room.  Excellent location.  Do not go for the character dining -total waste of money.  Excellent staff.  magical time in disneyland.  excellent trip!!!  Staff super nice!  Walked 10 miles per day at disneyland.  felt like home.  hot tub full of kids and adults.  Wanted to soak after all that walking, but kids splashing water.

Summary Heading: Rooftop Vantage Point --- Just the One Aspect
Summary: (September 25 - October 7, 2013)  Traveling with my Hula Halau Sisters and my brother, all of us were thoroughly were pleasantly delighted when we arrived to the Paradise Pier.  The proximity to the Parks presented a nice walk through Downtown Disney, whether starting in the early morning or returning to the hotel as the Parks closed.  In the morning, everything was in its place, clean and fresh; upon returning back to the hotel --- the bright, colorful lights ushered us through, reminding us of what a wonderful day we just enjoyed.  The hotel itself, with its beachfront boardwalk theme was loaded with all the Disney touches one would expect --- which is a tickle to be greeted with.  Goofy and his surfboard just sets the mood for a great time.  The cast members at every venue

Let me start off by disclosing that I'm a Disney snob. I have visited the resort in Orlando hundreds of times.   The Paradise Pier lacked the Disney magic you feel in the Orlando resort.  The staff were not friendly, not even offering celebration buttons upon check in.  The outstanding staff were the bell hops, who helped in getting me a cab every day.    The room itself was a basic hotel room with two queen beds, and the typical Disney- hidden mickey decor.  Spacious.  Amazing view from the 9th floor of Disney's California Adventure park.  And the TV has a channel to pump in the music for World of Color water show at night.  The fireworks from Disneyland we're also visible from the room.  The room was very clean.   The hotel itself was a short walk through the Grand Californian

We stayed for spring break. Great place we had us and our 3 kids in our room. Plenty of room for everyone. Nice amenities.  Pool and hot tub were a bit on the cold side. We didn't go to the hotel restaurant it was expensive. But we brought our own and the room has a mini fridge. However it's not all that big so choose carefully on what you bring.  Good hotel for the price.

Summary Heading: Excellent room but check all details with them!
Summary: The room, location and service were excellent during our one night stay but make sure you check everything with them before you book and before you arrive. We booked a Disneyland specific hotel so we could enjoy the "magic hour" the next morning. We arrived at 7pm to discover that the park was closing at 9 (3 hours early!) due to a graduates event that night, this made day 1 of our tickets useless as we had planned for 4-5 hours in the park that night. We were then told the park was opening 6am-6am the following day for a special event so we couldn't get the magic hour anymore. We still spent 13 hours there that day but were disappointed we couldn't spread the time out over the 2 days anymore and that we didn't get the benefits of being a hotel guest. We could have saved

My husband and I stayed here May 17th thru the 23rd. We started in a standard room, but was upgraded to a suite the next day. Pixie dust for sure!!!! The standard room was ok. It was a bit outdated and it really showed. We found a glass case behind the curtain, so we know housekeeping does not move the curtains to vacuum. I don't really like the the sink is in the same area as the tub and toilet, but it works. It was just small and cramped. The next day when we moved to the suite, was magical. We had a living room, formal dining room, kitchen with a microwave, full stainless steal refrigerator, kurig coffee pot, a standard bathroom, bedroom with a sofa and a master bath.  Everything was so clean. Maid service everyday cleaned everything. We tested by putting something behind the

Friendly staff, clean rooms & convenient to the Disney parks.  Recommendation: Care for a breakfast buffet and meet several characters? All the Disney locations require reservations for this experience and it's not cheap! However, we were probably 3rd or 4th in line at the buffet, and the food had been out long enough that even with the heat lamps, didn't seem as good as it could have been. Ever attend a buffet and when you bite into their specialty item you know it instantly? The breakfast buffet specialty at this hotel is the opportunity to meet several characters; not the food. Oh! And care to have a professional photo? It's over $30 for a packet of the same pose. No options. All or none. (I went with none.)  Have any questions about the Disney experience or need directions?

DIsney's Paradise Pier was  clean with very comfy beds,and in room fridge  I suggest, buy  bottled water, they don't have complimenatry water in the room. I didn't find the elevators overly slow considering there are so many people in the hotel, what do you expect??  The whirlpool on the other hand was discusting with every diaper kid in it ,even though  the sign read No children without a parent  may be in it ,many were in it. Kinda wish there was one that parents could relax in with out the thought of  soggy diapers in it.The poolbar was out of site from the pool so make sure you go to the lower deck and around the corner, the bartender was very lonely down there,there are no signs saying Bar here with an arrow? Drinks are average 10-14 depending on what you drink.  They

This was a great place to stay. We had a beautiful view of California Adventure, including the fountain show. It was great that we could actually listen to the music for the show through a tv channel in the hotel. The cast members were so nice. Everything was close by. I would definitely recommend staying here.

This was our first time staying at a Disney hotel and boy was it worth it. The staff was amazingly friendly and the rooms were super clean. We used the short cut through the grand Californian that led you out by Sephora in downtown Disney. The stuffed balls were great entertainment for the kids and the couch that folds out into a bed was great to allow the kids sleep separately.

If you are making Disneyland a once in a lifetime trip stay in a Disney hotel. The early morning hours perk is worth it. Getting not the park early is invaluable! the hotel is good, nothing to blow your socks off but perfect as a base. We literally slept in the room. The room is big and very nicely decorated.  Get a VONS breakfast order in for when you arrive. It saves a massive amount of time trying to find breakfast in the morning. The hotel is close and my boys 5 and 7 had no problem walking to the park. We never used the pool so have no comment on it. Overall fab stay.

My experience here was far from good.  Horrible customer service throughout our stay. Very unhelpful staff overall. They didn't explain the early access to the park or tell us about any of the hotel amenities, ie pool, breakfast, cafe, gift shop, or children's area (which smelled of vomit so no loss there). I will not return nor will I recommend this hotel to others.  For the price, I expected much more. At the least a balloon for my son at check in after watching 6 other children get them.

For a  1-night/2-day trip to Disney this was an ideal property. Staff were great, the room was nicely laid out, decent size bathroom. Definitely get a room with a view over DCA as the World of Color is a great show especially if your kids are exhausted after a day's adventure in one of the parks.  The best thing about staying at either of the 3 hotels is the magic hour entrance. We made good use of this at DCA by getting in right at 8am and riding Radiator Springs Racers within the first 20 minutes. Next time though I think we'd pay a bit more and stay at the Grand Californian as it's is right on the park and handy via its dedicated entrance to DCA if you ever wanted to go back to your room for a rest or the hotel for a swim etc. during the day.

I have now stayed at both the Paradise Pier and Disneyland Hotel and feel that it maybe cheaper but just as good.  The location is close to Downtown Disney and you can use the guest entry into California Adventure Park from The Grand Californian right across the road, it is also a short walk to some cheaper Resturants out on the main road. We arrived well before normal check in time (11am) and we got our room right away.  The only problem we had with our room was it was by an out door exit, and who would really want to walk down 11 flights of stairs at 4am in the morning but we think some health nut that left the door swinging and in the wind it would bang.  It was painful to wake up with a door banging and have to get up to fix it before getting back to sleep again.  The staff

Having stayed at Paradise Pier and several "Main Gate" hotels/motels, we have found the service and amenities worth the additional cost at Paradise Pier. You get what you pay for. The room was quiet, well appointed with Disney themes, and very clean as well as conscientious service provided by the staff. We spent the extra money and got a room with a park view (of California Adventure) and found it both entertaining and exciting: worth the extra expense. Also, you can watch the Disneyland fireworks from the pool area and, if you get park view, you can watch World of Color from your room.

This was the least expensive of our three Disney Resort choices, but we did not feel in any way like a "poorer cousin" on this trip!  We were treated very well by staff.  Check in was easy and fun.  The rooms were clean, beautiful, and whimsical.  The view of the park was exciting, and considering the view (of the roller coaster in California Adventure) it was very quiet.  This hotel is just a short walk from Downtown Disney which is delightful to stroll through as you anticipate your entrance into the parks, and is also a nice transition from the parks back to the hotel.  You are just steps away from The Grand, which you can walk through to enter California Adventure.  I loved the way our hotel smelled like sun tan lotion (very subtle) and the beach ball pillows!  I just wish

Paradise pier located across from The Grand Californian and California Adventure.  We arrive early so we can check in and go to Disneyland. We check our bags and pre register. They said they would text us when our room was ready. Well later around 2:30 we go back to check since they never texted and check in is at 3:00. Well our room wasn't ready. We waited and waited. They told us the king room we had requested was not available but since we had to wait so long they were giving us a suite with a good view.  Finally after 4:00 we got out room.  It had a fantastic view of California Adventure. We got 2 queen beds which were smaller than a normal queen. So if you are tall it is a bit small.  We did pay a little more to take advantage of the club floor which I strongly suggest. It

Summary Heading: Too expensive of course, but we had a nice stay
Summary: Like all of the properties owned by Disney, this hotel is too expensive.  I mean its not even as nice as a typical hotel, yet they charge $300 a night.  That said, its the cheapest Disney hotel near Disneyland and we had a nice stay.  The staff was attentive, checkin was quick.  They brought our luggage to our room.    As Annual Passholders at the time we got a nice deal (call and ask) and also THREE express passes which we of course used for Radiator Springs and saved us a LOT of time.  We got a nice room with a view of the World of Color show, though its the back side and you won't get the full effect and its still pretty far away.  Still, we turned the TV to channel 17 and listened to the audio one night and quite enjoyed it.  This hotel is farther away that any of the

Summary Heading: Clean, nicely decorated, but nothing special
Summary: I booked this hotel at double the price of close-by "good neighbor" hotels for 3 reasons: extra "magic hour" each morning, close to the Grand Californian's private entrance for Disney Resort guests, and the Disney bubble experience.  While we did like the hotel, I don't think it was worth twice the price of neighboring hotels and we will not stay there again.  This was our 6 year old son's first time at Disneyland and our first time as adults so we opted not to rent a car; we thought it would be worth spending a bit more to eat/breathe/sleep Disney for the 3 days we were there.  We had a great time on our trip even though it was packed, but the hotel had nothing to do with that.  (Although I suppose a bad hotel experience could have made it a bad trip, it didn't do that either.)

I made reservations for two separate room to accommodate our family of 6.   We stayed at Paradise Pier Hotel May 6 - 9, 2014.  We arrived early to the hotel (8a), the rooms were not ready but we didn't expect they would be this early.  The staff was friendly and professional.  We were given our keys and told that we would receive a text when the rooms were ready so we headed for the park.  We received a text around 1p that our rooms were ready and given our room numbers.  When we arrived to the hotel we went directly to our rooms to find beautifully updated, CLEAN and spacious rooms.  We had park-view rooms and the view was to die for.  We called for our luggage and it arrived within 5 minutes.  The rooms had mini refrigerators and coffee makers.  The bathroom had toiletries,

Summary Heading: Loved everything at the Disney Paradise Pier except for the elevator wait :(
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in April of 2012. I could not think of one thing at the hotel that I did not like there except the rooms were a little pricey. In 2013 we went to Disney World and stayed at the Disney Caribbean Beach hotel and did not have the best time at that hotel :( We went back to Disneyland in 2014 and decided to try the Paradise Pier since it was quite a bit cheaper. The hotel was very clean, in a great location, friendly workers and the standard rooms were huge! The pool was so nice and everything we ate at the resteraunts was perfect. My only complaint was the very, very slow elevators. We stayed for a week in the beginning of February and it was not very crowded but still the wait was very long almost all day. We took the steps many times

We were visiting California Adventure for my son's birthday and instead of staying at our regular (cheaper) motel just outside of the park, decided to splurge at a Disney Hotel for one night.  The Grand Californian was way out of our budget but Paradise Pier was reasonably priced.  This was our first time taking the kids to a Disney Hotel and based on the service, quality and "magical" touches, we'll probably be coming back!  First off, because we wanted to head to CA Adv early, the staff was able to pre-check us in so we could receive our Magic Key Cards (allows us Magic Morning access and special delivery of all purchases to our hotel room)  Every one in our family received a personal card -- even the kids, which was so cool! Timothy, at the front desk was extremely helpful

We live about 35 miles from Disneyland and California Adventure, have Premier Passports and visit the parks, restaurants and hotels frequently.   Attending a wedding near Disneyland on a Saturday with nearby post wedding family obligations on the Sunday made staying at one of the hotels a convenient break between the two events.  We priced Disneyland Hotel, Grand Californian, and Paradise Pier and selected paradise Pier partly because of the lower (but still expensive) rate, and because we had never stayed here before, but often stay at the Grand Californian.  Parking was very easy and we parked literally right near the hotel entrance on the same level. The circular registration area is tucked into a corner - it looks very casual and welcoming. The staff were very friendly upon

Summary Heading: truely is a paradise and happiest place on earth
Summary: We stayed as family off 4 from australia in august 2013 Oh My Goodness it is truely wonderful you feel like your the only guest in the hotel and its not even the most luxuious off the disney resort properties ,Highly recomend this Hotel ,I actually got ill while I was there and they were wonderful that is for sure ,if living your dream and comming to disneyland it is well worth the extra exspense to recieve such wonderful service from Disney califorina can not wait to return in 2015

We have stayed here multiple times.  Most recently in September 2013 and April 2014.  We have three children and the five of us fit comfortably in the rooms.  The sofa folds open to a bed- these sofa beds are much more comfortable than the old ones.  In September we stayed on the 12th floor and had a view room-that was awesome because you can see World of Color from your room and listen to the music on the TV.  In April 2014, we opted to stay on a lower floor closer to the pool- we still had a bit of a view, but could not see World of Color.  Convenience of staying at a Disney hotel includes:  Magical Mornings- (definitely worth it if you are going during a busy time), special entrance to CA Disney only for hotel guests, close access to downtown Disney.  Disney hotel also had

Because this was a Disneyland property... perhaps my standards were too high.  But honestly, I was expecting more.  The room was clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful.  The beds were comfortable.   The room service was acceptable.   But the eating options were limited.  The pool was nothing special.  The elevators are the slowest and smallest I've ever seen in a hotel.  You wouldn't think speed and size of elevators would be a huge problem, but when hundreds of folks are trying to get to the park when it opens, it's a big deal.  We ended up taking the stairs EVERY MORNING.  The best part about this hotel was the close location to the park, and the ability to get into the park early for an extra magic hour because it's a Disney property.  But if you want

Summary Heading: For a Disney hotel it's disappointing
Summary: I had never stayed at the Paradise Pier but due to the military discounts Disney offers I got to stay for a 40% discount. I must say that even at a discounted price this hotel is nothing to rave about.  It is the farthest walk from the parks, the rooms are ridiculously small, the pool area is not impressive, the parking situation left a lot to be desired, and there really wasn't much to do there. The worst by far is the elevator situation. Each floor had an elevator but it was one where you had so many people trying to get down to the lobby at once that if you were lucky enough to get an empty one, or partially empty, you had to ride all the way to the top before going back down. On the way up and on the way down you also had to stop on every single floor. It took me an extra

Summary Heading: Great Location, Friendly Staff and Magic Mornings...
Summary: The staff of the hotel is very accommodating, friendly and professional. The location of the hotel provides easy access to both the Magic Kingdom and California Adventures Park, with a private entrance for hotel guests next door at the Grand Californian for California Adventures. Our room was a 'Premium View' room, this meant we were on the 9th floor on the Park side. The location allowed a view of "World of Colors" each night, during which we were able to have the music piped in over our television.  The room, 918, was large and comfortable, being a unique floor plan that is duplicated only once on each floor. We had two large comfortable queen beds and a couch that flipped into a bed for our daughter. This was not an ordinary sleeper that pulls out, but a couch that the back

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for entering the parks early
Summary: My husband and I spent our last valentines day weekend here. It was the first time to Disneyland for both of us. We chose this hotel for the proximity to the parks and for the fact that we could enter the parks an hour early each day. -Service: The customer service here was very good. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was cleaned daily with cute new disney chocolates on our bed each day.  -Accommodations: The best part about our room was that it overlooked the parks, which was pretty at night. The room itself was spacious enough, but a bit dated, and we found the bed to be uncomfortable. We could hear lots of noises from people in the halls and our neighbors in the rooms next to us, which was difficult when we were trying to sleep. The bathroom was also dated with a

Summary Heading: Better than expected on some fronts
Summary: I am a Disney annual passholder and have previously stayed at the Grand Californian and the Disneyland hotel.  I stayed here in May 2014 just to check it off and experience it.  Also my family and I wanted to partake in the fastpass offer for annual passholders which was a great perk.  Pros: - Our family LOVED the theme in the rooms.  Disney lamps, beach colors, beautiful desk, beach ball pillows, colorful bathrooms and signage - Right across the street from the Grand Californian hotel - Nice restaurant for breakfast - Rooms were very clean and I was able to get up to my room an hour before check-in. - Nice gift shop on site.  Cons: - It is very true to say this hotel has a Holiday-Inn type feel to it.  You will not find such a minimal front desk on any other Disney properties

Summary Heading: Theme park view suite with concierge
Summary: Stayed in a suite with a theme view and concierge. I stayed on the 11 th floor. Fabulous view, there is nothing to complain about its perfect! The suite is a decent size but I have stayed at a hojo queen suite that I believe was larger. The housekeeping was great as was the response to my request that out DVD player wasn't working, it was fixed within 15 min. When the hotel is packed the elevators are very slow. If this is an issue for you then ask to stay on a lower floor for access to the stairs. Concierge was nice but I'm unsure whether I would do it again. One concierge person wouldn't allow us to take more than one alcohol drink up to our room (I was trying to get one for my spouse so as to not make two trips) however the next night there was a different attendant who did.

Summary Heading: My Stay At Disney Paradise Pier
Summary: I stay at this hotel from March 24- March 29th. I went with my three kids and my mom. I booked through a travel agent with Disney. We arrived at LAX and rode the Disneyland express which seemed like it took forever to come pick us up. Once we got to the hotel there wasn't a line to check in in fact we went right up to the desk. It was almost like noone was there but only because everyone was at the parks. Check in was very smooth and quick. They gave my kids each a balloon which they loved! I thought that was really nice. I got a one bedroom suite on the 12th floor room 1222. I really liked the suite it was perfect for us. The room had a half bath off from the living room and a bathroom next to the bedroom.
