It also had a dining table, microwave and refrigerator. We had a awesome

One of the best things about staying at the paradise pier is its location. It's perfect because of its proximity to the Disneyland Park and Islands of Adventure, which are 5-7 minutes away by walk and also it's proximity to the restaurants and cafés around town. The staff are wonderful and really friendly. The rooms are spacious and very very comfy. When booking a room at the Paradise Pier, make sure you ask for one which has a view of the Disneyland Park. The view of the park during sunrise and at night are simply mind-blowing! Especially at nights when there are special events at the park that involve fireworks!! Bottom line, a wonderful place to stay at and not very expensive as well.

We have stayed at both gone Grand California and DisneyLand Resort so decided this trip we'd give the Paradise Pier a try-very impressive.  The walk to and from the parks is a tiny longer than from the Grand California but it's Disney-there is walking required! The rooms are the biggest for all three of the resorts and it has a true theme-beach/boardwalk throughout the decorations.  Hidden Mickey faces are all over the hotel and my daughter of course loved finding those as well as the real sized beach ball pillows on each bed! The pools are a bit lacking and we have had very strong winds this trip which apparently this area is not used to-so the water slide, pool bar and pool umbrellas were closed/not in use-bummer.  We upgraded to the concierge level-well worth it for a family.

Summary Heading: Well we did it , we stayed in a Disney hotel!
Summary: When we decided to make our first visit to Disneyland we wanted to make the most of it but there is so much advice out there about where to stay. We looked at every option and finally decided on the Paradise Pier. We believe we made a very good choice after a four day stay. We chose the package with the park passes and the concierge park view room. When we arrived the room was not ready but they checked us in and gave us all we needed to get into the parks and we were allowed to check our baggage and park our car. When we returned we were shown to room 1500 on the top floor.......absolutely amazing , the view was right over the California Park so you could see sunrise , the World of color , sunset.....! The Beach Comber Breeze on the 2nd floor has day long goodies included in

We booked based on getting the 1 hour early access into Disneyland.   Extremely disappointed and will never stay here again because: - no Wifi access during our stay, despite me speaking to managers, front desk people and the IT help desk (the answer is you can't get wifi in some of the floors at all, and it is a known problem that has not been addressed!) - early access means only SOME of the park is open, as well as you need to line up with the other 2,000 people from the 3 Disney hotels - dated hotel including poor lifts - after 1 night they moved us to a different room to try the wifi there. Not only still zero wifi, but ey lost one of our small bags in the move!  Save your money and stay at a cheaper park within walking distance

Summary Heading: Great place to be, walk to everything!
Summary: We booked everything (Air, park tickets and room) through Disney so I have no idea if this hotel is a good value or not but it did seem a bit pricey. BUT I can say it was clean, the staff is typical Disney (they do everything in their power to make you happy) and there are multiple places to eat, drink and basically do whatever you want within walking distance. You can walk to Cars Land and to the Downtown Disney Area where you can catch the monorail to Disneyland. No car necessary for the 5 day trip we were on. Walking to everything saved aggravation and a lot of waiting i'm sure.  Great place to stay in my opinion.

Summary Heading: First Time not staying at a good neighbor motel
Summary: We are new Disney Vacation Club members and this is first experience staying at a Disney property. We normally stay at a good neighbor motel. We loved it! The room was really nice, big and clean. We had a non park. It was still nice! My only complaint is that the shower head could be a little better(I'm sure that has to do with SoCal water restrictions) We will defiantly stay here again!

Summary Heading: A dated Disney hotel that is dramatically overpriced.
Summary: The location of this hotel is great though not much better than off site hotels. The hotel was very clean and comfortable as one would expect of a Disney hotel but the price is a bit ridiculous. Save your money and stay with a nationally branded chain nearby.

This hotel was average at best for me.  You can not get a hot breakfast before 7:30 unless you order room service. The hotel room itself was clean but very basic. You can hear your neighbors and anything else in the hallway.  You can tell this hotel is older and has been kept nice. The carpets are nice throughout the hotel. The gym is good and has most things you will need.  The elevators are so slow. In the mornings it can take up to 7-10 mins to get downstairs or up. Everyone is so frustrated. Do not take the elevator that stands alone. It got stuck and reset itself each time on the 5th floor.  It does this so often we just couldn't believe it.      You can walk to downtown disney in 5 minutes or less. You are close to everything which is great. I was traveling for a business

The ONLY reason we booked at this hotel was to take advantage of the Extra magic hour at the Disney Park. We could have stayed at the best Western Stovall for $113 a night but decided to pay the $400 a night instead. NOT worth it. What Disney doesn't put on it's web site, nor does the Paradise Pier, is that the extra magic hour is for one section of the park only. Fantasy Land. Sometimes Tomorrow land will be open too. However all other sections are still closed. So you are still stuck waiting inline for the favorite rides, especially if you are visiting during the busy months. Which is every month except Sept- Oct-Nov. The hotel is run down. The elevators can't handle a full capacity hotel. We ended up taking the stairs every single day. The pool area was just sad. Small pool,

The hotel is 5 minutes from both Disney attractions and the and the staff service what you would expect from the Disney experience, happy helpfuln and always in attendance. The wifi is free and strong which is a big plus for us as this is a bi consideration for my family. The hotel breakfast is good but pricey, however they have abudget offering at the cafe which ooens early so you can take advantage of the early opening at the attractions.

This hotel is very nice, the room is really comfortable.  Restaurants are cool ! Food is great my kids loved their pizza, and they also have a nice snack bar with coffee and danish. The store has lots of Disney stuff, the water park is great for kids !!!  We liked very much that the hotel was very close to disneyland park and california adventure.it was great that we could have an extra hour at the parks. We really enjoyed our stay at Paradise Pier.

I think it was a bit over priced but it is Disney so its kind of expected. Over all things were ok, but when we went to leave there were extra charges on our bill. Took sometime to figure out. In the end I guess since we had said it was our first time staying with them they tried to send something to the room. There were room service charges and we never got what they were trying to send. Kinda sad because having a special something extra for staying there our first time would've made it even more "magical" to my kids. Sadly I guess we'll never get our "first time stay" gift. It took a few extra hours to figure out their screw up and we weren't even compensated. Glad we were driving and didn't have a plane to catch. Make sure to check your bill closely.

One of the best visits I've had. No complaints about the room or hotel.  Staff were great and very help full. The room had great view and very clean. And exceeded my expectations.  It was a short walk to the park which my wife was happy after a long day.

We had a view over looking the California adventure park which was great as we watched the water show at night. The staff were great 10 min walk to disneyland. Everything you need is in this hotel. You must get the room with a view although it is quite expensive you will enjoy it.

The Paradise Pier is essentially an overpriced version of a Holiday Inn.  The rooms are ok, but nothing special.  We had a non-functioning thermostat which I reported at the start of our 4 day stay.  It was still non-functioning when we checked out.  The hotel is convenient to the Disney Attractions and occupancy gives you access to a special gate into California Adventure..  The decision to stay here depends on how much you are wiling to spend to be within close walking distance of the Disney Attractions.

Having spent several week long vacations at Disney World, I was not sure what to expect for our first trip to Disneyland.  I knew that Disneyland would be a very different experience and I did not have high expectations.  I have to say I was pleasantly surprised!  We booked a Premium View Room with Concierge Service (room 1418).  The view was outstanding!  Our room was on the 14th floor with a sweeping view of California Adventure.  It was such a treat to look out at the beautiful park and listen to the happy screams of riders as they braved, California Screamin'.  Best of all, we had a spectacular view of the nighttime show, World Of Color.  Our room had 2 full sized beds, a sleeper sofa, work desk and armoire which contained a small fridge and safe.   The room was clean, roomy

Summary Heading: Stay at the Paradise Pier and extend your visit to the Happiest Place on Earth...
Summary: The only reason Paradise Pier doesn't rate excellent overall is the price; this fun, family-friendly hotel (although less expensive than the Grand California) will definitely put a dent in your budget. However, the perks, starting with the location, make it a great choice for any stay at Disneyland and California Adventure!  The hotel is breezy fun from the moment you enter the lobby and are greeted by a surfing Goofy. The rooms are delightful and the beach-y theme is constant throughout the property. We've stayed at PP six times and our rooms have all been comfy, clean and well maintained. With excited kids of all ages, it can be a little noisy at night but hey, you're at Disneyland right?!  My grandkids love the pool area, complete with a well-guarded water slide, "pool party"

Just returned from a 4 night stay with our 7 year old and 1 year old sons.  We arrived at 11:30am and checked in immediately.  We stayed in room 1200 which had a terrific view of California Adventure.  The good: pretty much everything.  The hotel room was adequate (maybe the bathroom could have been bigger) but the view was incredible.  Suggestion- book through Expedia as I think all their reservations are for Upper Level Theme park views.  The hotel had a small arcade and theater room which was fine for our kids and the pool was great---- not as big as the other Disney hotel pools but even during a busy week with temperatures over 90 degrees it didn't seem too crowded.  I read so many reviews about the elevator problems and I have to say they are greatly exaggerated--- they

We checked in April 6th. We got their early and had to wait which was a real bummer, but expected. Other than that it was perfect!  I was expecting some cuter soaps and shampoo bottles. When we visited Disney in Florida, we had cuter stuff.  But everything else was wonderful. The pool was really nice!   The room was wonderful. We shared with my son, daughter in law and 3 year old granddaughter. We had two queen beds and a day bed which was perfect for our granddaughter.  The staff were all very, very nice. Everyone called our granddaughter princess. It was great. If we ever go to Disneyland again we would go there again!

Hotel is nice and location is super! Staff are also v efficient - she managed to get us a room when we arrived at 9am even though check-in was supposed to be after 3pm.  One major downside - hotel does not provide drinking water so you have to buy your own.

Summary Heading: 1 star for some, 5 star for other reasons
Summary: It really could have gone either way, but today turned it into a 5 star rating for customer service.    First, the bad.  For three days, I thought that any hotel who couldn't regulate shower temperature for a 10 minute shower deserved 1 star.  The shower changed temperatures every couple of minutes and it was a small nuissance, but if Hilton properties can do it, Disney properties can do it too!  Second, folks always complain about the cost of Disney and we are no different - without my husband's work bringing us here, we would have spent vacation money elsewhere (there are no lines to hike the rainforest in Costa Rica), but we thought we'd give it a try.    We absolutely loved the character breakfast the hotel offered.  We went at 7 a.m. two days and our toddler and baby had a

We didn't think the extra walk from The Grand to Paradise was a big deal.  We enjoyed our room with a view but the elevator situation was sometimes a wait and crowded. Also the concierge lounge was crowded at times.  For the price I think we would definitely try it again I'd in the area.

We stayed here for two nights last week.  We were on the 7th floor.  The room was a little cramped with 2 adults and 2 teenagers, but it was quiet and the location was fantastic.  It was even quiet during our rest time in the afternoon. We will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and get in early
Summary: Rooms are good size and we fit four comfortably.  Frig.  5 minute walk to downtown Disney.  5 or so to California adventure, 10 to disneyland. Get in an hour early to both dependent on day- the only way to get on the Cars ride without waiting.  Pool area is nice.

Paradise Pier is not like other "luxury" Disney hotels that we stayed in (and the price and advertising clearly reflect that). However, the staff were super helpful and friendly. The welcome we received was lovely. The room was cheerful, clean and charmingly Disney. The restaurants were fine too. If you are looking for luxury, look elsewhere. If you are looking for a charming, clean room with a quick walk to the parks (5-7 min to DCA and less than 10 to DL with 2 little kids) Paradise Pier is the way to go.

Stayed here last week for 2 nights. Arrived and the front desk had 2 signed photos for our kids. Disney knows how to do it right. Was told we could see some of the fireworks show from the pool area so that was cool as well. The room was spacious (5th floor) We had 2 queen beds and a pullout. Loved the beach theme of the rooms. TV's had plenty of Disney stuff on for the kids while we were in the room. Loved the fact that we could get in to California Adventure by walking through one of the other hotels. Total walking time from room to parks was about 10 minutes. The only things I did not care for at this hotel was the bed. It was pretty hard to me. The other thing was the time it took to get an elevator to stop at your floor. We waited a good 10 minutes one morning for one to

Summary Heading: Paid for the Disney name, but didn't receive Disney quality.
Summary: We are premium annual pass holders and decided for this trip to try out Disney's Parsdise Pier. We have stayed at various hotels in the Disneyland area, our last hotel being Disneyland Hotel in November. Disney's Paradise Pier is not in the same caliber as either the Disneyland hotel or the Grand CA. I would even venture out to say this hotel is no better than the Dessert Inn and Suites located across the street from Disneyland. Upon arriving via taxi after flying we were not greeted by bell hop, it was too early to get into our room, so we checked in and was told to see the bell desk to check our luggage to hold. We were told by the front desk that we would receive a text when our room was ready. We thought great we walked over to the park. We did not hear from the hotel until

My husband and I stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights.  The room was comfortable with 2 queen size beds.  There was a refrigerator big enough to keep bottled water, lunch meat, and other things. The hotel was quiet for the most part.  We did not care for the amount of kid's in the hot tub.  The hotel itself is walking distance to California Adventure Park.

Summary Heading: A nice hotel if a bit pricey!
Summary: My family and I recently stayed at the Paradise Pier Resort during a visit to Disneyland. The hotel was okay for our stay however it was not to the standard we have come to expect from a Disney property. We have been spoiled by WDW properties and the guest services there.  One of the biggest drawbacks was the overpriced restaurant within the hotel itself.  The character breakfast left a lot to be desired. We had to wait almost 20 minutes even with a reservation! Not to mention that it was very overpriced. It was the only option at the hotel!

Summary Heading: The extra hour makes it worth it
Summary: We stayed as a family of 4, concierge with no view.  We loved our room.  It had a balcony that went right to the pool.  The concierge snacks, saved us time and money in the park.  Getting the extra magic hour in the parks for staying at a disney resort was worth the extra $ the disney hotels cost.  We could do more rides in an hour than we could do the rest of the day.

Summary Heading: Large Room, Great View, Dare I say worth the price!
Summary: As part of Dapper Day weekend in February, we were able to get a discounted room for Grand Californian for Friday night but they were sold out for Saturday night. So I got the annual pass spring special for Paradise Pier for the only room type they had available: Concierge Park View level on the 14th floor. This was a total of about 400 for the night. I know that sounds crazy. But to be honest for what we got, it was better than the Polynesian (Deluxe hotel) in WDW which I paid the same price for. We had the best view of Paradise Pier in CA and could see World of Color perfectly from above. We could see Car Land, Tower of Terror, Grizzly Peak! Even parts of Disneyland! Also, the room was huge!!! Plenty of space! I was told by the bellmen, biggest rooms on property. On a side

Summary Heading: OK, but would look elsewhere next time
Summary: I mean the hotel is OK, its just over priced, Only real benefit is location, aside from that its a wee tired, and the buffet breakfast is the biggest con job and rip off ever. $100 us for a family of 4, what a joke. 5 minutes more work and there are better hotels for better rates.

We chose to stay in a 2 bedroom suite for this visit of 4 nights.  The room were spacious, but the set up is somewhat awkward, it is basically a 1 bedroom suite with the room next door for the second bedroom.  Room are clean and well maintained and the staff is unfailingly polite.  WiFi was lousy, slow and unreliable.  We had a nice view of CA Adventure and we could see World of color and also Disney Fireworks from our room.  Room s are decorated in a Disney/Beach theme.  It is an easy walk to the parks.

You have to really like Disneyland and crowds to make this a vacation. I am not a fan of either but due to my wife's conference at this hotel, I went along for the expereience with our 17 year old son. The hotel itself is nice. Parking is easy...pull in, go into the parking garage..lots of spaces, unload luggage and head into hotel. Check in was easy. Door cards issued in all our names. 9th floor with wonderful view of CA Adventure.  Room decorated very Disney. You NEVER forget you are in a DISNEY Property. Elevators...they were ok. Not too slow and worked ok. WIFI...worked fine and easy to connect with. Room safe was beeping non stop...called front desk. Worker showed up and fixed it within 5 minutes.  Wake up call easy to set on phone system. Room service easy to use and

I am reviewing the hotel only.  (During our stay, the Disneyland Resort had some bothersome issues....but that is the not hotel's fault).  We stayed two nights in a concierge level room with a view directly over Paradise Pier in California Adventure.  We loved the view, and were able to enjoy the World of Color from our room.  The room was sufficiently spacious to suit our family, and had two queen size beds in addition to a couch  which made into a twin size bed.  The room was very clean, and had everything we needed.  Housekeeping kept it neat and clean.  Our first night, we received Mickey rice krispie treats, which was a nice touch.  The concierge lounge was fine, and was exactly as advertised.  We were able to make good use of the lounge.  We did not see ANY abuse of the

Stayed for 6 nights, good check in, thanks Maddie, good location, nice view of California Adventure, but wifi was horrible, not the end of the world, but highly annoying. Room 928. We phoned desk for solution, they got the internet provider to phone us. He tried everything he could which was nothing, he said if you go out in the hallway it might work, stupid, then his suggestion was we should move rooms and a different floor, that area had a "weak signal". I found the whole hotel to pretty much have weak signal. Phoned desk again and they said we'd have to pack everything up and be out by 11 and then couldn't get into a room until after 3, well that doesn't work when you're using the days at a disneyland hotel to take advantage of magic morning every morning and spend as much

Summary Heading: Not up to Par this visit
Summary: We've stayed here many times so were looking forward to it. And normally we love this hotel. The rooms are pretty large, so plenty of space.  Even though we went off season the only rooms available were the upgraded "concierge" level.   For the extra cost I expected more.  And they do not clearly  spell out what benefits you receive for the extra cost. We got a flyer when we checked in  listing some amenities, but it was incomplete. The only difference in the room types is that these have a DVD player and you can watch movies. Who has time to do that at Disneyland? And nowhere was that explained or written down.  The first night we received some Mickey rice crispy treats which was nice. But the next night - nothing. Also we got the turn down service 2 of the 3 nights, but not

I stayed at the Paradise Pier for three nights while on a work trip this March.  I have a nine month old daughter who is still breastfeeding, and so I was pumping on this trip.  At check-in, I asked if there was a freezer where I might be able to store my milk (sealed in individual milk storage bags, within a large ziplock, all inside of a brand new soft-sided cooler). The answer was no, as it was when I asked a second employee later that day, and when I asked a third time to speak with a manager (the manager never spoke with me, but communicated via front desk staff).   I felt strongly that they were not interested in providing me with a solution.   I gave up on freezing my milk and hoped that with ice it would stay cold during my 9 hour trip home.    The last morning of my

We put off booking our stay at Disney because we knew we were going on a dead day so we thought they may try to sell extra rooms for the one night cheap. We were wrong. We ended up paying a little more than we we would have if we booked in advance.  The service was unreal. Maddie was our guest services rep and she pulled out all the stops for us when we ponied up the big bucks to stay. When you stay with Disney you are getting a extremely detailed experience, to me it was worth the extra money. If you are looking for a cheap day at the park stay somewhere else. http://bit.ly/1eDthnX  I really enjoyed our night at the Paradise Pier Hotel, but I am a huge Disney nerd. You can walk over and enjoy Downtown Disney for free and have a character breakfast in the hotel before your day

Summary Heading: Best Disney hotel for those on a budget
Summary: Positives. So many...  Love this hotel!  The staff- They were so very kind and helpful. We arrived 4 hours before check in and the still let us have a room right away (of course depends in what day and time you arrive for availability). The staff member gave us all kinds of information to show us how to cut to the park.   Room cleanliness- When we arrived in our room it was very clean and well made. Our room was in view of the pool.   The walk-  Great to get into the park it was fantastic! Super close and a beautiful walk through Grand California. I never once dreaded the walk back to my hotel.   Purchase drop off- We did not take advantage of the purchase hotel drop off since Disneyland closed so early we did our shopping after.   Extra- They have this great feature where at 5

Very close to Disneyland, California Adventure and downtown Disney.  We got a premium view room which was great.  We could see the fireworks and the world of colors right from our room.  They have a channel you can put the tv to and hear the music to both of them.  The kids loved watching these every night.  Coffee shop was great, we got coffee and snacks there every morning. Breakfast with Mickey was way over priced for what you get.  Pool was really good.  The kids loved the slide.  They have life jackets there to use. Rooms were very clean and every day the maid made the beds with the kids stuffed animals tucked into the sheets.  The kids loved it.  Fridge was great to have.

This has always been my choice to stay. I;ve always loved to stay at this hotel.  The price has increased in recent years so it become more of a challenge to find a better price.  This is alwasys a great location and wonderful to stay on property.  The rooms and service is wonderful.  It's also very nice to be able to run back to the room in the middle of the day when you are at the park.  Also at night, when you are done playing in the park, it's nice to be so close to your hotel.  We just jumped on the monorail, and then its a short walk back to our hotel.

Service was great.  The room was clean, with comfortable beds, and cute décor.  The pool and hot tub were large, though my kids did not get a chance to use the water slide as it closes early evening this time of the year.  All was as I would expect for the price.

We recently stayed at Paradise Pier Hotel (9th Feb 2014 to 19th Feb 2014) as a family of 5. 2 Adults, 3 children (ages 3,6 and 9). We had a wonderful time at this hotel. Rooms were very clean, the beds and pillows were the most comfortable i have ever slept on! Room was big enough for the children to play on the floor withough having to step over/around them :) Bathroom was a tad on the small side if you had more than 2 people in there at once, but no issue for us, as we only have 1 bathroom at home! Friendly and helpful staff, our room was ready when we arrived (9am), which was lovely, as i had prepared myself for a long wait (checkin isnt until 2pm). There is a guest laundry which we made the most of $1 for a load of washing and $1 for the clothes dryer and $2 for the washing

Knowing that everyone is on the same schedule with water usage and elevators prior to parks opening. It took a day to get up earlier or stay in a little later to avoid waiting 15 min. For an elevator or having a cold shower. Simple fixes if also put in bigger water heaters and a few more elevators for the second tower that was added on. I suggest staying on the Lower floors to avoid the elevator, or staying in the 13/14 floor where there is a private elevator. The pool and slide were great for kids and location was awesome to parks. The title of the review was something another guest quoted while we rode up an elevator to get down. That was the big secret.

Stayed late February in a 2 queen room. Room was ok, on a high floor so that was nice. My first complaint is the lack of ventilation in the bathroom, any smells that originate in there fill your room for the next 15 minutes or so which is just very unpleasant. The shower changes temps on you which must be a Disney hotel feature since I had the same issue at the Grand Californian. Most aggravating feature of the Paradise Pier is the elevator wars. Our second day was our first encounter with it and it was chaos. A pileup of people in the lobby waiting for the elevator and people even being taken up in the service elevator. After waiting and waiting I asked an employee where the stairs were and I was informed that the stairs can only be accessed to walk down, not up. so we go back

Went to Disneyland for a two night getaway. Stayed at the Paradise Pier. Room was great. Huge, comfy bed and just a short walk away from Downtown Disney and the amusement parks. We will stay there again on our next Disneyland trip.

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel
Summary: Stayed 5 nights Feb 27 - March 1.  2 Adults 3 kids (9,6,1).  We had a standard room, 2 Queens and a sofa bed.  Pros:  Location: 5-10 minute walk to Downtown Disney, Disneyland, California Adventure.  Easy walk. Felt closer than the Disneyland hotel if you cut through the Grand California Hotel.  Our family had no issue making the walk everyday. Housekeeping: Room was very clean upon check-in and cleaned well every day Magic Morning: The major reason we stay on-site.  Great to get into the parks an hour early everyday. Pool: Slide was fun and different, wading pool good for infants, pool a bit too cold, but good size.  Towels and child life jackets available.  Staff: Friendly staff, lifeguards etc.  Good atmosphere.  Cons: Room ammenities: no microwave.   Room storage: not a lot

We took my 18 mth old to disneyland for the 1st time. I would recommend this to parents if your trying to decide if your child is to young to go. They aren't! There is lots to do. Anyway, check in for room took awhile. I had asked for a king bed and they said that I had two queens but they were able to switch me. They did tell me they only had like 13 king rooms in the whole place. The room was clean. We were on the 4 floor and the wifi was good. Our friends could not get wifi from there room on the 3rd floor and even had troubles in the lobby. The elevators were extremely slow depending on the time. We waited almost 15 mins one morning and we had a stroller so it wasn't easy to take the stairs or I would have. I found the location great to get to disney. Not too many

While I am not sure the hotel is worthy of the price (although significantly less expensive than the Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian) it was very comfortable with clean good sized rooms.  The hotel's pool area was nothing special, with a pool, hot tub and a modest water slide. The selling point for staying here, is the early magic hour. Each morning you stay at the hotel, you are allowed into one of the parks an hour before the general public.  It alternates between Disneyland and Disney California Adventure.  This extra hour is invaluable to hit all of the popular rides before the regular opening.  This let us get most of the rides down by late morning.  Then we would head back to the hotel for pool time and a nap!  The hotel's location is good with both parks and

Best: getting into Disney California 1 hr prior to main gates.  We followed the throngs to Radiator Racers and we were amazed at the lineups after 10 am opening.  Walking to park and early time was best feature for us. Good:  comfortable beds, cute theme, pleasant staff, movable table under desk  for eating breakfast, small fridge (we had cereal in room), pull out couch (altho we did not use bed) Wondered about theme viewroom but we could see world of colours from a window in the main hallway of our floor, so we were glad not to have paid extra. Could be better:  wifi is PAINFUL - it pained me to connect at all, and kept kicking me off.  Check in was slow, we arrived at check in but were told our room was not ready.  After 30 min they gave us a "different room" that was ready.

Summary Heading: Does Paradise have to be Pricey?
Summary: Accommodations were very comfortable and spacious. The walk from the hotel to the Disneyland Park is a bit lengthy - but doable.  It involves crossing a major, wide street. We were there off season, and yet the price of the room was double that of The Legoland Hotel.  It still served my purpose because getting to the park didn't require transportation, and it was the least expensive of the 'on premises' hotels.

As a family of Disney junkies, we have been to Disneyland a number of times but this was or first stay on Disneyland property. We had an expectation of something more as we have stayed on WDW property several times and the WDW resorts we've stayed at truly do something different then the standard hotel.  Differences between the two WDW-great disney orientated pools for the kids DL-standard hotel pool WDW- linens and decor very disney and unique DL- minor decor touches standard hotel linens  Overall our stay was fine, room was clean and spacious, but so are the local brand name hotels but at a significantly lower cost. WDW raised our expectation for DL and Disney missed the mark

It has been a number of years since we have stayed at Paradise Pier Hotel.    Lots of modifications have been made.   Booked a package through Costco and was given a Premium view room.   (Looking at the DL Site or AAA Site for booking, the price was the same, but would have been given a standard room).    We arrived about 11am and we know check in is not until after 3pm, The front desk staff searched for an available room and found one.   We were able to check in and get settled before heading out to the parks.        We were on the 11th floor with a park view.    The room was very large, with 2 queen beds and a sleeper sofa.  We never felt crowded in the room and loved the space..  The beds were comfortable.      At night when not in the parks we would watch the DL Fireworks

Summary Heading: Solid Choice for Budget-Minded Disney Visitors
Summary: This is a well-kept standard hotel close to the park. It doesn't have a "Wow" factor but it does have reliable and friendly Disney service plus neat and clean amenities. The elevators got very busy and slow, as others have mentioned. The food in the restaurant and catering (I was there for a meeting) was average.The fitness center was average with 4 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, a stair climber plus free weights and med balls. The pool looked fun but I did not try it out. The location is across the street and about a 10 minute walk from the park entrance. I could not figure out the thermostat in my room. Nothing seemed to change the temp (which was a little chilly).

The hotel was clean and well kept, though slightly outdated. The bathroom had no fan (gross). The elevator situation was kind of ridiculous--believe it when you see this type of comment on other posts. We took the stairs after waiting several minutes, which, when your shins, feet and ankles are killing you after hoofing through the parks all day was not cool. There is not a decent adult lounge to relax and have a drink in. It's basically an extension of the lobby. So, if you like to stay in a place that has a lounge with some semblance of character (and I don't mean the Goofy statue in the entrance), you will be disappointed with this 'lounge'. You'll need to trek over to Downtown Disney for an adult experience.  Some might think 'duh', but hey--Disney ISN'T just for kids. It's

Nice rooms very nice people. Great location very easy to get to the parks and Downtown Disney. Coffee Shop is only negative. Not designed to handle the traffic in the morning. Restaurant is closed so not much choice. Very limited selection and extremely slow service. Needs improvement.

They have a waterslide, heated pool, are close to Disneyland, Downtown Disney, and convention center. Unfortunately that's the only good things I can really say.  Food and gifts were very expensive. I'm still trying to get a receipt, but billing is very very difficult to get a hold of.

The hotel was our first stop on our California vacation up the coast. The room was a little on the small side. However, since you're at Disneyland and will be busy, it's fine. The hotel is typical of Disney. Characters and decorations abound and the hotel is immaculate. Our kids loved the on-site character dining experience. We had a great time here and Disneyland is a short walk away. We parked out car for 5 days and never left the hotel and parks.

Great location for Disneyland and that's the only reason we stayed here.  Hotel room larger than I expected and very friendly front desk service.  Had breakfast with the Disney characters and that was fun. Overall, a very pleasant experience and I'd recommend the place.

Summary Heading: Good stay but probably not worth the cost
Summary: I stayed at the Disney’s Paradise Pier from Feb 9th to 14th to attend a tradeshow at the Anaheim Convention Center.  I brought my family along so they could go to Disneyland.  This is the 1st time I’ve stayed in Anaheim in over 10 years.  I decided to stay at that Disney’s Paradise Pier because it was discounted for the tradeshow.  I normally wouldn’t pay the premium for staying at Disney hotel.  My feelings about my stay were mixed.  The front desk was really friendly (as one would expect), but the check-in time was much longer than I’m accustomed to due to the Disneyland info.  But as a 1st time visit, they gave everyone a “1st Visit” pin, which was nice.  Upon entering the room, we immediately noticed two things.  The security lock was barely attached to the door (see

We recently spent the night at the Paradise Pier Hotel because we were attending an event at downtown Disney.  The hotel is located across the street from the Grand Californian Hotel.  It was about a 5 minute walk, there is no shuttle service.  The hotel room was a good size with a couch, tv and bed.  The bathroom had a tub and a very interesting Shower nozzle that spun the water in a constant circle while you took your shower.  If you can spring for the difference, I would highly recommend the Grand Californian instead, much nicer.  If not, there are many other hotels around Disneyland that you can stay for a lot less and that also have shuttle services.  We have stayed at the Doubletree before and it was a nicer hotel.

We stayed here for four nights in early February. The hotel itself is very clean and the room was comfortable. The staff was also friendly and helpful. We booked the concierge level room with a theme park view. We were on the 14th floor. The view from this floor is great. You can see all of Disney's California Adventure Park. At night, it looks beautiful, particularly the Cars Land area. While you are able to see the World of Color show from your room, you are not seeing the entire performance.You see it kind of from the side, so you miss all the movie clips that are projected onto the water. You can still see the colors and water effects and you can hear the music because there is a channel on the TV dedicated to this show and it broadcasts the music and sounds as they are

Just returned from a marvelous trip to Disneyland with my son and my 3 year old grandson. I opted to spend more and stay on Disney property since I knew we would be returning daily for a nap. It's a lot of walking from Disneyland or California Adventure to this Disney hotel. We had friends with a 4 year old that stayed at a nearby hotel with a shuttle service for quite a bit less money. I really would have preferred the shuttle service from the main gate to the hotel. Overall, the hotel was adequate but nothing spectacular.

We, 2 adults, wanted a quick Disney fix with our adult kids but didn't want to pay the huge rates at the other 2 hotels. This one is perfectly nice and fine. We had a view of California Adventure which we really enjoyed. Got our package via Costco so had a couple of extra perks there that others don't have. So nice to be able to quickly walk to the Parks. In the past we have stay 'close' but it is still a hike. Also enjoyed the early entries so we got to ride the new Cars rides!

First time staying here -  We had a very nice room with a pool view which I didnt care about since we didnt plan on being in the room that much anyway.  The first night our neighbors were extremely loud just around the midnight hour which I thought was very rude but who would we complain to?  In the morning we got up and were able to attend the power walk which took place inside California Adventure park, we last saw the park in 2011 so never saw the new things that were there.   The walk was a great way to walk up and start the day. Upon returning to the hotel we took showers and the shower head was spinning which surprised us lol, but the water was extremely hot! There were also a hugh pile of linens sitting outside the room from the time we got there until the next morning

We arrived and used the text service to be notified when our room was ready. When we returned to get our room and put our son down for a nap, we went to our room, and the cleaning crew had just begun cleaning our room. We were given a new room, which was not the view we were told we were getting. So, we finally got the room we needed after about an hour, and getting us into the 3rd room. We were rather frustrated by this. Although they did attempt to make it right by comping us free character breakfasts for my family, as well as refunding our parking. The beds were comfy and the shower was good.

A perfect location to enjoy disneyland, clean with friendly, accommodating staff, lovely pool area and games room for the kids to frolic and have fun safely, a wonderful experience. Parking was convenient but rarely used the car.

Summary Heading: January is the time to visit Disneyland
Summary: My family stayed at Paradise Pier slightly before and during the 2014 NAMM convention, which sees 100,000 people descend on Anaheim for four days.   This time around, we were on the third floor facing the park. The downside of this location is that the traffic noise starts getting pretty loud at around 7am and you're not really high enough to overlook the entire park. The upside is that the pool access is on the 3rd floor, so the kids didn't have to take the elevator to swim. Some concierge rooms are also on the 3rd floor, with little balconies facing the quieter pool area.   The room was clean and well kept and the housekeeping staff took the time to arrange the kid's stuffies and Disney stuff on the bed each day.   Important things to note: There's a mini fridge and safe in

Booked this for the Tinkerbell 1/2 Marathon.  Perfect spot as the start and finish are right at the hotel.  Close walking proximity to all Disney CA things, very unlike FL.  Hotel was very clean, room was spacious and staff was friendly.  We arrived a few hours before checkin and staff was able to get us right into a room.  Room had 2 beds and a pull out, large dresser, coffee maker, fridge.  Cafe opened at 3:30 AM on race day to accommodate participants, which was great.

I recently stayed at Paradise Pier Hotel bewteeen 28 December 2013 and 1 Janaury 2014.  I believe the hotel is in a great location. The Hotel itself is fine and the rooms present as neat and tidy. The staff were helpful and friendlly and despite presenting at the hotel on day 1 at 10am they managed to check us into our room immediately.  A major advantage in staying at this location along with other Disney hotels are the "magic hours" allowing early entry to the parks.  If you want to save some $$$ I would recommend this hotel over other Disney Hotel's in the area as I believe it provides everything you need for a great Disney holiday.

Whether you are a kid at heart or really are a kid...Paradise Pier is a great hotel to stay at. Great facilities, great location, early Disney Park entry and easy access to great surrounding restaurants like Napa Rose. And if it's breakfast fun you're looking for, try the buffet, Mickey and Minnie are there to greet and rock with you!'

We stayed here the last 2 nights and did the first 4 off property. The guy who checked us in wasn't friendly at all. He gave us no information about the property as far as restaurants or merchandise locations. Didn't even know if there was a pool or not. The girl at guest services was rude and we had questions about parking cause we had a guest visiting for a few hours. She talked to us like we were stupid but the luggage guy was amazing. After the checkin it was amazing. The room was amazing and very spacious. Had a nice room on the 3rd floor with a patio right across from the pool.  I suggest taking the super shuttle is was 20 dollars for 2 people.

We stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel over the Tink Half Marathon Weekend. This was our first stay on property. We visit Disney a few times a year and normally stay at a hotel on Harbor that we are very fond of. We decided to stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel this trip so that we would be closer to the race start lines and expo. I can honestly say that I will always stay here for Disney race weekends! The proximity to the start line is worth the extra money you pay vs staying offsite. But I can also say that for our family vacations that don't involve a Disney race, we will continue to stay at our favorite offsite hotel due to the price difference.   The hotel is decorated in a beach/boardwalk/surf theme which we loved! Having grown up visiting the Boardwalk every summer, I'm quite

I was treated to a stay at the paradise pier and it was fantastic!  Room was simple,  but nice,  all the staff was very attentive,  and early admission into the disney parks is a wonderful benefit for resort guests.  I will definitely return to the paradise pier my next visit to disneyland!

Summary Heading: A great Disneyland hotel - Paradise Pier
Summary: We stayed at Paradise Pier Hotel for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon weekend at the Disneyland Resort.   I loved how it was within walking distance of the parks!  It was PERFECT for the race, because the race started and finished right outside our hotel.  We were on the 10th floor - had a great view of the pool, but couldn't see the parks (extra added expense).   There were 2 queen beds in our room and a pull out couch.  Beds were super comfortable!   We've been to DisneyWorld several times and stayed at both high end & value resorts.   I would compare Paradise Pier to somewhere in the middle.  One downside is having the bathroom sink inside the bathroom - even the value resorts at DW have the sink outside.  Makes getting ready in the morning for a whole family a little more

Summary Heading: Nice enough but weigh the features with the price to see what you think
Summary: First I have to say that I didn't have any real issues with the hotel.  Our family is big on Disney.  We have had annual passes to Disneyland many times over the last 15 years, still love it even though our kids are young adults.  It was really cute and you can read other reviews for the highlights.  But based on what I was expecting I thought it was a little worn looking.  The front desk staff was amiable, but I didn't feel a typical warm Disney welcome.  I felt like the hotel was a bit of an orphan to the other two hotels. Stayed here during the half-marathon and that was fantastic since the race started and ended right at the hotel.  And when you are walking 13 miles...that helps.  I would probably stay here again, but only specifically for that situation.  It seemed

My family and I stayed here during the Christmas Period. We got a great deal through Cheap Tickets and thought we would treat ourselves to stay in a Disney property so we could take advantage of the privileges offered only to Disney hotel guests. We are so glad we did this as it really made our holiday so much better. We have been to Anaheim many times and have always stayed at other off site hotels to save money but I now think it is worth spending the extra to get all the benefits. Our room was clean, bright and comfortable. We never had any problems with the lifts and the services they provide are excellent. Be aware though of the charges for ordering room service.  The hotel is quite close to the parks as well and it is a really pleasant walk. We just crossed the road and

Stayed here with the family during Tinkerbell Half Marathon.  Fantastic stay as always, with great rooms, beautiful view of California Adventure with World of Color, and excellent management and staff.  We prefer this over the other Disney hotels as you can see both the Disneyland fireworks and World of Color.  Plus the proximity to the start and finish lines of the races are steps away.  Rooms were nice and clean with a nice beach feel.  We will be back again!

My hubby and I are annual pass holders this year :) We wanted to stay in a Disneyland Resort Hotel, so we picked the Paradise Pier, because it was the most affordable.  We have stayed at the Grand Californian, and I have to say, I preferred this hotel's architecture, it was so cute, I loved the way it was decorated. I am a huge beach person, so it was perfect...and my favorite character, Goofy was in the lobby :) Our room was super clean, and the beds were very comfy. We are coming back to stay in February for a short Disney trip!  I have no complaints, everything was excellent. This will now be our go-to hotel for Disneyland from now on, we are spoiled :)

We stayed 5 nights .... having four day Pass to visit Disneyland & California Adventure Parks.  Easy walking distance to/from Parks / Downtown & walked around to restaurants & 711 only one (large) block away.  Staff were helpful and able to answer any query for us.  Beds and pillows very comfortable.  Rooms beautifully appointed with Disney Seaside theme.  As traveling from overseas it was convenient to have coin/token operated washing machines and dryers available for hotel guests.  Ice machines & cool drink (soda) machines on each level.  We had lunch on first day we arrived in the hotel which was very tasty and staff were very attentive and great with our children.  We had room service one evening ordering only two meals, which were large servings (to our standard) and easy

My wife and i just stayed hete two nights and had a great time!  Rhe hotel is very new and nice and in good condition.  The rooms are very nice and well appointed and soft beds.  The hotel has a few eating choices and a cafe to buy cheaper items like coffe, pastries, snacks etc. It is about a 5 minute walk to downtown disney and 10 to the parks.  We cant wait to go back and stay here again is eas a pleasant stay!

Summary Heading: Great Disney Hotel, best view from a room ever!
Summary: Got the room where you can see the World of Color. Great experience to ring the new year from the comfort of your hotel room while watching the show + fireworks. The rooms have refrigerators, this is a plus compared to WDW. A short walk from hotel to the  parks.

We stayed here for 6 nights during Christmas Week and we loved it!   It was me, my husband, and two kids, and it was our first time staying at a Disney hotel.   At first they put us in a Handicap room, but luckily the Bellman informed us that the regular rooms were much larger and had a sofabed which would suit our sleeping arrangements.   So we switched to a regular room which was the perfect size.  It wasn't fancy but it had nice decor, 2 queen beds, a sofabed, desk/chair, tv airmoire with lots of drawer space, large closet, decent size bathroom with lots of counter space, coffeemaker, iron/ironing board, pack-n-play, and lots of floor space for extra suitcases and strollers.   We stayed on the 12th floor and only had issues once with crowded elevators.    For some reason even

12/22/13-12/27/13 We are a family of 4 with a mom, dad, 17 year old daughter and 14 year old son.  We booked this vacation all the way back in April and booked a DCA park view on high concierge floor with Beach Comber's Club access.  We checked in around 5pm on Sunday and were given a room on the 14th floor facing DCA with an awesome view of the park - exactly what we asked for.  There were 4 Chocolate dipped Rice Crispy Mickeys waiting for us - they were delicious.  The room had 2Q beds plus a twin size pull out couch.  My daughter took the twin and was happy with it.  The room was clean and had a fridge.  The only complaint was lack of electrical outlets in convenient places (there were plenty but they were all in awkward locations not good for having phone charging at night

Had such an awesome experience at Paradise Pier!  The front desk staff were nice.  When we checked in, they said that we were Disney's family of the day which was just awesome!  We stayed at a suite and the view we had of the park was amazing.  Walking distance to the park was not bad at all.  Probably a 5 minute walk.  My family & I enjoyed our stay at Paradise Pier and we can't wait until our next stay!

Summary Heading: stay here to get a great view of disneyland
Summary: i garentee that you would get a great review from me i love the fact of free breakfast and free inroom refridge it was awesome that you treat your guest like family thanks. i hope in the future i get to stay here again because the view of disney was awe inspiring.

We stayed here and opted for the conceirge level of accommodation. What a big plus that turned out to be. We had free breakfast, daily snacks and desserts at night. We were also given a floor on one of the highest levels and had a room with a spectacular view. Having two teenagers, it was perfect to have the sofa couch which was very comfortable with a thick mattress which my daughter slept on every night.  It was great walking to Disneyland every day with not so far to go and checking out the crowd report from our very own window first. The Christmas decorations also were very eye-catching and a small group of choir singers sang Christmas Carols in the hotel foyer which was a lovely touch. Lots of people told us that 4 days was too long at Disneyland with teens, but we all wish

We were there mid-Nonvember for a convention and park touring. This hotel has a nice location and more reasonable rates than the other Disney properties. Our concierge room on the 14th floor was nice, but no matter what we did to try and make it warmer it was always less then 65 degrees. Maintenance came by twice and said it was fix but never was. The park view was excellent. There also was a problem with phone scammers being let thru the room which a few people got caught up in....THIS SHOULD NEVER HAPPEN. All in all a very good trip, 1st time for Paradise Pier(we have stayed at the GCH and DLH many times and a first for a Christmas experience.

I have stayed several times at the Grand California and the Disney Hotel.  Both lovely and had a wonderful stay.  Booked 3 nights, with 4 rooms.  Items went missing ie: cash tickes and a child inhaler machine.  This turned me off totally at staying at any of their hotels as the way they made me feel about the theft.  I coming back, booking 3 rooms, 5 nights at another hotel, not sure which yet.  If Disney had treated me better I would have come back  I have stayes at the Hilton, Marriott, Hyate before and never treated so poorly.

Summary Heading: Honest Review of this Hotel. Lovely Lobby.
Summary: This is the first time we stayed in a Disney Hotel and to be honest my first impressions were.....WOW, what a tree what a lobby. The lobby was amazing and the staff are fantastic. We paid $3500 for Flights/Accom/Park Tickets(3 Days) and Xfers for the Christmas period. We upgraded to a Park view room, to see the World of Colour show, and it was about $54 per night (we stayed 3 nights) which was quite reasonable. We were an early arrival so we got breakfast at the Hotel on the morning we checked in in the Hotel restaurant, the I said WOW when the bill came, I know Disney is expensive but it worked out at $30 per Adult and $20 per Child (including Taxes and Gratuity) for a Buffet. We got to meet some Characters in here. The room was average and the Décor was very nice, very Disney,

This is by no means a luxury resort. If you take out the "Disney" it is pretty average except for the super comfy beds. As far as I can tell though, it is the second closest hotel to Disneyland. Right across the street from the Disney California hotel which connects to Disney and California adventure. Out of all of the Disney resorts, this is the lowest on the totem pole, but it has the best character breakfast out of the three. For the price and location, we'd definitely stay here again next time!

I have stayed at all 3 of the Disney owned hotels at Disneyland and while the Paradise Pier Hotel doesn't measure up to the character of the Disneyland Hotel or the Grand Californian, it is a perfectly acceptable option for a lesser price.  If you have stayed at Walt Disney World resort hotels, the Paradise Pier Hotel would be closer to a deluxe category resort than a moderate.  No free Magic Express service from the airport but you can take the Disneyland Shuttle from LAX or SNA for a fee.   The Cast Member who checked me in was knowledgeable and efficient, volunteering helpful information for my stay.  When it was time to leave the front desk staff also checked me in for my flight and printed my boarding pass for me.     The Christmas tree in the lobby was decorated with

We stayed here for 3 nights and it was amazing, When we checked in the cast member Shay was so helpful and sweet. When she found out it was our first time she upgraded us for free to a park view room which was a nice surprise for us. When we walked into our room it was amazing, it had a strong Disney theme to it and had a great view of the park. We stayed in a room which had 2 queen beds and they were very comfortable. The kids loved that they had there own room key with their name on it. The gift shop that is in the lobby was very reasonable and the staff were just as helpful and wonderful to us. It is a bit of a walk through the Grand Californian Hotel to get to the parks entrance but it is worth it. If you want to eat at the PCH grill you need to make a reservation at least a

Paradise Pier is located across the street from disney California adventure park! It's in a great location in terms of accessing the parks!  Staff were all VERY courteous.  They managed every special request we had. The rooms were average in size. Tub was huge! Shower pressure lacked. In room fridge was great. Cafe on first floor was convienient but a bit overpriced.  Lovely place, we would stay there again!

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay but just ok, nothing special
Summary: We have been going to Disneyland for over 30 years. Both my husband and I growing up and then taking our own kids every year. We have never stayed at a Disneyland hotel before ever so decided to give it a try.  Someone said it best when they said it's a Holiday Inn at Disney prices. That is a dead on statement.  We arrived at 10am. We got all checked in and were charged $15 a day for parking!!!! After paying thousands of dollars for our week stay I had to pay for parking on top of that! That is so insane I can't believe it. Disneyworld didn't even charge for parking when we went there so why do they here?  They didn't have a room available yet so we headed to the parks and they said they would text us when our room was ready.  Another part I wasn't that crazy about is you have

The hotel was great. We were allowed to check in as soon as we arrived at 10am. The staff was very helpful and gave my daughter signed pictures of characters for her birthday. The room was nice for the eight hours we spent sleeping, that was the only time we were in the room. Housekeeping was great. The only problem was the elevators were very slow especially in the am when leaving for the park. Consider taking the stairs to save time since there are only three elevators for 14 floors. The character breakfast only had four characters, we were told Ariel's grotto in paradise pier features all the princess characters the breakfast food itself was not that great either. Do not take the disney express bus to and from the airport beside costing 28 bucks a head it's always late and

I stayed here Thanksgiving weekend with my husband and son.  Our room was recently upgraded, very clean and everything in good working order.  Our room was considered a "city view" but we had a nice view of Paradise Pier at California Adventure.  We watched the World of Color from our room one evening.  It's a short walk to Downtown Disney to catch the Monorail or to Grand Californian Hotel to enter California Adventure.  Staff is very nice.  The lobby was decorated for Christmas with a beautiful tree and Santa Claus was there in the mornings too. The character breakfast was cure with a beach theme.  We have stayed at both the Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian before and we were pleasantly surprised at how nice our stay was at the Paradise Pier considering the

We stayed at this hotel for a short Disneyland stay the weekend before Thanksgiving -- we knew the parks would be packed (touring plans crowd calculator gave it 9 out of 10 for crowds) so we wanted to stay on site to have the extra magic hour.  This hotel is the cheapest of the 3 Disney properties.  It is well located across the street from Downtown Disney and the Grand Californian.  You have to walk through the Grand California to get to the park.  We did not find this to be a big problem!  Overall it was a nice hotel.  We paid extra for the premium view.  We could see fireworks and the World of Color.  The room was nice and rather large in comparison to the Value resorts we had stayed at at Disney World.  Everything was well maintained -- and clean.   The pool was heated

If you want to stay near the Disney parks and have the special "early morning" access to the parks, you are going to have to stay in a Disney owned hotel.  The Paradise Pier is a nice enough place to sleep, but nothing special.  All the staff is "Disney friendly" which is a plus.  The good news is that you are close and get the park benefits.  The bad is that you are across a street and have to walk through the much nicer Grand Californian to get to the park so are constantly reminded that you are "second class".

Summary Heading: Loved the View, Waterslide, and Extra Magic Hour!
Summary: We stayed at Paradise Pier over Veteran's Day weekend 2013. The hotel is Disney clean, you can tell it has been updated. Ask the hotel for a view facing California Adventure - it is amazing to see, especially at night. You can watch the World of Color and listen to the audio on TV. The pool in November was not especially warm, the hot tub was nice except when crowded with kids (try not to be a germaphobe and you'll enjoy). My 5 and 7 year olds loved the waterslide. The attendant at the top of the slide was so amicable - chatted the kids up while they waited in line. The vending machines at the hotel are ridiculously overpriced... there's mini-fridges in each room so bring your own drinks. Now, the real reason why you want to stay here is that it is within walking distance to

We stayed here in November and were happy with the stay. We enjoyed the extra hour of park time, the short walk to both parks, and the view. We had a perfect view of California adventure from our room which looked spectacular at night.  We also enjoyed watching the disneyland fireworks from the balcony at the end of our hallway. The rooms are clean, beach themed and could sleep five comfortably. There is also a small fridge in the room. It's by no means a 'luxury' property, but a good choice if what you're looking for is convenience at a lower price than the other two disney properties. My only complaints are small- they did not have any bottled water in the room - free or for sale, and it would be nice to have a starbucks or coffee stand in the lobby.

I love Disneyland Resorts and the Paradise Pier is the last one on my list to try out.  We stayed for one night November 23rd and loved it.  I arrived early to the hotel and they were happy to give me my room right away.  With the self parking fee of only $15/night, I went ahead and parked myself.  I handed them my credit card and ID, then we proceeded to the room on the 10th floor.  I don't go to Disneyland for the view unless I'm staying more than three nights.  We were given a city view room, which meant it overlooked the roof pool area and Simba parking.  The room was spacious and was a 2 double bed with a sofa bed, TV, desk, fridge, safe, and of course, closet and restroom.  For 4 to 6 people, it would be crowded, but everyone could sleep comfortably in one room.  For my

Was surprised for my birthday with a concierge's room that over looked CA.  The room was nothing spectacular, your general hotel room.  The concierge's lounge was good with lots of different snacks to eat during the day.  The amazing part was the view of the part.  We were on the 14th floor and was able to see most of what was going on during our visit.  The view of the World Of Color (the winter show) was great.  It is one thing to see it at ground level - as Disney knows how to put on a show, but it is completely different to see it from above.  When you look at the show from above you can see the technical aspects of the show.  This was fascinating.  We watched the show probably 3 times from our room, with the audio from the TV that is timed perfectly.

Summary Heading: Least Expensive of Disneyland Resort Hotels, But Still Very Nice
Summary: We stayed here in October and overall were very pleased with our stay. We checked in at night and the front desk was very pleasant and gave my daughter a signed picture of princess Aurora which put a big smile on her face. We parked in the front of the hotel and unloaded our luggage there and then parked our car in the lot right behind the hotel. I thought it was convenient and we could just enter through the back entrance of the hotel. They did offer valet service as well which was more expensive. The lobby is nice with a statue of Goofy holding a surfboard which the kids liked. On the first level right behind the statue is a lounge where you can get drinks and bar food, a Disney store where they had plenty of souvenirs and their main restaurant, PCH Grill (definitely recommend

Summary Heading: Everyone should experience staying at a Disney Hotel once
Summary: We stayed in October 2013.  After a long day at Disneyland and California Adventure, it was so nice to be able to walk a short distance back to our hotel.  We didn't even use our car the four days that we stayed!  The hotel staff were so friendly and nice.  We were fortunate to be "upgraded" to a view of California Adventure, and it was wonderful to see at night!  My children loved seeing California Adventure light up at night.  We were so busy with Disneyland, that we didn't get to enjoy the amenities, but they looked lovely!  The room was clean, beds comfortable, and the housekeeping does a great job!  The elevators were very slow, but that is my only complaint.  P.S. The restaurant downstairs makes THE BEST margaritas ( and after a day at the park with four children, trust me

Summary Heading: Excellent stay with a fabulous view
Summary: We decided to take an overnight trip to Disneyland and wanted to stay close to the park so we could walk back and forth. The only room type left on short notice was a park view concierge room with a fabulous view of California Adventure. I think they need to work with their valet parking attendants because no one was around when we pulled up and we were not sure what was going on. But check in was quick, easy and efficient. Our room was ready so we were able to take advantage of early entry to Disneyland. The concierge lounge was great and we had a nice continental breakfast the next morning before we left.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but lacking Disney Magic
Summary: Being huge Disney fans, I was keen to stay at both the Grand Californian and the Paradise Pier hotel. (We have previously stayed at the Disneyland Hotel)  We stayed at the Paradise Pier Club Level for 4 nights after an 8 day stay at the Grand Californian.  Whilst a pleasant hotel, it does not compare to the Grand Californian in terms of convenience and cost.  The Paradise Pier was around two thirds of the cost of the Grand Californian a night.  If you can manage the cost stay at the Grand Californian.  Club Level was good, but not exceptional.  The room is quite dull, with no outside windows and only a skylight.  In comparison to the Grand Californian, the pool was disappointing.  The room was a reasonable size, but the sinks were inside the bathroom/toilet area.  This meant

Summary Heading: A dream come true - can't fault it
Summary: We had two nights at Disney's Paradise Pier in September whilst we were in California for our honeymoon.  Our room was gifted to us by family members who are Disney Vacation Club members, and they made sure that our 'Just Married' badges were waiting for us at the front desk!  The staff at the bell desk saw the badges and immediately comped our valet parking, and the badges were commented on and complimented throughout our stay.  The room was fun, but not 'too Disney', we especially liked the beach ball cushions!  The in-room coffee maker and fridge were nice touches, and the Disney-themed toiletries were great.  The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable - which is just what you need after a long day at Disney.  The room was also very quiet and peaceful, even

Stayed 16 October to 27 October 2013, with family of four in a concierge level theme park view room - room 1418.  Room was beautiful. Understated Disney so it was not a Mickey overload.  Very comfortable beds, fantastic housekeeping service and staff were helpful and obliging in every respect. View of California Adventure Park was to die for. Spectacular!  Short and Comfortable walk to the parks and Downtown Disney through the Grand Californian and tour buses/transfers pick up from out front.  Also close to other restaurants in the area - when we got tired of the bagels, Danishes and cold cereals etc available free to concierge level guests in the Beachcomber room on the second floor.  Had heard that the elevators were slow - did not find this a problem at all.  The only issues

My recent stay at the Paradise Pier hotel was quite nice. I would recommend this hotel. It is the cheapest of the Disney Resort Hotels but still quite a bit nicer and quieter than the surrounding Good Neighbor hotels. I have stayed at the Disney Hotel but will come back to Paradise Pier. Room was clean, comfortable. I liked the layout. Nice large closet. Lovely little coffee nook.  I didn't eat at the restaurant but it looked nice enough. Reception staff was helpful and friendly. Great experience.

We had a wonderful stay at the resort. The staff is very nice and accomodating. The location to the park is close and easily accessible. The prices of items in the hotel are high, but that is expected of a Disney Hotel. The room had two beds and a couch that made into a bed which fits one. Being able to sit in the room and watch California Adventure was a lot of fun!! Overall, good place to stay, high quality food, and friendly staff if your budget can accomodate the expense. One issue, not all ingrediants inside their menu itmes are listed. For example, bell peppers were not noted on the menu for the breakfast burrito and I'm highly allergic and had to call back for another order.

We chose the Paradise Pier Hotel because we have had pleasant stays in the past and we were only going to California Adventure for one day. We are a family of five (2 adults, 16 yr, 14 yr and 10yr olds) and we reserved 2 rooms with park view and got concierge when we showed up.  Our stay consisted of checking in early on Saturday and went to concierge to check things out.  In our whole stay the cast members were always nice and helpful. (Ask for water..its in the back room and sodas are in cabinet under food).  Our rooms were on the 11th floor and overlooking C.A. park.  The view was awesome.  It was nice to open the windows and hear and watch the World of Color show and see the fireworks at Disneyland.  I knew our room choice was good when we woke up Sunday morning to find our

Second trip to Disneyland and this time we stayed at the Paradise Pier. Definitely a step down from the Disneyland Hotel, but being within walking distance of the parks and having the extra magi hour in the AM makes the stay on property worth it.   The only staff we encountered were at the front desk,,super friendly and efficient.   Room was small, yet comfortable. Bathrooms need an upgrade.   Pool is well maintained, but much smaller than the other Disney pools.

Cool hotel in the middle of the accion in Disneyland california ! justa few block from both parks !   try to shoose a view from one of the parks, because is awesome to see the fireworks show from your room and you can select the channel of the respective show on your TV .  parking for DVC members are free, but if ypu don´t it is 20 dollar fee.

We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in Sept in a concierge park view room.  I had tossed and turned as to whether it was important to stay within the park and on my husbands insistence I booked this hotel.  I was just so pleased I did, the location is great we could come and go from the park as often as we liked and only had a 5 minute walk to do so.  There are just so many restaurants and shops its impossible to get to them all. The concierge room gave us access to a special room in the hotel for snacks, drinks and assistance which was fantastic. We had such a wonderful time in Disney and would return again in a heartbeat.

Summary Heading: Disney Land is a 10 minute Walk across the Street
Summary: we arrived and got to our room, it was very Large, the customer service at the front desk was great, the pool area was so wonderful the kids wanted to stay there instead of going to Disney. The bar by the pool was great and the kids loved the Mickey shaped ice cream bars. The restaurant downstairs has the best food and the kids made their own pizza. We didn't have to have any transportation as we walked across the street and we were in Disney Land. We are going to start a  new tradition to stay at the Paradise Pier just because of the convenience and the staff, we had a wonderful time. We got into the park early because of staying in a Disney Hotel.

We booked a room with a Disneyland view and concierge service and it is worth the extra.  The lounge is a nice break and has great snacks and beverages and made the start of the day easier for us.  The hotel is really nice and an easy walk to Disneyland.  This was our first time staying in a Disney hotel and our second trip and staying at a Disney hotel was a real treat.

Recently stayed here for a family get-together.  We all had an easy and fast check-in and our rooms were clean and comfortable.  Not as fancy as the Disneyland or Grand Californian, but just as convenient to access the park.  You also get an Early Bird Entry if you stay at any of the Disney Resort Hotels.  I would stay here again!

This was my first time staying at a Disney Property and as expected, the customer service was exceptional.   All the Cast Members were eager to help and pleasant to deal with.   The big downside was that the rooms are very small.   While technically it did sleep 5, it was a tight squeeze.   There is no separate sink in the room, it is a traditional bathroom with shower, sink and toilet in one room, which makes it difficult to get ready in the morning.    The toilet seat was broken and one of the beds squeaked so loudy it kept us awake.        While the great customer service and the Early Entry to the parks was really nice to have, this was just an adverage hotel at an above average price.  We'll stay at our old hotel next time.

I stayed here last weekend with my cousins! The staff was beyond kind and were very sweet to me when I was upset about my phone being taken at the park. They were considerate enough to allow me to call home and were willing to care for me beyond what you would expect of staff. The room was well maintained and the fold out mattress was great! I was very surprised by how comfortable my sleep was! I rather enjoyed all the aspects of the hotel and if given the chance again, I would go there! I just wish it had a bigger pool!

Stay away from here if you are looking for a Disney experience. This Hotel has no magic what's so ever. I have read other reviews in regards to How rude staff are, let me tell you this is 100% correct.  The cost of this hotel does not match what is offered. During check in we were met by a grumpy lady and the bell service man was even worse. He was actually intimidating. Firstly, we were not given the room we requested 4months in advance  Then when we entered the room it was like a nightmare.  -pubic hair in the shower -dirty toilet  -dirty sink with soap on bench -never given new soap on the last day it was lucky We had some with us to shower with. -not up to standards with the price per-night. Very basic and I mean very basic!! I can promise you cheaper Hotel chains have much

We are a mom, dad, and almost 3 year old daughter.  This was our first trip to Disneyland.  We stayed 3 nights in October 2013 in a top floor room with a park view and had access to the concierge lounge.  We loved this place.  The room itself is large with a king bed and pull out couch with a desk and 2 chairs, and a table that pulls out from under the desk.  The bathroom was large as well with a separate toilet room and a tub/shower combo.  There was a refrigerator and a safe in the room.  The view of California Adventure from our room was awesome!  The cast members were kind, friendly, and super helpful from the bell men to the front desk to the concierge level.  We did not eat at the on site restaurant, but took full advantage of the concierge level.  We had a decent

Have stayed here a few times, always with a theme park view.  It's amazing!  Last visit was for 3 days.  Watching World of Color from your room is great.  Small cafe downstairs is great and offers food (and drinks if you like)which you can take back to your room.  The burgers were amazing, better than the ones we had from room service!  Walk to the park was not bad but a little tiring after a long day.  Saw previous comments about issues with elevators but we did not experience that.

Great location next to the parks and downtown Disney we were able to walk to everything the hotel room was very clean and the hotel offered all the amenities we needed we will definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: This a Disney hotel by name only!
Summary: My family just returned from a family vacation at Disneyland and I will give a honest review on the Paradise Pier hotel,    We arrived at the hotel after taking the Disney Resort Express to the hotel and the Girl that checked us in was very Friendly and even gave us a free upgrade to a Resort view on the 12th floor since I was Military and celebrating my sons birthday.  I was very appreciative as the view from the room was fantastic view of DCA.     So went to downtown Disney for dinner and the walk is about a 7 minute walk from the hotel so not bad.
