After dinner we came back to the room and the room was warm so I turned on the AC to cool and we went down to the pool and I must say that's where the disappointment started as the pool was very small and maybe 20x40 feet granted

My mother and I stayed here for three nights, a Weds thru Sat.  The check-in process was smooth enough, our room was ready at approx 3:30pm, when we got there.  Having traveled across country, this was a plus for us.  Room was clean and bright, beds were comfy, sheets were extraordinary, tons of pillows.  We had a pool view, which was pleasant.  This hotel is across the street from the Grand Californian, which is basically the gateway to all of Disneyland.  I am glad we chose this hotel over the Grand though, because the grand is just plain huge and over three times the cost.  It took about 10 mins of walking to get to the entrance to both Disney parks, the walk took us thru the Grand and Downtown Disney.  It was also about a 10 min walk to the monorail, which is free with your

My daughter and I had a girls' weekend at Disney's Paradise Pier and absolutely loved the hotel.  The location was convenient, the staff were fantastic and we had an amazing view of the park.  Wifi was excellent and we enjoyed the food from the PCH Grill one evening when we just wanted to relax.  My only complaint would be the elevators ~ quite a long wait during the check-in and check-out times.  Still, I would definitely stay here again.

We got the exact room we booked and they decorated it with Halloween treats beautifully!  Shay and Katrina at the front desk, Lisa and Michael in the Lounge and Robert in Valet consistently exceeded our expectations and then some our whole stay.  We were there for 7 nights in Oct 2013 to celebrate my birthday and mom's retirement.  The location is great and the view overlooks California Adventure.  Ken the Manager has an awesome bunch of cast members and we were spoiled all week!  Loved it!  Thank you for making it magical!  The only thing I could whine about is that there were no pay channels for movies, but the view of California Adventure made up for it!

So at first I was annoyed, Disney's travel company messed up our reservations multiple times. When we got to the hotel we were told the 2 bed rooms were booked, even though we booked 9 months in advance. Upset, the clerk said we had been up graded. Well wow! The room was the most beautiful thing I have seen. A suite fit for a king. The amenities were great and could have easily slept multiple families. Comfy!

We stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier for 8 nights in October 2013.  The location is great, walk through the Grand Californian and straight into the park.  The room was fine, we didn't spend much time in our room, there was 5 of us, so space could be become an issue.  We had a view of the pool and the carpark.  Elevators were extremely slow.  Water pressure is terrible.  Rooms were cleaned daily, and fresh towels supplied.  I wouldn't say that staff were extremely helfpul, we asked them on a couple of occasions about getting to different places, and pretty well the answer was no you can't do that, with no other options offerred.  Coco's restaurant up the road was great for breakfast, lunch or dinner, reasonably priced and good food.  Rainforest cafe was also another favourite  as

While the hotel is a little dated, it still has the Disney magic. Out of the 5 times I have stay there only twice was I able to get a room before 4 pm. The last time was awesome got in at 11 am and in the park by 12pm. This for me is a big plus! The price could be a little less too!

We stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier hotel for 6 nights and it was a great choice. From the moment we entered the hotel we were treated with class and respect. We never had to wait long to check in and the CM at the front desk Donny was so helpful. He told us all the in's and out's of the hotel and gave us directions to both parks.   We had a room on the 12th floor over looking the pool, I was kinda hoping for a upgrade but did not ask for one. I was just happy that the room was high up so we did not have to hear street noise. The room was clean and everything was were it was suppose to be. The room had the single sofa bed which was nice because then my mom , who was traveling with us had a bed to her self. Each day the room was cleaned and we had plenty of towels .   We had

We stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel for 4 nights in September 2013. The location is great and given that you can walk across the road, through the Grand Californian and straight into the park it makes the extra cost worth paying.    We had an interconnecting room which was good and the rooms are big enough to accommodate a family of 5 (with 2 double beds and a single).  The age of the property is evident but the rooms were very clean and well equipped. The view at night time (if you have a room facing California Adventure) is beautiful.  We ate at the PCH Grill one night and wouldn't return.  There are far better options in Downtown Disney.  The kids had a great time at the pool one afternoon.  My biggest issue with this hotel is the Wifi. Disney advertises that there is

I always love to stay here. Super location and very nice hotel. Service staff was excellent. Room was nice and clean. Views are great. Short walk to the Grand and Downtown Disney. Parking was very good although it should be free for guests. We were facing the pool which can be very noisy in the late afternoons. Windows are not very sound proof. They could use updating.

I've stayed at other Disney hotels before but this was by far my favourite we arrived early on our flight from Australia and our room wasn't ready as it was like 12 when we got to the hotel and check I wasn't till 3 but everyone was really nice so after we went and got something to eat and try and keep ourselves awake we went back to the hotel and the room we had was amazing I hadn't paid for a park view room but I opened the blinds and was absolutly amazed by the view it looked straight out over California adventure.... Best Disney stay I've ever had the staff were so nice and happy to help with anything and loved talking to the 2 young Aussie girls on there first trip to the states haha was hard to leave the hotel is beautiful we loved it

We had a great Disneyland experience staying at Paradise Pier. Very convenient to parks and downtown Disney. The staff was very helpful and being able to see the fireworks and water show from the room was nice. The park view does mean street side so there was some street noise. A sound machine would have been nice. The hotel restaurant was pricey but that's Disney. We usually visit Disney World and stay off site so a visit to Disneyland and being in the resort was very exciting.

the whole disney experience is just amazing we were there for 4 days and stayed at the Paradise Pier hotel. the hotel was very nice with great pricing the pool that is on the outside 3 floors up was a blast great view of the nightly fireworks show

Stayed here on my trip to Disneyland. Has good access to the park. Never ate in the restaurants and as with the other Disneyland eateries all priced higher for the quality of food. The room was OK. The shower was running hot and cold every day and it never would get to the same temp. Last day the tub backed up. Swimming pool was nice as was the concierge but the free breakfast had no hot items except toast. The menu was very below average compared to other hotels. Coffee was weak. All of the personnel however were very nice and friendly. I think I can find a more reasonable place next time and take the shuttle to the park.

I spent one night at the Paradise Pier Hotel, following a full day at the parks. Somewhat convenient to Disneyland/California Adventure, but I find that many of the outside hotels are just as close for a fraction of the price.  Our room was clean and comfortable.  There were plenty of towels and plenty of bathroom amenities.  No complaints here.  We didn't get to use the pool, but it didn't look like it was anything special.  As with all of my Disney experiences, everyone I encountered working at the hotel was friendly and helpful.  One word of warning though - avoid using the elevators at peak times (just as parks are opening and/or closing). We were on the 6th floor and waited almost 10 minutes for an elevator to stop on our floor. When one finally arrived, it was packed, so I

Summary Heading: Average hotel with convenient access to parks
Summary: Surprisingly average hotel for the price paid. The location is very convenient to Disneyland and California Adventure via access through the Grand Californian Hotel across the street. If going to Disneyland, go through the breezeway of the Grand, then short walk through downtown Disney. If going to Calif Adventure, use the exclusive Grand hotel guest entrance.   The Paradise Pier hotel itself is showing its age, and could use some refreshing, especially the rooms. We did not pay for a premium view room, which would have been wasted on us, as we were out and about throughout the day and evening. We did have a park side room on the 4th floor, and could see some of the Halloween Party fireworks one night (we did not spring for the extra-fee Halloween tickets required to remain in

Summary Heading: Not the greatest, but it IS Disney
Summary: My husband and I are DVC members, but the Grand Californian had no availability so we booked PP with our points.  Having stayed at various resorts at WDW, we have a pretty high bar when it comes to Disney hotels.  This one was meh.  The pool was nothing spectacular, the rooms were nice enough, but not on par with what we have been used to.  The proximity to the parks is great and the whole reason we chose to spend our previous points on the hotel instead of staying off the resort was for the "Extra Magic Hours"....what a joke...every day of our stay hardly any rides were in operation during the Extra Magic Hours...either they were down for maintenance or they were closed until the park opened.  Ridiculous.  Our room overlooked the pool and it was very loud.  Our first night we

Summary Heading: My new favorite place to stay
Summary: We arrived at 1 pm and went to check in our room wasn't ready yet but they checked us in gave us our keys and checked our bags. I was told it would be around 3 pm when the room would be ready but got a text message telling us it was ready 45 minutes later. We had a rom on the 15th floor with a view of DCA and access to the club for breakfast and snacks. The breakfast was basic continental but better than having to pay to eat someplace else. The only problem I had was the shower was super tiny and the shower head was low.

We only spent 3 days / 2 nights at Disneyland Resort, so wanted to be close to the parks and be able to take advantage of early entry.  Paradise Pier with Concierge and a park view wasn't ridiculously expensive!  We had to wait 10-15 minutes on arrival for a valet to take the car and luggage. Check in was done in the concierge lounge - the process was efficient, but didn't feel very 'Disney'.  Our room wasn't ready yet, but we able to go to the parks and we received a text once our room was ready.  We got the text around 3pm.  Our room was on the 15th floor.  The elevators were a little slow and at peak times you had to wait a while. However, the view was great.  Straight across to the California Adventure park - with a very good view of World of Color.  The room itself was

Summary Heading: Windy California, Disappearing Luggae, and A Hidden Room
Summary: Me and my dad made this trip to see the Hallowern festivities. Upon arrival to our room, we found NO BED. Yes, just a couch and a table. We called the front desk to where the beds we're, and they said " In the door to the right." Vague. We opened every door in there, but to no avail. All we found was a bathroom and another locked door (like a con joining room). So dad goes to the front desk and the manager offered to go to the room to check it out. He opens the hotel room door next to our and alas, there are beds behind that locked door. No problem, we have a suite now! After spending much time in the parks, leaving our luggage with bell services, we lay down before calling for our luggage. And then we heard the whistling. It was wind coming from a poorly sealed window in our

Summary Heading: Close proximity to Disney parks and bonus magic mornings
Summary: We wanted to be close to the parks for our 5 day holiday in Disneyland. We didn't hire a car. Disney Hotel vs Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel.....we selected Paradise Pier Hotel due to price (the hotel rate is the lowest of all 3 Disney hotels).   The hotel is across the road from the Grand Californian Hotel which has a direct entrance to the California Adventure Park. From Paradise Pier, it's out of the front entrance, turn left, cross the road at the lights and the Grand Californian is there (a few minutes walk). There is no direct hotel access to Disneyland from the Disney hotels. You have go via Downtown Disney which you can also access via a walkway at the back of the hotel. This is our preferred way in the mornings and a brief stop at the bakery to get breakfast (breakfast

Disney always seems to do it right.  This hotel was very much up and past their standard!  Parking was a dream, gift shop and character breakfast buffet were good.  Fitness room was very clean and quite adequate given all those that were staying at the hotel.  Guest laundry was perfect.  Did not have time to go to the pool, but there were a lot that did.    NOTE;  If you have the opportunity, get a room with a view of the parks...it was fabulous to see the World of Color each night and just by opening the windows we could hear the music.  Fantastic.  This hotel is also just a short stay from the Disneyland Hotel, Downtown Disney (which is not in a crossover above Disneyland BLVD since our last stay of a few years ago).

My family usually stays at the Disneyland Hotel, but this was a last minute trip and I was trying to save a little money. This was my first stay at Paradise Pier (PP). PP is the least expensive of the 3 hotels that make up the Disneyland Resort Hotels, but that's not to say that it wasn't expensive. For 3 nights my dad and I stayed in a concierge standard view room on the 3rd floor. It had 2 queen sized beds-very comfortable, a terrace area that lead out to the pool deck and Slurpin' USA pool bar, mini fridge, sleeper sofa, spacious bathroom and a fun beach theme. The average nightly rate was approximately $350 a night.  I spoke with the front desk staff twice prior to arrival to ensure we were in a 2 queen room (since it was just dad and I and we didn't want to share a bed),

Summary Heading: Nice Clean Hotel - Well Maintained Grounds
Summary: I stayed here for a conference and the room was spacious, neat and clean. Easy check in and out process and the staff was very courteous and accommodating. The beds were super comfortable. It was like sleeping on a cloud. My only complaint was the water pressure in our shower. It was very weak but my colleagues did not have any problems with their water pressure. This hotel is a long walk from Disneyland though so wear comfortable walking shoes. The landscaping was so well maintained and beautiful that a long walk is a treat.

Had a great time staying at paradise pier hotel even if it was only one night!Staying so close made the at disneyland that much better! It truly is the happiest place on earth!I would definitely stay again.This was a fun way to spend my 40 th birthday.

Stayed for four nights in early September and it was a far better stay than I could have hoped for! Arrived there at 9am after a 16 hour flight and was greeted by nothing but positive and friendly staff from the concierge who helped me rearrange my dining choices to the lovely Katrina who checked us in, joked around with us and made us feel truly at home. We were thankfully able to head straight to our room as to it being a quiet day. The little "gifts" (badges, luggage tags and a beautiful picture) that were presented on check in were a wonderful touch!  The room was nothing short of wonderful, perfectly clean and I really loved the little seaside touches and the little "hidden" Mickeys about the room. The bedding was incredibly comfortable and the room was big enough to fit

I have stayed at many different hotels in the Disneyland area over the years. The Disney resort hotels are of course the most expensive, but the experience and the convenience are usually worth the price. Not with Paradise Pier. Clearly this is the Disney budget experience, and at about $50 less per night than the Grand Californian, perhaps I should have lowered my expectations. Our room was average, with two comfortable queen beds, but there was mold in the shower. The room looked nothing like the professional photos online. Not sure who got those rooms.  The hotel is walking distance from the parks, but it's just far enough to exhaust you at the end of a long Disney day. It is NOT convenient for popping back to the room and grabbing a sweatshirt. Customer service overall was

Summary Heading: Another great stay at Paradise Pier (but with Wifi problems)
Summary: This was our second stay at the Paradise Pier - last time was september 2012. This stay was great, just like last time, and this time we had time to enjoy the pool area which was nice. Two negative things - it felt like the hotel and the room weren't as well maintained as last year. It felt a bit dirtier and not as nice as last time. And we had a lot of problems with the wifi the first 24 hours. We called the front desk to ask about the problem and the woman who answered told us that there is no wifi in the rooms at the hotel. Which we found to be very strange since we had no problem using wifi last year. And the hotel's website clearly states that there is complimentary wireless internet in the rooms. We called the Internet support and after a long talk on the phone they

Every year, we go to the Disneyland Resort for our anniversary. We spent our wedding night and first anniversary at The Disneyland Hotel, our second at Disney's Grand Californian, and this, our third anniversary, at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel. A few months after I booked, they came out with an Annual Passporter deal that included a World of Color dinner package. I changed my reservation to the package, no problem. I'd read online at (outside website) that you could upgrade to concierge for fifty dollars. I asked about it at check-in and was told that it was 100.00. We said no, and the young man who checked us in said, "Well, let's see what we can...NOPE!" He gave us our meal vouchers and sent us on our way.  My husband is 6'7", so I asked for a King bed at the time of the

Summary Heading: Average stay for a premium price
Summary: This was our first experience in a Disney property, so we went in with very high expectations, with very little being met.  We did a view room, which was spectacular - however unless you are spending all your time there, it's not worth the extra cost.  The room was very clean, but there wasn't much in the way of Disney décor, a Mickey lamp and a Disney poster was about it - otherwise not much different from any of the other Good Neighbor hotel rooms we have stayed in.  The view was really the only thing reminding you that you were on a Disney property.  We did the concierge service, but would not recommend doing unless, again, you were spending a lot of time at the hotel.  Breakfast in the lounge was ok, but not spectacular.  We did enjoy an evening there once, and again the

While this is considered to be the value resort level at the Disneyland Resort I can only say that it was a great value and in no way a moderate Disney experience.  We stayed 2 nights over the Fourth of July holiday in a pool view room with us and my brother and fiancée and we had more than enough space and amenities in this room to accommodate all of our needs comfortably.  The room is decorated in a tasteful beach/boardwalk theme with a coffee machine, refrigerator, couch and desk in our oversized room.  We also had nightly turndown service with Disney character candy and character wake up calls.  The Disney spirit is very much alive all throughout the resort with character pictures and figures all around if you just look.    Located just a short walk to the Downtown Disney

was their for sisters birthday. Friendly, clean, many families; we had a refrigerator wish we had mircrowave; don't ask front desk if having disney ticket issues - go to guest setvices at the park; got missleading info. Breakfast Buffett at grill over @$25 per just for characters. Have breakfast other places

I stayed at this hotel to consider it for a business conference I plan so my views on this hotel are not from a family/child perspective but rather as a possible site for a business event. I originally liked what the hotel had to offer but had concerns that the kids might be distracting for our type of event and that possibly it would be too geared towards children. I was wrong. Although the time of year has a lot to do with it. I went the weekend after a Labor Day so I just missed the crowds and that would be key in any event. They offered a Disney feel without feeling like you are in the wrong place for your meetings. The benefits are endless especially with Downtown Disney and the Disneyland Hotel being a walking distance away. The conference room space is very nice and set

Summary Heading: All the benefits of the other Disney hotels with a better price.
Summary: We stayed 2 nights here and spent one day at each park we did not do much at the hotel outside of spending the night, but it is easily walking distance to both parks and downown disney.  It is clean and we found the staff very friendly. Be aware that the elevators are slow and it may take a few minutes to wait for one. The extra hour in the park and the ability to send all your park purchases back to your room instead of carrying them make this place worth the extra money over non Disney properties.  Note we got a better price from Cheaptickets.com (20% off) than disney offered.

Summary Heading: Get what you pay for, a lot.
Summary: My husband and I were taking our kids on their first Disneyland experience.  They are 9 and 14, and we wanted to make it special and not worry too much about price (which is why we chose the pier on the resort).  I grew up going to Disneyland and always stayed across the street, so I was hoping that it was going to be worth the money we were spending.  We booked through the Costco vacation because of all of the extras.  We received luggage tags, lanyards, pins, buttons, gift cards, meals at Pluto's buffet, etc... and our kids loved all of the extra goodies!    Once we arrived at the Paradise Pier, the kids were gawking and excited about everything!    But I will start with dislikes: Parking = horrible.  Next time we will unload first, but we didn't know what to expect and didn't

We usually stay in a Good Neighbor hotel near the entrance, except for a couple of times splurging on the Grand Californian, but friends recommended the Paradise Pier so we decided to give it a try.  I would definitely return.  The room was great - spacious, tastefully decorated, spotlessly clean.  The bathroom was smallish but certainly adequate for my daughter and me.   We upgraded to a room with a view of the park and were glad we did.  Watching the rides and the people and seeing the beautiful lights at night was delightful.  A note about World of Color, however.  Our room gave us a "to the side and behind" view of the show.  We could see the fountains and lights just fine but couldn't see the pictures at all, and the music sounded muffled.     We'd seen the show before and

Summary Heading: Here's some details - Nice hotel-ask for Park View;  hidden expense
Summary: We have stayed at the Grand Californian,  the Disney Hotel, and this was the first time to stay at Paradise Pier.     It was clean,  modernized,  had a fridge, but the feel of overly friendly staff members just wasn't there like at the other Disney hotels we experienced in the past.    It seemed like if an employee had 'friendliness' issues,  they got the Paradise Pier assignment... BEWARE RE 'CONCIERGE' PACKAGE:    Upon arrival,   the front desk clerk asked if I wanted to upgrade to  CONGIERGE LEVEL for extra $50.00/day.    It includes 3rd floor room with patio,  or 14/15th floor rooms.    All Concierge guests get access to the Club Room on the SECOND Floor requiring Key Access to a locked door.    Clubroom open from 630 am to 8 pm.   From 630-10 am,  a continental breakfast is

Conveniently located within close proximity to the Disneyland parks. A leisurely 10 min walk and you're there. The room is comfortable & Clean. Tickets included in the deal make it more cos effective Than buying them separately, and you get to spend an extra magic hour in the park before it opens to the general public.

We've been to the parks many times as pass holders, but it was our first time spending the weekend at one of the Disney hotels. It definitely adds to the whole experience, and we would do it again. The Paradise Pier was great overall, there were a few things that could have been better, but we're glad we did it.  The Good:   1. Close to the Disney parks, we also had an upgraded room and got to see World of Color from our window. Can you say awesome?  2. The beds were very comfortable, and we loved the beach theme. It wasn't insanely overdone (as I was a little worried of) but there were still lots of Disney touches and hidden mickeys.  3. The A/C - I know this may sound dumb - but we live in the valley, and good A/C is a luxury. Our room was always cool.  4. Room Service -

This hotel turned out to be exactly what we had expected. It was clean, very family oriented and the service was excellent. The pool is not huge but my kids enjoyed it for an hour or two. Our view was of Anahiem, not so great.  We did get the "Hospitality Suite" option. This worked well for us since we had breakfast, snacks and even a light dinner there several times. The staff in the Hospitality Room were fantastic. Also, it gave us an opportunity to meet many other families and compare notes.  The location is great. It is just a short walk to the parks and Downtown Disney. There is an entrance to the California Adventure park though the California Hotel that we were not told about. Knowing about that entrance would have made it much more convenient. You really don't need to

We returned to Paradise Pier to celebrate my daughter's 6th birthday. This visit we decided to splurge and get the concierge level room. We checked in at 11:30am and our room was ready. The room was located on the 14th floor overlooking the pool, slide and parking structure.  Concierge level included continental breakfast, snacks, desserts, fruit, drinks, movie rental and other services. It's a terrific convenience especially for a family of five. We were able to get bottled water, soda and snacks to bring to the parks and pool.  Wifi worked well. The pool and slides were fun. Lifejackets were available that my daughter used. She was able to stay in the pool with her brothers while we watched from the side. Turn-down service included chocolate coins, mickey mouse-shaped rice

The room was really nice. Clean and the beach balls on the bed made the room so cute. It had the Disney feel and it was so close to the parks! Staff were nice but pretty non existent. When staying at DisneyWorld it seems cast members are everywhere, we hardly saw anyone but it was not an issue since we did not need anything.   We were on the 12th floor and could watch World of Color from the hallway which was so nice.  We could hear people in the hall and in the room next door which at times was odd but it was never a problem but different from other Deluxe hotels we have stayed at. We would 100% stay there again though.

The Paradise Pier is the least expensive (not cheapest, nothing at Disney is cheap!) Disney hotel at Disneyland.  It is in a great location, as are all 3, convenient to the parks and Downtown Disney.  You need to cross the street and go through the Grand Californian to most conveniently access them all.  The pool is adequate, with a nice water slide.  It is not so nice that my 5 yo wanted to spend all day at the pool instead of going to the parks, but great to kill an hour or two.  We stayed 2 nights, spending 3 days at the parks, and never needed a car.  The restaurant has a convenient character breakfast, so really it has everything you would want.

This hotel is certainly no better than any Courtyard you have stayed at but by the time you add the Disney perks it is well worth it.  1- Fireworks from the pool deck with the music piped in.  Why deal with the crowds when you can have an awesome view from here and have the little ones already bathed and in their pjs?  This is seriously worth the money alone.  Then, early access, just walk across a well marked and easy to cross street, through the Grand Californian lobby and out to either park for your early access.  Unbeatable.  The room was fine, the pool was nice.  The slide does not empty out into the pool but is just behind it - no problem.  Valet service available but parking yourself is convenient too.  The room was adequate, decently clean and an amazing value for the

Hotel is another fine example of Disney excellence.  Can't beat the location - a short walk through Downtown Disney into the Disney parks. My family stayed in two rooms - both were clean and comfortable - who stays in their room much on a Disney vacation anyway. Every aspect of the hotel was clean.  We ate at one character breakfast at the hotel restaurant and the food was very good.  Front desk staff was excellent - very helpful in getting us an extra day Disney park ticket since we arrived so early.  The concierge gets a A++ for his helpfulness.  We had some non-Disney activites planned and he was very helpful with tweaking our plans, additional advice, bookings, taxis, and a rental car (for trip to Phillies/Dodgers).  We had a party of 7 and for those going through John Wayne

Summary Heading: Fun Place to Stay Close to the Park
Summary: This is my 15th trip to the Disneyland Resort, and the first time I have stayed at the Park.  Although a couple motels at the main gate might be closer, it is not a far walk to get into either Park or Downtown Disney.  The hotel has a great pool on the third floor.  On that same level there is a viewing area for Disneyland fireworks.  We had the musical background to accompany the fireworks - so cool!  Our room had a King and a sofa sleeper.  The sofa could have been more comfortable, but it was okay.  All Cast Members went out of their way to be friendly and helpful.  I would definitely think about staying here again.

We loved our stay at this hotel!!!! The location is awesome...step out the back door and you're steps away from Downtown Disney.  Monorail entrance straight into Tomorrowland is right there in downtown Disney.  Step across the street and into Grand Californian hotel for your own access into California Adventure.  The walk is not bad at all.  This is the cheapest and most distant hotel of the 3 Disneyland resort hotels (we paid about $350/night for a standard room), but we didn't think it was far at all.  The location made the price worth it!!  Plus hotel guests get the magic hour early entry into the parks!  Downstairs in PCH Grill they do dining with the characters (Surf's up with Mickey...buffet breakfast and dancing/meet and greet with the Disney gang).  Our son loved it!  We

Just returned from the Disneyland Half Marathon Weekend, and tips hotel was like a comforting home away from home during our visit.  It is extremely convenient to the theme parks and Downtown Disney, and the staff are friendly and helpful.  There is an opportunity to enjoy character dining in the hotel restaurant, the PCH Grill, and both the food and the experience are fun and pleasant.  The Surfside Lounge also offers very good food in a relaxed atmosphere.  The pool was never too noisy, nor was it too crowded to enjoy.  The rooms are bright and cheerful, and the beach vacation theme contributes to the overall feeling of casual relaxation.  The gift shop in the lobby, Mickey In Paradise, has fun Disney gifts as well as basic necessities you might have forgotten or not known

Resort is jam packed with activities and so close to park, this single mom saw value right away.  The service is excellent and staff is very courteous.  Relaxing by the pool and room service made our vacation perfect. Anyone with babies or school age kids can definitely appreciate it.   Single mom of 17 month and 7 year old boys.  Awesome!

The rooms are very comfortable, we paid a little extra for the room with a view of the park, worth the extra $$, front desk employees were very pleasant, however, concierge male, had an attitude and was not very friendly. He needed to be sent back to  customer service classes 101.

If you just have to stay at a Disney property, this is the least expensive with the same level of service as the more expensive.   This is a no thrills hotel, clean, nice and with all the standards; cute Disney-fied decor though. We won't stay here again, just because it was too pricey just for the Disney logo - don't get me wrong, there was truly nothing wrong with this hotel at all except the cost for a moderate hotel. A much better choice, if not insisting on Disney, is a Good Neighbor hotel offered by the Disney website.

The best part about the hotel is obviously it's proximity to Disneyland.  It's a nice hotel, not great & pricey, but certainly good enough.  The cleanliness and service is up to Disney standards, but the facility itself is nothing special.  Watching the Disney fireworks from the hotel pool was cool.  Speaking of the pool, the pool area and slide were nice, my 7 year old enjoyed it thoroughly.  We would go back.

Summary Heading: Fun Place to stay close to Disneyland, Adventure land
Summary: This hotel has a great staff and they are all very friendly and helpful the rooms are very nice and are bright and clean there are several activities for the children in the hotel including a character breakfast it is in walking distance to both parks and to downtown Disney and the other hotels Where there are other activities to participate in we had a great time the pool was nice and the water slide was a big hit with my 9 year old grandson.

We just stayed here 8/21-8/28 and LOVED it!!!! We are DVC members and tried to stay at the Grand Californian...no luck! I went into this thinking we would be disappointed; not at all! The property is very well maintained, and the staff was excellent. It's very Disney, as you would expect!! We ate a lunch and dinner there and enjoyed both immensely!!! The rooms are beach themed and light and airy. The bed was unbelievably comfortable with many pillows. Te kids loved the kid's theater and the pool slide. I think the pool was a bit small, but the kids didn't complain.  It's the best value for your money of the three Disney properties. Everything is within walking distance which was great!! I highly recommend this property!!!

Summary Heading: Overpriced. Service is poor and the quality of food appalling.
Summary: Disney Land is amazing. A wonderful place where the children (mine are 7 and 6) are entertained like nowhere else on earth.  With that out the way. The Disney hotel Paradise Pier is OK, nothing more. Rooms are a little shabby and the location is no better than the Best Western over the road. What really let's this hotel down is the poor quality of the extraordinarily high priced food. We had room service and breakfast with the characters - both of which I was thoroughly underwhelmed with the standard.    Room service - how can you make a mess of a cheese pizza?  They piled loads of cheese on a microwaved base that contained little or no tomato... think cheese frisbee!  Breakfast with the characters - nothing freshly cooked aside from omelette. I wanted poached eggs which was not

I'm a member of the Disney Vacation Club and have stayed at this hotel before but this particular visit sticks out because the hotel was better than I remembered. The room is themed very well to the beach. A note advised against taking the beach ball pillow home but I really loved the Mickey Mouse at the beach lamp. The room overlooked the park. We couldn't see World of Color clearly but we could kind of see the water, which was fun anyway to see with the synced music from the TV. The bed was extremely comfortable and the staff at the desk were very helpful with my many questions.

Overall this hotel is a good Disney Choice Hotel. It is less expensive than the Grand Californian and the Disneyland Hotel. You still get the prek of entering the parks through the Californian private entrances by showing your hotel key. However, you do have to walk across the street.  The rooms are your standard hotel room. Two double beds, flat screen TV, AC, bathroom with a shower/tub. We found the beds quite comfortable.  The pool is rectangular with a separate slide. There are pool chairs and they run activities for the kids poolside.  There are a couple of restaurants onsite. I found it easier and cheaper to go across the street, grab a blended coffee at Haagen Daz and get a quick breakfast sandwich at the Earl of Sandwich at very reasonable prices.  We took the Disneyland

We go to Disneyland often but mostly stay at one of the hotels on Harbor Blvd. I decided to give this Disney hotel a try since we got a killer deal for dinner vouchers at Ariel's Grotto for staying 2 nights (via an AP promotion). Aside from that deal there's no way I'd stay again and pay $300/night. Paying an extra $150-200/night for a comparable hotel nearby just for the Disney name and maybe the fun water slide at the pool is just not worth it.  The room is well, just another room. The rooms are decorated in a fun California themed decorations, and you get these beach ball pillows. We were surprised to find there is no microwave, but they have one downstairs in the lounge area.  Parking is another bear. You have to pay $15/day for the privilege of parking in their parking

My Wife and I and our 3 boys (16,14,7) stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel for 2 nights on our RTW family holiday. The hotel was clean and friendly but somewhat dated. The room was clean but a bit small for 5. The location is excellent, just a short walk to Downtown Disney and the 2 theme parks. The main issue for our family was that the hotel did give that wonderful magical Disney experience we were expecting. (We found this 'Magical' feeling when we stayed at Disneyworld Art of Animation in Orlando... Fantastic!!)

Summary Heading: Expensive, but reasonable option for on-site stay
Summary: All the Disney hotels are overpriced, but if you want to stay on site, Paradise Pier is the most reasonable. The rooms are decorated nicely in a Disney beach theme, and my daughter loved the beach ball pillows. The beds were nice and our bathroom was spacious. And, the restaurant in the hotel was surprisingly good, with friendly service. I wish we had time to use the pool -- it looked like great fun!  However, I noticed that the public areas could use some sprucing up (worn carpets, etc.) and I was also disappointed with our check-in experience. Upon check-in, I asked about the Magic Hour and how we should access the parks. She gave me a vague answer about a "short-cut" through the Grand Californian. However, she didn't tell us how to access the private entrance! As I've never

While we love the theme of the Grand Californian, the price tag was not in our budget for this trip. We've stayed at the DL hotel before and decided to try the Paradise Pier this time. It will be our go-to on-site hotel from now on. The beach theme reminded us of the Yacht and Beach Club hotels at WDW with just enough Mickey touches to make us feel at Disney.  The Extra Magic hours daily (and use of the GC entrance to California Adventure) made the additional cost worth it. On top of that, we didn't have to leave the Disney cocoon and venture out into the Anaheim hotel strip.

We have stayed many times at the Paradise Pier Hotel and have never been disappointed.  It is done in a beach theme and definitely carries the Disneyland theming into the hotel.  The rooms are nice and spacious and the beds are really quite comfortable.   While this is usually the least expensive of the three Disney resort hotels, we actually prefer this to the Disneyland Hotel... the rooms are larger and seem to be set up better than the smaller rooms in the Disneyland Hotel.  There is a safe and small refrigerator in the room as well.  Access to the parks is pretty easy, either by going out the back door of the hotel and through Downtown Disney or through the front door and through the Grand Californian Hotel (Paradise Pier guests can use the direct access from Grand

Just returned from a week long trip to Disneyland / California Adventure staying at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel.  I can't say enough good things about this hotel.  We were very happy with our stay.  I am very surprised at some of the negative reviews I've read on tripadvisor.    The only negative thing was the price.  It was expensive, but the least expensive of the 3 Disney properties.    There were many positives: 1.  Daily early entry to parks. 2.  Very friendly and helpful "disney-esqe" staff at the hotel.  3.  Free delivery of items purchased in parks to the hotel.  That way we didn't have to carry bulky bags around and could keep "prizes" a secret from my toddler for later. 4.  Immaculately clean rooms with a cute beach theme. 5.  Amazing view (if you upgrade to a view

Staff was helpful.  Housekeeping did a great job. Room was nice and spacious.  The pool slide entertained the family for hours.  You can see the fIrework show with music is piped in from the 3rd flr opposite end of the pool.  Snacks and food is expensive but all theme parks are that way.  World of Color show at the California Adventure park requires a ticket!  Get one early at the Grizzly Rapids ride.   Have fun!

Check-in was delayed. I asked for a voucher for a free meal or snack while we waited and was told they didn't have any available. Later in the evening we found rice crispy treats and milk waiting in our room.  Our room was spacious. Beds were very comfortable. The tub was dirty. I had to clean it before I showered. You could hear the noise from the parks, but it was not too disturbing. The water pressure in the shower was very poor, so you have to allow extra shower time. They did offer a free late checkout which was helpful. Just make sure they print new keys for you before you leave the desk or the original keys won’t work after the normal check-out time.   I requested a room in advance on a lower floor as my daughter gets vertigo using the elevator. However, I was not

Paradise Pier is a great place to stay if you have kids. If you can afford it, get a room that faces Calif. Adventure. You get a great view of the fireworks and World of Color. The only minus is, even though its in Disney property, it's quite a walk through downtown Disney to get to the park. You can hop the monorail in Downtown Disney and get to tomorrow land. Or, if your going to Ca. Adventure, you can take a shortcut through The Calif Grand by the pool. There is an entrance there. The kids seem to really like the "Beach" scene. Pool area is very good!! Have fun!!!!

Summary Heading: A Practical Guide Disney’s Paradise Pier Hotel
Summary: This will be my third trip advisor review of a Disney Hotel.  My previous two, of the Animal Kingdom Lodge and the Aulani garnered over 80 “helpful” reviews.  I’m told that’s a lot, and judging by the amount of people who email me and ask me for advice for their upcoming vacations, I think it’s fair to say I do a pretty good job at this.  As such, my review of the Disney Paradise Pier Hotel (DPP) will be in the same format as my other reviews.  I will break each section of the hotel down into an individual subparagraph for easier comprehension.  And please note that this will not be your typical “oh Disney is so magical and they can do no wrong,” type of reviews.  While I am a huge Disney fan, I am not one of those people who refuse to admit that in certain areas, Disney hotels

Summary Heading: Not up to par with other Disney Resorts
Summary: As DVC members we are use to staying in Disney Villa rooms at Disney World, however, we decided to take a trip to Disneyland and all of Disney Californian rooms were booked.  We used our points at Paradise Pier.  Front desk cast members were ok, seemed to lack knowledge of the area.  Room was relatively clean, but was in need of a deep cleaning.  Pool was adequate; kids enjoyed the water slide and the hot tub.  Location was good for Downtown Disney and the parks.  We were on the 12 floor with pool view.

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier Hotel, Disneyland Resort, Anaheim
Summary: We stayed here for three nights.  Were surprised to have been selected as the 'Big Kahuna Family of the Day' which entitled us to a complimentary photo next to Goofy in the entrance hall plus we got an upgrade from a city view to a park view which we really appreciated as was amazing to see the California Adventure Park from our room especially during the World of Colour show on our second night. The room was clean although small as there were 5 of us sharing.  Two queen beds and a sofa bed didn't leave much room for anything else although we did have a fridge!  Bathroom was fine - clean but again, small with not much space for 5 washbags!  We stayed on the 9th floor.  Pool area was on 3rd floor.  Great pool and sun loungers, amazing water slide and a bar there also although we

This was a really nice hotel, the room was large and we were lucky enough to get a room on a high floor with a view of the California Adventure park. The room had a few nice Disney touches and a few hidden mickeys. It was only a short walk to the parks, it is the same distance away from the parks as the more expensive Disneyland Hotel. The only problem we had was that it was an inter-connecting room. A family checked in at about 11pm and were clearly excited and talking very loudly and then ordered room service. We wanted to be up very early so spoke to reception who quickly asked them to be a bit more considerate. Although the hotel is great it is expensive, so best if you're prepared to take advantage of the extra park hours. We got to the parks at 6.50am and it meant we got

Summary Heading: Worth it for the magic morning hour
Summary: We stayed at the cheapest of the Disney properties to take advantage of the magic morning hour.  I think you have to if you want to ride Radiator Springs Racers more than once.  Our wait for RSR was 30 minutes (first ride of the morning) and we were able to get a fast pass for later.  They were out of fast passes by 9:30 when we were there. The rooms are spacious and super clean.  My teenager thought that the room was not overly themed.  We had two beds in our room and a sofa.  There was plenty of room for our stuff.  The bathrooms were big, too.  Everything was clean! There are lifeguards at the pool and at the lone waterslide.  The slide was fun and twisty, not steep.  And, we had regular pool side service while we were there waiting for our room to be ready. I think it's

To be honest I thought that i was going to have a not so nice time at this hotel, It seemed like too much of a kids hotel and not so much of a adult one. I traveled to disneyland for a 2 day 2 night excursion with my friends ( all 20.yrs old) We were so surprised at how clean the rooms were and how nice everything was we had a view of the Farris wheel (and that was with a normal non-view room) and at night we left the curtains open so that we could fall asleep to the amazing lights and colors. The only ONLY down side it that it is a bit of a walk to the parks and down town disney, While we didn't mind it much, others might because of small children. Staff was amazing and kind as always and I had an amazing birthday get away. :)

Family of 5. Including a 2 and 4 year old. Loved the entire experience. We booked the concierge room. That was perfect for us!!!! The movies the play the snacks my kids felt at home here!! 10 minute walk to the parks not bad at all. The staff was great. We had a view of the adventure park it's so cool to see the canyon lit up at night!! Overall a great time!!

Like everything else at Disneyland, this hotel operates for the benefit of the Disney corporation, not the customer.  They know they have a captive audience and consequently customer service is not a priority.  While we encountered several lovely employees, interactions with others negatively colored our experience.   The hotel is clearly the "budget" of the three Disney properties- although not at budget prices!  Public spaces are dark and depressing and a little tired. Rooms are adequate but also tired and could be cleaner.    The proximity to the parks and the early entrance (as well as watching fireworks from the pool deck) are great perks.   Do not do the Breakfast with Mickey at the hotel!!  Only one character came to our table. For the same price you will have better food

Summary Heading: As always a fantastic Disney experience!
Summary: My girlfriend is a massive Disney fan and I too was sold on the 'Disney experience' after visiting Disney World with her in 2011 and having such an amazing time staying at Disney's Pop Century Resort. Fast-forward to September 2012 and we had booked some time off to relax out in Las Vegas, NV. Unbeknown to her, I had organised a surprise 3 day extension to our latest U.S. trip and instead of flying back to LAX to wait for our flight home, we instead jumped on the Disneyland Resort express to Anaheim!  Only having visited Disney World in the past and knowing just how large that resort is, I was unsure of just how far we'd have to walk from Paradise Pier hotel to reach either park, that concern was instantly quashed, the hotel is basically across the road from the Grand Floridian,

My daughter and I visited Disneyland two years ago and stayed off site. I greatly preferred staying with Disney! We had park view rooms and could see many rides and the fireworks from our room. It was decorated like a beach retreat and very roomy. Coffee makers and refrigerators in the rooms. Loved the bedding, hated to get up in the morning! Staff was cheerful and helpful, housekeeping was great. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Clean, spacious, reasonable walk to Cal Adventure, slide disapoints
Summary: 1. Hotel is clean 2. Room was big enough for family of 4, no problem 3. The walk to The Californian and the Cal Adventure was no problem (and we are not walkers) 4. Staff was friendly 5. Price was the lowest of the three hotels.  I would not lock in your vacation date as the prices change like crazy between the three hotels depending on dates and when you are booking.  Stay flexible between the three hotels, but know that the Californian is a complete grade above the other hotels.  Character breakfast dining at the Californian was the best (smoked salmon, eggs benedict and on and on). 6. The pool is adequate.  The slide is for kids below 7 in my opinion.  My 9 year old who loves water said is sucked.  I (dad) went down it and had to push myself about half way through. 7.

Wanted to stay on Disney property, but didn't want the expense of the other 2 hotels.  This property is clean, well-maintained, beautifully decorated and of course family-friendly.  Staff were friendly.  The 24 hour laundry room was convenient.  The pool was well-supervised.  Be aware that the neighboring fireworks are loud!  You can hear them, even if your room faces the other direction.  PCH restaurant was great.  Surf's Up character breakfast was great, but a bit pricey.  We would go back again!  It is also a very short drive to CVS and other restaurants and shops.

My family of 5 stayed here to be close to the Disneyland resort. We have stayed at a good neighbour hotel before which was great so expected this to be excellent. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated, however the staff were not very friendly at all. You expect they would be happy like the staff at Disneyland but they are far from it. The Goofy Surfs up breaky was very overpriced and very average food. Plus quite a few of the characters never came to our table which disappointed our children.  Much better to do the Goofy dinner instead. An incident occurred in our room during house keeping which the hotel just didn't help with. We had to continually explain the situation to various desk staff who all assured us they would get back to us and never did. Expected a lot

Summary Heading: Fourth Stay at Paradise Pier Hotel
Summary: This is a review of our fourth stay at PPH (7/22 - 7/26). We consider PPH our base camp hotel, as it is just right for our needs. We prefer to have the convenience and perks of staying on-property without paying through the nose, so this is the best option of the 3 Disney hotels for us. What puts this hotel in the 4-star range is not so much the value, as it is the great guest service. We've always found the staff here to be very friendly and welcoming, and they do their best to satisfy any special requests we may have. As a hotel not originally built as a Disney property, it is decidedly "Disney-fied" with subtle nods to the Mouse, without being over the top. Additionally, staying at the PPH does not mean missing out on the offerings of the other 2 properties. The Disneyland

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier is your Fastpass to Radiator Springs Racers
Summary: Spent 5 nights giving us 5 early morning entries (3 @ California Adventure) into parks. This alone was worth the extra expense of staying at a Disney property. Since our families’ priority was to maximize time at the parks (not @ hotel), we opted for Disney’s least expensive option which was just fine. Everyday around 3 PM, when sun/heat was at its hottest and crowds peaking it was very convenient to walk back to Paradise Pier hotel, for a quick dip in the pool to cool off and kids could get a 30 minute nap – allowing plenty of energy for our 14h/day@parks  (7 AM to 3 PM + 5 PM to 11 PM).  If you wish to ride Racers @ Carsland multiple times, staying at a Disney resort is the ONLY way you will be able to do this without wasting all day in 90 minute lines…  On days with early

We arrived and our travel agent had not sent the email requesting adjoining rooms.  The staff was wonderful in researching right on the spot and accomodating us which saved the sanity of the adults who came into my room when the little ones went to sleep!   They also gave us great information on early entry into the park

For a Disneyland trip I recommend staying at one of Disneyland Hotels for a couple of nights and using a 3 day pass. It is a total experience. This way you can be at leisure and enjoy what you are doing without feeling you have to sqeeze everything into on day.

We love Paradise Pier!  I think that it is probably the least amazing of the Disney Hotels, but it really is fantastic.  We would simply cut through the Grand Californian after crossing the street to enter California Adventure at the Grizzly River Run ride.  We would also walk through Downtown Disney by cutting through the Grand Californian as well.  Twice now we have booked the Concierge level.  My family loves it.  We get up have breakfast, take snacks and water (the staff is willing to grab whatever you need uncrustables, apples, water, chips, etc for you) to take into the park.  We would spend time in the park eating our snacks for the majority of the day eat a late lunch in the park and then head back to the hotel.  Before heading back into the park for the night we would

Work at Disney for many years and know perfectly the expectations of maid work. For the same reason we decided to travel to another Disney property and receive the same treatment that I offer to our visitors. Once we got to California, we had a very unfriendly welcome. We went to the room and although everything looked very nice, the details are not passed from our sight. The small bed linen was stained. We are looking for an employee who is scared a lot to think about whether the reported, which we did not. They worry because they had not enough sheets, but managed to get one. The bathroom had used the shampoo and conditioner had not. Long black hairs in the bathtub and floor. And no mickey mouse in bed as required our hotels in Orlando. The evening service only leaves two

This hotel seemed to have it all. Lots for children to do including a tv room, and a game room. They also had 2 restaurants that I know of, a little store, and a laundry room for the guests. Awesome pool and a lot to do out there with it. In walking distance to the park, great view of several things. List just goes on and on. Rooms where very nice and clean, beds where very comfortable, and so where the pillows! Although it is a bit pricey, But worth it!

I would recommend staying here for your next trip to Disneyland, great room, great pool, early entry, spend 4 nights and 3 days in Disney worth every $$ we spent could not have been happier, give it a try you won't regret it.

Location was fantastic.  Quick access to the Parks and Downtown Disney.  The Staff was welcoming and accomodating.  Nothing to complain about there.    The only thing that kept me from granting it five stars was that I only had a two queen bed room, I had asked for a King, but they can guarantee nothing, and the shower pressure was quite poor for a hotel of this price.  The front desk comped my valet parking to make up for the bed, which was nice.

Overall very nice hotel and vacation experience. We had a 12th floor two queen bed guest room with a sofa that converted to a twin bed. Room view of California Adventure park. Bedding was silky softness - nice! Great closet space. Liked the rolling table from under the desk - made it easy to eat in the room. Elevators were quick and rarely a wait even though hotel appeared to be packed during the July 4th holiday. Very professional and friendly staff at front desk and luggage area. The early entry to parks was so nice - allowing us a chance to get to the Cars radiator springs racers attraction! The parks and downtown Disney areas are an easy walk from the hotel. Although there is a resort only entrance to California Adventure park - the morning wait time was too long and it was

This hotel is nice and very close to the parks.  Not as magical as resorts in Disney World that we stayed at prior to coming to California-but Disney service is still some of the best.  The rooms were clean and the advantage to the extra hours at the park made our selection worthwhile.

Summary Heading: Nice clean hotel,  but no Disney Magic
Summary: The hotel was clean, very close to the Disney Parks and downtown Disney.  My only complaint if  was that it doesn't have the same feel of hotels at Disney World.  This is just a standard hotel.  The accomodations were fine, but for the price, I expected a little more.  No one greeted us and our 6 bags at the entrance, we basically had to fend for ourselves.  Not the end of the world, but even non-Disney hotels are good at that, and it wasn't super busy when we checked in.  The restaurant in the hotel had good food and good service.  They had a nice gift shop.  The biggest highlight was the pool and the water slide.  My daughter really enjoyed that.  Overall the hotel was good, just not for the price.

Summary Heading: The most underrated of all Disney resorts...
Summary: My family and I have stayed at a number of the "official" Disney properties, both in Orlando and CA so I speak from experience. We've stayed at all 3 in CA and several in Florida. I spent most of my life in the service industry, half of it as a manager, so I know what to look for. Prior to my first visit to the PPR, we only stayed at the Grand Californian, typically on the Concierge level. It's fair to call me "particular" about my accommodations. The GC was booked up once, so we took a chance on the PPR and we were very pleasantly surprised. The staff is courteous and very friendly, the valet's know me by name now. We've even booked the night before when the hotel was completely sold out and not only did they "make room" for us, we had a high floor to boot. Also, Disney has a 2

Summary Heading: Nice hotel ... good for Magic Morning Hours
Summary: I stayed here with my husband and 5 year old son for a night.  We live in San Diego with Annual passes and wanted an early start to the day at Disneyland, as well as the opportunity to catch the extra hour for Magic Morning hours.  All Disney properties offer the extra hour (and we've found it is worth it to be first in the park with short lines ... at times, we've been able to ride the 3-4 popular rides before the crowds overtake the park).  For this stay, the Magic Morning hour was at CA Adventures (I recommend heading straight to Cars Land Radiator Springs Racers and once done, get in line for a Fast Pass, as the lines for this ride can exceed 1 hour and the fast pass typically runs out well before noon).  I've also stayed at the Grand Californian and was pleasantly surprised

My family stayed here because my parents were renewing their vows and we wanted to stay near the venue for convenience. The double queen room we stayed in was very cute! The beds were comfy and the decor was tasteful Mickey and friends. They treated my parents rooms like vip because of their event I'm talking Disney candy and flowers. And being able to walk to the park and get in early was the best part for us. Now the downside. For such an expensive hotel the bathtub was a little worn and the water pressure was very poor and temperature changed often. I had plenty of time to inspect because we did not have a shower curtain and when we called in the early morning, because we were planning to get to the park early by 7am, we did not get a shower curtain for 45 minutes. I called

I really enjoyed staying here, we won a free upgrade with check in and it was fantastic! The room was clean, employees were helpful and nice, swimming pool was great and the close walk to California adventure was extremely convenient! It is a bit pricey but if you want to get that full Disney experience, it's totally worth it!

Summary Heading: Good points outweigh the not so good.
Summary: This was a first time here for me but my American companions stay here all the time and love it. It's the cheaper of the Disney hotels in California. I've stayed at Disney hotels in Orlando (Polynesian and animal kingdom) and the paradise pier pales into insignificance, although there is quite a price difference. Firstly, you wouldn't really know this was a Disney hotel, only some Disney pictures dotted around. There is of course the very expensive standard gift shop. Nothing much in the rooms.  Good points - very close to the theme parks, cross the road, walk through the grand Californian hotel and your right into either downtown Disney (which leads into Disneyland) or California adventure park.  Staying at a Disney hotel gives you "magic hour" where you can get into the park

Our first trip to Disneyland , so it had to be a "Disney" hotel. Was within easy reach of the two parks--just a five minute walk.  Cast members all polite and helpful , they always make a fuss of you when they know it is your first trip!! If you don`t want to be Disneyed out, there are shops and eating places about a mile`s walk away.

Summary Heading: Nice! Liked it better than Disneyland Hotel
Summary: + Cute room color scheme and design. + Across street from Grand Californian with access to California Adventure. A great time saver except at opening. Line can get VERY long (especially with them taking pics now) and may be faster to use main entrance. + Pool crowded by 3pm and impossible to find open chair. Liked that the pool is close to slide so you watch your kid without having to leave the pool (unlike Disneyland Hotel pool). Just wish pool was slightly bigger - and needs more chairs or cubbies to hold stuff. + Parking $15/day but easier and closer access than Disneyland Hotel. + Free wireless internet. + SLOW elevators so it was nice being on the third floor (room #300) next to the stairwell so we just used that mostly. Much faster! Plus pool is located on third floor.

This review is a little late, but I thought I would leave one anyway. My husband stayed in this hotel for 7 nights with a view of park. The room was spacious as it was just the two of us. If you can, It's worth it to spend the extra money to have a view of the theme park. The hotel staff was very friendly. We had food delivered to the hotel, but you have to come down to the lobby to pick it up. I'm assuming for security reasons. Would stay here again. I've heard of people complaining about the elevators, but my husband and I never had any problems. Even during busy time.

Our family just stayed at this hotel from the 21st of June to the 25th of June 2013. First of all we were very happy upon arrival , our kids were given ballons , there is a kids theater room that plays the old Disney episodes , and repeats them after a while back to back. one banana , orange or apple costs $1.99, they have vending machines thru out the hotel , if you want a bottle of water 20oz, or vitamin water, the price is $ 3.50 for one. One yogurt costs $ 1.99 , okay you get the picture. The room service is not that good, I did not feel very well all night after I ordered with them only once.  Be aware , make sure you check you bill upon departure I got double charged for room service we only ordered it once, but were charged 50.00 extra dollars the following day, for

This was the 2nd time we stayed here, last time was just 2 night stopover when emigrating to NZ, this time we we stayed 6 nights & had our 2 girls with us (7&5)  I had read that it had been upgraded but I'm not sure where tbh  Nothing too Disney about it apart from the lamp. The bathroom was just old & needed a new one fitting, dirty wallpaper & discoloured grout.  It was clean though, a bit small for us all & although there was an ajoining room we could have booked we all went to bed at the same time anyway as after a day at Disney you are knackered! Unless you pay for the character breakfast I'm not sure what options you have for brekkie, we ate there once then ate at the rainforest cafe for a lot less.  Good for the early orning pass to the park but who wants to get up & be

we enjoyed our stay, and the staff were very nice and friendly. and the pool was awesome! will go back again! and we stayed at the least expensive hotel on the premises.and we're within minutes of walking through the gate to Disneyland and California Adventure.

Summary Heading: I really wanted to love this hotel...but....
Summary: We decided to splurge and stay onsite for a few nights of our trip. We had never stayed at this hotel, but we have stayed at DLH. We had read about the wonderful views of Disney California Adventure with upgraded rooms, so we decided to pay extra for a premium view. The view was great! We got the 13th floor! Here are my thoughts: GOOD *I loved the transportation options we had. We could cut through the Grand Californian, hop on the Monorail, or cut through DTD. Yes, it was not the closest hotel, but we hardly noticed.  *The view..really cool! We left the windows open a bit at night to listen to the sounds of the themepark.We did watch part of WoC show along with the music, but we did miss seeing the screen. Was fine for us because we have seen the show, but for first

Summary Heading: Not quite up to the Disney experience
Summary: I did quite a bit of research for our almost week long trip to the Disney Parks. Originally was going to stay off property due to the significant difference in cost & ammenities. Have gone to the parks on & off since I was a child and took my two very young kids on their first Disneyland adventure. Our family went in early May while the crowds were relatively light & the weather was still mild. We did 5 full days with park hopper passes.  Cost of hotel was about 400.00 for 1st night (weekend night ) a little over 300.00 for other 5 nights.  Pros: Magic Mornings every day for being hotel guests           Relatively close walk to hotel for mid day naps           Nice view of CA Adventure from our 12th floor room  Cons: *Disney includes very little with the high cost of the hotel

This was my second time staying at Disney's Paradise Pier.  The least expensive of all Disneyland  Resort Hotels, it is really a good deal (relatively speaking for Disney!).  The property is clean and close to the parks.  Although there is no direct access to the parks, it is close enough to go back to the room for a break.  The walk isn't very far at all... a much better option than a good neighbor hotel.  It is my understanding that the hotel used to be owned and operated by another company and Disney took it over and remodeled.  If you look closely (room doors, etc) it kind of gives it away that it was not always Disney.  Nevertheless, our time at Paradise Pier was really nice.  Our sink was not draining when we checked in, but upon reporting it, they promptly repaired

Our family of 6 is yearly Disneyland attendees & we usually stay at the Grand California or the Disneyland Hotel, but decided to take a chance on the less expensive Paradise Pier for this trip. We were pleasantly surprised with the hotel. It has that same Disney sparkle of the other hotels. The rooms and public areas were extremely clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful, the pool area is great & a nice place to view the fireworks if you're not at the park. All rooms have refrigerators & we made a special request for a microwave in our room & it was there when we got there. Although there is not a direct access to the parks, it is not far to walk through the Grand CA or to the monorail. We would definitely stay here again.

Keeping in mind that Paradise pier is the least expensive on-site Disney hotel, we were satisfied with it. The hotel staff is friendly, although a bit bumbling sometimes, and all areas of the hotel are very clean. Laundry services and the business service room are open 24 hours. We had a pool- view room, and the pool is cute, but a lot of the surrounding area is parking lot. The upper level park view rooms have a great view of the world of color show and the big ferris wheel. We decided that it might be worth the extra money to stay in one of those next time, however, being able to see the pool from our room saved us a trip downstairs to check if it was too crowded.    This leads me to my main issue with the hotel: while the room did feel spacious, the hotel areas are too small.

We stayed here previously so this was our second stay. We were booked at the villas at the Grand Californian for the rest of our trip. However when our plans changed and we couldn't get into the villas we decided to try PPH again. We have stayed at all 3 of the Disneyland Resort Hotels and although this hotel is the least themed of the three the rooms are very nice and some of the views of DCA are amazing. We went for standard room view this time (a few years back had theme park view).  Our room was on the 3rd floor and overlooked the corner of the villas of the Grand and the back side of Goofy's Sky Coaster in DCA. Overall a very nice standard view. The rooms have a day bed in them which was nice for our teens ages 16 and 19 so they can each have their own sleeping

We were misinformed and realized only after we arrived that there was no direct access to the parks. We had to cross the road to Grand California hotel (5-7mins) and used their direct entry to California adventure park. To go to Disneyland park, It is even further. One has to walk 10mins to the Disney downtown (there are shops and some shopping here), then take a monorail. Tedious right?  Therefore the only benefit we can think of staying at the Disney hotel is the one hour earlier admission to park.  Could have stayed at other hotels in Anaheim that provide shutter to parks or park near the parks. Parking at the hotel is not free by the way.  At check in, the lady seemed nice at first, welcomed us to their hotel, passed us the welcome package, keys etc. All seemed impressive..

We loved staying here. It really does add to the magical experience of Disneyland to stay at one of their properties. No complaints except the Wi Fi. It really does stink. They should really not even offer it since it doesn't work. And I hated paying $15 a night to park. But that won't effect my rating because I loved the hotel so much.

This was a first time visit to Paradise Pier, we booked a Passholder Discount rate.  We usually stay at a good neighbor property and wanted to stay on-site to take advantage of the early morning hours for resort guests.  We were very happy with the location.  You may pay a little more but the convenience and perks make up for the price.  Its nice to walk back to your room for a little nap and then be back in the parks within minutes.  We used the pool.  Kids loved the mini-slide.  We didn't use the restaurants on site as we were always in the park as much as possible.  WiFi connection was good.  The only downside was the guys working at the Bell/Valet Desk.  We checked in and were greeted by a guy and he was nice.  It started the first impression.  We checked in and the cast

Summary Heading: Perfect place for Granddaughter's first Disneyland visit!
Summary: We just took our two-and-a-half year old granddaughter to Disneyland for the first time, and our overall experience staying at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel was outstanding. Not only were we happy, but our granddaughter, daughter and son-in-law also were! Very happy customers with the Paradise Pier, as second-time guests. Safe to say we'll stay there again in the future.

When I first booked our trip to Disney I reserved a lower priced hotel on the strip outside the park.  After seeing some reviews that mentioned less then clean rooms I canceled that reservation and called Disney. They were able to book our family of four into a room at the Paradise Pier Hotel for only 100. more for the entire stay including taxes.  Wow was it worth it.  We arrived early and did the early check in.  Our room was not ready at 9:00 in the morning which we expected.  However, we were able to park at the hotel and go directly to the park.  The front desk texted me when our room was ready.  It was my children's first trip to Disney and my birthday week.  The hotel upgraded us to a park view room.  I was so pleased I had tears in my eyes.  My boys spent a lot of time

This place is really convenient to the parks and had clean and tidy rooms. It was worth paying extra to stay at a Disney hotel and have easy access to rides and a full Disney experience. In the past I have stayed in the seedier and cheaper hotels outside of the park and won't bother again. Staff is friendly and helpful, and made our birthday celebrant feel special.

Loved this place.  First time staying near the park and you could walk to both parks and Downtown Disney.  I did not venture out beyond Disney.  Many, many restaurants in the surrounding Disney hotels and Downtown Disney.  Room was very clean and bright, and I would love to stay here again. Super nice TV, and I could pick up the free WiFi in the room.  I did hear noise from the next room but that may have just been because the people were loud and there was a door between the two rooms.  Stayed here using vacation points so I cannot really comment on price.  Wish I had had a view of Disney California Adventure park to see the World of Color show but I was on the other side of the building with a pool view.

We moved from Orlando to Texas and needed our Disney fix.  We know Disney hotels pretty well and we were not disappointed, at all.  We enjoyed having queen sized beds, with soft sheets and a larger bathroom.  The price was a jolt, compared to what we are use to paying in Florida, but the location, room size, concierge, staff, chocolates on pillow, location, sofa bed, restaurants and location were great!  Paying for parking bites a big one and we were disappointed we couldn't buy a t-shirt or hoodie with the hotel name and logo!  We wanted to let the world know we stayed there and loved it!  Would have loved a hoodie with the Goofy and his surf board on it!  We laughed when people complained about the walk to the resorts!  Really?  Have you been to Disney World?? Paradise Pier

Took my kids here on a surprise trip to Disneyland Resort for Christmas. Check in was quick and easy. We were assigned our room, and on we went. Upon arriving to our room, housekeeping was still cleaing (it was well past 3pm check in time). She said it would be just a moment. 20 (long) minutes later, we had our room. Rooms were very spacious. There were only 4 of us this trip, but a 5th would have fit easily. Of the 3 Disneyland properties, this one is the furthest from the parks, and my least favorite. Being December, we did not use the pool facilities, but we could see the pool from our room. It looked to be a basic pool, with a small waterslide. Nothing fancy.   A nice perk is being able to send your resort purchases to the hotel, so you don't have to carry your bags around

Summary Heading: Not too impressed with this Disney property.
Summary: First time staying at Paradise Pier. Stayed for 8 days, 7 nights. In comparison to Disneyland Resort this establishment lacked the luster and luxury for the price. It was a distance from both parks. Friends in my party experienced a clogged bath tub.  The bath tub had an awful smell that resonated beyond the room.  It spilled over into the halls. This  was absolutely unpleasant. Staff is friendly.  Yet, this hotel just ultimately is lacking.  Rooms and bathrooms are smaller compared to the Disney Resort. Suggest stay at one of the good neighbor hotels and save money or splurge and go to Disney Resort.

This place has the best views into Disney California Adventure theme park.  Provided you get a theme park view room and are on the 8th floor or higher.  We were on the 13 floor concierge level and had a great view (although sideways) of the World of Color show each night.  It's also the cheaper of the three Disneyland Resorts owned and run by Disney.  The downside is it's the longest walk to the parks of the three.  It's not bad since it's only about about 5 more minutes then the walk from the Disneyland Hotel.  People staying at Paradise Pier Hotel can cross the street and cut through the Grand Californian Hotel and use their entrance into California Adventure.  This way you can be in park in about 10 minutes.  Use of this entrance is exclusive to Disney hotel guests up to

My family and I took a trip to Disneyland this Memorial Day weekend.  It was my grandson's (5 years old), first trip and the we wanted it to be a memorable one.  We wanted to stay at one of the hotels on site becasue we wanted to have the ability to come and go from the park with ease.  We decided to stay at Paradise Pier because it was the least expensive of the 3 hotels.  We selected a one bedroom suite which had 2 bathrooms.
