There were 7 of us and that second bathroom came in handy.  This is not a plush hotel.  I would put it on the level of a Holiday Inn.  And to be honest, given the price we paid (every though it was the least expensive), I expected a bit more.  The hotel felt very dated but was fairly well kept.    There is only one swimming pool here, but it does have a

We have stayed at this hotel more times than we can count, and may have gotten even better service than normal!  The rooms are fantastic, clean, and usually quite quiet, and the staff is amazing. The room was booked through my mom, but a number of us had to share the room with her for a couple nights. The hotel upgraded us to a huge corner room next to the glass elevator so we had tons of space not to be in each others way. The view of the park from our room was amazing and you can watch World of Color from there (minus being able to see the projections).  On our final day, the airport bus that comes to the hotels didn't show up at the time we needed, and we ended up missing our flight (this is no fault of the hotel, just the bus company). One gentleman working in valet helped

We stayed May 17-20, 2013.  May is a good time to go.  Weather was nice, but not too hot and the parks aren't crazy busy yet.  This was our first time staying at a Disney hotel when visiting Disneyland and it was an outstanding experience!  I know it is expensive relative to the hotels just outside the park, but it is just such a good experience, it is worth it.  It's the convenience of being able to walk out of your hotel and into Downtown Disney and the parks.  It's the little Disney touches, like the Mickey phone call before the trip, the special lanyard and pin, the bag tags, the early admission and it's the service.  They really do know how to do it right to make it special for their guests.  We were in room 628 facing California Adventure.  This is not high enough to see

We spent 7 nights and didn't want to go home.  THe hotel has larger rooms than the other Disney hotels and the character breakfast is worth the money if you have small children.  We don't but enjoyed it anyway. The characters visit each table and spend a good amount of time with you.  We had a view room and it was worth paying the extra money for it. The room was clean and the maid service was great. The pool area was clean and the hot tub great. I would recommend this hotel over the other one's.  We talked to people who stayed at the grand Californian and they said that after we compared rooms and the service they the would stay at the Paradise pier next time.

Pleasantly surprised with the hotel and room.  Nothing fancy for sure, but everything was clean and modern.  We had a view of the pool and parking lot, but since we spent all our time in the park, we didn't care.

Summary Heading: DO NOT LISTEN TO THE BAD REVIEWS
Summary: First of all, the bad reviews from people, they are liars. We spent 2 nights their, and being part of the Hotel industry, my expectations are alot higher than most people. We were not able to get our room when we checked in, which was fine we showed up a bit early, but they went ahead and checked us in, and mentioned to us that they will send us a text message when the room was ready  NOTE: IT IS WORTH THE MONEY FOR THE CONCIERGES LEVEL!!!!  so with the note above, after we checked into our reservation, they mentioned we can stop by the concierge room, and get snacks, since the front desk agent went ahead and called up for us.  Upon checking into the room, i needed to get a quick shower, i did notice a hair in the tub, but did not make a stink about it. I called housekeeping,

Just returned from a great weekend at the Paradise Pier and couldn't have been more pleased!  Every single "cast member" from the valet, front desk, guest services and housekeepers were as pleasant and helpful as can be.  We never made a request or asked a question that wasn't answered with a smile.  We had a room on the 13th floor..yes there was a 13th floor, with a park view and were able to watch the World of Color show each night from our room, tuning in the music on our TV.  Our room was clean and comfortable, we loved the turn-down service and little chocolates left each night.  We didn't mention that we were celebrating a birthday when we made the reservation, but my sister mentioned this to the desk when we checked rice krispie Mickey Mouse treats in our room that night.

Stayed there mid-week with two children under the age of 4.  Upgraded to a view room which was definitely worth the $.  See pic.  Walk to parks was short and the private entrance into California Adventure saved us lots of time.  The room was old but adequate for our needs.  Staff was friendly and my kids LOVED the character breakfast in the hotel.

Stayed here in 2 adjoining rooms with son/wife and 2 grandsons under age 6.  Rooms were dirty, old, not updated at all, the hallway and rooms smelled like rotten eggs or worse, the elevators were almost unusable...need more elevators.  On the last morning our daughter-in-law on crutches due to recent surgery (they charge $10 a day for a wheelchair), had to walk down 5 flights of stairs with her crutches with the rest of us carrying little children, strollers, etc just to get them to the van to get to the airport.  Staff could care less especially the front desk manager who just was concerned that he was going to have his breakfast with long check-out lines and 2 less employees out sick...he could care less.  Terrible hotel.  Avoid at all costs and it will cost you there.  Disney

We had a nice stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel. We were surprised with a park view suite upgrade to room 622.  The walk seems far to the park at first; however, the reality is that the walk and wait to the tram if longer. The elevators were the biggest challenge in the morning... People were getting upset waiting for them.  The trick ... Press the up bottom jump on go for a short ride and what goes up must come down. Worked great every time!  Clean and great service...

Good price for the breakfast with Mickey and early admission into the parks. The pool  with the slide keep the kids happy. The food was expensive, you pay for the company and variety. The beds were comfortable and the staff helpful enough.

I wasn't expecting a lot when we made this reservation.  We had wanted the Disneyland Hotel, but we also knew we wanted Concierge Level service and it wasn't available at the Disneyland Hotel, so we settled for the Paradise Pier.  And I was left very happy and can see myself coming back next time we visit.  The staff were very friendly (aside from the aloof lifeguards, but I will give them a break considering how boring their job must be), the rooms were spotless, everything was great.  Yes, the decor is dated and you can see the years on the building, but it never felt dirty or run down.  The Concierge Lounge was terrific.  We were travelling with 3 small kids and they loved going in there with the big TV playing Disney cartoons so they could eat a nice breakfast and watch a

Summary Heading: Great price and location for a Disney Hotel
Summary: This was the first Disney hotel that I ever stayed at and it was a really great experience. We stayed in a Club level Cabana room, something I would suggest if you want to enjoy a pool level room with access to the Club room (more below).   The Cabana room features a walk-out "balcony" that's really just a deck because you can walk right from it to the pool area. This was a nice perk.   The rooms here are great. We had two queen. They leave you Disney chocolates each day they clean your room and the beach ball pillows are fun. The room was clean and spacious (more so than the Grand Californian in my opinion). The service from the Castmembers was great, they delivered promptly even when we arrived earlier than our check-in time. They will hold bags for you before check-in and

Summary Heading: A Nice Hotel that is super convenient to gain access to Disneyland & California Adventure
Summary: This is my Hotel of choice when I stay at Disneyland, only because it's the most affordable of the (3) Disney property Hotels.  It wouldn't be my first choice for luxury and amenities, but due to the high price of the other two Hotels on the Disney property, this is the best value (if you call $256/night a good value "choke, wheez"...hehehe. The only concern that I'm seeing more lately is the cost of everything else.  I think $139 for the Character Breakfast for 2 Adults and 2 Children is simply INSANE!  There are many places in the world where $139 would be more than a month's salary!  It's just a crime to charge this much and therefore I downgraded my rating to 3 Stars compared to 4 stars previously.  I realize that this is children's dream of a lifetime, but they take the

Great location within the resort and a short stroll to both parks...Our 4 day stay was very pleasant..We got upgraded to a room with a view of the California Adventure Park which was totally unexpected..! The room was very clean and had all necessary amenities. The only negative was we weren't impressed with room service (very expensive for the quality you get and slow delivery).  Overall the property and staff were very helpful and friendly!

Let's start with the bad since the list is so short- Water pressure was really low, so it took forever to shower, and our shower head leaked all over the bathroom floor. $15 a day to park, even though with my premium pass, I can park for free at the park. Mattress was a wee bit too firm. Wifi access was non-existent The good- Concierge service was awesome, although it's mainly snack type stuff, we were so full we didn't really need to buy food. The free DVD rentals were awesome too. The people that worked in the concierge room were beyond friendly, making each and every guest feel special. The sheets-I think they were 50 million thread count, they were so soft & luxurious feeling. Soundproofing between rooms & balcony. Walking down the halls you can hear the anthem of children

Great location, short walk to the theme parks and downtown Disney. The Disney staff could not have treated us better :) We had a great view of California Adventure and the World of Color water show every night.

I would recommend staying at this place because of the location and price. Only across the street from Disneyland and you cut through the Grand California in the morning.  The room was clean and had a nice beach motif, try to get a room on a higher floor and facing the park and you can see into Disney’s California and the World of Color show.  Note – if you are a early sleeper then get a room facing the pool – tends to get quite loud because of this show.  About a 20 min walk to Downtown Disney.  Parking was easy –show your card and they let you in.

Had a one night stay on our trip back to New Zealand. We had a view room on the 14th floor which looked out over California Adventure Park so we could see the World of Color display.   The room was very spacious and our daughter loved the different themed lights etc. The heated pool and spa pool were great and the staff were very helpful.  Was great to be able to store our bags all day while we were in the park before heading to LAX to catch a late flight.

Just got back from 3 days at Disneyland/CA Adventure. It was our first time booking our stay at a Disney hotel and I will do it again when we visit in the future! Loved the theme of the hotel, the pool and water slide was perfect for my 9 yr old. Book a room with a park view for sure so you can view World of Color! We were on the 11th floor and the view was breathtaking. I also just received a phone call from the hotel's Lost & Found telling me we left some bathing suits hanging up on the back of the bathroom door and they are sending them back to me ASAP, which is totally awesome because I didn't even realize I left them behind! Although Paradise Pier does not have its own entrance to the parks it's just a small walk away from the Grand Californian, which is where you can

We spent 4 nights here with family to celebrate our two grandsons 4th and 2nd birthdays, the hotel of course is in a perfect spot for exploring Disneyland and California adventure, the staff are super friendly and they made a fuss over the kids for their birthdays, 2 treasure chest cakes and baloons in the room when we got back one night and they didn't chrage as they were late. we had the concierge service which is well worth the money, lots of good snacks through out the day, wine, beer, soft drinks.Breakfast, muffins, cereal, bagels, lots of fresh fruit, very well presented. But the hotel is dated it needs uograding, the bathroom was small and the shower was the worst shower I have had, small bath with shower curtain, very dated. but it was comfortable, just didn't have any

We booked 3 rooms for our family when we took the grandkids to Disney.  This hotel is great!  Great service, great rooms, great location.  We booked club rooms and had a continental breakfast at the club lounge every day of our stay.  We also had drinks and snacks all day which was great because we could take it all into the parks.  The lounge also offered a cocktail hour and late night dessert bar.  Great value if you have kids.  The lounge was also a great place to relax and gather the family before we headed out to the parks.   Another perk of staying at this hotel was the package delivery service.  Anything (except candy) we purchased from the parks' gift shops were delivered to the hotel, we did not have to carry it around all day.   They also have the Magic Morning Hour

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, great location, need more elevators!
Summary: We stayed in a room on the 14th floor, which required use of the elevator.  Unfortunately, there are only a couple of elevators, which clearly could not handle the traffic load...especially in the mornings.  On one morning, the elevator actually got stuck with us inside!  Luckily, I've watched too many movies and decided to pry the doors open.  By the time the fire department got there, we had decended the 14th flights of stairs.  :)    The room was clean...even the white comforters on the beds.  The beachball pillows were very cute.  Everything was in working order.  Overall, the hotel was great and very convenient.  The restaurant was overpriced with mediocre food, however, so I wouldn't recommend it, but I would stay here again.

At first glance, Paradise Pier might seem like a great way to go:  Close to the parks, Disney theme, and early admission. The problem is that it's so darned expensive. I have stayed in luxury accomodations in Paris, Frankfurt, and Dubai that cost less than Paradise Pier. So, I was hoping that there would at least be some sort of flair, something to make it worth all that extra money.  There wasn't.  1) The rooms are nothing special. Smallish, with the usual TV and fridge, but nowhere to stretch out at all. At least they were very clean.  2) The rooms are horribly insulated. You might as well be sleeping on the street for all the noise you hear. The one saving grace here is that the beds were exceedingly comfortable. We slept deeply and soundly because of those beds, which is why

Summary Heading: Great view and a great enhancement to the Disney experience!
Summary: We recently stayed at Paradise Pier for 5 nights. The hotel itself is older but the location and the views available from the rooms are worth the extra money (especially for World of Color). The hotel is a short 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney where you can get the monorail into Disneyland Park and is an even shorter walk to get to the entrance of California Adventure park in the Grand Californian Hotel.    The rooms are very clean and fresh, and have cute Disney accents. There is no mini bar but there is a fridge, a store in the lobby and a vending machine on every floor. Room service is very good and reasonably priced for a Disney hotel.   We did not have much interaction with the staff other than check in and room service where they were helpful and friendly.   I felt like

I was surprised how much I liked this hotel.  I've stayed two different times now, and both were positive.  Before I've only stayed at the Grand Californian or Disneyland Hotel, and I was worried this one would be disappointing.  The decor (remodeled in the last few years) is fun and whimsical, the rooms are really comfortable, and our rooms were clean.  The second time I stayed I paid an additional $50 just to get a View room of the Cal. Adventure park, and I have to say it was worth it.  It really adds to the magical vacation feel to see all the lights from the rides all night long.  It was my friend's birthday, and I called ahead to arrange for guest services to put balloons and chocolate covered strawberries in the room while we were out at the parks, and it was all done

What a great place to stay, we were upgraded to a park view when we checked in and could see the fireworks at Disneyland, the view at night was wonderful. They had a special dinner the night before the run. I would stay here again. The parks were great and we got right on all the rides, and it was labor day weekend.

This really is the place to stay if your visiting.  We've been to plenty of hotels over the years and the standards here are high. We misjudged our travel time so we didn't get in until 8:00pm - after 13  hours of cross country travel. Anxious to get inside, we made a mistake I did not see in any earlier post  - make sure you drop off your luggage at the front of the hotel.  DO NOT park in the self-parking garage until you do.  I've never seen a hotel parking garage without an elevator or ramp - so if you try to save time, you'll have to bump your rolling luggage down a lot of stairs.  That said, the greeting at the front desk was warm and friendly, and after asking politely if they had a park view room available, we got the upgrade free.  If you are as lucky, I advise leaving

We were pretty happy with this hotel, it is clean and comfortable and convenient to be so close to everything. We would definitely stay here again. We had small children and being able to get back to the room for a nap was worth the cost. We also got a room with a view of the world of color and the kids loved it (though you can't see the screen very well.)

Stay here if you want to be on-property at Disneyland and save a few bucks (or if the other two are sold out). It's slightly further than DLH from the Monorail/Downtown Disney to enter Disneyland, and you must cut through GCH to get into California Adventure. But that's still better than the "Good Neighbor" (off property) hotels. And as of this writing, staying on property also gets you an Extra Magic Hour (early entry into one of the parks each morning) which is priceless.  The hotel itself is themed beach Disney but the structure doesn't seem to have been updated since it was a non-Disney hotel many decades ago. The elevators are slow, slow, slow... every morning guests could be heard complaining about waiting >10 minutes to get down to the lobby, although the timing was

Two couples were visiting Disneyland and we spent 2 nights at the Paradise Pier Hotel.  Being visitor number something for that day we became the "Big Kahuna Family" and had a free upgrade with a very nice view of CA Adventure and that evening water show.  Accommodations were very nice and the staff was outstanding.

Summary Heading: Nice size room for family of 5
Summary: The is the cheapest of the Disneyland resorts but it was a great value.  A little far from the parks but the early entrance into the park was definitely worth it during spring break.  The from was a decent size.  We were able to sleep 5 of us comfortably.  The pullout daybed was great - looked like a twin size bed, and a felt more comfortable than other pull out sofas.  Kids had fun at the pool.  The pool was pretty small given the size of he hotel.  Good thing it wasn't crowded.  Not a lot of food places nearby.  We'd pick up dinner in downtown Disney and bring it back.  Lowest price for Disney hotels, an if you're going during a busy time then 1 hour early is worth the mark up.  There is no other way that I knew of to get early entrance into California Adventure.  If going

Hotel is very basic, older, has almost no shower pressure, neither the sink nor the tub were draining and house keeping skipped our room one day.  Beds were comfortable and sheets were soft.  Staff were hit and miss and seemed a little Disneyed out.   Having said that the proximity to the parks can't be beat.  This is the best deal compared to the other two Disney hotels.

Stayed for a night before flying back to UK as we wanted one more morning at Disney.  Check-in staff very patient as we discussed all room options.  Chose a premium park view room on 13th floor, totally worth it.  Room overlooked DCA.  You can see the Disneyland fireworks from the pool deck and then the DCA World of Color show from your room, accompanied my the show's soundtrack on the TV.  Had originally wanted to stay at the Disney Californian Hotel but decided against it as they only offered glimpses of the DCA park. Only takes 10mins to walk to park entrances and you have use of the entrance to the parks through the Californian.  If you're using this for extra magic hours, get there 60mins before (not 30mins as staff suggest, you'll be right at front of queue.  Room was ok,

We were really happy with this hotel. Staff were lovely. Rooms were comfortable and had nice Disney features. Best thing of all was the view over the park- awesome!!! Easy to walk to Disneyland and to the facilities in other Disney hotels.

First of all, when we arrived we checked in and they said our room was ready.  When we carried our heavy luggage up to the room, the key was not working.  We went back down with our luggage and they mentioned that it was not ready and hadn't been cleaned yet.  After waiting several hours, we finally got the working key into our room.  Immediately we had noticed that the room smelled badly of baby diapers, the source was the closet.  The maids vacuumed which didn't help. We couldn't even talk to them about how it was fine and we'd deal with it after our long day, but the maids didn't even speak English.  Sleeping was hard, the pillows were thin and uncomfortable.  The only reason I am rating this 2/5 stars is the breakfast buffet. Even though we had to pay for the buffet, it was

Well located for Disney, very short walk to both parks, either through Downtown Disney or through Grand California Hotel. Breakfast is better at Disney land hotel but as the breakfast is targeted at the kids for the characters, you need to do Paradise Pier breakfast to meet Mickey. Staff very friendly and helpful always looking to interact with the kids to ensure they are the focus. Would recommend this hotel but if we returned we would probably try one of the other on site Disney hotels as they looked even better than this one.

Twice is not enough! Best place for an injection of excellent customer service. The staff, the hotel, the location, the proximity to Disneyland the happiest place on earth what more could you ask for!! Would have to say I loved every second of it and would certainly have no hesitation in staying there again.

The closness to the park is what makes the place all worth it to me, I go into the park in the morning, stay a few hours, then back to the hotel for a nap and then back for nightime park fun. Free Wi-Fi was very nice. The rooms were good and the bathroom has just about everything you need if you may have forgot something. Service from the staff is hit or miss because they seem just slightly overwelmed at times, but are always nice.The restuaraunt was average and seemed just a bit overpriced for what was given...

It was Christmas 2012 when we visited Disneyland so everything was decorated to perfection a big Christmas tree in lobby with a awesome Santa we had no trouble getting to our rooms which were a good size we had two large beds the decor was a nautical theme Mickey holding a surfboard lamp and beach ball look cushions Disney theme large paintings on the wall a huge window overlooking the pool  my daughter paid for a theme breakfast which was really cool she got to meet the Disney character's and take plenty of photo's with them and get their autograph's  and the food was delicious we also booked and met Goofey and had a family photo with him so cool..I liked staying at the Paradise Pier because it was not far from Disneyland our car was safe and secure in the hotel car park the

Our family of four stayed at Paradise Pier for three nights during Spring Break, so the hotel was 100% occupied during our vacation.  We are big fans of Disney hotels, having stayed onsite multiple times in both Florida and California.  We were well informed ahead of time regarding location, services, meal costs, and relative cost of local hotels.  I believe knowledge is the key to enjoying a Disney vacation.  The room itself was large and exceptionally convenient for our family.  Our 11-year old son appreciated sleeping alone on the day bed rather than sharing a bed with his younger brother.  Our younger son loved the pull-out work table that gave him an L-shaped play area off the floor.  We made every early entry during our stay and utilized the Grand Californian park entrance

Recently me and my family went and stayed at the Disney Paradise Pier for a week! It was very convenient as it was directly across the street from Disneyland and California Adventure park. The hotel was pretty clean, the maids did an excellent job on the rooms while you were out at the parks except one night they stole a bag with my dads 6 pack of beer in it! lol i think they thought it was a tip! lol All in all great hotel, close to everything you need , connivence stores are just a few blocks away with really cheap souvenirs and things like that! We didnt eat at the hotel a lot, mostly we ordered delivery ( dominos pizza, panda hut chinese) and it was alot cheaper and was actually pretty good!

It is always a benefit to stay on Disney property versus a separate hotel..... Easy access  throughout property, parks open early for guests, some discounts, etc..... We had two adjoining rooms on the 11th floor overlooking California Adventureland.  That is the way to go with young kids.... You can see the entire World of Color show from your room and they have a TV station with the correct music playing.  It beats dragging tired kids through the park at 10pm to see it. Beds were comfortable, free wireless, very clean, plenty of towels. Our room had a fridge, safe, ironing board, hair dryer, sofa, desk, extra blankets, and a playpen in the closet ready to go. Restaurants at this hotel were pretty basic.  You can get breakfast cheaper inside the parks rather than doing the

Summary Heading: Not worth the money and terrible service
Summary: Went in 2012.  Good - Location. Easy park access. Easy to return to hotel room when tired from walking in the park. Good view of fire works from hotel pool.   Bad - Service. Front desk terrible, bell boy service terrible. Arrived at 1400 Had to wait way past 1600 to check in. Everything was wait, wait for room, wait for service, wait for bags. Ended up carrying my own bags.  Had better service at other good neighbor hotels.

Other reviewers have noted, this hotel costs a lot for the room and amenities.  However, we found that location paid off for us.  Located directly across from the DCA park, there is a gate inside the Grand Californian that guests of this hotel can also use.  We found this was super convenient and worth the premium rate.  The other option is a 10-15 minute walk to downtown Disney area to access either theme park.    Room was average size.  They had a small desk in one corner.  This freed up space for a day-bed, which folded down easily and really worked better than a typical sleeper sofa.  So the room was perfect for our party of 5.  Above average bedding and linens.  Decor had a whimsical beach theme with tasteful Disney accents.  Bathroom was a good size with tub.  Sinks and

There is absolutely no reason to stay here and pay this kind of money for what you get.  You will find nicer accommodations nearby for much less money.  Sure, it's convenient to be a little closer to some aspects of the Disney property, but depending on where you stay you will actually find off-site hotels that are closer to the entrance gates.  We were chumps and fell for the promotion of getting into the parks 1 hour earlier by staying at a Disney hotel.  It was not worth it.  The room was very small and had nothing special about it.  Those who compare it to a Holiday Inn are correct.  The pool area is small for the size of the hotel and the hot tub was packed with adults and kids alike so we never could use it.  The assistance at the front desk was slow.  If you can afford

We stayed four nights, from 3/20 to 3/24.  We have a four year old and a six year old, both boys. We all loved DIsneyland, and staying in a Disney hotel was the best decision. Proximity to all and the complete Disney experience are worth paying a little extra.  It was great not to have to deal with driving and parking.    Our hotel room was comfortable, though we spent very little time in it.  The room was quiet.  One thing I noticed was that the sink and shower head are very low, almost as if they are more designed for children than for adults. That wasn't a big deal, but we found it a little humorous. For the first three days of our stay, the pool at Paradise Pier was closed, so we were welcomed to the pool at the Disneyland Hotel, which was amazing for us and for our kids. It

Summary Heading: Great experience - apart from pool being closed
Summary: The staff at the hotel were awesome and really took care of us. They made our 6-year-old daughter feel special for her birthday, upgraded our room and the guest services person was amazing, helping us with everything from booking a character breakfast, figuring out what opened when in the parks and checking us in for our flights. The character breakfast was fun, with many characters and dancing fun for the kids. The only thing that was not great was the pool being closed for construction. We were told that we could use the pools at the Disneyland hotel, which we tried to do on our last day, but we had trouble getting into the pool area. There was no one around so we had to ask a janitor for help from a nearby lobby. Once we got in we could use the pools fine, but found no

Summary Heading: Perfect Disney Stay, Concierge View Room
Summary: We arrived at 9 am after our 13 hour flight and our room was ready. Check was smooth , we picked up our hopper tickets from the front desk too so we were ready to roll. Up the glass elevator( which we used the whole time with no drama) to the 14 th floor and walked into our room, looked outside to the most amazing site.  The room was spacious for the four of us, beds comfortable too. I have read people complain about the pressure in the showers, I didnt find that a prob it just took a while for the water to heat up.  The club lounge was great, wonderful selection of food in the evenings, we ate there 3 of the 4 nights. Hot items included mini quiche, pork stuffed mushrooms and pineapple and steak mini kebabs. Also lovely fresh vege and fruit, cheese , salsa and yummy desserts

No better than staying at a Holiday Inn.  Came for a medical conference with 3 children 13-6 yrs old.  Expecting a better Disney experience staying at the resort.  We have been here many times but chose to stay elsewhere. Not impressed. Pool extremely small and you cannot venture to other pools that are part of the resort which apparently are bigger and better.  Rooms are small and the futon/daybed my 13 yr old slept on was horribly hard.  We received a discount rate as part of the conference, I couldn't imagine spending full price, I'm irritated with the price versus value as it is. Do not recommend.

Recently stayed for three nights at Paradise Pier Hotel a fun treat for my grand-daughters 6th birthday. We flew down from Seattle on Monday 4th March into sunny weather, although did go cold in the evenings. The staff at the hotel were all friendly and accommodating especially guest services. The room we stayed overlooked California Adventure Park so we could watch the spectacular wold of colour show from our window. Beds really comfortable and room ceaned every day. We did the character breakfast one day in the restaurant downstairs, the food was not great, but there were plenty of characters which my grand-daughter loved meeting. The only downside whilst we were there was the pool being closed due to renovation, but we were told that we could use the pool at the Disneyland

Summary Heading: Is the Concierge level, worth the extra money?
Summary: We recently did the Disneyland Anaheim, CA thing – we had some tax refund money to spend and needed to do our part to help stimulate the economy (someone has to do it, right?) so we splurged and went to Disneyland in Anaheim.  Since we live in Northern California it was a short flight on Southwest and I will be posting a separate review on the airport transfers but this review is regarding the upgrade from a ‘standard room’  to a ‘Concierge Room’ at the Paradise Pier which is one of the three Disney resorts in Anaheim.  When booking rooms at any of the Disney Resorts, you have lots of options. Standard Room, Park View Room, Concierge Room, Concierge Park View Room, Suite Park View Room and like any of the rooms at the resorts, they are probably all great rooms but what you pay

Summary Heading: Good Hotel - but the higher the floor the better
Summary: We recently became Disneyland Annual Passholders and to celebrate we thought we would stay a night in one of the Disney owned, on site hotels.  Paradise Pier being the least expensive, its the one we choose.  The room is very comfortable, well appointed and very clean.  The beds and linens are comfortable and the bathroom is nice.    We went to the first room we were given, on the third floor, but there is no view at all from there.  We asked for an upgrade (at an additional cost of course) and went up to a higher floor where we had a stunning view of Disney's California Adventure.  It was well worth the upgrade price.    We did the character breakfast at the downstairs restaurant and while it was fun for a one time thing, I wouldn't do it again. The food was pretty average but

Recently stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier and could not have been more impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel rooms and common areas. I know it's Disney and love their high standards but I felt as if I was at home within this resort. All of the Staff that I came in contact with were lovely and accommodating. Very much enjoyed my entire stay!

Even though this is the cheapest of the three Disney hotels, it doesn't disappoint. The DIsney smiles start at check-in and don't stop. We paid a bit extra for a 'park view' room and it was well worth it - being able to watch the California Adventure Park in action from your room before and after going there. The 'Magic Morning' is great, getting access to the best rides an hour before the parks open to the public. Plus, you have private entrance to California Adventure, so you bypass the queues. The rooms are impeccably clean, and the beds are more comfortable than home. There is plenty of space and the little Disney touches add to the fun. Would return there in a flash.

You say "Paradise Pier Hotel" to people and they reply "Huh?".  Everyone thinks that the Disneyland Hotel is the place to be, well it is, but if room rates are too high or booked up, look into this hidden gem. The hotel is "Disney Clean", the staff is "Disney Friendly", and the location is "Disney Awesome"!  Believe it or not, this hotel is closer to the parks than the Disneyland Hotel.  I went there for a birthday weekend trip, even though I live 5 miles from the resort, and had a great time.  The pool area is small, but I only spent one short afternoon out there.  It had a fun waterslide, and is actually elevated, on the third floor. I really enjoyed the PCH Grill inside the hotel.  It has very affordable prices compared to other Disney table service restaurants.  There is

Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel but go GCH if you can afford it
Summary: After a long flight from Perth Western Australia my wife, two children (ages 4 and 11) and I wished for a seamless check in and a comfortable bed in which to relax.  We arrived to the Paradise Pier at around 10.30am and although there were only a few couples checking in, it seemed to take a while as there was a lot of questions being asked by those checking in. Never mind, after a 15 minute wait was served and the check in lady was wonderful, very efficient and helpful. Unfortunately the pool was out of action for refurbishment, I was a little upset over this as nothing was mentioned when booking and even on the day of check in nothing was posted on website.  We were allowed to use the Disneyland hotel pool but this is a 5 - 10 walk, plus crossing a road and walking through a

2nd stay at Disney - 1st time at Paradise Pier.  It is their lower end hotel.  Everything was ok but underwhelming.    Not much to say about the hotel - was so average, we were a little disappointed and will book at the Grand California Hotel next time.  The shower in the room was awful - no water pressure and no consistent temperature.  Space was ok.  Housekeeping was questionable.  Staff threw out boxes placed on the bed with brand new doll clothes (American Girl) in them. Lobby staff ended up ordering us replacements and shipping them to us however the whole situation seemed a little odd (housekeeping throwing out personal items yet not throwing out empty used coffee cups?).  If not for how the staff took care of this I would have been more upset.    Pool was down the whole

This was the second time we had stayed at Paradise Pier, both times we booked the room with a view and it is definitely worth it. Last time we had a great view of World of Color, this time an OK view of World of Color and a great view of the fireworks. Of course I would prefer to stay at Grand California as it is prime location, but Paradise Pier is far better value for money. The staff are friendly, the rooms are very nice and we love having a day bed in the room without paying extra for it! The restaurant is not as nice as the other hotels, but we usually eat in Downtown Disney. My only complaint is that both times we stayed here, the pool was closed.

For vacation us east coasters took it to the west coast. We are DVC members and are a bit spoiled. We couldn't get into the grand Californian, be sure to book way ahead of time. We ended up at the Paradise Pier Hotel. It's an average hotel at best and the staff must have not been through the Disney academy of hospitality, when we checked in no one told us our pool was closed we had to find out by default. We had to walk over to the disneyland hotel, their pool is really nice. It is cool to be walking distance from everything but that was really the only redeeming quality. The fridge was broken the lights didn't work just annoying little reminders that we were not in a DVC hotel. I usually hate reading reviews like this before my vacation, however just be optimistic and enjoy the

Summary Heading: Cozy, convenient and all about Disney
Summary: We stayed at the Paradise Pier hotel for 3 nights in early January.  The proximity of the hotel to the theme parks was really appealing, and we did manage to find a 'reasonable' rate for this property.  This hotel was originally built by Pan Pacific, and bought and converted to a Disney property.  Even though this is the most modestly priced Disney hotel, I found the rooms to be very well appointed, and the amenities fresh and ample.  The staff were all Disney friendly, and paid great attention to our kids.  The beds in our room were very comfortable, and the surf city themed furnishings were warm and inviting.  The kids loved the decor as well.  Getting to downtown Disney and the parks is VERY quick - and the exclusive entrance to California Adventure is very useful, especially

The staff here were fantastic more than happy to help. The location is fantastic just a short walk and your at down town Disney and Disneyland. Rooms are nice and big the view good. Nice touch with the Mickey mouse theme in the rooms. The only negative I have to say is the cost of the buffet breakfast was not worth the money found most the food to be disgusting especially the pancakes that were hard and not hot.

We stayed here for two nights in September 2012 while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure. It was perfect to be so close to the park and to have the early entrance that came with the hotel room. Room was great - our son loved the beach ball on the bed, we had a pretty good view over the pool and a great view over California Adventure from the windows in the hallway. Had character breakfast at the hotel one morning which was great also. Staff was very helpful. Only problem we had was that they were remodeling the hotel and the main entrance was closed during our stay so our taxi driver had a hard time finding where to enter the hotel area.

I had an opportunity to spend a few days at they Disneyland Resort while on hiatus from work.  I booked a room at Paradise Pier using my Disney Vacation Club points, and I had a very nice stay.  The Cast Members working were very gracious and truly "Disney".  The resort is nicely located, even after a long day of walking around in the parks.  Do yourself a favor and get the park view rooms - spend one night watching World of Color from your room.  They pipe in the music via your television.  Be aware that extra plugs are not easily acessible to all beds.

The cast members who work there are great...the decor is cute but pretty tattered. We were able to use the AMAZING Disneyland Hotel pool because ours was being serviced and we were stoked about that.. I think we will just have to bite the bullet next time and stay at the Disneyland Hotel. You pay more but you get a lot more for your money.

Other than location this hotel doesn't really have much to offer. You are a short 5 min walk to downtown Disney which was great. This hotel reminds me of a Ramada. The decor old.  I would not stay here again.

On Feb. 5th, we decided on a last minute Disney holiday and after SEVERAL phone calls directly to Disney, we decided to pay the extra money and stay on Disney site. One of the reasons was the great rooftop pool. This sounded like nothing we had ever seen before and we were quite excited to see it, watch the fireworks from the pool deck and enjoy what we were told was a better experience than staying across the street (which we have done and after this experience would highly recommend!).  When we arrived, one of the first things we did after check in was race to see the pool. Imagine our shock to find it bone dry! When we asked a staff member, we were informed that it was closed for regular maintence. Regular maintenece?!? We just called! Are you kidding me?!? Were you hoping we

We expected great service and clean rooms from Disney and that is what we got. We stayed for three nights.   The  location was terrific as it was close to Downtown Disney, the monorail station, and California Adventure.  We had a great view of California Adventure Park. The beds and linens were comfortable.            Our only complaint was the ever present odor in the lobby. We believe it came from the dining area. It smelled of bologna. We didn't spend time in the lobby though so this was only a minor issue.  We saw many complaints of long waits at the elevators. We never had to wait. The three elevators were fine.           All this being said, if we return to Disneyland we will consider a cheaper hotel that is close to the park. The stay was great, but much more expensive

Can't say anything negative about this hotel and our stay. The hotel is so very well kept inside and out. Staff is pleasant and helpful. Our room was a regular room; no upgrades and was more than ample in space for 5 people; we only had 2.  Very comfortable beds, large bathrooms, tv, fridge, and safe (which was nice).  Only drawback I have is the parking cost. We valet parked and was charged $22 per nite. Self parking is $15; should have done that.  Overall, would stay again and again. Love the closeness to the park and walking right into California Adventures.

We took our family here for Spring Break last year.  We usually stay at the Disneyland Hotel, but the price here was so much better that we decided to try it.  I paid the extra cost for the concierge, which is worth it and includes gourmet coffee & espresso available all day, snacks & drinks, morning breakfast, evening snacks & beer or wine.  You can even take snacks with you for the park.  The rooms were great and the exercise room was easily accessed.  The pool was being remodeled, but we got a free pass to go to the Disneyland Hotel pool, which was great.  You can't beat the location which has a quick entrance to the California Grand Adventure park for hotel guests only, and a shortcut through the California Grand Hotel to Downtown Disney (there aren't any signs, so you may

Summary Heading: A less expensive option for a full Disney Experince
Summary: I enjoy the Disney Pier.  I love the cool California beachy vibe coupled with the Disney Characters.  It seems closer to the parks to me than the Disneyland hotel... Probably because you can use the private entrance from the Grand.  If you want the Full Disney experience, but at a value.  This is a great pick. However personally I would probably spend the extra and stay at the Disneyland hotel.... It's worth it

This hotel has great restaurants and the Disney service is unbeatable. Close to the parks but unless your staying there you have no reason to go there unlike the other Disney hotels. Which makes it a little bit more private.  The staff was wonderful and very helpful with anything you need.  But yes those elevators are a pain so plan ahead to have to wait in the morning rush to use them.

My husband and I took our 5 and 3 year olds to Disneyland for the first time and stayed at Paradise Pier 2/14-2/17.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The location was so convenient to walk through Downtown Disney and take the monorail in to Disneyland or walk through the Grand Californian to get to California Adventure.  My kids had fun at the pool.  We had the Surf's Up character breakfast on our last morning it was a great way to end our Disney vacation. We booked our package through Costco travel.  Great deal and made the vacation easy to plan!

Summary Heading: It is worth the extra money to a point
Summary: We like staying at Disney Resort properties when taking the family to Disneyland and California Adventure for the following reasons. It is very easy to go back and forth to the hotel as the children's needs indicate throughout the day. The children feel they are still experiencing the Disney element even when it is time to go back to the room. The hour early admittance into the parks is fantastic for hitting the most desired rides before the crowds hit. Riding the Monorail into Tomorrowland or entering through the Grand Hotel avoids the rush at the front gate. Be prepared for a line at these early entry points also though. Park Hopper passes are great too. It began to drizzle and they started closing rides in Fantasyland. The ones still open were rediculously crowded so we went

Summary Heading: Great Choice & Walking Distance to Parks
Summary: This was our third stay at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel.  As always, we enjoyed our stay.  This was the first time we did NOT have a theme park view, and IMHO the upgraded view is worth the extra money.    We find the rooms to have very nice Disney touches -- our kids LOVE the beach ball pillows. The rooms are nice and bright,  very clean and nicely appointed. There's a mini fridge in the room which proves to be a money saver.  The rooms have ample storage with a large closet and a lovely tv console with drawers.  A family of four would have adequate storage for a long weekend or so.    All of the staff we encountered were friendly and knowledgeable.  They all seemed versed in that Disney magic:-)  My only complaint was that the pool was closed for refurbishment.  The hotel made

Family goes every year and stays at the Disneyland Hotel.  This year we stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel for the first time and it was disappointing for Disney.  We had problems at checkin where they over charged our card and didn't know how to fix it.  It took an hour, multiple people, and the person who made the mistake wasn't friendly.  Our room had water pressure issues, lacked towels, glasses were not replaced with clean ones, and other small issues. Breakfast with the characters wasn't very good.  For the price ($300+) we wouldn't stay here again.  The main towers are much nicer, maintained, and friendly staff.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay At DisneyLand
Summary: My wife and I, together with our 4 1/2 year old and 10 month old baby, really enjoyed this hotel.  Very close to the entrance of the 2 parks and Downtown Disney (10 minute walk - can cut through the Grand Californian Hotel - can enjoy that beautiful hotel without the expense!).   Totally recommend the rooms with the view of California Adventure (we were on the 8th floor).  Since we are from NY, we were very tired at around dinner time, so we went back to the hotel and enjoyed World of Color and also the DisneyLand fireworks from our room!  We ate at the character breakfast in the hotel one morning.  It was a wonderful experience for our children.  The staff were great and there were enough characters to go around...including Mickey!  Although on the high side, the breakfast

Summary Heading: Great hotel; convenient to downtown disney
Summary: The staff was very personable and the beds were incredibly comfortable. We were there to see a concert at House of Blues. This hotel was a great location for that; easy walking distance.  It was a little odd when we drove up the valet didn't offer to park the car but rather directed us where to self- park.

Paradise pier Stayed here with my husband for four nights over valentines day weekend, and True Love  Week. It was my first trip to Disneyland and my husbands first trip as an adult (he went once when he was in 2nd grade). We are in our early 30s and recently got married so this was our Disneymoon! We love Disney World and have been there many times and my husband had to travel to California for work so he extended his trip and I met him out there to go to Disneyland.    We thought the hotel was very nice and worth the money to be close to the parks. Every day we went back to the hotel either in the afternoon or at night and then returned to the parks again. The walk was quick, through the grand Californian most times, and once we walked the entire length of downtown Disney,

This hotel is just across the street of Disney's California Adventure, but you there is some walking involve to get the the theme parks and Downtown Disney.  We were situated on the 13th floor...yes the 13th floor with an amazing view of the entire California Adventure Park (see pictures) so be sure to ask for the park view when making an reservation or when checking in. The hotel made my Valentines day much easier by arranging a gift set for my wife that contained several items (see pictures). This was left inside the room between 4-6pm and when we got back after dinner, she was surprise to see this on the center table.  Tickets for both theme parks are available for purchase during check-in and there is an arcade room, waiting room with tv (beach like themed room) for the

Summary Heading: Great location, no the best dining facilities!
Summary: We loved our stay at Paradise Pier. The only down side to the stay was that the dining facilities weren't all that great. When we wanted to eat we ended up heading to downtown Disney or over to Disneyland Grand hotel where the restaurants were alot better! Room was clean and comfortable.

Summary Heading: Good location - close to Disney & Convention Center
Summary: I was in Anaheim for a large trade show at the Anaheim Convention Center ... the Paradise Pier hotel was in walking distance (~10-12 mins) and much less expensive than the Hilton or Marriott (that are right next to the Convention Ctr) ... it's also right across the street from Disney's California Adventure park (too bad there was no time!).  A good choice if you're attending a convention.  The hotel is fine ... decent rooms, relatively well updated (this hotel was not built by Disney, so it doesn't have some of the Disney touches, but they've renovated the rooms in the past few years) ... with a couple of issues:    There are only 3 1/2 elevators, which can cause long waits in the morning (especially going down, for some reason) ... when I say "3 1/2" elevators, there are 3

Summary Heading: We had a great time with one concern
Summary: We stayed at the Paradise Pier for a week at the end of January 2013. Overall, the stay was great. There was a negative that I'll get to later. It was the first time Disney visit for our two kids (12 & 8) and we don't know when we'll do it again, so we chose to spend more to get the "Disney Experience" with a theme hotel, the magic mornings, etc. Being able to walk to the parks and Downtown Disney was great for us. The atmosphere of the hotel was nice and the staff was always friendly and trying to help. We were there during a less busy season for the Theme Parks, that's why we went at this time. I don't think the hotel was full, so I can't address  We reserved an upper level, theme park view room with the Concierge package (or Beachcomber Club Level Amenities). The room was

Summary Heading: We will be back in March. "Cutest kids"
Summary: We love this place and are looking forward to returning in March. We will utilize the free grocery delivery to our room. Ask the front counter clerk because they don't advertise the service. We will save money and eat picnic style meals for lunch in our room and have bagels/pastries for breakfast. There is a refrigerator in the room to store food for our young kids. You can save money overall if you manage you money. That will give you a little more for the fun stuff like souvenirs.

We stayed for 6 days and 5 nights. 2 adults and 2 children under 5.  Pros: Clean, NO bed bugs, roaches, fleas, or rodents. Nice atmosphere, great views of park from park view room. We watched the World of Color and the Fireworks from our window! Close walk to parks, about 12 minute walk with 2 strollers. Gift shop had Childrens Advil and car was safe in parking lot. Souvieners not stolen and check out was easy.  Cons: 1-The shower head is beyond horrible and the staff says that is normal because they are trying to conserve water. If you have hair past your shoulders you will not be able to wash it due to no water pressure and horrible, leaky, calcium crusted shower head. No joke. It was aweful! 2-Housekeeping does NOT clean your room. They make the beds (only changing the sheets

Traveled with my friend and had a great time at this hotel. Rooms were really nice, big and cleaned every day. Restaurant's were great, pool area lovely, wifi good in the room. Staff exceedingly helpful and smiley. Thanks for a brilliant stay, would come back for sure :)

I booked two rooms in January to celebrate my daughters 18th Birthday. I would normally choose a hotel off property, but decided to splurge on a Disney hotel. Mary Lou at the front desk spoiled us upon arrival! She accommodated our request for adjoining rooms and gave us all colorful buttons to wear in the parks. Entrance to the parks is just a short walk to the Grand Californian. There were 7 of us so we found this convenient for those who needed a break from the parks.

Over the last 10 years I have done quite a lot of traveling, staying in all types of hotels & this hotel (the Paradise Pier) has the WORST internet connections of any I've ever stayed in.  I've stayed at cheap hotels with better connection than this hotel & it's a "resort" hotel?  The rooms are nice, staff is very nice, location to the parks is ok if you are a very healthy, illness free person.   It is a long walk for someone with back issues to the Disneyland Park.  If you don't need internet connection & all you want is a fairly close place to the park then this is a fairly good hotel to stay in but it is NOT worth the money when you have kids that want that Wi-Fi for all their "toys".  They have NO Wi-Fi, it is Ethernet connections only.  I know if I ever come back to CA I

Summary Heading: Just back from a all around Disney experience
Summary: O.k., we are not the type of traveler to stay in the Disney hotels, mostly due to price.  We have stayed at many of the hotels on Harbor before and been quite happy with the price and location of those in the past.  This trip, we thought will be our last one to Disneyland for quite awhile, so we opted for the Disney experience.    The hotel is comfortable, clean, and what I would expect from a Disney hotel.  The beds were very comfortable and I slept soundly each night.  The rooms look just like the website pictures so there are no surprises there.  Having a refrigerator in the room is a definite plus for us traveling with food allergies.  Plenty of storage for unpacking bags and food we brought.  Bathroom was roomy and bathtub was clean.  chocolates on the beds each night was

We booked our room on the concierge level because my husband wanted a patio area so he can lounge outside and enjoy the lovely78 degree weather.  I would encourage anyone to upgrade to the concierge level just for the fact that they offer snacks, wine, beer and soda throughout the day, plus a fresh continental breakfast.  Other services on this level are helpful if you need assistance with tickets, tours or just want to lounge around somewhere besides your room or in the parks.  The pools at the hotel are great, plus they have a huge waterslide that my son absolutely loved.  The restaurants and bars in the hotel are fabulous and offer a character breakfast.  The gift shop is also nice for the last minute gifts that you might have forgotten to buy at the park.  We visited the

We have stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel at Disneyland many times and found it wonderful.  This time we stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel for a change.  What a lovely hotel!!!  It felt warm and friendly.  If I had small children this is definitely the hotel I would take them to.   Every staff member was friendly.   The rooms are pretty much the same layout as the Grand Californian but the prices are cheaper at Paradise Pier.  I have to commend Karen at the Bar.  She was so warm and friendly.  She could not do enough for us.  She was never short of a story and a good laugh.

Summary Heading: NOW I see the difference between Disney and "Good Neighbors"
Summary: I have been going to the Disneyland Resort for 20+ years now and almost always stayed at a "Good Neighbor" hotel for budget reasons.  I could not stomach the idea of spending $250-400+ a night at a Disney property when I could get other accommodations around the park for under $100.  We decided to give the Paradise Pier a try for one reason only: location.  Except for the Grand Californian, there is no closer hotel to the parks.  So having given Disney a shot, I can see the differences.  The property was CLEAN, and I mean SPOTLESS.  I have never seen a property this well cared for.  Our 5th floor room was nice and comfortably fit the five of us with 2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper.  The couch bed wasn't your typical futon or pullout, but the seat panel flipped over and became a

We stayed here for 2 nights on an LA stopover and really enjoyed our time here. We are regular guests in Disney hotels in Orlando, Florida and were interested by the differences.  Check in was smooth and friendly, and concierge/bell services were very prompt and helpful with our cases and getting a wheelchair for me. Room was spacious, clean and modern with a subtle theming to Disney. This was really the major difference with Florida Disney hotels, the theming was minimal at Paradise Pier. There was one large (Donald Duck) poster which was fun, and a few small "mouse" touches, but it didn't scream Disney in the way the Florida properties do but was nicely decorated and welcoming.  The walk into Disneyland and California Adventure wasn't too far - around ten to fifteen minutes (I

Summary Heading: Decent (but pricey) hotel in good location
Summary: We stayed at Paradise Pier for two nights in between Christmas and New Years.  It's a really nice hotel and has the benefit of being on site at DisneyLand (a 10-15 walk) from park entrance.  We've stayed a lot at DisneyWorld resort hotels in recent years. In terms of size and theming its not a patch on what's in Florida and its pretty pricey (five star prices for three to four star facilities).  That said. the service was Disney quality from start to finish. My wife has mobility issues right now and they offered a wheelchair for the duration of our stay for no charge.  The first night we arrived quite late. We watched the DisneyLand fireworks from by the swimming pool the first night before retiring for a good room service dinner.   The room is a reasonable size with a comfy bed

This hotel has both pluses and minuses.  The pluses: lovely decorations in the room, convenient location to the back door Disney Resort guest visitor entrance to California Adventure and great view of the fireworks on pool deck.  The minuses: the hotel convenience store has short hours, the one restaurant is poor and for this high rise, the elevators are horrible.    If you pay for an upgrade for a Park View, you won't regret it.  From our room (we had an upper floor view) we saw California Adventure Theme Park and could watch Disney's World of Color Spectacular as well as the fireworks.  This was not an optimal view but lovely if you're too tired or have small children that need to sleep.    The hotel rooms appear to have been refurbished in the relatively near past and the

Summary Heading: A Short Walk to Disneyland/California Adventure
Summary: Second time staying here. It is USUALLY the least expensive of the 3 Disney properties. The rooms are clean, beds comfortable, but the rooms are somewhat small. Their are 2 elevators, an on-site restaurant, and very nice pool area. The staff are very accommodating. It is somewhat difficult depending on where you park to get your luggage in and out of the hotel. Pull-up to the back and unload before you park. It is a short walk thru The Grand Californian straight into California Adventure.

I LOVE the convenience of staying at Disneyland hotel properties and have stayed at each of the three Disneyland hotels. When booking for this weekends trip, we couldn't get a room at our favorite (Disneyland or Grand California) for the Saturday night of our stay and finally called the reservation line for some assistance to find out the reason why was the Tinkerbell half marathon. We managed to get into the Paradise Pier for Saturday. We arrived in the evening to a welcoming staff and a room with a beautiful view of California Adventure and the World of Color. The nightmare came just a few hours into our sleep. The windows seemed like they may have been open as they started setting up the street out front for the marathon. Trucks and loading gear beeping, then after 3am came

Summary Heading: Better off at a good neighbor hotel
Summary: My family is all about Disney.  We were pretty disappointed witht the hotel.  Nothing special and it was quite the walk.  We should have stayed at one of the food neighbor hotels that are much closer in proximity.

Summary Heading: 2nd Time Even More Incredible - 2013 Tinker Bell Half Marathon
Summary: After having a wonderful stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel for the 2012 Tinker Bell Half Marathon, we decided to stay here again for 2 nights the 2013 Tinker Bell race.  This trip exceeded our expectations yet again.  We had a very early flight into John Wayne airport, arriving at 8am.  We got to the hotel at 8:30 and we were pleasantly surprised when they told us that our room was ready.  We were delighted to find out that we had a room on the 10th floor overlooking California Adventure. One night, we were able to watch the World of Color show from our room and with the window open, we had no problem hearing the soundtrack.  That was a great treat since we needed to turn in early for the race and had to miss being in the park to see the show.  Our group ran the 5K on Saturday

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier Theme Park View Suite
Summary: We stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel in October and loved it. One bedroom suite with theme park view and concierge. The property was very clean and grounds were nicely landscaped, the Cast Members very friendly. The view of DCA was GREAT from both the bedroom and living room and you can see the backside of World of Color. The beds and pillows were cozy we had no trouble getting comftorable and falling asleep. The room had a small fridge and microwave as well as a safe and ironing board and iron. Big table with four chairs in the living room with a L shaped couch flat screen tv with dvd player. The bedroom had 2 queen beds a desk and chair with flat screen and dvd as well. Two full baths double sink with bathtub and shower in the bedroom, and single stand up shower in the living

Great, fun hotel. We got a park facing room which really did have a great view of the california park so we could see the water show in the park from our room with the soundtrack on tv. The room was great for the 5 of us. There is a fair sized pool and water slide which was fun for the kids. Only a short walk to the parks. No breakfast included unfortunately so that's one more expensive disneyland meal to pay for. However definately worth being in an actual disney hotel for the extra magic hour in the park, it was fab.

Walking in, you get the feeling that the hotel is not a Disney hotel. It feels and looks like an outdated hotel that used to belong to another chain. There really is no Disney feel to it. Even comparing the gift store in the hotel to the gift stores in the other hotels, you can see the difference. Sterile basic hotel gift store with Disney merchandise.  Nevertheless, the desk staff was friendly, as were the valet people.  Here is a dining tip. The food at the Surf's Up in Paradise Pier is better than the food in Storyteller's Cafe, at the Grand Californian across the street. The place is smaller, but we found the food tastes much better here.

Summary Heading: A great place to crash!   Fun stuff for the kids.
Summary: The two days our family was in this hotel was such a nice place to crash after all day in Disneyland.   The fact we could just walk back to the hotel was nice!   Rooms were clean, staff was very kind, gift shop had wine for Mommy too!  There were great perks with a kids movie room, game room, pool, and hot tub.  Thank you Paradise Pier staff for the friendly welcome and enjoyable stay!

The proximity, the extra magic hour, and the Disney extras make it worthwhile if you can afford the premium.  First - the extra magic hour, for Disney resort residents the extra hour before the general public is essential to get in the big rides.  Second - a nice short and pleasant walk through downtown Disney to the entry to the parks.  Better dinner options at downtown on the walk home.  Finally some nice touches of Mickey throughout the hotel to extend the experience for the family.

We have stayed on property at Disneyland 4 times.  Twice at the Grand Californian and twice at Paradise Pier.  This past trip to Paradise Pier was in a standard non-view room.  My last review of Paradise Pier (in 2011) was in a view concierge room.  We had a great visit in 2011 but this one was just so so.  When we arrived it was quite late (11:30pm), we were all tired but excited to be at Disneyland.  The check in person was not unfriendly or rude but there was no dialgoue...just asked our name and got our paperwork.  I always think a little small talk is welcoming...especially when we are the only people at the front desk...there was no one anywhere around us so we were it, as far who needed any assistance.  We asked about upgrading to a view room but it would have added an

Summary Heading: Will upgrade to alternative next time i come to Disneyland
Summary: A very well kept and run property with all the benefits of being on a Disney hotel. Staffed excellently, very well maintained and decorated.  Everything "works" right.  Great beds, good pillows, superb in-room climate control unit.  Many other pluses made my family vacation very enjoyable. That being said, my next Disney vacation will be at either of the two other Disney hotels.  The "discount" you get for staying at this location is not worth its minuses: No in-room microwave, no direct entry to park, very small standard rooms with hardly any carpet space to place luggage, or table space for an in-room meal. Bottom line, you're paying as if you're in the park, but you're not, have to walk half a mile or more and cross streets to join the other more fortunate Disney vacationers

So I decided to ask my wife where would she like to go for our 25 year Anniversary, no limits. Her response " I wanna go to Disney land". So online I went, booked the flight and the hotel. Arrived at the LAX and after some difficulties with lost luggage(mine), we boarded the shuttle and off we went. Arrived at the hotel, and the registering was quick and painless. The desk staff were more than helpful with any inquiries that we had and assisted in booked a dinner on that special night. Our room was basic with a partial view of the park, it was clean enough but did have a worn down appearance. The location was great as with any of the Disney hotels. The food was good, not great. There was some construction going on but at no time did this affect our stay. As we basically only

Just returned from a 5-night stay at Disney's Paradise Pier.   As we drove up, we were immediately greeted by the valet and bell captain.  Our party of 5 made our way at 7a to the front desk and again was immediately greeted, she was very friendly and knowledgable.  Knowing that our room wouldn't be ready at that time, we checked in and had them hold our luggage while we headed for the park.  When our room was available, we received a text from the front desk.  We headed back to the hotel to unpack.  Our room was beautiful with plenty of room for the 5 of us.   It was clean and quiet.  We had a huge window that overlooked California Adventure Park.  From our room we could watch the World of Color and the nightly fireworks show.  The room had a refrigerator (which I had requested

We have been Disneyland junkies since our first child turned 2. For the past 7 years, we have been annual pass holders, and have stayed at probably 10 different properties around the park—including all 3 Disney properties.  Disneyland resort hospitality at the park and in their hotels is truly unrivaled. I have no idea what some of these reviewers are talking about.  When my daughter tripped and spilled her $6 popcorn she got inside the park all over the Paradise Pier lobby, a cast member literally came running from across the room to first make sure she was okay. Then before she could even get upset about spilling her popcorn, he assured her that he would go get a fresh batch and refill her bucket for free.  That set the tone for the entire trip.  They treated my daughter like

We stayed at the hotel to be close to the park. Did not see the point in spending the money to stay at The Grand since we would hardly be in the room.  The staff was very friendly and accomidating. The person who checked us in was Randy and she was great .  We told her it was our anniversary and she gave us buttons to wear in the park.   We were given a room on the 14th floor with a terrific view of California Adventure. We were able to see The World of Color from our room.  The bed was comfy and the decor clean and simple.  Would definitely stay here again! Tip:  Use the entrance to California Adventure through the Grand.  It will save you a lot of time.  Call ahead to Dine Disney for reservations to resturants well in advance  to make sure you get a table otherwise you will

We stayed at this hotel for one night soley to be close to Disneyland and to gain early admittance into the park.  The hotel was fine -- nothing special.  Felt a bit like an old Crown Plaza with a fresh coat of paint.  We didn't use the restaurants because we ate in Downtown Disney.  My only complaint about the room is that the shower heads were at chin level (I'm 5'9"), so in order to wash my hair, I had to point the shower head straight out and bend my knees.  This is for some reason fairly common in California though.  So, this does NOT feel anything like a $350 per night hotel, but we knew it wouldn't - you're paying for the location, and it was great for convenient access to the park -- I don't understand the reviews that said it's a long walk or not that convenient.  Cross

Exellent stay. Arrived at 1Oam and our room was ready, thanks Jerry for being so friendly and efficient. Rooms was clean and comfortable. Walking distance to the parks. Excellent stay on the 7th floor with good views of the park.  Had meals at the park

Summary Heading: Cold showers and no water pressure... otherwise decent.
Summary: My husband and I stayed here two nights. Fortunately we were getting a pretty big discount because we know someone who works at Disney - otherwise this review would be a LOT worse. Basically, this is a mediocre hotel. The staff, like all Disney staff, are really nice and attentive. The rooms are clean and decent. But it's nothing special.  And of course the most notable feature was the total lack of water pressure. Showering was like taking a spit bath. And the water was warm at best, and downright cold whenever anyone else nearby was also taking a shower. For some reason it was easier to get hot water by running the tub, so we ended up taking baths instead of showers, which is not really my cup of tea.  The other issue is that - while the view of California Adventure is

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a Disneyland vacation
Summary: My family and I just got back from a week at Disney's Paradise Pier hotel with the Concierge level. First, the hotel itself was fabulous. We were given a Cabana room which is the 3rd floor with an outside patio that has a path to the pool. The room was pretty big compared to the good neighbor hotel rooms at Candy Cane Inn, very clean, 2 queen beds were very comfortable, lots of pillows, good quality amenities (spa shampoo, lotion, mouthwash, body wash), nice sized bathroom, DVD player, desk with laptop (WIFI a little slow) outlet, turn down service (first night with rice crispy treat mickey mouses, the other nights were chocolate Disney coins). The Concierge level was worth the extra money for us. The Concierge clubhouse offered breakfast (assorted cereals, bagels, cream cheese,

Summary Heading: WDW to DL in One Day
Summary: This was an exciting trip for BFF and I.  We had talked for years about trying to do WDW and DL iin one day.  Will for my 41st BDay we did it.  We hit Epcot Soarin and DHS Tower of Terror the morning of Dec 6th raced to the airport and flight left at 1130 and arrived in Anaheim at 4:30 checking in to Paradise Pier at 530(traffic was terrible) and hit DLA Soarin and Tower of Terror and DL pirates that evening.  Exhausted doesn't even describe how we felt but we can say we did it.  Now on to the review:  Check-in was a breeze and front desk staff was wonderful.  They even gave us a couple of fast passes for my BDay and our journey.  They came in handy.  Hotel was nice but nothing to write home about.  Clean, friendly and rooms comfortable but for the price it could have been

I must say I was impressed with the Paradise Pier. After staying at the Disneyland Hotel, I said I wouldn't go back. The atmosphere was amazing but that was about it. At the Paradise Pier, we had a good view, the rooms were a little bland, but the customer service was excellent. I stayed with my grandmother who has a hard time walking long distances, so they found us a room right next to the elevator. It was a little noisy in the hallway being next to the elevator, but it calmed down around 9 p.m. and was quiet for the rest of the night. The rooms were very clean and passed our cleanliness tests (The Disneyland Hotel did not). It was a nice walk from the hotel through downtown disney and onto the monorail. The price was less than the other Disneyland Hotels, but still more than

This was or third stay this year. Our other two stays were great, which is why we decided to stay here again. Each stay we have booked a conceirge view room.Each time we have gotten a different room on a different floor. We arrived November 14th,2012. The front of the hotel was closed off. You could not walk through the lobby, or out to the parks this way. Our taxi driver dropped us off at the back of the hotel. The Lobby had a big curtain around it. It was also closed the first day of our stay. There was  one family checking in. As a conceirge guest you can check in downstairs or on the second floor in the conceirge lounge. Not knowing if our room would be ready at 12pm we decided to check in downstairs incase we needed to store our suitcases with the bell hop. The cast member

Summary Heading: A bit disappointed in Paradise Pier
Summary: In August I booked four rooms for our family Christmas reunion at Disneyland Paradise Pier Hotel.  One room for us was specified as a handicap/ADA room with other rooms near by.  I reconfirmed twice before the trip, once when I made (by phone) the deposit for four rooms.  Upon arrive, one son with family arrived first and was given an available room on 13th floor.  They immediately headed out to the park to begin using their 3-day Park Hopper.  When we arrived later in the morning with our daughter and were registering, she confirmed that one room was ADA, and it appeared they did not have that in their computer, although it was clearly stated on our confirmation.  It was a rather lengthy process to put us, our daughter and other son on the 9th floor near our ADA room.

Last time we went to Disneyland 18 months ago, we splurged and stayed at the Grand Californian.  This time, we decided to try Paradise Pier, where we haven't stayed since our honeymoon 13 years ago.  This hotel has some pros, such as the location.  It is right across the street from the Grand Californian, so it is only a slightly longer walk to get into the parks.  The rooms are very nicely appointed, providing a safe, and a couch which folds out into a bed, thereby sleeping 5 people, or a nice place for putting wiggly children :)  We chose to upgrade, and we were placed on the 11th floor overlooking DCA, and we were able to watch World of Color right from our room which was great!  We had to switch rooms the first night though - we were placed in room 1102 which is right near

Arrived at the hotel the 25th of Nov. with my wife, kids  and grandkids (one of them an infant) at t 3:00pm since they list 3:00pm as the check in time.
