Had two connecting rooms, rooms were not ready. Had to seat at the coffee shop/bar to wait for the rooms to be ready, they text me 3:20pm and said that one of the rooms was ready, took the elevator to it and when we arrived the maid was still working on it had not even made the beds yet (not her fault). Went back downstairs and complained all they could say at the front desk is "we are so sorry". We finally got our rooms at 4:20pm. I feel that for the money they charge management should be more on the ball. This is the the second time we stayed here and we have stayed at Disneyworld hotels and never had a complain before. They

We enjoyed our concierge room on the top (15th) floor overlooking California Adventure - enjoyed watching World of Color and the fireworks from our window -- not a complete view but an interesting perspective.  The perk of comp food all day for concierge level guests was great.  Our only complaint was no elevator in the parking garage.  A wonderful experience that we look forward to enjoying again.

There are a lot of hotels within walking distance of Disneyland that are a lot cheaper than any of the official Disneyland hotels and I’m sure some of them are probably better, but there is something nice about staying on Disney property when you visit a Disney park.  I took a calculated gamble and waited to make my booking until there was a sale and made quite a significant saving as a result so our room was a bit overpriced, but not outrageously expensive.  Paradise Pier is the cheapest of the Disneyland hotels so the facilities are reasonably basic, but it is extremely clean and comfortable. Everything works well and the surroundings are pleasant.  We were upgraded on arrival to a room with a view of the California Adventure park, which was nice. On the downside, we thought

Summary Heading: Hotel & Concierge service - plus and minus
Summary: I think we have been spoiled by the Grand California Hotel.  That said, here are the plus and minus: Paradise Pier is close to California Adventure Park w/ fantastic view of night shows/lights;  Short walk to special entrance inside Grand California Hotel; a little cheaper than the other two Resort Hotels;  Rooms were clean & comfortable; Housekeeping was quick;  The Concierge Lounge was easily accessible with some vegetation accent (well kept gardens).   Minus:  Concierge breakfast was all carbs and did not vary in menu options;  dessert options did not vary with only a few choices; elevators slow!!!; Swimming pool area and public areas did not offer any private sitting areas as did Disneyland Hotel and Grand California.  From now on we will stay at Grand California and

Summary Heading: a treat to stay at a Disney Hotel
Summary: 2 nights spent at Disney hotel, Paradise Pier.  Would I spend that much money on a hotel again just because it is a Disney hotel?  Probably not. Having said that the room was lovely although we couldn't get a king size bed as there are only 10 in the whole hotel, we figured due to it being family orientated. We were told there was no internet available in the room which was disappointing but in fact had internet connection from Disney hotel. Check in was easy and the folks at the front desk were very helpful. We had a cocktail and snack in the lounge and that was yummy!!! Disneyland was buckets of fun. Room service for breakfast was quick and tasty.

Summary Heading: 13th Floor Room w/ Direct View of World of Color! Spectacular!
Summary: In the past, we've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel...this time, we thought we'd give the Paradise Pier a try, primarily because we could get a better deal there - higher room floor for less money. The staff was wonderful in every way - exactly what you'd expect from a Disney hotel. The theatre room and arcade were perfect for our children, ages 8, 5 and 5. The hotel itself lacked a little charm, but the view at the top made our stay entirely worthwhile. The second we opened our curtains to see all the lights of California Adventure, we were as happy as could be. There was no need to brave the crowd to see World of Color - we watched the pyrotechnics from our room and that was sufficient for us.The room was perfectly clean - I even took a bath one night, which is extremely rare

Summary Heading: Thank you for giving us a magical experience
Summary: We stayed here over halloween for my daughters make a wish trip and were treated with such kindness. I know our experience will be different from other guests but am still very impressed with everyone's willingness to help and make us comfortable.  The rooms were clean and so fun to come back to and see how housekeeping placed the stuffed animals in different arrangements every evening.  When her stroller broke the first night the engineers came up quickly and did their very best and were very helpful.  The children had a great time with the pool and slides, and enjoyed the glass elevator.  The laundry facility was clean and very convenient. The location is a little further than the other two resorts but still walking distance was no problem.  It was great to be able to get into

Summary Heading: Great Room and easy access to Disneyland
Summary: We were visiting Disneyland to remember my Grandfather who had just passed, this was one of his and his wife's favorite places.  Paradise Pier is a great alternative to Disneyland Hotel for a slightly better rate but not sacrificing quality and fun.  Breakfast was lacking here as it seems to be at all Disneyland Hotels, go to Downtown Disney.  It is a brief walk to Disneyland from here, and you can cut through the Grand Californian to get to a back entrance to California Adventure and skip the bag check lines.  Rooms were very clean and all the staff were very helpful.

Summary Heading: Good location, nice staff, but not much to the hotel itself. Disney fans will be pleased.
Summary: If you're reading this review you probably fall into one of two categories. You're either planning your first stay at a Disneyland Resort Hotel or you've stayed at either the Disneyland or Grand Californian Hotels and wondering if Paradise Pier is worthwhile.   Let me start by saying that all three Disneyland Hotels are expensive. There are significantly cheaper options in the area. If you're like my wife and I though, you know that Disney brings a certain level of service to their theme parks and this extends to the hotels. For the added benefits like early admission, the private entrance to Disney California Adventure and truly being walking distance from everything, I think the stay is well worth it.  Paradise Pier is the least expensive of the three Resort hotels. It was

Booked through a travel agent.  Rooms are clean and comfortable but nothing special.  Must be insulation in the walls because it was very quiet and it was at 100% capacity when we were there.  The only noise we heard was from the hall and one night a baby crying.  Noise sounded like it was traveling trough the air vent system. I was concerned about being a few floors over the pool but it was not bad.  Elevators are very busy in the early AM so take the stairs down.  The best part of this hotel is the location.  Just across the street from the much more expensive Grand CA, we were able to use the side entrance to CA Adventure and the direct entrance to Disney's Main street.  Super convenient.  Loved not having to walk a mile in the morning or evening and being able to pop back to

We wanted to make our daughter's birthday a really special occasion so we chose a two night stay at Disney's Paradise Pier because it was the least expensive of the three properties.  Why does Disney charge such exorbitant prices to stay at their hotels?  Because people will pay it.  Still, we were pleased to observe that Disney understands that their guests pay top dollar and therefore deliver top notch service.  We paid $ 335.00 a night for a standard two queen bed room.  Officially this would have meant, having a view away from the resort, but upon finding out that we were celebrating a birthday, the gracious desk "cast member", upgraded us to a resort view, which meant we could see California Adventure.  Our family was delighted to note that the same Disney environment that

If you are going to Disneyland you must stay in the park.  We stayed here for 6 nights then went on the Disney  Cruise.  The experience was MAGICAL - staff were fabulous and to have the parks on your door step is ideal - we had our 7 year old with us and she loved it.  Highly recommended!  The halloween party was also brilliant.

originally booked 3 night stay here. Needed an extra night due to flight cancellation by hurricane Sandy. They were very accommodating and were even able to keep us in the same room. Very clean over all with reasonably priced 24 hr laundry facilities. Very convenient to Disney Land and Downtown Disney. Less than a 10 minute walk and you are there. Good housekeeping staff and quick with service and problem solving. We would stay there again

We have just returned from our six night stay at Disney's Paradise Pier hotel.  Right from check in, I knew we were going to have a wonderful stay - and we did!  Everyone working at this hotel no matter what their job wants you to have the best stay possible and the positive and friendly attitude that we encountered throughout our visit made our stay even better.  Our room was cleaned in a timely fashion each day and was a welcome sanctuary after a day of walking through the parks with our two little guys.  We had a two queen bedroom on the 13th floor (can't believe there was actually a 13th floor) and it was very spacious.  The beds were very comfortable and each came topped with four pillows.  In the closet there were extra blankets and a pack n' play.  Bathroom had all the

I chose this hotel for my son's first trip to Disneyland. I wanted something special but didn't want to go overboard on the price. It was petfect. We were upgraded to a park view room, over looking California Adventure. We watched the fire works and World of Color every night from our room. Service was great. Room was a small. But an overall good experience my son will remember.

The Disneyland Hotels are all pretty expensive, but this was the least expensive option of the three onsite hotels, so we thought we'd give it a try. The room was nice... modern and clean. Had everything we needed.  My son (3) and husband are both avid swimmers, so we had in mind that we'd hit the park in the morning, and rest up at the pool in the afternoon to avoid my son getting overwhelmed with everything. But, the pool was pretty boring for kids, with the exception of the one large slide. The poolside bar was also closed and I guess they are refurbishing a large area and it was pretty poorly signed and communicated.   Overall, this was just ok. Not bad but not great either...

Pricier than the standard hotels that surround the park, but the Disney perks that were expected to go with a Disney hotel completely lived up to expectations.  Early park hours, right beside World of Color for a comfortable seat, room card charge opportunity in the park and downtown Disney (so that no wallet was needed!) and Disney themed activities... all were provided with the room.  Being on a busy street, I expected it to be noisy, but it was surprisingly quiet.  The lobby and pool were quite active because of the number of children, but at night it was very peaceful.    Given the convenience of being right next door to the park I am tempted to make this our future destination for Disney given the 20 minutes to and from the Orlando parks.

Last January we stayed at the Grand Californian and this trip we tried Paradise Pier.  Both trips were fairly quick, just 2 or 3 days.  I found that for these quick trips in which you are just trying to jam in as much park time as humanly possible I would suggest Paradise Pier.  It doesn't have the massive lobby and super pretty pool area but pretty much the rooms have the same layout and room service is too expensive in both.  If you plan on staying a week or more then you ought to spend a bit more and try the Grand Californian.  It has shops, is closer to the park, and get a view of the park to experience the World of Color.  But if all you are doing is sleeping at the hotel save your money and stay at Paradise Pier.  It is clean and nice.  The cheapest rooms do face a parking

I invited a friend to spend 3 nights @ the Paradise Pier hotel since I was attending a TA seminar the following week and staying at an offsite hotel.  I booked a concierge room, and was very excited when we checked in and they offered a corner room on the 15th floor! What an impressive view, especially when watching (and listening, since they stream the sound on tv) the World of Color!! We were so thrilled and pleased with the room.  It was quiet, clean and bright and colorful.  The closet space was large, the bathroom was spacious, and we loved the laundry basket on the floor in the bathroom for dirty towels! Unfortunately I came down with a terrible chest cold so by the last night I decided to stay in, and I wasn't unhappy because I felt so comfortable and I ended up ordering

Stayed 8/14-8/21/12 Paradise Pier is located across the street from Grand California. Which made it pretty easy to walk to both parks, The rooms were nothing special and the pool is a simple rectangle. It has a separate slide which the kids enjoyed. The downside was no pool grill area to get snacks, burgers or umbrella drinks for Mom. Most Disney pools the Pool grill/bar area you can keep an eye on the kids while you get your fancy Mommy's on vacay drink or there are waiters/waitresses that walk around and bring you food/drinks. PP did not have that a minus in my books. Also the elevators seemed to take a long time. The real big positive was breakfast at Surf's Up with Mickey. We stayed at Disneyland for 2 weeks and this was the best breakfast we had and we went to Goofy's

Expensive as it wears the "Disney" name. But as expected, hotel is clean and lifts can take away (as well as check in).  If you dont get a room facing the park you get a pretty massive view of nothing - but it's still a veiw =)  Other than that nothing out of the ordenary to report.

Summary Heading: Awesome stay in this Disney hotel
Summary: Stayed from 10/14-10/19/12.  We were on the 7th floor with a view of Paradise Pier @ California Adventure.  The Cast Members here were all so welcoming and friendly and so very helpful.  The room was spotless and beautiful.  Beds and pillows were so comfy - great sleep here.  There were 2 queen beds and a couch and desk and dresser w/t.v. and refrigerator and safe.  Big closet and nice sized bathroom.  There was an area with a shelf with a coffee machine.  The windows were large and the view was awesome - mountains in the background also - we had a sunrise view.  We could watch World of Color from our room and tune in the music on our t.v. (nice touch).  The stay here was perfection at its finest!!!!!

From the second we arrived, the service was fantastic.  The room was clean and comfortable, and slept our family of 4 perfectly.  My kids are ages 2 and 4.  The coffee shop in the lobby was perfect for a nice quick and reasonably priced breakfast before hitting the parks all day.  The hotel is literally directly across the street from the Grand Californian, so you are really close to the park - no shuttle or monorail needed.  We had stayed at the Anabella last time, and this was a much better value in my opinion.  If you're on a budget, but want all of the perks of staying Disney, you should stay here.

We stayed at Paradise Pier in 2006, 2010 and just returned from another visit of four nights.  We have always found the staff and rooms to be excellent and this visit was no exception.  Our room had a wonderful view of California Adventure. We did have a hiccup this visit but it’s not always what happens but how the hotel handles it. After two nights we came back to our room to find painters plastic covering our entire window and more importantly blocking our entire view! This was unacceptable to us and we called the front desk immediately.  They agreed to move us however the hotel was almost completely booked and there were few choices.  We moved from the 11th floor with a marvelous view to the 4th floor almost directly above the entrance of the hotel.  We were not pleased.

Close to the Park(s).  Friendly staff and very informed.  Nicely decorated rooms.  Clean and very comfortable. We took a 4 year old and she loved it.  Too busy to use the pool, but we did check it out and it looked nice.  They have a water slide too.

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier is really for families, not couples
Summary: We stayed at the Paradise Pier hotel for a family event that was occurring at the Disney Hotel.  Our discounted group rate was still well over $200/night for non-view rooms.   Pros: Staff at front desk was helpful and friendly. Proximity to Downtown Disney, Disneyland and California Adventure Parks. Ability to go one of the parks 1 hour early (Magic Hours) each day your room key is valid. Special entrance to California park via Grand Californian Hotel Personalized roomkeys are a cute keepsake Room was pretty sound proofed.  Cons: High cost for nothing really special. Noise!  With so many families you just can't escape the noise in the common areas. Furniture was showing wear and tear. Pillows and such were dirty so made us wonder about the quality of the housekeeping. **Unless

Summary Heading: Only if you are a Disney fanatic
Summary: To be fair, my review of this place is a little jaundiced.  My family are not Disney people.  This hotel was also not my first choice for a Disneyland vacation, but special extended family circumstances made this place the choice for our first real extended Disneyland adventure.  I can't say there wasn't anything that offended us other than the length of time it took one day for housekeeping to even bother getting to our room, but there is nothing special enough here for us to even consider staying at any of the Disney hotels.  The positives: other than the one day of our five day stay where housekeeping had not gotten to our room by 3:30 pm (with children needing a nap, we settled for just asking for garbage removal and fresh towels), all Disney "cast members" (the staff) were

If you do one thing for your kids on a Disney holiday have the Character Breakfast at Paradise Pier Hotel.  You can now make a ressie via email, which was great for us coming from overseas.  The kids loved breakfast and we enjoyed getting the photos with the Characters and their autographs.  For the rest of the day the kids were quite relaxed if they saw Mickey at Disneyland as they'd had a lot of time with him at breakfast, so we didn't need to stand in long lines to get a photo.  Magic stuff.

Summary Heading: Take advantage of extra magic hour
Summary: Always clean, staff is friendly and has the magic of Disney. Easy walk to the parks, you can go to the Grand Californian to enter California Adventure. They pipe in the music for the fireworks from the rooftop pool. The rooms have Disney Channels, a decent size fridge and you can upgrade to a park view to watch world of color. Great stay!

We can fault nothing with this stay! Every staff member we came across, from reception to room service to the park entry was fantastic and they were always in "character", which made it an amazing experience. The extra hour early park entry for Disney hotel guests really helped getting on the most popular rides before the big crowds. We purchased the Disney Photopass in the park on our first day which cost USD99.00 and it was fantastic value. Every photo opportunity from rides, restaurants and roving photographers was included in our pass, including hard copy presentation folders at the theme restaurants. Breakfast with Mickey is pretty special!  The hotel was clean and the attention to detail in the room was amazing, mickeys and other characters everywhere! Highly recommend it.

At first I was sad that I wasn't staying in the Grand Calfornian Hotel but after staying her I was glad.  The room we got was one of their nicer suites facing the Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure Park. We were able to watch the entire World of Color Show from our hotel room. And the hotel has a channel on the television that allows you to listen to the show at the same time.  The room service was high quality and delicious.   The beds were very comfortable and we had such a peaceful sleep that I did not want to wake up in the morning.

I have visited DLR serveral times and have stayed at this hotel before and liked it.  This time the staff weren't quite as friendly and if there wasn't a Goofy in the lobby I might not have even known this was a Disney hotel.  Our room had some peeling wall paper, but was overall clean.  It does have a great water slide in the pool area, but he pool itself was a little on the cold side.  We stayed b/c we want'ed the entire Disney experience, the hotel didn't deliver, Next time, which is in December, we will choose a different hotel.

We were pleasantly surprised by how great this hotel was.The rooms are nice. They utilise the space well. The location is awesome. You are right across fron the Grand Californian and get special entrance into California park.the club level is worth the extra money. The staff is so helpful and make you feel welcome. Nothing seem to ever be a bother. We are returning in 2 weeks for another stay.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel for it's Location and amenities
Summary: We arrived around 11.00am and were quickly checked in. Our party consisted of 1 adult and 2 children and we stayed for 3 nights. We had a city view room and it is because of this that I havent given it a higher rating. The location is good and worth it if  you intend to use the Magic hour every morning otherwise it is not worth the additional money. The rooms are clean and well serviced. We didnt have any complaints during the stay. It also has a guest laundry which is handy. The pool is nothing exceptional it has a water slide but again nothing to rave about. The pool can create some noise at night as some of the guests seem to think they are the only ones there. There are plenty of staff if you want to check in or out but lending themselves to helping out at the guest services

The rooms are wonderful, beautifully decorated & extremly clean. We had a fridge, coffee maker, & the safe is big enough for a laptop & my purse. The magnifying makeup mirror was a real surprise. We were able to walk to both of the other Disney motels as well as both parks & Downtown Disney in a very short amount of time. Things are much closer together than at Disneyworld. On that note you don't quite feel the Disney magic here that you do at the World. The elevators made us miss extra magic hours even with the use of extra service elevators & we were only on the third floor but with a stroller the steps wern't an option. Although you can order some food late night from the bar in the lobby it was terrible. $10 for nachos that we threw away. There is a microwave & toaster you

We arrived at 10:30 am and were quickly checked in to a 6th floor room with a view of the park (we reserved a standard room so this was a nice surprise).  The birthday button was ready for my little one and she felt very special.  The room was clean and bright - my toddler loved the beach ball pillows.  We quickly got unpacked and headed out to the park.  In the mornings, there was always a line for the elevator so we always took the stairs (I had my little girl and my husband took the umbrella stroller - this was easy and fast).  On the last day when we were taking our luggage down, we went up in the elevator to go down.  I was prepared for the elevator slow down - it seems to be common in the mornings.  Everyone was so helpful and considerate.  The room was quiet.  I could see

Summary Heading: Clean, Quiet with a Good Kids Pool
Summary: Dead quiet room, a revelation for hotels.  Clean, clean, clean.  This is one of the cleanest hotels in which I have stayed, and that includes the nicer hotels like the Four Seasons chain.  The pool here has the longest and tallest water slide with bins of kids safety vest available for use along with bins and bins of extra towels.  They really had kids in mind here, obviously since its a Disney hotel.  And there are always employees in Disney attire running around picking up towels, cleaning messes, adjusting chairs and cleaning the bathrooms, just like in the park.  And the room was just as clean.    This hotel is formed like a tower with half of it pushed forward a bit so it misses the view of the pool on that side.  They call it the city view side.  The other side looks out

Stayed 3 days at this hotel, from 12 - 15th September, with 2 adults and 1 child aged 9. I cannot fault this hotel. Everything is made to perfection, from the room to the staff. I'd say, breakfast was just OK, but we were entertainted by Mickey and Friends, and it was priceless.  Room is huge, we had 2 double beds but still plenty of space to roam. There's also guest laundry service at the property, and that is brilliant I think.   All in all, it is such a good hotel and value for money. It's only like 10 minutes walk to Downtown Disney, which is nothing to us.

Paradise Pier is OK for a run of the mill hotel but not for a Disney hotel.  We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and various Disney resorts in Disney World and the atmosphere at Paradise Pier doesn't have the Disney Magic.  Our room was clean and our beds comfortable but the decor in the room, lobby, etc. was blah, especially for the price we paid.    As others have mentioned the elevators cannot handle the numbers of early risers who are in a hurry to check out or eager to get to the parks for Early Morning Entry, nor the exhausted masses returning to their rooms at the end of a fun-filled Disney day.  There were 15 - 20 people crammed in our elevator one morning.  All we could do was laugh when someone compared us to a clown car.  Kudos to the staff, however.  They were

Great hotel in a great location, a very easy walk into the Disney parks. The hotel is very clean and comfortable and it is worth paying for concierge. Concierge gives you continental breakfast, drinks and snacks throughout the day and evening hot snack, cheese, wine and beer followed by chocolate strawberries and other pastries. The staff are very welcoming and helpful I can't wait to return.

Summary Heading: Turns a trip to Disneyland into a Vacation
Summary: We live in Ventura but wanted to have a special time with my niece and her 2 year old so we splurged on an overnight stay at this, the most reasonably priced of the Disney Hotels.We had a good experience here. We arrived way before our checkout time and were told the room was ready whenever we wanted it. They stored our luggage while we explored Disneyland and we checked in about 1:30. They delivered our luggage to the room quickly. We enjoyed the pool then returned to Disneyland. The hotel is decorated in a Mickey surf theme. We loved the Beach ball pillows, the attention to detail is adorable. They room was clean and spacious with a view of California Adventure. The windows open part-way so you can get fresh air. We did the Mickey and Friends Surf's Up Breakfast in the

Our family stayed here from Aug 29 - Sep 08 and thoroughly enjoyed it. The rooms were very clean and bathroom amenities well stocked. Loved having a refrigerator and coffee machine. Our daughters particularly loved the pool and the slide, we were there every afternoon. Our stay here was over the Labor Day weekend and during the Half Marathon and although it was busy, we never noticed it in the Hotel, only in the Parks and Downtown Disney. The Hotel is a short easy walk from both parks, our girls coped well, as did my 71 year old Mother-in-Law. The only thing I feel was not so good, was the menus in both restaurants. They were pretty ordinary. Room service menu was much better. The best staff member we met was the evening Barman, we didn't get his name but I do know he's from

Not the happiest place on earth. A regular hotel, on the expensive side for what they offer, but good. Stay here if you want a clean, nice place to stay very near to the parks. If you are on a budget, look for a different hotel. Breakfast is expensive and not that good quality, you're paying for the characters.

Not much to say about this hotel.  I received a theme park view....I could see World of Color from my window.  It is less expensive than the other two Disneyland resort hotels, but further away from the parks.  If you have the extra money, stay at the Grand Californian.

This past labor day weekend, my son & I were at the Disney Paradise Pier Hotel for the Disneyland 1/2 marathon weekend!!! As usual, the Disney Paradise Pier Hotel ROCKS!!!!! Everyone is ALWAYS so happy and friendly and helpful!! We only stay at this hotel when we go to Disneyland!!   We arrived at 4:30am and they found us a room when check-in is not until the afternoon.  They always make our stay wonderful and an experience.  They also only 5 minutes from the start/finish line.  They also are very, very green.

We had only 2 1/2 days to spend at Disneyland and California Adventure, so opted to stay at a Disneyland hotel for the convenience.  The Paradise Pier was the least expensive option.  It did cost a bit more than other hotels I priced around the area, but the early entry and convenience went a long way toward making the increased cost more palatable.  Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, but we were early.  We checked our bags and walked over to California Adventure.  We got a call from the hotel about 3 p.m. that the room was ready.  Because we had to wait, the hotel upgraded us to a room on the 8th floor overlooking Cal. Adventure.  The room was quite clean, the beds were comfortable, and the bath amenities adequate.  Although you could fit 5 people in these rooms, it would

Nice Hotel. Of course you are paying for the Disney name, but it was very nice and clean. We had the opportunity to stay in nicer and bigger room hotels (that included full breakfasts too) for a cheaper price, but we chose to stay here for the early entry to the parks because we stayed at their hotel. I do have to say that we took advantage of the early park entry and it definitely paid off. We went to the New Cars Land area and did not have to wait more than 10 min. to get on any of the new rides. We didn't even attempt to go back when the park opened up to the rest of the public because it was a zoo!! The early park entry is definitely a plus and we also got Fast Pass Priority seating to see the World of Color also. Which is absolutely Wonderful.

We feel it was a very good decision to purchase a Disney package that included our three nights at the Paridise Pier Hotel as well as park passes and meal plan vouchers.  The Disney experience is first class - from check-in to check-out.  The hotel is bright and colourful, beds and linens top quality.  We were fortunate enough to get a room on the 9th floor which looked straight out on the nightly water and light show.  You can have the music in your room by tuning in to a particular channel on the TV.  Immediately following was the fireworks display for which we had to look slightly to the left and change the channel on the TV for the music.  Our family was too tired to stay in the park late enough to enjoy those features so to be able to see them from our room was great.  The

My family of 5 arrived Sun. Sept. 2 and stayed until Fri. Sept. 7th I really wanted to love this hotel, but I'll let you decide based on our exact experience. Granted we arrived the day of the half marathon, I'm not certain it mattered much.  Pros: They upgraded us to a corner room with a park view. I was really excited. You can see World of Color, but not the cartoon part. It was great to have the extra day bed and refrigerator. They gave my daughter a birthday packet with a picture of her favorite character, Rapunzel, and a birthday button as well as celebration buttons for us. I had told them about her birthday when we booked. Despite other review mentions she did not receive balloons nor did we ever get the rice krispie treats others mentioned. We spent two afternoons and

Summary Heading: Pleasant hotel in the heart of Disneyland
Summary: The Disney magic was clear from the time we checked in, as David at the front desk went out of his way to talk to us and give tips about maximizing our experience in the theme parks.  Our room was great - a view of the California Adventure theme park from the third floor (the same floor as the pool area). The room was cheery and very clean.  I think the biggest perk to staying at any of the Disney hotels, though, is the extra magic hour in the morning.  We were able to go to the Disneyland park one morning at 7 before the park opened to the general public at 8, and then use our next morning to do the same at California Adventure.  We were able to get so much done during that early time without the lines that it made the rest of the day much more pleasant.  The new Cars Land was

Our first stay here was in September of 2011. We had a great time and decided to book a stay again this year. We try and go in September to avoid the large crowds. I booked through Alaska Airlines and there was not an option to upgrade to a suite or a park view room.  I called the hotel directly to inquire about an upgrade. The first thing I heard was, “wow that is a very busy week. There is a large convention taking place and we are near capacity”.  My dream vacation instantly felt like a nightmare. I was told that I cannot purchase an upgrade until the day of arrival because I didn’t book through Disney Travel. They transferred me about 7 times and wasted over an hour of my time to basically scold me for not using Disney Travel. I understand that hotels in Anaheim fill up for

Summary Heading: A great stay at the Paradise Pier
Summary: Our family checked in about 11am and to our surprise our room was ready. We booked a room for 5 with conceirge and a view and were upgraded to a two bedroom suite on the 15th floor. The room was fantastic. I think it could sleep 8 people. The first room had a full bathroom with a large closet. A large sofa that folded to a bed. A dining table, Tv and large cabinets. The second room had two queen beds, another TV and cabinet and a large chair that folded into a bed. Both rooms had great views of the California Park. All beds were comfortable with a lot of room. My favorite part was being able to watch both World of Color and viewing the freworks from the room with the music turned on through the TV. All staff is very friendly, especially the conceirge staff. The pools are clean,

It was not planned to check in early, we thought to hop on the parks in the morning and do the check in late in the evening. We arrrived at 11.00 AM, front desk was quite busy however the whole process of waiting, checking in and tickets hand over were very efficient. So thankful to Randy at the front desk for early check in, plus her very professional attitude. It shows that Disneyland will always be the happiest place on earth and they kept that promise. Our kid was very happy with the room, it has a good decor, best view, and very clean. We bought a meal plan including the character dining, but did not have them at the hotel. We rather used them at Grand Californian, and the Plaza Inn. The idea was to get in the park early while having breakfast, access was available for

Visited on a last minute road trip with my 14 year old.  Normally we stay at the grand Californian but we were on a tighter budget. Last stayed here in 2001 and was disappointed. This time very pleasantly surprised.  Check in was effortless taking a mere 5 minutes. We were upgraded to theme park view room. The room itself was large and very well appointed and themed. Very bright and cheerful. Travelling with a teenager this time the walk to downtown Disney was no problem. We did not use the restaurant but we did use the pool which was nicely themed and with lots of chairs.  While I still prefer the over the top theming of the GC I would stay here if budget is more of an issue

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but not worth the price
Summary: I stayed here with my sisters & friends.  They thought it would be fun to stay at a Disney property and this one was the least expensive of the three, plus they had a special going on.  There was a line for check-in, and the process was lengthy because of all the time spent with each person going over tickets, etc.  I have since learned that we could have had early admission because we were staying on-site (although it was never mentioned), so that would be a bonus to consider.  It is a long walk from the hotel to the Disneyland entrance or the monorail.  Downtown Disney was also quite a walk.  Closer to California Adventure by going through the Grand Californian.  We had dinner in the PCH Grill.  Food and service were okay.  Restaurant was very colorful and bright.  We opted to

Summary Heading: wonderful views of the park from room
Summary: We stayed September 2010 actually, I know my review comes 2 years after my trip but the day is still fresh in my memory.  I really loved the character of this hotel.  The staff were great and the room was very comfortable and love the beach vibe decor.  We had an adjoining room with my inlaws and both of our rooms had 2 queens and a daybed.  We got upgraded for free to a higher floor and able to see the lights of the World of Color Show, beautiful views of the park.  This was in 2010 before all the carsland stuff was just barely beginning to construction.  We ate dinner once at the hotel restaurant and I was not thrilled. My food(which was gluten free) was all rubbery and gross and my other family members didn't really care for their food either.  Normally disney is great for

wow couturegirl. I am sorry but your review sounds like you are such a hard person to please! You are not the "Royal Family" and you should feel privileged to have stayed at the Paradise Pier!! I am sorry but all your complaints seem very ridiculous! You must realize you are not the only one visiting Disneyland and you cat be first for everything! I found the Paradise pier to be such a pleasant experience compared to other hotels we stayed at!

Even though this hotel is a little on the pricey side,  it was well worth it.  The room we had was decorated in a beach theme with very comfortable beds.  We had an awesome view of California Adventure and it was just beautiful all lit up at night.  The hotel is conveniently located close to Downtown Disney.  The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and very friendly, and they actually seemed to enjoy their jobs.

I've now stayed at all three Disneyland properties (and several Disney World hotels) and this was better than expected. The property was clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff went above and beyond. We got in at 8:45 am and our room was ready for check in. The location was more convenient than it looked on the map since you can walk through the GC. The pool is small and plain, but the water slide was a lot of fun and you can watch fireworks with the music piped in. I prefer the Disneyland hotel for the ambiance, but I didn't feel like we were staying at lesser hotel. We are annual passholders, so the price here was not much higher than staying off property and the benefits made it worth it.

Summary Heading: Okay, but not $200/night worth of okay
Summary: We enjoyed the Paradise Pier -- the decor is adorable, the rooms large and bright, and our view of California Adventure was fantastic! Check in was easy and the desk staff friendly.  Breakfast at the PCH Grill was tasty, not horribly overpriced, and lots of fun with the characters.  The pool slide was fun, and does not empty into a pool, so my 4 year old could enjoy it, which was nice.  Pool also provides a good view of fireworks, with the music piped in.  Getting an extra hour in the parks each morning was a definite plus.  Unfortunately, I would not pay the onsite prices ever again.  The pretty hotel and extra park hour just do not justify the added expense.  The service we received in the hotel was not bad, but was not nearly as attentive as I would expect for the price.  We

Summary Heading: Early Entry and concierge service - Can be a good value
Summary: We have stayed at a number of WDW properties in the past from the Deluxe on the monorail to the All-Star Resort.  I would put the Paradise Pier around the level of the Caribean Beach Resort, except that you can walk a short distance and either be in a park or on a monorail (no buses involved).   We stayed one night to take advantage of early entry (which was great).  Because we were there such a short time we also made sure to take full advantage of the concierge service.     I would say it was worth it if you take advantage of 3 things:   - Walk / Monorail to the park  - Concierge Lounge (i.e. Food / Drink)  - Early Entry  For reference I took a picture of the schedule of the lounge hours / food.  We had an afternoon check in and then some snacks ( nothing too exciting - Potato

Summary Heading: Very good, not excellent.  Not sure it was worth the money.
Summary: We decided to splurge on our once in a lifetime trip to California and stay at Disney hotel.  We have stayed at Walt Disney World hotels many times and have always been fabulously impressed.  I can't say that about Paradise Pier.  I'll start by saying the I have to give it four stars since that's "very good" and it was very good.  It just wasn't great, or wonderful, or memorable...and that's what I was hoping it would be....especially for the price!    We paid extra to have a park view/concierge room.   It was quite a bit more than a regular room and WAY more than a hotel off site, but it was a splurge.  We checked in and were given Happy Anniversary buttons and our kids were given "We're celebrating" buttons.  That was very nice and check in was easy, but that was really the

We had the most fabulous time here. When we told the front desk person that we had just become engaged he went and got us some extra special gifts, photos and badges which said "Just Engaged" We did wear these around Disneyland and had no shame in doing so. The people there just love Disneyland and you just feel like you can not have a bad day. The rooms were excellent and we were even upgraded to a room overlooking the roller coasters and the light show at night. It was perfect. We can not wait to go back and relive it all again and be kids!

Summary Heading: Best of the three Disney Hotels for the price - but shhhh, don't tell anyone
Summary: Surf casual decore. Rooms are very nice and clean. Lobby could use an upgrade and looks tired. Staff is classic Disney and helpful.  For the money this is a far better deal than the grand Californian. The pool is better, they have Mickey character dining right downstairs and it's directly across the street from the GC so entry into the park is a breeze

We stayed two nights at the Paradise Pier and it was a good choice for being $100 less a night than the Grand Californian across the street. The hotel is designed with a fun beach theme. Our room had two Queens and a sofa that folded into a twin bed, futon style. We ate at PCH in the lobby one night and it was slow and a little pricey but decent food. For breakfast, we skipped the character meal and ate a la carte at the Surfside Lounge.   The pool was fun with a separate slide that my kids loved going on, a main pool that went to 6 feet deep, a shallow pool for little kids and a hot tub. The walk to the park was easier, either cutting through Grand Californian or walking out the back and catching the monorail in Downtown Disney. Parking as $22 valet or $15 self-park and our

Stayed 5 nights recently at this Hotel with my mom and daughter. Convenient to everything "Disney". We could easily walk to the 2 parks, the view from our window was right in front of the fabulous pool, at night you could watch the fireworks.  The food was definately pricey, but hey, its Disneyland. The rooms are nicely cleaned, the staff helpful. Nice decor.  I was attending a  UCLA medical conference at the Hotel, so it made my family happy as well, that we could take advantage of everything else.

My review pretty much mirrors "JEFF B". We were mostly in the hotel to sleep, about 7 hours a night for 3 nights. We did take a 3 hour break from the park the second day to swim in the hotels pool to cool off. The pool is small but relaxing and it does have a hot tub to enjoy. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. Late night room service was outstanding. The Pacific Coast Highway (PCH) Grill restaurant in the hotel was just average and overpriced. Overall , you are paying for the location of this hotel and getting into the park one hour earlier than the general public.

Easy check-in. Fantastic staff, as always at a Disney property. The room was clean and very comfortable. The upgrade to an upper theme park view room was well worth the cost. An easy walk to the park whether through Grand Californian or Downtown Disney. The snack bar area before you enter the "pricey" restaurant actually had very good and affordable breakfast menu....just limited. I guess most people want to stay at the much fancier Californian or the old classic Disneyland Hotel (which I have also stayed at) but the Paradise Pier is well worth a go. I would most likely choose it again when I visit Disneyland. PS:My daughter was absolutely over the moon with the hotel. She loved the view.

Very plain hotel , clean well kept and very exceptional staff , from the front desk to the valet to the conciege all very pleasant and great to talk to. Very convienent to the parks and character breakfast in the hotel was fun for the family. I have nothing negative about the hotel just the rooms a little small and plain for a disney property

Summary Heading: Great Room Adds to a Great Vacation
Summary: I found Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel to be the perfect hotel to relax in after a hot day at Disneyland Resort.  My room was spotlessly clean, and I was lucky enough to have a spectacular view of the collective Disney theme parks.  Great venue for fireworks and the World of Color show each night.  Check-in was a breeze, made especially good by cast member Gabriel who scored us that spectacular room (1308).  The room was cleaned by 11 am each day, and believe me when I say it was spotless (unlike Disney World's All-Star hotels).  This hotel is the least expensive of the three hotels on Disneyland property. I would most definitely stay here again. There were two drawbacks that stopped me from giving the hotel an excellent rating-one was the elevator which cannot be helped.  It's a

This is a very average hotel for the price. The service is very good however and the best part is the ability to access the parks one hour earlier than everyone else though a special entrance about 5 minute walk from the hotel. We did both parks in one day so we paid the premium to stay at this hotel so as to get early access. Its also not as close to Downtown or the main entrances as we thought. Its a good ten minute walk.

Summary Heading: Great place for families to have fun.
Summary: My kids loves this place and so do I. We stayed at the hotel for my dourther  7th birthday in June 2011 the hotel staff was very nice and friendly to us but they don't have any rooms for us when we first check in to the hotel. We have to wait for the rooms or any rooms to be ready for us for 3 hour that after noon. So, that was not very good all of my three children was good and we did have a long long day.  The room was bueatiful and very nice view of Disney park / clean and big. Good location and easy to walk to Disney park.we do love the hotel and all of staff at the hotel they were very nice to my kids and specaily my douther because is her 7th birthday.The hotel enter lobby was welcome the kids with Disney cartoons that any kids in the world would love to see. Maybe next

Paradise Pier has a beach boardwalk theme.  It is the least expensive of the on property Disneyland hotels and a good value.  The lobby area is limited but there is a very cute completely enclosed kids lobby with mini adirondack chairs facing a flatscreen with Disney cartoons. The hotel sits directly across the street from the Grand Californian and within easy walking distance of the parks.  As a guest at any of the Disney hotels you can use the direct California Adventure entrance in the Grand Californian.  The standard rooms are spacious with 2 queen beds or a king, a pull out sofa, a desk, bureaus, refrigerator, safe, TV, portable crib, luggage rack, hair dryer, iron.  We had a service dog puppy with us and the staff was very helpful and supportive.  The PCH Grill has a great

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and Location for the Price
Summary: Spent 2 nights athe Paradise Pier and really enjoyed the hotel.  The room was good sized with 2 queens, sofa/sleeper, table/chair, fridge and large bathroom.  The bathroom could use some updates and if would have been nice if the sink was outside of the rest of the bathroom, but overall is was a nice size room for 4 people. We had a view of the pool area, which is pretty small but clean and functional.    The elevators can be a little slow and during certain times of the day there can be quite a few people waiting.  Lobby could be a little more comfy, it mostly is a small bar area with a few tables, booths and chairs.  The staff was really nice and friendly.  We had stayed 2 pervious nights at the Grand Californian, so it was a little step down, but I did still enjoy the hotel.

This was our first time staying here, great service from the start. Easy and friendly check in. Easy walk to both parks enjoy the extra hour for both parks. We would get up early enjoy the parks and leave around  noon when the park would start to get more busy then head back at night when the crowed was less.Nice with the no wait time for at the new Cars Land. Nice pool,waterside, kiddy pool and hot tub. The room was clean by the time we got to back, beds where nice can't go wrong with two queen and a day bed. Mini-fridge was great we stocked it with lots of water and it was nice to have a cold drink. Everything was great on the trip no one wanted it to end. We will be coming back for sure the extra money is worth it.

Summary Heading: Huge Disney Disappointment...No Paradise at the Pier.
Summary: Where do I even begin with this...?  I booked with Disney Travel directly because they are supposed to be amazing with any special needs.  The last time I was at Walt Disney World (for a whopping 2 days over the packed New Years Eve holiday) the staff was so accomodating and understanding that I never had to explain my food intolerances even once to anyone but the chef.  I wasn't frustrated or upset at all while I was in Florida.  What a disappointment California turned out to be!     ***My only expectations were based upon what the Reservations Specialist had told me over the telephone.***      When I called Disney Travel I booked a Concierge/Club level room with "Priority" seating at three character meals and "Priority" seating at the Blue Bayou (even with the Military Special

Staying at this hotel was the best thing to enjoy our 3-day park-hopper pass for Disneyland with the kids. Just cross the street, walk through the lobby of the Hotel Grand Californian and you were entering the California Adventure Park from the side, without having to deal with all the general public trying to rush through the park entrance. The room was comfortable, but wished they had a better shower head for the price we paid (Holiday Inn Express chains have much better ones). On the 3rd floor they have a nice pool, hot tub and a small water slide that the kids loved during our afternoon break. From the pool deck you get a great view of Disneyland's fireworks at 9:30 PM daily, together with the sound and music, and you don't have to deal with the crowds and the usual 1-2 hour

I have always gone back and forth about spending the extra cash and staying at one of the Dland hotels, or saving it....This year I decided to try it out. I am really really happy we did.   We arrived on a Monday around 230pm and although check in is at 3pm they were able to move us right into a room and in fact upgraded us to concierge level. Although there was a long line we moved through the check-in process fairly quickly.   I was expecting a little room for some reason, and although it wasn't HUGE it was fully adequate. Two queen beds, a crib was in the closet (which we used for my 4 year old) and there was a couch type of pop up bed. The beds were VERY comfortable. Usually my back tends to hurt from hotel beds, not here. I started bringing my own pillows on vacations a

Summary Heading: The service & the "magic hour" is worth the extra $!
Summary: the magic hour at that all hotel guests to receive daily pays for itself due to it's close proximity to the both parks and the ability to get in line  the staff is extremely helpful and go out of their way to make your the staff is extremely helpful and go out of their way to make your stay comfortable enjoyable and worth your time.

Summary Heading: Awesome Family Hotel by Disney Resorts
Summary: I have stayed at all three Disneyland resort hotels. They have all been very good. The Paradise Pier hotel is by far the best value of the three. The rooms were Huge,the sleeper sofa/daybed was fantastic.Both my kids said it was comfortable. We had a premium view that looked right into the California adventure park. We could view the Lights of World of Colour and tune into the TV to get the music.The room had a small fridge and a desk and small table on wheels that we used to dine at when we ate in our room. It was clean and recently updated. I highly recommend this hotel for quality and value. I was the least expensive of the three hotels and by far had the most to offer families...  The pool was small but the deck area surrounding it was great....It is right across the street

Summary Heading: Not sure this felt like Disney.
Summary: Room was clean and as expected for a Disney property.  Staff, not very Disney friendly compared to Orlando and Hilton Head staff.  Pool was small given the size of the hotel.  Probably would stay elsewhere in the future.

We stayed at the Paradise Pier for 4 days towards the end of May. The property was very clean and the staff was friendly. The hotel was a little farther to Disneyland than I had expected. It was pretty easy to get to California Adventure park through the Grand Californian Hotel. Downtown Disney was also rather close. We only used the pool once, but it was fine.

We loved staying here!!!! The rooms are nice and the beds are very comfortable. We ate ate the PCH grill and the service was excellent and our 3yr old granddaughter was able to make her own pizza she had a blast!!!! The only advice I can give is take your own stroller, because you can't take there strollers out of the park and it is a walk to get to and from the parks. All I can say is staying on property is the best!!!!

Summary Heading: Stay booked with Disney Travel Co.
Summary: We booked our Disney vacation through the Disney Travel Service. In order to stay, we had to have an attraction ticket combo. It was worth the price to be walking distance to the parks and have early access. The park didnot track how many morning we entered early although it's advertised as having one morning of early access.  However, I would caution you when booking. The operators do not give out all the information you need. You have to ask a lot of questions. They did not tell us we had to book the tour to Universal Studios ourselves after we paid for the tour with them. Airport transfer is booked by them with Anaheim grey line  bus tours. Unless you have a large number of suitcases, you don't need a tour bus to pick you up and you wait longer for them versus the smaller

This hotel ticked all the boxes for us. It has been recently refurbished and is very beautiful. The location to DisneyLand is exceptional. Not to mention the view of the park from our room window.  The staff at the hotel were fantastic as well.  If you are pressed for time and want to make the absolute most out of your visit to Disneyland at a reasonable price, the Paradise Pier Hotel is perfect!

Okay for a disney property. Not as plush as some of the others but it does the job. Cute movie room downstairs and the quick take out counter was a major plus. I was headed to a conference and it made it easy to get a pastry and coffee before heading out.  We dined with the characters and there were lots of them.  Nice time.

I've never really completely understood the TR ranking system, and usually take it as a "general guide" in deciding where to book. IMO, the Paradise Pier hotel should be ranked much higher. I was hoping for the best when I booked this hotel, and that's just what we got!   From the moment we arrived to our departure, the level of service was top-notch, and could not have been any better at their 2 pricier properties (Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian). Front desk, bell desk, and concierge personnel were more than helpful. Gift shop cast members were very friendly and personable - asking where we were from and how we were enjoying our stay. I opted to include the concierge lounge services during our 3-nights at the hotel, which for our family of 5 was definitely worth it.

Clean, friendly staff, very nice neat room, (bigger than the picture) we got the room with a deck, nice access to the pool. Fireworks visibles from the Hotel, (pool area).  Room service very polite and respectfull, house keeping did an exelent job. Did I mention it's really clean and in exelent conditions to rest and enjoy the Hotel alone.  The only problem we had was our children did not wanted to get out of the hotel at all. We stay by the week of the 4th of July, (we could tell it was very busy, but the services was on time all the time)

We stayed here for 2 nights in May right at the beginning of peak season as schools were beginning to let out. Overall the hotel was nice and clean. Staff, although our interactions were limited, were very nice and helpful as you would expect for a Disney Hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted at our car and helped with luggage. We had a nice discussion with one of the valet / hosts out front while we waited for a luggage cart.  We have 2 kids ages 3 & 5, so use of the elevators for our stroller and help with luggage was a must. Both mornings during our stay we got up early to head over to the park, as most families do. We stayed on the 6th floor of (not sure) 14 or 15? On the first morning we waited 15 minutes for an elevator. Each time one stopped at our floor it was completely

Summary Heading: Cold in the morning- 50's in June- to 80- Blue Skies, California Dreams
Summary: We stayed four days at the Disney paradise Pier Hotel, which is smack dab in the middle of everything going on.  Plan on lots of walking, if you don't mind walking.  Convenient to the Convention Center and the Disney resorts. Our room overlooked the California adventure and featured the Magic waters light show every evening and we could hear the Disneyland fireworks.  the rooms were well kept with beach ball pillow and surf board lamps.  Walking distance to about everything Disney, except Disneyland- you catch the monorail in Downtown Disney- Everything enjoyable with the mouse.  Food across the way at the Grand Californian was EXCEPTIONAL in one of their many restaurants.  Pricey- everywhere on disney- for food and attractions, but how often do you get to California? Go- enjoy,
Very friendly staff, well located enough, nice pool and lounge area. Has all you need.

We had a park view room which was clean and roomy. Lovely fresh decor though the aircon was really noisy at night. View of the park was great for both day and night. Our first impression however was terrible. Checking took 30 minutes with frequently being left standing g at counter while things were sorted. We were not impressed after a long flight. Hotel store could do with some more basics as there isn't a convenience store in Downtown Disney either. Short walk to both parks, and safe at night. Housekeeping was ok, no turn down service was provided in our room. Bar/light meal area Karen and Esther were great however the male working when we werebtherevwas rid about our country of origin and very very slow with service. Character breakfast was fun- go early in the morning for a
This hotel was great. The price was lower than the other two resort hotels and it was just as nice. Would stay here again.

We have stayed here twice in the last two years.  We get the concierge service so that we can take our own snacks and soda into the park, as well as grab a tasty bite to eat throughout the day and evening.  The last time we stayed, we were upgraded to a very nice suite.  The service can't be beat!

Stayed from June 16 to June 21 for a first visit to Disneyland after six trips to WDW. The hotel is impeccable, very clean and well kept. The room is of adequate size: we are a family of four and the kids are teens but it didn't feel cramped. The A/C seems to have trouble maintaining an adequate temperature and it feels uncomfortably warm sometimes during the night before it kicks in to cool again. There is the usual: coffee maker, hair drier, ironing board, iron, small fridge. There are plenty of areas and plugs for all the chargers for the phones, iPads, cameras, etc.  The safe was spacious enough for us. The beds are very comfortable. The bathroom is spotless. The sink and countertop are placed lower than usual, maybe done with kids in mind. The restaurant tends to get

Summary Heading: Fun Waterslide, Amazing View of California Adventure
Summary: At the Paradise Pier hotel, we were upgraded to a theme park view, and it was much more impressive than I would have imagined.  We could look out over the park and watch the Screaming Roller Coaster along the boardwalk, and the roller coasters at It's a Bugs Life, as well as all the other area attractions, and at one point I saw a parade marching through. We were perfectly centered to see the World of Color show from our room, although to get the full affect you really need to get a fastpass to see the show from a specified viewing area.  This is the only way to see the images in the lights, and the viewing area features surround sound and bubbles.    During our trip to Disneyland, not only did we stay on the concierge level of Disney's Paradise Pier, but we stayed at the

We stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel June 23rd and 24th.  Lovely beds, convenient fridge, great pool and water slide, and very spacious.  Our kids loved the close walk to both Disneyland and California Adventure.  We have stayed in the Grand Californian before, but the Paradise Pier is a great choice for families who want to save a little money.  It was clean, quiet and accessible.  We really loved this Disney property, and would stay here again next time we are in Disneyland.

We stayed here from 16th - 20th June for our first ever Disney trip. Check in was a breeze; David at the front desk was amazing even going so far as organising birthday balloons for our daughter and 'first visit' buttons for all three of us. Our room was excellent; overlooking DCA, and the beds were extremely comfortable. The front desk were awesome in helping us change our dinner reservation in Downtown Disney after our late arrival. The close proximity to the parks and Downtown Disney was wonderful; a short walk across the road and through the Grand Californian...loved it. Would definitely stay here again; in fact trying to con the rest of our family into a visit here again hopefully soon. Thank you Paradise Pier for an amazing first visit experience we will never forget!

Summary Heading: Everything we hoped it would be!
Summary: The Paradise Pier Hotel was a great way to end our stay in Disneyland. They allowed us to check in very early (11:30) and we were able to enjoy all of the amenities of the hotel. The kids loved the pool and waterslide. The room was wonderful and relaxing as well. It was spacious, quiet and clean. We took advantage of the table that slides out from under the desk, and appreciated having the extra seating and sleeping space from the couch. (It converts to a twin bed.)  The kids really enjoyed the beach ball pillows. All of the staff were very helpful and friendly, including the maid that tipped us off on the ability to view the World of Color show from the top floor, even though we didn't have a view room. The walk to Disneyland wasn't nearly as long as we had expected, especially

Summary Heading: Stay right in the middle of the Disney Experience for Half the Price
Summary: When heading to a Disney resort I like to stay as close as possible to the parks and immerse myself in the magic (yes, I love Disney that much). I've tried both the Grand California Hotel and the Paradise Pier in Anaheim. While the Grand California is definitely a 5 star experience and you get the "old times" really well, it is extremely pricey.  The Paradise pier offers similar amenities in terms of room size, convenient location (5 minute walk to the park and no need of a bus), parking spot at hotel (no need to get into the enormous parking lot of Disneyland and take a train) etc, and at half the price of the Grand California. Plus, the Grand California with its great lobby is right across the road, so sit back, relax and enjoy the view on World of Color you can probably see

Upon arriving the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. I was there for my daughters dance competition and needed to know the fastest route to the ballroom.  The room was very clean and the beds are comfy.  I love to eat at the PHC downstairs it's quick, convenient, and affordable.  Parking was discounted to $10 since we were there for the dance convention; that was nice. In addition the room rates were very affordable. I appreciate that the hotel understands we have to be there and makes the prices reasonable. After that great experience, I decided to book the hotel two more times this summer :)  Thanks Paradise Pier  for making DL trips so much fun!

There were 9 of us in 3 rooms.  Had requested all 3 rooms be very close & connecting if possible.  Phoned a few weeks prior to our arrival & was told that rooms were all next to each other.  Turned out 2 rooms did connect, the other was clear down the other end of the hall.  The water slide was open the 1st afternoon & closed the rest of the week.  It was sad to watch our 8, 5 & 3 year old look longingly out the window at the water slide they couldn't go on.  It's quite a long walk to the park, probably at least 10- 15 minutes, not bad in the morning, but after all day at the park, it seemed even further!   It was a fun to be at a Disney Hotel, all sorts of neat stuff for the kids who were 1st timers.  Not sure if all the extra walking was really worth it.  Especially when we

The 2nd half of our Disney stay was spent at the Paradise Pier Hotel, and it awesome. This hotel is the perfect choice for families who want the most out of their vacation. The check in went wonderfully. Chantall, the cast member who checked us in was so friendly and helpful. All of the staff made us feel very welcomed. ~We had a park view and loved it. The room was super clean and the decor was very cute. My kids loved the beachballs too. Being so close to the parks makes all the difference on a Disney trip.  I loved how easy the access was into the park and Downtown Disney. Our vacation was truly magical ,and staying here was one of the reasons why. Our family looks forward to our next stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel. Aloha*:)

Summary Heading: Wanted to have a great honeymoon...
Summary: Since this was my honeymoon, I really wanted it to be the best time ever.  The rooms were nice, clean and the staff pleasant, but when it came to neighbors not so great.  We woke up all three mornings that we were here to screaming fighting kids and adults yelling at them in the room next door.  When we complained to the manager, Ken Purdy, he explained to us that they were renting the space and he couldn't make them leave (which is not what we were asking) but that we could be moved.  When we posed that we were also renting the space he maintained that he would move us if we wanted.  Meaning we had to give up the view we paid for thus rewarding the disruptive guests and punishing the guests that were not causing trouble.  I would not choose this hotel to stay in again.
Definitely Disney. Rooms were clean, staff was awesome. Close to park and price was affordable. We even spent a day at the pool on the roof. Watched world of color from room at night. Will stay again

I like this hotel, but it is not as nice as the Grand Californian or the Disneyland Hotels. The rooms are still pretty with the Disney touch, but it did still felt more budget. The beds were still very comfortable, and the rooms were clean. It's a longer walk from the parks, and the parking lot did not have elevators (or at least I did not see any). I did like that our hotel had a view of California Adventure. If you want a feel of the Disney hotel without breaking your wallet, then this is it.

My husband and I stayed here for a week in May. We are annual passholders to Disneyland so we decided to spend more than usual for the hotel. At check in I asked the employee, Jacob, if we had to pay for parking as passholders do not pay to park when they visit the resort. He told me that the free parking only applied to certain parking areas. I was a bit irritated but let it go. We had booked a standard view room and were completely surprised when he upgraded us to a room with a view of California Adventure. That more than made up for the parking issue. The room was very clean and very quiet. We never heard any of our neighbors the entire time that we were there.  We ordered breakfast from room service on a couple of the mornings, the food was great quality with large portions

Our kids loved the view from our window which looked out on the California Adventure Park.  Every night, we watched the World of Color from the room.  We loved the convenience of being able to ride the monorail into Disneyland after a short walk to Downtown Disney.  The kids also loved the Disney "surf" decor in our room...beach ball pillows, surfboard lamps, etc.  The rooftop pool was shaded in the morning hours, so a bit chilly in April when we went.  Overall, a nice place to stay although not a brilliant value for the money.

We stayed at this Disney property in May 2012 for four nights.  The hotel is overpriced, considering the accommodations are average.  Also, while it is close to the theme parks, you have to walk through all of Downtown Disney to get to the Disneyland entrance...kind of a pain.  The worst part of the hotel is the paper-thin walls.  We could hear our neighbors conversations, sneezing, showers, and flushing toilets.  The third and fourth night, however, were unbearable, as a family with a baby and toddler checked in next to us.  The baby woke us up three or four times both nights by crying, and the toddler was up and active very early.  We could hear everything.  For a hotel that mainly serves families, the insulation needs to be much better than this.    I would not stay here

After staying at the other two Disney hotels on the property, we decided to try the third (and least expensive).  We were not disappointed! While the Grand is the closest Disney hotel, the Paradise Pier is right across the street from the Grand. You can access the parks by going through the lobby of the Grand. You can even use the Grand's "private" entrance to California Adventure by showing your room key.  We enjoyed the character breakfast in the hotel one morning and bought breakfast sandwiches from the Cafe the other mornings. Our room had two queen beds, a day bed, a desk, and we still had plenty of room for a stroller and all our luggage.  The rooms had the Disney touch with pictures and hidden mickeys.  The beds were comfortable and very welcome after a long day at the

Have always wanted to stay at one of the Disney hotels, so after we extended our Anaheim trip by 2 nights we decided to splurge on one of the Junior Suites here since we really wanted two separate rooms for nap time (and they couldn't guarantee us two adjoining rooms, which would have been much cheaper. This is their way of making sure you book the expensive suite)...We had received such a great rate at Hojo's for 8 nights, we figured we could spoil ourselves a little. I was so excited!  But, like others, we just can't find the value in the rates they charge. Doesn't really feel like you're staying on the grounds...it took almost as long to walk back and forth from here as it did from Hojo's. If I'm paying that much, would like to be much closer to the park entrance.   Be aware

My family and I stayed at Paradise Pier Conceirge Level for a week in May 2012 and we loved it! It was very clean and the staff was wonderful! A very special thanks to Clay and Chelsey (conceirge lounge) for making our stay extra special. The Conceirge level was well worth the extra cost. The chocolate covered strawberries that were served each evening were the best! The ladies that worked in the lounge setting up the food were so nice and friendly. The lounge was great for a quick breakfast in the morning before hitting the parks or also a nice relaxing wine/beer and cheese snack after a long day at the parks. We had a Park View room and the view of the nightly World of Color show was spectacular!  It is not a far walk from the parks. Just cross the road and go through the

We visited the Parks over Memorial Day for 2 nights / 3 days.  It was very night to pull up at 9 am, valet the car and enter the parks.  The hotel texted us when our room was ready.  We requested a Park View room so the little ones could watch World of Color.  We had a great view from the 12th floor.  Little ones watched World of Color in their PJs while eating a cheeseburger and fruit.  We were unable to see Fireworks over Disneyland.  If you are interested in the Disney fireworks, you will need to request a room in the north east part of the building.  The room was comfortable and clean with a mini-fridge and safe.  The beds were comfortable.  The linens and sheets were clean.  We were only in the room for naps and at night for room service and sleeping.  The room service is

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel but the least impressive of the park hotels
Summary: I write this review as a 40 year old mom traveling on business for a conference (without my daughter). I'm trying to consider both families and other types of guests that might stay here.   Anywhere else, this property would have a fantastic rating:  - it has two pools - a hot tub - an amazing water slide - a TV beach lounge for the kids - beach ball pillows in the rooms - restaurant and cafe food options  But I couldn't help but feel like I was in the oldest of the three hotels in DisneyLand. The Disney Hotel was flashier and newer with a better pool and better restaurants. The Grand Californian had the most amazing ambiance with super tall ceilings, a lodge atmosphere, several fireplace lounges, seemed attached to Main St USA. The Paradise Pier just seemed stale.

We spent 4 nights at the Paradise Pier Hotel and enjoyed our visit.  Although we have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and Grand Californian before, this was our first visit to this property.  We had a standard theme park view on the 13th floor.  It was interesting to see World of Color from above.  They pipe the soundtrack for the show into the rooms which is a nice feature.   We could not see the Disneyland fireworks from the room, but were told they are viewable from the pool area.  The rooms were reasonably spacious, quiet, and very clean.  Beds were comfortable.  They offered the largest in-room safe I’ve ever seen.  I was able to get my SLR camera with large zoom lens, tablets, small cameras, headphones, wallet, and full size binoculars into it.  It was a tight fit, but it

Summary Heading: really?? this is a DISNEY hotel?!!!
Summary: We booked a room with concierge service for my sisters bday. We were upgraded to a suite which is where the wonderfulness ends. The elevators are extremely slow and the restrooms in the public areas of the hotel were dirty. We paid extra for the concierge service ammenities and were extremely disappointed. We had to wait in the 30 min check in line, dispite being promised priority check in. The concierge room was nice, had drinks and snacks, etc we didn't really use this ammenity, we actually just wanted the priority check in. Valet was a huge mess. When we arrived we waited in the valet area for 15 min before a Cast Member (CM) came out to find out what we needed. He instructed us to park in an adjacent handicapped stall and hand over our keys to him and he "would get to our

Summary Heading: first stay at Disney Paradise Pier
Summary: My husband and I frequent Disneyland from Canada, 7 times in 4 yrs and usually stay at the Hojo. This time we found a great rate for Paradise Pier and decided to try it out. We arrived at 2 pm, too early to check in ( our room wasnt ready) so we were able to hand in our luggage and go to downtown disney while we waited for a cell phone call to tell us it was ready. This was unfortunate for my husband though, because it was very hot and he was wearing full pants etc and unable to change. Our room was nice, I loved the Mickey lamp and the decor, the cleanliness on arrival was 3/5 though, there was sticky pop rings on the desk and I threw the bathmat in the laundry bin as there was someone elses hair on it, but for the remainder of or stay the room was kept very clean, housekeeping

We were so happy to be staying 4 nights at the Paradise Pier Hotel it being our first visit to Disneyland!  Our room was dirty, the sliding closet door as you walk in were FULL of sticky finger prints. Then where the coffee pot sits there was thick sticky jelly like substance smeared all over the counter, so I though well kids stay here let it go. I then went into the bathroom and looked down at the toilet to pubic hairs including long hairs on the floor...this put me over the edge! I called down to the desk and said my room was dirty she cut me off and said hold on, I waited for ten minutes then handed the phone to my son he hung up after I got a text my room had been changed. No one came back on the phone to tell me what to do next so my son went to try our room key and it did

Summary Heading: The best value of the Disney Hotels
Summary: We always stay at the Paradise Pier.  It is not as fancy as the other Disney hotels but you can't beat the price and it still comes with the amazing Disney customer service.  If you are a pleasant friendly person, my customer service experience is more than reciprocated by a Disney employee.   The rooms are nice. There is plenty of room for my family of five.  The location in great and easy access to the parks.

Summary Heading: Average Hotel at Disney - It Could be Better
