Summary: I've stayed at the Disney Hotel and at The Grand Californian before. This was my first stay at Paradise Pier. Paradise Pier is by far the most average of the three. We arrived early at around 11:00 AM and were excited to learn that a room was ready for us! We were expecting to have to check our bags with the bellhop and get them later. When we got up to the room, the room was not made up yet! I discussed it with the housekeeper I found, and she said we could leave our stuff and she would clean our room next. I expected more from Disney. Also, we had an uninspiring view of the pool and mostly of a parking lot. The room was average size, and the decor was mildly Disney at best. It felt like a motel room, and at $300/night in a Disney property, I expect more. Also, you are a good

We stayed at DPP for 5 nights . Overall it was a great family hotel without being too "Disney". Subtle Mickey Mouse motifs in the room and cute beach ball pillows on the beds. We had 4 people in the one room and it was plenty of space for all of us. This hotel is very convenient to both Disneyland and California Adventure being about a 5-10minute easy walk away. Staff are very pleasant and welcoming. The pool area is good with a fantastic waterslide and spa. This hotel is not a 5 star hotel but it doesn't claim to be.It's just a great convenient, clean welcoming hotel to stay whilst enjoying the Disneyland area.

The person who checked us in was ok, but not overly friendly.  Some of the people at check-in were not friendly at all.  There was one man in training who was extremely friendly and helpful. Not what I expected from Disney. Had requested a King room as it was DH and myself.  We were told when we arrived there are no King rooms in that hotel.  Seems strange to me. Have stayed at the Beach Club in Disney World, so I guess I was expecting something like that.  The room itself was nothing special.  Just a hotel room. All the maids were nice and friendly, so that was a plus. The pool was clean and nice and so was the spa. Character bkfst with the Grandchildren was good food & lots of entertainment for the kids. Just like I would expect from Disney.  Very happy with that. Breakfast in

Disney hospitality is top notch, so our stay was pleasant and the staff was very nice.  However, there isn't anything special about this hotel - basic room, basic amenities.  One great thing is that it is very close to the side entrance of California Adventure so when my young daughter got tired, it was an easy walk back to the hotel.  On the flip side, the entrance to Disneyland is a looong walk,

We have stayed at Disney's California Adventure numerous times and decided to try and save money by staying at Paradise Pier.  Glad we did!  GREAT customer service from front desk and bell staff! All very friendly and made us feel welcome.   Room was WONDERFUL!  Just enough decor to remind you of Disney and California beaches.  We requested a lower floor so as not to bother with overcrowded elevators (which we read on the internet reviews) and got a beautiful room located minutes away from the beautiful pool area.  Elevator service was not a problem when we were there. Hotel location is close to Downtown Disney and other Disney hotels.  We will stay here again for sure!

Summary Heading: Don't count this Disney property out
Summary: We splurged and booked a concierge room for one night at the Paradise Pier Hotel. We had a cabana room wich meant we had a sliding glass door that led out to our own gated area with a table and cushioned outdoor chairs. We also had direct access up the stairs to the pool area.  The concierge service was great. It's called the Beachcomber Club. It's open from 6:30am to 8:00pm. Coffee (and espresso), soda's water, juice available all day. Continental breakfast from 6:30-10 featuring fresh fruits, pastries, bagels, muffins, cereals, fresh juices. Afternoon snack from 10-5 included bags of chips, fresh fruits & trail mixes. Followed  by cocktail hour(s) 5pm-7 that included various cheeses and crackers, fresh honey, a hot appetizer, and bite size desserts. It as great for the 5 of us

This is a decent middle-of-the-road hotel, but there isn't any magic. The airline had lost my luggage, but I wasn't offered a toothbrush or anything like that.  The biggest weirdness is the elevator system. The main elevators are all set back about two feet from the lobby, so that everyone getting out (with strollers, wheelchairs etc.) has to squeeze down a little corridor before anyone can get in. Since the hotel only has 3 main elevators, this creates a major bottleneck at popular times. Also there is an up-only elevator (!!) that has call buttons only on the bottom floors, but doesn't seem to return to the ground when it's been used. Odd.  Downtown Disney is very close. Restaurants here (and throughout the area) are relatively expensive, and very crowded on weekends.

Okay, so I knew exactly what we were getting when we booked our stay here, but...  Aside from location - because yes, the location was perfect! - the Disney Paradise Pier hotel was just okay for us. I totally expected to pay what we did (and actually, we got a pretty good deal when we booked at $800 for 4 nights / 5 days), because I know Disneyland and the surrounding area is going to be inflated, just because of what it is.   But, here's why I wasn't particularly impressed:  The service at the front desk left much to be desired. We were the second couple in line when we got there - and with 5 people working the counter, it still took us almost 45 minutes to get any help.   As well, we had reservations for dinner in LA that night at 8:15, so we asked what time we should leave,

Summary Heading: We were there for a conference
Summary: The lobby was great. Services was OK.  Breakfast was delicious.  Also, the coffee shop serves food and we ate hamburger there which was delicious (costs 9.9$).  It is close to Disney town.

We had a great stay from the time we arrived. We were upgraded to a park view room. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The location was fantastic as we across the road from california Adventure Park which was unreal. the staff were very helpful. Pool was clean and the service was great. I would definitely stay there again with my family. Only one thing we would have liked a Queen size bed. otherwise beds comfortable.

First, let me get one thing out of the way.  YES, it's expensive and YES, it's not as nice as the Disneyland Hotel or the Grand.  I'm always surprised when I hear people complaining about the fact that it's not that great for the price.  HELLO....it's Disneyland!!!  Everything is overpriced and you can tell by simply looking at the outside of the hotel or the lobby that it's NOT going to be 5 star accomodations.  You should consider booking somewhere else if that's what you're looking for.  And yes, the elevators are a bit slow at peak times.  Again, book somewhere else if that's an issue for you.  We just returned from a 4 night stay at the hotel (view room on the 11th floor) & had a really nice stay.  Opted for this hotel as we saved $420 over a "parking lot view room" at the

After they swipped my account of 700 extra $... Then basically acted like I was lying... Finally got my money back after my card got declined trying to feed my kids dinner... Fridge broke in room as well as safe took 24 hours to get help... I just wanted a little sympathy wasnt looking for free anything!!! Felt like I could've got better service at motel 6! I love disney have annual passes! Never had issues like this at any other hotel!! Very sad and discouraged... But clean room and close to park... But I will never stay here again... Crying in the lobby not my idea of a fun vacation!!!

Summary Heading: Budget hotel but not a budget price
Summary: My kids loved this hotel, but for adults, ehhh... Our season passes where coming to end so we decided to stay overnight.  One problem was it was Thanksgiving week, a very expensive week.  Not the hotel's fault.  It just had a budget feel to it.  Being close to both parks as wonderful but next time we will try another Disney property. The beach theme is cute and the surfboard rice crispy treats are a wonderful touch.
My 20-yr-old daughter and I stayed at Paradise Pier last August when we came for ElecTRONica.  The room was amazing!!! Great location, great price. When we go back, we will be staying here again!!!
best place to stay we loved it and the kids too very friendly and great location. hope we can get back there.

My family loves this hotel.  We were upgraded to a family suite, but even if we had been in the room we originally booked it would have been a great stay.  If possible, book a concierge room with theme park view.  These rooms are maintained in excellent condition and I feel the upgrade is worth the money for my family of five.  I haunt the Disney website for the best deals, I saved over $200 per night by checking frequently and requesting a revised room rate.  Disney Travel is easy to work with and will update the rate if there is a better deal.   It would be nice if they adjusted your reservation as their deals and specials become available.  We had a minor incident with our housekeeping - the night housekeeping staff went over the top to say sorry.  They made a giant Mickey

Summary Heading: Hotel is due for an update and is old but service is great.
Summary: We have stayed at the other two Disney properties and were excited to stay at Paradise Pier.  We booked the concierge level with park view.  The view from our room was beautiful.  However we were very dissapointed in the hotel and the concierge service.  We barely accessed the concierge service as it was on a different floor than our room and they lock the room at 8 pm.  So when we returned from the park when it closed at 9 we had to purchase waters and snacks for our kids from the cafe downstairs.  They had a very limited breakfast selection of muffins, coffee and bagels.   We would not purchase this service again.   The carpet in our room was very stained and dirty.  The bathrooms are small and have one sink.  This was hard with a family of five.  The service was still very

Summary Heading: Worth the experience, but dubious value
Summary: This is our second stay at the paradise Pier, the first since the room refresh. I am a veteran of many Disney properties ( all 3 at DLR, and 6 at WDW) . The check in was smooth and professional, unfortunately the first room they showed us was stained, dirty, and reeked of smoke. I called down to the front desk, and they sent up a manager to escort us to the same room two floors up. Very seamless. There was nothing at all wrong with the second room. We had a great view of DCA.  The pros of staying at paradise pier include: 1. Benefits of charging , package delivery, magic mornings, wake up calls etc. 2. Enjoyable stroll through GC and downtown Disney to DL, and straight through GC to DCA. 3. A real Hotel experience including room service etc.  The cons: 1. Room quality for the

I'm twelve and will be turning thirteen this year(2012)...We've been going to Disneyland every October since I was two. Ever since we have been staying in this hotel every time we went, I've had more fun...the maids and staff are very nice and convenient. When we go in October, we celebrate my two brothers' birthdays, the hotel has given us chocolate covered Mickey Mouse rice-crispy treats and chocolate coins. The staff and workers, enjoy watching kids have fun...that is very important. Despite only having one pool and one water slide, I find it to be more pleasurable. There are less people, so it is easier to have fun..(I hate big crowds). And come on, how many hotels will you find with the pool on the roof!? I have stayed at all the hotels numerous times, but Paradise Pier is

We stayed for three nights during Spring Break, with our four-year old son and six-month old daughter. As Disneyland Resort's "value-priced" hotel, we were pleasantly surprised by the overall quality of the property, guest rooms, furnishings, and especially the service. Although it is still priced far higher than the independent "good neighbor" hotels nearby, the proximity to the parks, consistent theme, and extras such as Magic Mornings and park access through the Grand Californian make it worth it. You're spending a lot to be enchanted by the Disney magic - might as well go all the way.  Liked:  Walking distance to the parks, especially California Adventure. With two young children, being able to scoot out for a midafternoon nap, and then return in the evening for dinner and a

Summary Heading: The Best Disney Hotel to stay at!! It was a great location!
Summary: I went to stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel in 2011.  It was a nice place!  They bumped us up to a park view room (could see World of Color clearly from our room!) and requested more pens because there was 4 of us (only 2 pens).  They left us a bunch of stationary when we came back from a fun-filled day at the parks!!  Very roomy for us!  It was nice to have the sofa turn into a bed, it was very comfy too!  The PCH Grill was a fun place to eat breakfast!

We stayed April 12th to the 15th. We had a early flight so arrived at the hotel about 9am. Our rooms of course were not ready yet. We had requested to have two rooms next to each other. Both rooms were upgraded. The first was a conceirge room which was upgraded with a view. My room was a conceirge/view room which was upgraded to a suite.  We were able to check in about 330pm. Both rooms were beautiful. The view of California adventure park is outstanding. The suite was amazing. The first room has a large bathroom, A sectional couch that folds out into a large bed, and still leaves part of the couch. A large dining room table. A tv,with DVD player, fridge and microwave. The second room had 2 queen beds, a couch that folds into a small bed, a tv, and another full bathroom. I was

Our extended family of 6 just returned from a great time at Disneyland, staying at the Paradise Pier was an excellent choice.  From the time we arrived to the time we left, we found the staff to be knowledgeable, helpful and always friendly. As we had read about the elevators being slow, it was never a big problem and getting in the elevator going up even if you wanted to go down was a good plan as then it never took too long. The convenience in being close to the park(walk less than 10 minutes to the Disneyland gates), having the opportunity to have all Disneyland tickets, confirmations made right there and early entries all made staying at the hotel most beneficial. The pool and slide were great and those comfy beds are a great place to fall into at the end of a busy day.  We

Summary Heading: Good Disney hotel for the price
Summary: The least expensive of the resort hotels. We have stayed here twice and have not been disappointed.  Food in the character breakfast was just OK, nothing special but my kids enjoyed breakfast with Lilo and Stitch.  One downside is the very long walk back to the hotel after a day at the park.  This hotel is located at the very far end of the resort property on the other side of Downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel, A Must!
Summary: From the moment our family openend the door to our room, we fell in love with it!  Our 6 year old son ran immediately to the beach balls(now I can see why one would want to take them home).  Our daughter yelled out"Don't mess anything up, I want to take a picture of  the room before it gets messy".  We are a family of 5.  The room was very comfortable and the maid service was outstanding.  The view was "to die for", you could see Caif. Disney Adventure, the foreworks, and the "World of color" from the window.  The "World of color" had music on the TV playing simultaneously as the 26 minute display of water color occurred outside our window.  The downstairs cafe had spectaculat mochas and breakfast burritos!  For a buffet breakfast, the cartoon characters were fun to have our

We have stayed at this hotel more times than I can count, due to convenience. This stay was not the best. First, room wasn't ready until later in the day. When we got to the room there were two lights burned out. My daughter took a bath and it took twenty minutes for the water to drain. Not so bad as we were leaving for dinner anyway. Our room was on the fifth floor, one room away from the end of the building. Delivery trucks started backing in (ie: beep, beep, beep) at about 4:30am. You used to be able to eat off a menu in the Lilo and Stich restaurant. Not now. The expresso machine was broken this morning at the snack bar (the only other place to eat breakfast). And the last expected problem: After waiting through 3 filled elevators we joined the exodus down the stairwell to

We enjoyed our stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel. We are a family of 5 and the room actually accomodated all of us. (most hotels only sleep 4) Both the room and bathroom were kept very clean.The beds (incl the daybed my daughter slept on) were really comfortable. The staff were friendly, even the housekeeppers greeted us in the hallways.We had a nice view of the pool from our window. Although our room came with a small refrigerator It didn't have a microwave. I also thought the character breakfast at the PC Grill was a bit pricey. I don't think I could've eaten $29.99 worth or breakfast. Let alone my 11yr. old. But I understand I'm paying for the entertainment. It is quite a walk to Disneyland and California Adventure but you could take the Monorail which comes about every 5 mins.

Our family of 5 stayed at the Disney Paradise Pier during Spring Break in a premium view room on the 7th floor. The room was super clean and comfortable. Even the convertible sofa bed was easy to convert and cozy enough for our kids! We were able to see the World of Color show from our room, which made it very convenient for our 6, 4 and 2 yr old. The shower head was not at all "slow flow" like some previous reviews mentioned...the shower head even rotated continuiously while the water was running! Although the hotel was fully booked, it was quiet in the evenings and we all slept very well. It's a very short walk to both parks (5 minutes), which is another convenience if your little ones like to take naps! We didn't experience the long elevator wait as some mentioned except for

Okay the pool wasn't open until the next day we got there.  The rooms were nice and the people on the concierge level were great ! However they charged my credit card three times for one day of Disney tickets!! I had to call my bank and each time they reverse the charges they charge my card again!!!! Annoying!!

Summary Heading: Good location and view, nice room, but service not up to Disney standards
Summary: Our room was on the 9th floor with a great view of DCA.  Watched World of Color from our room on the first evening, as we were Jetlagged.  TV has a station that played the World of Color music, which was nice..  Room was extremely clean with a nice layout and a small frig.   Breakfast in the PCH grill with characters was very nice.  We went somewhat early 7:30am on a Sunday, and the crowd was small and enjoyed all the characters thoroughly (Mickey, Minnie, Pluto, and Stitch.) Walk to parks was easiest cutting through Disney's California Resort.  Elevators were never an issue and self-parking was easy.  Front desk was not as knowledgable as I would have liked.  I learned about the early entry to DCA from a website.  The oddest experience was a phone call on our first evening at

We had a great stay.  We arrived early so they didn't have a room ready but that wasn't a problem.   Just checked our bags with bell staff.   Emily Ann was great at check-in!  Gave us pointers and fussed over our birthday girl. We had a room on the 12th floor overlooking the pool.  It was really quiet.   I have to say that having the pool down was an OK thing for us.  It was cool.  We wouldn't have used it anyway.  No pool noise. We were very impressed that we didn't hear our neighbors at all.  We had zero issues with any of the elevators being slow.  Only one morning with other guests getting on but that would happen anywhere.  We ordered a birthday cake to be delivered to our room as a surprise and it has cute but hideous tasting.  It was probably 6" tall and 4" was frosting

Summary Heading: The Happiest Place, not so happy
Summary: I would like to start by saying I am a DVC member and live life around Disney. This was not a pleasant Disney hotel experience.  The service was not up to par. Two days in a row they never picked up our breakfast in bed order...had to just cancel and head to parks. We quit trying after that. The pool was unexpectedly shut down for the week with no notice and it was suddenly back open the last day we were there. It would take 5 - 10 minutes just to get on an elevator...literally. Always ended up using stairs, thank God we were on the 4th floor.   The only great thing I liked was that I could walk to the parks...no getting into a car.  If I go back to Disneyland, it will not be to stay in this hotel.

This is one of three properties on the Disneyland property. I made the reservation online and was able to make payments on it directly out of my checking account through the Disney site so that all was paid in full before traveling.  Very nice rooms that are neat and clean and very comfy beds - we all slept great here.  (although the shower water pressure is very poor)  Even though the farthest of the three away from the park - still close to Disneyland park by walking through Downtown Disney to the monorail.  Also close to California Adventure Park by crossing the street and accessing the entrance to that park through the Grand California Hotel.  Overall it was a good experience.  One problem.  The pool was closed for refurbishing.  Seems odd to pick a peak time (spring break)

Summary Heading: Nice hotel to stay at for a Disneyland adventure
Summary: Paradise Pier hotel in Disneyland.    We had made reservations early in January but I still thought it was best to pick up everything when we checked in rather than have them mail us the documentation.  Making the reservations was very simple and went well.    We had a delightfully nice but thoroughly inept front desk person to check us in.  She was very nice but missed out of some important details.  Starting with the nice part was that she upgraded our room from a poolside view to a parkside view.  The parkside view does have its drawbacks.  It is noisier because it is on Disney Drive and all the traffic whizzes by.  We were there in time to hear this noisy bad neighbour style of music – when we looked out the window we saw the water show for World Of Color was on.  It was

Had a great time especially if you have a park view room. Easy walk to Downtown Disney and California Adventure Park through Grand California. Even the walk to Disneyland is easy. Shop in foyer is excellent and I can't complain about the service anywhere in the hotel. Maybe a few more Disney themes would be nice.  Only complaint was the pool was closed for renovations and I wasnt told beforehand. Didn't matter in the end as it was too cold to swim and who wants to swim when you could be at Disneyland :)

We recently visited Disneyland in March 2012, and while I would have loved to stay at the Grand Californian, the extra $500 was hard to justify, so I thought I would take a chance on the Paradise Pier hotel instead.  As other reviewers have mentioned, there is no elevator in the hotel's parking garage, so be prepared to walk down the ramp with your luggage.  This was not a big issue for us, but if you are bringing small children, I can see where that would be inconvenient.  We arrived at 2PM on a Friday (check in is at 3PM).  The lobby was not crowded and we were checked in in a matter of minutes and a clean room was available.  The decor is beach themed, and while the hotel does show it's age, it's pleasant and not over-the-top in its theme. I was prepared for horrible

Booked this hotel for the raging water slide as my kids love water slides...and NO POOL! Also, booked concierge with no park view because they put concierge customers on the 2nd floor (where the concierge is) or the 14, for those customers who want concierge but also a park view...  Well, guess? We have no park vue and they put us up on the 14th floor with a view of the broken pool!   Yeah that's great after traveling for 7 hours and you aren't on the concierge level (but paying the concierge prices) AND you have a view of the pool with 3 kids itching to use the pool!  They don't care - I tried to upgrade to a park vue today and they told me they are sold out!  Guess what? I am NEVER staying here again...and we come to Disneyland once a year...

We did a lot of walking on this trip. There was not great transport back to the hotel. Room was clean and larege enough for 3. The elevators were a bit slow but not too bad. Pool was not open yet. Our room had a great view of CA Adventure and the World of Color show!

This was the first time staying on the concierge level of the Paradise Pier hotel and it was WONDERFUL!!! The concierge people were so friendly and helpful!!! Our room was on the 14th floor with an excellent view of California Adventure!! The food in the club was delicious!!! We had a wonderful Character Breakfast downstairs with Mickey and Minnie. Our room was very comfortable for a family of five. We had 2 Queen beds and a couch that turned in to a bed. The room was nice and quiet. We stayed 2 days here and then moved over to the Grand Californian. Personally the concierge staff was friendlier here. When we were leaving to go to the Grand Californian our van wouldnt start but security jumped started it. Parking is $22 a day for Valet and $15 for Self Parking. We really enjoyed

This hotel was the first time we had stayed at a Disney hotel, and the service was top-notch. One day was particularly memorable. We got back to our room after a day at the park. My kids' stuffed animals (various Disney stuffed animals that they have accumulated over multiple Disney trips) had been set up in a beautiful display on the table in our room, together with chocolates and balloons. One of the stuffed animals even had a custom Mickey hat on its head made from construction paper! It looked like a true labor of love, and really made our day! We also had a fun time doing the trivia challenges that Paradise Pier offered.

we stayed here on the canadian spring break  mar 20-27.  check in was perfect, when they asked us if we were celebrating anything on this trip, we told them it was our 38th anniversary, and they gave us 3 helium ballons with heart weights on them, buttons with happy anniversary on them and a 8x10 photo signed by mickey and minni.The hotel was super clean all the time. Evert night there was 3 chocolate disney coins on each of our pillows when we returned to our rooms. Our room looked over california adventure ,making every evening looking at all the lights  such a cool end to the day. The pool was under renos, but we could use the pool at the Disney hotel a few steps away if we wanted to. The pool was open just two days after we checked in, and it was great. all the staff was

Summary Heading: Beachy resort with subtle Disney accents
Summary: I liked the break from all-things-Disney when we returned to our room. Very clean, neutral, comfortable room. We enjoyed a character breakfast and it was a quick walk to the monorail. Our room had a view of the Paradise Pier and evening water and light show was awesome! It was pricey but we completely enjoyed this first visit to Disneyland. The staff provided excellent service.

Summary Heading: Friendly service...what you would expect from a Disney owned property
Summary: You have Goofy statue greeting you as you first enter the lobby but other than that, you don't get the Disney feel.  The rooms were clean with comfortable beds, which is most important to me.  There are 2 "beach ball" pillows on the beds which have a sign stating that if you take these they will charge you $65.00 a piece!  For renting a room at over $400.00 a night, you would really think that they would include those for the kids.  You know that they don't really cost that much but it would be a nice "thank you" for their guests.  Their parking terrace does NOT have an elevator so if you want to use your car then you better hope that you find a parking space on the main level.    We had the Conceirge Room that is a great service through out the day.  Especially 5-7 PM when it's

overall  this was a nice hotel. you def pay for the disney name. there aren't really any perks otherwise. when we checked in the pool area was under renivation, but accoring to the Disneyland website it was suppose to be done the day we arrived. it wasn't yet completed when we left FIVE days later either. the told us that the Disneyland Hotel pool wwas open to us since the pool at our hotel was closed. we chose not to do it. we also had a "pool view" room it would have been nice if the constuction team didn't start working at the butt crack of dawn. they were very loud, and also after watching them for a bit i understood why the pool wasn't finished. they just stood around talking and some would start painting then five minutes later sit down and take a break.  also we HATED the

We stayed here from 03/19/2012 to 03/23/2012.  I knew before going that the pool was closed, however I didnt know that there would be horribly loud construction starting at 6 am every morning and lasting until around 6 pm.   The guys right outside our window were loud and just talking they werent even doing anything and when we called the front desk all they said was they could move us to the 15th floor.   The elevator was to slow so since we were taking the steps we just declined.    We paid $400 extra to have conciere service which was completley not worth it.   When we arrived we had two rice kripies treats on our bed.  Considering there were 5 of us (3 kids) that did not work out to well.   It would have been better for them to just keep them instead of my kids fighting over

Summary Heading: Terrible Water Pressure in Two Different Rooms
Summary: The hotel itself was nice, rooms were spacious, sheets were nice.  We had two rooms for two different families.  Water pressure in the shower barely got the soap out of our hair, It was awful.  To enter the disney parks you either had to enter at the Grand Californian into California Adventure, which you could not return through if you left the park at night to go to Disneyland as they closed the entrance unless you were seeing their World of Color Show.  If that option was closed you had to walk all the way through Downtown Disney to find the hotel.  It was not well marked how to get back to the hotel from this way.  Overall stay at the Hilton at least you would have a good shower and save some money

The Pool is currently closed at the Paradise Pier Hotel for safety reasons.  I am fowarding this to let travelers know this ahead of time so that they are not disappointed at check in.  If you travel to the Disneyland Resort and want to stay on property that has a pool, either make reservations at the Disneyland Hotel or the Disney's Grand Californian Hotel.  The Pier is currently directing guests to use the Disneyland Hotel's new pool.  Please inform other travelers of this before they arrive or make reservations.  Thank you!!!

My family LOVES Paradise Pier! We go to Disneyland ALL the time because we have annual passes, and Paradise Pier is PERFECT! The first time we went there, we got fantastic service, a great room, etc. All the times following, we got the same thing. They always have great service, and the location is perfect! It's right next to Downtown Disney (which is good if your taking the monorail to a specific part of the park) and it's right next to Grand Californian Hotel which is where you can to California Adventure. They are both within walking distance. I LOVELOVELOVE Paradise Pier hotel! I definitely recommend you check it out! (:

We are DVC members and usually stay at the Villas at the Grand Californian. But they were full and we had points that we had to use or lose, so we decided to give the Paradise Pier Hotel a try. I was a bit worried since we were used to the service and surroundings of the Grand Californian but we were very pleased with the hotel, the service and the amenities. We arrived around 7 am and they didn't have a standard view room ready yet, but did have a park view room ready (overlooks California Adventure). We paid extra to have to view and the room right away and it was totally worth it! Even though we only had a standard size room and 5 people, it didn't feel cramped. It was clean and bright. And of course, the view made it just that much better. The staff was friendly and very

We stayed at the Paradise Pier from March 1st - 7th and we can't say enough about the great service they provided to our family.  Our son ended up getting a 24-hour flu bug one of the nights we were there and housekeeping was amazing with our middle-of-the-night requests for extra towels, bedding, etc.  They were prompt & always courteous with whatever request we had for them.  We had an amazing view of California Adventure Park from our room on the 10th floor.  The only downside was that the hotel pool was being re-decked at the time but we were able to use of the pool at the Disneyland Hotel, which was amazing!  The beds & bedding were very comfy as well!

We just had the most wonderful 6 night stay at Paradise Pier Hotel! We paid extra for an upper level theme park view and concierge service, it was WELL worth the money! We have been to Disneyland MANY times and have stayed in good neighbor hotels and Grand Californian...this hotel is the BEST so far! We were in room 1402 and the view was AMAZING to say the least! We could watch world of color from our room! Even my 2 year old couldn't get enough of the view!  The concierge beach comber lounge was good, could use more variety but was great to grab breakfast and soft drinks etc.  The rooms were spacious and comfy. Very short walk, literally across the street from the Grand Californian. We love to walk to the park through Downtown Disney!  I have read other reviews complaining

We stayed at the Disney Paradise Pier Hotel  March 8-11 .The location was so convenient .The employees at the hotel were all so friendly and helpful ! We had a car so we parked it in the parking lot at the back .The front desk recommended that we unload the luggage first before parking as there were no elevators in the parking garage .The parking was $15/day ,and the key allowed you to leave the secured lot by showing your key . The room had 2 queen beds ,and  a pull out sofa bed (if you needed it ) ,and was done up in a Disney theme with a beach ball cushion  on the bed . The walls were a little thin as we could hear the kids next door . The rooms were very clean ,and the cleaning service was very good.  .You can walk to Downtown Disney in 10 minutes ,and the Convention Center

Summary Heading: Nice hotel within walking distance to theme parks
Summary: We stayed at the Disney Paradise Pier Hotel President's Week 2012.  It is a nice, clean hotel with friendly staff.  Unfortunately, the pool was out of commision during our time there, but looks like it would be fun, with a waterslide for the kids to enjoy.  The room had 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa/twin bed.  It was perfect for our family of 4.  The property seemed to be well maintained.  If you are going to stay in one of the Disney properties, it is the farthest away from the theme parks.  (Grand Californian is the closest.)  A couple of blocks from the hotel, you can catch the monorail into Disneyland through Downtown Disney, which is like an open air mall.  To get to Disney California Adventure park, you have to walk through the Grand Californian lobby.  We did not take

We stayed at this hotel Dec 15-20, 2011. Having stayed at the Hojo on previous trips, I was prepared to be feel that we paid way too much for the whole "Disney" vibe. I was also a bit iffy after seeing some reviews here, although the majority were good. Boy, was I happy to be mistaken. This is a gorgeous hotel, staffed by fantastic employees who all had a smile on their face. We didn't get in until 7 pm, and the clerk at check-in made a big deal of my daughter's birthday! Then, we rode up the elevator (remember, try to use the glass elevator near the lobby. It saved us a TON of time the whole trip!) to our fourth floor room. Everything was clean and looked neat and remodeled, even the cool hidden Mickey beach ball carpet in the halls.   The room was well-sized, with two queens

We just returned from our mini vacation to Disneyland and we stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel.  What a great location, just minutes walking distance to downtown Disney.  The staff was extremely nice and helpful.  We did arrive early so they held our luggage while we ate at the restaurant at the hotel and then proceeded to Disneyland.  The only bummer during our stay was the pool was being renevated so we had to use the Diseyland Hotel's pool....so....more walking.  The elevators are rather a nightmare in the morning as everyone has the same idea...get to Disneyland before anyone else does.  We finally just started taking the stairs...much quicker.  Very convenient, clean and friendly hotel.  Would certainly stay there again.

I paid for an extra night just so that me and my family could check in early. I called to verify we would have a room and when we got there they sent us to a DIRTY room. Room service never cleaned it from the last guest. The only thing the front desk said was they would hold our stuff tell and we could go to breakfast. I have 2 small kids that wanted to nap before we went to the park. They magically found a new room only after i got really rude.VERY disappointed.paid for an extra day for NOTHING! Will never stay here again. O  and did i mention i was told they had a great pool and slide we would get to use and when we got there it was under construction!!

The parking garage was small as was the lobby which did not lead to the best first impression, but it got much better after that. The desk staff was super friendly and the room was huge with a beautiful view of California Adventure.  Water pressure not the best and the elevators could get crowded, but the hotel was immaculately clean with great staff. Would definitely stay here again in the future!

Summary Heading: Great value, location and just enough Disney.
Summary: This was our second stay in this property, the first being a year ago.  As in last time, we paid for an upgrade to a theme park view room.    We had a bit of a rough start with this reservation -- meaning the Disney agents made two errors in our room/ticket package.  The first  not adding enough park hopper tickets to the package and the second not adding in the concierge service requested.  As in true Disney fashion, they more than made up for this by a HUGE upgrade to a one bedroom suite.  What a nice surprise at check in.  If your budget allows for a suite, go for it!  The room is so spacious and has two very nicely appointed bathrooms.  Also the refrigerator and microwave are ideal, as you could save some  money by having light food in the room.  The room had a lot of

I always wonder about onsite versus offsite hotels when planning a trip to Disneyland in Anaheim, CA.  Since Disney was offering an off season special I booked a night at the least expensive of the onsite hotels, Paradise Pier.  We planned our trip to take advantage of Disney's "Magic Mornings," which allows onsite guests to enter the park one hour before the general public, even on the morning of the day you check in.  The Magic Morning started at 9:00 a.m. and we arrived at the hotel at 8:00 a.m.  What makes a hotel stay really nice is when they go beyond what you expect.  We expected to store our luggage until the afternoon check in, but since a room was available they checked us in at 8:00 a.m.!  The second unexpected pleasure was a complimentary upgrade to a park view room.

Summary Heading: Great Room, Great View, Great Service, Slow Elevators
Summary: I was chucking about all of the comments about how slow the elevators are at the hotel until the first morning of our stay.  A 30 minute wait!!  I took the stairs down from the 6th floor.  But that's the only complaint I had about our two night stay at "The Pier".  The staff was great - cheerful, acommodating, the rooms were very nice - quiet, comfortable beds, good towels, great view of CA Adventure, the location was superb - a short walk through the Grand Californian to the Disney Village area or the "secret entrance" for hotel patrons.  We got the "winter rate" which made the value even better.  The breakfast buffet was too expensive ($24 for adults) for what we needed to get us going in the morning but the snack bar in the lobby sells a quick breakfast including Micky

This was our first ever trip to America and our first night was here....The staff were so lovely; they helped us with everything that we required! Donnie served us upon arrival and gave us all signed photographs from the Disney characters. This hotel felt like we were still at home, it was comfortable, safe and a 5minute walk to all the Disney shops so every morning and evening we would walk to the store and check it out.....I would 100% recommend staying here if your wanting to visit Disneyland....it will blow you away!

I am 7 months pregnant and came down to Disneyland...I know I'm crazy. :) Anyways, recently back at home I've been having troubles with pain in my hips when sleeping so I bought a memory foam mattress pad for it. Well...going on vacation I couldn't bring it with me so was hoping I'd be ok...well I wasn't. My 2nd morning I woke up in so much pain I was in tears. My husband went and talked to the hotel about my situation and they put a memory foam mattress (or something similar) on our bed for us so I could get good rest. It was a life saver!!! I don't know what I would've done without it!! I'm ever so thankful and grateful!

Summary Heading: Great hotel, but not for a business traveler
Summary: I recently stayed at the Paradise Pier for a convention in Anaheim. I must say, the place was very clean and they pay attention to detail. The staff was exremely friendly, which you don't always find at hotels so that was nice. The multiple "Have a magical day" comments from staff was a little much, but I understand it's a Disney thing.  Being there on business, I needed internet access and good internet access. Most hotels today offer that and there are no problems. The wi-fi service at the hotel was HORRIBLE, so bad it took 3 minutes for a new e-mail to pop up.   The internet was my only complaint but for a business traveler that's a big one. Otherwise I did appreciate the beds being nice & the bathroom being very clean.

Summary Heading: fun and memories with my grandkids at disneyland
Summary: I gave my grandkiddos a trip to disneyland for christmas.......we made the trip in february. it was awesome from beginning to end but heads up grandparents there is ALOT of walking..... if you have walking issues rent a scooter as I  did. it was great!  paradise pier hotel was super.....nothing fancy but very comfortable and clean and right on disney property..... so convenient  and we had a great view. the food was expensive and average. I would suggest eating elsewhere. the buffet breakfast was really fun with lots of disney characters but don't go for the food as it wasn't great.... and quite expensive. we had a wonderful time with lots if laughs and memories, quick get the kids together board a plane and go to disneyland.... it was a great vacation.

Summary Heading: Not the Grand, but Great Value!
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised by Disney's Paradise Pier hotel. We normally stay at the Grand, but found the rates for a last minute weekend to be over the top. Just a crosswalk away, the Paradise Pier was a great value. Clean, nicely decorated, and the staff was true to Disney.  We enjoy the atmosphere of the Grand, but would just walk over and relax by the fire, or in the lounge there as there's not really a gathering place at the Pier.  Would recommend concierge level. Breakfast items, espresso, juices; with a family of four we easily saved 60-75 dollars a day just in breakfast. Afternoon snacks and wine was also appreciated.  Theme park view was great - the lights of California Adventure were a great night light.  All in all, would definitely return. Being right next to the

since there are only 3 disney resorts in anaheim, this is their "value" resort (but of course is still pricey!). but it was still an amazing location, was able to walk to the parks, great service, FAST AND SPEEDY CHECK IN!!!! absolutely loved it!

1. No one but no one gets into their rooms until 3 PM. Disney wants you in the park. 2. No room service for lunch. Disney wants you in the park. 3. Room is full of Disney promotions. Disney wants you to spend more.  4. Limited room service menu...Disney wants you in the park. Food arrived only slightly warm. Milk was warm. 5. Money for concierge upgrade is not worth the extra expense. 6. Rooms are decorated in a sea side theme. Much of the door is over the line that separates cute from tacky. 7. Poor TV reception. 8. Even worse wifi. Called  tech support and on hold for 30 minutes. The problem was not fixed. 9. Bath towels stiff and scratchy. 10. Nice bed but way too may pillows. 11. Upgraded to a suite..thanks Disney. 12.Disney sent a text to my phone that the room was ready

Summary Heading: The best balance between convenience and budget for us!
Summary: We were delighted by Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel and would definitely recommend it for its location and ease of entry into California Adventure....just across the street and through Grand California Hotel--into the "hotel only" entrance which never crowded.  This is the lowest price of the Disney property hotels and was delightful.  The pool area looks entertaining, but it was closed for a remodel while we were there.  Refrigerator in the room was good to have.  Room service was always prompt and friendly.

We checked in at Paradise Pier Hotel and were met with helpful individuals working the front counter. Everyone was nice and knew  our needs without asking. After our seven hour drive and us having a three and one year old in tow, all we wanted was to check-in. Mike, the one with glasses, helped us with great personal service. He gave us helpful advice for the week we stayed.  The park was within walking distance. I do wish the swiming pool was in operation but it was being serviced or "resurfaced" according to Mike. The rooms were clean and kept clean during the week. For the price it was well worth it. NOTE: Have groceries delivered  (FREE) to the hotel and save money on food. We did and even ordered pizza and had it delivered. We saved a lot of money doing so. You have to ask

We stayed for three nights and loved it.  The hotel is the least expensive of the three Disney hotels but it is a great value.  The rooms are very comfortable.  We had two queen beds and a sofa that pulled out to make another bed.  There is a safe and a small refigerator in the room, which are nice to have.  The beds are comfy and the linens are great.  At this point, the pool is closed but you are able to use the new pool at the Disneyland Hotel.  It is a short walk to Downtown Disney or California Adventure through the Grand Californian Hotel.  I love the convenience and ambience of this hotel.  It is set with a beach or surf theme and they do a great job throughout.  People complain about the elevators but most everyone ignores the elevator set off to the side by itself.  It

Summary Heading: Nice Stay easy access to Park's
Summary: I recently stayed here Feb 10-12th 2012 with my cousin. We enjoyed being able to see the fireworks from our window. The room was clean and well appointed. The draw backs were not enough dinning options. They had only character breakfast in the main dinining room and offered coffee/bakery items in lobby. The beds are comfortable, the AC is strong and wont adjust properly so it was turned on and off frequently.

We stayed at the Paradise Pier hotel for 5 nights in Feb 2012.  We had read previous reviews and knew what to expect. We were traveling with our 9month old baby. The check-in was smooth, as soon as the staff saw a small lineup growing, they asked us to come to Guest services in order to be helped faster. Check-in was knowledgeable and accommodating. We got room 342, with a slight view of California Adventure Park.  The room was great, clean and comfortable. We had ordered some groceries to be delivered from a local grocer, and that went very smooth as well. The rooms were quiet, and we heard nothing of the people around us. The walk to the park is about 10mins, and only is a stretch if Downtown Disney is busy (ie:Saturdays).  Great Hotel, feels like you are staying somewhere

Summary Heading: Have stayed here many times and continue to come back!
Summary: We have stayed her at least once a year since December of 2008 and have never been disappointed.  The rooms are large.  The beds are comfortable.  The couch that folds into a bed is perfect for my 4 year old!  There's even enough room to store all our clothes and keep the strollers unfolded so the kids can hop in them and go!  The closet is large and I love that I don't have to haul my own pack n play with us because the rooms have a pack n play in them already.  One less thing to carry with us.  I have a 4 and 2 year old, but have been coming here since my oldest was 10 months.    As far a cleanliness, no other hotel can beat the Disney properties.  The rooms are always spotless and I never have to worry about the kids touching things that are dirty.  I'm super picky when it

Summary Heading: The Grand Californian is nice. But this is better in some ways.
Summary: Far exceeds expectations; strongly recommend!  So, let's get one thing out of the way: If you've already committed to stay inside the Disneyland Resort, at one of the 3 on-site hotels, then you know you're going to be paying more than the weekend special rate over at the Beverly Wilshire Hotel. Ridiculously more. You have to go into it with the full expectation that the Disney organization is going to extract money from you, with authority.  OK, embrace that idea yet? With that aside, I thought this was a great hotel pick.  We usually stay at the Grand Californian but decided to try out Paradise Pier. 1-bedroom suite on 13th floor (they have 13th floors at hotels?), facing the California Adventure Park. It cost less than a similar room at the Grand Cal, but I really do think

Before I start I think I need to let people know that I won this trip, so the hotel cost me nothing. OK, with that out of the way....I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I have never slept in a more comfortable bed while staying at a hotel before. The rooms have been renovated and are very nice and clean.  Short walk to the parks through the Grand Californian. My only gripes are the water pressure and the wait for the elevators.  Our first morning we finally called quits after waiting for 10 minutes and took the stairs.  Others had the same idea because the stairs were packed with people, including those that were holding babies and carrying down strollers.  Thankful our kids are old enough to walk! If the price was right I would definitely stay here again.

I've stayed at many Disney resorts and most are very good. This one does not disappoint. It costs a bit more than some hotels but I feel that the superior customer service is worth it. This is a very comfortable impeccably clean resort. The rooms are more spacious than I expected. When we were here the pool was being refurbished but we were given passes to the pool at the Disneyland hotels a short walk away. We felt that the the breakfast buffet was a bit overpriced so did not eat there. Downtown Disney is a short walk away and is quite enjoyable.  If you want to enjoy the parks, they are close by as well. I feel that overall the value for the price is very good and I would stay here again with no hesitation.   Jeff

We loved the service, and the theme of disney. A little expensive, but well worth the price if you have little ones, like we do. I highly recommen,up grading if you can afford it, you get so much more. Little disappointed in cleaninees of hotel public areas. Disney characters came to our hotel, when were eating, a nice suprise after trying all day in the park, trying to get a picture.

If you are looking for Disney magic- it ain't here  Nothing speaks of Disney except for the statue. It's a very basic hotel, clean hotel.  Not really closer to the park then motels on harbour. Anabella Inn is and extra 2 minute walk - we timed it :)  The only park you can access as a guest through a private entrance is California Adventure. Please make a mental note that if you are traveling in the off-season Magic Mornigs are not good - we only had 2 rides open Thursday - Ariel and Flying over California. NOT worth getting up an hour early - and they only open at 9:15  Pool is closed for renovation, which we knew about, but I forgot to consider the noise every renovation brings. They try to keep it to a minimum, but if you are travelling with a little one that naps during the

Summary Heading: Tinker Bell Half Marathon Weekend - Great Hotel!!
Summary: My friends and I stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel for the Tinker bell Half Marathon.  I chose this hotel mainly due to the fact that the start and finish lines were right outside the hotel entrance.  I was very pleased with the level of service we received from the cast members at this hotel.  Even though the hotel was at capacity, it never felt crowded.  I have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel three times and the Grand Californian once and while there are larger grounds at those hotels, there were also tons of people walking around.   Every cast member we saw wanted to know how we were doing and if there was anything they could do to make our stay better.  The cast members working at this hotel truly seem to enjoy being there.  This makes a huge difference.   The valet staff

Summary Heading: Nickle and Dimed through the entire process
Summary: I stayed at Paradise Pier the weekend of the Tinkerbell 1/2 marathon, January 28-29th. I'd read rave reviews about in-room treats, turn-downs, and amazing views. I saw none of that.  Pros:  - Nice to have the option to buy tickets downstairs, but you'd think there would be a discount for paying $300 for a room AND $130 for a race. Nope. - The room was very clean, there were plenty of towels and toiletries. - The text message service that tells you when your room is ready is pretty convenient. - Close to downtown Disney - The beds were very comfortable  Cons: - Getting two separate charges, one for the hotel room and one for parking. Parking should really be included in the price. - Check in is at 3pm and check out is at 11am. That's the latest check-in and earliest check-out of

I stayed here with my partner and 3 year old daughter.  We arrived really early (9.30am) and were lucky enough to be able to go straight up to our room.  The room itself was very spacious, it had 2 double beds and a day bed in it.  It was beautifully clean.   We'd been upgraded to a park view room and it was very exciting seeing what we could expect when we went over to the California side of the park! The staff were all really friendly and helpful - especially when on check out day, my partner became really sick....they were so good in helping us extend our stay.  We'd planned to stay for 3 days, but ended up staying for 7!!   The cleaners would put the cuddly toys we'd brought on the pillows, which was a lovely touch. The pool was out of action due to being refurbished, but we

I stayed here with my 2 year old daughter, husband and mother for the weekend.  I was running the Tinker Bell Half Marathon, and so was prepared to deal with heavey crowds and long waits.  It was surprising that the service did not suffer at all, and every staff or cast member I encountered was delightful.  Especially those who had to show up at 2 a.m. to deal with us insane runners!  The room was very clean and well appointed.  We did not spend much time in there, (there is way to much to see and do there!), but I slept soundly, as did my little one in her own little pull out bed.  The housekeeper even laid out her P.J.s for her!  I would love to stay here again.  The price my prove prohibitive, but hopefully I can find another great deal!

Summary Heading: Fit for a Disney Lover on a budget
Summary: As an annual passholder we are privy to discounts throughout the park. This includes the hotel, we stayed in a park view room that fullfilled my love of Disney. The room was well kept and offered all that we hoped. The shower and tub combo was clean and provided disney themed shampoo, body wash, and lotion. The service was impecable and for families was very accomodating. You are offered amenities such as park purchases being sent to the hotel, delivery of a scooter if needed, an early entry into the park. If you can, stay with Disney.

Summary Heading: Be thankful your allowed to stay here
Summary: Had never stayed at Disneyland before and decided to try.  Be prepared to pay for everything you do.  Parking is extra.  I think check in was 3PM and when we arrived at 2PM we were not allowed to check in.  Came back at 4PM and still waited 45 minutes as the desk staff was generally disinterested and unhelpful.  Wait for the two elevators on a daily basis is rough, you are better off taking stairs even on 10th floor(one of three elevators did not work during our two night visit).  A tip:go up so you can get on one, because waiting to get on as they descend and they will all be full.  Decided to spend one afternoon at the pool, however the entire area was under construction and very loud.  The spa(hot tub)was walled off and drained, I believe for repairs.  Even the pool was

After a year of planning our holiday, finally we were in Disneyland for Christmas, we stayed at the Paradise Pier. A great room, very comfortable and clean, a little small maybe but decorated nicely with a great view. The rooms were serviced everyday. Not a too bad walk into the park. Staff were helpful and welcoming and went over in detail about the park entry and services that were available such as leaving purchases at the store and being delivered to the hotel so you didnt carry them around all day. I only have one complaint, that is breakfast had to be booked, we did not know this and found it very frustrating when travelling with hungry children. Why!!! the hotel know at any given time how many people are booked with them, surely they could be more organised. We would

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while at Disneyland
Summary: Everything was geared for a great adventure at the Disneyland parks adjoining the hotel.  The rooms were cleaned each day and the staff was very helpful.  Eat at the PCH Grill for breakfast and enjoy the Disney characters that visit your table.

It was the first trip with our 3 kids (6,8,10) to LA and Disneyland and Paradise Pier Hotel. We arrived after midnight and 24 hrs traveling to be greeted by friendly helpful staff. Our room was on the 5th floor facing the street which gave us a low view of California Adventure park. The rooms are nicely decked out and the beds were comfortable and the staff kept the rooms very clean. The extra sofa bed was comfortable and fine for the kids. Room service was great and we were able to share the meals as they are a good size.This hotel is the smallest (and cheapest but not cheap) of the 3 Disney hotels but still has a good size pool and a water slide. It only has one restaurant (which is expensive) but also has a cafe where you can get a snack/coffee and a poolside bar and vending

Summary Heading: Close to parks, great decor, wish I had upgraded to a view room.
Summary: We visited as a family of four in early December. I really liked this hotel here are a few pro's and con's: Pro's - Very short walk to the parks which is on Disney property pretty much the whole time. It felt very safe. This was an important feature to us because we did have a car during our stay. - Rooms were average size and were decorated nicely with Disney themed accessories. Very clean also. - A pack and play was provided in the closet. It was in great condition. - Santa was in the lobby during select times. He was the best Santa helper I have ever encountered. - Front desk staff were very nice and went over in detail how to get to the parks, when to get to the parks, and what to do first at the parks (get world of color fast passes, etc.). This was extremely helpful info.

Summary Heading: The place to stay for your Disneyland stay.
Summary: I stayed at the hotel on business from Jan 18 - 22, 2012.   From the moment I arrived at the hotel and throughout my four night stay, I found the staff were truly customer service orientated professionals. I felt welcomed at the hotel and was even treated to a balloon bouquet from the front desk.   The hotel was very clean and secure. At night, there was uniform security personnel stationed at the lobby doors. However, the area is very safe and clean too. Lots of street lighting and Disney staff working around the clock. I felt very secure walking outside late at night.   My room was complete with a fridge, a room safe and the usual amenities. Modern, well decorated and comfortable furniture. The couch folds out into a bed. There was even a hidden desk on wheels that I would

We enjoyed our stay at Paradise Pier.  Rooms were very nice--clean and roomy.  The staff overall was very accommodating for a family of 5 that upgraded to a suite when grandma arrived.  The only complaint is that the food was not great.  Why fix breakfast potatoes with bell peppers and onions when you know many children stay there?  The cafe had a grumpy waitress that looked and acted like "mama" from the movie "Throw Mama from the train."  This is so not ok for a Disney Hotel.

If you are on a budget but still want to experience the Disney brand, this is the hotel to go. Services are basic and rooms are not out of this world, but you are close to the parks (5 min walk) and as a guest you are entitled to many of the perks you are expecting (early entrance, character dinning, etc.) I have seen some complaints around the elevator and it is true. Hard to get on or off specially at rush hour. Only 4 for this massive hotel seems too low. Parking is quite expensive and if you are only going to stay in the parks, the Resort Express is a good choice for airport transportation. My other complaint is that the free internet is quite slow. 3 out of 4 days I wasn't even able to download my e-mail.

My family recently visited Disneyland and stayed at Paradise Pier Hotel. Overall it was a good hotel. Theroom was spacious, very clean, fast room service, good coffee, friendly staff, and you can cut through the hotel directly across the street into California Adventure.  We ate at the breakfast character breakfas.t which was fun for our 3.5 year old daughter.  They offered a good variety of food.  We would stay here again:-)  The only negative was the pool and hot tub were being repaired.  Request a park view, our daugter enjoyed watching the light show from our window! Disneyland and California Adventure were not crowded and the longest wait time was ten minutes-go figure it was the Peter Pan ride:-)

Summary Heading: Nice and close to the parks. Perfect for an affordable family stay.
Summary: We chose this hotel somewhat reluctantly as some of the reviews said it was a fair distance to walk to the parks.  We walked to the parks for four days in a row and found it to be about 5 minutes to the back entrance of California Adventure and 12 minutes to the main entrance to Disneyland.  Not a problem at all!  The kids didn't even complain.  Plus, there is the monorail option, which you can hop on from Downtown Disney (maybe a 6 minute walk from the PP?). That will take you to Tomorrowland and Star Tours, Space Mountain, Matterhorn, and all those other popular rides.  The hotel itself is clean and easy to get around.  There is an elevator back-up issue in the mornings, but really this was our only complaint and it wasn't a huge one as we only ever waited 5 or 10 extra

Summary Heading: First experience at a Disney Property - We'll be back
Summary: We got a great deal for a stay at the Paradise Pier over MLK weekend and so after many years of staying at other hotels surrounding the resort, we decided to stay at a Disney property. We arrived early - too early to get in our room - but we were issued our park hopper passes and room keys and given the option to receive a text message or voicemail message with our room number when it was ready. Around 3:30pm we go tthe text message but we were having too good a time to go back right away.   The hotel recently had its public areas and soft goods in the rooms replaced (bedding, curtains, etc.) so it looked good. Coffee makers are now standard in all three of the Disney properties which is a new concept. There were also small refrigerators, a good-sized safe, and a nice

I booked this room over the phone, specifically, because I've had bad experiences with so-called "accessible" hotel rooms.  When I got to Disney, I found the hotel clean and comfortable, but since I'm focusing on access, there were several problems.    The 2 elevators were incredibly busy, and very crowded.  I waited 25 minutes before there was one with room for my wheels.  (I use a wheeled walker and a mobility scooter)  The beds were extremely high and the mattresses soft.  Very difficult to access without gymnastics.  The room itself was made smaller by the bigger bathroom, so there was little room for maneuvering within the room.  The bathroom was big enough and the toilet high enough, with rails, but there was a bathtub!  I was able to carefully get in and out but an

Summary Heading: Good location, reasonable value, but pretty mediocre
Summary: Warm welcome at check-in, but having asked for a quiet room (I know, a bit optimistic in a Disney hotel) we were initially given a room right next to the main road, on a low floor.  We moved to a room on the other side of the hotel, which looked better at first, until we discovered in the early hours of the morning that we were overlooking the industrial-size hotel bins.  Serious noise from the garbage trucks meant we were always awake long before sunrise.  Restaurant average and room service continental breakfast rubbish (the smallest croissants I've ever seen).  The hotel generally was pretty tired.  However, the location was good for easy access to Disneyland, it was much less expensive than the Grand California and it did the job for us (we didn't need to spend too long in

When we arrived at the hotel, our room was ready, and the staff were amazing!  We have heard nightmares about the elevators, and honestly I have had worse.  The busy times were during check out or check in.  However we did not wait for more then a few mins for each one.  Our safe did not work, so they had us move to another room, which was a huge surprise because we got an upgrade (8th floor park view).  It was awesome!  We were able to watch the fire works, and see California Adventure....park view is a must if you can afford it!  The water pressue was terrible, so be aware of having to rinse your hair for a while!! We also were not told of the pool closure until we arrived, however we were able to use the Disneyland Hotel's pool.  It was really nice, and heated however a bit

Summary Heading: Fun for the kids - not so much for Mom and Dad
Summary: We recently spent one night at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel.  It was my first time staying at any of the Disney Properties in Ca.  I have stayed a few times in Orlando and Disney does it much better there. The positives of the hotel were the Disney touches - the kids received balloons upon checking in and the room had cute Mickey Mouse Decorations.  The room was spacious and the beds were cozy.  It was nice to be able to walk to Downtown Disney and to the parks - without dealing with shuttles - parking etc. The bad - the room we had was very noisy - I'm used to noise but this was music until at least 3AM - we complained at the front desk but received no response. Also the showers were horrible (but they were sparkling clean) just no pressure at all - it wasn't relaxing and it

Summary Heading: Great time at the Paradise Pier
Summary: We just had three days at Disney and decided it would be easier to stay on site. This hotel was really nice. The rooms were clean, well appointed and decorated in fun Disney decor that our kids loved! This is an inexpensive hotel compared to the other two properties but it was a wonderful location and well appointed. The only negative was the pool. It was a bit disappointing. I would recommend this hotel to any family that only has a few days at Disney as it was wonderful going back to the room to freshen up or have a nap.

Summary Heading: Nice place BUT not nice service.
Summary: We came from Las Vegas for a 2 night stay, check-in was very smooth thanks to Dusty. The room was very clean and had a great view of disneyland. Our trip was cut very short because my girlfriend threw out her back, when I called the front desk the girl told me I would have to go down and get the wheelchair myself, I then called the bell desk and they said it'd be $10. The few times I called the front desk the girl seemed annoyed and wanted me off the phone. All this was only in 12 hours.. I would NOT recommend this hotel..

Summary Heading: Cant compare to WDW resorts but good for WDL
Summary: I must admit I am a big fan of the WDW resorts. I have stayed at most of them and really love how each one is almost like an actual resort as opposed to a hotel. It became fairly obvious to me that I wasn't going to find anything similar at WDL (Disneyland). I really debated whether or not to put in the extra money to stay at a Disney property or stay at one of the good neighbor hotels nearby. I looked at using my reward points at the Marriott or Hilton properties nearby but because they jacked up the reward values due to the park, a $119 Courtyard room would have taken almost as many points as a Ritz Carlton free stay.  When Disney ran the 30% off promotion, I booked this property at a decent enough rate. It was still $60 - $100 more than some of the comparable good neighbor

Just finishing up the tail end of our four day, three night vacation. The hotel is approximately a city block from Downtown Disney (and the Monorail stop that takes you into Tomorrowland at Disneyland), Disneyland Hotel and across the street from California Adventure. A short well-lit trail leads to any of the three areas.   TIP: Don't question the value of the Concierge upgrade-- it's worth it.  On our three night trip, the cost was $70, which gave us access what basically amounts to a snack buffet.  Early morning in our clubroom provided access to cereals, oatmeal, hot chocolate, coffee, juice, danishes, muffins and bagels. Midday had chex mix, goldfish, chips, and cookies. Wine and cheese hour was amazing-- gourmet cheese, honey, crackers, dried and fresh fruit, wine and

I have twin 5 year old boys and a 2 year old daughter.  My wife and I were visiting my family in the Los Angeles area and decided to plan a trip to Walt Disneyland, spending two nights at the hotel and two full days at the theme parks.  I priced out all hotels including the three Disney Hotels within what I would call the "Disney Campus" and the hotels that are outside the actual resort area.  After pricing the hotels out I found that the Disney hotels were only slightly more expensive.  I made the decision to stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel because a) it was within the secured Disney Resort and b) I wanted my kids to have the Disney experience.    Here are the positives regarding our stay:   1) We checked in at 2:00 pm (one hour earlier than the advertised check-in time of 3:00

Summary Heading: Distance to hotel only good thing!!!!!!!!
Summary: Location is convenient, very small lobby, no characters were wandering around as promised....only at expensive breakfast they offer that is not worth it.  Only normal thing to eat was bagels and mickey waffles at surfside grill.  water bottles $3. parking $15 a night, no breakfast, swimming pool really small and was closed for construction while there.  Elevators sometimes take too long to come empty.  They leave msgs for rooms everynight with daily activities walks around hotel for a tour and activities just to walk around downtown disney  u can do that all on your own.  No shuttle service anywhere.  Rooms were small for a family, 2 queen beds that felt like double and a day bed.....pillows were very bad, bring your own if u want a good sleep.  shower very slow. but ladies

Summary Heading: A good hotel choice for a Disney vacation
Summary: 3 of my young adult children and I went over to Paradise Pier Hotel a couple of days after New Year for some Disney fun.  I found a good rate for the concierge level. We were pleasantly surprised with an upgrade to a suite when we checked in.  It will be hard to go back to a "regular" room.  There was a large entry way with a huge 3/4 bathroom to one side of it.  You walk into a large living room area with a round table a coffee table and an "L" shaped couch, a flat screen tv and a refrigerator.  The main part of the couch folded out into a bed and the other side of the couch could sleep another person.  The bedroom had 2 queen beds, another flat screen tv and a huge full bath with double sinks.  The view of California Adventure Park was simply amazing.  We watched World of

Our family stayed at the Paradise Pier over the holidays.  It's location is convenient especially if you plan to go to the theme parks daily.  And we had early access into the parks. The staff was friendly and helpful.  The rooms were spacious and clean.  The only thing not very good was the shower head--the water flow wasn't strong.  All rooms we stayed in were like that.  Perhaps it's for water conservation.  But that's just a small quirk.  It was an enjoyable stay.  I would definitely return.

Summary Heading: excellent location for disney adventure but not disneyland
Summary: greeted by very nice front desk lady on Christmas Day.  Room was ok. small, but ok.

This hotel is the moderate Disney hotel choice. Please keep this in mind as this might be the lowest end Disney hotel it does NOT mean it is low end. Disney does things right. The check in went fast and the staff is amazing and goes out of their way for you. I didn't notice ANY problem with the elevators. The hotels come with a day bed in each room and a pack n play in the closet. The only reason I gave it 3 instead of 4 is because I gave Disneyland Hotel 4 and they are a better hotel. (more $ too) I wish the lobby store was big and plentiful like the Disneyland hotel one. The pool area is ok and the waterslide is a nice treat (no age limit but they must wear a life jacket) The baby pool was great but the water in all the pools was ice cold (kids didnt care but mommies did)

Summary Heading: Please stop complaining about the elevators
Summary: My son and I stayed here from December 28 through December 31 (before transferring over to the Grand Californian). We arrived very early and our room wasn't ready but they offered to text us when it was, so we enjoyed a very good lunch at the hotel and received a text about an hour after we had arrived telling us the room was ready. Headed to the room, opened the door and were stopped by a housekeeper running down the hall, asking us why we were going into that room. And she was right, because the room was not made up and hadn't been cleaned since the last occupants. Went back to the front desk and let them know and they surmised that it was a housekeeping error since the front desk sends texts based on information provided to them by housekeeping. To make up for the

My family of 4 stayed 3 nights at Disney's Paradise Pier hotel during our visit to Disneyland Resort in December 2011.    The room was big, clean and looked newly renovated.  The beds in the room were large enough to accommodate the 4 of us (2 adults and 2 kids). Everything we need is available in the room and there's free wifi as well - in a disney property, anything free is rare.  Within the hotel, there's a guest laundry room, gift shop, nice restaurant and swimming pool. We didn't use the pool because it was too cold but the pool looks big and clean. We chose self parking (not free) and parked our car in the parking structure connected to the hotel.  Breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant was overpriced.  So, we ordered room service American breakfast for 3 people every

we stayed here on 12/30/2011 and 12/31/2011 wow what a charming place we stayed in room 1510 and the view of the park was mind blowing we stayed on the conciere level and it was totaly worth it the room was large and clean and the staff was so sweet I almost got a cavity. I was concerned about the elevator service after all the reviews I read but I never had to wait for the elevator more than two minutes. this is a great place to stay and we will certainly stay here again.

After two stays at the PP, it has become our favorite place to stay at Disneyland. For a fraction of the price of the Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian, you get all the benefits of staying at a DLR hotel, such as access to all Magic Mornings and the GC entrance to California Adventure. Our daughter loves the pool area and water slide, and the staff all provide the legendary Disney service.
No frills, very clean, spacious room (got upgraded to a cabanna-room by pool).  Pleasant pool w hot tub. 10 min walk to the park.  Would come back.

Summary Heading: Even Better the Second Time Around
Summary: We didn't think the hotel could surpass the service we received back in May, but they did. We were blown away with the view, and with the overall demeanor of every cast member that we interacted with during our stay. We'll be back!

Summary Heading: Kids Loved it! Great atmosphere and convenient
Summary: Stayed here on business while the kids and wife visited the parks. We've stayed at several surrounding hotels but there are certain things that you will only get at the Disneyland properties. Most importantly, direct access to the parks. Since I had to work, my wife went to the parks alone with our 3 and 7 year olds, it was very convenient for her to get to and from the parks without driving or paying for parking. It's a decent walk, but no further then you would walk from the parking structures. Being able to go directly into California Adventure through the Disney's Grand Californian entrance was great. (would love to stay there, but it's much more $$$)  The hotel is nicely decorated with all you would expect from Disney. The rooms are not huge but very comfortable and clean

We spent four wonderful nights at this hotel.  All of the staff went above and beyond to make sure we were having a magical vacation.  I almost felt like we were VIP guests when in fact we just had a regular room.  My daughter loved the pool.
