We loved the easily accessible location and the convenient ability to send purchases back to the hotel.  Also the perk of getting into the park an hour early was SO worth it.  We rode some of the most popular rides four times!  I plan to use this hotel again when I return to Disneyland.

This hotel does not deserve the Disney name. The rooms look like you walked in Motel 6, and they are very small. The food at the buffet is horrible and the service worse. A "pack them in kick them out" philosophy with miserable food, and bad service added to a few Disney characters. You get much more for your money on the Garden Grove side, about mile away at hotels such as Hyatt or Marriott and stay in suites for less. Those hotels actually have Disney counters where you can buy your tickets at the hotel. They also have a shuttle. Disney wants you to walk you kids to the park. I think they get a lot of "onzees" here who come once, and most likely don't return. I will never stay here again even at half price which will still be too expensive for what you get.

We just got back from a 5 night stay over Christmas.  Overall, we were pleased with our stay.    Here are the positive aspects:  1.  Very friendly staff.  We were able to check in early and found the valets very helpful when our shuttle to the airport was running late. 2.  The bed linens and towels were high quality and the mattress was very comfortable. 3.  The chocolate coins left by housekeeping every night were a welcome treat after a long day. 4.  The rooms are generally quiet except for the exception noted below.  Here are the negatives:  1.  It doesn't feel as "Disney" as the other Disney hotels.  I think this is a result of the property not originally being built as a Disney property. 2.  As others have noted the elevators are inadequate for the size of the hotel. 3.

Summary Heading: NOT WHAT YOU EXPECT FROM DISNEY
Summary: My wife and I own Disney Vacation time and have stayed at numerous Disney properties around the country.  Paradise Pier has received some renovation since our earlier visits and the employees try to be friendly/helpful in general however, the property is just not what you expect for the price you pay and definitely not from Disney.  On our visit, all elevators were inoperative upon our arrival and the manager showed up and berrated the guests for clogging the hallway and not trying another elevator (he was informed that NONE of the elevators worked which only made him more obnoxious).  We asked about wireless Internet and were assured we had wireless Internet in our room however, it would not work and after TWO days and numerous calls to the front desk & tech support we were

This is the cheapest of the three Disney hotels at Disneyland, and the only one I hadn't stayed in.  It is missing a bit of the "magic" style-wise, but it is friendly, convenient and spacious.  Staying on this side of the parks (nestled by the other two Disney hotels and Downtown Disney) offers visitors a chance to never have to enter the real world at all if you don't want to.  The walk to the parks is a little long, but it's all through the Grand Californian lobby and Downtown Disney, so it's a lovely walk, and Disney all the way.  The elevators (there are 3 or 4 regular ones and one glass one that you can take up, but can't "call" to take down from upper floors) can be a bit of a wait, and are crowded at popular times of the day, but we didn't have much issue with them. We

I have stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel a total of three night, divided between two separate trips. A one night stay, and a two night stay.  The hotel is very nice upon arrival - very easy to access as the main entrance is right off the road - parking is behind the hotel in a parking structure (the spaces in the parking structure are very tight, so if you are driving a larger vehicle - be careful pulling in and out) Also watch kids around the corners as some folks do speed, and it would be very easy for a child to dart out across a corner and get hit - not different than most parking garages, but something to be aware of.  The lobby is very night with a solarium style room in the off set of the two sections of the building. This hotel, along with the Disneyland hotel were

Summary Heading: Holiday visit was great although issues with elevators
Summary: We took our son and two grandkids to Disneyland the first week of December.  This is the first time staying at Paradise Pier, we usually stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  On the plus side the rooms were a good size and accommodated all 5 of us quite well.  The decor was great with the California Beach style theme throughout the hotel, rooms and hallways.    The holiday decorations were amazing with a very large tree in the lobby.  Carollers were in the lobby every day and there was a visit from Santa every morning.  Service was great from the staff.  On the down side were the elevators.  Comments on this from other reviews are quite valid.  They have 3 main elevators and one glass elevator to service the entire hotel.  There were times I couldn't get into the elevator with my

Disney's Paradise Pier is a nice resort.  We stayed here in order to see Disneyland during the Christmas season and we were not disappointed.  The hotel is beautiful during the Holidays, as is the rest of the Disney property.  My kids are older, one tween boy, and two teen girls.  They absolutely loved the atmosphere and the holiday joy.  The room was not large, but it was nice and comfortable.  We ate at the restaurant and loved it.  Reasonably priced for Disney and great food.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  It is a short walk to Downtown Disney and the parks.  You can enter California Adventure from the hotel across the street, the Grand Californian.  This hotel is not as beautiful as the Grand, but much more reasonable.  I would recommend to other families.

We stayed here for 2 nights on our Honeymoon and loved it. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was very clean, had wonderful views and amazing, comfortable beds. It was only a short walk to Downtown Disney and the park entrance which gave us time to explore the food and shops on offer. The breakfast at the hotel was a little expensive for our budget but we found nice food in Downtown Disney any time of the day. We will definitely stay here again.

Although it is advertised as on Disney property, it is not in the park. To get to the gates you have to walk some distance through "Downtown Disney", which is all shops and concessions. The monorail does not go there.  Also, unless you take the special "character breakfast", the only place in the hotel for breakfast is in the lobby. self service, limited choice and poor quality.

We had originally booked a room at the Grand Californian, due to a mix up with our reservation; they moved us to the Paradise Pier and placed us in a Concierge Room.  As another has already posted, the pool area was under repair while we were visiting.  Our room did have a view of World of Color and we were looking forward to seeing that, but due to high winds, the shows were cancelled the two days we were there (not the hotels fault) but disappointing none the less.  Getting free access to the beach room on the second floor was nice with snacks, water and soda available.  Our room was very nice, roomy with refrigerators and a microwave and the two bathrooms were very nice.  We were there during the wind storms and all night you could hear the wind blowing through the windows,

I wanted to make this christmas a special one for my kids so we stayed here. What they forget to mention in the ads is that for 6 days parking is going to cost you $80 more. The hotel itself was kept up ok i suppose but the hot tub was under construction the whole time we were there and out of 4 elevators only one was working for 2 days. Hiking up to the 9th floor is good cardio but not after a long day at disneyland with a 5 and 6 year old practically sleep walking up to the room. A small free continental breakfast is too much to ask from this hotel. The cheapest thing they have which they call the continental breakfast is 10.99  a person. I will definitely not stay here again. I was more impressed with the friendly service of the staff at the Best Western where I have stayed

There are 3 hotels located on Disneyland property that include the Disneyland hotel, Paradise pier hotel and the Grand Californian.  Maybe we';ve been spoiled by the Disney properties located in Florida so maybe this is a apples vs oranges review.  The PP staff were very nice and accomodating but the hotel accomodations/ Amentities didn't live up to our expectations considering we were paying $230/night for a standard room. The rooms were plain but clean.  Little things like complimentary water would have been nice since there was a coffee maker.  A little fridge were provided which is good but a microwave would have been a nice touch.  We were texted while we were in the Park (after pre-registering) that our room was ready which is great but when we arrived our bags weren't in

We decided to try the Paradise Pier Hotel this time around, for our trip to see Disneyland on my birthday.   Was a very nice hotel, a bit farther to walk to get to the monorail, and Downtown Disney, but, manageable for we in our middle 60's.  Nicely lit sidewalks, security around, and one of the Valet men even took us once in the golf cart when it rained.  Some complained about the elevators, but they weren't bad, I was afraid of them, and even wrote a letter to the manager about them.  He did call and leave a message, but, I had no complaints about them, they were a bit slower, but not nearly as bad as people had said.   The room was clean, wonderful view of the pool, and nice shower in the bathroom.   Bed was comfortable too, and a sofa was in the room, too.   Front desk was

We booked our vacation during the week of Thanksgiving which turned out to be great despite the crowds. Paradise Pier was very clean and great customer service and we love how close it is to walk to Disneyland, California Adventure and Downtown Disney. I feel this hotel and the other 2 Disney hotels are way too pricey. This hotel is the cheapest of all 3, but still too much for a hotel stay. The rooms are average as is the bathroom size. Nothing to brag about. The worst thing during our stay is the awful smell of tar by the pool and water slide. Definitely put a damper on the pool usage by us. We will not stay here again due to the cost of the hotel, too expensive for just an average room that you can get elsewhere for a lot less money.

Summary Heading: This hotel used to be it
Summary: I was so looking forward to staying here.  This hotel used to be the place to be when I was younger.  However, this is a perfect example of a hotel making cosmetic adjustments when it needs a FULL overhaul.  Adding a touch of whimsy and Disney magic will not make this hotel sing anymore.  The beds were uncomfortable and squeaky even when you sat down.  Walls were paper thin.  I could hear families talking at normal volume like they were sitting right next to me.  The sink area seemed to be made for toddlers.  It came up to my thigh.  I'm 5'11 but still.  Water pressure was non-existent.  It was less than a trickle.  The elevators were PACKED.  Most of the time we had to take the elevator up to get to the bottom floor.  We literally stopped at every level and when if got down to

We traveled at the end of October 2011.  The hotel was 100% capacity so we were not able to check in until after 3pm - and we did not get those upgrades many of the reviewers noted when they went on less busy weekends.  STILL - we had a great time.  Travelled with husband and 3 kids, 18, 16, 7.  All had a great time.  Room was standard, could be considered small if we were in the room all day.  But we were not - this was a DISNEYLAND vacation and this hotel was PERFECT for it.  It is close to the parks, we came back every day to rest and sometimes to use the pool.   I am not sure why the bad rap about the elevators...they were more than reasonable.  Peak times - yes, a little wait...but not overwhelming.  We will definitely stay here again. I have been to Disneyland 5 times and

We came here not knowing what to expect. It was a very clean hotel beds were clean and the floors are emmaculate! Basic furniture but roomy enough for all 3of us ! Ordered room service one night because we didn't want to wait in an hour for a burger and the food was amazingly great! Our 4yr old enjoyed his spagetti whole we had half a salad and soup which was a very generous portion . You only have to walk across the street to Califgrand hotel to get to the parks and your there ! Saved a lot of money o. Staying here well worth the money spent !

This hotel would probably cost you about $120 in most other places, but here you are paying for location, location, location (and some Disney perks!).  We got a rate of $169 in early November.  This is not a luxury hotel in any way, it is fairly basic, however it was very clean, had very comfortable beds and lovely linens.  The daybed is sturdy and comfortable for a child, and as a family of five, we are so pleased that Disney will accomodate us, without having to rent two rooms, pay for a roll-out or sneak your third child in!  (yes I've done it!).  We had dinner in the hotel restaurant our first night, and it was pretty good.  Much better than I was expecting.  Tasty, fresh ingredients.  My kids loved the make-your-own pizza.   The in-room fridge was handy.  My husband took a

We stayed at Disney' Paradise Pier Oct. 18-22,2011.  The hotel itself was nice and the amenities were great.  The walk to Downtown Disney and Disneyland were easy as well.  However, one of the days we came back from the park, we found one of my wife's earrings under the sheets of the bed.  This wouldn't have been unusual except that she never wore those earrings on our trip!  All her unworn jewelry was kept in a jewelry bag which was stored in her cosmetics bag located in the bathroom.  We didn't think much of this at the moment and just kind of dismissed it as "that's weird".  It wasn't until we got home the next day when my wife discovered that her 2nd favorite diamond ring was missing from her jewelry bag!  My wife only wears two rings, her wedding ring and this one.  She

Although the hotel is not that appealing on the outside and the lobby is rather dull, I loved the rooms: big, spacy, fun, clean, comfortabel beds, nice details. Service at the reception was excellent. I recommend staying here, but not eating in the main restaurant.

Stayed 2 nights here and everything was on par.   Very comfortable beds and pillows, clean rooms, excellent service.  David at the bell desk took us and my wife's elderly parents twice in a golf cart to Downtown Disney so they would not have to walk it.  Hotel is conveniently located to both parks.  Great time of year to avoid the crowds.   View to the West is OK, towards the park would be better.  The small cafe is good for quick foods in the morning.   Did not eat at the restaurant but it looked good.   If you are not leaving the Hotel at all don't rent a car take shuttle from LAX.   Will recommend to friends.

Summary Heading: Beeter than paying the extra for the Grand Californian
Summary: Great hotel.  Clean and quick walk into california adventure park. Dont pay the extra for the Grand Californian as this hotel also gives access to the park via a private entrance and you can still use it's lobby.

My husband, 4-year-old son and I stayed at Paradise Pier for 4 nights in a room with 2 double beds.  We had a great time and enjoyed our stay.  Our view was of the pool and parking lot but we didn't really mind.  The beds were some of the most comfortable we've ever stayed in away from home! We loved the fact that we were a short walk from the parks and it was nice to be able to come back to the room during the day if we needed to.  The hotel staff was friendly and responsive to any issues.    When we arrived we took our son to the pool and he had a blast on the slide.  He must have gone up and down 20 times!  That night we were exhausted so we ordered room service and the burgers were delicious.    We did the character breakfast one day and it was so much fun.  We booked the

We stayed at the Paradise Pier for 1 night, for a quick visit to the Disneyland Resort parks. Check in was fast and were surprisingly greeted with balloons, buttons and an autographed picture of Mickey himself infront of the castle. We got a standard view room in the 12th floor. The room was very nicely decorated with so many Disney details. The day bed and fridge was very handy. The pool area is not very big, but enough for a relaxing time after the parks. The waterslide was a lot of fun for the kids. It's only an 8 min walk from the hotel to the security tables at the parks, if you walk through the Grand Californian Hotel. This is the least expensive of the Disney hotels in Anaheim, but it's very nice when you don't have a big budget.

We went to Disneyland for Mickey's Halloween Party plus a few days at the Disneyland resort.  We stayed in a standard room with 2 queen beds.  The room view looked back over the pool area and onto the parking lot.  It wasn't a great view but no bother because we were all so exhausted by the time we reached the room each evening that we went right to sleep.  The room was a good size for 2 adults and 2 kids.  The bathroom and shower are nice though water pressure is a bit weak.    Disney service was excellent!  In several instances cast members took the extra step to make our stay that much nicer such as the time I asked a cast member where I could find a trash can to dispose of a small bag of trash and the cast member took the bag out of my hand and told me very nicely that they

Overall, this is a great place to stay when trying to maximize the whole Disneyland experience. Being the "least pricey" of the 3 Disney Hotels it is easily worth recommending. Location to the park and proximity to Downtown Disney are great and the concierge floor is more than likely worth it if you plan on coming back to the room throughout the day.   Our kids are older but the staff really focuses on smaller children and it's evident everywhere. When you're checking in, staff are passing out balloons to the lil ones. On the concierge floor, staff seemed happy to go over the DVD check out list with the kids. It's all Disney, all the time. Fireworks can be viewed from the pool deck (with music). World of color (from DCA) can be viewed from "theme park view" rooms with music

Summary Heading: All you can expect from Disney, Great location, amazing service!
Summary: OK, I will say it up front.  I love Disney!  We are DVC members so we were able to use our points to stay at this hotel.  It was just my daughter and I.  We wanted the Grand Californian but it was not available.  But we were not disappointed.  The hotel was clean, the service impeccable.  Right from the moment we pulled up with our car, to when we checked out.    The food is a bit limited, but there is small coffee shop that has pastries and sandwiches and coffee and drinks in the evening.  Then you are steps away from the Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian as well as Downtown Disney.  So the food was not an issue.    We had a premium view room, with an amazing view of California Adventure.  We were not doing the parks, but it was just nice to see from our room!  My only

Summary Heading: Right choice to enjoy the park
Summary: We were all packed into one room but the hotel was nice, clean and with the perfect Disney atmosphere that our kids were expecting to get. Breakfast with the Disney characters was a great experience (although a little bit expensive). Other food options were very limited...specially when you are there with three kids (one of them a toddler).

We stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel Oct 22 - 28 after much researching.  We really wanted to stay at the Grand California, but couldn't justify the additional $1600 for rooms.  The Pier was clean, beds were so comfortable we couldn't believe it.  The rooms were very roomy and my son loved the daybed, and we loved that it didn't take up as much room as a fold down couch.  It really was so very close to both parks and to Downtown Disney.  The staff was s friendly, the concierge helped us navigate to Huntington Beach as well as giving us a coupon for a free appetizer at a restaurant there.  They were so helpful at te front desk, housekeeping, everyone!  The food was great at the character breakfast and we ordered room service and were very pleased.  The surfside lounge had good,

Summary Heading: nice and close to the park but the food was horrible
Summary: Stayed one night ($200) and had room service breakfast the morning we were to leave.  I ordered oatmeal, wheat toast, coffee - the wife ordered egg white omlet, coffee.  The oatmeal was runny, the toast was cold and soggy, the eggs had no taste.  All for only $35.  We left with only a cup of coffee we could say anything good about.  Glad we had a good day at the park the day before.

This was are second time. We stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel. Are flights were good, we flew into John Wayne which is a lot  closer to Disney Parks. The shuttles were awesome, didn't have to wait, very friendly. We arrived at our hotel. Stood in line watched other children receiving buttons and balloons. One desk clerk even came out to take a family photo, not ours. When it was our turn we just received our room key. No hello, no service, told that our room wasn't ready (after a long flight) My young son didn't get "no first time button". Nothing. What the heck. Not pleasant at all.  We didn't feel welcome at this Hotel. Our room was good, we had a view of the park.Clean. Beds and pillows were comfortable.But no magic service there. Too bad. We even thought that the Surf's Up

Enjoyed the stay in this hotel. The suite was convenient and the location was perfect. Very close to restaurants and the business center in Orange, CA. I'll definitely be back for business and may bring my family next time--right across Disneyland

Summary Heading: Excellent Service, Rooms and Cleaning Staff!
Summary: This was my first time at a Disney Resort hotel.  Talk about being spoiled!  Every aspect was wonderful.  Next time I will rent a car to take advantage of some lower cost meals, but besides that, a wonderful time was had by all!

I was pleasntly surprised when I checked, after all the reviews, I didnt know what expect.  On that note, I found everything to be spot on.  We were there from Oct. 10th-Oct.13th.  We didn't have any problems with elevators, they 3 regular & the glass elevator, they all ran perfectly, including the glass elevator worked, I know many people said that the glass elevator was not accessible from the 1stf floor.  The other thing that people had a problem with was the water pressure, we didn't have any problems with it.  I have had worse showers at other Hotels. When I made the reservation, I told them I needed 2 queen beds, but we goy 2 queen bed intend we got a king size bed, so my niece slept on the pull out ( which she said was totally comfortable.)   I think most people are

Since this was the cheapest of the three disney hotel, we stayed here for the duration of our disney vacation. We got there around 9:00pm and check in was smooth. The room was nice, spacious for only us two. Wife liked the little touches, like beach ball pillows, lighthouse lamps, mickey lamp. The beds were comfy so no complaints from us. The bathroom was nice but the water pressue was very low. The other nice touch was the bottles of shampoo and conditioner had mickey's ear for the cap. One morning we decided to eat at PCH Grill and it was ok. I would not come here for the food but if you have little ones, they would probably love it since you do interact with disney characters a lot.

Summary Heading: The Scent of Sulfur: and I don't mean He Should Not Be Named
Summary: I attended a conference that was held at Disneyland's Paradise Pier Hotel and I have to say it was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. Thank goodness I did not bring my nephews and niece here or I would have been upset. Parents please avoid staying here. Stay in either the classic and historic Disneyland Hotel, because it has been recently renovated and the room I had the last time was glorious (I'll put up a post later), or the Grand Californian (my friend stayed here and gave it the mouse ears up). 1) There are no elevators in the parking structure ($15 a day to park), so drop your bags off first and then drive back around. If you have any seniors or disabled and you don't have a placard, also drop them off. If you valet your car it is $22 a day. 2) Be prepared for

Although we really wanted to stay at the Grand Californian we decided we'd give this one a try...boy were we in for a surprise. Upon arrival, had to wait like 30 minutes to get checked in, lobby was small and so was the front desk given its a Disney hotel.  The long wait was compensated when we got our room on the 3rd floor right next to the pool (which my kids loved by the way)-Awesome!!!! We practically dropped our luggage in the room and decided to head out for dinner since we had other family members that live in the area that were going to join us. Dinner went great, always fun catching up with long distance family :)  However when we got back, my 7 year old daughter was traumatized to find a spider crawling all over our bathroom tub. I mean she screamed her lungs out that

We stayed here Oct 10-13 for 3 nights.  This was our first time at this property and we found it to be very nice, great location, clean, nice beds (we're picky).  We upgraded to concierge level and that was an extra $115/night.  We thought it would be worth it because you get an extensive continental breakfast, snacks throughout the day and a happy hour with beer, wine and hot hors'doeuvres, all included.  If you're going to be around the hotel to enjoy all of this, it is definitely worth the extra cost.  If you're going to be in the park all day (as we were) probably not worth the extra cost. We didn't get a better room, concierge level just gives you access to the concierge room goodies.  I would stay again.

Nothing to brag about in the rooms. Two beds in a very basic setup. We had picketers outside our window that woke us up super early. Not good after a long day/night at Disneyland. Especially with kids! It made for moody kids all day. Disneyland is NOT the happiest place on earth when you stay here!! And you have to pay $15 a day for parking!!!!

The first time we stayed there was in Nov. 2007, when we were only a family of 3 (my oldest son was 2 yr old at that time).  We booked a standard room with theme park view and had character dining for breakfast at PCH grill.  We enjoyed our 3 day/2 night stay and planned to go back someday.  Four years later, we are now a family of 4 (oldest son now 6 and youngest son is 2) and wanted to experience this hotel again.  This time we decided to spend a little bit more and booked a concierge room with theme park view.  The room décor has since changed and now there is a cute goofy statue to greet guests at the entrance (great for pictures!).     There was no wait at check-in when we arrived at 8am.  We were pleasantly surprised to receive a complimentary upgrade to a Suite on the

Summary Heading: Enjoyed staying at a Disney Hotel
Summary: We stayed at the Paradise Pier in Anaheim for one night so we could go to Mickey's Trick or Treat Party.  Although it was a pretty basic hotel, I would rate it excellent for location, cleanliness, and the Disney hospitality.  It is across the street from the Disney Lodge, and you need to walk through the Lodge to get to the Monorail in Downtown Disney or you can reach the main entrance to Disneyland at the far end of Downtown Disney.  We took the monorail into Disneyland as there was no line, but it drops you in Futureland (or whatever it is called) so you don't get the experience of walking down Main Street, but there was no one waiting to get on the monorail so it was a fast trip in.  We walked back to the hotel at midnight, but it was an OK walk, even for my very tired child.

Summary Heading: Great Place for the Whole Family
Summary: We loved this hotel!!!  It was our first time staying at a Disney hotel and it was great!!!  WE had a park view room with two queens and a convertible sofa bed.  The room was large and big enough for our family of five.  They even had a pack-n-play for my little one already inthe room.  Every staff person we encountered was friendly and helpful.  The room was a little older but clean and nice.  The cleaning staff did a wonderful job cleaning every day and even made up the pack-n-play with my daughters blankets and stuffed animals.  We were celebrating my mother in laws 75th birthday and everyone wished her a Happy Birthday.  My only negative is the elevators.  They are slow and there aren't enough of them.  We went to the character breakfast inthe hotel restaurant.  It was worth

I stayed at the Paradise Pier with my 2 children.  We had a pleasant stay.  The rooms were average.  I don't know if there is anything I can 'rave about' from this hotel.  We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel which is also average.  For a Disney property I expected way more.  Next time I will try the Grand Californian.  It's location is exceptional.

We had spent the previous night at the Grand Hyatt in Union Square, so by comparison this review seems critical...  We flew into Long Beach airport arriving at 10:30 a.m.  Caught a cab that gave us a flat rate of $45 to the hotel. It was a very pleasant 25-30 minute ride as we got aquainted with our cabbie who was originally from France.  We arrived at the hotel at approximately 11 a.m.  Unlike the Grand Hyatt, our room wasn't available. We left our luggage and headed over to Downtown Disney, a short walk away, until 1 pm when we were told our room would be ready.  My husband had booked our room through Disney Vacations 4 months prior and requested the best King Size bed room available. After a leisurely lunch at the House of Blues and a stroll through most of the shops at

We are an Australian family with thwo kids aged 7 and 10. We stayed here for four nights in late September 2011. We chose the Paradise Pier as is was the most economical and after we paid for the resort's concierge service upgrade, it was still cheaper than the other two Disney resorts. The staff were great, very helpful, courteous and understanding for our first ever visit to Disneyland. No request was too difficult, and they really made our kids feel wonderful. We had a room overlooking California Adventure Park, and my wife and I re-watched the World of Colour a couple times after the kids went to bed. We would recommend the Paradise Pier to any family. The room  was clean, tidy and well laid out. Lots of towels and sufficient toiletries. Enough storage space for a family's

Yes the Disney hotels are more expensive then regular hotels but I believe it is well worth the money.   Firstly the rooms are a excellent size, very clean also and the bed is very comfortable!!!!  It's great to be able to enter the park 1 hour early on selected days and it was a pleasant surprise to receive a gift of rice crispy treats!!!  Will stay here again when I return to Disney land!

The Paradise Pier Hotel is the least expensive of the Disney Resort Hotels. I struggled with deciding if my overall rating was average or very good. I gave it a very good because of it's overall cleanliness and room size and because there wasn't anything bad about our experience there.   The decor is nice - a beach theme, the rooms are spacious (enough for 5 people) and clean. Nice touch is that there were surf board shaped rice crispy treats upon arrival (however, there were only 2 for the 5 of us). Beds are comfy, sofa bed was perfect for our son. Never heard a peep out of any neighbors, can't say that they didn't hear anything out of our room with 3 teenagers sometime quarreling with each other. Our bathroom didn't have a shower curtain when we got there, and we actually

Summary Heading: Great experience, but not Disney World
Summary: My family has a Disney Timeshare. After spending countless family trips on Orlando, my husband and I decided on a change of pace first wedding anniversary.  We decided to use the timeshare to stay at Disney's Paradise Pier, and use it as a jumping off point for a SoCal adventure.  The hotel is perfectly located with plenty of things within an hour of the hotel.  We spent a week at the Paradise Pier.  I think it is a great hotel for anyone to stay at, whether you are staying as a couple or as a family.  It was just my husband and I, and even as 20 somethings, we still had a great time.  The thing I really love about Disneyland is how close everything is.  If my husband and I didn't want o eat at the hotel, we walked across the street to the Grand Californian or Downtown Disney to

We only stayed for 1 night here prior to a scavenger hunt type game at Disneyland and it was my first time staying on Disney property at the Disneyland Resort. Check in was a breeze and I checked my luggage with the Bell Desk since our room wasn't ready. The front desk sent a text when our room was ready that afternoon. The room itself was very nice! I loved the beach theme and the beach ball pillows are super cute (they come with a note saying that if they "accidentally bounce into your suitcase" you will be charged $65. The bed was comfy and the overall room setup was very nice and easy to use. Bathroom was fine, loved the mirror and shelf outside so that more than 1 person can get ready at the same time. There were 4 of ladies staying together so we really liked that feature!

The rooms are dated, the bathroom tile grout are discolored. The toiletries are cheap quality. The bed is comfortable, the sheets are of good quality. The carpet in the hallway smells musty and old. The service is ok, not exceptional. For the price, there should have at least  free bottled water in the room. There is no wifi connection in the room due to poor signal according to staff. Overall, paying almost $300/night is NOT worth it. The proximity to the parks is the only advantage to this hotel.

It was my first trip to Disneyland!!  Our choice to stay at the Paradise Pier was great.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Hotel was very clean, always.  The short walk to Disneyland and California Adventure was a huge plus.  Also, can't beat the view of the park from our room.  Definately would recommend staying here.
Great hotel in the Disneyland precinct, clean, spacious and comfortable with great staff.  Great for kids and that's what it's about if you're going to Disneyland

Summary Heading: Great location, minimal extras, plain Jane but fine if you're not worried about extras.
Summary: Staff at check in were polite and helpful. Room cute, halls narrow w tacky decor and carpet. Glass Elevator kind of dirty and tiny. Shower tiny. Pool small and plain. Don't bother paying for concierge lounge, Costco baked goods and bagels, cereal. Soso eve appes. Very crowded, hard to find a seat. The WORST part of it all was at 7am on Saturday (we had arrived after midnight) there was a VERY loud group of picketers yelling W horns, drums for over an HOUR about unfair pay for housekeeping. I called manager...they said nothing they could do as it us a public street in front of hotel. I was on 14th floor and it was outrageous. Do yourself a favor and gontonone of the other two Disney hotels that are not on street.

Summary Heading: Magical Disney holiday, great value and location
Summary: Big family trip to Disneyland coupled with our daughters 8 th birthday. Everything was fantastic. Check in was a breeze and our daughter was so happy to get a balloon and birthday pin (to wear the next day at the park) by the front desk staff member. Room was big, loved the queen size beds and pillows!! We had 5th floor room overlooking pool but honestly if we were ever in the room it was mainly to rest or sleep! The proximity to the parks is fantastic and honestly the walking time is barely worth discussing because there is much to see when walking through downtown disney. We had character dining breakfast on the first morning at PCH grill which was so much fun! Our daughters birthday was so special. If we ever visit Disneyland again we will certainly stay here again!!!

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier Hotel : Perfect, will return again!
Summary: Stayed 2 nights mid-September with family of 4. Seemed like a good time of year, not crowded. Hotel is friendly & colorful with Disney touches all over! It is convienant (just walk through Grand Californian and you have your own entrance to CA Adventure Park!) Staff all friendly and helpful. We booked a club-level room and were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite on top floor! I asked for Park view, they said they were booked, maybe thats why we were upgraded, but the room was awesome! We had a pool view, it was clean and huge! I think its worth it to do club-concierge level. It wasnt too much more money (I think maybe $50 a night) but your family is given access into a special room all day for cont breakfast, snacks, drink, light supper and dessert. Worth it if you dont have a car

We had a great stay at this hotel. Our adjoining rooms were upgraded (without even asking) to a theme park view. This was fabulous. Use the bell service to have them take your luggage up - do not attempt to use the elevators for this. As others have said, the only downfall with this hotel is the SLOW elevators (and perhaps not enough of them). We learned that you needed to go up to go down - remember that or you could end up waiting 1/2 hour or more with fidgety kids to get to the parks! We actually sent a person on a mission to get to the lobby and then ride the elevator up to our floor so we could all get down with a stroller. Seems bizarre, but it worked.  The pool was just the right size for off-season. I can see how it would get crowded during peak times though. My kids (4

We've stayed at this hotel many times in the past 5 years.  We liked the renovated rooms with new bedding, etc...  We had an extra special time this past trip because of a very helpful cast member Traci at the front desk.  She made sure we had a great stay by giving us helpful info and treating us like family.  :)  We especially enjoyed watching the fireworks from the viewing area near the pool... complete with music!  The PCH had great burgers and service!  We will be back in the years to come...

Summary Heading: Didn't expect much, but pleasantly surprised.
Summary: After reading some of the negative reviews, I was prepared to stay in a very mediocre hotel.  However, I am happy to report that the hotel exceeded my expectations.  As reported by other tripadvisor reviewers, we did wait in line with many other guests for a very long time to take the elevator to to our floor (5th floor).  Not a good introduction for our first time at the Paradise Pier.  But we quickly learned to hop on the "special" elevator located adjacent to the main elevators when the doors opened;  you can't call this elevator from your floor unless you are on the concierge floors, but you can get on it if the doors open.  When we arrived in our room, I was pleased.  The room was bright and cheerful with no musky odor.  The linens were fresh and crisp.  Both of my

We stayed 2 nights here. We had booked 2 rooms. We checked in early in the morning and rooms were not ready but they were willing to hold our luggage until they were. Finally received a text around 4 pm that our rooms were ready. Excitedly we moved our luggage up to the room, after waiting a VERY long time for the elevator and were very disappointed. We were told at check-in that we had a pool view, but the only view we had was of the roof by the pool.The room had peeling wallpaper, cracked molding, and heaven only knows what I wiped off the bathroom door (kinda brown and smudgy, I don't want to know what it was). Tried to upgrade to a premium room in the hopes it would be cleaner/better maintained but they were totally booked. Nosier and dirtier than the much less expensive

My  seven year old had a really bad start but the hotel was great as they were more then willing to help. All the cast members were great always willing to help. The room cleaners always placed my sons teddys in a different way each day it was a surprise when you came back to your room each day. The PHC Grill was great and the service was fast, My son really liked the idea he could make his own pizza. I would go back to this hotel again next year and stay another week. easy access also to the park and downtown disney.     I would love to download some pictures of the teddies as l am having problems with my memory card.

My husband and I recently stayed at the Paradise Pier for our 10th Anniversary, along with our children, ages 18, 16 & 5. We were pleasantly surprise with the hotel as we had heard mixed review, due to the cost. We found it affordable and enjoyed the close location to the Disney Theme parks. We were also surprised at checked in, when we were made The Big Kahuna family, and were upgraded to a theme park view room, that had an amazing view and yummy treats waiting when we got into our room . It was cooler during our stay, and we wanted to spend as much time in the Parks, as this was our first family visit, so we didn’t spend much time in the hotel and we didn’t get to use the pool. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and the sofa sleeper was handy for our 5 year old to

This is a older type Hotel. Rooms very clean. Typical TV,refrig,safe. Plenty of hot water and if you face the Disney park alittle noisy. Staff goes out of there way to help. Disney character breakfast ,food cold and not to tasty. Lunch and dinner very good. Cannot complain about price and location. Stay at the other Hotels at Disney dig deep into your wallet. Over all staff made the vacation an excellent stay.

We found this hotel to be fantastic and very child friendly.  Very good service and great location close to the California Adventure Park.  We were able to watch the World of Color from our room, with the music played on one of the television channels.  The restaurant hotel (PCH Grill) was convenient and nice, but I would probably choose to eat elsewhere in Downtown Disney.  Overall, very good service, nice spacious room and very welcoming.

We recently stayed here on our family vacation. Not our first time to the parks but it was our first time staying with a Disney hotel in California. It was definitely worth it!!! All of the cast members were wonderful, the Mickey touches were extra special and the location was unbeatable! The rooms overall were pretty basic but decent and clean. The beds were really comfortable (or maybe i was just tired from the parks...). Coming back to the Disney theme rooms made it seem like it was an extension of the parks, which it kind of is. Very cute!!!

Most people think of Disneyland for kids! But this trip was just for the mom's! We stayed one night in the Paradise Pier Hotel! What a fun trip. The hotel location is a short walk to California Adventure and Disneyland! The Hotel feels like "fun" from the moment you enter! The views of the pool area and of California Adventure are incredible. The decor of the room made you feel like a kid again! FUN!

My sister and I brought our girls on an 'All Girls' trip to the Park and Resort in early August.    When we got there, we were informed we were the 'Family of the Day' and was awarded with an upgrade of our room and the staff brought us some YUMMY treats!  To our surprise, our room had a balcony that led out to the pool! PERFECT!  So it was bonus to actually have the EXTRA room outside to just sit and enjoy the evening!  Staff was great!  In room coffee maker was another bonus as we did not have to leave the room for some really good coffee!  The kiddos loved their pool time and waterslide!  Will definately stay there again! Thanks!!!  ;)

First let me preface this review by stating I love everything Disney and overall I am usually very satisfied with any of their hotels, attractions, shows etc...  That said I was not disappointed by our hotel stay at PP.   Paradise Pier is a lovely hotel that offers clean rooms with a cute beach theme and super comfy beds. The hotel is within walking distance to both parks and Downtown Disney. PP offers many amenities including a nice pool, game room, in room coffee and fridge restaurant and various activities.  My only complaint is the lack of food choices in the hotel. I was hoping for more quick food offerings,but it was not a big deal.  I would definitely stay here again.

I recently stayed at the Paradise Pier with my family over a long weekend, and I was very satisfied with the hotel.  It was very convenient to the parks and Downtown Disney.  We also had the pleasue of enjoying the character breakfast available at the hotel.  We wanted plenty of time to eat and not feel rushed before getting to the park, so we ate relatively early at 7:30 and we were one of just a few families eating at that time so Minnie joined us for a good 20 minutes of laughs.  We also had a wonderful time with Pluto, Stich, and Mickey, and we all just had so much fun as there were so many characters and it was not overcrowded, noisy, or a hassle.  The food was delicious and it had a large range of options from pancakes to individualized omlettes to muffins.  We thought

Summary Heading: enjoyable family stay close to disneyland
Summary: Stayed here with wife and 13-15 yo daughters. Room 1414 was terrific, bed and linens extremely comfortable (wife has since contacted PP and linen vendor to replicate comfort at home).  Room slightly larger than average, bath good size, view of park spectacular.  Staff was accommodating, though nothing exceptional.  Used concierge level service which was great.  Three times a day small plate food, snacks and beverages provided.  Private space, mostly quiet space great for light meals and snacks.  Had a "special" request of one of the concierge and they did not deliver.  An excellent hotel and/or staff member would have delivered on the request.  Overall hotel nice, central to parks with a good staff and clean amenities.

Even though we live in West LA, we stayed overnight at the Disneyland Resort with our extended family from out of state.  We wanted a place on the property so that the kids could go to the park with or without us but be relatively close if they wanted to rest.  The adults in our group wanted to be able to hang poolside without the kids for an hour or two.  The rooms were really quite nice.  They were clean, well maintained, and the beds and linens were comfy.  We also had a great view of California Adventure and the World of Color show.    The pool area was clean and again, very well maintained but left a lot to be desired.  The food and beverage choices (at the pool) were pretty slim pickings.  The pool was small and nearly every chair was occupied and yet there was only one

Summary Heading: Always love to stay at Paradise Pier!
Summary: This is our second visit to the Paradise Pier. We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and Grand Californian. Yet, Paradise Pier has been our favorite. We have a toddler and it's perfect for them. It's a very family friendly place and has the casual yet still Disney feel to it.   Customer service is always outstanding. No complaints. We upgraded this time to Concierge Level which we were glad we did. It includes great view of California Adventure. Plus, from behind pool, you have great view of Disneyland fireworks! The turndown service is outstanding. Love the chocolates and rice krispy treats left on bed as well as them refilling our towels.   Can't wait to stay here again.

Summary Heading: If this wasn't on Disney Property, I wouldn't stay here again.
Summary: I have very mixed feelings about this resort. Part of me wants to say it was amazing, since our vacation was absolutely amazing, but I really can't say that about the hotel itself. We're seasoned Disney Park visitors (18 stays in the past 10 years) and this is only the third time we've stayed on property. If this hotel wasn't on Disney property, I would not stay here again.   The good: - Disney Service is great - the cast members at the front desk are happy and helpful.   - The PCH Grill Character breakfast in the hotel is AWESOME! Good food, not very busy, and lots and lots of interaction with the characters. But not so much that you can't eat your breakfast.   -You will LOVE the walkability of this hotel to Disneyland and California Adventure. It's a short 5 minute walk

Summary Heading: Great hotel, close to parks, lots of disney magic and great service.
Summary: We stayed at the paraise pier hotel over a very busy weekend in september, regardless of how busy the hotel was we never felt left out. the front desk staff was great and the valet staff was simply amazing. The staff remembered us andalways made us feel welcome. Other reviews on here state the hotel is missing the disney magic, very wrong. Those people must be expecting harry potter to appear and perform. The hotel has many Disney touches, and the rooms are large and very updated and clean. At around $250 thishotel is a value for everything you get. In my opinion the people who give this property a bad review cant afford it and stayed there anyways and expected fireworks in the room. Stay here for a great place by the park and if you can afford it stay at the Grand Californian

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay with lots of special touches
Summary: Stayed at PPH for my sons 5th birthday. This was a wonderful trip. Donnie in guest services was very helpful and made my children feel very special with buttons, glow sticks, jewels, chocolate coins, and pictures of princesses and toy story addressed to my children. The surf board rice krispies were a nice surprise. The room was clean and very comfortable. The pool was delightful and having life jackets for the children was a nice touch. The life guards did a good job watching the children in the pool area. This was the best place to stay and all staff were very friendly, especially Donnie :)

The hotel is close to the park and you can use the Grand Californian entrance into California Adventure. The hotel theme is California Surf and if you get the California Adventure view room you can watch the nightly show from the comfort of your room. As with all Disney properties, the staff is very friendly and goes out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back!

I stayed at this hotel Sept. 2 & 3, 2011 over Marathon weekend.  I brought my daughter with me and met my friend and her Aunt, the 4 of us shared a deluxe room.  We were on the 11th floor and had a pool view.   The room was spacious enough for the 4 of us and had a day bed as well.   My friend and I were there to run the Half Marathon and it was a GREAT location, being close to the parks, Sports Expo and Events.  When my daughter and I arrived, we immediately parked and went to meet my friend, who had already checked in.  We parked in self parking on the 3rd floor and as we unloaded our luggage, we realized there was NO elevator in the parking garage, only stairs!  I never thought about unloading at the hotel front doors since my friend had already checked us in and we just

We stayed at this hotel during the Disneyland half marathon weekend. We checked in around noon on Thursday and our room was ready. Everything was really clean. The beach ball pillows on each bed were adorable. They included an unobtrusive little card advising guests not to be tempted to take them home unless you wanted to pay $69 for them. LOL.  We had upgraded to the concierge package. That gave us a cabana side room on the 3rd floor with our own walk-out porch, which included a table and chairs inside a gate. If you walked out of the gate, it was only a little ways to the pool. We could sometimes here the guests at the pool, but only if they were super loud or screaming kids. We weren't in our room much, so it didn't matter. There was also a place to get tasty adult beverages

We stayed here because my wife was attending a 3-day course there.  Rooms were definitely more expensive than one would normally pay for the same size and quality, but you are paying for proximity to Downtown Disney and Disneyland (5-minute walk to the former; maybe 10 minutes to the latter, though you can take the monorail from Downtown Disney into Tomorrowland).  Except for a few Disney-themed decorations, the rooms were standard.  We had a special conference rate so our room had a view of the pool; you pay extra to get a view of California Adventure, etc.  Room was quiet except for during the nightly fireworks shows at Disneyland/C.A.   There is a business center, with PCs-- Internet access cost $6 for 10 minutes!    The bar/cafe downstairs had decent meals.  Not cheap, but

My daughters, age 22 and 18, and I decided to take an end of summer vacation at the Disneyland resort. We all have annual passes so we got a great rate on the concierge level at this property. We arrived Tuesday afternoon around one and our room on the 14th floor looking toward California Adventure was ready. The view was amazing. We headed out for Disneyland but came back to the concierge lounge, located on the second floor, for snacks and drinks. Pretzels, snack mix,, cookies, chips, fruit, sodas, water, tea, coffee, are all available all the time.  we headed out to the pool on the third floor. The pool itself it nothing special, but the kids there were obviously enjoying the large water slide. And one of the reason I love this property over the other two resort hotels is how

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in August and had a really, really great time. The hotel staff were all exceptionally friendly, and when they found out this was our anniversary trip, we were upgraded to a king suite and given big red "Happy Anniversary" buttons (although somewhat embarassing to wear, they proved valuable - we got free champagne with lunch at Ralph Brennan's Jazz Kitchen and free dessert at Wine Country Trattoria, among other things!).  Our room was clean, modern and fairly large. The housekeeping staff were great, and decorated our bed with rose petals on our first night. The turn-down service with chocolates was a nice touch, as were the complimentary surfboard-shaped rice krispy squares.  The pool was small but nice enough, we spent an afternoon

To celebrate my daughter's 4th birthday, we stayed at the PPH. It was our first stay. We checked in early and got into our room by 12:30pm. Since it was my daughter's bday, she received balloons, a pin and a 8"x10" b/w photo of Disney princesses. As part of the summer promotion, we received 2 fastpasses each.   The staff is friendly and attentive. They have a upbeat attitude. Our standard view room was located on the same floor as the pool. This is convenient when you have 3 kids. We didn't find the elevators to be slow or troublesome as some reviewers wrote. Our view was of CA Adventure but we weren't high enough to watch the World of Color show from our window. Room is good enough for a family of five. We had two queen beds and a couch that turns into a bed. It's not like a

Loved this hotel!  The pool was a good size and there was a kiddie pool, hot tub, and waterslide.  The pool deck was the perfect place to watch the Disneyland fireworks and they placed the music through the speakers for you.  Our room overlooked the California Adventure Park where we had a great view of the World of Colors show and the music was loud enough for us to hear with the windows open (although you could also hear it with the windows shut at 10:15pm).  There was a fridge in the room and a nice pull out sofa.  I wish their sink area was separate from the toilet and shower like the Disneyland hotel is set up.  The character breakfast was very fun--a must do.  Beds were nice and the room was spotless.  The next time we're back at Disney this will probably be my first

I stayed here with friends and my son for a trip to Disneyland and California Adventure. We stayed for three nights. The hotel is clean, has nicely appointed rooms if a tad small (we had two queen beds, 1 trundle) and has a zippy surfboard / beachy theme. It is right across the street from California Adventure and access to Disneyland is within just a few minutes walking distance through the luxurious Grand Californian Hotel.  The maid service was prompt and friendly leaving extra bottles of toiletries cheerfully since we had a group of 5 in the room. We also received delicious surfboard shaped rice krispies treats with white chocolate frosting the first night. The concierge room on the 2nd floor offers free breakfast and afternoon snacks for an extra fee. There are other more

Summary Heading: Best Value for a Great Family Vacation
Summary: Our family LOVES to go to Disneyland.  We have 2 daughters and a son, all with varied interests, so it has been difficult to find a vacation where everyone is entertained and having fun.  Disneyland has never disappointed. Over the years we have tried a variety of hotels, and have found Paradise Pier to be the best value.  YES, you pay a premium to stay in a Disneyland property, but the extras are SO WORTH IT!    #1.  You are never without that wonderful Disney touch ... clean, themed, and friendly.   #2.  There is No Messing about with line ups for trams or shuttles.  The walk to the parks is short (via the Grand Californian and Downtown Disney).  OR you can use the monorail.  This makes it easy to be flexible with your days.  Somebody need a midday nap or swim?  No problem!

Summary Heading: Yes, The Disney Experience is worth it!
Summary: Yes, it's more expensive. But to be on-site, immersed in the Disney Experience was worth it to us since we don't take many vacations like this and we had planned and saved for it! Nice, big rooms, very clean, just a short walk to the California Adventure Private entry, or through Downtown Disney into the parks. We opted for the concierge level and were impressed with the value we received from that service: Breakfast, snacks, drinks, waters, wine & beer, light dinner, desserts, internet access, printing access, private check-in, someone available to answer any questions and help with any reservations (even off-site reservations), nightly turn-down service with chocolate coins, great view of California Adventure and incredibly comfortable bedding -- well worth it for our family

I was pleasantly surprised.  The rooms were large, comfy bed and a short walk to the parks and downtown Disney.  Had a quick breakfast at the small cafe.  Nice is not interested in the pricey character breakfast.  My only complaint would be the need for more elevators.  Will definetly stay again.

Summary Heading: Enjoyable stay for our family of 5
Summary: We had decided to use our DVC points for a last minute surprise trip to Disneyland for our kids. Service, quality, and location are all top notch. Check in was a breeze and our kids even got balloons! Our room wasn't quite ready, so we enjoyed early entry into California Adventure and got a text about 11am that our room was ready.   Our room had 2 queen beds, a pull out couch that fit my 4 yo perfectly, and a Graco pack n play for our baby. There was a fridge, desk, chair, and plenty of room for the kids to relax and play. We had a great view of California Adventure and the kids even watched World of Color from the room with the music playing on the TV.    Our only complaint would have to be the elevators. It took a while to find an elevator that was empty enough would fit our

Summary Heading: Great Overall Experience, Need to Update Some Services
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel during our Disneyland vacation this week.  We have no complaints about the hotel or the overall level of service, which was excellent.  The room was exactly as pictured, down to the beach ball pillows, decently sized with an in-room refrigerator. Although we had a standard room, it was easy enough to walk to the end of the hall to catch a glimpse of World of Color and/or the fireworks, if we wanted to.  The kids loved the pool and water slide, I enjoyed the pool-side bar. :)    My only quibble with this otherwise excellent hotel is that some services need to be updated to account for the inconveniences of modern air travel.  The vending area had a very small selection of tiny toiletries, including no sunscreen or deodorant and

Stayed 4 nights with family of four. Bathroom fan was not working. Call on first day to have fan fixed. Promised that fan would be fixed. Fan was never fixed. Asked if we could at least be comped for 3 days of parking ($3x15=45 dollars) for broken fan. Told we could only be comped for 1 day ($15.00). Feel that Disney should be able to afford $30.00 less profit for vacation package that cost over $2000.00. Will not ever be going back to Disney Hotel.

My family of five stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel from June 27 to June 30.  We stayed in a family room with two queen beds and a sofa bed.  For a change the sofa bed was quite comfortable with no lumps!  The room was not as roomy as a suite of rooms that you could have gotten in an outlying hotel, but more than adequate for the 5 of us.    It was easy to walk from the hotel to California Adventure.  By the way Soaring Over California was great.  It was also an easy walk to the Monorail Station in front of the Disneyland Hotel.  We ate at the hotel restaurant twice, once for dinner and then once with Mickey and Minnie.  Yes, the meals were expensive, but what the heck, we were on vacation and we planned for it.  The food was very good and the Mickey and Minnie morning brunch

Summary Heading: Closeness to theme parks only quality
Summary: If you want to be able to come and go to your hotel from the parks and not have to worry about shuttle schedules then this is the hotel for you.  If you like comfort and quite, I would suggest any of the hotels that are close to the parks.  Disneyland Blvd. is a very busy street with traffic going at all hours.  We were on the fourth floor facing the Blvd and it was noisy.  The beds were not the pillow-top comfort we were used to and the daybed was only big enough for a child or very small adult.  It was also very uncomfortable.  We dined at Downtown Disney quite often and found the prices very reasonable.  We also used the Surfside Lounge for breakfast.

This hotel was well worth the money. If you can afford to pay $500 a night at the other Disney hotels than go for it, but if you would rather spend more money on shopping than on a hotel room you will mostly be sleeping in, then stay at this hotel. The service was excellent, hotel room was clean, beds were super comfy, cute Disney decor, the view over the parks was excellent and so was the pool and water slide. Family loved it, we were on the 12th floor over looking California Adventure, and the entrance into the parks is about a 5 minutes walk. Easy to drive out of the hotel to eat elsewhere also. Food and drinks are pricey, but that goes with everywhere else you go. The hotel is old, but its maintained pretty well. I even accidently left my rings in the room for the whole day,

Summary Heading: Love staying here.  Fun beach theme.
Summary: The Disneyland Hotel is my favorite but having stayed at the Paradise Pier more frequently has made it a favorite in my book.  The rooms have a nice lightness to it and I think the surfer beach theme is lovely.  Great views of California Adventure if you face one of the sides.  Staff is always helpful and always greeting guests.  The coffee shop and restaurant are a great feature and the store always has great merchandise.  There's something special about this specific hotel that I love and I always visit it even when I'm not a guest.  Maybe it's the smaller feel it has and creates a more intimate feeling.  I will always consider staying here for my Disney trips.

Summary Heading: Comfort and Convenient at a Cost
Summary: I stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel in mid-June for two nights with my wife and our little girl.  I did my reservation through Disney Travel co. directly and reserved a "Park View Room".  The room rate was not cheap, but the location was quite worth the extra $$.  Once we stepped into the lobby, we can definitely tell the design is an older hotel.  The lobby decor is less magical than the Disneyland Hotel but it is very clean and refreshing.  Since we arrived early, our room was not ready when we checked in.  No problem! We were going to spend the day in the parks anyway. The receptionist gave us our room key told us we will receive a text msg when our room is ready.  What a nice feature!  When we returned from the parks and entered into our room, what a nice surprise.  The

WOW.....my family and I just got back from our Disneyland vacation and I must say, it was wonderful!!  We purchased our vacation package through Costco Travel.....saved us 25% off the vacation price.  Well worth it!!  We LOVED staying on property.  The Paradise Pier hotel was great.....roomy and clean.  The map can be a bit confusing though.  We thought we would have direct access to the park, but we didn't. We had to walk to the Disney Grand hotel to get to the parks.  If you have a little extra money, I would HIGHLY recommend staying there instead.....5 minutes closer.  I know it's not much, but when you're already exhausted from the day at the park, you want to get home as soon as you can.  Staying at the property came with many perks....the MOST important one.....we were

Summary Heading: Great location and decent hotel with excellent service
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights on part of our honeymoon trip and were extremely happy with the service provided and location of the hotel. It was only a short walk over the road and through downtown disney to get the parks which made things extremely convenient.  The room was clean and the staff made a nice fuss over it being our honeymoon with a room upgrade and disney items given to us.

Summary Heading: Typical Disney and Good Location for Theme Parks
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a west coast tour. It is all you would expect from a Disney outlet; well organised, tidy room and slightly pricey. The hotel is not too big and has a roof top swimming pool which is quite cool along with a 100ft+ tube/slide - the kids loved this. Parking is at the hotel at $15 per day. From the hotel it is a 3-5 minute walk to the park gates and as a hotel guest you get to sneak in a little earlier that other visitors which makes for 4-5 hassle-free rides. Tip - if it is your first time make sure you tell them as you great a pile of goodies! Whilst you pay a premium for the Disney name it is a well located hotel that served us well.

We've stayed at all three hotels and still prefer Paradise Pier because: - The rooms are bright and spacious. - The location is great (special entrance for California Adventure and not too far from Disneyland). - The price. We got a concierge level, theme park room and it was still much cheaper than Grand Californian standard rooms. And the view was so amazing compared to the ugly monorail views you might get at Grand Californian.  Here are some tips: > If you have a family of 4 or more, the concierge is totally worth it. Think about how much you would end up spending for just breakfast and all the water bottles at the park.  > If you do get a concierge room, you can also borrow two DVDs every day and they have a huge collection of DVDs. It's great for late at night before the

Summary Heading: Try to stay at Grand Californian instead if you can
Summary: We booked a last-minute trip to Disneyland with our family, and unfortunately the Paradise Pier was the only option left of the 3 Disney properties. It's not that the hotel is bad, it was just worn and tired. It was cool for our 5 year old that they had a pool and water slide onsite, but the place was packed and the space available seemed inadequate the number people allowed in and near the pool. It felt like we were at a public pool as opposed to a "resort." It was like rubbing salt in the wound to walk through the brand-new and beautiful Grand Californian on the way to the park each day (it was recommended to us by the staff that we cut through the GC from the PP). To be fair, the GC is a step up in price, but were we to go again, I would spring for the upgrade - for a newer,

Summary Heading: A  Disney resort hotel at a more reasonable price
Summary: This was our second stay at the Paradise Pier, and I have enjoyed our stay both times. We usually stay in a good neighbor hotel walking distance to the park, but sometimes the bonuses that come with staying at a Disney resort are too tempting. This was certainly the case with our recent trip that coincided with the July 4th holiday. The special deal that included bonus fastpasses and early entry made it well worth a little extra cost over staying in a standard motel. And while it is the least "luxurious" of the 3 Disneyland resorts, it is also the least expensive, and still offers plenty of Disney magic. We had excellent service at the check-in desk, and were upgraded to a park view room. We got to our room just as the first "World of Color" was beginning, and since there is a

First of all, I thought a Disneyland hotel would be magical just as most Disney things are, but this one is not. It's a nice hotel, the rooms are very clean, the beds very comfy, but it's just not magical!! Neither is the Disneyland Hotel based on a walk through the lobby. *The good* - The fast passes!! You get two per person, and for me, that alone was probably worth the stay. We used them all on the wonderful Star Tours ride (they weren't giving out fast passes when we got there, but you can still use the "special" ones from the hotel). - Short, easy walk to the Parks (~10 mins) - Clean rooms, comfy beds *The bad* - When we checked in, we moved from one room to another and back to the first room (with kids and all our stuff), and the keys didn't work, so we had to go back to

Stayed three nights with my family in two connecting rooms. Everything was set as requested. Rooms were large and clean. Had two queen beds  and a twin sofa bed in each room. Also included refrigerator and free safe. Best part of staying here is the easy walking distance to Disneyland and California Adventure. Aside from the usual early entry options, the Disneyland resort hotels are giving two fastpasses for each registered guest! I don't know how long it will last, but it's a great promo. Costs are typical for Disney, expensive but somehow they make you feel like it's worth it for the kids. Gym is excellent and the pool is large and usually not too crowded. Self laundry is plentiful.

Summary Heading: worth the extra money to stay on the Disney property
Summary: Yes, I know it is more expensive to stay here. On our last trip to Disneyland, we stayed down the street at a very nice place and walked to the park. The walk back to the room at 10pm was so tiring. This time we stayed at the Paradise Pier and I want to say it was worth the money. Nice room, very clean, a very short walk to Disneyland and an even shorter walk to California Adventure. The walk back to the room during the day and again at 10pm was not a problem. You really feel that you are a part of the excitement when you stay at one of the Disney hotels. The Paradise Pier is the least expensive of the three and the room was amazing. Cute decor, a refrigerator in the room, nice big bathroom, and very quiet. The only downside was the slow elevator system that gets crowded in the

We stayed at the PP on our most recent stay at Disneyland.  Excellent service all around.  At the PCH Grill, we had probably the best served meal of our lives.  Ruffo was courteous, funny, treated my two kids like they were royalty and provided a great experience.    The pool, while not overly big, was a lot of fun.  The slide was great too.    Our room was bright and cheery with extremely comfortable beds.    If I was to have one complaint, is that the price of a beer in the gift shop was really high.  But overall, a great travel experience.

Where to begin.......  When I 1st looked at booking a Disneyland holiday I was a little overwhelmed by the choices I was able to make. I decided to ditch the travel agents & book it myself through disneyparks.disney.go.com. Turned out to be a smart & easy choice. We opted to stay at the Paradise Pier & went for the full concierge treatment. I've heard ppl say this is a waste of money, but I beg to differ!  The treatment & attention we received from Jerry & Brittany in concierge was 2nd to none & the attention to what we wanted out of our 1st Disney experience was understood & made happen beyond out expectations! The day my husband & son were going to Universal, we'd slept in. Jerry rang to check on where they were, as they didn't show up for breakfast. They jumped out of bed

Summary Heading: Not a "Magical Experience"-Very Poor Customer Service-Will Not Be Back
Summary: Was not told that the $100 concierge service covered the first day of check-in. We checked in late on our first day, after the concierge room was closed.  We had a 2 night stay. When we tried to eat on our last day, we were denied. Rudely told we didn't pay for that day. When we pressed the issue we were told "it was against their policy" but they would "bend the rules and let us feed our kids dinner." They loudly exclaimed to other guests as they told us that we were to understand it was a "one-time thing, one-meal only." We were never so insulted! We will not be staying there again. Don't waste your money. Make your own Magical Experience somewhere else.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, large rooms, convenient to Disney parks
Summary: This was my first stay at this Disney property.  We decided to stay at Paradise Pier for a change of scenery from the Disneyland Hotel across the street which is where we usually stay when we go to Disneyland, plus the price per night was less.  When we arrived the bellmen welcomed us and were quick to move our tons of luggage – we were traveling with our three teenage/young adult daughters.  There was not a line at check-in so we got our room keys and park hoppers within minutes.     Paradise Pier is an older hotel which has been remodeled, but you can hardly tell because everything looks fairly new plus the rooms are huge.  We had a room with two queens and a daybed so the five of us were comfortable.    There is a refrigerator and a coffee maker in the room as well so we

We loved this hotel and can't say enough good things about the wonderful staff here!!! My 8 year old daughter got VERY sick for 2 of the 3 1/2 days we were there and the staff bent over backwards trying to help her still have a semi-enjoyable trip. We will be back in December and there was never any question about where we would stay. My 8 year old said, "I want to stay where we did before. The workers were all so nice to me."

My wife and I stayed at this hotel last year, it was her birthday so we drove to L.A. to celebrate in Disneyland. The park was wonderful, as expected, and we greatly enjoyed ourselves. On my wife's birthday, before we departed from the hotel, my wife decided to take of her 400 dollar ring (my gift to her) and stored it in her makeup case on the bathroom counter. In our haste to get going we forgot to put the "do not disturb" sign on the door as we usually do. We were at the park all day, and every minute my wife was thinking about the safety of her ring. We don't ever let maids come in and clean when we aren't present because in my opinion that's just asking for it, but I wasn't too worried because of the sheer reputation of the hotel and its seemingly outstanding code of

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay with Kids at Disneyland
Summary: For our first family trip to Disneyland (4.5 year old and 14month old), we decided to do the whole Disney experience and stay at one of the Disney hotels.  Since the Dinseyland Hotel was under construction and the Grand Californian was a bit pricey, we opted for the Paradise Pier.  Overall the hotel was very nice.  The room was clean, comfortable and fairly quiet.  We didn't have a car so we walked through Downtown Disney to get to the park, about a 15 minute walk.  The character breakfast at the hotel was great.  Again, a bit pricey, but the experience was worth it.  The kids got to meet Mickey, Minnie, Daisy, Pluto and Stitch.  Overall we would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Not as magical as the other Disney hotels
Summary: We booked the Paradise Pier hotel as we had previously stayed in the Disneyland hotel and found it really added to the Disney experience. The Disneyland hotel is undergoing building renovations so we decided to try the Paradise Pier hotel. It was nice enough - the rooms were large and comfortable - but for the price and distance from the parks we felt we could have stayed in a Good Neighbor hotel and had better value for money. The rooms weren't really themed enough for a Disney hotel, and I'm not sure what benefits were gained from paying Disney prices on this occasion. Next time we'd either stay at the Disneyland hotel again, or go to a regular hotel within walking distance from the parks.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with a fun beach/surf vibe
Summary: My husband and i stayed here from June 18-22.  We loved the proximity to the parks, it was a very short walk to everything!  We stayed on our DVC points and were welcomed home at check in, the girl (i forgot her name) who checked us in was so sweet and gave us 2 fast passes each for any ride in the park for our stay, i thought that was awesome!!  We loved the decor of the room, there was surf stuff everywhere, even our pillows were beach balls, we also had a view of California Adventure (well the back of it anyway), i was able to put it on channel 65 and listen to world of color as i saw the back of it from my window, that was definately a treat (room 408, if your wondering).  They had a nice little bar downstairs and Suzie the bartender was very nice, attentive and easy to talk

Summary Heading: Excellent choice for family with young kids - proximity, clean, perks
Summary: This is a very good hotel with nice room.   Proximity, clean, and some nice perks makes it always an excellent choice ....   Can you save a few bucks by going somewhere else ?  Sure, but you'll miss on something.  This is the best value for a room on the disneyland property.   I came for three days (june 4-7), and just love staying at the Paradise Pier.   Just before actually going, the reviews on trip advisor almost made me cancel my reservation.  That would have been a huge mistake.         I feel most bad review are made by people who thinks that because they pay 220$/night, they are now royalty.   Imagine that some review complain that they have to wait 15 minutes for check-in.   Can you believe that these people would go to Disneyland, the waitiest place on earth !!!  (You

Staff was absolutely outstanding; everyone was friendly and helpful, most went above and beyond; at worst they did exactly what they said they would or you asked of them - and with a smile.  Very pleasant.
