Cost was a bit high, but for the convenience of not having to catch shuttles/drive daily and being able to walk across the street to CA Adventure, and a bit further to get to Downtown Disney/Disneyland (walk toward the Disneyland Hotel - same side of street as the Paradise Pier) was well worth the cost, not to mention being able to see the CA Adv. World of Color and Disneyland Fireworks from the room was a bonus.    Only one restuarant, PCH Grill, and not a lot of options for kids, and of course pricey, but good quality food.  One short block down to Catella are two family

We've stayed at Paradise Pier on 3 different occasions.  We prefer to stay at the resort because of the proximity to both parks & the special perks that go with staying at a Disney hotel. Unfortunately, Paradise Pier is in serious need of a renovation.  The hotel is dark & everything about it is old & dated. It even smells dated. I hope that after the Disneyland Hotel renovation is complete, the good folks at Disney will turn their focus on renovating the Paradise Pier.  For the price you pay, I would expect much better from a Disney Hotel.

I am a Disney Vacation Club Owner who could NOT get the Suite I wanted across the street at the DVC. We opted for 2 rooms, adjoining. Only had two choices for breakfast: a $27.00 buffet or walk up service that was served with plastic knives and forks......should have ordered the room service???? Gift shop not coordinated with the park openings, but had a great selection of gifts. No time for the pool although it looked nice from our 8th floor windows. No towel animals.....but I am spoiled by WDW. Shortage of elevators at park closing time.....you can tell this was not built as a Disney property, but bought and refurbished. Free parking ONLY for DVC members, otherwise $15. a day.

My husband and I took our three year old son to Disneyland and we decided to stay at Paradise Pier.  It was a great choice!  We arrived VERY early for check in - 6am and the person at the front desk was very cheerful and helpful and was able to let us into our room even though we were super early for check in.   The room was clean and quiet.  Every night of our stay the maids remade our beds and left chocolates on our pillows Our whole family loved the swimming pool and spa!  We were happy to see that the hotel provides towels and life jackets for pool and spa use so we didn't have to bring ours from home.  It was wonderful staying so close to the theme parks too - especially with our three year old! Overall, we had a great experience staying at this hotel and we will be back!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for good price, walking distance to Disneyland.
Summary: In May, 2011,I went to Disneyland for the first time with my daughter, SIL and grandson.  They stayed at the Grand Californian which I could not afford.  I stayed conveniently across the street at the Paradise Pier..  The Paradise Pier is a lovely beaxch-themed hotel.  The staff "cast members" are very friendly and helpful.  The pool is beautiful and well stocked with towels.  There is a great restaurant, the PCH grill and a shop.  My room had a fabulous view of the giant Ferris wheel at California Adventur across thwe street..  The only drawback is that there are no handicap-accessible rooms.  No roll in showers, etc. But,  It is less than a five minute walk to the Grand Californian and the Disney shops behind the GC and Disneyland itself.  If you stay at one of the three

My husband traveled for business and our daughter and I tagged along.  The hotel was 'free' for us as his employer paid.  The location was great and by staying on site at a Disney hotel we could take advantage of Magic Mornings (early park entrance).  The pool and water slide were fun for afternoons after a day at the park but a little poolside service from the poolside bar would be nice.  I tried to use room service twice but only used it once--there is no room service from 11am to 6pm.  Very strange.  So no afternoon room service lunch for me and the tired child after a very long day at Disneyland. I used the business room one morning and it was perfectly adequate.  The room itself was also perfectly adequate.  I have no complaints about this hotel but it was a far, far cry

Stayed here for 3 nights.  I've stayed at all 3 hotels now, and this one is probably the best value.  Clean, large rooms, nice hotel in general.  Disneyland Hotel is still a little nicer, and neither compare to the Grand Californian, but price-wise, Paradise Pier is a great value!

Summary Heading: Fantastic location and magical Disney spirit all round
Summary: What a fantastic location - just a short stroll to Downtown Disney and on to the two parks.  Manageable for all - our 2 1/2 year old could walk it no problems - but a stroller/pram is a must for any considerable time away from the hotel.    The rooms are clean and comfortable - the only issue I had was the bed height - they were too high up off the ground, especially considering in many instances, children would be using them.  Our daughter fell off one night.    The tv channels are not that great - and there was a princess bed time story chann that would play the same 10 min story over and over again, and it would only be changed to a different story the next day - very annoying.  The free wifi and Internet access was fantastic!  The staff were great, and the food at the hotel

This hotel was very clean and a cheap price for a Disney hotel. The price was not worth for what you get. The our room was decent. The restaurants at the hotel were good. But we did not go to the pool. Are room had an amazing view of California Adventure. This hotel is decent.  The Grand Californian hotel is a lot more worth it even with a way higher price.

Summary Heading: Checked us in right away at 9:00 am!
Summary: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel.  It was clean, comfortable and well-kept.  Most important, close to diseneyland & california Adventure!

we started our trip on a sad note to help our son cope with loss of gramdma  but from the moment we got there a 'cast memeber" Marie made it magical she gave him balloons and a picture he will treasure forever.  Each time we were in lobby or she saw us during our trip she rembered his name.   The fireworks on the pool deck were amazing! We loved the world of color too!  This holel is not as fancy as the Grand but worthwile and easy access and close to the park.  We were disapointed the monorail was down but the walk was easy enough.   It was a great time and we will come again.

Summary Heading: Overall we liked Paradise Pier, but...
Summary: - no elevator in parking garage, make sure if you are parking onsite that you unload the car at the front with the bell desk and then drive around and park; front desk staff did not inform me of this and it was a HUGE hassle. -the hotel is an older property that has been purchased and refurbished by Disney, so it is not going to be as spectacular as the Grand Californian; the price reflects the difference in luxury. I have stayed at both properties and enjoyed each for just what they are. You just have to know that going in.  -Our (non park-view) room was set up as your average hotel room (no balcony, just a big window) but cute beach- themed furnishings/ lighting. My 2 boys loved the large beach balls on the bed (decorative pillows). We also loved the little lotions/soaps with

Summary Heading: Convenient Disney hotel with great  room
Summary: Traveling solo, I decided to travel down to Disneyland Resort after an event in Hollywood.  I was able to acquire 30% off the room through Walt Disney travel company.  I wanted to stay at one of the Disney hotels, so I could take a break from the parks during the day and not have to walk more than absolutely necessary (you WILL walk miles over three days).  The Paradise Pier is very convenient to the Monorail stationa and Grand Californian entrance.  The room was fantastic, very large (although no balcony( with a fun beach theme and great in-room amenities.  I had a view overlooking California Adventure and thouroughly enjoyed World of Color from the room.  The extra perks were great:  FastPass to World of Color, early entry through the Grand Californian, lanyard for park ticket

This hotel is nice and all, but for the price, I'd have rather stayed at the newer Disney Hotel.   It has a gift shop, which is fairly priced, and usually has store promotions happening. The restaurant is alright, they do a special character breakfast in the morning but make sure your kids know who chip n' dale are. :)  It's a bit of a walk to the Entrance to California Adventure, but that park is the closest. If you stay here just keep in mind it'll be a bit of a walk to the Disneyland Park. After walking all day and night for a week it got incresingly hard to ignore how far our hotel really was.  The room is nice, clean, and very helpful speedy service, but its not fancy in anyway. We got an amazing view of the park, so ask for a Park view room, it was worth it.  The Pool is

Summary Heading: Dissapointing for the money, but a handy location
Summary: We were a bit disappointed with our (1 night only) stay at Disney Paradise pier hotel.  The hotel is starting to look a bit shabby and dated, and certainly lacks any sort of wow factor, which for the money we found rather disappointing.  When we arrived to check-in, we had to wait a good 20 minutes in a line, and the check-in process itself seemed to take an age - how much typing do you honestly need for a pre-booked hotel stay these days? He seemed to be writing war and peace! Not the check-in persons fault, but clearly something wrong with Disney's systems here, not impressed at all.  The hotel is situated on a main road, and is good for one thing only - easy access to Disney California adventure park (and via monorail to Disneyland). But even here we were slightly

Summary Heading: Best Hotel during our California vacation
Summary: Absolutely wonderful hotel!  The rooms are immaculate.  Bedding luxurious.  Access to Disneyland and DCA is so easy.  We got a complimentary upgrade to a "park view" room just by asking, where we could see "World of Color" from our window each night.  The experience at a Disney hotel is hard to put into words, but you DO get that Disney Magic at this one.  I could nitpick some things: the fridge was a bit small - but worked fine; the pool is NOT the best Disney pool I've used.   Still these things did not hinder me giving this great hotel a 5!

Best vacation. We had a nice view from our room to the Disney California Aventure. Every day they leave chocolate coins with Disney characters face on them in your room. Clean rooms the only bad thing about the hotel is that the elevators they are verry slow and many times crowded but other then that it was great.

After a 23  year hiatus from Disneyland, I just returned from a five day trip there with my 9 and 6 year-old grandsons.  In a nutshell, it was the trip of a lifetime for the three of us, due in large part to the staff, location and environment of the Paradise Pier Hotel.  When we arrived at 2:00 p.m. our room was not ready, which I was prepared for.  The Bell station kept our bags while we walked to Rainforest Cafe in Downtown Disney for a late lunch after a long flight.  We were texted by the hotel at 3:00 that the room was ready.  By the way, the fellow who checked us in, Alex I think, was great and asked if we were celebrating a special occasion.  We were celebrating the 6 year old's upcoming birthday since I only see them every few months.  So the kids got special buttons

This was our 2nd stay at Paradise Pier.  Rooms have been updated and were very comfortable.  The shower did seem to run out of hot water and water pressure was low.  Only other complaint was how slow the elevators were.  There was a convention staying at the hotel and this greatly impacted the elevators.  We had a park view last time and this time we had a pool view - our rooms both times were quiet..  Downtown Disney is about a 5 minute walk.  I am recovering from a knee injury and the staff will give you a ride to and from ESPN Zone in the golf cart.  Everyone there was really great!!

Last April we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, so this trip we didnt want to lose the "Disney experience",but couldnt afford the previous hotel. I was apprehensive on what we were going to get,but I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and our room was ready when we arrived. The room was not a park view room,we  had a view of the pool,but I was fine with it. It was quiet enough,we had a room at the very end of the hall.The room was very clean and the beds were soooo comfy! We had a 2 cup coffeemaker which was niceand our first night there we got Rice Krispie Mickey squares. The pool is small,it has a waterslide that is not attached to the pool that my daughter enjoyed. The pool is on the 3rd floor and we were told you could watch the fireworks there,but we didnt so

Summary Heading: Very nice time in concierge level
Summary: First of all, this is a long overdue review.  Our first stay at the Paradise Pier was last May 2010, and that’s when this review is for.  We are heading to Southern California again next month, and will be staying offsite for the first 4 nights, then we may stay at the Paradise Pier again for the last 2 nights, which will be the first days of the grand opening of the updated/new rides!  It would have been nice if we could have checked in immediately, but we were told that check in would probably not be until 3pm, so they held our bags and we headed to the parks.  Other than that, everyone was very friendly and nice, including the concierge, front desk and baggage personnel!  Once we were able to check in, we headed to our room, which was on the 3rd floor.  I liked the big

Summary Heading: Best Disney experience by staying at Disney resort!
Summary: We had the best time at Paradise Pier Hotel! After reading reviews after I made our reservations, I was a little concerned! But I was totally relieved on arrival. Excellent customer service thanks Luis and Jerry u Guys are the best!! Couldn't do enough for us. The room was fab the little Mickey touches were great and the view of Disneys DCA park was awesome at night. We never had any probs with waiting for the elevator like some people mentioned but I guess if u go btwn june and august you may have to expect that with sooo many guests. The walk to Downtown was a short stroll straight out the  back exit only ten minutes if that or straight out the front and across to grand cal hotel cut thru only 5 mins. Best location for us first timers from Perth Western Australia.

This hotel was amazing, the staff were all so friendly and helpful. The room was fabulous and the beds soooo comfy. We had a park view room and the view of the California Adventure park was spectacular! We could see theWorld Of Colour show every night. It's in a great location, only a 3 minute walk to Downtown Disney. My son loved the pool area and the character buffet breakfast can't be missed. The only con was the water pressure and temperature of the shower wasn't the best but that's neither here or there. Highly recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: Good Hotel & value for your money
Summary: This is probably the best value you can get if you're wanting the Disney experience, the amenities of staying a hotel (not just a room), while managing your costs. This was the first time I stayed here, and I was pleasantly surprised.  The first thing I would say is out of the three resorts (Grand Californian, Disneyland Hotel, and this one), this was the least expensive.  So going in, I was curious how things would play out.  I went in with 0 expectations.  It ended up being a very nice stay.  They do all the right things as its Disney.  From check-in to departure, customer service was excellent (Front Desk staff, housekeeping, guest services, bell services, coffee service) - no issues there.  Its a well-maintained property.  Very nice (but small) lobby area, restaurants,

Maybe my expectations were too high, but being a Disney Resort Hotel, I expected more. The bathrooms were semi remodeld, with what appeared the original tub. It still had the pull out clothes line that was oxidized and worn out. The water pressure was terrible and the water temperature kept changing when the neighboring room flushed or used their shower. I took many cool showers. The first day the safe would not work. The 2nd day the tub stopped up and I took a shower ankle deep in water. Thankfully the maintenance  men were quick to fix the problem in the same day. Elevators are extremely slow. They worked on them constantly while we were there. Check in was slow. They seemed unprepared for the spring break rush. The pool had a bar but it never opened the whole week we were

Summary Heading: I am very upset by the custodian.
Summary: Very rude janitorial service. Unfortunately one Juan Francisco Avalos was impertinent & rude. I will not stay here again. I enjoyed the hotel but one particular janitor ruined my trip.

Stayed at the Paradise Pier March 9-12, 2011 and was very impressed. (Got a great rate through Travelocity.) The room was very clean and updated: flat screen TV, new carpet and bed linens with a view of California Adventure. The hotel's location can't be beat both parks and DT Disney are just a short walk away. The room definitely looks better in person. The maids did an awesome job - nothing like coming home to a clean room after a looong day at the parks. Pros: Location, Comfortable rooms, Cleanliness,  Friendly professional staff  Cons: Expensive  Would definitely stay here again for the right price.

Summary Heading: So impressed with hotel, service and staff
Summary: Review  I wanted to take my 17yr old daughter and her three friends to Disney. Called around and the only hotel I could find close by Disney was paradise pier. I had not stayed here before and the only room they had available was a standard room w two queen beds with concierge service. I had no idea what that entailed, but I booked it. the price was a bit steep by my standards with tax it was around $330. The day before our arrival I called to see if anyone had cancelled at any of the Disney hotels or if there were any better deals. There were not. Unbeknownst to me, when I checked in the next day, we had been upgraded to a 1bedroom suite.  that meant all four girls could have their own room. I got the front room with a fabulous & comfy couch,tv, my own bathroom and a dinning

First of all, let me say that I came in knowing I was paying for the Disney experience.  After waiting my entire life (I'm 25, hahah...) to stay in a Disneyland Resort hotel, I finally got to.  I'm fully aware I could get a similar room at another hotel in the area for less.  However, given the fact that my family has always wanted to try a Disneyland Resort hotel, but still wanted to spend a reasonable amount of money, we chose Paradise Pier.  I read a lot of reviews of the three hotels here on TA, looked at pictures, read about the hotels on allears.net... and we decided Paradise Pier (PP) was our best bet.  I got a good deal with my annual pass ($174 per night, for Friday and Saturday nights), and it could've been around $150 if I had stayed during the week.  Yes, more

We stayed here because of an off season special. This was our first time staying at a Disney property and wow. It was like we never left the park. Our room was ready a little late because they had to wait for Mickey to come up and visit to leave a basket and note for one of our children who was having a birthday. The staff was wonderful. We had gotten the concierge package which was wonderful. They even made a special to order breakfast when one of our kids ended up with a tooth issue.  The restaurant is a really good, and quiet spot. We eat at the resaurant even when we are not staying at the hotel. The food is good, not expensive and the staff is great.

Arrived and the "Cast Members" were great. Room was ready and clean. Larger feeling than the Californian. Two problems, 1- shower head leaked, no water pressure, I beleive in saving water but this was crazy, 2- AC was very loud. Our biggest problem was Friday night, after seeing the shows in Disneyland, we had rented a stroller for our 4 year old daughter, who had been at the park all day, we had been going through California Adventure using the stroller, but this night I was advised that the park was closed (10PM) and it wasn't that far of a walk through Downtown Disney. When I explained that my daughter was sleeping and I had stuff to carry back to the hotel, she said that's what happens when the park closes. When we got to Downtown I had to give stroller back and caryy my

We just returned from the Paradise Pier and I honestly can't say enough how great our stay was. We were celebrating our anniversary and from the minute we arrived Donnie at the front desk went above and beyond to make sure our stay was extra special. From balloons and pins on arrival to a specially reserved and decorated table in the beachcombers lounge saved just for us. It made our anniversary that more special and I am forever grateful.  The rooms were clean and the bed and pillows were super comfy and it was literally half the price per night as The Grand Californian! A superb staff, a great place to stay and you're not going to go broke doing it. I'm already wanting to go back!

Summary Heading: Our second time at Paradise Pier; loved it!
Summary: The room was ready for us when we arrived. It was very clean, including the bathroom. Room service was excellant.

No microwaves in the bedrooms, which is lame when the food in the hotel and Disneyland  is not very good and overly priced.  Pool area was dirty, overly crowded, and no snack bar was open...or if it was, there were no snacks. The lifeguards were not supervising rude kids that jumping on my kids and kicking them in the face. However, my son LOVED the water slide. Elevators took forever and there was no staircase to get to the other floors. Disneyland hotel is much better if you are going to pay the price. Otherwise, I will stick with the good neighbor hotels. At least they have microwave ovens and some have small kitchens.

Spent 5 nights at the paradise pier hotel and have nothing but positive things to say about it. The staff were super friendly and went out of their way to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.  We were luckily enough to be upgraded to a park view room overlooking the Disney California adventure park at no extra cost.  The beds were extremely comfortable and the daily turn down service was a nice touch.   I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future.

Summary Heading: Nice Value, compared to The Disney and The Grand. I've stayed at all of them.
Summary: OK.. I am finally getting around to writing some reviews from trips I took a while ago. For the record I have stayed at all 3 Disney Resorts. Disney and The Grand California multiple times, but this review is about our first stay at the Paradise Pier, for a weekend vistit in July of last year. I have always wanted to give this hotel a whirl since it was the only of the three I hadn't tried yet. I have a lot to share, I'm going to give details from my own perspective as well as what I think the majority of Disney visitors might want to know. I will try to be as helpful as possible as I know so many people anguish over these 3 resort properties and how to decide which one is right for your family.  This hotel is situated across the street from The Grand Californian. The Grand has

We stayed here for two of our 5 nights at Disneyland.  We booked via a special we recieved online and we upgraded to the concierge level and resort view.  All in all, we loved this hotel.  We have stayed on site at the Grand Californian twice before but this was our first stay at Paradise Pier.  The rooms were really clean and comfy.  I loved the shampoo and conditioner bottles with the little Mickey shaped lids...very nice touch.  The service for us was outstanding and such a nice change from our first three nights at the Sheraton (I also reviewed that hotel as well).  The concierge level provided a good breakfast and light dinner...my husband was surprised that there was not an option for oatmeal but the cereals, fruit, bagels, juice, sweet rolls were quite nice.   There is a

Stayed here prior to Christmas in lieu of the Villas at Grand Californian as t hey were all booked. Excellent service from the front desk and bell staff, housekeeping and room service also. Even the maintenance crew I encountered was very friendly and pleasant.   The room was nice and had a pool view. Very well outfitted with amenities. The thermostat and HVAC system worked very well, always toasty when we needed those cold, rainy days. The beds are incredible, slept like a happy baby.  We ordered breakfast in the room as is our habit when traveling, and DL dining didn't disappoint however, we noticed that the bananas Foster was served in plastic cups where DL hotel serves it in stainless steel. Obviously not a big deal, just a small detail.  Parking was very convenient in the

Great stay at the Paradise Pier. Ive been to Disneyland many, many times since the 60's but have never stayed on property before. I will return to this place. We stayed on the concierge level in a cabana room which had a patio that faced the pool very nice. Went around Dec 13/2010 very warm temps so we did use the pool and slide. The slide does not exit into the pool which was kind of a bummer. The room was great and I talked to some other folks who were locals that regularly stay here during the holidays. They told me the rooms here were actually larger than the Grand Californian at one quarter of the price for concierge level. The food and snacks in the private concierge level were plentiful and great. The staff here did a great job and even encouraged us to grab six packs of

Summary Heading: Renovation Required - Retro 80s feel is because it was last renovated in the 80s
Summary: The are good things about Paradise Pier - location and the kid friendly swimming pool.  Almost everything else is past its prime - the hotel's decor resembled the furnishing in the basement of my parents: not touched since the 1980s.  The restaurants in the hotel are sub-par with mostly food prepared via microwave or fryer - after a long flight to get to Anaheim, I was looking for a good dining experience: the restaurant staff were friendly but the food was such a disappointment (kraft dinners would be a comparison).  The rooms are small - we chose to pay extra to get on the concierge floor with better rooms. The food provided by the concierge lounge is really sub-standard (worse than Kraft dinner - there is free beer which many parents drink and probably allow them to forget

I have stayed in many of the good neighbor hotel and have never minded the commute to the park but travelling with a 1 1/2 year old this time we decided to stay in one of the resort hotels to make nap time easier. I don't think I can ever go back to another hotel.  The staff was incredible, the rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable (although after a long day in Disney anything would be comfortable haha), and I can't say it enough the staff was incredible.  The walk to the park through Downtown Disney was quick and the private entrance through the Grand Californian was fantastic!  We chose it because it was the cheapest of the Disney hotels so we weren't expecting much and we were blown away.  I recommend it to everyone now! Oh and the rooms were very large.  I stay in

The pp was awesome. We found the accessibiity to both parks close, easy (through the Grand) and could not fault this place at all. The beds were big, comfy and the pillows amazing. The room was immaculate, well decked out and spacious enough to spread out your stuff. We spent most of our waking time in the parks or in the hotel pool. We loved this hotel and would stay there again if we are ever fortunate enough to return to Disneyland.  We loved the fact that If you stay at the resort you get special passes into attractions such as Aladin(VIP seating), toontown and early morning entry into the park.... Well worth it. The. Free pin and lanyard was great as the kids got into pin collecting.    Make sure you find out all the short cuts into the parks too!!!!

Summary Heading: PERFECT FOR ALL FAMILIES VISITING DISNEYLAND
Summary: This was our first stay at Paradise Pier,  you cant beat the location, yes its a little further walk than Disneyland Hotel and The Grand Californian, but its nothing to winge about. We had a very spacious room overlooking California Adventure Park, we looked straight over to Paradise pier with a clear view of WORLD OF COLOR every night (you can put the music on the tv and get the real atmoshpere)  so its very worth it to pay extra for a park view.  Just up the street is a Coco's reasturant, this saved us a fortune for breakfast each day rather than paying the big bucks in the hotels/downtown disney, $30 for 3 of us!!!  but i do recommend if you have kids doing the Surfs Up breakfast buffet at the PP at least once, dining with the characters is so much fun! Staff are great,  pool

My husband, two children and I had the horrible experience of staying at The Paradise Pier.  First let me start with the good things.  The staff allowed us to check in early, and stored our luggage while we went to Disneyland. It was such a nice feature.  Ok, that was the good part. After spending most of the day at the park we walked backed to the Hotel, ITS A LONG WALK with two sleepy kids after a day in the park.  We wanted to get settled into our room, get the little ones a snack and walk back to the park to watch Fantasia.  When we first walked into our room I was a little disappointed in the cheap out dated decor.  After being in the room for a few minutes we noticed food all over the floor.  Our one year old managed to find peanuts and was lifting it to his mouth when I

We were able to get a discount for this hotel through my daughter's dance school, which made it well worth the price.  I would have been upset if I had paid the $300 per night that I have seen on some sites.  The rooms were very spacious.  We had 3 adults, a child and a toddler.  The best part for me was the true day bed rather than a sofa bed for our daughter, and every room comes with a Pack n Play crib.  The pool was small but heated, so a nice break, even in a Fall trip.  As long as we had the discounted rate, I would definitely stay there again.

We have stayed at the PPH a few times before and had good stays - our rooms were comfortable and clean.  In previous visits we have mentioned that we were celebrating a special occasion and once we were greeted at check in with special balloons and autographed character picture - when we stayed there in July and stated several times we were celebrating a birthday there was no acknowledgement by the hotel.  So, we were not expecting any different when we stayed in October to celebrate my daughter's Sweet 16 and to attend the Mickey Halloween Party.  We like the PPH because of the room size (Mom, Dad and 3 teenagers) the ease of unloading our luggage from our motor home, the pool area is not over crowded, and we can usually find a good rate for a standard room.  When my husband

Summary Heading: Wonderful! A perfect start to my vaction in the USA.
Summary: This was the first hotel I stayed in during my three week USA vaction - and it was also the most relaxing hotel.  The room that I stayed in was very clean and spacious, and the room service (in-room dining) was very prompt.  The one thing I remember the most, was the excellent customer service at the front desk. As I checked in, I was welcomed by a very friendly and helpful lady (unfortunately I do not recall her name), who provided all the information I could need about the hotel and the 2 theme parks.   I will definetely be staying here again!

The location is fine- very close to the Grand California Hotel, California Adventure and Downtown Disney. Very few elevators for so many rooms, so the wait can be long. Attended a convention based in the hotel-this worked out well and the hotel provided refreshments for morning and afternoon breaks. The major drawback is the restaurant situation. PCH is buffet, which we do not care for. The first day we went for breakfast in the lounge- it was terrible. Food was greasy and served in plastic containers. Of course the entire park is full of terrible restaurants, terrible food and prices that are astronomical to say the least. The beds were very high off the floor and the lighting was minimal.

We were so glad we stayed in this Disney property.  The walk to the parks was not bad at all, and we enjoyed being close to Downtown Disney.  The room was spacious and clean, with lots of closet space for our suitcases.  The bathroom was roomy and clean.  The sofa converted to a day bed, which worked great for our third child.  Each evening "Mickey" did something fun to our room: leaving balloons, coloring pages, chocolates, and fun arrangements of the dolls.  Our birthday girl was made to feel extra special.  All the staff were friendly.  We had a fun time at the Surf's Up character meal.  We ate midweek, at 10:50, and there were barely any other diners at that time.  My girls loved the attention of the characters.  The food was good, and there was a great variety.  The gift

Great value,very  clean and friendly, good house keeping , and special perks(for little children), pool looks better than  photos on the Hotels site, location is fantastic, just around the corner from downtown disney and not much further than the other two disney hotels elevators are a bit slow but it's not a big deal, just an extra minute or two. would stay there again.

I stayed at this hotel to celebrate my mom's 75th birthday. I traveled with my oldest daughter and two of my grandkids. I also traveled with my youngest daughter. When we arrived at the hotel it was too early to check-in but we were greeted warmly and the kids received pins and  balloons. While we waited for the room to be ready the kids watched Disney movies in a beach themed theatre. Our rooms were ready in about an hour and my daughter and I got connecting rooms. The rooms were spacious and included two double beds and a pull out couch, dressers, a big tv, a coffeemaker and a refrigerator. The beds were super comfortable and our room overlooked the rooftop pool. The hotel had a nice restaurant with reasonable prices and a snack bar that was open late. They also had an arcade,

Summary Heading: Location and concierge package is great...service and cleanliness not spot on.
Summary: I signed up for the Paradise Pier concierge package and thought that we would be getting A+ service, treatment, and personalized professionalism.  But it lacked it all; including a concierge who could speech English as their first language.   Our room was not clean, our service was not great, for first timers they neglected to tell us were to go and how to get there.  I am not sure how they could change.

We chose the Paradise Pier for this visit to Disneyland because we wanted to experience a Disney hotel and be close to the parks while also staying within a budget. The offer we got for this hotel was better than the Grand Californian by a few hundred dollars, so we decided to check it out.   On the positive side, the check-in process was smooth, and all of the employees were very pleasant. Our room was cheery and clean, and the beds were quite comfortable. We were fortunate enough to have a view of California Adventure, which is lovely at night when the lights are all on. Chocolates were left on our beds each night, although on the last night, they somehow missed one of the beds. It was generally quiet - we only heard noise when people were walking and talking in the hallway.

My husband and I just spent 3 days at Disney Land and Paradise Pier Hotel (October 9-10-11)  We had a fabulous time.  From the moment we checked in (quickly and efficiently) we were wished a Happy 40th anniversary and presented with big red  Happy Anniversary buttons !!!  Our room (1207) was cool, clean and comfortable.  We never heard a sound from other guests at night...  Sunday we went to the character buffet breakfast at the PCH grill....it was delicious and we enjoyed seeing Mickey, Minnie, Daily, Pluto and (my fave) Stitch "up close and personal".  When we were seated we were presented with an anniversary card that all the characters signed for us. Again, all the cast members wished us a Happy Anniversary.  All in all, it was a great way to celebrate this milestone in our

They didn't give us the bed we wanted.  We reserved King bed and when we checked in they said we know you asked for a King but we don't have any more.  I had booked way in advance and it was our anniversary.  They just didn't seem to care.  There's lots of construction going on around the Paradise Pier and you can hear it all through the night.  Also, our safe didn't work in the room.  Bad customer service.  In the past I have gone here and the customer service was really good but this time I was very disappointed.  The Guest Services desk clerk kept us waiting for over ten minutes while he dealt with someone on the phone.  Then right in the middle of helping us, the phone rang and he assisted the caller and continued to ignore us.  When we inquired about tickets for the

Summary Heading: This was shoebox of a room for $258
Summary: Wanted a king bed room and got that in a twin sized room. Room had one chair so one of us had to sit on the bed to eat our room service breakfast. I had called them and was assured they would send up another chair while we were at the park. Well of course when we returned, no additional chair. The ac was abysmal, I had to manually move the louvers on the vent to get air to where we were in the room, they were pointing to the wall. This was a fairly new hotel and not cleaned well at all. We were taking it easy so it bothered us that they were remodeling below us. Never again will I do the "stay at the park bit".

As a cast member in europe we were lucky enough to get a good rate on this hotel. It is a fantastic place to stay with all the magic you expect from a Disney hotel, incredible service and cool views over California Adventure. Watched the amazing fireworks from the hotel balcony which even plays the same music that is played in the park so you get the same effect of the fireworks as if you were in the park.

This was the first time we stayed at Paradise Pier at the Disneyland resort.  I've read many reviews and was not really sure if I should book a room for our annual visit to Disneyland.  I had absolutely no regrets in choosing this hotel.  Paradise Pier hotel isn't as large as the Grand Californian or the Disneyland Hotel.  I've stayed at the Grand Californian and the big difference in terms of service is that Paradise Pier seem more personable because it's smaller than the other two hotels.    We arrived Sunday morning and we stood in line to register during check out time.  We spoke to Rich and he was FANTASTIC!  We booked a hotel room with a view of park and he put us in the 11th floor.  Rich didn't rush despite being very busy and he was extremely professional, thorough,

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier was great and met our needs!
Summary: Paradise Pier was a great hotel that met our needs.  It was an easy walk through the Grand Californian Hotel to Disneyland and the California Adventure Park.  We reallly enjoyed the pool and waterslide each afternoon.  I would prefer the Grand but this hotel is definitely worth it for the price.

Summary Heading: Really nice and worth every penny
Summary: We stayed at Paradise Pier about a month ago and it was better than expected. We were supposed to stay at Disneyland Hotel, but they called us 2 days before we left and said we overbooked so you have to move to Paradise Pier. We were expecting it not to be great because its the "cheap" hotel at Disneyland. We loved it though!!! I hadn't been there since 1990 and it was my daughter's first time who is 13 first time, we always go to Disney World, but we did Disneyland this time and we liked it better!!! Anyway they upgraded us to a theme park view (which was AMAZING) plus you watch the world of color show! They also gave us $200 in character dining at Goofy's Kitchen because of the move. They also said we would get dream fastpass' but they didn't give them to us, which was

We just came back from a week in Disneyland - the kids' first time.  We were determined to stay in the park and it was worth every penny.  We got connecting rooms and were surprised at how big the rooms were. The rooms were incredibly quiet (even though we were right beside the elevator), and the beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in.  I have never slept so well in a hotel.  Yes, the hotel could use a bit of updating but overall it was fantastic and good value for what we paid.

Summary Heading: Did not live up to my expectations -- will most likely stay elsewhere next time
Summary: We're annual passholders, so we paid a discounted rate of $154, and upgraded to concierge level for an additional $71. However, I discovered the concierge fee varies depending on when you stay, and it doesn't matter how many people are in your party.  For example, one night the room only will be $250 with the concierge level an additional $100, and then another night the room will be $315 with the concierge only $35 more. But, you're still paying $350 total for either night. So, if your travel dates aren't flexible, it can be worth spending the extra $$.  Was concierge level worth it for us? For what we paid, just barely. We were able to have breakfast there (no doughnuts, though -- muffins, bagels, fruit danish, cereal), but our 2-year-old wasn't really interested in the

Summary Heading: Great stay during my long weekend.
Summary: I came to Disneyland with my two sisters for a long weekend getaway.  We chose Paradise Pier Hotel because we were short on time and needed something very close to the Parks. Paradise Pier was the least expensive of the three.  We got in late and checked in after 10pm. Being a family hotel, front desk was quiet but it still took time to check in because getting all the keys, pamphets and brochures was quite an intensive process. There were just so much stuff.  We didn't eat so we ordered room service. The food was excellent and service was courteous and prompt. The rooms were a bit smaller than what I had expected. The gym on the other hand was a good size.   Things in the room are starting to look slightly dated
awesome hotel! great for big family's, close to Disneyland and California adventure

Summary Heading: This is a hotel that is does the job, but at an exorbitant rate that you would expect more.
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel during the week of our four year wedding anniversary.  I must say that while I liked the efficient, yet not overly friendly staff, this hotel was a let down for $250 per night.  Yes, you pay more for a hotel on Disneyland property, but we were expecting this hotel to "celebrate" our anniversary with us.  I was reading people got chocolates on their pillows every day and unexpected goodie bags commemorating life's celebrations, i.e. A birthday or anniversary.  We received neither the chocolates nor the goodie bag, even though we specifically told the Walt Disney Travel Company when they came out and asked us if we were celebrating something. I find this a redundant question if nothing was done for us. We were anticipating to come

My mom and I stayed here in Aug '10.  We've stayed at the other 2 DLR hotels, and decided (relunctanly) to stay here for this trip based on a recommendation from a  family member.  When I was growing up, this was the Pan Pacific, and we had heard that the rooms were very small.  We got a room on the 3rd floor, not the "park view" room, but we still had a view of Paradise Pier...we were too low for the best view, but it was still good!  The room was large...at LEAST as large as the other two hotels!  The blackout curtains were the best I've seen.  I am a very light sleeper, and I always wake up from street noise or other guests, but even though we were right above the street and near the elevator on the same floor as the pool...it was so quiet!  I slept like a rock!  The staff

Summary Heading: Can't wait to stay there again!!
Summary: I stayed here for 5 days on a Mom and Son trip. I am so glad we chose the Paradise Pier! The staff was always courteous and dependable, rooms were neat and clean, atmosphere is great for the young and old alike, and all just a short 7-10 min walk from Disneyland or California Adventure! We had the opportunity to dine with the characters at PCH Grill and enjoyed it. Mickey, Minnie, Max, Daisy, and Stitch joined us and took time at every table. My son enjoyed the "surfing lessons" with Stitch :-) If you are looking for a casual hotel the whole family will enjoy, this is it!

After going to Disneyland several times we decided to splurge and stay at Disney's Paradise Pier and we weren't disappointed.  Check in was smooth but it does require some patience because every "group" is given extensive information about the hotel and the park.  This is a nice added touch compared to the typical "here are your keys, enjoy your stay". We were given the honor of being the Big Kahuna Family of the day and were given a room upgrade to a room that overlooked the roller coaster in California Adventure.  We were able to watch World of Color from our room (but don't miss the show close up!!).  The walk through the Grand Californian is less than 10 minutes and to the Monorail is a little longer.   The pool while not huge was nice for a swim in the middle of a hot day

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier was a very good hotel
Summary: I stayed here with my wife and two kids (ages 6 and 4) for 5 nights from Aug. 15th to 20th.  We were very pleased right from the start.  There were mickey mouse Rice Krispe Squares and chocolates in our room.  The kids found this great that "Mickey had visited their room!".  Candies were left for them each day when we returned from the park.  The room was spacious with 2 double beds a desk and a couch.  The shower always had good water pressure and lots of hot water.  No problems with hot and cold water even once.  The beds were very comfortable with nice sheets and bed srpeads.  We did have a problem with the safe not opening one night.  Maintenance came up quickly and fixed the problem.  The elevators for the most part were good until checkout, when they were all full from

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier a great Disney property
Summary: My family of 4 recently returned from a 2 night stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel.  Having stayed in the past at both the Grand Californian and Disneyland Hotels, we were very pleased with the Paradise Pier Hotel.  Our check in went smoothly and the room was spotless.  The room size was quite roomy and perfect for our family of 4.  We were in a 2 queen room with a daybed which was excellent, unlike most other hotels where we would have required a rollaway for an additional fee per night.  Being the least expensive of the 3 Disney properties did not diminish in any way the Disney feel of this hotel.  Great service, friendly staff, spotless rooms, cute interiors with many cute Disney lamps, and pictures on the walls.  In addition, even though the hotel was full on our stay we never

We stayed at the Paradise Pier for 2 nights!  What a fantastic hotel!  It all started from the moment we checked in!  All for ready for us to arrive!  Our check in was swift and informative.  It wasa week away from my daughter's birthday and once we told the receptionist this, she was given balloons, badges and a signed photograph of the Disney Princesses!  Then we were informed that we were given an upgrade to a room with a view!  And what a view!!  A fantastic view of California Adventure Park!!  We even watched the show World of Colour from our room! We had opted for the concierge service in our package and have no regrets we did!  It is a wonderful service with only a few other people in the room!  An extremely fresh continental breakfast than snacks all day then wine/beer

Summary Heading: Excellent service, very attentive staff, great restaurant
Summary: Our family thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Paradise Pier. We had adjoining rooms which were spacious and comfortable. Our 4 yr old loved breakfast with the characters, especially Daisy Duck. The characters had wonderful interaction with the children and made sure everyone in the restaurant had plenty of attention and interaction. The adults enjoyed it as well. The food was excellent with great omlettes made to order. Yes, it was a pricey breakfast, but very well worth it considering the entertainment also. We viewed it as a worthy splurge.  The hotel was spotlessly clean. The rooms were made up as soon as we left each morning for the Park. Even when coming back early one day the rooms were done up fresh and neat, always with a treat left for the children. We were impressed how

Summary Heading: Poor Service and we were not taken care of....
Summary: The Paradise Pier was a below average hotel, that had overpriced rooms, with expensive room service.  We had our childs life jacket TAKEN from our room, and the hotel did NOTHING to resolve the issue, like they said they would.  It was close to the parks, but that was it.  Housekeeping was the only positive experience we had. We asked for a park view, they said it shouldn't be an issue, well, didn't get one...Will not recommend this to anyone. Sorry

Summary Heading: Long walk to any local business
Summary: We liked the Paradise Pier, but the problem we had was the distance to any restaurants or stores.  It is secluded and if you aren't willing to pay crazy prices for food, you will find yourself walking a long distance.  For us, it would have been better staying on harbor. Close to restaurants on our way in and out.  Even to buy a small bottle of milk in the gift shop was almost $4.00!  It took over 30 minutes to walk to the closest gas station.  The hotel was nice itself, but took forever to check in!  After a 8 hour car ride, the last thing you want to do is wait 5 hours for your room.  I think off property is just as nice and we will save our money for treats, instead of a disney hotel.

Summary Heading: Large Rooms and great eats, but not a resort experience.
Summary: Having stayed at the Grand California several times and being an annual visitor to Disneyland, we wanted to try something new.  My mom, sister and I were visiting for the Candelight Processional at Christmas time and selected a Double Queen Room with Sofa with Concierge services.  Our stay was for 4 nights.    ROOM Our room was large, plenty big enough for 3 adult women.  The sofa sleeper was an excellent touch and was rather comfortable as a couch and a bed.  Very clean, as always, and had a very open feel (which is hard to do with 3 adult women).  The beds were comfortable and room was rather quiet for the amount of children on the premises.  The bathrooms were great and very user friendly.  CONCIERGE Prior to our trip, it was explained to us that concierge had priority

If you are looking strictly for the convenience of being near the parks, then this hotel will do.  Other than that, I think the rates are absurd for what you get.  Having just come from the Four Seasons in Las Vegas where our room cost about the same amount, this place was a huge disappointment.  Upon entering the room (1406), we found a dirty bathroom floor complete with pubic hair, a dirty mirror and vanity.  Also dirty prints on the back of the door that resembled blood.  We also found hair... a lot of hair in one of our beds.  Additionally, the bottom drawer of the dresser would not stay closed and was a real hazard as it was wide open at floor level unless we propped something up against it.  The safe was also broken.  We called to complain about the dirty room, drawer and

We stayed here in July 2010.   The hotel was very nice and clean, and the rooms are larger than comparable Disney properties in Orlando at DisneyWorld.  The hotel is within easy walking distance of Downtown Disney and California Adventures, and a very short monorail ride to Disneyland.  We were very happy with our visit and it certainly met our expectations.

Summary Heading: Good hotel - very convenient and worth the extra money
Summary: We stayed at the Paradse Pier for 7 nights, spending 5 days in the Disney Parks, and had a great holiday.  The room was good, lots of space, very clean and very quiet.  My only thought was that it was not as 'Disney' as I expected - other than the Mickey Mouse lamp, we could have been in any hotel room (but not an issue for us).  During our stay, the staff dressed our kids many bedtime cuddlies up in Mickey Mouse hats and laid out balloons, colouring gifts etc - very nice touch.   The biggest plus for us was the convenience.  Only a 5 to 10 minute easy walk to the parks (through the Grand California) , which meant that getting in early and leaving for breaks was so easy.  The benefit of 3 early entries was also great.  As mentioned in a previous review, you need to get there as

Summary Heading: Great Hotel but elevators a major issue
Summary: The Paradise Pier is a great hotel except for the elevator issues.  Between 7am and 9am we always had to wait for at least three elevators to get to the lobby.  When the hotel is full, it is a real issue. The hotel is otherwise great.  Service and the rooms are nice.  We had a park view room which was great to watch the world or color show.  Room service was fast and delicious.  Really close to the park, which makes it great for the little ones.

The value of this hotel is for the accessibility of the Parks at a very reasonable price without the major frills!   1) 3 Early Days in the Parks; 2) Back door access to both parks (Disneyland via monorail);  3) Free readily accessible parking.  With these three things you will spend more time having fun, rather then standing in a long line:-D  If you want to upscale it pay the extra money to stay at the other Disney Resorts.

Summary Heading: Loved it and would stay again!
Summary: We arrived after the long Brisbane to LA haul and our room was ready at 10am when we checked in.... greatly appreciated by our tired family.  Reservation staff very helpful and the complimentary "Mickey Mouse biscuits" were a great surprise.  I was expecting "Disney kitsch" but I was taken away in the magic of the hotel. The concierge was so helpful and we bought our tickets to the park from him and he gave us "fast pass" tickets that made our 1 day / 2 park experience wonderful. The room was great - excellent view over DCA Park, however the aircond was loud.  Short walk to Disney and Downtown.

Summary Heading: Poor, very poor expected much more from Disney
Summary: My 4yo daughter has been wanting to see Mickey for ages and on a recent stop over in LA (originally from the UK now in Australia), we decided to take her and stay on the resort. After traveling around the world this has to be one of the worst hotels I've stayed in. Tired, over priced and generally unpleasant, the only saving grace was the lovely woman on reception. Who wants to pay $29 for breakfast, even if it's 'all you can eat'..? The cafe food was also shocking... I stayed here after reading the reviews on trip advisor, I now have to question the people writing the reviews and look at why our stay was so poor...? We were given a disabled room, it was shabby at best and the decor needs to be revamped if you continue to charge these prices...  As for Disneyland, if you have

Summary Heading: Great Stay, Excellent Service, Fantastic Location
Summary: We stayed at Paradise Pier Hotel the last week of April during the slow season at Disneyland.  We chose PPH because of its location to the parks and because of the price.  Because the price was low, we upgraded to the "concierge level" for our stay.   I wanted to write this review to include some of the things that I was looking for when reading reviews myself that I had trouble finding.  I had many questions of whether or not the concierge upgrade was worth it or not. (About an additional 475 dollars for 5 nights)  In my opinion it was. It was not quite what I was expecting, but still worth it.  We mostly chose to upgrade because of the free breakfast, snacks, drinks, and nightly selections.  I have two very picky eaters that are 4 and 2.  We felt that it would be nice to have

Summary Heading: Another Great Stay at the Pier
Summary: We are Annual Passholders and have stayed a lot of places in and around Disneyland and we will always prefer the Pier. First of all when you stay on site, you never leave Disney and there is something to say for that. The walk to and from the parks is wonderful..it's nice to hear all the live entertainment and look through the shops..you can smell all the food and it's so nice! When you stay at the Tropicana or on Harbour you pass the homeless people and all the smokers waiting at the bus stop...Idk...I prefer the Pier. You have a pretty good shot of getting an upgrade if you ask. We've stayed 8 times and 6 of them had been upgraded. We stayed June 11-16 and saw World Of Color 3x a night from our room. It was awesome! We have older kids (15,12,9) so they don't use the movie room

Summary Heading: good Disney hotel but missing all the other Disney experience
Summary: It's the cheapest option among all the three Disneyland hotels and it's all the farthest from the Disney parks. There's still easy access to the parks and Downtown Disney and they're all within walking distance.   Rooms were spacious and clean. I really liked it. But what is up with the pillows? They're so thin, you don't even feel it. AC was very cold though and it's hard to turn it to warm without turning it off. Elevators are quite ancient though and take so long to go down or up. There are restaurants but quite expensive. Although Downtown Disney is not far, where you can buy food.   Overall, enjoyed our stay there. Want to try other Disney hotels but too expensive. Paradise Pier is cheaper but still makes you feel part of the Disneyland Resort and experience.

Summary Heading: Disney Paradise Pier Hotel is Worth the Money
Summary: We traveled with my six year old son.  So any type of walk is a long walk for us.  Paradise Pier is about fifteen minute walk to the Monorail station that takes us into the Disneyland's Tommorrow Land.  It is about ten minute walk to the side entrance of California Adventure.  For either Disneyland or California Adventure, we crossed the street and walked through the lobby of the Grand Californian Hotel.  As far as location, I think only the Grand Californian hotel has a better location.  Even if you stay at the Grand Californian or the Disneyland Hotel, you would have to walk to the Monorail station located at Downtown Disney.  I guess originally, there was a Monorail station located inside the Disneyland Hotel.  I asked the hotel staff several times, and they said the only

Stayed here with 2 young kids for first trip to Disneyland.  The location cannot be beat (well, maybe the Grand Californian, but by a few hundred yards) and the rooms are fine.    We arrived early morning, room not ready but Bell Services held our luggage.  Went to the parks, came back around 4 pm to swim.  The pool is very nice....crowded, but it is about 3 ft on one end and 6 ft on the other.  They provide life vests for little ones, there is a separate baby pool and a slide that I could not get my 5 and 8 year olds off of......Really, after 20 trips down that slide, I had to drag them inside.  Towels are provided at the pool.  Beds were nice.  The couch/bed is nice too, but you have to figure out how to do it....you push the top and bottom cushions at the same time and it

We stayed at the Paradise Pier May 30-June 4, 2010.  It was the best stay ever!  When we arrived we were chosen as the Big Kahuna family of the day, Our grandson received balloons, because it was his first trip.  We got pictures taken in front of the Goofy statue, and best of all we were upgraded to a park view room with turn down service every night.  Everyone in the hotel was super friendly and our housekeeper was great!  She kept everything spic and span.  It wasn't too far from Disneyland, and we found the short cut through the Grand Californian was great when we were tired.  The water slide was a ball.  The lifeguards were friendly and made our non-swimmer feel very safe on the slide.  Over all a fabulous trip!

We spent two nights mid week, off-season.  We arrived a day early and couldn't find a phone number for the hotel in the AAA book or our booking information so we stayed at another hotel for one night, unusual.  Once there they could check us in that morning which was very convenient, but it was mid-week and off-season. The free wi-fi worked, the fitness center is better than average and the pool was warm and un-crowded in the morning, but no free breakfast.  In addition there is a $13 ‘resort fee’ which covers parking, why it’s not part of the quoted price I don’t know.  The obvious advantage is the location/connection with the Disney parks.  Charge everything to the room, reservations at restaurants and early entry on select days (we did 4 main rides in an hour!)

My boyfriend and I recently stayed here for his birthday. I would highly recommend it to anyone. We did not have any bad experiences for the week we were there. Everyone was very willing to help us out. They made everything easy... such as getting back to the airport and booking our day trip to Universal Studios.  They also left chocolates on our bed everyday. They left us Mickey Mouse rice crispy squares for my boyfriends birthday. Along with a birthday card.  Very satisfied.
great beds and really fluffy pillows. rooms quite and clean. bright lobby with friendly staff. character breakfast yummy and fun. easy walk to both parks.

We do Disneyland every other year, but this was the first time we stayed at a Disney property.  I have to say, I'm spoiled now, I don't know if I'll ever go back to staying offsite!  It was great being surrounded by all things Disney for our 4 day, 3 night vacation!  This hotel is nice and has just the right amount of Disney touches to make it feel special.  We had a pool view room, which was nice, but a family member who we were traveling with lucked out with a park view room which was a little bigger than ours and had an amazing view of DCA.  The beds were very comfortable and the rooms also had a portacrib in the closet and a pull-out sofa bed with extra linens in the closet.  There was a tiny fridge in the cabinet next to the TV that we didn't discover until our second night

An excellent hotel.  Good location, just across the street from the Grand Californian which is overpriced.  Great friendly service.  Dealt with a noise issue in the room next to ours immediately and fulfilled every request with a smile.  Room was clean and had a great view of California Park which we didin't even pay for.  Also they accommodated a low floor request with no problems.  Would definately stay here again!

While Paradise Pier is a comfortable hotel, if you are looking for the Disney Expeirence...stay at one of the other resorts! The beds were very comfortable. While the rooms were small they worked fine for as little time as we spent.  Elevators are very slow and crowded....we waited for 6 (already full elevators) to finally get in one to go down to the parks one morning.    Tha water slide is great! The pools are warmer than at the other 2 resort hotels. Nice size, nothing fancy or themed about the pool. Wheelchair access is by a long long ramp that wraps around the pool area.   From certain areas of the hotel you have a wonderful view. It is a very clean hotel with friendly staff. The store has limited items (unlike the Disneyland hotel stores) but is well stocked.   They do

Summary Heading: To much money for the quality of 3 stars
Summary: Elevators are terrible, we wait and wait every day, to far from park better to stay acrros the maingate, service poor, I felt bad to pay that kind of money to receive so little. I went on a Disney Cruise and that was really good, also stay in Disney in Orlando but Paradise Pier dont desrve to be a Disney's hotel.

We stayed in mid Jan 2010 to celebrate my sons birthday.  We actually booked Surf's Up with Mickey and Friends breakfast, and find out that it was inside this hotel.  For convenience we checked out prices and got a pretty good deal ($140 p/night), since usually this hotel is about high 100's to low $200.  The hotel itself is nice, but the rooms are really no frills.  The TV is older, and so is the decor (although it is Disney themed).  We ordered Room Service one night and ordered a Treasure cake (which was more like a cold brownie w/colorful swirled gel to fancy it up-cost...about $20).  Room service was ok, the food was good but a little on the cold side.  One perk of being a Disney guest is you get to walk thru Grand Califorinan Hotel and enter to the park.  You also can

Summary Heading: I Didn't Expect to Love It, but I Did!
Summary: My husband had a day of business which was tacked onto the end of our Southern CA vacation. Since we had to be out of our condo by 10;00am on Wed. and his meeting was Thurs morning, we wondered what to do for Wed. I happened to find a great last minute rate on a travel website for Paradise Pier so we thought, "Why not?" and went. I had no real expectations of the hotel. We had stayed at the Disneyland Hotel several years ago and found it nice, not plush, but fun with cute decor. All I knew about Paradise Pier was that  it's close to Disneyland and considered their lower scale hotel, as compared to the Disneyland and the Grand. It was hard to do much research for a last minute reservation on a Blackberry.  We arrived at the desk at 9:30 in the morning. We were not expecting to be

What a nice hotel.  Not as fancy as the other 2 disney hotels but franly how much time do you spend in your room when you are at disneyland? Very clean, always nice help, fun pool, housekeepings turn down service was good  and they always left something in the room. Only one place to eat in the hotel and only open breakfast and dinner.  Better priced than disneyland and certainly tasted better.  Ordered room service one morning and it was pretty bad for 20.00 for one breakfast.  Food was dry and not warm.  I wouldn't recommend nor did we order more than once.  Great location with wonderful views of the park.  I would stay again!

Staying at this hotel was so much better than staying off-site!  It was no more than a 15 minute walk to the main gates of Disneyland through Downtown Disney (and this is with two kids age 5 and 2!); faster still if you go through Grand California Hotel to California Adventure or ride the monorail in to Tomorrowland.  I understand this hotel is normally on the expensive side but with a promotion we received 2 nights free with the purchase of 3 nights, this deal was cheaper than booking the Howard Johnson Hotel (on S. Harbor Blvd).    My family and I were thrilled to stay at a Disney property and Paradise Pier Hotel did not disappoint us.  The room was clean, comfortable and roomy.  Staff were very friendly and helful.  The only minor annoyances we had included the slow elevators

One of the great things about this site is that you are made aware of things to look out for, hopefully before you book a trip. Some of the recurring themes about Paradise Pier included: soiled linens; bad/rude service; bugs; lack of hot water/water pressure; slow elevators. With that said, the only one of those I can confirm are the slow elevators. My family and I stayed at PP for three nights during Spring Break. We new there would be lots of folks at the hotel and at the parks, but we booked anyway. Indeed, there were plenty of people. With that said, the hotel really shined! Smiling faces on the staff, bending over backwards to help..typical of any Disney employee. In fact, noticing that the elevators were indeed slow at check-in, an observant cast member guided my family on

Summary Heading: Wow, I guess the moral is don't go anywhere without your ID?
Summary: I can't believe how I was treated at the front desk of the Paradise Pier this morning.  It was only 5:30 and after finding that my room key didn't work to access the fitness room I went to get it activated.  I'd only left my room with my room key and my phone, I didn't think it would be a problem.  A single cast member was present (I'll leave her nameless).  I presented my key and explained that I didn't have access to the fitness room and asked if I could get access.  She asked for my ID which I didn't have with me.  She ended our conversation with, "I'm sorry, I'd need your ID."  This cast member never asked for my room number to check my account (which she would've seen was prepaid for 4 days).  Had I not paid for the right to have access to the fitness room? What were they

The one thing you can always say about Disney hotels is that they think of everything. This particular hotel seems to be aging and I think could use some updating. For how much they charge to stay, I really would have liked to have seen the best of the best. I know it's worth paying more to be in Disney and have quick and easy access to their parks, I just think it's time for them to update this hotel and the Disneyland Hotel. The Grand Californian (which we walked through each day to get to California Adventure) is obviously top-notch, but it is beyond expensive. All that said, we would stay there again. Like I mentioned, Disney thinks of everything, and the staff are always so helpful, friendly and accommodating. We opted to get the concierge service seeing as we have three

We stayed at the Paradise Pier hotel at  the concierge level. It could not have been better. We got to the hotel early and were just going to drop off our bags and as we were checking in they informed us that our room was ready and waiting! It was perfect. Our room faced the park and it looked so great at night with everything lit up. We had a breakfast (bagels, cream cheese, fruit, cereals, yogurts, coffee, tea, hot chocolates) and happy hour afternoon  filled with yummy snacks and drinks daily. They had cheese and crackers, wine, beer, sodas, water, mini sandwiches, sliders, taquitos, chips, salsa, lots of fresh fruit and desserts available every afternoon that you could eat there or take a plate back to your room. They also have DVDs to pick from that you can watch in your

Summary Heading: Great Location, Clean Hotel, But POOR Service from Staff
Summary: I have been to Disney World in Orlando MANY times. The staff in the parks and hotels in Florida are beyond wonderful! So helpful and friendly... Disney Land is another story.   This was my first time to Disney Land, and we chose to stay on property like we do in Orlando. The hotel itself was great. Our room was clean and updated. It was a fairly decent size, as was the bathroom. No complaints there. The best part of this hotel is the LOCATION!!! If you want to be close to Downtown Disney and the Parks, this is the hotel for you. The hotel is right next door to Downtown Disney (literally like a 2 minutes walk). This was great because my family and I ate in the downtown area almost every night! To get to the parks, all you do is walk through a scenic route of Downtown Disney, and

We loved staying at this hotel.  It was easlily walkable to the entrance.  I can't believe anyone would complain it's too far.  In 3 days, we never took the Monoreal.  The beds were extremely comfortable after a long day at the park.  And the service was very polite.  The pool was great because they had a great waterslide that they big kids enjoyed and was also safe for my 4 year old to go on without a life jacket (and he can't swim).  We went and checked out the Disneyland pool because you have access to any of the 3 hotel pools staying there.  We were in ahhh of how cool the Peter Pan themed pool was, but quickly went back to Paradise Pier because their big waterslide you couldn't go on if you couldn't swim.  And Paradise Pier pool wasn't as chaotic.  It was a very peaceful

I have been reading a lot of reviews on this hotel over the past months getting ready for our Spring Break trip.  We went last week (March 10-13) after visiting family.  We arrived around 8 that evening and the Cast member who checked us in was very helpful.  She gave my girls (ages 9 and 13) a bouquet of balloons, their birthday pins, and a card for their birthday.  They were excited!  The "Disney feel" is there, just not IN YOUR FACE as the other hotels might be.  But, it suited us just fine.    Our room was nice and roomy and it was wonderful having a sofa that turned into a twin bed.  Everyone was happy with their sleeping accommodations.  We had a wonderful view of California Adventure on the 8th floor. Overall, our room was nice and comfortable--we weren't in it that long.

Summary Heading: What a joke! Do not support this hotel !! Rude people who don't care !!
Summary: This hotel is rull of rude people who talk over you. They gave me the wrong room, overcharged my card, and had me at the counter for way too long. They do not care about their customers!! After talking to someone over the phone about this, they yelled over me, interrupted me, and didnt let me finish talking. I asked for a supervisor and she was the same way. They will do whatever and say whatever they want to not give unsatisfied customers their money back for TERRIBLE SERVICE. Someone should teach these people some manners, and not to talk like crap to their customers. I have stayed at this hotel many times, but will never stay here again. I will be letting everyone I know to never stay here. Disney Guest Services is nothing but a joke, and should be replaced with people who

Summary Heading: Good Option for Families who Want to be Close to the Parks
Summary: This was our 2nd stay at Paradise Pier, and we'll be back again in the fall.  We had one problem this time around - we found a few blood stains on one of the sheets, pillow, and comforter.  Housekeeping came up and stripped both beds and replaced all bedding, including the pillows.  The stains were definitely gross, but we were pleased with how quickly the hotel remedied the problem.    Pluses of this hotel:  Rooms with great views overlooking Calif. Adventure park.  Makes you feel like you've never left Disneyland.  Good sized rooms.  Enough room for a family of 4 to spread out pretty comfortably.  Reasonable price considering it's a disney resort.  You can also find pretty good deals/rates during the offseason.  We got 5 nights for the price of 3.  Outstanding, engaged staff
It is a beautiful hotel with great park views.  Very clean and the staff couldn't have been any more helpful. Very convienant park entry.  Only downside is cost.

Summary Heading: A Key Component of Our Wonderful Vacation
Summary: My husband and I both went to Disneyland as children, and both recall being green with envy of the people who stayed at the Disney Resort. So when it came time to take our children to Disneyland, it was a chance to make some of our own dreams come true.   Our room was on the 12th floor. We had a great view of California Adventure from our spacious hotel room. The rooms were quiet, airy, and nicely appointed. The windows could be opened to let in cross breeze which was very refreshing. The desk had a trundle table which could be rolled over to the full-sized sofa so we could eat take out meals in comfort.  Our room was very clean. VERY CLEAN. And everyday was cleaned promptly.   During our stay the housekeeping staff were staging protests against the Resort as part of an ongoing
This was an awsome family adventure.  We can't wait to go back.  Hopefully Steven will be tall enough next time to ride everything!!!  CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!!!

Our family of 4 (kids are 1 and 5) recently stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier and had a wonderful stay. I was pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was, having read some reviews that lead me to expect an Econo-Lodge (not that there's anything wrong with that).  We had previously stayed at the Grand Californian, which is right across the street, so we knew the location was not as bad as some would have you believe - very easy access to the park. Overall, we had a great stay and a good value. We would definitely stay here again. Pros: -Great check-in by cast members - gave us lots of tips and extras, including signed Mickey pics, upgraded room, etc. - Great TV viewing area off lobby - much larger than the one at Grand Californian and enclosed, so you can ask a question without
Great experience , unmatchable atmosphere. Near to the walkway to the park, all staff was amazing, restaurants reasonably priced, spacious room, free internet I have been for 5 days in a fable

My family and I just got home from Disneyland. I have been to Disneyland several time , but this was the time best ever. The hotel made all the differance in the world, after a full day at the park,it was so great to be able to relax ,catch your breath ,then start again.  the poeple at the  Paradise Pier  treated us like V.I.P's  and helped to make my wife and grandkid.s birthdays very special .  THANK YOU FOR A GREAT  STAY;  THE REESES FROM BAKERSFIEL CA.

We stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier at the end of October in 2009 for 4 nights.  Upon check-in we were greeted with smiles and warm wishes!  The cast member who checked us in noticed that we had noted on our reservation that it was one of our kiddos birthday that week.  He retreated to the back briefly and brought out two balloons for our kiddos!  Nice touch!  Our room had a view of California Adventure and at night it was beautiful!  The room offered a day bed, which came in handy to separate our two kiddos at night.  The beds were cozy and the room (though on the small size) accommodated us pretty well.  We were not in our room that much, so it was perfect for our needs.  The pool was fantastic!  Our kids loved the water slide and the two life guards were cheerful and mindful.

We stayed here Jan 3-8th while in town to see the BCS National Championship game (Roll Tide!)  The hotel was great.  The location was great, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms nice.  The only disappointment:  they say they have a guest laundry, but it is actually in the Disneyland Hotel.  That isn't far away, but it would be when carrying dirty laundry!  So just don't count on using the guest laundry.

My family of 4 stayed at the Paradise Pier Jan. 14 -18th in a standard pool view room.  Hotel Positives The room was spacious and clean, the housekeeping staff was very efficient, the pool slide was really fun, we ran into Mickey, Minnie, Daisy and Stitch in the hotel lobby one day, it's on Disney property so you get Magic Mornings (into the park an hour early on Sun, Tues, Thurs and Sat).
