Hotel Negatives The hotel is limited of Disney magic (unless you happen to run into the characters), there is only 1 restaurant and it is just ok, the pool is a standard rectangular shape with no Disney themeing at all, the elevators are terribly slow, the hotel is pretty far from the parks and you have to cross a major street to cut through the Grand Californian or walk through a parking

Disneyland is the perfect place to spend Christmastime!  They decorate Sleep Beauty's castle and the Small World ride to celebrate the holidays.  They also produce fake "snow" that falls on Main Street during select times throughout the holiday season.  The park isn't too crowded on Christmas Eve or Christmas Day, and there are plenty of Christmas souvenirs for sale.  While it rained during our stay, the weather was still warm and mild enough to make the days at the park enjoyable.  The hotel was absolutely perfect, as it was only a short walk across the street to enter the theme parks!

As DVC members, we were able to accumulate enough points to avail of this hotel and upgrade to concierge service.   1.  This hotel has good service. 2.  close to the disney parks(walking distance) 3.  Concierge service made it even more pleasurable. 4.  Restaurant and coffee shop at the hotel.  5.  The swimming pool has a huge slide for the kids and hot tub for the adults  The concierge service served Breakfast, snacks during noontime and wine and beer with aperitifs in the late afternoon(unless you want to eat out - this is quite the savings in itself).  The staff at the concierge service is willing to help you in anyway by answering all your questions and enquiries.  Also you can ask for bottled water before going on your way to the parks which also helps a family save instead

We stayed for the first time at the Disney Paradise Pier and enjoyed every minute of our stay. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were great with more than enough space for a family of 5 and the PCH Grill was convenient. The giant Christmas tree in the lobby was beautiful and I loved that my kids were able to visit with Santa right there. After reading a few reviews about the "long walk" I was a little worried but was pleasantly surprised....The walk from the hotel to the park enterances were only about 10 minutes and not having to wait for a shuttle and loading strollers onto them was priceless. When we arrived home and unpacked our suitcases we discovered that our 10 year old had forgot an entire drawer full of clothes at the hotel. I contacted the hotel the next day and

Summary Heading: Wonderful location, but rooms are small
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised, being used to Disney World's deluxe resorts and expecting an average stay at this so-called "value" resort. The hotel is a quick walk from the parks and the other hotels. We overlooked the pool but it was never noisy inside the room. The concierge lounge was great for breakfast but we had to get there early to get food.   That being said, the rooms are small compared to Disney World resorts. Two of us stayed in one room and I wouldn't have tried to put a third person in there.   Overall, we were very surprised and delighted. We will never pay more money for the Grand Californian or Disneyland Hotel.

We could not beat the price, 3 nights at ($119) and 4 nights at ($100). We arrived at 9:10 pm, bell hop was nice, we went into the desk, no line thought this would be fast and we would go eat a late dinner. Was not to be, the CM from London, England was friendly enough but you could smell the alcohol on her (no one else was around) and we do not drink. She had trouble getting the ressies up, although I had called before hand, asked them to join them and to have connecting rooms for us. She finally found them, but could not give us connecting rooms untill the next day. So we asked her to make sure she put the little one in the room that would not have to move, she did not, the next day we all had to move since she also neglected to tell us that the other room only had a King bed

Summary Heading: Better service than the premium cruises we've enjoyed
Summary: We encountered service that was impeccable, friendly, timly, pleasant staff, helpful at all times. Clean comfortable room, upgraded because of my fiancee's birthday, at no charge, many disney extras thrown in with the package price of the room and park passes. We spent 4 days there, and were alwaqys taken care of. The restaurant food was very good with plentiful portions, even though the menu was rather limited, every thing tasted great. Cleanlieness was tops, bed was turned down every night with mints on the bed, and the king size bed we got was extremely comfortable. We could not have been more pleased with the service, staff, food, cleanlieness, etc.

Summary Heading: A wet, cold but delightful 4 night stay!
Summary: We arrived on Dec 6 for a 4 night stay at Paradise Pier without our Vacation package. The big blue envelope was a safe at home. A quick walk to the Disney Travel Company Office just down the street and we had a new one. They did have to charge for the Park Hopper tickets. When we returned, we mailed the original package back and they quickly refunded our credit card. Great job Disney Travel Company!  We have stayed at the Grand California on our last trip, but decided to save money and check out the Pier. We were not disappointed. We were close to everything and the great restaurants were just across the street at The Grand California. Although breakfast at the PCH with Lilo and Stitch was a delight! We arrived during a wet cold snap, which kept the crowds at a minimum. Monday

Summary Heading: Celebrate your birthday here at the Disneyland Resort in Anaheim!
Summary: Book your room when they have special deals for "park view" and get at least 10th or 11th floor. The view and the room were wonderful but best of all the hotel made a big fuss over my birthday-it was wonderful!

Summary Heading: Super Convenient Place to Stay with all the Magic of Disney
Summary: We travel to Disneyland at least 3 times a year from Hawaii. Usually stay at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South. We love the place. Started this year trying lower cost options, and places that were closer to the park. Paradise Pier was awesome. There is something about staying on the park property that you have to experience. My wife and kids call it Disney Magic. It really takes you away. It took only 9 min. to walk to and from the park (with two children under 5) by going through the Grand Californian lobby. Wonderful for quick power naps, and to change to dry clothes (during Winter) after getting soaked on the water rides. Staff were super attentive to our every need, and parking and internet are included in the resort fee. Carolers and visits by Santa in the lobby were a plus.

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier was great...could be excellent with some minor improvements
Summary: I found an incredible deal on Expedia for $100 a night for four nights at the Paradise Pier.  Because our rate was so low, I was sure they would put is in the smallest, least appointed room they had, but instead, the staff at the Paradise Pier treated us exactly as if we had paid the full rack rate for our room.  We arrived via SNA airport at 9:00 AM, and went straight to the hotel.  I explained to the front desk staff that we knew check-in time wasn't until 3:00, but were hoping we could at least get through the check-in process and stow our bags with the bellman until we could access the room.  I also asked if there were any room upgrades available, thinking that if the price for the upgrade was reasonable, we would go that route.  Not only did they upgrade us to a park view

Can't beat the location - 10 minutes walk to Disneyland. Rooms clean, spacious and comfortable. Staff very friendly, booked our plane seats for return flight home to UK and nothing was too much trouble. Had room service breakfast which was good and not too expensive. You can queue for lifts but we never had to wait too long.

First trip to a Disneyland anywhere in the world and thought that staying at the Paradise Pier made the experience that much better!  We got a great package deal putting the room around the $100 mark and for that you couldn't ask for better.  Staff were wonderful, room was big and we got an upgrade to a view over California Park. Agree with some other comments about the lifts being slow however it was only around that half hour before park opening and everyone was heading the same way The 5-10 minute walk to Disney is fantastic and it was great to go back for a refresh late in the afternoon and then head back for another couple of hours of Disney fun!! Went to Goofy's Kitchen and had dinner with Goofy which I would highly recommend Would definately stay again

Summary Heading: Overall A Fantastic Stay ... Why is everyone complaining?
Summary: After searching trip advisor for a hotel we decided to book a Disney hotel for one main reason ... LOCATION! We had originally booked a neighbouring hotel, but upon more research decided it would be best to book a Disney hotel to ensure our close proximity to the Parks. We were travelling with an 11 month old and knew we would need to have a midday nap!  Upon check in the front desk girl ... Hannah? Was very bubbly ... VERY! But she was lovely and really suited the Disney vibe. We were given our welcome pack as we are international guests ours was not sent to us. We received luggage tags and a voucher book with vouchers to collect our free lanyards and pins - which we did and discounts to various places - we used one of these in the gift shop to recieve 10% off which came in

Had 3 nights at this hotel. It was clean.  That's how I rate a hotel.  We got a rock bottom bargain. Beds comfy. Staff helpful, friendly.  We noticed  workers there were always tidying up things.  The convenience to Disney was great.  Only downside had to pay for parking each day.

I have read most of the reviews posted and was a little concerned about the reviews posted in the negative.  We had Disney's special for 2 nights and 2 day park hopper tickets for November 2 & 3rd.  This was a family trip and the best trip we ever had.  Upon arriving at the hotel, the hotel staff was great.  They explained everything including the parks magic morning hours.  Although our rooms were not ready when we arrived we were allowed to leave our luggage with the hotel and when our rooms were available  the hotel did send cell phone text messages advising of our room numbers.    The distance to the park took only 7 minutes to walk to the monorail station.  As a cancer patient still undergoing chemotherapy and with little energy this was a short walk even a cancer patient

Summary Heading: Magical stay, expensive but glad we stayed
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights booking it because it was the cheapest of the 3 Disne hotels, albeit it was still very expensive.  We were on the 7th floor and the room was standard Disney - lots of Mickey mouse touches, large room with a queen bed and we were over looking the pool.  The biggest negative about this hotel was the lifts - I can't overstate how bad the lifts were, one morning we were waiting over 15mins to get in one (no other alternative when with suitcases).  We frequently had to go up because all the elevators going down were just too crowded.  If you can stay on a low floor so you can walk down.  We had the breakfast which was excellent, all very fresh and omelettes made to order - all superb.  The walk from Paradise Pier to Downtown Disney and the parks is no more

We have stayed at all of the Disneyland hotels. My kids are 10 and 13. Hands down the Paradise Pier pool is your best bet for the older kids. It's a regular pool with a big slide. We really enjoy watching the fireworks from the pool as well. I prefer Paradise Pier over the Disneyland Hotel and I prefer to have a couple's only stay at the Grand California. Disneyland Hotel=younger kids; Paradise=tweens. The rooms are always clean and the staff is so Disney friendly!! Super great with my kids everytime. We are annual passholders and we frequent Disney often. Our favorite place to eat is Goofy's Kitchen for breakfast.

This is an old hotel, and it showed.  The carpets were worn. The furniture looked second hand...Was told that we would have a view of the pool area, actually we had a view of the parking garage with the corner of the pool fence...Would not go back to the Paradise.  Kick in the extra money and stay at the Grand, much better.

Summary Heading: Glad we did it once, but wouldn't likely stay again
Summary: We usually take a couple of trips to Southern California yearly to visit with family and take the kids to Disneyland.  We typically stay in the same hotel each time located within a mile of Disneyland and have always been extremely happy with our stays there.  This year we were able to find a relatively good rate (by Disney standards) at Paradise Pier as part of a AAA Disney package, so we decided to mix it up a bit and change from our usual routine.  The hotel entrance is easy to find and there was plentiful parking; we didn't have to schlep our bags very far from parking to the check in desk.  The kids were immediately gratified by seeing a small arcade and a mini "theater" that plays nonstop Disney cartoons.  Check in process was friendly and quick; we were upgraded to a

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, close to Disneyland and Downtown Disney
Summary: We had a great time here.  It is right across the street from the Grand Californian and a block away from Downtown Disney. -Grant

Went with kids and grandkids, had adjoining rooms. Rooms were very nice and clean. Hotel is well located and the staff was great. Our "Disneyland Express" bus did not show up to take us to the airport so the hotel sent us in a taxi and paid the bill. Would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Okay but wouldn't stay here again.
Summary: The staff was great and the rooms were clean but that was about it.  It was not worth the price.  There are cheaper hotels much closer to the front gates of Disneyland.  Next time we'll stay at the Grand Californian which is closer, nicer and has more eating options.

Summary Heading: Awesome Disneyland hotel with all the special Disney touches!
Summary: We visited Paradise Pier for the 1st time last week.. we were immediately greeted by warm, welcoming front desk staff that upgraded our room to a room with a GREAT view of California Adventure.. gave our girls balloons, Disney pins, Mickey Rice Crispie treats(and chocolate), turn down service with Disney chocolate coins and a picture with Goofy in the lobby!   The hotel itself is spacious, quiet, comfortable and has a fabulous pool, jacuzzi and kiddie pool.. the only bummer is that the pool slide was closed for repair :(  Free parking, free wi-fi, newspaper delivery and a fridge and safe right in your room!   You cannot beat the location... it is an extremely short walk from the Disneyland monorail in Downtown Disney district... (2 blocks on a scenic brick walkway or a quiet cut

Summary Heading: WORST EXPERIENCE EVER - NOT WORTH IT
Summary: I stayed here with my family this past weekend and it was horrible from the moment we drove onto the property.  Once we got there, some strange looking man in a tee shirt and shorts came up to our car and opened our door.  The bellhop was not too far away and did nothing! We closed the door and I went inside to tell the front desk (the front desk said sorry and that was about it). Who knows if they got him.  The check in was fine, but when we got to our room to call the front desk to have them deliver our luggage, the phone didnt work.  Luckily, they have 2 phones in there.  The room was TINY!!!!  We got a room with 2 double beds and we were packed in like sardines.  We traveled with an infant and 2 young children.  I booked this room on the disney web site and the confirmation

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Paradise Pier!
Summary: We got a great deal at the Paradise Pier through Expedia.com.  We stayed for 4 nights, Sept. 28 - Oct.2.  It was a great stay.  Check-in was a breeze, beds were comfortable and the in-room high speed internet was very reliable. Staying on Disney property allows you to feel like you never have to leave the Disney magic. It was a quick walk to Disneyland via the Grand Californian and an even faster walk to California Adventure. Overall a really nice stay!

The Paradise Pier hotel is THE place to stay. Although it is the farthest from the park of the three resort hotels, the walk is still very good. A tip: USE THE CONCIERGE SERVICE! It only costs a few dollars more, and will get you a free breakfast, delicious snacks throughout the day, and a evening reception that can go as a meal! You'll also get a room with a good view. Thanks, Paradise Pier, a great stay!
Right across from California Adventure & in the heart of Downtown Disney, great walking distance to both.  Had a room that overlooked the pool, and it was packed each day I was there.

When we checked in we were given an upgraded room with a view of the California Adventures, it was a corner room so it was much larger than the standard room. We did have plumbing issues the first morning there, but that was quickly taken care of by hotel maintenance - not the greatest experience waking up to an overflowing sink. It would have been a lot cheaper to stay in an area hotel instead of one on the Disney property, but the convenience of being able to walk a short distance (5 minutes max) to the park was worth it. We had a great experience and recommend the Paradise Pier.

There were 5 of us in our group.   Mom (61), Sis (39), Myself (37) and sis's two girls ages 12 and 9.  We had a standard room and it worked out well for us.  My sis and I each shared a bed with one of the girls, while mom took the couch/daybed.  Our room overlooked the pool area and we were on the 9th floor.  The hotel was always very clean, and staff very friendly.  We did room service breakfasts on the days we did early entry, and it was fairly economical.  We ordered 2 breakfasts and split between the 4 of us that were eating breakfast and the cost was about $40 total.  We also did the character breakfast twice and our bill for 4 was about $80+ each time.  If you have children, you should do the character breakfast at least one day.  Lilo, Stitch, Daisy and Pluto seemed to be

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier Was Made The Stay Nice
Summary: We overall had a great stay at the hotel. Im going to give my stay a 4.5 out of 5 because unless everything was perfect, it cant be a 5. Seldom can any hotel deliver perfection so PP falls within what normally happens at a hotel. I spent a lot of time doing research on PP and reading others reviews. Also, I work at a 5 star hotel on the Las Vegas Strip, so I have a unique understanding of hotel ops.   The good - The people working at the hotel are castmembers and as such, give guests the highest level of personal interaction (are very patient and good natured). Our check in was very quick and the bell service did a good job helping us unload and get our baggage ready to deliver to our room. My desk agent was pleasant and asked about our stay (what are we celebrating). This was

Stayed at Disney’s Paradise Pier Hotel for two nights on Aug 12 & 13, 2009.  Stayed on the 14th floor in a one bedroom suite with my new wife and my two kids - ages 12 and 10.  Having the separate bedroom for the adults was a great idea as the living area had a large queen bed sofa sleeper that the kids said was very comfortable.  The room was very clean and the furniture was fairly new and comfortable – as were the beds.  Both bathrooms were spotless when we arrived and housekeeping kept them that way during our stay.  The level of service and hospitality we experienced at the hotel was well above my expectations – even for Disney.  The first night I had to call the front desk to get sheets for the sleeper sofa (there were two blankets but no sheets in the closet).  House

We stayed at the Paradise Pier for spring break trip to Disneyland. We have stayed at the Grand Californian which is incredible but wanted to cut down on the budget some. Our room overlooked the park (they upgraded us for free). The room was nice, clean and quiet. The pool is on a deck and a little small but it was too cold for us to swim anyway. Breakfast is available at a little cafe or you can pay the higher price for the buffet with characters. The walk, if you cut through the Grand Californian to Disneyland, takes about 8 minutes.

I went with my boyfriend, my dad, his girlfriend, and her two kids. 6 people can't stay in one room so we got 2 rooms. The staff went out of their way to get us adjoining rooms! That was very nice throughout our stay! It was my Dad's birthday and they got him a 'birthday turndown' on our first night- he got a few mickey shaped rice krispie's that were dipped in chocolate.  There was construction going on at California Adventure, so the normal walkway you take into Disneyland was not there. Every time we came and went, we had to walk inside California Adventure to get there. A bit out of the way, but not horribly difficult.  I did not visit the pool while we were there, but the members of my party did. They were barely there for 20 minutes before they came up to take showers.

Summary Heading: Happiest Place on Earth? Think again!!!!
Summary: We had an awful time at the Disney Paradise Peir Hotel.  First room we got checked into was the most disgusting room, something you would find at a motel 8 off a truck travelled road in the middle of nowhere.  The bed smelled of urine, the carpet was covered in candies, popcorn, candy wrapper, gumballs, papers, magazines (All throughout the room), strings.. u name it. The window glass, from top to bottom covered on greasy marks, fingers, face marks on the WHOLE window.    My daughter walked around the room for 30mins w no shoes, with her socks on and at the end of that period her socks were BLACK with dirt and who knows what else!!!!  I have pictures of the socks AND the condition of the room that I will be posting for people to beware of the facility. When I complaint to the

Summary Heading: Amazing Disney Experience...I don't understand negative reviews!
Summary: Our stay at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel exceeded our expectations. We were not exactlysure what to expect since this hotel was the least expensive of the 3 Disney hotels. Upon arrival the woman who checked us in was very helpful and informative. She told us all about the hotel, its amenities, explained the taxes and fees, parking, and even drew on our map the quickest ways to the parks in the morning. She saw our  toddler was getting fussy and gave him a balloon. That made his day!   Our toddler LOVED the goofy character in the lobby and giggled watching  cartoons in a beach themed children's television room. The pool alone was worth the stay. There is a pretty large main pool, kiddie pool, jacuzzi, and very fun slide. The hotel definitely has that California beach theme in a

Summary Heading: The best value and service of any of the Disneyland Hotels
Summary: My family frequents the Disneyland resort, and even though we live only a half hour away, several times a year we take mini-vacations and stay at the park.  Yes, the Disneyland hotel is the first amd has probably the best pool of all the hotels, and Yes the Grand Californian is superb in it's elegance, but by far the best value, the  friendliest staff, and the best hotel for families with children is the Paradise Pier.  Try to get an elevated room with a view of the California Adventure Park.  The view from one of the upper floors is one you won't forget.  We have used all three hotels, but the one that treats us like family and makes us welcome everytime we are there is the Paradise Pier.  Kids will enjoy the water slide in the pool area and also the movie theater on the first

We, as alot of other people, chose to stay at the Paradise Pier because it was the least expensive of the three Disney hotels and I enjoy not leaving the Disney admosphere when going to/from the parks and hotel. All of the staff we came in contact with was very friendly and nice (we only stayed one night so it was limited) but overall, we enjoyed our stay.  The hotel was perfect for what we came there for - a simple, quick and inexpensive weekend getaway, just the two of us.  I was a little disappointed with the cleanliness of the room though, when we got there, I put my bag right on something dirty (and greasy) that was left on the countertop in the entryway and when I checked under the bed when we were leaving to make sure we got everything, I noticed a couple toy cars under

The hotel is close to Downtown Disney and the Park.  That's the positive.  The rooms are outdated, and certainly nothing special.   The food cost is outrageous. I think you pay much too much for what you get. The desk clerk neglected to tell us about Magical Morning, where guests get in the park at 7am, an hour early.  Luckily we overheard other guests talking about it, or we would have missed it.

The 2 day stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel was over priced, despite special military offer. The hotel parking structure has no elevator access back to the hotel entrance, long walk when travelling with children using strollers, I was expecting special experience for children, ended up to be a regular stay in a hotel. Could of got a better deal with another hotel within the area. Hotel to Disneyland entrance was about 15minute walk. During my stay 12JUN09 FRI from 6am to 8am labor union was protesting infront of the hotel yelling out load, very annoying when you still trying to get more sleep. Hotel room no DVD player, Very  Small Refrigerator, No Microwave, nothing complimentary,  Elevator was a long wait after park hours. Over all I rate this hotel One Star ! Its not worth the

Summary Heading: Nice stay with a touch of Disney
Summary: This was our first time taking our kids to Disneyland. We wanted to be onsite and go all out. We chose the Paradise Pier over the other 2 because it was the lowest priced of the 3. We stayed 5 nights. When you walk in you see a huge Goofy, which my kids loved. All staff were really nice and helpful. We reserved a standard room, but were given a room with a view of CA Adventures. Very pretty. Room was neat and clean. The beds were so comfy. We heard no noise from people in the rooms around us. However we awoke at 5 am to constructon noises that were going on in Ca Adventures and the Grand Californian Hotel. My kids slept through it, but I am a light sleeper.  I did love the hotel though, next time I will just request a room away from the construction if it is still going on. The

Summary Heading: Another great stay at the Pier
Summary: Our family just returned from a 5 night stay (6/1-6/6) at the Paradise Pier and had a great time.  This was our second time staying here and it did not disappoint.  The rooms are larger than average and the day bed was perfect for a family of five such as ours.  Every night when we would return from the parks, we would come back to our beds turned down, chocolate mickey coins spread out on each bed, and the kids stuffed animals all arranged in a new way.  It was a nice way to end our day.  On the first night we also came back to a plate of five "Mickey" Rice Crispy Treats and a birthday card for our daughter (even though her birthday is not until later this month).  We never even mentioned her birthday, so it was certainly a surprise.    I would also highly recommend having an

We are experienced travelers to the Walt Disney World resort hotels, and this was our first time at Disneyland.  Generally, the hotel was clean and nice, but it was probably not worth the price tag (at the time, it was more than twice what the rack rates of what surrounding 4-star hotels were).  In Florida, the Disney hotels are a MUST and have several advantages.  Not so much in California, where other hotels are a shorter walking distance to the gates than Paradise Pier was.  The room was terrific and very clean.  Each room had a daybed, which the kids loved.  We had a 10 year old boy and a 5 year old girl, and they were glad to get their own bed.

Summary Heading: This hotel worked very well for us
Summary: Mom and Dad and 3 year old in one room and Grandmother and Grandfather in the room next door.  We were there 6 nights.  Grandmother is handicapped and uses a wheelchair full-time and a Hoyer lift to transfer to and from the w/c.  The handicapped room worked great for her.  Staff was very, very accomodating, and did whatever we asked to make it work better for her.  The pool, water slide and spa were a lot of fun, especially for the 3 year old.  Disneyland's evening fireworks can be seen from the pool area of the hotel.  The hotel is a bit of a hike from Disneyland or Disney's California Adventure park, but the walk is not too bad.  Instead of walking thru Downtown Disney, a short-cut thru Disney's Grand California Hotel, across the street, is a good alternative.

Summary Heading: Nice until a little friend joined us.
Summary: The hotel overall was your basic holiday inn-ish hotel. Ok and the location was great . About a 10 minute walk to the park. However in the room it did smell a bit musty and one night after unlocking our safe a cockroach ran out from under it.   Freaked me out so much I called the front desk and they moved us to a Premier Suite on the 10th floor.  They didn't ask where I saw it or apologize for it. They just moved us.  Im sorry but there is never just 1 cockroach anywhere. Just kinda grossed me out.  Also the elevators took forever. There are 15 floors and only 3 elevators. And tons of Little kids. Not a romantic hotel at all.

First of all, this was a “grown up” getaway weekend.  My girl friend, my adult (22 year old) son and I grabbed an opportunity to spend a few days at the Disneyland Resort.  We stayed at Paradise Pier and had a great time.    Although we arrived (all 3 of us from different points of origin) before noon we were fortunate enough to have a room ready for us when we checked in.  So we dropped our bags, went to Downtown Disney for a quick lunch at the ESPN Zone and headed to the parks.  This is the first bonus that struck us about staying at Paradise Pier – it was so quick and easy to get from the hotel to Downtown Disney.  No more than a 5 minute walk – really more like a stroll - though hotel property streets (safe from traffic).    Parking was included in the hotel’s daily “resort

The best part about this hotel is the location.  It is close to the Downtown Disney area where you can get the monorail to Disneyland and a short walk through the Grand Californian to the California Adventure Park.  The check in process was pretty fast however we were early and a room was not available.  They had given us the keys and a phone number to call to check on our room but after 4 calls to the number with no answer we had to get back in the long line to get our room information.  The rooms are pretty small and need a little updating but they were clean and comfortable.  We had requested a King bed but were told that they only had one king room per floor and they were all taken so we ended up with two queen beds which were pretty small.  The "rooftop" pool is somewhat

Summary Heading: Those willing to give up the Disneyland Hotel's lagoon-style pool will find this is the more relaxed option.
Summary: As a travel consultant for cre8adventures.com, I've visited this property a few times. Situated furthest from the Disneyland Parks, this is the smallest and least expensive of the three Disney-run hotels. The parks and Downtown Disney are still very much within easy walking distance.   The PCH Grill around the corner serves California specialties from its open kitchen in a festive confetti-flocked setting. Kids can make their own pizzas, and Disney characters join guests for breakfast without creating a mob scene like that at the Disneyland Hotel next door. This actually enables kids to get a lot more one-on-one time with Stich & Lilo.   The Yamabuki restaurant continues to offer both Western and Japanese seating to go with the sushi and other Japanese specialties. A room

Although the rooms are on the small and basic side, and starting to show their age a bit, who goes to Disneyland to spend all their time in the hotel room?  For a place to get some sleep between all the fun, you can't be a location like this.  Walking distance to both parks, and Downtown Disney, plus a guests only entrance available to get into the park without the lines at the main gates.  We were 3 adults in a room, and had plenty of space, but it could be tight if you had small kids with pent up energy or cribs/playpens.  The room had a view of Disney's California Adventure and you could hear the people screaming on the roller coaster, but the park wasn't open too late so it didn't interfere with our sleep.

Checked in 4-10 Checked out 4-12  Room: 2 queens w/ a view (free-upgrade) Guest: 2 adults one child We really do love this hotel. This was our second visit , in less than 9 months.  Parking: We used valet, our stay was during Spring Break & the parking structure looked packed & there is no elevator in the parking levels. Valet service was wonderful the guys are always very delightful. Check in: We arrived early, 10am, check-in isn't until 3-4pm, but we wanted to drop or bags off & head to the park. As we stood in line to do so we witnessed a few crazed -rude guest demanding that they wanted to check in early. Why must people yell & be rude. The hotel staff was wonderful @ calming them down & explaining check in & check out time. Another gold star for great staff! The gentleman

Summary Heading: Okay with a discount, but would not have been worth $200 or more a night.
Summary: The locations is really what this hotel is about, you can walk to California Adventure thru the Grand Californian and it is not too far of a walk to the monarail that you can take into the other park.  We did get upgraded to a room with a view without asking, which was nice.  We also stayed with a discount ($140 a night), I would not have wanted to pay much more.  Keep in mind as we did not know that although parking is "free" you do pay a resort fee each night in addition to the room cost.  The rooms are pretty standard and besides the drawings of California Adventure they are not very disney.  Also the bathroom wallpaper is peeling up a little as our bathroom fan did not work.  Also you definetly heard the people in other rooms/in the halls.  There is also a pretty good wait

Summary Heading: Decent hotel, close to Disney parks
Summary: I am so glad we got the discounted rate of $169.  Since I am an annual disneyland passholder, they upgraded our room from the regular rate to the park view room on the 10th floor.   The hotel is in walking distance to the Grand Californian hotel, which has  an entrance to the California Disney Adventure park, and also puts you closer to disneyland.  Either that, or you can walk to downtown disney 5-10 min. walk and ride the monorail into the disneyland park.    We were right in front of the California Disney Park, it little noisy with the rides going.  but We did have a great view of the fireworks. The room was average size.  The cleanliness was okay, but not super clean. The bath room was a good size.  The counters were granite.   The self-parking structure is located behind

I have no idea why anyone would complain about this hotel. We stayed for 3 nights starting March 23rd. We were upgraded to a family suite which was great especially with a 14,11 and 8 year old. This is out families 5th time staying and we love it! Location is great, rooms are great service is awesome. This hotel is always clean, the glass is never dirty (and there is glass everywhere from huge glass doors to the glass elevator)It's worth it just for the early entry into the parks. So what if the bar at the pool was closed..we just went downstairs to the lounge and brought our drinks up from there. Kids love the arcade and the movie room was pretty cool. I agree that $280-$300 a night is a little steep but there is just something about staying on site..you never leave the Disney

I will never stay at another disney hotel!!! The website advertises a roof top pool where you can relax and watch the fireworks.  The truth is it is a third floor pool, Not on THE roof, half of the fireworks are not visible and the bar closed hours before the fireworks.  We arrived at 6pm and went looking for dinner. Much to our dismay, we were told it would be a three hour wait.  We were traveling with children who were now crying because they were hungry.  When I inquired about half of the restaurant being empty, the "cast member" shrugged and said we would have to wait.  The room was very average and VERY overpriced!!!

I stayed at the Disney Paradise Pier with my husband and kids (2 year old and 5 year old) from March 16th thru March 20th.  We booked our trip to Anaheim at the last minute and got a great deal on Hotels.com for $180/night.  We wanted a hotel that was in close proximity to the Disneyland park.  We felt the rate we paid ($180/night) was an appropriate rate for what you get from this hotel and not worth paying more.  The regular rack rate for the hotel rooms are normally $280-$300/night which I think is overpriced.  If you can get this hotel for less than $200/night, it's worth staying at.  Otherwise, you can find other good hotels in the area for less.    In describing the hotel, it's a clean, comfortable hotel with close proximity to the park which is a plus if you are traveling

Summary Heading: Very satisfied staying here for first trip to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed from Thursday to Monday (12-16 March) on a very good discount deal (approx $140 per night).  For the price we paid, I was very satisfied with staying in the Disneyland resort area for our first trip to Disneyland (we have visited Disney World several times).    We have three children (ages 6 through 10) and found the room size to be large enough to fit us comfortably.  We had two queen beds and a sofa (which converts to a twin bed) for use.  The room as well as the bathroom was in very good shape and we found the rooms to be very very quiet!  Even with children all around the resort and in adjacent rooms, we never heard any loud noises from other rooms.  We stayed on the 13th floor overlooking the Disney California Adventure Park (DCA) and really enjoyed the view.  At the

Stayed 4 nights and had a really great stay.  Was a bit worried about staying at a Disney resort with no children but had no problems.  Yes, there were families everywhere but the rooms are quiet and there was no noise issue at all.  Didn't experience the much talked of problems with the lifts but my room was quite high so maybe that helped.  Was able to check in at 8am which was a blessing after a 12 hour flight.  All staff were up to the usual helpful Disney standard.  Travelling in early Feb, it was off season and so I saw everything in both parks in 2 day and had the third day to stroll around at my leisure.  My only complaint would be that it is very hard to get "off world" as they offer no options for leaving the Disney precinct.  Well worth the expense if you are a fan

Summary Heading: OK stay, but next time I'd choose another hotel.
Summary: The staff (or cast members) at this hotel are great, just like all Disney hotels.  This was our second stay at a Disney property (the last one being Disneyland Hotel), and I was a little disappointed.  We chose the Paradise Pier because we got a great discount on the room.  The rooms were very average, not decorated with a Disney theme, and a long walk to the park and Downtown Disney.  This is tough when traveling with 3 young kids, especially after staying in the parks the entire day.  But the biggest disappointment was the pool and water slide.  The pool was no bigger than a large personal pool at your neighbors house, and the waterslide was below average (not to mentioned closed during our stay). The next time we go to Disneyland, we'll either stay back at the Disneyland

We've now stayed at this hotel several times, and it's our top choice for Disneyland.  The staff is very helpful and friendly, rooms are big and well appointed, and the location is so convenient.  The addition of a seriously fantastic Japanese restaurant makes this place a can't miss.  The rooms are, well, roomy.  The standard room has two queens and a fold out couch.  TV is typical analog type, but fairly big.  Flat screen would be a nice touch, time to uprade!  Rooms are alway very tidy and the hotel is quite modern.  It was my husband's birthday during our stay, and the staff was obviously trying even harder than usual to make our stay special.  Mickey Mouse Rice Crispy treats were delivered shortly after we checked in, the housekeepers presented us with a birthday cake

Because this was both my niece's and my boyfriend's very first time at Disneyland ever, I read the reviews and waffled over where to stay on my trip to Disneyland for months.  Finally decided to stay at one of the three resort hotels, so I called the Disney hotline and got a very helpful (and jovial) lady on the phone.  She described the two that I was trying to pick from in great detail, and sold me on the Paradise Pier Hotel because their 1-bedroom suites have two full bathrooms, so I thought that was a really great value since the Disneyland Hotel suite was about the same price, but only has one bathroom, and there were up to five of us at one point on this trip.    When we got there, we were blown away.  The staff was super friendly and courteous, the room was way bigger

We stayed here for 4 nights over President's Day weekend. The 4th night was free. While this hotel is farther from the park entrances than the other two Disney properties, we were overall pleased with our stay. Our room, a suite, had plenty of room for four, including two bathrooms. The room was clean and comfortable; although the hide-a-bed was horrible. But the couch was large enough that one teen slept fine on the cushions. The only other complaint we had was not enough wattage in the lights. Very hard to read at  night. The stafff was always accomodating and very pleasant. We never ate at the hotel, so cannot comment on that. We would stay here again.

I went with a friend and her two teenaged children for one night on February 12th.  The pool is heated and nice.  The rooms are clean and nicely decorated.  They are basic hotel rooms, nothing special, but perfectly good with a few cute Disney touches.  We paid the pass holder discount rate of $139/night.  The hotel itself is not worth more than that, but the location is.    It's a quick walk (cut through the Grand Californian) to Disneyland.  This hotel seems to be closer to the parks than the Disneyland Hotel, but I didn't test that out.  We ate dinner one night in the hotel restaurant and the food was good.  I got coffee and cereal in the morning at the coffee bar.    One negative was that the room was warm the entire time.  I could not set the air low enough.  I forgot to

Summary Heading: More good than bad at Paradise Pier
Summary: We booked our trip to Disneyland staying at Paradise Pier hotel, from January 31 - February 8th 2009, directly through Disneyland.com.  There is no doubt that there is not a lot of "value" associated with staying at ANY Disney resort.  You are paying for one thing only - and that's being close to the park.  The paradise pier is a short walk to the monorail, downtown disney, and california adventure.  You could stay at a much nicer spot, off property, for much less money.  That said, there is something special about being so close the park and having the Disney service around you.  Contrary to some reviews, I found the service to be quite good at the hotel.  I was always greeted, smiled at, and everyone seemed quite nice.  Because we were celebrating our engagement and I had let
We stayed at the paradise pier for a weekend away with the kids.  The rooms are very clean.  The hotel offers a lot for kids of all ages to do.  Great hotel!!!

We spent 5 nights in this hotel.  We arrived a bit jet lagged after 30 hours of travel to get there for four of us, and twenty hours for one of us, so were pleased to get in and freshen up.  Check-in was straightforward and friendly.   The pool area was great, and the bar served fantastic cocktails.   Downtown Disney was so easily accessible, when we go back to Disneyland we will definitely stay on the grounds again.   We had four adults and a child sharing one room.  It was a little cramped, but very liveable in the short term, and it made staying here a very affordable option. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay here and I'm VERY happy to recommend it.  Oh, and the glass elevator is fabulous!

Wasn't sure what to expect from this hotel - but can't not speak highly enough about the service, cleanliness and location to everything.  Room was immaculate - breakfast buffet was great.  Great chance to get pictures with the Minnie, Lilo and Stich etc without the lines at Disneyland.  This trip was worth every cent and the Paradise Pier certainly a hotel I would recommend to anyone travelling to do the Disneyland experience.

We stayed here twice and received a free upgrade both times. The hotel is very nice and the views are beautiful. We had a pool view once, and a park view. both were nice, but prefer park view. It's the farthest hotel on property to walk to, but at least its still on property.

Booked a Disneyland package-Paradise Pier Hotel with Concierge Service plus package extras. Just the wife and I. Of the 3 on the grounds hotels, this was the least visibly populated (Great!). Convenient to get to Disneyland and California Adventures and easy to get back to hotel for rest and then back out. Accomodations were above average. Wife loved the mouse eared toiletries. Concierge service is well worth the extra money. Someone always there, contiental breakfast, snacks throughout the day, wine/beer with hors d'ovres after 5:00 pm. Also, had an internet PC. Concierge helped get us a dinner reservation when phone service said no reservations available. Had room service breakfast our last day and was about the same cost as the character viewing buffet breakfast. I would

I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!   We have stayed at this hotel 3 times and are always impressed.  The last time, due to cost, we were thinking of possibly staying at another property.  I'm so glad we didn't!  On our first day there, our daughter became very ill.  I was very worried about her and when housekeeping came to the room, I told the woman they did not need to clean today because my daughter was ill and in bed.  WIthin the next 5 minutes, the front desk called my room and offered to help.  They had an onsite nurse talk with me.  She told me they were able to contact an on call doctor that does house calls to the hotel and within an hour, a doctor was at our door ready to examine her with medication in hand for my daughter's nausea.  I was so grateful.  She woke

We just returned from a family vacation from the Disneyland resort, where we stayed at the Paradise Pier.12-14-12-18-2008. This was our grand kids first visit, and I figured staying on a Disney property, that we would be greeted at check in with a little "Disney enthusiam", but it was just the opposite, no smiles, no eye contact, nothing...there was only 1 person working the check in desk but it was not busy. We asked if we could upgrade our room and  was told the hotel was full. When we got to our room it was the wrong type so back down to the lobby, where I talked to a new front desk person, and asked her if the hotel was full, and her answer was no, so when I asked her why we could not be upgraded she said it was because of the travel agent we went through (Disney

This was my first stay at Paradise Pier. My brother was treating my mother and I to 3 days at Disneyland. We had a 3rd floor room. These rooms all have little porches with direct access to the pool. It was not very noisy even though there were people in the pool several nights.We also used the Beach Combers lounge. I don't know how this worked I guess you payed more. You had to use you room card to get in, but it was nice. Free food until 8pm. Would stay there again. Walkto park was long, but not as long as the wait for the shuttle to the parking garage.

We stayed 4 nights at Disney's Paradise Pier Nov. 23-26, 2008. Our stay was absolutely wonderful.  This was our second stay at PP. We had a two bedroom suite located on the 15th floor, which is the top floor so no pitter-patter above us!  The suite is huge!  It is basically three guest rooms connected together.  We had one king room w/ bathroom, the living room in the middle with a large "L" shaped hide-a-bed couch and its own bathroom, and a third room with 2 Queen beds and a bathroom.  For our family of 7, the suite was more than adequate.   We also chose the concierge option at the hotel figuring the extra $100/day would pay for itself having 5 kids and ourselves.  The lounge is large and very nice.  There is a big screen that shows Disney movies, a computer for guests to

Summary Heading: Perfect room for the 5 of us...just right!
Summary: We booked this one night (Nov. 5, 2008).  The hotel was fairly empty, so they upgraded us to a view of the park.  This seemed great, but we were kept up a little later due to some fireworks nearby (not sure where, as the park was closed)!!  Nonetheless, it was a great room.  2 queen beds and one twin bed for my youngest.  It is sometimes tricky with three kids, but this set up works great for us.  My husband and I still get one child each with us, but in a queen bed it is much roomier.     We got a notice the morning we were checking out with an option to stay for one more night for $99.00.  Unfortunately, for us to stay another night, we would have needed to purchase another day at the park--which negates the savings on the room!  If we had only know earlier, we could have

Summary Heading: Great view of the California Adventures
Summary: Stayed in Room 1126.  Great view of Disney's California Adventures and the mountains.  Unfortunately, there during the fires so lobby even had smoky smell.  Rooms were fine and no smoky smell above the lobby level.  Refrigerator, safe, coffee pot all nice to have and working well.  Plenty of bathroom supplies-nice big tub with shower (but some mold around shower control).  Everything else spotless.  Nice closet with ample space.  Good tv with about 25 channels (not as many as advertised but not there to watch alot of tv)-most local channels were showing fires anyway.  2 beds and a single sofa bed.  Beds not as comfortable as those at other places I've stayed (i.e. most Hampton Inns and BW Raffles)  pillows not as firm as I would have liked.  Clock radio between beds worked fine.

What impressed us most was the staff.  Everyone went out of their way to be extremely helpful, polite and so very friendly.  Our room was upgraded upon early arrival.  We were on the 13th floor and had a lovely view of the park.    I look forward to staying at the Paradise Pier Park in the future.  Thank you for the wonderful time.

my husband, 2yr old, and i stayed at PP and were expecting it to be more of a motel when a lot of people refer to it as the budget disney hotel.  If you can get a good rate, it can be a good deal, over 200.00 a night, it would probably be better to stay off property like at the BW anaheim inn.  we found the rooms to be quite spacious, clean, and with nice views(we had CA view).    The walk to disneyland was about 15 minutes, but that is about the same as from any of the parking lots and you can just walk thru downtown disney which makes it quite nice.  you just need to cross the street and thru the grand cali to get to CA.  everything is a long day of walking when talking about disneyland.  the hotel has vending machines for sodas and snacks or 24 hour room service, you can also

My husband and I stayed at the Paradise Pier and loved it!  Benefits include the direct access into the parks and you can shop and have your items delivered to your room!   Just across the street, you have direct access to California Adventure by going through the Grand Californian Hotel lobby.  It's a beautiful walk through this hotel and you walk right into the park through the back entrance.  No crowds, no waiting in line, you show your pass and into the park you go, it's awesome!   While shopping at the parks or Downtown Disney, you can have all your items delivered to your room, they arrive the following morning.  I love to shop in the morning when the stores are not yet crowded, but hate carrying packages around.   This was a great service to use!  The hotel is really nice

Summary Heading: Little Black Feet  From Filthy Carpet
Summary: My Family and I really Love to visit the Disneyland Park and California Adventure park.  I think it is the most favorite vacation of mine ever!!!  I try to book a visit and fly over at least once a year with my family.  We usually stay at the Grand Californian hotel but it was really booked during the week we were coming and did not have the six consecutive evenings we wanted.  I reserved our stay at the Paradise pier instead since they could accommodate us.  It was our first time staying at the Paradise pier Hotel.  I read on the trip advisor website that it was a clean hotel to stay at.  To our absolute shock we found the bottom of our Childs feet turned totally black from walking on the carpets barefoot. I wouldn't let my kids (7 and 2) play on the floor, inside! We all kept

We switched to this hotel after staying at a VERY low budget hotel recomended by our travel agent.  The room was awesome, very clean, VERY comfy beds.  We were on the 13th floor and had a view of the park which was great!  The fridge was handy for snacks and drinks.  The pool was very fun with the water slide and the 1' deep kiddy pool - great for our 4 year old son who isn't a huge water fan anyway.  Our only complaint was that there were only 4 elevators and one morning our elevator stopped on every floor going down - it took forever.   we would definitely stay here again!!

Summary Heading: Great Time at the Paradise Pier
Summary: When we arrived the check-in was very quick.  The front desk staff were very friendly and had little gifts for our daughter.  They are very knowledgeable as is the concierge desk.  The rooms are great.  They have that beachy Mickey theme and it is cute.  They are a good size - not super small - we had 2 double beds and a couch that converted into a single bed.  This was fantastic as it was kind of built into the room and when it was a bed it didn't take up a whole bunch of room (like cots often do).  Then you could switch it back into a couch and sit on it.  The air conditioner is nice because you can actually set the temperature - not like other places where you just put it at low/medium/high.  Our room faced DCA and it wasn't noisy at all.  You can see the fireworks at night

For our Disney visit this year my family (we have 2 kids 6/8) decided to stay inside the parks. In Disneyworld we were staying outside, but this time we wanted to try the experience, and it worked well, especially since we could leave the park at noon, take a swim and rest, to go back fresh after 5pm and we could see Fantasmic at the second show. GC or PP?- The hotel is located behind the GC, in a much quieter place. GC is undergoing some expansion, they have construction undergoing on one side and noisy Downtown Disney on the other. PP is smaller, which made it more interesting for us, I hate huge hotels. It has a nice pool on the 3rd fl, kids loved the waterslide; our room was over the pool on 6th floor but it was not noisy at all. GC is really 'grand' indeed, but it also had

We stayed here for a medical conference while the family visited Disneyland. We had a great time and the service was excellent. The rooms were nice a big and had the fold out couch. There were two restaurants on the property and both were good. I have read reports that the elevators were slow, but we never had a problem with them.   The pool area was nice and the children loved the water slide. We also appreciated the tot pool.    I was much more impressed by this hotel that the Candy Cane Inn that we have stayed in several times. The rooms were much larger and brighter.  The whole atmosphere was more luxurious. Also, the walk to the parks was not bad at all. Plus you could take a short ride on the Monorail and get right into Disneyland from nearby.

The room was great, the view was great, the service was great, the staff was great, but breakfast was $30 per person...WOW!.  I would stay at the hotel again,  I would even suggest it as a place for family reunions (I have pretty small family). But I would not recommend eating in the hotel. Seriously, we paid $30 for our 3 yr old to eat 1/2 a pancake and some orange juice.  There are lots of other options in the parks and in Downtown Disney.

We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights.  The hotel is clean and the staff is great.  One day my mother took care of my 3 kids so that my husband and i could go to California Adventure.  She went to the bathroom to clean my son and when she came out she thought she lost my middle child.  Within seconds of her calling the front desk, ecurity was knocking on the door and the entire hallway was full of cast members.  Since the hotel was close I was able to get there from the park in about 3 minutes.  While I was running to the hotel I lost my park ticket. When I got to the room there were cast members comforting my mother and my children.  My daughter was playing hide and go seek with my mother (without her knowing) and ended up falling asleep under the bed.  The hotel gave me another

I was traveling solo and was greatly inpressed with this hotel.Check in was fast compared to many other hotels. The king bed was soft and fluffy just like sticth.The breakfast was more than i could eat> The waite staff was great and even the chief waved when i came by with my viedo camera. The room was allways made up when i reunted from the parks and the trun down sevice with the candy coins was a great suriprie.I alos liked  it when mousekeeping took the time to pick up my stuffed toys and sat them on chouch. The hotel staff were really wonderfull and even thank me when I had to make resevartions for my trip back to the airport. The desk clerk  told me that many guests waite untile the day of depature to make those revartions. I alos want to say the staff any handle any

We had never stayed in a Disney Resort.  The hotel was way above your average hotel.   Very clean.  Rooms were promptly cleaned before we got back in the afternoon.   I was a litttle worried when I saw reviews of the walking distance.  I don't know how far these people who complain walk but to get to California Adventure you walk across the street to the Grand Californian, maybe a 5 min walk, very close.   To get to Disneyland you walk to Downtown Disney, again maybe 5-10 mins not very far at all then you can catch the monorail or walk through Downtown Disney to the park.     If you were staying outside the park you would be parking and walking to the tram and then still having to walk into the park, your distance would be farther than walking from the Paridise Pier Hotel.     I

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two days and nights. Our room was spacious, clean, and well appointed. It was also pretty quiet, which we really appreciated. We were disappointed about the lunch options on Sunday (very expensive brunch, or too-crowded and slow bar/cafe) but there were plenty of restaurants in close walking distance, so that wasn't a problem for us. Staff members were all friendly. We would stay here again.

This was our first trip to a disney hotel.  For the price ($300+), we expected a lot more (eg. continental breakfast, champagne toast, decent coffee). We got a basic stay at a hotel.    Lobby service was very slow and they seldom answered their phone.   The room was clean, but nothing spectacular.  Morning coffee was less than adequate.  Be prepared to do lots of walking just to get to the parks. Save money and book at a nearby good neighbor hotel.

My husand, two children and I looooved the Paradise Pier. First we arrived at about 2am in a motorhome. We were happily given a parking pass and when we preregistered at 8am that morning our room was already ready! I couldn't believe it, it worked out perfect. The front desk was very nice as well as the lifegaurds at the pool and the housekkepers.   The room itself was great. There was an armoire in the room that was high enough to keep everything out of kids reach and a play pen in the closet, the room was definently kid friendly. The water pressure was great(we showered at night) and the bathroom was bigger than most.  Although noone else noticed, I did see some dried goo on the bottom of the curtains and one of the chairs had some gunk on it but it still felt cleaner then

Summary Heading: Fine Experience...Is it worth the price?
Summary: We booked the senior rate, and paid $200 for room, parking, taxes, etc.  Check-in was fine, but the room wasn't available at 9 am when we arrived, but was availabe when I checked back at 230pm.  They gave my kids balloons and birthday buttons for their birthday's and everyone at Disneyland would say hello.  My dad said when he walked by at 3pm, true check in time, the lobby was packed.  We had a pool side room (odd numbers I believe) so we didn't have a view of the park/fireworks.  That was fine for us.  The room was a very standard hotel room in fair condition...nothing terrified me...nothing impressed me.  The beds were really firm (but not in that high quality way) yet we were so tired, it really didn't matter. I  think they have it set up pretty well for families with a

Having taken many Disney Vacations - this was our first on Disneyland property (have stayed on Disney world).  Was not overly impressed, but as usual customer service was very good.  Two issues that were bothersome - the slow elevators and the lack of a laundry room/machines.  This hotel seems on the par with other moderate Disney resorts.    There is more convenience and amenities when staying at the higher end resorts, but that's why you pay more to stay at them.  Rooms were clean/fresh and pool was well kept - not much else to ask for since you are there for the parks.

This was our 7th trip to disney- 3rd "on property". If we could afford the California Grand, we would,(but cant)  so  we chose  paradise pier.  I like staying on property, but the hotels across from disney are alot shorter walk. The bad thing about staying on property is they have your "trapped" as far as walking to any little stores, so you really have to spend your $ there. When you stay across the street , you can walk to some little stores and stock your fridge. I liked the paradise pier hotel and I liked how clean it was. The rooms are nice and we had a great view of the theme park.  The biggest perk was to be able to cut through the "Grand Hotel" to get to private entrance of california adventure. When we go again I would save my $ and stay across the street. Weve stayed

We returned from a 3 night stay at the Paradise Pier (June 11-14).  We visit Disneyland 2 times a year and this was our first stay at one of the 3 Disneyland hotels.  We obtained a AAA discount which you can only obtain by telephone and is not available through the internet (we did not see an option on the Disneyland site).  The discount made it more "reasonable" although it was still more expensive than some of the other surrounding chain hotels, e.g. Hilton, Sheraton, Marriott and Hyatt.  We arrived a little before 10 a.m. but were not able to get a room until 3 pm.  We were allowed to "pre-register" which is where they do everything but give you your room number.  They given you a telephone number that you can dial in to see if your room is ready.  Given that it is summer

Summary Heading: You're Probably Better Off Somewhere Else
Summary: We stayed at the Paradise Pier hotel for two nights in April.  Our party consisted of my wife and I.  We booked the room through Disney using an annual pass special.  Location: The Paradise Pier is located in the southwest section of the Disneyland resort and is around the same distance to the parks as the Disneyland hotel.  It is less than a ten-minute walk from the hotel to the parks.  The bad thing about the walk is you either have to cross a busy street to get to the Grand Californian, or basically walk through a parking lot to get to Downtown Disney.  Being next to Downtown Disney there are plenty of shopping and dining options.  Basically if you’re on a Disneyland vacation, the Paradise Pier is in a pretty good spot.  Outside Appearance/Lobby:  Both the outside of the

I have no real complaints about the hotel but nothing great to say either.  It was Okay. The room was a little tired (carpets seemed a bit dirty), sofa was a bit shabby, the room was clean enough but not sparkling, the pool was a little cold, there was almost no "Disney" atmosphere.   Nothing horrible, just okay.  For half the price, I would have been happier.  We had 2 adjoining rooms @ close to $300 each per night once taxes and resort fee were added onto the bill.  I think for $1200 for 2 nights, there must be way better choices.  Next time, I'd either step up, hold my breath and stay at the Grand Californian and not look at the bill or stay somewhere else, likely have a much nicer room and save major money.  Yes, it's close to Disneyland but I'm not sure it was worth Double

This was our second stay at the Paradise Pier hotel.  Our first stay was for one night just to sleep so we thought we would try it out again for a longer period of time.  This stay was for 3 nights and we were not disappointed.  Overall the hotel is very clean and the staff seemed friendly.  My two boys, ages 3 and 6, loved the pool area.  My 3 year old spent all of his time in the 1 foot deep toddler pool area and loved every minute of it while my 6 year old spent all of his time on the water slide and loved every minute of that!  The pool at the Disneyland hotel is bigger and has a disney theme, but if you have kids that aren't great swimmers yet, the one at the Paradise Pier is better suited.  It also seemed like there were more life guards on duty, which was definitely a

Queensland  - Australian Travelers 25th April  -   3rd May  2008 Arrived at the hotel around 1:00 pm after a long flight from Australia, and were happy to find that our room was ready no lines for check in, staff were great. We had a room on the 13th floor overlooking California Adventure park which was fantastic.  The room had 2 queen beds and a fold our sofa bed which was great as we had our two boy with us aged 13 and 16 years. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, as we found a fantastic place just down the road called Coco's, great food and very well priced. We did however eat and drink from the bar/cafe at the hotel which I found was well priced and had a nice selection of slices and cakes. The shop in the hotel lobby was well equipped with everyday items you my require

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay,but rooms extremely overpriced for what they are
Summary: My wife and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel for a wonderful Disneyland vacation.We booked through Getawaytoday.com. This was our first stay at a Disney hotel, and overall I would say we enjoyed it. The  Hotel staff was fantastic and very friendly, giving us both buttons for our 10th wedding anniversary, as well as a 1st visit button for myself despite this being my 2nd visit. The hotel was easy to find from I-5 and parking was a breeze. We had no trouble with the elevators as others seemed to have. The Room was absolutely fine, no issues at all.Very nice standard room. (Well, a microwave would've been nice but we brought our own.) We requested and got a king size bed,which was a little firmer than I like, but  it was fine. It is my opinion that the

What a wonderful, magical place. Everything and everybody was great. Our room was large, comfortable and clean. The staff so friendly and helpful. Being that my wife and I are getting awfully close to 50 and having no children with us, didn't expect to be treated so well, but we were treated like royalty. We couldn't help going about with a smile all the time. Room service was great. The short walk to the parks didn't bother us in the least.

Stayed May 13-17th, room 808, with a view of Disney California Adventure Park. Nice staff, helped me print boarding passes at guest services which was a BIG help. Could hear lots of road noise and on a Grad night when the park was open all night could hear teens screaming on the rides - luckily we brought ear plugs. Could hear the neighbors too one night-their kids were jumping on the beds the beds hit our wall and it was obnoxious. Luckily, they quieted down before we went to bed. The pool was small compared to the Disneyland Hotel, but my daughter liked it just fine and liked the big slide too. We used the Disneyland Hotel pool too with the permission of the hotel staff. We had no problems with the elevators at all. We used the glass elevator a lot, that may have helped. The

After a stay at the Grand Californian, no other Disney hotel (in CA) can compare...except they are a lot cheaper. So we tried the PP, it was just ok, not horrible, people were semi friendly, it was crowded, slow elevators, rooms felt a little old, average pool. But easy walk to parks! And parking was wonderfully easy. Also when you stay at Disney properties, the tickets are discounted, savings of $120 for a family of four! That is nothing to sneeze at! We stayed one night on property and the rest off property, worked out great!

I stayed at the Paradise Pier for 3 nights while at a convention in Anaheim.   I love Disney and have stayed at the Disneyland hotel before.   I thought this was a wonderful hotel- the room was comfortable and quiet- the walk to Downtown Disney was convenient.  I did find the elevators were slow but it wasn’t unreasonable and certainly wouldn’t prevent me from staying here.  The glass elevator does provide a little faster service to get to your floor.   I would definitely stay here again.   The price is cheaper than the Disneyland Hotel but the amenities were just as great.   Dinner at Yamabuki was also a great experience- the service and food was terrific.

Summary Heading: Elevators take forever. Carpets need DEEP cleaning.
Summary: The Pros: Has a nice pool and water slide. Comparable to a Seattle "H" hotel. Has a nice Lilo and Stich Buffet and the characters seem to hang around alot longer for photo op's compared to the Goofy's Kitchen. If you want to be at a "Disney" hotel, it's the least expensive of the three and priced so. The Cons: Life guards need to lighten up. My son's once white socks were black at the end of the day from walking on the carpet in the room. Resturant and room service not available all day, limited hours. Took a LONG time to board elevators.

Once again, Disney exceeded our expectations!  I checked into the hotel and was asked where the rest of my party was.  The front desk attendant asked me to get the rest of my party because he had some "magic" for us!  As excited as I possibly could be, I rounded up the rest of my group to find out that we were selected as the Big Kahuna family that day and received a picture in a very nice picture frame, free rice krispy treats to be delivered to our room that night!  This was a trip celebrating my son's 8th birthday and father's 65th birthday - and what a great treat this was!  Our room was HUGE and overlooked the park!  We ended up canceling the second room reservation because we were all easily accomodated in the suite!  The fireworks desplay from the room was spectacular not

This is a great hotel.  Even though it is the furthest away from the parks out of the 3 Disneyland Resort hotels, it was also the quietest as it is away from the hustle and bustle.  The rooms are very nice and clean and the staff is typcial cast member friendly.  I had a great time and so did my 2 year old son.  We can't wait to go back.

Summary Heading: Wonderful Experience at the Paradise Pier
Summary: While my husband was up in the mountains for a convention I took our son and two of his friends to Disneyland this last weekend.  Three 16 year old boys...was I nuts?!          In the past our family usually stays at the Disneyland Hotel or the Grand Californian. Since we're taking our first trip to Orlando this summer I didn't want to spend lots of $$$ for the Disney experience.  I read on Mouseplanet /MouseEars or something like that about a Southern Californian locals only discount rate at Disney properties.  I've never done Priceline,but our rate of $179 seemed fair (for Disney).     When making the reservation I informed the gal that we'd be celebrating 2 of the boys 16th birthdays.  She asked me their names and said she'd see if she could do something special.     So, last

Husband, teenage son and myself stayed here for 4 nights. Wanted to be close to parks and have Disney amenities. Booked the Concierge level and upon checkin upgraded to suite with Park view.  Beds, furniture and view nice. Bathroom tolietries sub standard.  Concierge club had great snacks all day and good food at dinner time. Could get sodas, boxed juice and water all day. Concierge available from 8 am -8 pm  Easy walking distance to parks/Downtown Disney. Could use the Grand Californian entrance to get into parks. Laundry self serve available only at Disneyland hotel.  Enjoyed the Mandara spa while boys had father/son time. Typical spa experience from Steiner (cruiseship spa provider).   Watch for the nightly "resort fee", not advertised, incudes the use of parking, internet

My wife I and stayed here for a 4 night stay.  I am not going to say that there weren't some small problems with our stay but the Disney magic out weighs those negatives.  The location to the two parks is worth the extra money of staying on the Disney property.  I don't know how most people travel to Disneyland but when I go to Disneyland I open the park and close the park.  I don't spend by days in my hotel room watching TV.  Is that wrong?  The best way to get into the parks is through the Grand Californian lobby and into California Adventures.   We timed our walk from the entrance to Disneyland through California Adventures and through the Grand Californian to the Hotel and it took us 7 minutes.  Also staying at the hotel gives us the opportunity to take the monorail into the

Summary Heading: LIked This Place - Low Key and Easy
Summary: I stayed here with my 10-year old daughter April 6-10 on a package deal booked through Costco on-line (and then thru Disney).  I was pleasantly surprised - as I previously stayed at the Disneyland hotel and was disappointed.  We arrived Sunday at about 2 PM - short line to check in - extremely proficient check-in with detailed information provided including how to use the Disney gift cards.  She recommended I charge everything to my room and pay off with gift cards at check out (and add'l credit card if needed).  I asked for a room with a view of California Adventures and they gladly accomodated me with a free upgrade.  We were on the 12th floor and liked taking the glass elevator up!  The rooms were well appointed - 2 comfie queen beds & sofa bed (didn't try this out), a small

Watch out, bed bugs in room 427.  The staff was not helpful in the situation.  There was not great concern on the hotel's part.  The rest of the experience was fine, but the big red itchy welts were not a fun going away present.

Just returned from a two night stay at Paradise Pier. Checked in 8am no line. Staff was very nice however our room was not ready until after 3pm but that is normal check in time. Our room was very clean with 2 queen beds and a twin sleeper sofa for a family with three young children it worked well. The room had a small refrigerator and coffee maker. Great water slide for children who are not strong swimmers because the slide is not attached to the swimming pool so water is only about a foot deep. One nice thing about this resort is that the pool and spa are open at 6am.  We stayed at the Disneyland hotel and did not realize that the spa was in the pool area that does not open till late morning. Two complaints. One is the elevators going from your room to lobby  took forever

I hadnt been to Disney in over 20 years and Against my better judgement, I booked at Paradise Pier for location. While traveling with a 4 year old, I thought that staying on the Disney Property would provide a little more magic to the experience.  It may have at one of the other two Disney Hotels.  (more money and totally booked 3 weeks out).  The Paradise Pier offered nothing more by way of ammenities than that which you could find down the street.  The location of the Paradise Pier is only SLIGHTLY closer in walking distance to Downtown Disney and the main park entrances than the main drag Hotel Row acrossed the street.... the hefty price tag per night does not at all make up for a SLIGHTLY closer walk.  Then there is the lousy service.  Our room wasnt ready til after 4 on day

My family of four stayed here3/29-4/2, 2008. We drove a long distance to Disneyland (20 hours), so we wanted to park the van & be able to walk to DL & DCA. We had never stayed "on property" before & thought it would be the ultimate DL experience. It was not. We have no real complaints, but at $1100.00 + for four nights, I would not recommend it. We had a standard room with a parking lot view. I had been advised that if you kindly ask for an upgrade, you may be accomodated, but no such luck for us. They said "we'll see what we can do.." & never mentioned it again. Additionally, I had called ahead to Disney's planning service, which is much touted, but we were disappointed. I purchased a $112.00 Mickey & Minnie Welcome basket- totally not worth it, either. Then they ruined the

Summary Heading: $ star price, 2 star HOTEL-  STINGY STINGY STINGY
Summary: I travel around the world for work, and have stayed at a wide variety of locations from single star to 5 star.  I think Paradise Pier is very overpriced, and even feels like it cheats you for what you get!!!  We thought the location with a 4 year old would be worth it, but what we got was 4 adults crammed into too small a space with shoddy amenitites.    The location lets you have access to the park, but no access to the less expensive food options--- traps you into paying a fortune for terrible quality!!!!!!!!!  The food was mediocre at best, and overpriced.  The bath fan was broken, the pool was to windy to use, the toilet paper was single ply scratchy, even the shampoo was to stinky to use - smelled like grandma lolas perfume yuck!!!!  The cleaning service was terrible, and

The hotel was in a great location, but certainly wasn't worth the price and lack of customer service.  The hotel would have been just fine, but heaven forbid you have a problem which needs resolved.  Our room wasn't ready upon check-in...we waited for hours, with young children.  Be forewarned with the 3pm check-in time- it doesn't apply to suites, which was ridiculously priced.
