You think the hotel staff would make the stay more enjoyable for the amount of money the suites cost.  Our key never worked in the door because there was a problem with the electrical component on the door.  The engineering team came, said the lock was "dirty" and cleaned the electronics.  We were still unable to get into the room the following morning, so the issue was certainly not resolved.  After a

Summary Heading: Just Can't Recommend it. Too many small things just add up to wrong.
Summary: Stayed at The Paradise Pier two nights for a trip to Disneyland/DCA. Have previously stayed at other hotels in the immediate park area. Picked Paradise Pier (PP) this time for easy access to park. Overall rather disappointed. There were no horrid situations just lots of little things that added up to a negative impression. I don't see bringing my famly back here again. Glitch:Check-in was very slow.  First a long line to check-in at 2:30 in the afternoon. 4 people checking people in (one in training?). All equally slow. The desk clerk took forever to get thru the process. It seemed the clerk was trained to explain/describe every feature of the great room we received, the great price, the great features of the facility, etc. Much of the spiel seemed an advertisment for all things

As a regular at Walt Disney World (usually stay at Beach/Yach club or AK Lodge) I was a bit puzzled as to which property to pick in Anaheim. I went for paradise pier based on location, and because i thought the Grand Californian seemed overpriced for just 3 nights. We were spot on. The Paradise Pier is less than 5 minutes walk from the Grand Californian, (you literally just cross the street), which directly connects to California Adventure and Downtown Disney. Or you can go out the back way straight into Downtown Disney, which connects to both parks...or just jump on the monorail 3 minutes from the back door, which will deliver you into Tomorrowland - the fastest way to get to that Finding Nemo line!  The hotel itself  - yes, its nothing special of the hugely themes WDW variety

I would loke to thank each any everyone of the staff that I had dealings with when I stayed as each and every one were aa delight to deal with. The hotel was great even though the decor was a bit dated, but that didn't matter as it was very clean. I found the hotel to be in a good location, we walked to the parks everyday. The charcater breakfast was brilliant, my two year really enjoyed that.I really liked they way our bed was turned down every night and each night they left little treats on the bed, nice touch. Overall staying here really mad our holiday.

We booked this property because we wanted a suite.  Nothing worse than staying with a 3 year old and a 3 months old in a regular room!  So we stayed for 3 nights in room 522.  Suite with two rooms/two bathrooms.  Very nice.  Room was great. Although right outside our window was a busy street so I wouldn't pick that suite again.  But I would stay at Paradise Pier again.  Bring your walking shoes because it's a bit of a hike (about 15 mins) to the main gates at Disneyland and California Adventure Park.  Didn't bother me but just so you know.  One of the great things about the hotel is the breakfast with the characters in the hotel cafe. Minne Mouse, Daisy Duck and Lilo & Stitch. Lots of fun.

MARCH 24&25 2008 My Wife and I took our grandkids to disneyland to Paradise Pier Hotel. We had a 1Br. suite actually it was 3 rooms 2 queens 1 king and a living room. there was only 4 of us but we figured we could fit 8 people in the rooms. 15th floor what a view looking over Cal adv.park. rooms great clean large very very nice. Everyone at Disney are always smiling and happy the kids loved it. One of the best vacations we had in years. pool alittle crowded and small but you can use Disneyland hotel pool if you want. suggestion make rev for dinner everynight long wait. Made rev. at Rainforest Cafe 6:00pm got right in we heard them say there was a 2 1/2 hr wait.

Paradise Pier was a great place to stay and we would stay here again.  The rooms were very clean and offered enough space  for all of us.  There were two queen beds and futon/ couch.  The beds were pretty comfortable.  Disneyand, the Adventure Park, and downtown disney are in walking distance of the hotel.    We a had a great experience.

I titled my review the way I did because if this place was anywhere else besides right in the middle of one of the greatest places on earth... I wouldn't pay more than $89 a night for this less than average hotel!   Where shall I start... I think I will go from the beginning, rather from worst to first...  The parking structure is WAAAY too small and cramped with two way traffic the entire way through it -- meaning, if you screw up and go up... you need to somehow negotiate a U-turn and make your way all the way back down and out! Also -- if you don't stay at this hotel, DON'T PARK HERE! It's WAAAAY Expensive!!! Especially to use the valet!!  The front desk area is very VERY SMALL with next to nothing to keep the screaming and excited kids busy. There is little place for all the

We are within 20 minutes of the Disneyland Resort but decided to stay the weekend there.  We had a wonderful room with a view of Disney's California Adventure theme park.  The room was spacious and tastefully decorated and even had a couch/daybed.  The monorail is a convenient way to travel between Disneyland and the hotel.  Also, walking thru Downtown Disny is another way to get to the park easily.  On the day of check out we spent all day at the hotel pool.  The kids had a lot of fun on the waterslide.  Oh, and if you want an inexpensive place to eat on the property the lounge on the main floor has a small menu but excellent food under $10.

Summary Heading: This is not a Disney Experience
Summary: The service was good but room itself needs some upgrades.  The a/c unit was pretty loud, bathroom had mold growing on the wall behind the door,  The plumbing and toilet are very old and it looks like proper maintenance isn't being done.  The bedspreads were old and pilled, and the quality of carpeting and furnishing weren't what I'd expect of a Disney Hotel. Glad we only spent one overpriced night.

Summary Heading: Lack of concern for guests comfort.
Summary: Our room was beautiful, but service was greatly lacking.  We visited in February, so we were expecting some construction to be going on.  We were right, the pool was under construction.  Our room was directly above the very cool looking rooftop pool area.  At 7am on the last day of our trip, a jackhammer woke us up... the earsplitting noise was making our room shake!  My four year old was scared out of his skin!  When I called the front desk to complain they told that they couldn't do anything about it.   They had a permit to work that early.  Oh yeah, and when we were looking out at the construction workers, they were laughing at us!  I will not stay in a Disneyland hotel again after this experience; there are way too many other hotels in the immediate vicinity to choose from.

Loved loved loved this hotel. A short walk to downtown disney and they play music along the way. The best part is the view of the park from the upper levels and the fireworks show. You can sit out by the pool and see them perfectly, plus they play the soundtrack over the speakers out there. The view is probably better than in the park and there is less of a crowd. Yes there are ALOT of kids at this hotel but come on it is disneyland. I would recommend this hotel for families especially but also for anyone wanting to have fun.

Disney's Paradise Pier wasn't our first choice of hotels, but our first choice, Disney's Grand Californian, which is right across the street, was $80/night more.  As resort guests, we could enter the parks through the Grand Californian's entrance, as well as receiving other guest benefits, so we opted for the more "reasonable" ($$$$) hotel. We have a lot of experience with Disney hotels so we didn't approach it with high expectations.  When we pulled up to check in and no valet - at all - was on duty and the valet desk was unmanned, we didn't get riled; we just waited.  We didn't have to wait to check in, and the front desk clerk was pleasant and helpful, but why does it always take fifteen minutes to check in to a Disney hotel (other hotels do it in five)?  When we went up to

My family and I stayed at the Paradise Pier February 11-15.  My niece joined us at the last minute so there ended up being six of us all together-four kids (ages 5-12) and my husband and I.  We arrived early Monday morning and our room wasn't ready yet but they prechecked us in.  They were very friendly and gave me balloons and an autographed picture of the Disney princesses because my daughter told them it was my birthday.  We called later at around 2:00 and found out our room was ready for us.    The room was just a standard room, but the check-in woman must have realized what a big crew we were because she put us in a corner room that had a lot of extra space and a decent view of DCA.  It was clean and well maintained.  The bathtub faucet wouldn't always turn off all the way,

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay, can't wait to come back!!
Summary: We stayed here at the beginning of November for one night, and we were not disappointed. Upon arrival we were a little early and our room wasn't ready, so we went to Disneyland for a few hours and came back. When we did, we were informed that we had been chosen as "The Big Kahuna Family", lol!!!   They gave us balloons, got our picture taken in front of the goofy and given a keepsake frame, an autographed photo of the characters, and 4 trading pins! We were upgraded to a family suite, had a wonderful view overlooking the California Adventure Park, got turndown service with chocolates, the whole experience we had there was very Disney!! The room was very spacious with a living area and a dining table, a separate bedroom area, two bathrooms, a tv in each room, a desk area.  We

Summary Heading: We Love the Paradise Pier Hotel
Summary: We loved our stay at the Paradise Pier! We arrived around 11 am for check in and asked nicely for a free room upgrade and was given a room with a view overlooking California Adventure. Our room was ready right when we got there and was very clean with plenty of blankets and pillows. I thought it was a very nice size and the beds were comfortable. One of the things I really liked about this hotel was you couldn't hear other people's plumbing. I hate it when you can here someone in the room above you or next to you taking a shower. This hotel was nice and quite. I also enjoyed the lounge/coffee area downstairs. It was a great place to read a book while I was waiting for my family to wake up in the morning. It was a short walk to the monorail and the walk to DCA wasn't too bad

My mother and teenage daughter and I wanted a night away, so we found a great rate on a night at Paradise Pier.  We checked in quickly without a wait at 1:30 on a Sunday afternoon.  The room wasn't ready yet, so we headed over to Disneyland for a visit to the Tiki Room and Jungle Cruise and by 2:30 the room was ready.  We had a wonderful room on the 11th floor overlooking California Adventure.  It was different from any other room I've stayed on in this property, it had 2 windows and the furniture was at an angle in the room.  It was a big room!  We had a fun time watching the setting sun cast shadows over the park and watching the Electric Light Parade from our window.  My mother slept in one bed, I slept in the other and my daughter took the day bed.  Everyone was happy.  We

We had a wonderful time at this hotel. The room was spacious and the room, bedding and bathroom were extremely clean. The staff were very pleasant and went out of their way to assist. We had problems with out shuttlebus and they rang our travel agent in Australia at no charge to sort out the problem! The location was fantastic, a couple of minutes walk to Down Town Disney and quick access to both theme parks. A truly wonderful experience. Well worth staying on site.

A true Disny experience. Location is excellent, rooms nice size and clean. But this is the no trills hotel on the resort. The excitement is at the original Disneyland Hotel and the place "to be seen lounging" is the Grand Californian  Location is great. A 2 minute walk to Downtown Disney.   Do not pay extra for the "view" room.

This hotel is its own magical experience.  Very clean and super friendly staff.  All of the staff was very engaging and went out of their way to make our stay extra special.  Everywhere you looked the hotel was spotless.  The amenities were great, pool open even in the winter (85 degrees), quick and efficient bell and valet staff. We did make a bit of a hike into Disneyland each day, but well worth it for the service.

Summary Heading: My first and last stay at Paradise Pier
Summary: To sum up our experience,  it was terrible and I will never stay at this hotel again.  The first room we were in smelled very musty, it was on the 11th floor, so they moved us to another room on the 7th floor.  Upon putting a few items in the fridge, we noticed that there was food left over from the previous guests.  I called the front desk and they moved us to a suite on the 15th floor.  The sheets in this room had blood stains on them.  There were many other things that went wrong but they attempted to fix them.  The staff is not nearly as friendly as the staff at Grand Californian.    Perhaps  it was a matter of staying at the GC prior to staying at PP.  It is a cute hotel in the lobby, but the rooms are a different story.  I think it is worth it to spend a little extra and

Our family of three stayed at Paradise Pier (PP) from December 10 – December 14, 2007.    Exterior  The hotel’s exterior is attractive.  One thing you know will be top notch with Disney is anything that has to do with vegetation; the plant variety is stunning.  The hotel is tall and easy spot from Disney’s California Adventure Park (DCA) and Downtown Disney (DD).  The premises was free of trash and very well kept.  Lobby  The hotel lobby seemed a tad-bit quaint.  While this results in a very cozy atmosphere in the offseason, I can see the same lobby area becoming a mad house during the busy summer.  What little available room there was in the lobby was taken up by a tall Disney-esque Christmas tree.  On the far side of the Christmas tree was Paradise Pier’s best kept secret: a

Summary Heading: Great Hotel especially for the kids
Summary: We loved staying at this hotel.  We arrived at the hotel about 2 PM and checked right in with no problems.  The cast member was pleasant and gave the kids stickers.  Bell hops took our luggage right up to our room.  We self parked because it was a bit pricey to valet park.  Parking lot was right outside of our door so there was not much of a walk to the car.  We didn't need it anyway.  The hotel was a 5 minute walk to the monorail - not far at all.  It actually wasn't too bad of a walk to the main gates either - maybe 10 minutes.  As guests we had early entry into Disneyland on Monday and Tuesday.  The rooms were decent sized.  We had a standard room.  There were 3 adults, 2 kids, and a baby in our room and we all slept comfortably.  We had 2 queen beds and the couch folded into

Summary Heading: Beach Boys BLAHS, but still fun in the sun at the Pier!
Summary: During our stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel, we experienced great service from employees; a cheerful, clean, large room with a spectacular view overlooking Disney's California Adventure, the Grand Californian Hotel, and some of Disneyland; lots of family fun; and some nice, unexpected magical moments.  But I swear, if I hear another Beach Boys song, I'm going to go CRAZY!!!  Hearing the same Beach Boys songs over and over, day after day, both inside the hotel and outside by the pool, is a cruel form of TORTURE!   Please, please, oh dear Mickey Mouse or Tinkerbell or whomever, I beg you, PLEASE change the music there!  How about some V-A-R-I-E-T-Y?!  Yes folks, some beach music variety I think would do the trick.  Can't be too hard to add in a few ,or might I suggest MANY more

Summary Heading: Great Hotel!! Would for sure go back with family!!
Summary: We stayed for 10 nights at the Paradise Pier Hotel.   We had a view room on the eighth floor. Clean room.  Spacious for 4 of us. Two queen beds.  The sofa bed folded out into a quant single bed for which the kids traded nightly for.  We stocked the fridge with lunches and breakfast from the Von's food store.   The closet was huge.  The kids would even have fun changing in it when the bathroom was occupied.  The location was great to get to the park.  We have two school aged  kids who handled the walk through Downtown Disney to the main gates or to the monorail just fine.   You can also cross the street and cut through the Grand California Hotel to the California Adventure Park even quicker.  The pool was great.  The kids loved the slide. At night you can see the fire works from

I really enjoyed this hotel,  I thought that it was well maintained and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  I was going to Disneyland at a time when they were offering a promotion of a $150 gift card if you stayed on site and upon my check in they were having trouble getting us our gift card so they could not give it to me right away,  the friendly girl at the check in counter promised me she would take care of it and that she would call my cell phone as soon as I could get my gift card,  true to her word she called me about an hour later,  she also upgraded my room for free which gave us a wonderful view of California Adventure as well as a little gift bag for my son with some fun mickey treats and a small toy.  The room was comfortable and spacious and even the pull out

The hotel and staff were wonderful! I stayed there from 10/21-10/28. The hotel was nice and refreshing from the typical gloomy WA weather. I will pretty much get down to the facts cause thats what you want, not the story behind it all. Ok lets get started...  Staff was very professional, very helpful and nice. Housekeeping was great. If you were in the room they would just come back later. Elevators wasn't a major problem for me because I was on the top floor, however there are 4 elevators, and at night it was a little crouded where you wait for them in the lobby. It is not that much farther of a walk to Disneyland than if you were to stay at the Grand Californian hotel. You are right across the street from the Grand Californian, and you just cut through the lobby. I did

First to note is that we didn't pick this hotel. My clever wife won a competition that including stay at this hotel for 5 nights. I had a four year old, a three year old and 9 month year old staying with my wife and I, and my mother in an adjoining room. Each room consisted of two queen size beds. The room was ameniable but nothing special. The only thing Disney being a Mickey lamp. We had a view over the pool. We got our coffee renewed once during our stay and on our last night we received some cup cakes. Service was okay but nothing special. The pool was good and included a spa and a large but quite tame water slide which our 3 and 4 year old went down without assistance. Life guards were on duty and life jackets were available to the kids. Overall this was a great pool

We live in San Diego so this is a road trip for us.  We spent Saturday night at this hotel before a full day at both Disneyland parks on Sunday.  We wanted to arrive early Saturday to enjoy some time at the hotel before having dinner and shopping at Downtown Disney.  This didn't happen.  Check in time is 3pm and they mean it.  We could not get in our room early and actually it wasn't ready at 3pm and we had to hassle them to give us a different room at 3:15pm.  Our problem with this is there is not much to do at this hotel while waiting for your room.  There is a cafe which is more like a snack bar with very little to offer.  The room was adequate, we paid extra for a view of California Adventures which was nice.  Note that the elevators are easily overwhelmed in the morning

We arrived at the hotel on 10/16/07.  The hotel was above what we expected it to be.  It is close to all the things a person needs.  The rooms are clean and room service was great.  The view from our room on the 12th floor was a spectacular view of the park.  The whole stay we came back to our room from Disneyland to find our rooms cleaned and ready for another pleasant rest from the day.  Just enough room for a family of four.  The fitness room satisfied my needs to get rid of all the bad/good food from the night before at Disneyland.  The services downstairs was great and everybody treated you with a smile and made you feel like you were the only person there.  The elevators are a tad bit slow.  I have owned turtles faster than the elevators.

For our family's first trip to Disneyland, I decided long in advance that I would "splurge" and stay at one of the Disney properties.  I chose PP because the Grand Calif. seemed too spendy and not as child-friendly in theme; and I had read negative things about the Disneyland hotel (peeling wallpaper, faded pixiedust ceilings, etc) So I chose the PP with the California Adventure View.   We stayed 3 nights and paid $279 each night that included the view.  I hoped when we arrived at the hotel we would have been met instantly with some of that Disney Magic but we got nothing of the sort.  It was just a flat, average, business-like check in.  Even when we told the staff it was our first ever visit to disney, no one seemed to care.  That continued for the rest of the visit.  No

Paradise Pier was a 50th birthday trip I shared with my granddaughter, daughter and husband. After a slow check in, we arrived at 2pm and didn't get into our room till 3:30pm.   It then went much better.  We were delighted once we got into our room!!. The room is fun, it had a view of California Adventure, which my granddaughter loved!!! The bathroom had fresh flowers and mickey soaps.  That evening we had chocolates and turn down service. Nice touch. We had treats delivered by a cast member. Very nice touch!  The rooftop pool and big yellow slide was the highlight of the trip for my 4 year old granddaughter. She is  a SoCal/ Disney aficianado. So that slide made quite an impression. It would have been nicer if they were not assembling the towel holders right at the pool.  The

We had a nice time at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel.  This was our first trip to Disney with our kids (aged 6 & 4).  Our trip was for two nights.  The Hotel Not a luxury hotel, but an adequate, family friendly resort.  This hotel is NOT in the park itself and you have to walk a bit to enter the park (cross the street & cut through the Grand Californian Hotel).  In general, we were satisfied with the facilities but did not have a chance to explore the pool, game room, etc.  Upon check in, they left coloring books and some Disney masks for the kids.  There was two double beds and a day bed in our room.  Uninspiring parking lot view from one of the higher floors that our room was on.  There are TONS of hotels in Anaheim and the city itself and the sheer volume of tourists is a bit

I stayed here three nights and could not have been any happier! The staff was SUPER friendly and upgraded me for free after I said I'd be willing to pay for one. The view into California Adventure was to die for and is worth every penny you pay! The staff is friendly and the location could not be any better! The room itself was quite nice, tasteful theme decorations with VERY comfortable beds! One of the best hotels I've stayed in!
We were there from Sept 1-5th with our kids (4 years and 8 months). The rooms were OK, the service horrible.

We stayed at Disneyland Paradise Pier for 1 night. Nothing really special for the price. It is just a regular hotel room. The staff are ok but not as friendly as the Residence Inn at Marriot that we stayed. The positive side is: its room is clean and the bed is comfortable, the rooftop waterslide is fun. I feel that the Residence Inn at Marriot Anaheim is a better place to stay.

I really liked the fact that it wasn't has heavily themed as the Disney hotels I have stayed in in Orlando.  I thought the room was so much bigger than I expected, this might be as it's older so built a big bigger perhaps.  I really liked the large windows overlooking the park.  Close to the Downtown Disney area for eating out so aside from the character breakfast we didn't eat at the hotel.  The bar right by reception was a little lifeless but a good just for a drink after the drive from LAX!   I liked the little touches such as all the Disney toiletries and chocolates in our room. Staff really helpful.  I would recommend staying here no problem.

We arrived late (11pm) on the first night.   The check-in was ok but slow.   The lady said she would call the bell boy to help with luggage (we had a lot as we have 2 kids) however the bell boy never came, so we ended up ferrying all the bags up to our room ourselves which was not great at when ended up being 11:30/11:45 at night (after a full day at disneyland).  Not a great first impression of the hotel.  The room was clean and spacious enough with a nice view of the California adventure park.  The other negative was when I asked the front desk to try make a reservation for me at the Rain Forest cafe.   Admittedly it was 7:30pm and we were asking for a reservation for 8pm - but they were VERY negative and almost did not even want to try.  I had to hang around the front desk

Summary Heading: Still a nice Place to stay...
Summary: We are annual passholders, so I keep an eye out for those AP rates. This fall we've begun our stays with one here at this hotel. We've stayed here before, and this time opted at the last minute to upgrade our stay to concierge. I was glad since I called the same morning to do it. We stayed one night on Aug 25th.  It came in really handy since I hung out in the lounge waiting for our room to be ready and my sister who was meeting me there.  Watched a couple of movies and had goodies. There is also WiFi. They offered pretzels, goldfish and fruit, drinks and a few things I can't remember during off food times.  We got out room - 1427 - and about the only weird thing with it was that the closet was in the bathroom...not good if you had a full room of people.  We had room service -

We recently (late August) stayed at Paradise Pier for 3 days/2 nights.  Although this was our first trip to Disneyland, we regularly vacationed at Disney World and stayed at their resorts many times.    Although not the nicest Disney resort I've ever stayed at, I found this resort to be ideally located and a good value.    Check-in was a breeze.  Within 5 minutes we were checked-in and on our way to our room.  Since we booked the package through Disney, we already had our park passes and other items.  The room was your basic hotel room.  I did like that internet access was included in our package.    We didn't use the resturants or pool at this hotel, but both looked nice.    Regarding proximity to the parks, I thought neither was too far of a walk.  At check-in, they provided

Summary Heading: Great place, best Disney Resort in Anaheim!
Summary: Ok, we spent at least 2 nights here once a month. This has to be the best Disneyland Resort in Anaheim. The best rooms are the Theme Park view. If you are staying here spend that little extra in order to get theme park view.   You get a great view of the Electrical Parade and you can hear the music in your television.   Not a lot of people know this, but you can also see and hear (theme music) the fireworks from the pool area.  I know the resort has 2 different restaurants on the premises, Yamabuki, we have never tried and we have had breakfast with Lilo and Stitch, which is an all you can eat buffet with character dining the food is ok and we have also had dinner here, the kids were able to make their own pizza and this was wonderful, but they never ate their pizza.   Well,

Summary Heading: Our First Stay at a Disney Hotel . . .
Summary: After several trips to Disneyland with our young children, we decided to splurge this summer on a stay at one of the Disneyland hotels.  We booked the Paradise Pier, it usually being the least expensive of the three Disney hotels.  It was clean, but nothing special. Prior to this, we'd always stayed at a Good Neighbor hotel.  The Howard Johnson was just as nice, much less expensive, maybe a smidgen further of a walk from the Disneyland Park, but much closer to inexpensive eateries.  We ended up spending a lot more on food this time.  The pool at the Pier is not as nice as the other two Disney hotels.  We probably wouldn't plan to stay here again, but also wouldn't complain if we had to.  We still want to try the other Disney hotels, but if we were on a budget we wouldn't

Summary Heading: Nice touchs but not worth the money
Summary: The Disney's Paradise Pier is just ok.  We had a few problems at check in.  The rooms are nice and clean and the beds are fairly comfortable. The y have a cute little turn down service.  We booked the concierge rooms that allowed us access to the Beachcombers club.  In there we could get drinks, snacks, continental breakfast and hor derves.  It was a nice feature but the hours are not convienant  and for the money we shelled out for our trip I think they could have been more accommodating.  Also the walk to the park although not that far was a lot after you have been in the parks all day.

I did not pay for or arrange the stay at this hotel -- my host did. The view of California Adventure Park was the best "perk" in our 13th Floor room (evidently, we paid extra for the park view). Another plus: during the evening fireworks you can sit at the hotel's pool level and view the show as well as listen to the piped in sounds of Julie Andrew's voice from Disneyland park.  This hotel isn't anything special -- this rooms are small. There was a tiny refrigerator (appreciated!) and an in-room safe (for an extra fee). Additional pillows and blankets are in the closet. Ice machine is down the hall -- with $2.75 bottles of water available in the adjacent vending machine.   Check-in was quick but only resulted in a "call back" token good for many hours later. (We arrived at noon;

In the past we have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and Disney’s Grand Californian Hotel.  For this trip we decided to stay at Disney’s Paradise Pier Hotel.  We booked two nights concierge level with a “City view”.  We tried to book a park view but they were all sold out.    We arrived at 11:30am and check our luggage with the bell captain.  We checked in but were told that the room was not available until 3:00pm which was ok since we wanted to go to the parks.   We were given all of the literature and a set of keys and told to call back at 3:00pm to see if the room was available.  We went to the concierge suite and grabbed some waters and juice for the parks.  At around 3:00pm we called and were told that the room was ready and give the room number.  Since it was hot and humid

--Book your trip and special dining through AAA for discount and nice perks. --We arrived at around 8 AM and checkin wasn't too busy.  Our luggage was stored and we were invited to get continental breakfast.  The desk person spent fifteen minutes acquainting me with AAA perks and tips to enjoy the park. -Room was large, clean, and chocolate coins and Mickey-shaped krispies treats awaited us. -Walk to Disney Calif. Adventure was not bad, about 6 minutes, but it felt worse coming back from long day.  Small price to pay. -I didn't care that our lobby wasn't as decorative as the other properties.  It was clean, functional, and not so big that I couldn't find the elevator. -Good tip here about using lone elevator off to side when many waiting for the 3 that are side by side. --Good

We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel.  We enjoyed our stay.  The rooms were clean and up to date.  The location is terrific.  Entrance to both parks is only a few minute’s walk.  We upgraded to a park view.  The view of California Adventure is nice; however, we spent very little time in our room to enjoy the view.   Don’t expect to get the same Magical feeling at this hotel as you do in a Walt Disney World hotel in Florida.  The staff was cordial but not very adept at accurately performing their jobs.  The cast member who checked us in made two serious errors during the check-in process.  She neglected to give us the park view room that we paid for.  We had to point out the proper room information on the voucher to make sure we had the correct type of room.  She also

This hotel is great! Great views really good service and food. For the people that complain about the walk there is a private entrance at the Grand Californian Hotel to the Parks and you can use it .All you have to do is walk directly across the street and your there. The PCH Grill is great. We were picked as the magic moments table and got free food. Wonderful Decor and overall great feel.I loved it.

Summary Heading: Not what I expected for the price
Summary: We had originally planned a stay across the street at a Harbor Blvd hotel.. take your pick, but my Mother convinced us to stay on Disney Property for the location.  Paradise Pier is not as conveniently located to Disneyland as we expected.  It was a further walk then if we would have stayed across the street!  We had to walk through Grand California to get to the main gates, dumps you out in the middle of Downtown Disney, and with 3 kids under 4 it was a long haul with crowded hallways!! The hotel was always clean, rooms cleaned daily before we returned, pleasant staff.  But for the price I expected more!!  The quality and ammenities were no more than an average 3 star hotel!  We visit DisneyWorld occasionally and there are HUGE advantages in staying on Disney property.... but

We stayed at the Paradise Pier from June 18--21.  We booked this trip through costco.com and got a pretty good deal (we booked 6 months in advance and saved $$$).  When we arrived we were immediately greeted with balloons for our kids, and our luggage was taken in and stored for us  because we checked in early.  The room was not to be ready until 3pm, but they ended up having it ready by 2pm. The hotel also upgraded us to the park view and we had two adjoining rooms.  It was great to look out at the view of the California Adventure Park each evening (even greater that we didn't pay for it!).  We could also see part of the parade and the fireworks from the window. The California Adventure Park is about a 5 minute walk from the Paradise Pier.  You just go out of the lobby, cross

I love staying at Disney hotels because the service is always unparalleled and they are in the most convenient locations to the theme parks.  Our room was large, clean, and I loved having the fridge in the room for restaurant leftovers, and beverages, etc.

I typically stay in Best Westerns, but my mother-in-law booked this hotel for me and my husband during a family trip to Disneyland.  I found the accommodations to be on par with a mid-level Best Western.  The hotel lobby was nice enough, and the concierge and front desk staff were super nice and helpful.  But, the room itself was nothing very nice at all.  The fan in the bathroom didn't work.  We were greeted with a couple of cupcakes, but I don't know how long they'd been there so we didn't eat them.  The pool was very cold and the hot tub smelled very strongly of mildew.  The elevators took an unbelievable amount of time to arrive on the 4th floor and there are three to choose from.  We were forced to take the stairs every day, which deposit you outdoors and on the extreme

Summary Heading: Not the Quality I expected from Disney!
Summary: My family goes to Disneyland every year. We have stayed at the Hyatt , the Howard Johnson's, and the Marriott to name a few. We decided to splurge this year and made a reservation at The Paradise Pier. Not so much of a paradise. We found the service in the PCH Grill to be almost non-existent. Once we got our food, our waitress disappeared. The front desk was ok, but nothing special. We got a room with the view of the street and the back of the California adventure park, which is very noisy.  The shower kept changing temperature from scolding hot to ice cold without touching a thing. We had a rusted shower head, and there was hair on the ceiling of our bathroom. After receiving housekeeping service, I found lipstick on one of the glasses in the bathroom, and let me say it wasn't

We just returned from our 3 night stay at the Paradise Pier and it was far better than I had anticipated.  I read previous reviews and I had mixed feelings about what I should expect, but the stay was excellent.    Disney staff was courteous, rooms were clean, and the atmosphere was just perfect.  We took the whole family (mother in law, nephews, so we booked 2 rooms and PP gave us adjoining rooms.    The walk to the parks is not that far either.  The entrance through the Grand Californian is a giant shortcut and we used that many times.  I had read on many reviews that it was quite a hike to get to the parks, but you need to realize that there is really no shortcuts anywhere.  If your going to Disney, plan on putting some miles on your tennis shoes.  Overall, PP was convenient

Is it just me or if your travelling from afar you want to make sure you choose the right Disney hotel to stay at? We found the Paradise Pier to be a little less understated than the other two.   The pool was fine and it did have a water slide. The California Grand was in true American style over the top.  But if your going to go Disney why not?  It looked like staying in a log cabin and if I went again this is where Id stay.  It was massive though so if your not into that sort of thing the pier may be the place for you. The pier is situated the futherest away but still its not that big a deal to walk to the parks. As for the other Disney hotel I was expecting it to be a bit old and run down but we went into the lobby and it was actually quite appealing.  The pool area was better

Summary Heading: Disney knows how to make you feel good.
Summary: We just got back from a 4nt stay at this hotel. The 5 of us (parents, 3kids aged 15,14,12yrs) had a great time.   When we arrived we were informed that we had been given a free upgrade! Instead of the "carpark view" room that we'd booked, we were given a 1bdrm suite on the 10th floor, AND concierge room access for our whole stay! WOW, WOW, WOW...  We had a great view over the California Adventure Park, and since it was the night of the Pirates of the Caribbean premiere, we could even see a little corner of the giant screen in Disneyland, as well as having a great view of the fireworks they let off at the end of the premiere.  Having access to the concierge lounge was great, and in hindsight I would highly recommend booking it, as it really does give you value for money. The food

We stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel May 13-17, we booked through Disneyland.com with a package deal, and opted for the concierge service. It was well worth the price and the experience will stay with our family (me, hubby, 4 yo daughter, 2 yo son) forever. This was our first trip to Disneyland, and the staff was nice, the rooms were clean and well appointed, and the park view from our 14th floor room was awesome - we watched the Electrical Parade from our window on our first night! Upon arrival, we were chosen as the "Big Kahuna Family" of the day, and given balloons, a signed Mickey print, and Mickey shaped rice krispie treats. That made our stay extra special. The walk to Disney was a hop skip and a jump. Just across the street and through the Grand Californian, you can go

We just returned from a 10 night stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel and had a wonderful time.  We traveled with our 3 year old son and also my mother-in-law.  Upon reading many reviews about this hotel, we were worried about the walking distant to both the Disney Hotel and Grand CA, no problem to walk as they are both less than 5 minutes from Paradise Pier.  They hotel itself was very clean and the staff were very friendly.  When we checked in, my son got two balloons and a sticker book.  The pooled was closed so we got to use the Grand CA pool which was very nice.  Anyone can use the poolside restaurant (Whitewater Snacks) you must try the nachos! We also found an excellent restaurant called Coco's which is straight down from Paradise Pier on the corner of Katella and West Street

Previously I have stayed at the Disneyland and Grand Californian hotels.  Although I like the Disneyland Hotel best, Paradise Pier is a close second. We booked a theme park view and ended up on the 11th floor with a spectacular view of DCA.  Our party left the curtains open all night just to enjoy the lights and to see the Disney cast members spruce up Paradise Pier at 3:00am.    The room was inviting and cheerier than what we experienced at the Grand Californian.  We ordered breakfast through room service so we could get to the park early.  It was delivered on time, the food delicious and plentiful for the price and the staff was great.  We had a problem with the toilet on the first night, but the maintenance crew was up within 5 minutes of calling.  The front desk staff was

I have just read another review that said this hotel was a dump - Not true!  We have just returned from a 5 night stay.  Two adults and 3 children, we had a room (709) with 2 queens and a sofa bed; the room was very recently refurbished from what I could tell, very clean, comfortable, empty mini fridge for your drinks etc.   The lobby is not the Grand Californian and the pool is nothing special - however you can use the Grand Californian lobby all you want, charge meals, spa service etc to your room.  When we were there the pool was closed so we were able to use the pool at the Grand Californian and the Disneyland Hotel which was a real bonus.  If your little ones are tired you can watch the fireworks from the pool deck and they pipe you the sounds/music that you would hear in

There are great small places to stay near the gates. Try any of those on tripadvisor first. Paradise Pier is overpriced for a three diamond hotel. Rooms were clean. Maintemance was slow for broken phone; one day to fix. Service was uncaring at front desk and manager. They could not react to any requests or feedback; just that Disney smile. Japanese restaurant was pretty, great service, high priced and poor food. Worst tempura; burnt old oil. I mentioned to hotel staff; just got that vapid smile. I expected more for $1500 So stay elsewhere, and check out the great Grand Californa Hotel lobby. great place listen to music and enjoy. Fun time except for this hotel.

We made a choice to stay in a  Paradise Pier concierge level room with a view of Ca Adventure for the same price as we would have paid for a standard rm at the Grand Californian.  It wasnt' worth it!  The food at the concierge room was scant (fish crackers & soda)  The pool felt really cheap and was not half as great as the picture looks.  The Grand Californian is the only place to stay if you're going to spend the night at Disneyland.  Everything from the pool chairs to the food quality was so much higher at the Grand, and you cant beat the easy access to Downtown Disney and Ca. Adventure.  (Think better food and fewer steps) It's easy to think that a $100/night difference in rates would not be worth it, but you realize once you get there, that $100 is "nothing" and you're
The Paradise Pier hotel is a dump. The service was equally as horrible. I would not recommend staying there. Pay a little extra and stay at the Grand Californian.

We loved our stay at the Paradise Pier hotel in late March of 2007. The hotel is a very short walk to the parks and the room was spacious and clean. It wasn't overly Disney themed - just a few Mikey touches here and there. The pool was warm even though the temperature outside was really chilly. The water slide is not huge but lots of fun. There is also a kiddie pool and a hot tub (no bubbles, just hot).
This place is a dump!  From smoke-smelling hallways(smoke free?) - to dirty glasses, bathtub that doesnt drain - ripped wallpapaper - stay-away!

My wife and I stayed at the Paradise Pier on October of 2006 for our Honeymoon for one week.  Had a great stay and had an excellent view of California Adventure.  Having worked in the hotel/hospitality business for many years, including some at Walt Disney World in Florida, I knew what to look for from both a guest and employee point of view.  I have to stress that this hotel wasn't originally built as a Disney hotel, and for those who are used to staying at the heavily themed WDW hotels in Florida, you might be a little disapointed in this one.  However,  we still enjoyed the stay, and both of us thought the cast members at the hotel were very friendly and helpful!  You can hear the noise of the theme park rides outside your room at night, but that didn't bother us.  In fact, I

Summary Heading: Our $300 View of the Parking Lot Was Quiet, At Least!
Summary: I booked 2 nights at Disney's Paradise Pier hotel in March 2007 because I wanted 3 days at “the happiest place on earth”, without ever having to leave the Disney properties.  Did the experience live up to our expectations? Was it worth the price? Well, yes and no.  We booked a standard room for the cheapest possible price....still a whopping $292 per night in March by the time they add taxes and resort fees.  We had a view of the parking lot from the 12th floor, and the pool was a tiny dot far below.  However our room on the 12th floor was very quiet...I am a light sleeper and had requested a quiet room. While I knew we wouldn't have a view of the Disney parks, I hadn't realized our view would mostly consist of the parking lot. (Somehow I had imagined a city view with lights.)

We stayed at the hotel 3/11/07-3/15/07. Had a stadard view room with 3 adults and 2 children which fit comfortably. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone based on the fact that the hotel did not have an overall fun Disney feel. We actually saw rats out at the pool and also found dead bugs in our suitcases upon returning home. We all found that it was actually quicker to walk to the park than to take the monarail as suggested. I would have liked to have heard some Disney music maybe and also have more food available in the hotel. This was however the best vacation that I have been on but the hotel in our opinion was no better than a Holiday Inn, it was just a place to sleep.

Summary Heading: Worth the money - if you have a small child
Summary: We just spent March 15 - 18 at Paradise Pier. We took our 21 month old son. This hotel was perfect location wise when travelling with a toddler. It was within a short walk to Disneyland (through Grand CA hotel) We booked a concierge room. The extra money was worth it - as you don't have to leave the hotel to get water, drinks, and misc snacks. It just was convenient. The room was what you would expect from a 3 star hotel. It was ok, clean, but nothing SPECTACULAR. It was a non smoking hotel, but at times I smelled smoke. Noise level was not that bad - you could hear the hall traffic if it was loud. I would stay here again - just because location is ideal to come back and forth for naps w/ my toddler. But it is not a luxury hotel otherwise.

I stayed at the Paradise Pier for three nights in February 2007.  We had a concierge room.  I would recommend this hotel.  Personally I didn't think the room was any better than a standard non-conceirge room, but the added amenities were worth it.  We definately saved a lot of money being able to get refreshments from the lounge.  It was a good location to be able to go to CA Adventure Park or to ride the monorail to Disneyland.

We loved this hotel.  We brought our 5 year old twins to Disneyland for the first time and enjoyed being so close to the parks.  California Adventure was accessed through the Grand Californian.  For Disneyland we went out the back door of the hotel, followed the red brick path to Downtown Disney, and hopped on the monorail to tomorrowland.  Probably 6 minutes walk at the most.  Aside from the convenience of being so close to the park, this hotel was great for other reasons as well.  It has a beautiful fitness center.  The kids loved the pool and slide.  They also made use of the movie room a couple of times.  Bell service was just fantastic.  Most importantly, our room was just the perfect fit for us.  We had booked a standard view room but were placed in a park view.  That

We took a family of 22 (grandma, grandpa, aunts, uncles, and tons of cousins) to Disneyland in January 2007.  We wanted to stay at one of the Disneyland hotels because of their proximity to Disneyland (in order to avoid loading and unloading 22 people twice a day).  The Paradise Pier accommodated our need for 6 adjoining rooms.  Its proximity to Disneyland was its most attractive feature.  Every morning we could walk across the road and through California Grand and into the park.  The rooms were great -- each had 2 queen beds, a pull-out couch, and a generous desk.  We really appreciated the extra playpen (with bedding) that we found in each room's closet.  The staff was accommodating and friendly.  Though slightly pricier than the regular hotels found around Disneyland, we

Summary Heading: Halfway round the world to stay at the Paradise Pier!
Summary: Coming from New Zealand, I spent a many hours researching accommodation options in Anaheim. I decided that spending extra on a 'real' Disney hotel would be worth the money, since we don't get to go to Disneyland very often! I was right!  My children and I stayed for four nights in mid january, and enjoyed everything about the hotel. The staff are great, and we were upgraded to a view room without asking, which was really nice. It was lovely to see the sun coming up over California Adventure in the morning.   We ate at the Hotel restaurant twice, once for dinner and once for the Lilo and Stitch breakfast. The dinner food was fine, and well priced I think. The breakfast was expensive, but worth it to see the Characters. It was my daughter's 15th birthday, and she was horribly

Just returned from a 4 night stay at Paradise Pier. For the proximity to the parks and relaxed atmosphere, I would definitely choose this hotel again. I took my 3 year old and my parents (ages 64 and 88)..adjoining rooms that were upgraded to park view. Service was terrific..from the check-in where Katrina (?) found out who my son's favorite characters are..to her running to get us an autographed picture and coloring books and stickers..very welcoming. My parents were also pleased with the room service and appreciated the easy feel of the hotel. Getting to and from the parks was easy..cutting through the Grand Californian to California Adventure was about a 7 minute walk..Disneyland is probably 15 minutes through Downtown Disney. The monorail is hit or miss. If it is running you

I booked a room at Disney's Paradise Pier for the Winter NAMM Show at the nearby Anaheim Convention Center. Although I did not partake in any Disney activity, I found this hotel to be a very good choice for conference attendee's that can't book the Hilton or Marriott.    The staff is courteous and helpful. I arrived at 11am (official check in time is 3pm) and  within an hour they had a room ready for me. I requested one king bed overlooking Disneyland but received two full beds without the view. But I am not choosy about that sort of thing when they've prepared a room 3 hours ahead of when they were obligated to do so.  The room itself was basic but nicely decorated. Not many TV channels but that's not a big deal. The gift shop has toiletries for purchase and of course a TON of

Summary Heading: A Pleasant Experience at Paradise Pier!
Summary: This was my first stay at Paradise Pier and it definitely will not be the last; in fact, our next vacation is booked in February. Having previously stayed at the Grand Californian (once was positive, once was pretty negative) I would say that for my money the Paradise Pier is an excellent choice for a Disney Resort without breaking the wallet.  Traveling as a family of five is always a challenge; we often must deal with rollaway beds (at an extra cost) or even booking a second room (pricey), but our room at Paradise Pier fit our family quite comfortably with two queens and a sofa that the housekeeping staff kept made up as a daybed as soon as they were informed that there were 5 in the room. Our room overlooked the pool (it was way too chilly for us to contemplate a swim,

I am a travel agent and stayed here as part of a work trip inspecting properties on the west coast.   This was one of my favourite hotels in Anaheim, we had a park view room and looked straight into California Adventure Park.  A fantastic property located on the outskirts of Disneyland Park where rooms look directly into California Adventure Park. Rooms are decorated to a 50’s California Surfing theme with a touch of Mickey here & there. Rooms were very spacious and comfortable.  The resort also offers a roof top pool which is nice after running around at Disneyland all day. This property definitely caters to families with children of all ages and I would happily recommend this to clients.

I will not waste time repeating info in previous reviews. Or lauding the good points as there are many-- The high points are outlined in previous reviews, see them. I will instead comment on things you need to be aware of, and maybe expect to happen to you. Some negatives that could easily be addressed to make this a GREAT hotel for the money. It ain't Grand Californian prices, but it ain't THAT cheap either.  While not wanting to appear to bash this hotel--we had a great time--we expected a certain level of competence and maintenance for the price we payed to stay onsite this time around. SO: CHeck in was smooth, even upgraded to a nice corner park view room, wow what a view-like a postcard. Room 1000. But we were not upgraded to concierge level so this was just a nicer view.

Summary Heading: Great on-site deal and superb park views
Summary: After growing up in Southern California, it had always been a dream to stay onsite at Disneyland.  Now that I live in Philadelphia, the dream became a reality just after Thanksgiving this year, with our stay at the Disney Paradise Pier Hotel.  Originally built as the Pan Pacific with an Asian theme, the hotel was purchased by Disney as they started considering building on the Disneyland site to create more of WDW atmosphere with two parks.  It was rethemed into the Paradise Pier to coincide with the opening of the California Adventure park, and has had a recent remodel of the rooms to complete the full look into a disney themed oceanside style resort.  We came early on Sunday the 26th at about 8am to take advantage of the early park opening, and drove up to the entrance.  Disney

we stayed at paradise pier from nov 13-17. We had the most wonderful vacation for my daughter's 3rd bday.  we got in late and the front desk were very helpful thank you so much RIA.she gave my daughter balloons and pins that she can wear during our stay. she was great,asked how our trip was and even told us that we can still get in the park to get autograph signing for disney princesses.  We were also upgraded to a park view without having to pay extra which made our long trip worth it.  we stayed @ the 10th floor. our room had 2 queen beds and sofa bed. housekeeping did a very good job cleaning our room everyday and had extra set of pillows and blankets in the closet and because they booked my daughter as infant even though she's 3,they had the crib ready inside the closet. you

Summary Heading: A Perfect Place to Stay at Disneyland
Summary: My son who is an employee of a Disney Subsidiary booked our room at the Paradise Pier Hotel, as this was our first trip to Disneyland.  When we arrived the check in staff were probably the most friendly and helpful I have ever met in years of travelling.  They seemed genuinely interested in personally making our vacation the best vacation possible.  We were checked in very quickly, and off to our room.  We were on the 13th floor and we had a very large room with 2 queen size beds, a full size couch that made into a double bed.  The bathroom was really large as well.  There was a fridge and an in-room safe, which was really convenient.  Extra bedding was in the closet all nicely sealled in plastic zipper bags in case you needed extra blankets or pillow.  The room was immaculate

I have stayed in Anaheim before at non-Disney property's, but I am glad I chose the Paradise Pier.  We arrived at 11.30pm due to flight delays, and were greeted by a very helpful and caring member of staff.  She quickly checked us in and made sure we got straight to our room.  Parking on site is great, a multi-storey attached to the hotel.  We never had to park higher than floor 2.  Very safe, never saw or heard of any issues whilst we were here.  Room, AMAZING.  WE booked a resort view room and were on 1 of the higher floors.  VERY clean room with good amenities.  We did use room service that night and were very impressed with the quality of the food.  Other reviewers have complained about the walk to Disney from the hotel.  What total rubbish!  You walk across the road, go

My husband and I stayed for two nights at the Paradise Pier Hotel on 28-29/10 and enjoyed our stay very much.Our room overlooked the park and we were very impressed at how clean it was.We even had a the Lilo and Stitch Breakfast ourselves and were visited by Lilo Stitch and Minnie Mouse at various times during our breakfast even though the kids were not with us.We enjoyed our stay so much we are bringing the kids back in January for their Holiday.Two years ago we stayed in the GC and I really prefer the PP.A short walk to Downtown Disney and Disneyland.Great Locations.

We spent two nights here and we enjoyed most everything about our stay here.  We were happy to find that we had been given a room upgrade with a park view even though we didn't reserve one. It was a wonderful view of the California park and my little boy really enjoyed watching the rides light up at night.  We liked the room a lot and had good service from the staff. We asked in advance that the refrigerator be emptied before we got there and it had indeed been taken care of so we had room for our sons drinks and milk. We also asked for a crib but found the all of the hotels now used pack and plays in the room. Not very comfortable for kids used to crib mattress's and kind of unsanitary since I don't know how they can clean that bottom board.  The only other thing that we found

My husband and I stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel with our 3 year old son from October 8-10, 2006, and were very pleased with our accommodations.  Because the hotel is directly across the street from the Grand Californian, we were able to take advantage of the GC's entrance to California's Adventure without paying the high prices of rooms at the GC.  We also used the GC shortcut through Downtown Disney to get to Disneyland.  Neither required much walking (especially when you consider how much walking you do inside the park), and it was nice not to pay for parking at the hotel.  We were pleasantly surprised by how quiet the rooms were at the Paradise Pier, since there were many families like us with young children.  Our room on the 4th floor near the elevator faced the theme

Summary Heading: Great deal for what you get
Summary: My husband, 4 year old, and I stayed at Paradise Pier from Oct. 24-Oct. 27th during Disney's Halloween Time.  It should be noted that we were at the Disneyland Hotel (DH) this time last year, and had just as much fun.  However, here are some of the Pier's perks over the DH:  PRICE: I paid $50/day less at the Pier for a resort view room.  VIEW: The view from the Pier is WAY better than the "resort view" at the DH.  Instead of being 200 feet away from Disney's California Adventure (DCA), we were DIRECTLY across the street at the Pier--what a view, day or night!  PROXIMITY TO PARKS: Many reviews have complained that this is the furthest hotel from the parks.  Obviously, they didn't take the short cut through the Grand Californian Hotel to get to Disneyland or DCA or they wouldn't

Summary Heading: Are you looking for paradise? You belong here!
Summary: So, I stayed for 3 days, as usual, It was better than ever! we got daily clean-ups while we were in the park. The greatest thing was that we got concierge, were I drank 12 sodas. I'd say this was My best ripn ever!!!

Summary Heading: Pier Hotel is lacking the wow appeal you expect
Summary: We decided to spend the extra this time to experience the "Disney experience".  Unfortunately, it seems that the Pier Hotel is just another business hotel.  The doorman and the goofy in the lobby were a great first impression, but after that, it was just a hotel.  The check in desk was up to my chest and did not allow our kids to hear the clerk tell me about Disneyland.  The hotel just needs to add some mini steps by the front desk so the kids can partake in the check in experience and hear all about the hotel and Disneyland.  Also, for very little money, they can add huge value to a guests stay by doing the following:  send up a Mickey shaped cookie for the kids as a welcome gift to get them excited, offer turndown service with a mickey chocolate left on the pillow or even

decided to do the disneyland vaction so we booked four nights at the disney paradise pier hotel, the room was large and clean, and very close to both parks.  our room had a mini fridge and safe for valuables, not sure if thats included in all the rooms but it made keeping cold beverages handy much easier and the safe gave me a place to leave my laptop while we were at the park.  the staff was very helpful with any requests and housekeeping did a great job of keeping the room stocked with towels and extra pillows we needed. the japanese restaurant on site is very good and not too unreasonably priced(especially for disney), all in all a very good experience

Summary Heading: If you are able splurge on a Suite!
Summary: We stayed @ Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel  while friends & family stayed at the Disney's Grand Californian Hotel. We booked the Suite with the view of the Californian Adventure. We had a excellent view at night with all the lights on the rides. Just a little dissapointed that most are turned off early after closing.  It was expensive but worth the experience for ourselves & especially our kids. We stayed Tuesday-Thursday. I highly recommend booking during the week. Lines at both Parks are minimal if any at all!  The Character Breakfast at the Paradise Pier  was unforgettable. They had a variety of fresh entrees & a friendly staff. Another perk going during the week is that we had almost all the Character's to ourselves at our table!  My Daughter had fun with Lilo, Stich, Pluto &

We just got back from our trip to Disneyland and decided to stay at this hotel.  From what I read before on the reviews, it is pretty close to what most people say.  The elevators can be a long wait at check out and the walk to Disneyland is about a 10 minute walk.  The final conclusion is that if you want to stay at a Disneyland resort for the least amount of money, then this is your best bet.  The character breakfast was around $50.00 for my family of four.  Kids were 2 and 4 and they enjoyed it.  One advantage of staying at a Disney resort is that you get early entry into the park on all of the early entry days available.  The service for the hotel was great and the staff was really helpful.  Book the least expensive room and ask for an upgrade to have a view of California

Summary Heading: Won't Stay Here If I Can Avoid It...
Summary: This was my first time at Paradise Pier, but I've stayed at both Disneyland Hotel and Grand Californian.  Hopefully I won't have to stay at PP again! Check in is at 3:00, but our room wasn't ready until 4:30. In comparance with the DH and GC hotels our rooms were always ready much earlier, like from 11:00am to maybe 1:00 pm, but never later.  Once I finally got in I was upset to see two Queen sized beds rather than the one King that I had booked, I didn't even need two beds!  I was already so frustrated with having to wait that I didn't even complain, I basically just said screw it.   Then I called the Bell Desk to have the bags brought up as I was dying to take a shower, but  I would have gotten them myself if I had known it was going to take them 30 minutes to bring them up!

This hotel is so cute!  It's totally Californian with a hint of Disney!  The PCH Grill downstairs is delicious and priced well.  They have a really cool pool with a slide that my son loved.  Everyone was really nice and when we called for extra towels, it took them about 30 seconds to get to our room. It kinda sucks that the monorail is out of service right now because the walk to Disneyland is about 10 minutes.  The walk to Cal Adventure though is great,  And never a line!  Overall I was very happy with my stay at Paradise Pier.

Stayed at Paradise Pier OCT 1--3 as I was meeting my sister's family celebrating my Niece's 10th birthday. Check-in was routine and the front desk provides park literature and walk-in directions. Room was clean with a window view of California Adventure. Service was good as i asked for some extra towels and in-room coffee packets. The only thing I would reccomend is a microwave vice the in-room safe. Also nice was they will hold your luggage on check-out day so you can roam the parks before taking off.

We stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel at the start of our holiday.  We were given a huge room on the 15th floor for my husband and I and our 17 month toddler. It was a really decent size.  The hotel doesn't have direct access to the parks itself, but if you go on a very short walk across the road, to the Disney Grand Californian hotel, you can get into California Adventure there. Disneyland is a short walk through the hotel and Downtown Disney! Which is really magical!  The service was really good in the hotel. The security box in our room was running out of battery, so i phoned down to the desk and a very friendly maintenance man was sent up within minutes. Also when my toddler looked himself in the toilet, security and maintenance were sent up very quickly to get him out!!  The

We stayed at the Paradise Pier for 5 nights in late September 2006.  Our room faced away from the Parks, however, this meant there was no road noise, so it  was very quiet, a joy to return to after long days/nights at Disneyland.  The room was well appointed and scrupulously clean.  Our children loved the pool, especially the waterslide.  The Hotel is an easy 10 minute walk to Disneyland, meaning we could take a break from the Park in the afternoon and return in the evening.  Parking was easy and free.  We highly recommend the Paradise Pier Hotel.

We arrived for our 7 night stay and were upgraded to a park view room and had a nice view from the 11th floor. Nice room with a VERY big window looking directly over California Adventure Park. The safe in the room was a plus.  In room coffee was good.  Full size closet.  Mini fridge was nice. Free wired internet in room.  The shower head was in poor condition,  the parking garage had no elevator and there were no shuttles to the main entrances of the parks, we had to walk thru The Grand Californian and Downtown Disney just to get to the park everyday, not fun with 3 kids, it was a good 1/2 mile. the onsite restaurant the PCH Grill was WAY overpriced even without the characters there. small portions also.

This place is absolutely incredible.  The staff are really over-the-top friendly...it's great.  The pools are great for both adults and kids alike.  There is a huge waterslide that my daughter played on for hours.  The waterslide is supervised by lifeguards.  The view of California Disney is spectacular.  Even the shampoo, conditioner and soaps that come free with the room were everything "Mickey Mouse".  The experience was one to be remembered.  I'd highly recommend staying here.  I wouldn't recommend dining downstairs for dinner as the service and food is not all that great, but you must dine there for breakfast with Lilo, Stich and Minnie Mouse.

Summary Heading: Does Not Have Direct Access to Disneyland, et al.
Summary: Contrary to its advertisments, this hotel does not have direct access to Disneyland, Downtown Disney or California Adventure.  It does not offer a shuttle service, either.  So, be prepared to walk and walk and walk to get to the entrance to Disneyland.  Other than that, a pricey, new hotel with just average rooms.  Next time, I think I would stay at a motel on Harbor Blvd. and be closer to the entrance to Disneyland - or at a hotel that offered a shuttle service.

We stayed in Disney Paradise Pier between Sept 3-6. We booked two regular rooms via Disneyland.com. We were asked for two connecting rooms. To our surprise, they upgraded us to a two bedrooms suite with DCA view up on 14th floor.  The room is large and very clean. The overall experience had been excellent. We like to short walk to the two parks. We will absolutely stay there again!

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier Was Great for Us
Summary: We stayed at the Paradise Pier from August 13-16 2006.  The room was big enough for three adults, one very large 12 year old, and one 6 year old.  There were two queen beds and a couch bed.  We had great views of California Adventure Park and it was fun to watch the goings on. It was my first time staying at a Disney Property and I found the convenience and ambiance worth the extra dough.  I will never stay off-property again.  The PP is close to Downtown Disney and the Monorail.  Access to California Adventure Park is just across the street and through California Adventure Hotel.  Paradise Pier is close enough to park  and activities that even if you are just plum tired, you can make it back to hotel, even with a practically comatose six year old who is falling asleep while she

First of all, I'd like to say that we stayed at Paradise Pier for our Honeymoon. We were there from July 16 to the  22nd and couldn't have been happier with our accomidations. As soon as we got there we got an immediate room upgrade to a grand view of the parks which was NOT expected considering the busy time of year we went. The hotel staff was very friendly an incredibly helpful with tips on what to do before we could get into our room. (Arrived at 11am, room is ready at 3pm) We thought that might be a little inconvinient but were surprised at how much there is to see in Downtown Disney. It took about 5 minutes to get to the restraunts from the hotel by way of the Grand Californian Hotel. Maybe 10 to get into the parks because of security and the lines at the gate. We also

Kicked off a three week holiday touring California with a 3 night stay here. From landing at LAX at 7p.m., we were checking in at 8.20p.m., courtesty of a pre-booked Prime Time shuttle from the airport. The boy who checked us in showed us a map of the resort, pointed out how to get into the parks, told us what days were early admission, and then informed us that if we were not too tired after travelling, we could go up to the pool area to see the fireworks scheduled for 9p.m. We made it up to the pool, but the fireworks were cancelled due to high winds. ( Apparently they had been cancelled the night before, and for all three nights while we were there)  The room was large, clean and we had a great view of California Adventure.We had 2 queen beds, and a day bed that our daughter

We (2 adults, 3 kids) stayed here Aug 13-16, 2006.  Fantastic!!  We were on the 14th floor and also used the concierge service.    The hotel character breakfast (last day) was wonderful--exceeded the previous day's princess lunch in California Adventure--more reasonable and more fun (more relaxed).   We took the monorail back and forth from Downtown Disney to Disnyeland, but walking would be ok (but we liked being able to enter DL that way, without going through the lines at the fron gate.)  The entry into California Adventure is through the Grand Californian which is across the street, again-easy.   I like the concierge service for the easy check-in/out and for the daily mini buffets--breakfast is cereal, fruit, pastries, bagels, coffee--etc.  The afternoon (5-7) is an

Summary Heading: Hotel was in a good location, but we hated the elevators!
Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights, and unlike some other reviews, we found the elevators extremely frustrating. During our stay, at least one, and sometimes two, elevators were not operating. After walking around for many hours, it was very annoying to have to wait an average of 10-15 minutes for an elevator. One woman had to wait over 20 minutes with two small children, and at one point after park closing, we counted over 30 people waiting. The service elevators were used only once for us, and we were told there was no stairwell access up from the first floor (although we quickly learned we could go down the stairwells and directly outside, but the door locked behind us). The staff was very apologetic but it would have helped  if they had at least posted a sign that explained what

Summary Heading: Park view and Concierge services were wonderful
Summary: We stayed at the hotel with a request for a 2 bedroom suite and a standard view room, both to be on the same floor and with a park view.  While the standard room had the park view, our 2 bedroom suite did not.  However, the staff accommodated our request the next day and put us in a series of 3 rooms, 2 of which were connected, so while we had to check out/check in/move to another room and onto a different floor, the slight inconvenience was worth it because seeing California Adventures from our room was awesome.  Locationwise, there were easy access paths to either Disneyland and California Adventures (back entrance via Grand Californian).  The Disney properties offer a concierge service upgrade which allows access to its concierge room from the morning to evening.  If you're

We stayed at the Paradise Pier July 9 thru July 13th.  This hotel is very nice & clean. The staff here is nice & attentive. We got to the hotel early, about 12:30 pm. They had a room for us ready. We were able to go the room & were at Disneyland within an hour. This hotel is a short walk, thru Downtown Disney to either park. You can also can the Monorail right near the Rainforest Cafe for a one way ride into Disneyland. Downtown Disney is full of stuff to do. Many good resturaunts & shops. Great entertainment in the evening as well, with many people playing music. If you go with a teenager, have them bring a friend along. It will free some time up for you & your spouse. They can go to the park and you can shop or go to the park together. The pool here is too small for the hotel

Originally our reservations were for the Grand Californian Hotel but we had a death in our family and had to rearrange somet hings and the Grand Californian Hotel was booked one of our nights.  Instead of switching hotels in the middle of our stay we opted to stay at the Paradise Pier.    First of all we ended up with a resort view instead of a standard view at $128/night cheaper.  From our window we had a spectacular view of California Adventure and at night the view was even better.  From the moment we checked in the staff was very helpful, we had some family meet us there and they gave them a parking passes for the hotel so they did not have to pay for parking at the parks.  We did the character breakfast the last day and the kids absolutely loved it.  It was well worth the

Just returned for three days at the Paradise Pier/Disneyland/California Adventure trip with our three kids, ages 5, 9 and 11. We've been to Disneyland several times in the past 10 years but those were all day trips. This trip felt like a vacation staying in the park walking to everything, getting early admission, going back to the hotel for a break in the afternoon and then hitting the park at night, etc. No comparison to the hassles and lines of the day trip experience. Example: 7 a.m. admission to Disneyland allowed our family to hit every major ride in the park by 9:30 (including the newly reopened Pirates, where the line snaked for more than an hour by 9 a.m.) because there were no lines, and this was July 4 week. Another example: Upon check-in to the hotel, I asked for an

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights towards the end of our 10-day californian vacation on June 6, 2006.  It was my husband and I and our two teenage daughters.  They were doing the Disney parks alone, so we wanted to be on the premises for safety.  Upon check-in we paid to be upgraded to a Concierge Floor Room.  We got a best view room with a room looking directly in to the California Adventure park of Disney.  The view was amazing!  We could see the whole Paradise Pier section of the new park.  In the distance was Tower of Terror and if you looked closely, you could even see the elevator work!  The concierge lounge was the best I have been in.  They have a very nice continental breakfast and then snacks and drinks throughout the day.  They have a free computer and printer and

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier - Happy with our stay AGAIN
Summary: We stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel in the Disneyland Park June 17 - 21 this was our second visit in 9 mos and this hotel was incredible yet again.  The staff treat you like kings. We got to the hotel at 11am thinking we would have to go into downtown disney and hang out until our room was ready, but to our surprise our room was ready to go.  The rooms were still very spacious and comfortable, the only item I wish they had in the rooms is a microwave.  Housekeeping cleaned our room every day without us having to ask.  We had 2 Lilo and Stitch breakfasts at the PCH Grill and one dinner.  Breakfast was just as amazing as last time and there were alot of characters there.  This was our first time having dinner there and it was very nice and reasonably priced.  With it being summer

My family stayed at this hotel in early June. We were upgraded to a park view which was great. What I loved most about Paradise Pier is the early entry you receive into Disneyland. You can get a whole days worth of rides in before the park opens to the public. The rooms were comfortable, our daughter loved the couch that turns into a bed. We also enjoyed the pool, the waterslide was a lot of fun. The only downside we found at this hotel was the elevators. Once, we had to take the stairs down from the 11th floor, we waited over 5 minutes and none of the four elevators came. Other than that, I will stay at this hotel everytime we visit Disneyland.

Hello All,  After reading the many positive reviews of the Paradise Pier Hotel I was very excited about staying with my family.  In doing a review I like to focus on general hotel problems, not specific issues or events that happened.  We had three problems with the hotel; the key card entry system, the service at the restaraunt, and the elevators.
