Apparently the hotel created new key cards to enter your room for the 50th anniversary, well the cards do not work very well.  Upon checking in, I slide the key card five or six times with no luck, the people next door happened to show up, they explanined they had a similar problem with the keys.  After 15 or 16 swipes, it finally opened.  We got new keys from the front desk and had the same issue with the new key cards.  On the last

A nice clean hotel.  Friendly "cast" members.  Had a perfect view of the California adventures (didn't even ask for it) what a wonderful surprise.  Convient location to California Adventures.  5 min walk to Downtown Disney.  Monorali to Disneyland is Right at the beginning of downtown disney.   My Husband, My 2 y/o, My sister, My 10 y/o niece and Myself enjoyed our 5 nite stay at Disney's paradise pier.

Summary Heading: LOVED OUR FIRST FAMILY VACATION HERE!
Summary: Thank you to all of you who have posted reviews! We changed hotels due to all the great reviews we read about Paradise Pier. It was our first vacation as a family and our first trip to Disneyland. We have children the ages of 3, 6 and 9 years old. Our stay was from May 29 to June 2 and we loved the Paradise Pier! Upon check in we tried to get a room with a view of California Adventure, but instead got a view of the parking lot and pool, which was not that bad. The room was very clean and spacious and slept all five of us comfortably. I usually do not sleep well away from home but slept very well on their beds. The bathroom was large and accommodating. We found the staff to be very courteous and friendly. The only mishap we had was when I called to confirm what day our early

We visited from Florida where we are Disney AP holders and frequent guests of the WDW hotels.  I would consider this hotel to be between a moderate level (Port Orleans, Coronado Springs) and a deluxe level (AKL, Boardwalk) resort at WDW.    We stayed at this hotel during Memorial Day weekend - checked in Thursday and checked out Sunday.  We were upgraded to a CA Adventure theme park view and loved our room.  It was very clean and nice, as were the hotel common areas.  The cast members were friendly and the location to the parks was great.  Only a short walk to the parks and the other hotels.  We watched the Main Street Electrical Parade from our room and heard the fireworks at DL, too.  We couldn't see them from our end of the hotel.  Dining at this hotel was ok; the PCH Grill

I loved my short two-night stay at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel. It was everything you would expect from the Disneyland Resort. I stayed in one room with two friends, and the room was large, super-clean, and had a charming boardwalk-meets-Disney theme. Room service was excellent. The hotel is a short walk to the shops of Downtown Disney, where you can take the Monorail into Tomorrowland in the Disneyland Park. California Adventure is right across the street and resort guests can enter at a private entrance in Disney's Grand Californian Hotel. The Paradise Pier's "Lilo & Stitch Aloha Breakfast" had the best breakfast buffet. The selection of food was incredible. The pineapple coconut scones were scrumptious. Lilo, Stitch, Daisy, and Minnie were all present and came over to our

My family just returned from a 2 night stay at the Paradise Pier Resort at Disneyland.  We were a little concerned at first because this is the more budget oriented hotel of the Disneyland properties.  Our concerns were unfounded.    The frontdesk staff is very attentive and service oriented.  We booked a family suite (ask for a room in the "22 stack" when making a reservation.)  We arrived early, so our room was not ready.  No worries, though, the bell desk took our bags and placed them in a locked area, we got our tickets and went to the park!  Promptly at 3:00pm our room was ready.  The rooms are decorated in a tropical motif. Our room had two bathrooms, a living area with small fridge and microwave, ironing board/iron, extra blankets and pillows which were in plastic

The Paradise Pier was a clean hotel and very close to Disneyland. We have stayed at The Disneyland  and Grand Californian Hotels in the past. This one was actually closer than the Disneyland Hotel. It is a quick walk to cross the street and just enter thru the Grand Californian or take the back sidewalk to Monorail.  Our room had two beds and a couch,wireless access and a small coffee pot. Closet had ironing board and a small portable crib. It had the typical Disney soap and shampoo. Room was very clean. The hotel is entirely non-smoking. Pool area was clean had a tame water slide and hottub.  You can view the fireworks from roof top pool area complete with the actual music over loud speakers. I would stay here again if the rates stay reasonable. It does not have the awe factor

Summary Heading: Exceeded my expectations and the kids loved it.
Summary: For the past four years my wife and I have taken our family to Disneyland as part of our spring break.  I have two sons who are now nine and 11, but I get as much fun out of this trip as they do.  Two years ago we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, I did not care for it.  Last year we stayed at the Grand Californian. My family loved it.  However, when I went to rebook our annual trip, the price had gone up by over $600 for the same number of nights.  I could not agree with this increase.  My wallet could handle this, but my stomach could not.  A 40% increase seemed excessive in one year's time.  I understand that it is the 50th anniversary, however it just did not seem right.  I opted for the Paradise Pier which presented a lesser expense.    Boy, was I pleasantly surprised! We

My family of five fit in the room just fine.  The room met all our needs and then some.  It was very clean and very nice.  It was nice to be able to look over Disney's California Adventure park.  We were able to go out to the pool area and watch the fireworks at Disneyland too.  The pool was very nice too.  They had a neat waterslide, a hot tub, a kiddie pool as well and a large pool.  Downstairs were two restaraunts that I didn't visit (too many good places to eat around here)  There was a movie room available for the kids, a video game room, probably a ton of other things I didn't get to see also.    i was especially impressed about the personal care they game me there.  The lady at the front desk went over all kinds of details of the hotel and the parks that really made

I've stayed at all three on-property hotels, and this one is probably my favorite - it's beautiful and intimately-scaled.  The rooms aren't huge, but the size is fine.  They're nautical-Disney themed, with cute Mickey art and lamps.  Soft goods were clean and in good condition.  The floors and furnishings were new.  The bathroom, toiletries, and towel situation was fine.  Yamabuki is expensive, but excellent Japanese food served in an upscale setting.  The valets and front desk staff are hardworking and very nice.  The only possible downside is the "distance" from the parks - but to be honest, it's negligible.  The hotel is across the dang street, for pete's sake.  Sure, you used to be able to access DCA from a side entrance that was a short hop across the street; In all,

We stayed at Paradise Pier/Disneyland Mar 13-17, 2006.  We found the hotel to be exactly what we expected from Disney. We live in the Orlando area and are annual passholders for Walt Disney World and have stayed at most of the Disney hotels in Orlando.  We were not disappointed in PP at Disneyland. The staff was courteous and friendly and quick to respond to our requests.  We were upgraded to a parkside room upon check-in.  The beds were very comfortable and my daughter loved the pillows. The coffee shop/bar on the ground floor was great.  They have bagels, croissants, and muffins in the morning and it is a great place to stop for a quick bite to eat on the way to the park.   One word of warning to people who are familiar with the Orlando parks and their bus system.  They are

Summary Heading: Great Stay at Paradise Pier Hotel
Summary: Stayed at Paradise Pier Hotel for 4 nights last week (March 11-15) and it was a great stay!  The cast members were all very friendly, our room wasn't quite ready but they gave me the room key and a # to call to find out when it would be ready.  We had other activities planned so it was no big deal.  When we got to our room it was a very nice sized decorated room.  We had a nice view of the pool area.  I asked for a theme park view upon check-in but they were full so a pool view was nice.  Have stayed in the Paradise Pier Hotel before and enjoyed our stay.  Have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel before as well and the room was smaller at the DH than PPH plus we had a view of the parking lot.  It was nice to have a fridge in the room for snacks and I also loved the comfortable room

Rooms were very nice and staff excellent, when they found out that we were visiting for my daughter's 6th birthday they brought out an elaborate set of balloons and little gifts.  She loved it!  The rooms are neat, clean, functional.  About a five minute walk through the obnoxious Downtown Disney to get to the theme parks -- but a three minute walk to the monorail.  In fact, having to go through Downtown Disney was probably the only downside to the hotel.    We were only there for one night, and so didn't have a chance to try the pool area, but it looks very nice.  Overpriced?  Sure, but it's a better value than (for instance) the food inside the parks.  I left very happy that we didn't spend the extra $150 to stay at the Grand Californian, that just doesn't seem worth it.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel a short walk from Disney/California Adventure
Summary: Loved this hotel which is located on Disney property! Previously stayed at the Disney Hotel and Grand Californian and also "good neighbor hotels" Sheraton Anaheim and Holiday Inn but found the Paradise Pier Hotel is a better option.  The hotel is located behind California Adventure and is a 5-10 minute walk from downtown Disney monorail station or from Disneyland/CA Adventure you can walk through Downtown Disney and then through the Grand California hotel to reach Paradise Pier.  Found the Paradise Pier staff courteous and helpful. Bell hop quickly unloaded our bags. At check-in our room wasn't available but cast member quickly assigned us another room.  Pool is located on the 3rd floor. There is a 158 ft. water slide, spa, kiddie pool and a medium-sized pool. Also there is a

At the end of our 17 day tour of SoCal last Summer I treated the wife and four daughters (7, 8, 13, and 15) to four days at the Paradise Pier. I have to say it lived up to our expectations. Upon arrival we found out we were the Big Kahuna family that day and received a picture in a very nice picture frame, free rice krispy treats to be delivered to our room that night, preferred seating to Aladdin in DCA and free valet parking for our entire stay. Our room was big and spacious (we had a suite) with two Queen’s in the bedroom and a queen size sleeper in the living room. The two full bath rooms were a joy. My kids loved the pool with its very cool slide. One bad feature, no guest laundry on the premises (I thought this was a family hotel, other guest thought it strange also). You

We really wanted to stay at one of the Disney Resort Hotels, location convenience - looking at how expensive the three hotels were - we decided to go with the one that was slightly cheaper "Disney Paradise Pier" - we heard mixed reviews on this hotel - we weren't to sure what to expect.   We were quite happy - the rooms were large, the beds comfortable, the hotel is very well kept, new rugs throughout. Best of all was the great service we found throughout the hotel, they had/made time to answer all our questions, plus more.... accommodating, friendly and helpful front desk staff, we asked for a great view and he took the time to make that happen for us - THANKS JAMES... we owe you one - would recommend this hotel for it's convenience, location and very friendly staff.

Summary Heading: Gotta love the Disney customer service!!!
Summary: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Paradise Pier.  We stayed at the hotel to celebrate our 10th anniversary and we are so happy we did. We checked in a little early at 2:15 without any problems and were even given a bunch of balloons for our anniversary and upgraded to a theme park room. Each night we were welcomed back to the hotel room with nightly turndown service with little disney chocolates on the pillows, I thought this service was only for conceirge rooms but I guess I was mistaken.  On our first night in the room we returned to find roses all over our bed spelling the word 'Love' and a plate of huge mickey mouse rice krispy treats.  It was such a nice touch.    This hotel is the furthest away from the parks, which I was originally concerned about,

Summary Heading: More Magical than I Could Have Imagined
Summary: I have just returned from the best vacation of my life, and I'm still in a euphoric state.  My experience with the Paradise Pier Hotel was incredible.  First, I must tell you that we booked our Disneyland trip through AAA, and if you are a member-- USE THEM, and if you aren't, SIGN UP AND THEN USE THEM.  The perks are incredible (unlimited Fastpasses comes to mind!), and everything is paid for ahead of time, so there are no surprise fees or questions.  My husband and I were there on our second Honeymoon (we called it our "Disneymoon"-- don't laugh), and because of it, we utilized the Disneyland Vacation Planning services to order gifts to be delivered to our room.  We were traveling over President's Day weekend, and because of the holiday, the traffic getting to the hotel was

I wanted to stay at Paradise Pier simply because I wanted to stay on the Disney resort, but I wanted to pay as little as possible.  I have to say that I was quite surprised with this little hotel.  While it may not be as nice as the Disneyland Hotel or the Grand Californian, it's quality is still higher than most hotels I've stayed at.  The rooms are of standard sized.  They don't have anything flashy, but they're very comfortable.  The beds are amazing!  I ordered room service one night, and though it was a little expensive ($40 for two people), it was very satisfying.  Our room looked out on the parking lot, the pool, and one of the Disneyland Hotel towers.  I would've liked to spend the extra money to see California Adventure, but we were so tired by the time we got back to

We stayed at the Paradise Pier the first week of February.  Surprised to discover its not actually on the Disneyland park but rather across the road.  Apparently it has gone through numerous owners/names over the year because it is certainly not new.  Still, it was close to the California Grand Hotel which we walked through every day to get into the park.  Now THATS a beautiful hotel. We arranged for our complete fully-paid package through a travel agent only to be advised upon checking in that "Oh - there's also an $11/day charge for incidentals such as a newspaper on weekdays and use of the gym."  When asked about the $150 gift card for those booking at a Disney hotel 4 or more nights, it was "sorry, yes we know about the program, but our computer screen doesn't show you're

We were upgraded to a Theme Park View without asking. This was an excellent way to start our trip. We let out a big sigh when we entered the lobby and the employees were all so welcoming after our long flight. It really set the tone for our whole trip. The kids were glued to the window night and day it just puts you all in the middle of that Disney magic. This hotel appears to just sit amongst rides when looking out at night.   They also loved the pool and what is nice is the slide softly lands you in a foot of water.  The walk to the parks is actually fun because you can go across the Grand Californian parking lot and through their beautiful lobby and this will save you about 5 minutes over going through the downtown area which is also a fun walk though about 10 minutes.  You

My wife and I just returned from a stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel and it was great. We had a beautiful room facing California Adventure which was a fantastic view especially in the evening. We ate at the PCH Grill several times for the Lilo and Stitch Aloha breakfast. This is something that you must do when you come here. It's great. But I think one of the best perks is the location. Everything is within easy walking distance. These reviewers who complain about the walking must just be lazy. It only takes about 10 to 15 minutes at the most to walk to either of the parks or Downtown Disney. And as far as the people who complain about the TV channels being only Disney channels, I suggest you learn how to use a remote control. All you have to do is start channel surfing to find

We stayed here in January 2006.  The hotel was pleasant, the staff friendly, and the hotel was clean and kid-friendly.  It was a very quick walk to Downtown Disney with lots of stores/dining estalbishments and the monorail to Disneyland, and another 5-10 minute walk to the main entrance to disneyland and California adventure.  We were upgraded (because basic rooms were sold out) to a deluxe room with a park view, which was big, had a nice DVD player, and large bathroom.  My only minor gripe was that there is an $11 "resort fee" that was above the rate I booked on expedia -- I'm not quite sure what I got for that fee.  However, I woul stay here again!

Just back from a wonderful stay at the Paradise Pier Hotel. The staff were wonderful and the room was great. We were given a free upgrade to a theme park view room, which after a ten hour flight was music to our ears. All in all an excellent trip.

Summary Heading: What a terrific change in this hotel!
Summary: I can't believe the changes in this hotel from a year ago!  The elevators are finally running in a normal manner - no long waits like there used to be.  The rooms are very clean and look like they've been renovated (or at least upgraded).  We usually stay at The Disneyland Hotel, but our last time there (August) was a big disappointment.  The room and hallways were shabby and service poor.  The Paradise Pier now has the feel that The Disneyland Hotel once had.  Even the rugs in PP's hallways seem clean and fresh, and the staff is helpful and very friendly.  The PP is now our number 1 choice for a Disneyland stay!!

Summary Heading: Best Hotel Stay with family ever!
Summary: We usually stay at pretty upscale fancy hotels on our trips, but decided to take the kids and go to Disneyland.  Paradise Pier was the only hotel with openings (Grand California was booked and the Disneyland hotel is just ok).  WE LOVED IT!  I was so impressed (and that is hard to do).  The customer service was fantastic, the rooms clean and comfy, the FOOD was wonderful (what a surprise!).  We had a park view and could watch the firework show from our window and let the baby sleep. The character breakfast was fun for us all.  It is hard to put into words.....but magical seems appropriate.

We arrived to find a beautifully decorated Christmas Tree in the lobby, with a sea theme.  We were immediately greeted at the front desk by Sharam, an employee who would, by the end of our trip, become a lifesaver.  We paid extra for concierge service and a park view room, and it was well worth every penny.  My only complaint is that when we got to our room, we found that it had not yet been cleaned, and there were no sheets or blankets on the beds.  I called down and found out that this was due to a computer error, and they sent a maid right up, and gave us a $25 credit for the inconvenience.  The concierge lounge was great, we used it for breakfast, an evening snack and just to relax each day.  My kids, ages 4 and 6, enjoyed sitting at the window when we were in the room, and

We walked in to the hotel lobby to see their gorgeous sea-themed Christmas tree and "Stitch" greeting guests and posing for photos. We were upgraded to a park-view room. The room was beautiful, clean, and had all the Disney-quality details, down to the basket in the bathroom for used towels. We have stayed at several Disney hotels in Orlando. This is the best we have ever stayed in. The view was amazing. The location excellent. We could walk anywhere on Disney property that we wanted. The staff was friendly and knowledgable. We ate dinner one night in the bistro - it was delicious and reasonably priced, for a resort. We had a great time during our stay and owe a large part to the comfortable luxury of our room. We will definitely stay here again. There wasn't a single problem to

I don't understand how anyone can rate this hotel as anything less than excellent. My daughter and I stayed on a concierge level room and loved every minute of our stay. The staff was excellent and very polite and friendly. The pool was heated (even though there was a heat wave during the week of our stay and it didn't matter). I recommend the "Lilo and Stitch" breakfast - the hula theme is too cute. I will definitely stay here again when visting Disneyland.

This is our second time staying at the Paradise Pier Hotel.  We stayed in a Family Suite on the top floor with a Park view. This is a very family friendly place...and the price is well worth being able to put the kids to bed and the adults can stay up. It had two full bathrooms.  And the living room space was very large. We have stayed at the DL Hotel in a suite and the suite at the Pier was bigger and nicer.  Sept is a wwonderful to go to Disneyland because there is NO ONE there...  The only bad part of the stay was that the pool was closed for 4 days during our 5 day trip.  I was NOT told this at the time of check-in.    They did let us use the DL Hotel pool , which is a nice pool.  BUt it was a pretty big oversight that they did not make us aware of this.  I have two

After reading some of the Trip Advisor reviews about Paradise Pier hotel, we were a bit apprehensive.  Once we arrived, however, it more than met our expections.  While the rooms are not large, our standard room worked extremely well for two adults and three kids, ages 6, 10, 12.  It was a short walk to the monorail in downtown Disney. We spent every evening poolside--the kids played on the waterslide, in the wading pool, and splashed in the regular pool.  Lifeguards were attentive, although they go off-duty in the early evening. You can order drinks at the pool or bring in take-out for dinner.  We recommend avoiding the over-priced restaurants in or near the parks and trying some of the ones on the perimeter.  All of us loved Zankou Chicken on Ball Road (dinner for 5 for under

I stayed at the Paradise Pier during a Red Hat Society Convention.  Every member of staff I met was friendly and helpful.  My room (404) had a great view of the California Adventure park, which was just lighting up for the evening as I arrived.  The room was very clean and well maintained.   Being so busy with a hectic convention schedule, I did not have the opportunity to make use of the attractive looking pool and hot-tub area or gym, even though there is a non-optional $10 charge per day for the use of these facilities.  My only gripe, which I have read in these pages about this hotel, is the elevators, which sometimes fail to stop on certain floors to pick up passengers.  I encountered a very friendly security man riding up and down, stopping the elevator on every floor to

Wonderful room! Very large, comfortable beds. Beautifully decorated with great amenities. First class accomodations-easy walk to the park. I would gladly stay here again and would recommend it to others.

I won this 3 day trip to Disneyland promoting their 50th anniversary, so that being said you now know it cost me nothing, except the tax bill I will receive at the end of the year (based on The Disney Grand Hotel Rates).  After giving them a few dates I could travel, they were to choose one of their 3 resorts to put us up in.  I notified them in June when I could travel.  I got Paridise Pier.  I looked at their website and it looked pretty nice - and knowing it was a Disney property I thought it would be 5-star. I was given the bill, showing that the room rate was $207/night, and was paid for.  The desk clerk had no idea that my "package" with Disney tickets etc was suppose to be there when I checked in.  I had to pull out documents from them stating it would all be available

This was a great place to stay. The rooms were large and comfortable. Price was reasonable for a Disney Hotel. Walk not that far to the parks. Pool could be bigger but good for families w/small kids. The waterslide was alot of fun. Would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Too much for a so-so design and sewer odor from the drain
Summary: Arrived around 6 pm and room had a great view of CA Adventure Park rides.  Noticed how warm the room was and that there was a smell in the bathroom.  Cranked up the A/C and left for dinner.  Came back at 9 pm and my 4 yr old used the bathroom and said that it smelled like poop in there.  Called the front desk and a housekeeper arrived to clean the entire bathroom.  The smell remained and was told that it was coming from the sink drain.  The shower also had a very slow drain which was corrected the very next day.  But the sewer odor remained and was never fixed during our 4-day stay.  Can you imagine brushing your teeth with that odor going up your nose?!!!  And why did they put a lamp on top of the bed with the bulb cover sticking out that it almost always bumped my head

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier- great place to stay!
Summary: We stayed at the Paradise Pier for six nights in August. We arrived at 11.30 a.m. to check in, not expecting a room to be ready. We were pleasantly surprised to have it confirmed that we could go to our room immediatley! The rooms were furnished with a lovely beach feel and the beds were very comfortable. Plenty of space to hang your clothes and there was also a sofa bed in the room. We had a view of the pool which also overlooked the employees car park but this didn't bother us as we hadn't come here to look out of a window! The only critiscm is that the laundry facilities were not at the hotel but located in the Disneyland hotel about a 5-10 minute walk away. When we got there, we found there was only two machines for all the hotels. I have stayed at Disney hotels before in

What an horrible week end ! I booked for my daughter and our family in California for the summer, it was the 50th anniversary and they were talking about such a stay for years. So I did the great treat: 2 nights at the Paradise Pier Hotel with Concierge level on a resort view room. So here what happened to them: -They checked in on Friday around 4:30pm to find that the concierge room was a standard park view on the 6th flood instead of the concierge level upper floor that I was guaranted 3 times on the phone with WDTC. They talked to the front desk and were told that our reservation was not noted and that this was the only room available. Then after dinner they were told by front desk to check back in the morning to get a new room, upgraded to a Family Suite on the 14th floor...

We have stayed at the Paradise Pier many times. On our most recent trip we had a very nice surprise - we were upgraded to a suite on the top floor facing California Adventure for no extra cost. It was a beautiful suite. The living room had new or very near new furniture, and was beautifuly decorated. The bedroom had two queen beds and a large chair that could be pulled out to a twin size bed. The view to the park was stunning. Friendly staff as always.  Housekeeping is great - they always leave the rooms spotless, even with my youngest smudging up the windows by pressing his face against them to admire the view. He prefers the view of the park to the T.V.  All in all, a clean, comfortable, very pleasant place to stay.

This hotel is the perfect Southern California experience.  Fun in the sun at a beach!  It's nautical, relaxed, and the attention to even the smallest detail is impossible to go unnoticed.  The views from the rooms are great no matter what room you're in, the gift shop is big with great merchandise instead of a typical hole in the wall stuffed with ugly postcards, and the PHC Grill's character breakfast is the perfect way to start a Disney adventure!  When it's time to wind down after an adventure filled day, take the little ones 'to the beach' and sit in a lawn chair to see some Disney cartoons (located in one of the halls on the lobby floor).   This is more than just a hotel-it's an experience that will easily be part of your Disneyland adventure!

My mom and I stayed at the Disney's Paradise Pier hotel from July 23 to the 26th. Everything was great! The hotel is clean and the maid service is excellent. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and nice. The PCH Grill is excellent. We ate there for breakfast one morning and enjoyed meeting the characters. I will definitely stay at Paradise Pier again.

Summary Heading: too much money for what is given
Summary: We were all looking forward to this trip; paid $2,300 all inclusive with hoppers for niece, nephew, mom, son, and myself, plus hotel.  Coffee pot was a laugh, brewed one cup of quazie coffee, had to go buy my own pot.  No microwave for quick heatups for children, nothing but Disney stations on the T.V.  What happened to some stations for the rest of us?  No garbage bags for the wastebaskets, none to be had!  Just not much thought as to what a family might actually need for the stay involved with smaller youngsters. The elevators were not running properly while we were there, and I saved the best for last.  For the July 4th fireworks, I had to continually circle the parking garage for a parking space as this hotel lets the public in for special events which leaves the guest out

We just completed a Disney Trip.  The Paradise Pier is not luxurious, but you will pay luxurious Money. The staff seemed dull and unenthusiastic.  The Lobby is not exciting.  I saw nothing luxurious that most high hotels have, no chandaliers, no waterfalls,  nor did I see any characters except at Goofy's Kitchen which was 60 dollars me and a 7 year old.    I do not mind spending money, but PP does not offer anything more than other hotels on Harbor offer for way less money.  Except a cool waterslide which we loved.   We left PP and spent our last two days at the Buena Vista Courtyard Marriott and took their complimentary shuttle to Disneyland which was only 10 minutes.  They just renovated and the place is super clean with marble floors that sparkle; a fireplace; no crowds, no

Enjoyed a 4-nite stay at PPH, but paid a $800 premium when a sixth guest required "upgrading" from a standard room for 5 with concierge service to a suite.  Concierge service would have been $100 more per nite!  We asked for a higher floor and got a 10th flr suite with a great view of the DCA park and DL fireworks.  It had 2 roomy baths, 2 queen beds, sectional sofa, table for 4, micro & fridge.  Got a welcome tray of Mickey treats.  Turn-down service nightly.  One elevator was not working during our stay, so slow service at park open and closing times.  It was working the next week.  Walked to DL via Grand California Hotel, but walking from back of hotel to DL Hotel to monorail was shorter, except monorail only stops in Tomorrowland, so inconvenient since we used rentals only

We stayed there in sept 2004,with our 3 yr old son(first trip to d-land).The lady at the front desk was very nice she gave my son a signed pictur of mickey mouse that helped out alot he was strating to scared. The room was very nice 2 queen size beds, and very clean,with a great view of california adventure.We had a character breakfest the next morning which dident work out when of them came over to our table,so the waitress took our order and had it sent to our room,No charge. The pool was great alot of fun,with a big slide.very close to both parks. But a little to high in price you are paying for the disney name.But over all great vaction

This was our third visit to Disneyland.  Always staying at the PPH.  Every visit was better than the next.  Staff was great from the front desk personal to the housekeeping staff.  Room was very clean.  And the food in the resturant PCH Grill was yummy.  My daughter and I will be returning in August for the 50th celebration! Bought a package...Guess what?  We're staying at the PPH. Hope to see you there.

This is such a mediocre hotel I'm surprised that the Disney Corp keeps it on the books.  Elevators are glacially slow. the pool is small. the desk even slower than the elevators.  Our "non-smoking" room reeked of cigarettes and when a complaint was lodged we were told that 100% occupancy didn't allow for a switch.  More complaining evidently drove some guests out and we were eventually accomodated.  The rooms are small and weirdly lit.  The choice of restaurant on site was unusual for families with small kids (Japanese; I'd like it but they need a bland, inexpensive kid menu).  You'd be much better off staying somewhere else like the Disney "Californian" across the street or an off-property hotel.  It isn't even particularly close to to the park.  I had a thoroughly mediocre

Is this really a Disneyland hotel? Disneyland and California are so well taken care of - however, this hotel leaves a lot to be desired. We asked for a non-smoking room and were put in a room that just stunk (BAD) of smoke. It was Sat. eve and we were told that we couldn't be moved until the next eve. due to no available rooms.  The next day we were moved but they had no record that we had called twice to be moved the day before.  Room service lousy. In both rooms the tub hardly drained or very slowly. Staff courteous once you make your way to front desk but lines very slow. One person usually checking people in - inefficient during busy times.  The coffee maker is absurd - literally one cup at a time.  Decor okay. Beds and pillows comfortable. Blankets had holes in them.

Our family of 4 (H,W,Kids 2, 13) enjoyed staying at this hotel because it is in the heart of Disney.  I can't speak enough of the benefits of staying on the Disney properties.  It is just so convenient to be able to walk the 10 minutes back to your room to swim, nap, change, etc, and it's like you are continually basking in the Disney experience.  It will add to the excitement of your Disney visit and is definitely worth the extra money spent on your vacation to stay at one of the Disney hotels.  O.K. now , for the hotel.  This hotel is neither luxurious, nor upscale, but more family fun oriented and pretty basic.  Our room was good sized with standard two queens and a daybed, a desk and chair, and a fridge and safe.  It was impeccably clean, new, and there was a great attention

Last August my family stayed at the Paradise Pier for three nights. We booked a standard room with a view of the park. It was great! Two Queen beds and a huge bathroom! I am currently planning a trip for this coming August with my best friend Ava and her mom along with my mom and me. I want to stay at the PPH but it is very expensive! Around 225 a night! We are currently looking at the CCI, but not to say the PPH was really nice!

We stayed in the double queen room, 3rd floor with view of CA Adventure.  There were 5 people in our party.  (2 adults and 3 children)  The room was very clean, well cared for and easy access to the elevator. Our room did come with a small fridge, which came in very handy for drinks and snacks.  The coffee maker was okay, enough for 1 person, but still nice to have in the room.  The clock radio was handy also...reception not so great, but nice to have not had to pack it.  The walk to California Adventure was quick, thru the Grand Californian.  The walk to the monorail station thru Downtown Disney quick as well...much more enjoyable to walk thru Downtown Disney to get to the park than try to cross Harbor or catch a shuttle.  :)    The staff was outstanding--everyone from the

Summary Heading: Maybe not Paradise but worth the extra money to stay at a Disney property.
Summary: I just returned from a long weekend at Paradise Pier.   We stayed in a standard double queen bed room as part of a conferece at the nearby convention center.  Overall, the hotel was great.  This was by far the largest standard hotel room I've ever stayed in.   The room was spotless, the bedding, furniture and bathroom all appeared to be nearly new - just as you'd expect.  We were on the 13th floor and had an ok view - of the parking lot and the Disneyland Hotel.  No way to change that really, except request a room that faces California Adventure which we didn't think of at 2:00 AM.  The distance to Downtown Disney was not a problem.  It was actually nice to be a little bit removed from ALL the theme park crowds.    The staff was very nice and helpful at every turn - again, as

I booked the Paradise Pier hotel for my MIL, my 3 children ages 6, 3, and 5 months and myself for 3 nights. It was wonderful! As a travel agent, I am familiar with ALL Disney properties and I was very impressed. The staff went completly above and beyond for my family. Upon check in, I had some difficulties with my credit card, but the staff was friendly and very helpful. We had driven 5 1/2 long hours and my children were tired and ready to get to our room. The staff quickly isolated the problem, corrected the situation and  we were checked into our room. They even sent Stitch up to our room with goody bags and tons of balloons for my children. The roomservice staff was extremly friendly and even brought me a microwave so that I didn't have to trapse up and down the elevator to

We recently traveled to Disneyland with our 6 year old and almost 3-year old sons. We had previously taken our older child when he was 3 and stayed at the Disneyland Hotel. While VERY expensive, we found that the added conveniences with disney properties and staying in a 1 bedroom suite make the trip far more enjoyable with toddlers. This time, we chose the Paradise Pier Hotel as it is at least a smidge less expensive than the rest of the Disney-owned properties.   The room was great. Terrific, in fact. We were on the sixth floor and it had TWO bathrooms. One with a tub and one with a shower. This was especially useful when the kids were sleeping and we wanted to stay up to watch TV in the living room - having a bathroom accessible without going through the bedroom was very

I have stayed with all three hotels in the resort, and I would have to say that visually, this one was the least impressive.  Other than that, there was nothing wrong with it.  The staff that we encountered were very friendly and I think that they even let us check in early.  We had a fabulous view of Disney's California Adventure.  It is a good hotel to stay at, but only for the right price.  If you find a deal at one of the other hotels that is comparable to the price at PPH, stay at the other one (I prefer The Disneyland Hotel above the others) for a more "magical" Disney experience.

W stayed at the PPH the weekend of March 4th, 2005.  The staff was friendly, our room was clean,, the grounds felt safe & secure and hotel service ( room service & housekeeping ) was quick.    The PPH is suited to familes, even our teenage children wanted to make time to take a swim in the pool. We loved being able to park the car (included/free parking) and walk to the Parks and Downtown Disney.  I do agree that those you have limited mobility, will find the walk to the Parks tiresome.   The PPH is a good value considering you are taking about Disney, where everything is overpriced. Checking out other comparable hotels in the area, the cost was just a little more per day.  We booked thru our travel club that was able to get us a package deal with no other hidden cost.   The PPH

Summary Heading: I would not stay at this hotel again
Summary: My family stayed at the Paradise Pier in May of 2004.  We had previously stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and were not happy with the hotel at all, so we decided to try the Paradise Pier.  It was not at all worth the money we paid!  We had a party of ten with adjoining rooms and when we open the doors to our rooms it was clear that the room had not been vaccumed.  There were doritos all over the floors of both rooms, and hairs in the beds!  We called the service desk and they did come vaccum and gave us new pillows minus the hairs, but that was only the begining!  My husband dropped a washcloth behind the toilet and after all we've seen on Dateline we deceided to put a small mark on the tag of the washcloth and see what happens.  When we got back to our room that day I went to the

Paradise Pier is similar to the other moderate hotels in DisneyWorld.  The difference in DisneyLand was the personal attention my family recieved from the front desk.  They went out of their way to make sure everything went smoothly.  The pool is nice, the slide is a big hit with the kids.  The gym is free to use.  The T.V. area for the kids is cute.  I never once moved my car from the lot.  Although, it can be a lengthy walk to the park, its no worse than running from park to park in DisneyWorld.  DisneyLand was a refreshing change from DisneyWorld, it may not be as big, but we still had alot of fun.  I had rooms on both sides of the hotel.  The view of the park is what most people want (because the kids love to look at the park lit up at night), but I found the back of the

Ok, we really liked it. I was kind of skeptical about this place because of the reviews on this website, but I was pleasantly surprised. We aren't that picky, maybe thats why:)  Well, from our first walk into the hotel, we thought it looked pretty nice! The front desk was very friendly and accomadating, and even recommended what ride to go on first at the California Adventure. We got into our room and were just in awe! Wow..what a view, we were on the 12th floor, with a full view of the park! BEAUTIFUL!! Can I say more!?   That, in itself was worth the money..just for the view. Every night we watched the Electrical Parade go by, it was so pretty! Our room layout had 2 queen beds, a day bed (folded over to be a bed for one) a little refrigerator, hairdryer, nice big TV, safe, and

Summary Heading: So So But wont stay here again
Summary: We went to Disneyland Website to order our 5 day vacation.  We are kicking ourselves for not spending the extra $200 to upgrade to Grand California.  The PPH was ok nothing special.  It really didnt have the Disneyland wow to it.  The rooms were nice but that was about it.  The elevators, omg talk about a disaster.  The coffee shop, once again OMG.  It seemed like all they had was 1 worker and the Espresso machine kept breaking down.  Also, with 1 person working there it was about a 15 min wait for a cup of coffee.  PCH Grill its a cheap restaurant with inflated pricing.    For a few hundred more stay at teh Grand California.

me and my girlfriend went down to d-land on Jan 15-18/05 and we booked our room at the paradise pier hotel this time.  last time we came down, we stayed at the disneyland hotel and absolutely loved it, so this time around we thought we'd try the paradise hotel, and you guessed it...next time is going to be the grand californian.  i was reading some of the reviews on here before we had left and kinda had mixed feelings about what to expect, it was either going to be an easy trip, or a hassal.  but we had an easy time at the disneyland hotel when others hadn't, so it was kinda up in the air.  when we got their, we loved the outside decor of the hotel, it just put you in a kiddy mood.  check in was fast and easy for us again, and our room (13th floor theme park view) was already

Been here few of times.  Hotel is great!  Clean and all that.  The staff?  Well, somebody needs to actually manage these people.  For a Disney hotel the staff should've been more pleasant to deal with especially with the money spent there when, for half of that, I could've gone to an actual 5 star hotel (I don't lodge in Paradise Pier anymore).  Only a handful of people were excellent to deal with.  The rest, especially at that coffee lobby (the one you pass by on yer way to the restaurant), I couldn't believe they are even working there.  Does Disney have any screening standards for employees that HAVE TO face customers???  Truly, a disappointment.

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier is close to Paradise, but not exactly
Summary: 1/19-1/20-05  Gotta love staying NEAR Disney.  Gotta love the Lilo & Stich Character Breakfast - my son sure did.  Gotta love looking out on California Adventure as the sun comes up in the morning...ahh.  Gotta watch out for 3 elevators and more than 12 floors!  Luckily it was very low season and we only waited a couple of mintues.  Gotta realize the lobby is not the big comfy plush rest stop like in the Grand Californian - there is NO SEATING in the lobby of Paradise Pier.  As an annual passholder, we wanted the January $79 cityview room special.  There were out of non-smoking rooms, and with a 2 year and 9 month they suggested the non-smoking $119 theme park view.  Love the view, but even on the 7th floor, we heard all the traffic on the street!  Strangely, we stayed at the

Summary Heading: Perfect for families - esp. with toddlers
Summary: Stayed at the Paradise Pier from Nov 18 - 23/04.   The staff were extremely friendly and helpful; the food was good (any meal).  My daughter 2-1/2 (not afraid of the characters) loved the Character Breakfast - well worth going at least once.  The room (city view) was extremely clean, spacious and the best part was the beds.  The comfort of the beds saved our aching backs and legs - we were refreshed in the morning and ready to go again. We didn't use the pool, but lots of kids really seemed to like it.  The park was very close; we walked across the street - thru the Grand California Hotel to access Downtown Disney or CAL.  I really liked being able to buy something at the park and have it sent back to our room for free.   We ordered groceries from a chain supermarket, over the

Stayed at the Paradise Pier for 4 nights right before Christmas 2004.  We requested 2 connecting rooms for our family of six. They gladly accommodated this request.  Very clean, nice size rooms.  Friendly staff, answered all questions and quick check-in.  Loved the location, some family members could head back to room for part of the day.  No long lines to get into parks like last year when we stayed across the street.  Some days took us 30 minutes to get through their security of checking purses and bags.   This year easy and quick access either by monorail or through the Grand California Hotel.  Will stay here again the next time we come to Disneyland.

Overall we enjoyed our three days at the Paradise Pier hotel and we would stay there again.  Accessing the Magic Kingdom requires a little bit of walking, either to the Monorail station or through Downtown Disney.  Disney California is just across the street through the Grand Californian.  After a long day in the park this may seem like a bother, but the added distance away from Downtown Disney and the two parks provided a nice quiet atmosphere for sleeping.  Half the rooms have "a pool view" which really translates to a parking lot view.  We opted against paying the extra $25 per night for a view of Disney California because we spent little time in the room.    We really enjoyed the package delivery service.  Purchase anything in either park and they will deliver it to your

i arrrived and first thing needed oversized parking, there 20 small spaces for oversized but all cars in them so had to park across street. good start. went to front desk and was told we dont have any king beds avail? but i was confirmed for king bed. sorry. went to room had to wait 15 min in hallway while cleaning people finished. went inside and noticed everything was about 2 feet off the ground, bathroom door was huge went inside and found that we were put in a handicap room this was also confirmed by the maint guy that was called to fix a broken light in the bathroom at 930 pm but we didnt call? the shower had a wand not a head and the plastic seat for the shower made us feel real special. more lights flashing in room at night than light parade from all the smoke and motion?

PPH was a great hotel, but it is slightly overpriced.  If you're an AP holder, you can sometimes get the hotel for $79 (that's the cheapest I've seen) and it's worth that price, but not much more.  It does have a fantastic view, but now that they've closed off the private entrance to DCA, it is a long (though do-able) walk to the park for an "on-site" hotel.    My only complaint is with the elevators.  They are *extremely* slow.  I think I was on one of the middle floors and on my check out date, I tried bringing my luggage down to the car, but on the rare occasions that the elevator stopped on our floor, it was already packed.  So my only advice would be to try to stay on one of the highest floors... you'll get a better view, and odds are that the elevator will be empty when it

We stayed here 1october 2004- 3 nights.  We loved it.  So close to everything.  Minnies kitchen was fun for the kids, dont eat the buffett eggs, yuck!  Kids loved the pool slide we  we swimming in october, WOW.  Staff was great, rooms nice and clean we had california park view, 3rd floor.  Parking is not so bad they offer valet.  Very helpful with questions.  We were impressed and spoiled, we are planning on our return next year.  Wouldnt go anywhere else.  Sure the other disney hotels are nicer and more popular but that is extra money I can spend shopping, and you can go to the other hotels for dinner or whatever.

My family and I stayed at the paradise pier for 4 nights in October. The rooms were really clean, and my young daughter really enjoyed all of the Disneyland touches in the room.  It was nice to have the Disney theme carried through, even when we came back from the park. We had a lower park view, which was still really great. We only had problems with the elevator on the last day, after waiting about 15 minutes with our bags my husband just took the stairs.  There are only outside stairs not internal ones. Check in was fast and efficient. I highly recommend staying in this hotel.

My wife and I spent a week at disney's Paradise pier horel in Sept, 04.  The hotel was modern,. clean centrelly located to the park, had a nice pool and free parking.  We were very happy with our stay, the only problen being Disneyland is slightly overpriced, examples $3.50 coffee, $8.50 tunafish sandwich.

My husband and I stayed at the Paradise Pier from 14th to 18th September, we absolutely loved it. We didn't check in until after midnight due to an air traffic control system failure which made our flight over 6 hours late! Staff were very understanding and a helpful. Our room was fab and extremely clean. Must recommend "Goofy's Kitchen" for breakfast....definately one of the best charactor dining venue's we've been to. This was our first time to the Disneyland Resort, although we've been to WDW several times. We don't think it's fair to compare the two resorts as both have different good and bad points. We enjoyed our days in both parks, especially being picked to take part in the afternoon parade in Disneyland. Only disappointment was the number of attractions that were

I stayed at the Paradise Pier for 1 nt last week and it was great. We asked for a park view at check-in and the woman said she could switch our rooms which she did. She also advised us that we could see the fireworks from the pool deck that night which was awesome! I was there for a work meeting the next day in their meeting rooms which was great. Their giftshop was nice and the cashier was very happy and oozing Disney spirit. Overall, the room was nice. Nice digital thermostat. Will definitely stay there again.

This hotel has all of the excellent service of the other Disneyland Hotels at a much lower cost.  The special entrance to California Adventure is great.  From the pool to the view of the fireworks, it is all first class.

We have stayed at the Disney Paradise Pier 4 times in the last 7 years.... and are going back in December.  You can't beat the location and the price.  Yes, if you can afford the price to stay at Grand Californian or the Disneyland Hotel, then by all means stay there.  It is closer, and I'm sure is more of a "luxury" hotel.  We love the Paradise Pier because we get the "Disney Feel" for our kids ... we can walk to the monorail and ride it in ... and we don't go into debt every time we go.  For instance, I just priced a weekend coming up on Expedia, and the Grand Californian was $275/night, Disneyland Hotel was $225/night, and the Paradise Pier was $150/night.  That is a big savings.  The rooms are clean and big enough.  The restaurant downstairs is fabulous (we also order room

Disney Paradise Pier Hotel was a great place to stay!! There were 11 of us and stayed there for a weekend. At the time, Disney had a promotional deal, 2 parks for the price of 1. We reserved a 2 bedroom suite, which already has the concierge service. The concierge service included free snacks and drinks, evening wine and cheese reception, and they even gave us rice crispies treats delivered to our room in the evening. The hotel staff was super friendly and very accomodating..They made a little mistake with one of our room, and to compensate, they gave us VIP passes for a couple of rides at CA Adventure, so we didn't have to wait in long lines, which is worth it. The hotel also has a private entrance for CA Adventure and is within walking distance of Downtown Disney and

Summary Heading: Paradise Pier is the Place to Stay
Summary: For the price and the location, this was such a great way to do Disneyland. We loved California Adventures more than we thought we would, and came into the park the "secret" way every day to see if California Screamin' was a quick line. What a rush to start the day.  Going across the street through the lobby of the Grand Californian is a quick way to get to Downtown Disney and Disneyland.  The location is still better than being offsite, but we didn't spend as much money as we would have with the other Disney hotels. Who has time to sit around the hotel anyway? We just slept there, had a quick swim, then ran back to the parks to have more fun.

Summary Heading: Nothing Special, Don't waste your money!
Summary: The room wasn't anything special! I was disappointed because the paint was peeling up on the walls and it didn't seem really clean. It was convenient and the restraunt at the hotel is nice but I must say I was really disappointed in the upkeep of the room! Stay at the Disneyland Hotel or Grand Californian because they're much nicer and worth the extra money!
this is the best place i have ever seen it was so fun and a great price i would so recomend it

I had a great time at the Paradise Pier Hotel. Their glass elevator was a cool treat for our kids and Minnie's Kitchen was a fun experience as well. Our experience started w/ the valet unloading our luggage, but we had issues w/ the am valet because we "tipped" him and then realized the bellman were the one's actually taking luggage to our room. By the way, the Bellmen were the most helpful and informative group of guys especially Peter who helped w/ our luggage and answered our silly questions about the park. When Peter couldn't make dinner reservations he had c.j. who was on his lunch, help us w/ our dinner reservation. They reminded us that the true magic is not about the themeparks, but guest service. We also found out that our room was one of the newly remodeled rooms

Summary Heading: Goofy and Mice in the Room
Summary: I didn't mind this place at all and it was rather quiet for the most part because we got a room facing the front of the Park, I think its called California adventure. The room was very clean and the bathroom had nice "Mickey" shampoo bottles and one could easily call up housekeeping for stuff like towels and soap bars. The parking is a real stinker because you have to park the car yourself all the way in the back and my 500lb friend has bad ankles so she could not walk the distance. I don't know if they charge but I think they might, I wasnt driving so I really didnt care. I avoided all the restaurants inside the hotel, from sushi to cheap Italian knock offs because of the price.  All over you can see tourists getting ripped off. I walked down the block to Coco's cafeteria which

We stayed at the PPH from 12/13/03-12/17/03 and had a great time.  Although the lobby is small and can get quite crowded and rooms are very large and clean. We had a king bed with a queen sleeper sofa. The room also had a refrigerator. We had a standard view which wasn't anything special but it was what we paid for. The hotel doesn't have a quick service restaurant but the coffee bar was good for breakfast.  Also DTD and DLR were so close that getting a quick bite was pretty easy. We loved being able to walk to the parks unlike most WDW resort hotels. For the price (stay 4 nights pay for 3 deal) it was a great hotel for a DL vacation.

We loved our stay at the Pier! I took 2 teen agers and an 8 yr. old. We were lucky enough to get a park view with our package, beautiful sight!  There was alot of space and a nice,clean and large bathroom. The elavators were a little slow but not too bad. The security was the only thing that may need attention,as we were sor t of followed by a large group of young males who appeared to be gang members using the bathroom facilities in the hotel area. We were alot nervous about that cuz anyone could follow you to your room and we didn't see any security.  Otherwise, we would recommend it and are planning to go back with more of our children. The neverland pool opened with our key so I guess you can use it even if not at the Disneyland Hotel. We have stayed at the DLH also and

The Hotel is in a nice location and I enjoyed having an entrance to California Adventure Park, however..I was not able to get the Annual Pass price of $79.00.  The hotel cost me $ 197.00 for one night (2 people).        The room didn't have tea bags with the complementary coffee. (Room service would bring them to you for $5.00.)         The view from my room was very nice.  The park leaves the colorful lights on all night.        I was a bit repulsed by finding human hair of the private kind (not ours) in the tub.  House keeping was very quick in taking care of the problem once I called.       I was suprised to hear street traffic noise in my 12th floor room (no open windows).       Maureen Albrecht

Our family of four stayed here for one night, taking advantage of a Annual Passholder discount of $79.00. Parking was easy (just behind the hotel) and free (they give you a validation ticket when you check in).  It took 3 minutes to check-in - the clerk was very courteous and thorough. Our room was on the top (15th floor) facing California Adventure - what a view! Our kids could not peel themselves from the window. The room was clean, spacious and had some nice touches. The bathroom was also clean. The TV was nice, and also included a channel which provides the audio of the Electric Parade so that you can watch it from your room. After settling down, we walked to Disneyland (about 10 minutes) and enjoyed the park until closing, and then walked back to the hotel. We found the

Summary Heading: A Nice Hotel For The Price
Summary: We had a great rate for their stay and play package. We were there from Nov 9-10, 2003. It was only $89.00 per person and it included 1 night stay and 2 adult tickets for both parks. We were on the 13th floor and faced the California Adventure Park. It had an excellent view, especially at night. The room was nicely furnished and clean. Some Disney pictures were on the wall and a Disney magazine to read. They had the Disney toiletries. I didn't find the elevators as being slow.  This hotel is further than the other 2 hotels. It's also a long walk back from the park. This hotel is nice but it doesn't have the Disney atmosphere that the Disneyland Hotel has. If I had to pay the regular rate, I would pay the extra money to stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  Maybe one day we'll stay at

My family just got back from our Disney trip. Paradise Pier is a quaint and conveniently located hotel.  There's nothing really outstanding about the hotel, but the pricing is reasonable considering its location in the resort. Guests of the hotel have a special entrance into California Adventure right across the street and the walk to Downtown Disney and the Monorail is about 5 min.  The Monorail is convenient if you don't mind being dropped off in Tomorrowland in Disneyland (the east side of the park). However, if you want to go to the front entrance of Disneyland, you'll have to walk through Downtown Disney or cut through California Adventure. Both walks are quite far.  Positives: (1) Friendly staff (2) Clean rooms and spacious. (3) Character greetings in PCH Grill restaurant.

I was a bit nervous about staying at PP after reading some of these reviews, but the second we walked in, I was wondering what in the heck people were talking about! We were greated as if we were the only guests there, the front desk CM's were awesome....even though they couldn't upgrade us because they were booked. They happily held on to our luggage as we headed out to the parks. When we returned to the hotel, we got our room keys (and I got a ballon and a birthday pin for my 30th), we headed up to our large, clean, city view, not-a-spot-to-complain-about-anywhere room, that had ballons, flowers (thanks, Mom) and a Mickey shaped small cake waiting for me! Then I was remembering the elevators. I heard about 10-15 minute waits, YIKES!.....then I waited about 3 minutes (yes even

Whenever we've gone to Disneyland we've stayed at a Hotel away from Disneyland and take the shuttle. This time we decided to stay at a hotel next to Disney and California Adventure, Paradise Pier. The place was nice but had, I feel, hidden costs. Number one was the parking.  While getting my room there was no mention of the $100 charge to park at their hotel. Number two was the breakfast with the characters. What characters? All we saw was Minnie, Goofy's son or whoever that is, and Pluto. I think that is misrepresentation. Also there was no price listed for the breakfast. When I got the bill, for familty of five, it was $100!!!! I almost passed out in disbelief. I figured it would cost about $50. I think this is a total ripoff and would not stay at this hotel again. Also bars

This was our first visit since the creation of the whole "Disney Resort" area, including CA Adventure. We have previously stayed at Disney Hotel and other off-site motels. We have always loved DH, but couldn't afford this time, so went with DPP. Got a good expedia rate of $112/night for mid-week. Arrived at 1:30 but room was not ready until 4. Asked for a park-side room but was told they were sold out. We were on 13th floor, which was a pain since the elevators are slow. (but not impossible, sometimes it just takes a wait of 10-15 minutes to get on) Stay on a lower floor if that wait may bother you. The room was just OK, reasonably clean. Smoke detector had odd stains on it. Bathroom had faint unpleasant odor that lasted 2 of 3 days of visit. Worn stains on the carpet. Room is

We stayed at the Paradise Pier July 10th through the 15th. We got rates through Expedia and paid a range of $99 - $120 a night. I'm glad we got the good rates and extra incentives because I would have been disappointed with the hotel if we had paid any more.  It was a very nice hotel. The service was geat. The room was was clean and nicley decorated. The bathroom could have used a makeover but was not at all objectionable. It was close to everything Disney, and we never had to use our car. My husband used the exercise room daily and really enjoyed that amenity.  There was really nothing wrong with the hotel, but it definitley lacked that Disney "sparkle"; nothing special, no pizazz. We were were especially disappointed with the pool. It was just a pool. with chairs on a concrete

Where do I start? Having to carry a two year old and stroller up and down 5 flights of stairs because the elevators that NEVER arrive or are completely full at peak times of day (very poor building planning 4 SLOW elevators to service 15 floors)... The clogged sink in the bathroom that kept backing up and leaving smelly grime in sink...  Having to ask four times for a portable crib that smelled like mildew... The only good thing about this hotel is that it has it's "own" (shares access with Grand Californian and Disneyland Hotel) access to the California Adventure park. NOT staying here again!! Next time we'll pay the extra money for clean rooms and better service at the Grand Californian.

Summary Heading: Nice, but plain for a Disney hotel
Summary: I enjoyed Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel. The rooms are clean, nicely furnished and comfortable. The atmosphere contains some of the nice Disney touches you'd expect to see from an Disneyland Resort on-site property, but really it wasn't much different than a bundle of other off-site properties. I guess the only real draw was the vicinity to the parks, but even that isn't as close as it seems.BOTTOM LINE: If I got a really good rate there (which could be tough), I would stay there again. But I think there are some better off-site values than the Paradise Pier Hotel.

We stayed at the Paradise Pier Hotel on Mother's Day weekend in May. Everything was wonderful. Our room got upgraded to park view, which helped since I had a sick daughter, watch the Electrical Light Parade. Room Service was great, very fast and affordable. The close walk to Downtown Disney was nice. And being able to get on the monorail from there straight to Disneyland was great. Once my daughter got over her fever we went to have the breakfast with minnie and friends at PCH grill. Great food. Loved there coffee bar. There only downfall is the elevators. When it is very busy (like on a Friday night or Saturday morning) it took us at least 10 - 15 minutes to get on the elevator from the 8th floor. The fan in our bathroom was not working, but besides that everything was great. I

Summary Heading: One good thing is it's close to the park
Summary: The only thing keeping me from giving this hotel a 2-star review is the fact that you can walk across the street to California Adventure. The problems with the hotel include poor elevator access... they have 4 elevators and are sooo slow... we didn't even bother waiting and just walked down the north staircase each morning. Our room was in need of new carpeting (I don't want to think about what made that big stain in it). But for the price and the location, it was worth staying at for a couple nights. I guess we're spoiled since the last time we went to DLR we stayed at the Grand Californian. Paradise Pier's location is better than the Disneyland Hotel (IMHO), but they still need to do some work to bring it up to the Disney experience most people expect.

We arrived in Anihiem at the front desk of the hotel and everything was PERFECTLY in order. Our reservations for 6 nights, our room keys and very good directions to and from the parks. We stayed 6 nights and on Saturday night (before Mother's Day), we arrived back from the park to find our room impecably clean and two fragrent red roses waiting on the nightstand for Mother's Day. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, the food in the cafe's and room service was outstanding and not unreasonably priced either. The hotel is very conveniently located close to Disney Downtown with a 5 minute walk to and from, and access to the monorail. After we had made reservations here, I read a couple very disturbing reviews on this hotel, however, the reviews were obviously written by

Summary Heading: Two Thumbs up For Disney's Paradise Pier
Summary: My husband and I stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier on December 31, 2002. We were celebrating our 3rd Anniversary. Let me say that my husband and I had a very pleasant stay. The hotel is very bright and cheery and the rooms are nice. This hotel was everything that we have come to expect from Disney's high standard of quality. We had a magnificent view of Disney's California Adventure. My husband and I were able to see the fireworks from both California Adventure and Disneyland. The staff was great, while booking the hotel we mentioned that we were celebrating our 3rd Anniversary and when we arrived the staff acknowledged our special day and we were given a special memento from Mickey himself and we had a sweet treat waiting in our room. We give Disney's Paradise Pier two thumbs up!

I want to thank the entire staff of the Disneyland Hotels for the kindness shown to my family when we were guests. My Grandsons Make A Wish could not have been made any better. Everyone was kind and courtious to us all. More staff members around the hotel chains should take lessions from them.

Summary Heading: Avoid this place like the plaque.
Summary: This hotel has seriously gone downhill. I just got back from staying there on my honeymoon and it was a disaster from start to finish. They screwed up our parkhopper passes (were somehow invalid and we were denied admission into the park!) The Yamabuki Japanese restaurant served us OLD sushi that took an hour and half to get to us. Last but not least, the hotel OVERCHARGED ME ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS. That's right. ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS. The card is a check card and now several expenditures are bouncing from my account, including my rent.  I'd sooner drive a pick through my head than stay there again. Can I put that anymore plainly??? ;o)

Summary Heading: Disney's Pier is one of the best
Summary: The Paradise Pier Hotel is a nice hotel right next to California Adventure. It's one of the closest hotels to the Disneyland entrance. Only the Disneyland Hotel is closer.    The rooms: Nice, clean, and everything you would expect. We had the standard room.    The lobby: Straight forward, small, not fancy, but functional.   Parking: Great.. Nice garage attached to the back with security.   Staff: they are Disney. Need I say more?   Restaurants: A few nice ones. Didn't eat there however. The boardwalk has many more choices.    Location: Great for California Adventure. The walk is fine. If you want to get to the Parks cut through the Grand California. If you want the boardwalk it's a bit of a hike.   View: You can overlook the city, or overlook California Adventure. The latter
